docs.title: Recipes
docs.text:
My collection of recipes made with cooklang.

The cooklang files are stored in the cook folder and the markdown files are stored in the docs folder.

Aliases used
alias e='micro'
alias gpo='git push origin main'

docs.title: Up Next
docs.text: See this link for a list up recipes to make next.

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
This collection is a consolidation of recipes from many different sources to make it easier to reference in one location and to guard against recipes disappearing from the Internet. The recipes are meant to be used for my own personal reference.

Info

Myself being a lacto-ovo vegetarian, will often convert the original recipes to fit my diet. Recipes that have been passed down through the original ingredients are kept to use the original ingredients or at least list a vegetarian alternative.

Info

Recipes, when applicable, have the original source specified to give them credit.

Info

giscus comments system is implemented on this site to make it easier to make comments on recipes when cooking. The comments can then be used at a later date to update the recipe.

Info

Recipes that I come across on the Internet and have not yet been incorporated into my site are tracked in the repository issues.

Warning

Recipes on this site might be different than the sourced recipes due to personal modifications. E.g. changing the amount of chili powder to make the dish less spicy or aging cookie dough where egg white are the main liquid component in order to control spread and concentrate flavor.

docs.title: Assumptions
docs.text:
The following may be assumed throughout the site unless otherwise specified

  • Butter refers to unsalted butter.
  • salt refers to kosher salt.
  • pepper refers to black pepper.
  • flour refers to all-purpose flour.
  • vanilla refers to vanilla extract.
  • heavy cream is the same as whipping and double cream.
  • stock is the same as broth.
  • caster, white, and sugar is the same as granulated sugar.
  • powdered sugar is the same as confectioners' sugar.
  • brown sugar measurements are packed.
  • brown sugar refers to light brown sugar.
  • Temperatures are in °F.
  • Powdered measurements are sifted.
  • Liquid ingredient measurements in g are equivalent to mL.

  • Veggie Rainbow Wrap

docs.title: Banh Mi Sandwich
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 16-oz pkg extra firm tofu
  • 1 cup garlic aioli
  • 2 cups pickled carrot and daikon
  • 4 asian cucumber
  • 1 handful cilantro
  • 6 french bread

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Grill extra firm tofu on a skillet with some olive oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add garlic aioli, pickled carrot and daikon, asian cucumber, and cilantro to a loaf of french bread and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cups rice
  • 2 Tbsp flour
  • 1.5 tsp curry powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp pepper
  • 1 14-oz can coconut milk
  • 1 tsp lime juice
  • 1 lbs frozen vegetables
  • 1 cup frozen peas

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 wire whisk
  • 1 sauce pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: While rice is cooking, combine flour, curry powder, salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup coconut milk.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Beat with wire whisk until smooth. Stir in remaining coconut milk and lime juice. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a sauce pan, combine frozen vegetables and frozen peas with 1/2 cup water. Cook, then drain and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Mix veggies with coconut mixture and bring to a boil.

docs.title: Cool & Spicy Noodle Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 package TJ's Organic Yellow Lentil and Brown Rice Spaghetti
  • some ice water
  • 1 package shredded cabbage
  • 0.5 package shredded carrots
  • 2 bell peppers
  • 1 cup TJ's Spicy Peanut Vinaigrette
  • some cilantro
  • some crushed half salted peanuts

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 very large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prepare TJ's Organic Yellow Lentil and Brown Rice Spaghetti according to package directions. Meanwhile, prepare a large bowl of ice water. Transfer cooked, drained pasta to ice water to cool. Drain pasta thoroughly and add to a very large mixing bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add shredded cabbage, shredded carrots, bell peppers and TJ's Spicy Peanut Vinaigrette to pasta. Gently toss to combine. Adjust dressing to taste and add cilantro, if desired. Cover and chill 30 minutes. Garnish with crushed half salted peanuts prior to serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Crispy Peanut Tofu & Cauliflower Rice Stir-Fry
docs.text: Total Time 1.18 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 12 oz extra firm tofu
  • 2.5 Tbsp peanut butter
  • 1 Tbsp sesame oil
  • 2 Tbsp tamari
  • 2 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 2 tsp chili garlic sauce
  • 2 tsp tamari
  • 1 small cauliflower
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 dash sesame oil
  • 1 dash tamari
  • 1 cup baby bok choy (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: If your block of extra firm tofu is larger than 12 ounces, trim it down. Then drain your tofu and use a tofu press or wrap in an absorbent towel several times and place something heavy on top to press for 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Once pressed, slice tofu into roughly 1/2-inch cubes and arrange on the parchment-lined baking sheet in a single layer. Ensure they aren't touching so they will crisp up. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes to dry/firm the tofu.

Note

At 20 minutes, the tofu should be chewy, and at 25 minutes, the tofu should be more crispy. Bake according to preference.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In the meantime, prepare sauce by adding peanut butter, sesame oil, tamari, maple syrup, and chili garlic sauce to a medium mixing bowl and whisking until combined. Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more chili garlic sauce for heat, maple syrup for sweetness, or tamari for saltiness.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add baked tofu to the peanut sauce and toss to coat. Let marinate for 10 to 15 minutes to saturate the tofu and infuse the flavor.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In the meantime, prepare cauliflower rice by using a large grater or the grater attachment on a food processor. Set aside. Mince garlic if you haven’t already done so, and wash and slice any veggies you want to add to the dish (optional).

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Heat a large rimmed skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add sesame oil (1 Tbsp as original recipe is written // adjust if altering serving size), cauliflower rice, garlic, and tamari. Stir and sauté, stirring occasionally, for about 5 to 8 minutes until slightly browned and tender. Transfer to a serving platter.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: If adding any veggies to your dish (optional), cook them now in a bit of sesame oil and a dash of tamari until just tender. Add to the cauliflower rice.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: To the preheated pan, add the marinated tofu with most of the sauce (reserving a few spoonfuls for serving). Cook, stirring frequently for 3 minutes until browned. The sauce will caramelize and may stick to the pan a bit – this is normal and adds more flavor to the dish. Stir with spatula, scraping up any caramelized bits. Then transfer tofu to the cauliflower rice platter.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Serve with any leftover sauce. Leftovers reheat well and will keep covered in the refrigerator up to 2-3 days. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Optionally, vegetables such as thinly sliced baby bok choy (optional) may be added with some sesame oil and tomari.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://minimalistbaker.com/crispy-peanut-tofu-cauliflower-rice-stir-fry/
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Easy Vegan Ramen
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.22 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Ramen
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 1 3-inch ginger
  • 1 medium yellow onion
  • 6 cups vegetable broth
  • 2 Tbsp tamari or soy sauce
  • 0.5 oz dehydrated shiitake mushrooms
  • 1 tsp sesame oil
  • 1 Tbsp white or yellow miso paste
  • 8 oz ramen noodles

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 10 oz extra-firm tofu
  • some miso-glazed carrots (optional)
  • some miso-glazed baby bok choy (optional)
  • 0.5 cup chopped green onion (optional)
  • some chili garlic sauce (optional

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 large saucepan or pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Once hot, add olive oil, garlic, ginger, and yellow onion. Sauté, stirring occasionally for 5 to 8 minutes or until the onion has developed a slight sear (browned edges).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add 1 cup (240 ml // amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size) of the vegetable broth to deglaze the bottom of the pan. Use a whisk (or wooden spoon) to scrape up any bits that may have stuck to the bottom to enhance the flavor of the broth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add remaining 5 cups (1200 ml // amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size) vegetable broth, tamari or soy sauce, and dehydrated shiitake mushrooms - stir.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and cover. Simmer on low for at least 1 hour, up to 2 to 3, stirring occasionally. The longer it cooks, the more the flavor will deepen and develop.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Taste broth and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more soy sauce or sesame oil if desired. Add the white or yellow miso paste at this time.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: When you’re 30 minutes from serving, prepare any desired toppings (see notes for miso-glazed carrots (optional), miso-glazed baby bok choy (optional), and quick-seared extra-firm tofu).

docs.title: Step 8 - Noodles
docs.text: Fill a large saucepan or pot with water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, add ramen noodles (depending on size of pan you may need to do this in two batches // use fewer or more batches if altering batch size) and cook according to package instructions – about 4 to 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Strain broth and reserve mushrooms for serving. (Save onions and ginger for serving as well, if desired, though I discarded them).

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: To serve, divide ramen noodles between four (amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size) serving bowls. Top with strained broth and desired toppings, such as miso-glazed carrots, miso-glazed bok choy, chopped green onion (optional), or seared tofu. Serve with chili garlic sauce (optional) for added heat.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Best when fresh, though the broth can be stored (separately) in the refrigerator for up to 5 days and in the freezer for up to 1 month.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/easy-vegan-ramen/#wprm-recipe-container-35499

docs.title: Everyday Chinese Vegetable Stir-Fry
docs.text: Total Time 4 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.33 cup vegetable stock
  • 1 Tbsp Shaoxing wine
  • 2 tsp oyster sauce
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp sugar
  • 0.25 tsp sesame oil
  • 1 pinch white pepper
  • 2 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 4 slices ginger
  • 1 cup sliced mushrooms
  • 1 cup carrot
  • 1 cup celery
  • 1 cup asparagus
  • 1 cup bell pepper
  • 1 cup long hot pepper
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 tsp cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 liquid measuring cup
  • 1 wok

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a liquid measuring cup, combine the vegetable stock, Shaoxing wine, oyster sauce, salt, sugar, sesame oil, and white pepper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a wok over medium heat, add the vegetable oil and ginger. Cook until the ginger is lightly browned at the edges, and then add the sliced mushrooms. Stir-fry for 1 to 2 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the carrot, celery, asparagus, bell pepper, and long hot pepper. Stir-fry for 1 minute, and then add the garlic and the seasoning mixture you prepared earlier. Bring the mixture to a simmer, and cook for 1 minute, until the vegetables are tender.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Combine the cornstarch and water into a slurry, and pour into the simmering sauce. Stir-fry until the vegetables are coated in sauce, with just a small amount of standing liquid. Serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://thewoksoflife.com/everyday-vegetable-stir-fry/

docs.title: Fresh Spring Rolls
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Peanut Sauce
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup creamy peanut butter
  • 4 tsp soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp lime juice
  • 2 tsp brown sugar
  • 1 tsp chili garlic sauce
  • 1 tsp freshly ground ginger
  • 2 Tbsp water

docs.title: Ingredients - Spring Rolls
docs.text:
• 8 rice paper wrapper
  • 0.5 head lettuce
  • 0.75 cup mint
  • 0.75 cup cilantro
  • 1 cup carrots1
  • 0.5 head purple cabbage
  • 1 red bell pepper1
  • 0.5 cucumber1
  • 1 avocado
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 peanut dipping sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 cutting board

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To make the peanut sauce, whisk creamy peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, chili garlic sauce, and freshly ground ginger in a small bowl. Whisk in 2 tablespoons of water until desired consistency is reached.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Wet each rice paper wrapper individually for 10 to 15 seconds and place it on a cutting board. Place lettuce, mint, and cilantro in the center of each wrapper. Top with carrots, purple cabbage, red bell pepper, cucumber and avocado. Season with light salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bring the bottom edge of the wrap tightly over the filling, fold in the sides, then roll from bottom to top until the top of the sheet is reached. Be careful not to tear the rice paper. Cover the roll with damp paper towels. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve with peanut dipping sauce and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text:
• Applied Kitchen

  1. Thinly sliced into long matchsticks. ↩↩↩

docs.title: Noodle-Free Pad Thai
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup (1 TJ's block) extra firm tofu
  • 1 Tbsp coconut aminos
  • 0.13 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 0.25 tsp turmeric
  • 5 carrots
  • 1 medium red peppers
  • 3 green onions
  • 2.5 Tbsp peanut butter
  • 3 Tbsp lime juice
  • 0.5 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 1.5 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 2 Tbsp coconut aminos
  • 1 Tbsp sesame oil
  • 1 jalapeño
  • 1.5 cups shredded cabbage
  • 1 Tbsp coconut aminos
  • 1 Tbsp coconut aminos
  • 0.5 tsp fresh ginger
  • 0.5 tsp turmeric
  • some cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 immersion blender
  • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Press excess water out of extra firm tofu, then blitz in a food processor or into a crumble. Mix in 1 Tbsp coconut aminos, 1/8 tsp red pepper flakes, and 1/4 tsp turmeric. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Slice carrots, red peppers, and green onions in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl, mix peanut butter, lime juice, 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes, maple syrup, and 2 Tbsp coconut aminos and bled with immersion blender.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat skillet to medium and add sesame oil. Add sliced jalapeño, shredded cabbage, and 1 Tbsp coconut aminos. Cook 3 minutes, stirring frequently.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add tofu and sauté 3 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add 1 Tbsp coconut aminos and sauté 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add sauce, fresh ginger, and 1/2 tsp turmeric. Sauté and heat until warmed through.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Serve with chopped cilantro.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Simple Fried Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 tsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 carrot
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 4 scallion whites
  • 4 cups jasmine rice
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup frozen peas
  • 4 scallion greens

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 14-inch flat-bottomed wok
  • 1 large plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Beat eggs and 1/4 teaspoon salt in bowl until well combined. Heat 2 teaspoons vegetable oil in 14-inch flat-bottomed wok or 12-inch carbon-steel or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until oil is just smoking. Add eggs and cook, stirring frequently, always until very little liquid egg remains, 30 to 60 seconds. Transfer to large plate.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add 1 teaspoon oil to now-empty wok and reduce heat to medium. Add carrot and 1/4 teaspoon salt and cook, stirring frequently, until just beginning to brown, 2 to 4 minutes. Transfer to plate with eggs.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add scallion whites and remaining 1 tablespoon oil to now-empty wok. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add cooked jasmine rice and stir until combined. (It's OK if some clumps of rice remain.) Spread into even layer. Sprinkle pepper and remaining 1 teaspoon salt evenly over rice. Continue to

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: cook, stirring frequently and pressing on rice with spatula to break up clumps, until grains are separate and heated through, 2 to 5 minutes longer. Add frozen peas, egg mixture, and scallion greens and cook, stirring frequently and using edge of spatula to break eggs into small pieces, until peas are warmed through, about 2 minutes. Serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Truffley Cauliflower Stir Fry
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 17 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg grain tempeh
  • 4 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 bag riced cauliflower stir fry

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium-sized bowl
  • 1 large non-stick pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To a medium-sized bowl, add cut grain tempeh and four tablespoons soy sauce. Toss to combine and let sit for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat and add two tablespoons olive oil. Add marinated tempeh and fry until golden, about 3 to 5 minutes, each side. Remove from pan.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add remaining olive oil and cook riced cauliflower stir fry until warmed through, 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Divide stir fry among bowls and top with tempeh. Serve with extra soy sauce for drizzling.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Vegetarian Egg Rolls
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp, 0.25 cup canola oil
  • 1 Tbsp sesame oil
  • 6 medium shiitake mushrooms
  • 4 cups cabbage
  • 1 cup carrots
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp ginger
  • 1 Tbsp soy sauce
  • some pepper
  • 10 egg roll wrapper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat 1 tablespoon of canola oil and the sesame oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the finely diced shiitake mushrooms, finely chopped cabbage, and grated carrots, and cook until slightly softened, about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the minced garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and pepper, and cook for 30 seconds more. Let the filling cool a bit before forming the egg rolls.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: When you're ready to roll, take a thawed egg roll wrapper and place it in front of you in a rhombus shape. Scoop on 2 tablespoons of the filling about an inch away from the bottom corner. Fold the bottom corner over the filling and tuck the filling tightly. Then fold over the right and left corners and roll up. Wet the top corner of the wrapper with a bit of water and finish rolling (the water will seal the roll). Repeat with the remaining ingredients.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To fry, heat 1/4 cup of canola oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Gently place egg rolls into the hot oil, being careful not to splash it. Fry until they're golden on all sides, 3 to 4 minutes total. Transfer to a paper towel-lined tray to drain excess oil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve the egg rolls warm, with duck sauce or hoisin sauce for dipping.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/873120/vegetarian-egg-rolls-recipe/

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix Kern's apricot nectar, pineapple juice, guava nectar, light rum, ice cubes or mold, and chilled champagne in a punch bowl.

docs.text: Enjoy!

docs.title: Cooked Eggnog
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup milk
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 12 egg yolks
  • 1.33 cups sugar
  • 1 tsp nutmeg
  • 2 cups milk
  • 2 cups heavy cream
  • 0.5 cup brandy, Cognac, dark rum, or bourbon
  • some nutmeg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large saucepan
  • 1 fine mesh strainer

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Lightly cooking this eggnog kill dangerous bacteria in the eggs. For a nonalcoholic alternative, 2 Tbsp vanilla or 1.5 cups string coffee can replace the spirits.

Warning

Do not double this recipe!

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine milk and heavy cream.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk in a medium bowl just until blended egg yolks, sugar, and 1 tsp nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat in a large saucepan over medium-low heat 2 cups milk and 2 cups heavy cream.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While whisking, slowly add part of the hot milk and cream mixture to the egg yolks. Then slowly pour the cream and egg mixture back into the saucepan, stirring constantly, until the mixture becomes a little thicker and reaches a temperature of about 175°F. Do not overheat or the mixture will curdle. Remove from heat and immediately stir in the combined 1 cup milk and 1 cup heavy cream. Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a storage container and cool. Chill thoroughly, uncovered, then stir in brandy, Cognac, dark rum, or bourbon.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hour, or up to 3 days.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve sprinkled with nutmeg.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Ginger Cubes
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:

  • 8 peeled lemons
  • 12 peeled turmeric root
  • 2 cups TJ's lemon ginger echinacea juice
  • some water (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:

  • 1 ice cube tray

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add peeled ginger root, peeled lemons, peeled turmeric root, and TJ's lemon ginger echinacea juice to a blender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add water (optional) to desired consistency.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour in an ice cube tray and put in freezer overnight.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Take them out and place in zip look bags and grab on every evening together with a little more echinacea juice or water.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Lisa

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat over medium until warmed through, whisking briskly so that the almond butter does not stick to the bottom and the spices incorporate. Do not let boil.

docs.title: Iced Chai Latte
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 4 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Whipped Cream
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup heavy cream
  • 2 tsp TJ's Spicy Chai Tea Latte Mix
  • 1 tsp Bourbon Vanilla Extract

docs.title: Ingredients - Chai Iced Latte
docs.text:
• 6 Tbsp TJ's Spicy Chai Tea Latte Mix
  • 0.5 cup hot water
  • 1 cup TJ's Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 hand mixer or stand mixer
  • 1 medium-sized pitcher

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large bowl, with a hand mixer or stand mixer combine: 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 teaspoons TJ's Spicy Chai Tea Latte Mix and 1 teaspoon Bourbon Vanilla Extract. Whip until stiff peaks form, about 4 minutes. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium-sized pitcher, whisk together 6 tablespoons TJ's Spicy Chai Tea Latte Mix and 1/2 cup hot water until mix completely dissolves. Add 1 cup TJ's Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate to pitcher and stir until combined. Serve chilled or pour over ice (we recommend making your own cold brew ice cubes), then top with reserved whipped cream.

  • 1 tall

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Bring to a boil in a large saucepan 3 cups water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add and stir until dissolved tea bags, dried hibiscus flowers, and sugar.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Let stand 10 minutes, then strain into a pitcher. Stir in ice water.

docs.title: Oat Milk
docs.text: Total Time 21 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup quick or rolled oats
  • 3-4 cups water
  • 2 Tbsp maple syrup

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender
  • 1 nut milk bag or cheesecloth
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cover the quick or rolled oats with 3 to 4 cups water and soak overnight (or for at least 20 minutes if you’re short on time). Drain and rinse the oats.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the oats, maple syrup, and water to a blender, and blend for about 1 minute (If you want a thicker milk, use 3 cups of water. Use 4 cups for a thinner consistency).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using a nut milk bag or cheesecloth, drain the milk into a bowl. Transfer to a sealable container, and store in your refrigerator for up to one week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/sauce/homemade-oat-milk/

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 oz Irish Whiskey
  • 5 oz strong hot coffee
  • 2 tsp brown sugar
  • some whipped cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 Galway Irish Crystal glass

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the Galway Irish Crystal glass with hot water (place a spoon in the glass to avoid shattering).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour in 2 oz of good Irish Whiskey.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour 5 oz of strong hot coffee over the whiskey.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add 1 to 2 teaspoons of brown sugar and stir well, making sure that the sugar is dissolved.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Add whipped cream to top. Do not stir after adding the cream.

Note

The true flavor of Irish coffee is obtained by drinking the mixture through the cream. May you enjoy this drink and many more of them throughout the years. "Sláinte!"

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Galway Irish Crystal Ltd.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 cups sugar
  • 1 cup water
  • 1.5 cups lemon juice
  • 7 cup water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 pitcher

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a saucepan, make a simple syrup with the sugar and 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil and stir to make sure the sugar is dissolved. Allow syrup to cool, then cover and place in refrigerator until well chilled.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a pitcher, stir together simple syrup, lemon juice with pulp (make sure all seeds are removed!) and remaining 7 cups of water.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Enjoy over ice on a hot day.

Note

For a "spiked" version substitute 2 cups of the water with 1.5 to 1.75 cups of vodka

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Helms Family

docs.title: Pineapple Apple Cider Vinegar Turmeric Drink
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup pineapple
  • 0.5 cup 100% pineapple juice (alternative)
  • 2 Tbsp honey or maple syrup
  • 4 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 2 leaves mint
  • 0.25 tsp turmeric
  • 0.5 tsp ginger (optional)
  • 2 Tbsp lime juice
  • some ice
  • :clinking_glasses: 12 oz sparkling water

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Blend pineapple or 100% pineapple juice (alternative), honey or maple syrup, 2 to 4 Tbsp apple cider vinegar, chopped mint, turmeric, ginger (optional), and 1 to 2 Tbsp lime juice until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Strain the mixture into glasses filled with ice.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Top with 6 to 12 oz sparkling water and garnish with mint and/or lime (optional).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Feel free to adjust the amount of apple cider vinegar to your preference. You can also add a bit of black pepper to enhance the flavor. Enjoy!

docs.title: Pineapple Paradise
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 12.3-oz container light extra-firm tofu
  • 1 16-oz can pineapple chunks
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • some dried pineapple (optional)
  • some cherries (optional)
  • some bananas (optional)
  • some raspberries (optional)
  • some walnuts (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor or blender
  • 1 small bowls
  • 1 small spoons

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place light extra-firm tofu, drained pineapple chunks, and vanilla extract in a food processor or blender until well mixed. Serve in small bowls with small spoons. Possible toppings: dried pineapple (optional), cherries (optional), bananas (optional), or raspberries (optional), or toasted walnuts (optional) if you don't have heart disease.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Prevent and Reverse Heart Disease by Caldwell B. Esselstyn, Jr., M.D.

docs.title: Spinach Banana Smoothie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 6 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 frozen banana
  • 2 Tbsp peanut butter powder
  • 1 scoop plant protein
  • 1 Tbsp hemp seeds
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.33 cup spinach
  • 0.5 cup oat or almond milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place frozen banana, peanut butter powder, plant protein, hemp seeds, cinnamon, spinach, oat or almond milk in the blender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend on high for 1 minute or until all ingredients are fully blended.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Strawberry Whip
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups strawberries
  • 0.25 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 cup vanilla yogurt
  • 0.5 cup pineapple juice
  • 1 cup crushed ice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender or food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Sprinkle strawberries with granulated sugar.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place in blender or food processor with vanilla yogurt and pineapple juice. Blend well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add crushed ice. Blend.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Makes two generous, frosty drinks.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Essential Mormon Cookbook

docs.title: Almost No-Knead Sourdough Bread
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 loaf 24.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 520 g bread flour
  • 1.75 tsp salt
  • 360 g room-temperature water
  • 85 g starter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 12 x 12 parchment paper
  • 1 Dutch oven

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Whisk bread flour and salt in a bowl. Hand whisk room-temperature water and starter in a large bowl until smooth. Add flour mixture to water mixture and stir.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Hand knead to form shaggy ball. Cover with plastic wrap and let sit at room temperature for 12 to 18 hours.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spray vegetable oil on 12 x 12 parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Knead dough 10 to 15 times.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer the dough to parchment and Dutch oven. Cover Dutch oven with plastic wrap. Put Dutch oven in middle of off oven with 3 cups of boiling water on bottom rack.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Keep in off oven for 2 to 3 hours until dough doubles in size or little finger mark springs back in dough.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove bread and water from oven. Discard plastic wrap.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Flour top of loaf and score 7" long x 1/2" deep.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text:
Cover Dutch oven and place on middle rack. Heat oven to 425°F and bake for 30 minutes.

Note

Oven should be off when the Dutch oven is placed in it.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Start timer when oven is turned on.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Remove lid and bake for 20 to 30 minutes until brown and bread has an internal temperature of 210°F.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Remove from pot and rest and cool for 2 hours before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Another Lemon Blueberry Bread
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 1.58 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Bread
docs.text:
• 1.5 (180 g) cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • 1 cup (198 g) granulated sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 0.33 cup (38 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 cup (113 g) whole milk
  • 1 cup (142 g) frozen blueberries
  • 1 Tbsp all-purpose flour

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp (28 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup (57 g) confectioners' sugar
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9"x 5" loaf pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a 9"x 5" loaf pan with parchment paper (or lightly grease with butter).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk the all-purpose flour, baking powder and salt, and set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Massage the lemon zest with the granulated sugar

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Beat the lemon sugar mixture with the eggs until light and fluffy.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In the bowl of an electric mixer, blend together the melted unsalted butter and lemon sugar and egg mixture. Mix until well combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add thee vanilla, and lemon juice to the whole milk.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: While slowly mixing, add flour mixture and milk mixture in two batches (some flour, then some milk, then the rest of the flour and the rest of the milk). Stop mixing as soon as it's just combined.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Rinse off the frozen blueberries (if using fresh) so they have just a bit of moisture on them, then, in a small bowl toss the blueberries and 1 Tbsp all-purpose flour. This flour coating will help prevent the blueberries from sinking to the bottom of your loaf while baking.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Add the flour coated berries to the batter and gently but quickly stir, by hand, to combine.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Immediately pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 55 to 65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool bread in the pan for about 30 minutes, then move to a wire cooling rack with a baking sheet below (to catch the glaze you're about to add).

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Prepare glaze by simply whisking together the melted unsalted butter, confectioners' sugar, lemon juice and vanilla, then pour glaze over the loaf. Allow to set a few minutes, then enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.glorioustreats.com/lemon-blueberry-bread/

docs.title: Artisan No-Knead Pizza Crust
docs.text: Total Time 1.06 days

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 247 g bread flour
  • 0.13 tsp yeast
  • 0.5 tsp granulated sugar
  • 8 g salt
  • 185 g lukewarm water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 pizza peel

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Weigh your bread flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess. Stir yeast, granulated sugar, salt, and lukewarm water together. Cover the rough, sticky dough and let it rise at room temperature for 24 hours. After this first rise, you may choose to refrigerate the dough for up to six days, which will help develop its flavor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: With a rack in the center, preheat the oven to 500°F to 550°F with a baking steel or stone inside. Make sure the oven is at least 500°F for a full 30 minutes before baking your pizza, in order for the steel or stone to preheat thoroughly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Divide the dough in half. Working with one piece at a time, transfer the dough to a well-floured surface.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stretch and fold it, as follows: Holding onto the dough at both ends, pull one end away from the other, then fold it back onto itself. Repeat on the other side so that all four corners of the dough have been stretched and folded.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Next, pull the ends of the dough toward the middle, then turn it over. Using your fingers, pull the dough under itself to make a smooth, round ball with the seams tucked into the bottom. Repeat with the other piece of dough. Place each ball seam-side down into a floured bowl.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cover the bowls and allow the dough to proof (rise) for 45 minutes to an hour, while your oven preheats.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Working with one piece at a time, transfer the dough to a well-floured work surface and dust the top with flour. Use your fingertips to gently depress the surface, being careful not to touch the outer edge of the crust; you want it to remain thick.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Lift up the crust and use your knuckles to gently stretch it into a circle about 10" to 12" in diameter. Move it to a well-floured pizza peel or floured sheet of parchment. If you're using parchment, trim the excess around the dough to prevent it from burning.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Lightly sauce the dough, then add your toppings of choice. For special toppings easy to prepare in advance see "tips," below.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
Turn on the top broiler in your preheated oven and transfer the pie to the steel or stone. Be sure there's at least 8" of space between the surface of the pizza and the broiler. If you have an oven with the broiler on the bottom (usually in the bottom compartment of the oven), or on top in a smaller, separate compartment, make sure there's at least 8" between the broiler and the cooking surface. If there isn't, don't use the broiler. Your pizza will still be great without being broiled, though it may take a few more minutes to bake., Gently slide the pizza (or pizza and parchment) onto the steel or stone. Bake the pizza for approximately 6 minutes on the steel (or 7 minutes on the stone), until bubbly and charred on the edges. Remove the pizza from the oven and top it with freshly grated Parmesan, if desired., Repeat with the remaining dough and toppings.

Tip

Substitute an equal amount of all-purpose flour for a slightly less chewy crust. No other changes are necessary.

Tip

To make the "Veg Vinaigrette Pizza": Top your pie with red sauce and add a sprinkle of grated mozzarella followed by roasted butternut squash or roasted sweet potato. Bake as directed. Remove the pizza from the oven and drizzle with your favorite vinaigrette. When the vinaigrette hits the hot surface it blooms — i.e., becomes super aromatic. Top with quick-pickled red onions (or other pickled items in your fridge, like capers) or radishes for color, and finish with a sprinkle of feta or crumbled blue cheese.

Tip

To make the "Smoky-Sweet Pizza": Top your pie with a thin layer of BBQ sauce and sprinkle with grated mozzarella. Add sliced pears, bacon that’s been cooked about halfway (pliable, not crispy), and thinly sliced scallions that have been flash-fried in oil. Bake the pizza as directed. To finish, drizzle with BBQ sauce from a squirt bottle, or BBQ sauce mixed with tomato sauce (roughly equal measures of each).

Tip

The maximum temperature rating for most parchment paper is below 500°F, and at temperatures between 450°F and 500°F parchment’s exposed edges begin to char. To be safe, keep a close eye on anything being cooked at temperatures above 450°F (especially anything on an upper rack). Burned edges can also be minimized by trimming away excess parchment before baking.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/artisan-no-knead-pizza-crust-recipe

docs.title: Bagels
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 bagels 17.87 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Starter
docs.text:
• 120 g bread flour
  • 0.25 tsp kosher salt
  • 0.06 tsp instant yeast
  • 75 g cool water

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 170 g room temperature water
  • 14 g barley malt syrup
  • 13 g dark brown sugar (alternative)
  • 0.75 tsp instant yeast
  • 8 g salt
  • 300 g bread flour

docs.title: Ingredients - Water Bath
docs.text:
Ratio 2.3%
  • 1808 g water
  • 42 g barley malt syrup or honey

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text: • 47 g Everything bagel topping (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Egg Wash
docs.text:
• 1 egg
  • 1 Tbsp water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 lightly greased bowl
  • 1 reusable cover or plastic wrap
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 shallow pot
  • 1 dough whisk or slotted spoon
  • 1 cooling rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To make the starter: Weigh your flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl or the bowl of your stand mixer, stir together the bread flour, kosher salt, instant yeast, and cool water to make a shaggy dough, then use your hand to knead gently until thoroughly combined. (This may take about a minute; it's quite stiff.) Cover the bowl and let the starter rest at room temperature for 4 to 14 hours; it should expand.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To make the dough: Add all the starter, room temperature water, barley malt syrup or dark brown sugar (alternative), instant yeast, salt, bread flour in the order listed to the bowl with the starter. Mix to bring the dough together, by hand or at low speed of a stand mixer with the dough hook attachment. Next, knead the stiff dough until it’s supple and elastic. This will take up to 15 minutes by hand or 8 to 10 minutes at medium-low speed with a mixer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl and let it rest, covered with a reusable cover or plastic wrap, until it doubles in bulk. This will take about 2 to 2.5 hours depending on the warmth of your kitchen.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Turn the dough out onto a clean surface, gently deflate it, and divide it into eight equal pieces.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: To preshape the dough: Working with one piece of dough at a time, fold the edges into the center. Pinch to seal and set aside. Repeat with the remaining pieces of dough.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Starting with the first piece of dough you shaped, place it seam-side down on an unfloured surface. Use your cupped fingers and palm to roll the dough into a tight ball, moving your hand in a circular motion. The dough should stick slightly to the surface in order to create tension to yield a smooth exterior. If the dough is unmanageably sticky, add a very light dusting of flour; if the dough slides around on the surface without tightening, use a damp towel to clean and moisten the surface and try again.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Once shaped into a tight ball, place the dough onto a lightly floured surface and repeat with the remaining pieces of dough.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Cover the preshaped dough and allow it to rest for 10 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment and lightly grease the parchment; or sprinkle the parchment lightly with cornmeal, semolina, or farina, to prevent the bagels from sticking.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: To shape the bagels: Working with one piece of dough at a time, use your finger to poke a hole through the center. Gently rotate the dough to expand the hole to 2" to 3" in diameter, forming a ring shape. Place the shaped bagel onto the prepared baking sheet. The hole will close up a bit; that’s OK.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Repeat with the remaining pieces of dough. Place the bagels on the baking sheet in a 3-2-3 arrangement to allow them to fit nicely on one pan.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Cover the bagels with a reusable cover or lightly greased plastic wrap and let them rest until they feel slightly puffy to the touch, about 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: While the bagels are resting, preheat the oven to 450°F. Combine the water and barley malt syrup or honey in a wide, shallow pot; the water should be at least 1.25" deep. Bring the mixture to a boil.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: To boil the bagels: Add bagels to the water two or three at a time to avoid crowding. Boil for 60 seconds, then use a dough whisk or slotted spoon to turn the bagels over. Boil for another 60 seconds before removing from the water and placing on the prepared pan.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: If adding a topping, such as Everything bagel topping (optional), brush each bagel with the egg and water (egg wash) and dip into a bowl of your desired topping before transferring back to the pan.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Bake the bagels until golden brown, 18 to 22 minutes. Rotate the pan (front to back, back to front) halfway through baking to ensure even browning.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Remove the bagels from the oven and transfer them to a cooling rack to cool.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text:
Storage information: Prepared bagel sandwiches can be stored, well-wrapped in foil, in the refrigerator for up to two days or in the freezer for up to a month. (See “tips,” below, for reheating instructions.) Bagels that aren’t made into sandwiches can be stored, well wrapped, at room temperature for several days, or frozen for longer storage.

Tip

To bake your bagels first thing in the morning: Prepare the dough up through step 4 (complete the kneading process) and allow it to rise for just 1 hour. Continue following the recipe through step 11 (shaping the bagels). Immediately place the baking sheet with the prepared bagels, covered, into the refrigerator overnight (8 to 12 hours). The next morning, continue the recipe as written starting at step 14 (preheating the oven). Leave the bagels in the refrigerator until the water bath is boiling and the oven is preheated.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/ultimate-sandwich-bagels-recipe

docs.title: Baguettes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 baguettes 2.22 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Starter
docs.text:
• 113 g water
  • 0.06 tsp instant yeast
  • 120 g all-purpose flour

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 255 g water
  • 1.5 tsp instant yeast
  • 420 g all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 medium-sized bowl
  • 1 cast iron pan
  • 1 dish towel or couche
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 baker's lame

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Weigh your flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess. In a large bowl, combine the starter ingredients.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix water, instant yeast, and all-purpose flour together to make a soft dough. Cover and let rest at room temperature for about 14 hours; overnight works well. The starter should have expanded and become bubbly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix and knead water, starter, instant yeast, all-purpose flour, and salt together — by hand, mixer or bread machine set on the dough cycle — to make a soft, somewhat smooth dough; it should be cohesive, but the surface may still be a bit rough. If you're using a stand mixer, knead for about 4 minutes on medium-low speed (speed 2 on a KitchenAid); the finished dough should stick a bit at the bottom of the bowl. If kneading by hand, let the dough rest for 15 minutes and then give it a set of bowl folds, flip, and cover.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place the dough in a lightly greased medium-sized bowl, cover the bowl, and let the dough rest and rise for 45 minutes. Gently deflate the dough and fold its edges into the center, then turn it over in the bowl before letting it rise for an additional 45 minutes, until it's noticeably puffy.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Turn the dough out onto a lightly greased work surface. Gently deflate it, and divide it into three equal pieces.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Round each piece of dough into a rough ball by pulling the edges into the center. Cover with greased plastic wrap, and let rest for 15 minutes; or for up to 1 hour, if that works better with your schedule.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Working with one piece at a time, flatten the dough slightly then fold it nearly (but not quite) in half, sealing the edges with the heel of your hand.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Turn the dough around 180° and repeat: fold, then flatten. Repeat this whole process again; the dough should have started to elongate itself.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: With the seam side down, cup your fingers and gently roll the dough into a 16" log. Your goal is a 15" baguette, so 16" allows for the slight shrinkage you'll see once you're done rolling. Taper each end of the log slightly to create the baguette's typical "pointy" end.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Place the logs seam-side down onto a lightly greased or parchment-lined sheet pan or pans; or into the folds of a heavily floured cotton dish towel (or couche). Cover them with lightly greased plastic wrap, and allow the loaves to rise until they're slightly puffy ("marshmallow-y" is the term we use in our baking school). The loaves should certainly look lighter and less dense than when you first shaped them, but won't be anywhere near doubled in bulk. This should take about 45 minutes to an hour at room temperature (about 68°F).

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Towards the end of the rising time, preheat your oven to 450°F with a cast iron pan on the floor of the oven, or on the lowest rack. If you're using a baking stone, place it on a middle rack. Start to heat 1 1/2 cups water to boiling.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: If your baguettes have risen in a dish towel or couche, gently roll them (seam-side up) onto a transfer peel and then roll back over onto a piece of parchment, seam-side down. If you don't have a transfer peel, roll the baguettes onto a piece of parchment (seam-side down) and then place the parchment on a baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Using a baker's lame (a special curved blade) or a very sharp knife held at about a 45° angle, make three to five long lengthwise slashes in each baguette.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Load the baguettes into the oven. If you’re baking on a stone, use a baker’s peel to transfer the baguettes, parchment and all, onto the hot stone. Carefully pour the boiling water into the cast iron pan, and quickly shut the oven door. The billowing steam created by the boiling water will help the baguettes rise, and give them a lovely, shiny crust.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Bake the baguettes - on the pan, or on a stone - for 24 to 28 minutes, or until they're a very deep golden brown. Remove them from the oven and cool them on a rack. Or, for the very crispiest baguettes, turn off the oven, crack it open about 2", and allow the baguettes to cool completely in the oven, until both baguettes and oven are at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Storage information: Store any leftover baguettes in a paper bag overnight; freeze for longer storage. Thaw and reheat just before serving.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/classic-baguettes-recipe
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a8l5Qi43U3c

docs.title: Basic Sweet Babka
docs.text: Total Time 3.65 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
Serves 2 large loaves
  • 1 Tbsp dry active yeast
  • 0.5 tsp granulated sugar
  • 0.5 (113 g) cup lukewarm water
  • 4.5 cups (540 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.33 cup (66 g) granulated sugar
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 cup (113 g) milk
  • 0.75 cup (170 g) melted butter
  • 2 eggs
Serves 1 large loaf
  • 2 tsp dry active yeast
  • 0.25 tsp granulated sugar
  • 0.25 (57 g) cup lukewarm water
  • 2.25 cups (270 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.17 cup (33 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.25 cup (57 g) milk
  • 0.375 cup (85 g) melted butter
  • 1 eggs

docs.title: Ingredients - Syrup
docs.text:
Serves 4 large loaves
  • 0.67 (151 g) cup water
  • 1 cup (198 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
Serves 1 large loaf
  • 0.17 (38 g) cup water
  • 1/4 cup (50 g) granulated sugar
  • 1/4 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Chocolate Filling
docs.text:
Serves 2 large loaves
  • 0.75 cup (170 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup (99 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.33 cup (29 g) unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 6 oz (170 g) dark chocolate
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 pinch salt
Serves 1 large loaf
  • 85 g unsalted butter
  • 0.25 cup (50 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.16 cup (15 g) unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 3 oz (85 g) dark chocolate
  • 0.125 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Ingredients - Cinnamon Filling
docs.text:
Serves 2 large loaves
  • 0.75 cup (170 g) unsalted melted butter
  • 300 g granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 1 pinch salt
Serves 1 large loaf
  • 85 g unsalted melted butter
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 greased bowl
  • 1 damp towel
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 8.5 x 4.5 inch loaf pans
  • 1 loaf pan
  • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: For the dough: Place the dry active yeast and 1/2 teaspoon granulated sugar in a small bowl. Add the lukewarm water and stir gently to mix. Set aside until foamy, 5 to 10 minutes. In a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook, mix together the all-purpose flour, 1/3 cup granulated sugar, and 2 teaspoons vanilla.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, scald the milk (bring almost to a boil, until milk is just simmering). Allow to sit for 1 minute to cool just slightly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: With mixer on low, add the water and​ yeast mixture, milk, and melted butter. Add the eggs one at a time.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When the dough begins to come together, after 2 to 3 minutes, turn off the mixer and scrape down the sides. Raise the speed to high and mix for another 5 to 10 minutes until the dough is shiny, elastic, and smooth. It may seem like a long time to mix, but the result is worth the wait.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a reusable cover and allow the dough to rise at room temperature for 1 hour. Refrigerate the dough for 1 hour, or until it’s thoroughly chilled.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Make the sugar syrup while the dough is rising: Combine the water, granulated sugar, and vanilla in a small saucepan. Bring to a low boil until the sugar has dissolved. Set aside and cool. This syrup can be kept in the fridge for 2 to 3 months and makes enough for at least 2 batches of babka (6 medium babkas).

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Prepare two greased 8.5 x 4.5 inch loaf pans. Note: you can also make two larger round babkas that can be baked on baking sheets.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: To make the chocolate filling, beat 3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) room temperature unsalted butter with 1/2 cup granulated sugar until smooth. Add 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 6 ounces melted dark chocolate (you can also use good-quality dark chocolate chips), 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and a pinch of salt.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Cut the dough into two equal parts (use a food scale for precision). Roll out one part into a rectangle where the height is the same as the loaf pan length. Spread one-third of the 1 to 1.5 cups of chocolate or cinnamon filling onto the rectangle and roll up along the shorter side (to create swirls inside).

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Once the dough is formed into a swirled log, cut it straight down the middle so the filling is exposed.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Cut 1/2 inch off each end.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Layer each cut piece on top of one another and twist. Place in a greased loaf pan.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Repeat with the other two pieces of babka dough. Lightly drape a kitchen towel over the top of the pans. Allow to rise another 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F while the dough rises.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Bake for 20 minutes. Brush each babka with two layers of sugar syrup. Place back in the oven for approximately 15 minutes. The edges should be slightly brown and the middle should be slightly doughy.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: When the babkas come out of the oven, immediately brush each with another 3 light layers of sugar syrup. Allow to cool for 5 to 10 minutes. Using a butter knife, loosen the sides of the babka from the pan and place on top of wire rack to cool.

  • https://www.thekitchn.com/chocolate-babka-recipe-reviews-23213321
  • https://family-friends-food.com/cinnamon-babka-modern-jewish-baker-review/

docs.title: Best-Ever Banana Bread
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Bread
docs.text:
• 1.25 cups (248 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup (113 g) unsalted butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 1.5 cups (3-4) banana
  • 0.5 cup (114 g) buttermilk
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2.5 cups (300 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 cup nuts (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Streusel
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup (60 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 4 Tbsp (57 g) melted butter
  • 0.5 cup (107 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp cinnamon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 8" loaf pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine granulated sugar, softened butter, eggs, banana (3-4), buttermilk, vanilla, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, and nuts (optional).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Make the streusel topping by whisking together the brown sugar, salt, all-purpose flour, and cinnamon. Add the melted butter, stirring until well combined. Add the topping to the pan.

Note

The crust makes it sweet enough as it is. Streusel topping is not required.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake in 8" loaf pan for 1 hour.

docs.title: Big & Bubbly Focaccia
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 8" square 4.20 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 360 g all-purpose flour
  • 9 g salt
  • 5 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp yeast
  • 284 g lukewarm water
  • 18 g olive oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Assembly
docs.text:
• 13 g olive oil
  • 13 g olive oil
  • some flaky salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 spatula, bowl scraper, dough whisk
  • 1 9" square Fabulous Focaccia Pan
  • 1 nonstick spray
  • 1 3"-wide strip of parchment

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To make the dough: Weigh your all-purpose flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess. In a large bowl (a 3-quart bowl with a lid works great), whisk together the flour, salt, granulated sugar, and yeast.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the lukewarm water and olive oil and stir — with a spatula, bowl scraper, dough whisk, or your hands — until the mixture is thoroughly combined and homogeneous; there should be no dry patches or lumps. Cover the bowl and set it aside for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Perform the first bowl fold: Use a wet hand to grab a section of dough from one side of the bowl, then lift it up and press it into the center. Repeat this motion, grabbing a new section of dough each time, until you've made a full circle around the bowl, about 8 to 12 times. Once you’ve circled the bowl, flip the dough over in the bowl so that the smooth side is up; the first bowl fold is now complete. Cover the bowl and let the dough rest for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Note: You’ll be doing this 3 more times over the next 45 minutes, each time further developing the dough’s strength.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Repeat the bowl fold for a second time. (Remember to use a wet hand to prevent the dough from sticking!) At this point, the dough should feel smoother and tighter. Cover the bowl and let the dough rest for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Repeat the bowl fold for a third time. Cover the bowl and let the dough rest for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Repeat the bowl fold for a fourth and final time; the dough should feel relatively strong.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cover the bowl and let the dough rise at a warm room temperature (70°F to 75°F) for 1 hour. After 1 hour, the dough should have nearly doubled in size and will be very puffy; it may even have a few bubbles on the surface.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: To prepare the pan: Once the dough has risen, spray the bottom and sides of a 9" square Fabulous Focaccia Pan with nonstick spray. Cut a 3"-wide strip of parchment that's about 16" long. Lay the strip across the center of the pan, leaving a few inches of overhang on 2 sides; press it firmly into the pan and crease the parchment where it meets the sides of the pan to help it stay in place. (The parchment tabs will help you remove the focaccia from the pan later on.)

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Spray the parchment with nonstick spray, then add 1 tablespoon (13 g) of the olive oil and tilt the pan to spread the oil evenly across the bottom.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Use a bowl scraper or flexible spatula to gently transfer the risen dough to the center of the pan. Using your hand as paddles (and a bowl scraper for assistance, if you need it) swiftly but gently flip the dough over so that it’s coated in oil; try to handle the dough minimally to keep it from deflating.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Cover the pan and let the dough rise at a warm room temperature for 1 to 1.5 hours, until it’s marshmallowy and jiggly; the dough should nearly fill the corners of the pan and be very close to the top edge.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Toward the end of the rise, preheat the oven to 475°F with racks in the upper and lower thirds.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Once the dough has risen, lightly coat your fingers in oil. Starting at one edge, press your fingertips into the dough until they reach the bottom of the pan, creating dimples. Repeat this process, working your way from one edge to the other, spacing the dimples about 1 1/2" apart. The goal is to thoroughly dimple the dough without deflating it — aim for decisive yet gentle motions. If there are any large untouched areas of the dough, add additional dimples using one finger.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: To top the dough: Drizzle the remaining 1 tablespoon (13 g) olive oil all over the surface of the dough; it’s OK if it pools in some dimples. Sprinkle evenly with flaky salt (use 1 generously rounded teaspoon Cyprus Flake Salt or 1/2 teaspoon Maldon).

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Bake the focaccia on the lower rack for 15 to 18 minutes, until brown in the highest spots and golden in the crevices. If necessary, move the pan to the top rack and broil briefly for the final 1 to 2 minutes, watching carefully, to achieve the desired color.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text:
Remove the focaccia fro the oven. Using the parchment tabs as handles, lift the focaccia out of the pan and transfer it to a wire rack or cutting board; remove the parchment strip. Turn off the oven and slide the focaccia back into the oven, directly on the lower rack, for 5 to 7 minutes, until the sides are golden brown and crisp. Remove the focaccia from the oven once again and transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Tip

Focaccia is best enjoyed the day it's made. If storing leftovers, wrap the focaccia loosely in foil, keep it at room temperature, and reheat before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/big-and-bubbly-focaccia-recipe

docs.title: Bread Machine French Bread
docs.text: Total Time 4.50 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.33 cups (303 g) warm water
  • 1.5 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp sugar
  • 4 cups (480 g) bread flour
  • 2.25 tsp (7 g) yeast

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bread pan
  • 1 bread machine

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place warm water into the bread pan of the bread machine.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the following in order: olive oil, salt, and sugar.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add bread flour, covering the liquid. Make a small indentation at the top center of the flour, but not deep enough to reach the liquid.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the yeast to this indentation.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Close bread machine and press "start". Take 4.5 hours.

docs.title: Bread Machine Italian Parmesan
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 2 lb loaf 4.50 hours

  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp Italian seasoning
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.25 cup (25 g) Parmesan cheese
  • 4 cups (480 g) bread flour
  • 2.5 tsp yeast

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bread pan
  • 1 bread machine

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place warm water into the bread pan of the bread machine.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the following in order: salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix the Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and Parmesan cheese to the bread flour.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add flour mixture, covering the liquid. Make a small indentation at the top center of the flour, but not deep enough to reach the liquid.

docs.title: Step 5

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Close bread machine and press "start". Take 4.5 hours.

docs.title: Brioche
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 large loaf 10.03 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 330 g all-purpose flour
  • 28 g dry milk
  • 8 g salt
  • 1 Tbsp instant yeast
  • 3 large eggs
  • 57 g water
  • 35 g granulated sugar
  • 142 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze (optional)
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp confectioners' sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp heavy cream

docs.title: Ingredients - Braided Loaf
docs.text:
• 1 egg yolk (optional)
  • some pearl sugar or sparkling white sugar (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 dough hook
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 instant-read thermometer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add all ingredients to the refrigerator so that they are cold when making the dough.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Weigh your all-purpose flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To make the dough: In a medium bowl, mix together flour, dry milk, salt, and instant yeast.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook attachment, add the cold eggs, cool water, then the dry ingredients, (except the butter) to make a smooth, stretchy dough that cleans the sides of the bowl; this should take 7 to 10 minutes at medium speed.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: If the dough looks too dry, add the granulated sugar earlier during mixing process. The sugar should be added later to give the dough time to come together because the sugar acts as a liquefying agent.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Using a rolling pin, beat the cold butter to make it pliable.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Once the dough has developed some strength and elasticity, add one piece of the cold unsalted butter, about 28 g, and mix at medium speed until it’s fully incorporated into the dough, 1 to 2 minutes. Scrape the bowl if necessary, then continue adding the butter one piece at a time, mixing to incorporate fully before adding the next piece. This dough takes longer than most to develop so be prepared to let the dough knead for another 5 to 10 minutes, or until it's formed a soft, smooth ball. We don't recommend trying to knead this dough by hand.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Form the dough into a ball (it'll be very soft), place it in a greased bowl, cover the bowl, and it let rise for 1 hour. Then refrigerate the dough for several hours, or overnight. This will slow the fermentation and chill the butter, making the dough easier to shape.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Divide the chilled dough into 12 pieces to make mini-brioche (brioche buns); leave it whole for one large round brioche; or divide it in half for two 8 1/2" x 4 1/2" loaves.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Place the dough into the greased pan(s) of your choice, cover lightly, and let rise for 2.5 to 3 hours, until it's doubled and looks very puffy.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: If you're making two loaves, it's fun to make simple three-strand braids, and set them in the loaf pans.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: To bake a large, round brioche: Place the pan into a preheated 400°F oven. After 10 minutes, reduce the oven heat to 350°F and bake for about 30 to 35 minutes more. Check the brioche after 15 minutes; tent with aluminum foil if it appears to be browning too quickly. Brioche should be a deep brown when done, should sound hollow when tapped, and will read 190°F at the center using an instant-read thermometer. (It's easy to underbake since it browns so quickly!).

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Remove the brioche from the oven, and after 10 minutes remove it from the pan to cool completely on a rack.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: To bake the mini brioches: Place the pan(s) onto a baking sheet for easy handling, as shown; then nestle that baking sheet into another baking sheet, to protect the buns' bottoms from over-browning. Bake the buns in a preheated 375°F oven for 15 to 20 minutes (tent after 10 minutes if they're browning too quickly).

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Remove them from the oven, let stand for 5 minutes, then turn them out onto a rack.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: To bake the loaves: Allow the loaves to rise until they've nearly reached the rim of the pan, about 3 hours. Set the loaf pans on a baking sheet, for easy handling. Bake in a preheated 350°F oven for 30 to 35 minutes, tenting with foil after 15 to 20 minutes. Bake until the internal temperature reaches at least 190°F in the center, and up to 205°F for a crustier loaf.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text:
To make the glaze: Combine the confectioners' sugar, vanilla, and salt. Add enough heavy cream to make a pourable consistency. Drizzle the glaze over the baked loaves, if desired.

Tip

If you're baking the brioche as a braided loaf, add an extra egg yolk (optional) to the dough, reserving the white. Just before baking the risen loaves, whisk the reserved white with 1 tablespoon milk, brush on loaves, and sprinkle with pearl sugar or sparkling white sugar (optional).

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:

  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RZBuJ4_LdDk
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Y8MxeG9BAc
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AG--9bm6s0A

docs.title: Buttermilk Biscuits
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 19 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 120 g buttermilk
  • 113 g sour cream
  • 284 g all-purpose flour
  • 12 g baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp baking soda
  • 1.5 kosher tsp salt
  • 113 g cold unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 bench scraper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust an oven rack to the middle position and preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). In a small bowl, whisk together the buttermilk and sour cream.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the bowl of a food processor, combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt and process until blended, about 2 seconds. Scatter cold unsalted butter evenly over flour and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse meal and the largest butter pieces are about 1/4 inch at their widest, about 8 times. Transfer to a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the buttermilk mixture to the flour mixture and, using a rubber spatula, fold until just combined. Transfer the dough to a floured work surface and knead until it just comes together, adding extra flour as necessary.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: With a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 12 by 8 inch rectangle. Using a bench scraper, fold the right third of the dough over the center, then fold the left third over so you end up with a 12 by 4 inch rectangle. Fold the top third down over the center, then fold the bottom third up so the whole thing is reduced to a 4 inch square. Press the square down and roll it out again into a 12 by 8 inch rectangle. Repeat the folding process once more. (See notes for cheddar cheese and scallion variation.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Roll the dough again into a 10 by 6 inch rectangle (about 1 inch thick). Using a floured biscuit cutter, cut eight 2 1/2–inch rounds out of the dough. Transfer the rounds to a parchment-lined baking sheet, spacing them about 1 inch apart. Form the dough scraps into a ball and knead gently 2 or 3 times, until smooth. Roll the dough out until it’s large enough to cut out 4 more 2 1/2-inch rounds, and transfer to the baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Brush the tops of the biscuits with the melted butter and bake until golden brown and well risen, about 14 minutes, rotating the pan halfway through. Allow to cool for 5 minutes and serve.

Variation

To make cheddar cheese and scallion biscuits: In Step 4, sprinkle 6 ounces grated cheddar cheese and 1/4 cup sliced scallions over the 12- by 8-inch dough rectangle before folding it the second time, and continue as directed.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.seriouseats.com/the-food-lab-buttermilk-biscuits-recipe
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-biscuit-bake-off/

docs.title: Challah
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 loaves 4.98 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
Serves 2 loaves
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 3 large eggs
  • 66 g vegetable oil
  • 302 g cold water
  • 930 g all-purpose flour
  • 99 g granulated sugar
  • 18 g salt
  • 17 g instant yeast
Serves 1 loaf
  • 2 large eggs
  • 33 g vegetable oil
  • 151 g cold water
  • 465 g all-purpose flour
  • 50 g granulated sugar
  • 9 g salt
  • 9 g instant yeast

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 1 large egg
  • 1 tsp water
  • some poppy or sesame seeds

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Weigh your flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess. Place the egg yolks, eggs, vegetable oil, cold water, all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, salt, and instant yeast into a large bowl (or the bowl of your stand mixer) in the order in which they’re listed. Mix just until the dough comes together to form a shaggy mass; using your mixer equipped with the dough hook, this will take about 3 minutes on low speed.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Knead the dough, by hand or mixer, until it’s smooth and well-developed; this will take 5 to 6 minutes at medium speed using your mixer.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a reusable cover and allow the dough to rise at room temperature for 1 hour. Refrigerate the dough for 1 hour, or until it’s thoroughly chilled.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Remove the dough from the refrigerator, and transfer it to a lightly greased work surface. To make two large loaves, divide the dough in half; each half will weigh about 824 g.

Tip

To make three medium-sized three-strand braids divide the initial batch of dough into three pieces, each about 549 g. Working with one piece at a time, divide it into three pieces, each about 183g. Pre-shape the pieces and let them rest as directed above, then roll each piece into a 16”-long strand. Braid the three strands. Repeat with the other two loaves. Finish as directed, baking the loaves for 20 to 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Working with one piece of dough at a time, divide it into three, four, or six pieces (to make a standard braid, a four-strand braid, or a six-strand braid). To make the six-strand braid pictured above, divide into six pieces, each about 137 g. Preshape each piece into a rough log; you’re going to be rolling them into long strands. Cover the logs. Repeat with the remaining piece of dough, dividing it into six pieces (or however many you need for the braid you want to make).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Let the covered logs relax for about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Uncover the logs. Working with the dough for one loaf, roll each log into a strand about 20" long. Make a six-strand braid; for help with this technique, check out our video, How to braid a six-strand loaf.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Repeat to make the second loaf.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Place each loaf on a parchment-lined or lightly greased baking sheet. Cover the loaves and let them rise at room temperature until they’re almost doubled in size, about 1.5 to 2 hours.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Towards the end of the rising time, preheat your oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Whisk together the egg and water for the topping and pour it through a sieve to remove any clumps of egg. Brush the risen loaves with the egg wash and sprinkle with poppy or sesame seeds.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text:
Bake the loaves for 25 to 30 minutes, or until they’re a rich golden brown and sound hollow when tapped on the bottom. Their interior temperature should register about 210°F using a digital thermometer.

Tip

The baking time listed above yields loaves that are a deep mahogany brown. If you prefer your bread a bit lighter in color, tent the loaves lightly with a sheet of aluminum foil for the final 5 to 10 minutes of baking.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Remove the loaves from the oven, and place them on a rack to cool.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Store cooled bread, well wrapped, at room temperature for several days; freeze for longer storage.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/jeffreys-challah-recipe
  • https://youtube.com/watch?v=UdYYRColviQ
  • https://youtube.com/watch?v=niM19Rt7t38

docs.title: Chocolate Chip Peanut Butter Banana Bread
docs.text: Total Time 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup whole wheat flour
  • 0.75 cup light brown sugar
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 2 mashed bananas
  • 0.33 cup peanut butter
  • 0.25 cup fat-free plain yogurt
  • 1 egg
  • 2 Tbsp canola oil
  • 0.75 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 loaf pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Coat standard loaf pan with cooking spray.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine whole wheat flour, light brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk together mashed bananas, peanut butter, fat-free plain yogurt, egg, and canola oil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir banana mixture into flour mixture. Add semi-sweet chocolate chips. Pour and bake 40 to 50 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook on rack for 15 minutes before unmolding.

docs.title: Ciabatta
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 loaves 18.63 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Biga
docs.text:
• 180 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 tsp instant yeast
  • 114 g water

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 1 tsp instant yeast
  • 2 tsp nonfat dry milk or 38 g milk
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 213 g water or 175 g
  • 11 g olive oil
  • 240 g all-purpose flour

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 bench knife or dough scraper
