docs.text: Add salt to taste.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover securely with a lid or seal and set in the refrigerator overnight (or for at least 6 hours) to set/soak.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: The next day, open and enjoy as is or garnish with desired toppings (see options above). See more flavor/topping suggestions in the blog post above!

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: OPTIONAL: You can also heat your oats in the microwave for 45-60 seconds (just ensure there's enough room at the top of your jar to allow for expansion and prevent overflow), or transfer oats to a saucepan and heat over medium heat until warmed through. Add more liquid as needed if oats get too thick/dry.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Overnight oats will keep in the refrigerator for 2-3 days, though best within the first 12-24 hours in our experience. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Cinnamon Rolls
docs.text: Total Time 2.5 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 pkg instant yeast
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.33 cup sugar
  • 1.5 cups milk
  • 6 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 egg

docs.title: Ingredients - Cinnamon Sugar Filling
docs.text:
• 0.67 cup light brown sugar
  • 1 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 0.25 cup unsalted butter

docs.title: Filling Variation
docs.text:
• 115 g unsalted butter
  • 170 g light brown sugar
  • 2 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 1/2 tsp nutmeg
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 115 g toasted pecans

docs.title: Ingredients - Cream Cheese Frosting
docs.text:
• 4 oz cream cheese
  • 0.5 cup butter
  • 3 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 3 Tbsp milk
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Frosting Variation
docs.text:
• 4 oz cream cheese
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 141 g confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 microwave safe bowl
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 floss or a very sharp knife
  • 1 9 x 13 inch pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 dish cloth

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large bowl combine 2 cups of the all-purpose flour, instant yeast, salt and sugar in a bowl. Mix to combine.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a microwave safe bowl, microwave the milk and butter for 30 seconds until warm and the butter is mostly melted. The mixture should be warm, but not hot. If it is too hot, make sure to let it cool before adding to the yeast to prevent killing the yeast. Add the warm milk and butter to the flour mixture.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the egg.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Beat on low speed, gradually increasing to high until completely combined, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Scrape down the bowl and add 1 more cup of flour, beating until combined. Add the remaining cup of flour in a little at a time until the dough starts to pull away from the sides of the bowl and form a ball.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Turn the dough out onto a well floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes until smooth and you can stretch a piece of dough out between your fingers without it breaking. This means the gluten has developed and your dough will be pillowy soft.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Transfer the dough to an oiled bowl and cover. Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until the dough has doubled in size.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: While the dough rises, make the filling. Combine the light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt together in a small bowl and mix well. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Once the dough has risen, roll it out into a long rectangle about 18 x 12 inches on a well floured surface.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Spread the butter for the filling all the way to the edge of the dough. Sprinkle the sugar mixture over the butter, pressing it down to stick to the butter.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: From the long end, roll the dough away from you into a tight roll, sealing the bottom edge down by pinching the dough together.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Use floss or a very sharp knife to cut the dough into 12 even rolls. Place the rolls in a 9 x 13 inch pan lined with parchment paper. Cover loosely with a dish cloth and allow to rise for another hour until doubled in size and puffed up.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Bake the cinnamon rolls at 350°F for 30 minutes or until they are golden brown and no longer doughy. Allow to cool.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text:
While the rolls cool, make the cream cheese frosting. In a stand mixer fit with the whisk attachment combine the cream cheese, butter, confectioners' sugar, milk, salt, and vanilla extract. Beat on low speed, gradually increasing to high until light and fluffy. Spread the icing evenly over the 12 rolls. Enjoy warm!

Filling Variation

Prepare filling with the same bowl and beater, mixing butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt on low speed until moistened. Increase to medium and beat the dark paste until creamy, light in color, and very soft, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a zip-top bag or disposable pastry bag and set aside until needed, up to 24 hours at room temperature. Reserve the pecans until it's time to fill and shape the rolls.

Frosting Variation

Combine cream cheese and vanilla with half the confectioners' sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Mix on low to moisten, then sprinkle in the rest of the sugar a little at a time. Once it is incorporated, increase to medium and beat until creamy and pale ivory, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a zip-top bag or disposable pastry bag and set aside until needed, up to 24 hours at room temperature. (If your kitchen is chilly and the frosting hardens in that time, briefly microwave the bag to restore its creamy texture before use.)

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://bromabakery.com/homemade-cinnamon-rolls-soft-fluffy/

docs.title: Cinnamon-Sugared Buttermilk Doughnuts
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 15-17 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 cups sugar
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 1.5 tsp nutmeg
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.75 cup buttermilk
  • 4 Tbsp butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 6 cups vegetable shortening
  • 1.5 Tbsp cinnamon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 2-cup liquid measuring cup
  • 1 wooden spoon or rubber spatula
  • 1 large Dutch oven
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 doughnut cutter
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 paper towels
  • 1 spider skimmer
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

For a bit more flavor, add two ounces of lard to every cup of shortening. You can also add one-quarter cup of flour to the recipe, which will produce a chewier doughnut with a less crispy exterior. Regardless, these doughnuts are best eaten very warm, as soon out of the pot as possible. The dough can be made by hand, using a large bowl with a wooden spoon, or in a mixer as directed. If you don’t have a doughnut cutter, you can use a 3-inch and 1-inch round cutter to cut out the dough. Like cookies, doughnuts rolled from scraps will be a little drier and less crisp than those cut from the first roll.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Stir 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, baking soda, nutmeg, and salt together in bowl of stand mixer. Whisk buttermilk, butter, eggs, and egg yolk together in 2-cup liquid measuring cup.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fit stand mixer with paddle attachment, add wet ingredients to dry and mix on medium speed until smooth, about 30 seconds. Decrease speed to low, add remaining 2.5 cups flour and mix until just combined, about 30 seconds. Stir batter once or twice with wooden spoon or rubber spatula to ensure that all liquid is incorporated. (The dough will be moist and tacky, a cross between cake batter and cookie dough.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat vegetable shortening in large Dutch oven over medium-low heat to 375°F. While oil is heating, line rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly dust with flour. Turn dough onto well-floured work surface. Roll with heavily floured rolling pin to 1/2-inch thick. Stamp out dough rings with heavily floured doughnut cutter, reflouring between cuts. Transfer dough rounds and holes to prepared baking sheet. Gather scraps and gently press into disk; repeat rolling and stamping process until all dough is used. (Cut doughnuts can be covered with plastic wrap and stored at room temperature up to 2 hours.)

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Set wire rack in second rimmed baking sheet and line with triple layer of paper towels. Using your hands, carefully place dough rings into hot fat four or five at a time, depending on kettle size, adjusting burner as necessary to maintain oil temperature between 360 to 365°F. Using spider skimmer, turn doughnuts as they rise to surface. Fry doughnuts until golden brown, 50 to 60 seconds per side. Drain on prepared baking sheet. Return oil to 375°F and repeat with remaining doughnuts. For doughnut holes, transfer all to hot oil and stir gently and constantly until golden brown, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Mix remaining 1 cup sugar with cinnamon in small bowl. Cool doughnuts about 1 minute and toss with cinnamon sugar to coat.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.cooksillustrated.com/recipes/1194-cinnamon-sugared-buttermilk-doughnuts?pac=mWqkH2daP1%2B/nBz33sh7IoL82IfIJ3UVJu36JnPKzwM%3D%0A&extcode=NSYTI16YT

docs.title: Cinnamon Toast Crunch Baked Oats Recipe by Tasty
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup oats
  • 0.33 cup apple sauce
  • 1 egg
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • 5 tbsp cinnamon toast crunch
  • 0.5 cup almond milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender
  • 1 ramekin or loaf dish
  • 1 air fryer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add your oats, apple sauce, egg, baking powder, cinnamon, vanilla, 3 tbsp of cinnamon toast crunch and your almond milk to a blender and blend until smooth. Set aside leftover cinnamon toast crunch for garnish.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer the baked oats mixture to a ramekin or loaf dish. Set your air fryer or oven to 350°F for 15 minutes. Halfway through add your cinnamon toast crunch to the top!

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove and let cool for 5 minutes. Add more Cinnamon Toast Crunch on top as desired.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://tasty.co/recipe/cinnamon-toast-crunch-baked-oats

docs.title: Classic Buttermilk Waffles
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 large eggs
  • 397 g buttermilk
  • 8 Tbsp melted butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 210 g all-purpose flour
  • 25 g granulated sugar
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium-sized mixing bowl
  • 1 waffle iron

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium-sized mixing bowl, beat together the eggs, buttermilk, melted butter, and vanilla.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a separate bowl whisk together the all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine the wet and dry ingredients, stirring just until nearly smooth; a few small lumps may remain.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Spray your waffle iron with a non-stick cooking spray before preheating it. Cook waffles according to the manufacturer's directions. For an 8" round waffle iron, use about 1/3 cup batter; cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until the iron stops steaming.

Tip

Waffles are best consumed as soon as they're baked, but in a pinch you may place them on a rack to cool, wrap tightly to store in the refrigerator, then reheat for 6 minutes in a 350°F oven.

Note

Leave out the sugar if you want savory waffles, such as the type you'd use as a base for creamed chipped beef or fried chicken.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/classic-buttermilk-waffles-recipe
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/waffle-recipe-reviews-23107623

docs.title: Conchas (Mexican Pan Dulce)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 2.13 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp warm water
  • 2.5 tsp active dry yeast
  • 1 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 0.5 cup melted butter
  • 0.33 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.75 cup evaporated or whole milk
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 2 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 2 large eggs
  • 4 cups all-purpose flour

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 0.67 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2 tsp unsweetened cocoa powder

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 clean kitchen towel
  • 1 food coloring gel
  • 1 knife

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To the bowl of a stand mixer with the hook attachment (you can also do this in a large bowl and knead it by hand!), add the warm water. Pour the active dry yeast on top and mix in into the water. Allow to stand until foamy, about 5 to 7 minutes. If it doesn’t get foamy then you’ll need to do it again.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: When the active dry yeast is foamy, pour in the vegetable oil, melted butter, granulated sugar, evaporated or whole milk, salt, vanilla, ground cinnamon and eggs. Break up the eggs with the back of a spatula and allow the dough hook to mix it up a bit, about 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Next, pour the all-purpose flour in all at once and run the machine for about 5 minutes on medium speed, until the dough is soft and smooth. If you’re doing this by hand, once the dough comes together, you’ll want to dump it out onto your floured counter and knead it for about 10 minutes, until it’s nice and smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Rub a large bowl with oil or spray it with cooking spray and place the dough in the center of the bowl. Cover it with a clean kitchen towel and allow it to rise for about 1 hour, until doubled in size.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In the bowl of stand-up mixer with the paddle attachment (you could also mix this by hand if you don’t have a mixer), add the unsalted butter, granulated sugar, all-purpose flour and vanilla extract. Mix until smooth, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Divide the dough in two. To one part of the topping, add a drop of food coloring gel. To the other topping, add the unsweetened cocoa powder and knead until it’s cohesive.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Once the dough has risen, divide the dough into 12 equal parts. Or better yet, weigh them into balls of 100 g. Form the balls of dough into rounds. Repeat until you’ve worked through all of the dough.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Take about 2 tablespoons of the topping and rollout using our palms, flatting it into a thin round. Drape it over the round of dough, patting down lightly. Using a knife, cut grooves in the topping like a clam shell. You can also do other types of cuts like criss cross, circles, etc. Cover and let rise until nearly doubled, about 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Bake for about 18 to 20 minutes, or until lightly golden brown. Allow to cool. Serve with hot chocolate or coffee.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Note: If you’d like you can use Instant Yeast. Instant Yeast is a bit different than dry active yeast because you mix it into the dry ingredients (vs. activating it in liquid). If you’d like to use Instant Yeast with this recipe, you would mix the first nine ingredients together and then combine the all-purpose and Instant Yeast together. Add the all-purpose flour mixture to the wet ingredients.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Note: Pan Dulce freezes easily. To freeze, bake them and allow them to cool completely. Place on a baking sheet and transfer to the freezer and chill for 1 hour. Transfer the pan dulce to a freezer-safe container and/or freezer-safe bag and freeze for up to 3 months. To thaw, place on a baking sheet on a kitchen counter.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.acozykitchen.com/conchas-pan-dulce

docs.title: Costa Rican Baked Doughnuts
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups masa harina
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 3 Tbsp brown sugar
  • 1 cup warm water
  • 0.33 cup creamed corn
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 baking tray

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, mix masa harina, salt, and brown sugar together. Add the warm water in small batches, mixing with your hands.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: After water is combined, add creamed corn and vanilla, mixing with your hands to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When dough forms, pinch off thumb-size pieces and roll between your hands.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Form small palm-size tubes and close them to form rings.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Place rings on greased baking tray and bake for about 35 minutes, or until golden brown.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Allow to cool before enjoying.

!!!note

These are a combination of corncake, muffin, and doughnut, so you can make them into a savory meal with salsa,
avocados, jalapeños, and hot sauce, or bring out their sweetness with a dollop of syrup and fresh fruit.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: Crispy Mushroom Galette
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 1.80 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 large leeks
  • 1 Tbsp grainy Dijon mustard
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 lb shiitake, cremini, oyster, and/or maitake mushrooms
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 2 sprigs rosemary
  • 1 flaky olive oil dough
  • some flour
  • some olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp panko bread crumbs
  • 2 tsp nutritional yeast

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium skillet
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Arrange an oven rack in the center position and preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium skillet (preferably cast-iron), heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add the leeks and cook, stirring often, until softened and translucent, 5 to 8 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and continue to cook, stirring occasionally and adding a splash of water to the skillet as needed if the leeks are starting to brown, until they're very tender and starting to break down, another 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the grainy Dijon mustard. Season with salt and pepper. Scrape the mixture into a medium bowl and set aside to cool.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Wipe out the skillet and set it back on the stove for the mushrooms.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil to the same skillet and heat over high heat until shimmering. Add half of the shiitake, cremini, oyster, and/or maitake mushrooms, 2 of the smashed garlic cloves, and 1 of the rosemary sprigs. Toss the mushrooms once just to coat in oil, then let them cook undisturbed until they're browned in spots, about 3 minutes. Continue to cook, tossing occasionally, until the mushrooms are browned all over, have released their liquid, and are tender, 5 to 8 minutes longer. Season the mixture with salt and pepper. Scrape into a separate medium bowl and set the bowl aside to cool. Repeat the process in the same skillet with 2 more tablespoons of oil, the remaining mushrooms, 2 smashed garlic cloves, rosemary sprig, and more salt and pepper. Reserve the skillet again for toasting the panko.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Unwrap the flaky olive oil dough, place it on a lightly floured surface, and lightly dust the top with more flour. Roll out the dough, dusting with more flour as needed to prevent sticking, into a round about 12 inches in diameter. If it starts to shrink back as you're trying to roll it, cover the dough and let it rest on the surface for 10 minutes, then proceed.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Transfer the dough to the prepared baking sheet. Spread the cooled leek mixture across the surface of the dough, leaving a 1-inch border all the way around. Scatter the cooked mushrooms and garlic (discard the rosemary) over the leeks.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Using the parchment paper to help you, fold the sides of the pastry up and over the mushrooms, leaving the center open and creating a series of evenly spaced pleats all the way around. Press firmly on the pleats to help the pastry adhere to itself, then brush the exterior of the pastry with more olive oil. Sprinkle more salt and pepper across the entire surface of the tart.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Bake the galette until the pastry is golden brown and the tops of the mushrooms are crispy, 45 to 55 minutes.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: While the galette is baking, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil in the skillet over medium heat. Add the panko bread crumbs, nutritional yeast, 1 grated garlic, and 1 Tbsp rosemary leaves and cook, stirring constantly, until the panko is golden brown and the mixture is very fragrant, about 4 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat, season the mixture with salt and pepper, and scrape it onto a paper towel-lined plate to cool.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Finish the galette and serve: Remove the galette from the oven and let it cool before topping with the garlicky panko and cutting into slices. Serve warm or at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Dessert Person

docs.title: Crunch French Toast
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6-8 2 hours

docs.title: Caramel Crunch
docs.text:
• 4 cups corn flakes
  • 0.75 cup sugar
  • 0.13 tsp cream of tartar
  • 2 Tbsp water
  • 3 Tbsp butter
  • 0.25 cup heavy cream
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon

docs.title: French Toast
docs.text:
• 8 large eggs
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 12 slices brioche
  • 1 Tbsp butter
  • some powdered sugar
  • some maple syrup
  • some sliced strawberries (optional)
  • some whipped cream (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 sheet pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 heavy medium saucepan
  • 1 wooden spoon or heat-resistant spatula
  • 1 sheet pan
  • 1 plastic bag
  • 1 shallow medium bowl
  • 1 large cast-iron griddle
  • 1 sheet pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To make the caramel crunch: Preheat the oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Evenly spread the corn flakes on a sheet pan lined with parchment paper. Place in the oven for 6 to 8 minutes or until the edges have lightly browned. Take out of the oven and allow the corn flakes to cool while the caramel is being cooked.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To make the caramel, place a heavy medium saucepan on the stove and add the sugar, cream of tartar, and water. Gently stir the sugar mixture until the sugar is wet. Turn the heat to medium high and slowly stir until the sugar dissolves using a wooden spoon or heat-resistant spatula. You're looking for the mixture to become an amber color.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Immediately take the mixture off the heat and stir in the butter. Once the butter melts, slowly stir in the heavy cream and salt.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Grease a sheet pan and set aside.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the corn flakes to a large mixing bowl. Gently stir in the caramel sauce and cinnamon. Toss until the corn flakes are coated, then spread into a single layer on the greased sheet pan. Allow to cool for about 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Set a small amount (about 2 cups) of the caramel crunch to the side for garnish. Take the remaining mixture and seal it in a plastic bag, leaving a small gap for air so the bag doesn’t break. Crush the mixture in the bag until it’s at a consistency you prefer.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Pour the crushed caramel crunch into a shallow medium bowl and set aside.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: To make the French toast: In another medium shallow bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, and vanilla extract until the mixture is smooth.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Dip each side of a slice of brioche into the egg mixture, allow any excess to drip off, then dip each side of that same slice into the crushed caramel crunch, making sure to fully coat each side. Set on a baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining 11 slices of brioche.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Place a large cast-iron griddle over medium heat and melt about 1 tablespoon butter. Once the butter is melted, place 2 brioche slices on the griddle and allow each side to cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Once cooked, place the French toast on a sheet pan with a cooling rack on top of it. This will keep the toast from getting soggy while you cook the rest of your slices. Repeat until all the brioche is cooked.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Diagonally cut each slice of French toast to make 2 halves out of 1 slice of bread.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Place 5 halves of French toast on a plate and sprinkle with the caramel crunch that was set aside and powdered sugar. Top with maple syrup, sliced strawberries (optional) (if using), and a dollop of whipped cream (optional) (if using). Serve immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://magnolia.com/blog/recipe/48c4b1e1-a599-483b-aba8-595cfd8e5f8f/crunch-french-toast/

docs.title: Decadent Chocolate Overnight Oats
docs.text: Total Time 6.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup almond milk
  • 2 Tbsp almond butter
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 2 tsp chia seeds
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 cup oats
  • 2 Tbsp cocoa powder
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mason jar
  • 1 spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To a mason jar or small bowl with a lid, add almond milk (or other milk of choice), almond butter, maple syrup (or other sweetener), chia seeds, and vanilla and stir with a spoon to combine and distribute the almond butter evenly.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add oats, cocoa powder, and salt (optional) and mix well to incorporate the cocoa powder. Then press down with a spoon to ensure all oats have been moistened and are immersed in almond milk.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cover securely with a lid or seal and set in the refrigerator overnight (or for at least 6 hours) to set/soak.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: The next day, open and enjoy as is or garnish with desired toppings (see suggestions above).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: OPTIONAL: You can also heat your oats in the microwave for 45-60 seconds (just ensure there’s enough room at the top of your jar to allow for expansion and prevent overflow and that you’ve used a microwave-safe jar or bowl), or transfer oats to a saucepan and heat over medium heat until warmed through. Add more liquid as needed if oats get too thick/dry.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Overnight oats will keep in the refrigerator for 2-3 days, though best within the first 12-24 hours in our experience. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/chocolate-overnight-oats/

docs.title: Dorie Greenspan's Lemon Poppy Muffins
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Muffins
docs.text:
• 0.67 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.75 cup sour cream
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 lemon juice
  • 1 stick melted and cooled butter
  • 2 Tbsp poppy seeds

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 1 cup confectioners' sugar
  • 3 Tbsp lemon juice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 regular-size muffin pan
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 large glass measuring cup or another bowl
  • 1 whisk or a rubber spatula
  • 1 cooling rack
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Center a rack in the oven and preheat the oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Butter or spray the 12 molds in a regular-size muffin pan or fit the molds with paper muffin cups. Alternatively, use a silicone muffin pan, which needs neither greasing nor paper cups. Place the muffin pan on a baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl, rub the granulated sugar and the lemon zest together with your fingertips until the sugar is moist and the fragrance of the lemon strong. Whisk in the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large glass measuring cup or another bowl, whisk the sour cream, eggs, vanilla, lemon juice and melted and cooled butter together until well blended. Pour the liquid ingredients over the dry ingredients and, with the whisk or a rubber spatula, gently but quickly stir to blend. Don’t worry about being thorough, a few lumps are better than over-mixing the batter. Stir in the poppy seeds. Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 18 to 20 minutes, or until the tops are golden and a thin knife inserted into the center of the muffins comes out clean. Transfer the pan to a cooling rack and cool for 5 minutes before carefully removing each muffin from its mold. Cool the muffins completely on the rack before icing them.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Put the confectioners' sugar in a small bowl and add about 1.5 tablespoons of the lemon juice. Stir with a spoon to moisten the sugar, then add enough additional lemon juice, a dribble at a time, to get an icing that is thin enough to drizzle from the tip of the spoon. You can then drizzle lines of icing over the tops of the muffins or coat the tops entirely, the better to get an extra zap of lemon.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• http://sparrowsandspatulas.blogspot.com/2011/11/dories-lemon-poppy-muffins.html?m=1
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/lemon-poppyseed-muffin-recipe-showdown-23321191

docs.title: Double-Berry Overnight Oats
docs.text: Total Time 8 hours 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 3
  • 1 cup (99 g) uncooked old fashioned oats
  • 1 cup (227 g) unsweetened vanilla almond milk
  • 1 cup (227 g) light artificially sweetened yogurt
  • 2.25 (376 g) cup mixed berries
  • 1 Tbsp lemon zest
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 3 Tbsp almonds
  • 3 Tbsp chia seeds
  • 1 tsp vanilla
Serves 1
  • 0.33 cup (33 g) uncooked old fashioned oats
  • 0.33 cup (76 g) unsweetened vanilla almond milk
  • 0.33 cup (76 g) light artificially sweetened yogurt
  • 0.75 cup (132 g) mixed berries
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 1 pinch cinnamon
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 Tbsp almonds
  • 1 Tbsp chia seeds
  • 0.25 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium jar or large glass

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine uncooked old fashioned oats, unsweetened vanilla almond milk, light artificially sweetened yogurt, mixed berries, lemon zest, cinnamon, vanilla, chia seeds, and salt in a medium jar or large glass; stir, cover and refrigerate overnight. Garish with almonds; serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.weightwatchers.com/us/recipe/double-berry-overnight-oats/585c27d0d4c2a8c517deece5

docs.title: Dreamy Cream Scones
docs.text: Total Time 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 280 g all-purpose flour
  • 1 Tbsp baking powder
  • 3 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 5 Tbsp cold unsalted butter
  • 80 g currants or dried cranberries
  • 1 cup heavy cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl or work bowl of food processor
  • 1 knives
  • 1 rubber spatula or fork
  • 1 8 inch cake pan
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place all-purpose flour, baking powder, granulated sugar and salt in large bowl or work bowl of food processor fitted with steel blade. Whisk together or pulse six times.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: If making by hand, use two knives, a pastry blender or your fingertips and quickly cut in cold unsalted butter until mixture resembles coarse meal, with a few slightly larger butter lumps. Stir in currants or dried cranberries. If using food processor, remove cover and distribute butter evenly over dry ingredients. Cover and pulse 12 times, each pulse lasting 1 second. Add currants and pulse one more time. Transfer dough to large bowl.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in heavy cream with a rubber spatula or fork until dough begins to form, about 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer dough and all dry, floury bits to countertop and knead dough by hand just until it comes together into a rough, sticky ball, 5 to 10 seconds. Form scones by either a) pressing the dough into an 8 inch cake pan, then turning the dough out onto a lightly floured work surface, cutting the dough into 8 wedges with either a knife or bench scraper (the book’s suggestion) or b) patting the dough onto a lightly floured work surface into a 3/4 inch thick circle, cutting pieces with a biscuit cutter, and pressing remaining scraps back into another piece (what I did) and cutting until dough has been used up. (Be warned if you use this latter method, the scones that are made from the remaining scraps will be much lumpier and less pretty, but taste fine. As in, I understand why they suggested the first method.)

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Place rounds or wedges on ungreased baking sheet and bake until scone tops are light brown, 12 to 15 minutes. Cool on wire rack for at least 10 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://smittenkitchen.com/2006/11/dream-a-little-dream-of-scone/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2020/04/30/best-scone-bake-off/

docs.title: Dutch Pancakes
docs.text: Total Time 1.02 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.25 cups (150 g) all-purpose flour
  • 4 eggs
  • 1 cup (227 g) milk
  • 1.25 cups (284 g) cold water
  • 3 Tbsp (42 g) butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • some cinnamon (optional)
  • some sugar (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender or mixer
  • 1 frying pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix together all-purpose flour, eggs, milk, cold water, melted butter, and vanilla with a blender or mixer.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: If you can let sit for about 1 hour in the refrigerator (that's best).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: If you can't wait, then pour about 3 tablespoons at time into a buttered or greased frying pan on medium heat until the surface is bubbly. Turn over for about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Then put on a plate, sprinkle cinnamon (optional) and sugar (optional) on it and roll up and enjoy.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: French Omelet
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Omelet
docs.text:
• 2 large eggs
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 1 pinch pepper
  • 1 Tbsp unsalted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Fillings
docs.text:
• some chives
  • some parsley
  • some ratatouille provençale
  • some creamed mushrooms
  • some guacamole and salsa fresca
  • some ricotta or goat cheese mixed with tomatoes and herbs
  • some chopped olives and sour cream
  • some duxelles
  • some caramelized onions
  • some sautéed zucchini or asparagus tips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 8 to 10 inch skillet

docs.title: Instructions - Omelet
docs.text:
Note

For French omelets both rolled and folded, the eggs should be beaten only enough to thoroughly blend the whites and yolks, not enough to incorporate air or make them frothy. Using a fork rather than a whisk to beat the eggs helps ensure that you do not overbeat them.

Note

When making more than one omelet, beat the total number of eggs you will need, then use a ladle or measuring cup to pour 3.5 ounces, or about 1/2 cup, for each 2 egg omelet. Keep the butter and filling ingredients by the stove and move quickly, as you make the omelets one by one. Serve them as they are ready, or keep them warm in a 200°F oven and serve when all are finished. If you have more than 4 to make, use another pan, or even two. Attention to more than one pan at a time is a skill that needs to be developed, so practice before your debut. Stagger the cooking so the omelets are not all at the same stage at once.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Beat with a fork until the whites and yolks are blended: 2 large eggs, 1/8 teaspoon salt, a pinch of black pepper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt in an 8 to 10 inch skillet, preferably nonstick, over medium-high heat: 1 tablespoon unsalted butter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Tilt the skillet to coat the sides and bottom thoroughly. You can also use nonstick cooking spray or a combination of butter and oil. When the butter is hot and has reached the point of fragrance, but is not brown, pour in the eggs. Meanwhile, agitate the pan forward and backward with the left hand. Keep the egg mass sliding as a whole over the pan bottom. With a dinner fork, quickly swirl the eggs with a circular motion, as shown. Hold the fork so the tines are parallel to, but not scraping, the base of the pan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: At this point the heat in the pan may be sufficient to cook the eggs, and you may want to lift the pan from the heat as you gently swirl the eggs, as illustrated, in circular scrolls from the edges to the center. Pay no attention to the ridges formed by the fork. The rhythm of the pan and the stirring is like a child's trick of patting the head while rubbing the stomach. Have ready a hot serving plate, which helps to inflate the omelet; choose a heat-resistant one if you plan to glaze. Whether you fill your omelet or leave it plain, grasp the handle of the pan so the left palm is up, as shown. Tip the pan down away from the handle and, with the fork, flip about one third of the omelet over, away from the handle, as shown in the center. If the omelet shows any tendency to stick, discard the fork and give the pan handle a sharp rap or two with the fist, as sketched. The omelet will flip over without the use of a fork and will start to slide. Slant the pan to 90° or more until the omelet makes a second fold in sliding out of the pan and lies with its ends folded under on the plate ready to serve.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Glaze and garnish, if you wish, and serve at once.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Herbs, such as chives and parsley or finely grated cheese may be added to the beaten eggs before cooking or more substantial fillings may be placed in the middle of the omelet just before it is rolled. Use 1/3 to 1/2 cup filling at room temperature for a 2 egg omelet. ratatouille provençale, creamed mushrooms, guacamole and salsa fresca, ricotta or goat cheese mixed with tomatoes and herbs, chopped olives and sour cream, duxelles, caramelized onions, and sautéed zucchini or asparagus tips.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: French Toast
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 2 Tbsp sugar
  • 4 Tbsp butter
  • 4 eggs
  • 0.25 cup milk
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 8 slices brioche
  • 0.5 cup syrup

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 12-inch skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a small bowl, combine cinnamon, nutmeg, and sugar and set aside briefly.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a 10-inch or 12-inch skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk together cinnamon mixture, eggs, milk, and vanilla and pour into a shallow container such as a pie plate. Dip bread in egg mixture. Fry brioche until golden brown, then flip to cook the other side. Serve with syrup.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/robert-irvine/french-toast-recipe-1951408

docs.title: Frittata
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Frittata
docs.text:
• 6 eggs
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.5 Tbsp olive oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Fillings
docs.text:
• 2 cups diced cooked vegetables (optional)
  • 2 cups cheese (optional)
  • 2 cups chicken (optional)
  • 2 cups seafood (optional)
  • 2 cups ham (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 10 to 12 inch cast-iron skillet or a nonstick pan with a heat-proof handle
  • 1 fork
  • 1 10 inch skillet
  • 1 hot platter

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Flat omelets and their Italian counterparts, frittatas, are made with vegetables, meats, or other savory ingredients mixed into the eggs. You may use any of the fillings for omelets, except the creamed or sauced ones, allowing about 1 cup of filling to 3 eggs. Frittatas are served hot or at room temperature cut in wedges like pizza.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To avoid sticking, use a well-seasoned 10 to 12 inch cast-iron skillet or a nonstick pan with a heat-proof handle, and make sure the bottom and sides of the pan are well greased before adding the eggs.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Have ready 1.5 to 2 cups additions, such as diced cooked vegetables (optional), cheese (optional), chicken (optional), seafood (optional), or ham (optional) in any combination.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Beat with a fork until blended 6 eggs.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in the filling and salt and black pepper. How much salt and pepper you add will depend on how highly seasoned your filling is. Heat a 10 inch skillet over medium heat, and add 1/2 tablespoons olive oil.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour in the egg mixture and proceed as in the basic French Omelet, until the bottom of the frittata is set and the top is still creamy. To finish cooking the top, place the frittata in a 350°F oven or under the hot broiler for a few seconds until the top is firm. A traditional frittata is not browned. Serve at once on a hot platter, or serve at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Gordon Ramsay Scrambled Eggs
docs.text: Total Time 3 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 eggs
  • 15 g butter
  • 1 tsp crème fraîche
  • some chives

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 rubber spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Crack 6 cold eggs into a deep saucepan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the butter. For smaller batches, use a 2-to-1 eggs-to-butter ratio.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Put the pan on high heat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir continuously with a rubber spatula

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: After 30 seconds, take the pan off the heat. Keep stirring. After about 10 seconds, put back on the heat. Repeat for 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In the last minute, season the eggs lightly. For extra creamy texture, stir in 1 tsp of crème fraîche.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Plate and garnish with chopped chives.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.gordonramsayrestaurants.com/recipes/scrambled-eggs/

docs.title: Hash Browns
docs.text: Total Time 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 medium potatoes
  • 1 large onion
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • some olive oil
  • 1 tsp cayenne
  • 70 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 grater
  • 1 strainer
  • 1 large pan
  • 1 large plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Peel 5 to 6 medium sized potatoes and 1 big onion. Grate them using a grater and place into the strainer. Season with salt and pepper, add olive oil and cayenne pepper. Then, squeeze all the liquid out. The more liquid you remove, the crispier your hash browns will be.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Take a nice large pan. Get it nice and hot. Add a glug of olive oil. Place your potato into the pan and pat it down. Make it nice and compact. Next, add flecks of unsalted butter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Turn over your hash browns by taking a large plate, placing it on top if the pan and flipping over. Then, slide it back into the pan.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Gordon Ramsay

docs.title: Jamie Oliver Blueberry Smoothie Pancakes
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups blueberries
  • 1 banana
  • 0.75 cup milk
  • 1 egg
  • 1.75 cups whole wheat flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • some yogurt (optional)
  • some cinnamon (optional)
  • some nuts (optional)
  • some honey (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender
  • 1 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Blitz half the blueberries, banana, milk, egg, and whole wheat flour with baking powder and salt in a blender. Fold in remaining blueberries.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place oil in heated pan, then pour batter to make pancakes. Top with yogurt (optional), cinnamon (optional), nuts (optional), and honey (optional).

docs.title: Joy of Cooking Pancakes
docs.text: Total Time 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups (180 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1.75 Tbsp baking powder
  • 3 Tbsp sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 3 Tbsp (42 g) melted butter
  • 1 cup (227 ml) milk

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat an electric skillet to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix all-purpose flour, salt, and baking powder together, mix sugar, eggs, melted butter, and milk together, add wet to dry and combine quickly. It is okay if lumps exist in the batter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Let the batter rest for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook the pancakes on the electric skillet covered for 4 minutes on the first side and 3 minutes on the other.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • http://recipecircus.com/recipes/cowgirl/QUICKBREADS/Pancakes_from_Joy_of_Cooking.html

docs.title: Levain Bakery Blueberry Muffins
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 9 1.67 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 cup almond meal or flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup whole milk
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 2 large eggs
  • 2.5 cups blueberries

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 small liquid measuring cup
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 offset spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, almond meal or flour, baking powder, and salt. In a small liquid measuring cup, whisk together the whole milk and the vanilla.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the granulated sugar and unsalted butter. Beat on medium-high until light, fluffy, and doubled in volume, 2 to 3 minutes, using a rubber spatula to scrape down the bottom and sides of the bowl as necessary. Reduce the mixer to low and add the eggs one at a time, adding the next egg only after the previous one is fully incorporated, scraping down the bottom and sides of the bowl after each addition.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: With the mixer still on low, add the dry ingredients in three equal parts, alternating with the wet ingredients in two parts. Beat until just combined, then scrape down the bottom and sides of the bowl once more, then beat on low for an additional 30 seconds. Take 1/2 cup of the blueberries and crush them with your hands so they are juicy; add to the batter and increase the mixer speed to high for 5 to 10 seconds to encourage the berries to release their juices even more. Immediately reduce the mixer to low and add the rest of the berries, mixing until incorporated evenly throughout the batter, another 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the batter rest at room temperature for 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: While the batter is resting, position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 400°F using the convection setting (if possible). Prepare two muffin tins by spraying the inside and border of every other cavity in the muffin tin generously with cooking spray.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Use a 1 tablespoon or 3 tablespoon cookie dough scoop to fill each sprayed cavity with 6 tablespoons of the batter. The first muffin tin will have six cavities filled, whereas the second muffin will have three cavities filled. For the second muffin tin, you'll need to pour water into every other cavity to mimic the placement of the batter in the first muffin tin. Sprinkle the top of each cavity, aiming for the batter and avoiding the pan, with 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar each.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake each muffin tin for 18 to 22 minutes, or until the muffins are domed and golden brown around the edges. A skewer inserted into the center of a muffin should come out with a few crumbs attached. Cool the muffins in their muffin tin on a wire rack for 15 minutes, then use an offset spatula to run underneath the edges of the blueberry muffin tops to prevent them from sticking in the pan. Be careful to just run the offset spatula under the edges—you don't want to accidentally cut into the muffin bottom and decapitate the muffin from its top!

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: After unsticking the muffin tops, keep cooling the muffins in the tins completely to room temperature. DO NOT TRY AND TURN THE MUFFINS OUT WHILE THEY ARE STILL WARM. Because these muffins are so top-heavy, you’ll run the risk of accidentally pulling the tops and bottoms apart if the cake is still warm! Wait until they are cooled completely before turning them out of the pan. Run the offset spatula underneath each muffin top once more and gently tilt the muffin upwards to turn it out of the pan. The muffins are best on the day that they’re made, but can be individually wrapped in plastic and stored at room temperature for up to 2 days.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.hummingbirdhigh.com/2019/08/levain-bakery-blueberry-muffins.html#wprm-recipe-container-7360
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2020/05/19/best-blueberry-muffin-bake-off/

docs.title: Loaded Potato Pancakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg potato pancakes
  • 4 slices pepper jack cheese
  • 0.5 pkg soy chorizo
  • 8 Tbsp sour cream
  • some cilantro

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To the cooked potato pancakes, arrange two quarters of pepper jack cheese on top and return them to cook for an additional minute, to help melt the cheese.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Evenly distribute the soy chorizo on top of each potato pancake, followed by a tablespoon of sour cream.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Garnish with cilantro leaves, to serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Mom's Breakfast Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 1.28 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 medium russet potatoes
  • 0.5 cup onion
  • 4 Tbsp butter
  • 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp dill
  • 1 tsp chives
  • 1 tsp garlic salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp parsley
  • 1 tsp Italian herbs

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Scrub and pierce russet potatoes and rub a small amount of oil on the skins. Bake the potatoes for 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook crushed onion in butter and olive oil, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Slice potatoes into 1 inch pieces.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add butter and olive oil to pan and add potatoes and dill, chives, garlic salt, pepper, salt, parsley, and Italian herbs.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cook for 10 to 15 minutes. Season to taste.

docs.title: Morning Muffin In a Mug
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup TJ’s Gluten Free Organic Rolled Oats with Ancient Grains & Seeds
  • 0.25 cup applesauce
  • 2 Tbsp honey
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 egg
  • 1 handful berries

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 coffee mug

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix TJ’s Gluten Free Organic Rolled Oats with Ancient Grains & Seeds, applesauce, honey, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, egg, and berries in a coffee mug. Stir well until thoroughly combined.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a microwave oven, heat on high for 4 minutes*, or until mixture is no longer wet on the surface. The muffin will expand as it cooks and may partially rise out of the mug.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Carefully remove the mug from the microwave, as it will be very hot, and let cool for about 5 minutes. Top with some fresh berries (optional), drizzle with more honey if desired, and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/morning-muffin-in-a-mug

docs.title: Orejas (Mexican Pan Dulce)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16-18 pieces 11 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 puff pastry
  • 0.5 cup granulated or demerara sugar
  • 0.75 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 3 Tbsp melted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 parchment paper
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 sharp knife
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 cooling rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Defrost the puff pastry in the refrigerator overnight or on the counter for about 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: When your pastry is defrosted, preheat the oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix together the granulated or demerara sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Line your countertop with parchment paper and spread about 1/4 cup of the cinnamon sugar mixture on it, roughly in the shape of the puff pastry.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Brush one side of the pastry with the melted butter and then turn it over and lay it on top of the sugar mixture on your countertop.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Brush the side now facing up with melted butter and spread the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar mixture liberally over the top of the puff pastry.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Use a rolling pin to gently roll on the puff pastry to gently incorporate the sugar and butter into the pastry. Gently, you don't really want to flatten it.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Fold the puff pastry inward from the edges on the long side and have the outside edges meet in the middle. Then fold again, again with the outside edges meeting in the middle. Using a sharp knife, cut about three quarter of an inch slices and transfer them, cut side down, to parchment paper-lined baking sheets (These expand a lot, use two). Fold each one in the shape of the letter U.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake at 425°F for 5 to 7 minutes on one side, remove the baking sheet from the oven and flip them over and bake for another 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool on a cooling rack. Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to 5 days (Trust me there won't be any to save that long!).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://creative-culinary.com/orejas-mexican-pan-dulce-recipe/

docs.title: Overnight Brown-Butter Yeast-Raised Waffles
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 18.12 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 Tbsp butter
  • 4 tsp granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 10 oz cold milk
  • 1 large egg
  • 7.5 oz all-purpose flour
  • 1.25 tsp instant yeast
  • 0.25 tsp baking soda

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 3 quart stainless steel saucier or saucepan
  • 1 heat-resistant spatula
  • 1 waffle iron

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Melt butter in a 3 quart stainless steel saucier or saucepan, stirring and scraping with a heat-resistant spatula as it bubbles, and cook until golden brown. Remove from heat and immediately stir in granulated sugar, salt, and cold milk, followed by egg. Sift in all-purpose flour and stir until smooth. Add instant yeast and baking soda last, stirring to combine. Cover and refrigerate overnight, between 12 and 18 hours. The batter should be gooey and spongy at this point.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Set waffle iron to medium and preheat until the indicator is ready; if using cast iron, brush lightly with safflower, vegetable, or canola oil. For an 8-inch square machine, scrape in half of the batter per batch. For a 7 inch Belgian machine, scrape in about one-third. Close lid and griddle until golden brown but still steaming, 5 to 7 minutes depending on the depth and heat of your machine. (Cooked waffles can be held on a rack in a 200°F (90°C) oven while remaining batches are cooked.) Serve immediately with maple syrup, lemon chantilly, and/or strawberries.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.seriouseats.com/brown-butter-yeast-raised-waffles-recipe
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2019/01/29/best-yeast-waffle-bake-off/

docs.title: Overnight Oats
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup old fashioned rolled oats
  • 1 Tbsp chia seeds
  • 0.5 cup almond or coconut milk

docs.title: Ingredients - Optional Add-Ins
docs.text:
• some chopped nuts (almonds, walnuts, pistachios, pecans, etc.)
  • some nut butters (peanut butter, almond butter, etc.)
  • some dried fruits
  • some fresh fruit
  • - some cinnamon
  • some vanilla
  • some cocoa powder
  • some unsweetened dried coconut flakes
  • some unsweetened applesauce
  • some canned pumpkin

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text:
Combine old fashioned rolled oats, chia seeds, and almond or coconut milk together and refrigerate overnight or for at least 3 hours before enjoying.

Optional add-ins

Optional add-ins include chopped nuts (almonds, walnuts, pistachios, pecans, etc.), nut butters (peanut butter, almond butter, etc.), dried fruits, fresh fruit, cinnamon, vanilla, cocoa powder, unsweetened dried coconut flakes, unsweetened applesauce, and canned pumpkin.

Note

The possibilities for flavor combinations are endless! For extra convenience, make enough servings for the whole week & store in the refrigerator until ready to enjoy.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Marissa Kent Nutrition

docs.title: Pan Boxty
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4-6 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup mashed potatoes
  • 1 lb Russet potatoes
  • 0.67 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp caraway seeds (optional)
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 0.67 cup milk
  • 6 Tbsp unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 wire rack
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 box grater
  • 1 clean dish towel
  • 1 12 inch nonstick skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 200°F. Set wire rack in rimmed baking sheet. Place mashed potatoes in medium bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Peel Russet potatoes and grate on large holes of box grater. Place half of shredded potatoes in center of clean dish towel. Gather ends together and twist tightly over sink to drain as much liquid as possible. Add shreds to bowl with mashed potatoes. Repeat with remaining shredded potatoes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour, caraway seeds (optional), if using, salt and pepper to potatoes and mix, breaking up any large mashed potato lumps, until evenly combined. While stirring, add enough milk so mixture is moistened but thick and stiff enough to scoop (you may not need all of milk).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Melt 2 tablespoons unsalted butter in 12 inch nonstick skillet over low heat. Spoon batter into 1/4 cup dry measuring cup and deposit onto skillet. Deposit 3 more portions onto skillet. Using back of measuring cup, press each portion into 3.5 inch round. Increase heat to medium. Cover and cook until tops of pan cakes are set and bottoms are deeply browned (color will not be uniform), 3 to 5 minutes, adjusting heat as necessary to prevent butter from burning.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Carefully uncover (condensation may cause splattering); flip pancakes; and continue to cook, uncovered, until browned on second side, 3 to 4 minutes longer. Transfer pancakes to prepared sheet and place in oven. Wipe out skillet with paper towels and repeat with remaining butter and potato mixture in 2 batches.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Season with salt to taste, and serve immediately. (Pancakes can be refrigerated in airtight container for up to 2 days and reheated in dry skillet on stovetop or on rimmed baking sheet in 350°F oven.)

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Peanut Butter Overnight Oats
docs.text: Total Time 6.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 4
  • 2 cups (454 g) almond milk
  • 3 Tbsp chia seeds
  • 0.5 cups (68 g) peanut butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 4 Tbsp (78 g) maple syrup
  • 2 cups (198 g) rolled oats
Serves 1
  • 0.5 cup (113 g) almond milk
  • 0.75 Tbsp chia seeds
  • 2 Tbsp (17 g) peanut butter
  • 0.25 tsp vanilla
  • 1 Tbsp (20 g) maple syrup
  • 0.5 cup (50g) rolled oats

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 mason jar

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To a mason jar or small bowl with a lid, add almond milk, chia seeds, peanut butter, vanilla, and maple syrup (or other sweetener) and stir with a spoon to combine. The peanut butter doesn't need to be completely mixed with the almond milk (doing so leaves swirls of peanut butter to enjoy the next day).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add rolled oats and stir a few more times. Then press down with a spoon to ensure all oats have been moistened and are immersed in almond milk.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cover securely with a lid or seal and set in the refrigerator overnight (or for at least 6 hours) to set/soak.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: The next day, open and enjoy as is or garnish with desired toppings (see options above). See more flavor/topping suggestions in the blog post above!

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: OPTIONAL: You can also heat your oats in the microwave for 45-60 seconds (just ensure there's enough room at the top of your jar to allow for expansion and prevent overflow), or transfer oats to a saucepan and heat over medium heat until warmed through. Add more liquid as needed if oats get too thick/dry.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Overnight oats will keep in the refrigerator for 2-3 days, though best within the first 12-24 hours in our experience. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/peanut-butter-overnight-oats/

docs.title: Potato Latkes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 36 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 large Russet potatoes
  • 1 large onion
  • 2 eggs
  • 0.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • some neutral oil
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 dishtowel
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 heavy-bottomed pan
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Using a food processor with a coarse grating disc, grate the Russet potatoes and onion. Transfer the mixture to a clean dishtowel and squeeze and wring out as much of the liquid as possible.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Working quickly, transfer the mixture to a large bowl. Add the eggs, all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder and pepper, and mix until the flour is absorbed.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium heavy-bottomed pan over medium-high heat, pour in about 1/4 inch of the neutral oil. Once the oil is hot (a drop of batter placed in the pan should sizzle), use a heaping tablespoon to drop the batter into the hot pan, cooking in batches.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Use a spatula to flatten and shape the drops into discs.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: When the edges of the latkes are brown and crispy, about 5 minutes, flip.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cook until the second side is deeply browned, about another 5 minutes. Transfer the latkes to a paper towel-lined plate to drain and sprinkle with salt while still warm. Repeat with the remaining batter.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1015533-classic-potato-latkes

docs.title: Powdered Sugar Doughnuts
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 dozen 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup unsalted butter
  • 0.25 cup vegetable oil
  • 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.33 cup light brown sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp baking soda
  • 0.75 tsp nutmeg
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 2.66 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 doughnut pans
  • 1 12-cup mini muffin tin
  • 1 medium-sized mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Lightly grease doughnut pans and 12-cup mini muffin tin.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium-sized mixing bowl, cream together the melted unsalted butter, vegetable oil, and granulated sugar, and light brown sugar till smooth. Add the eggs, beating to combine. Add the vanilla and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl. stir the baking powder, baking soda, nutmeg, cinnamon, salt, and all-purpose flour until well combined. Add 1/3 of the mixture at a time to the butter mixture alternately with the milk, beginning and ending with the flour and making sure everything is thoroughly combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spoon the batter into a pastry bag without a tip. Squeeze into the doughnut molds, filling the cups nearly full. Bake the doughnuts for 5 minutes and then drop temperature to 375°F. Continue to bake for 10 more minutes, or until they’re a pale golden brown and a cake tester inserted into the middle of one of the center muffins comes out clean. (Only bake 7 more minutes if they are in a mini muffin tin)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a medium bowl, add the powdered sugar. Melt the butter in a separate small bowl. When muffins have cooled slightly, roll the doughnuts/doughnut holes in the butter and then the powdered sugar. Cover in powdered sugar until completely coated. This may take a couple coats of powdered sugar.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve immediately or within 24 hours.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.certifiedpastryaficionado.com/powdered-sugar-doughnuts/

docs.title: Pumpkin Muffins
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 42 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup dark brown sugar
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp ground cloves
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 15-oz can pumpkin purée
  • 0.5 cup coconut oil
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 paper liners
  • 1 standard size muffin baking pan
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F and place 12 paper liners into each well of your standard size muffin baking pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Measure out the all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, dark brown sugar, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ground cloves, and nutmeg in a medium bowl and whisk together. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In another bowl, whisk together the eggs, pumpkin purée, coconut oil, melted, and vanilla extract.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir together. Do not over mix, just stir until everything is incorporated into the batter.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: It is helpful to use a large scoop (like an ice cream scoop) to evenly distribute the batter into each well. They will be nearly full. This will help give your muffins a nice puffy dome.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake your muffins for 20 to 22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Note: Recipe adapted from Sally’s Baking Addiction If your coconut oil is solid, warm it up a bit so that it is in liquid form.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://lovelylittlekitchen.com/best-ever-pumpkin-muffins/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/pumpkin-muffin-recipe-showdown-23430959

docs.title: Queen Elizabeth II's Drop Scones
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 Tbsp sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1.5 cups whole milk
  • 3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking soda
  • 3 tsp cream of tartar
  • 2 Tbsp butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 balloon whisk
  • 1 griddle or large cast-iron pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large bowl, combine the sugar, eggs, and 3/4 cup of whole milk.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Using a balloon whisk, beat the ingredients until they are well combined.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the all-purpose flour, baking soda, and cream of tartar to the bowl. Mix them into the wet ingredients until a thick paste forms.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the rest of the milk a bit at a time while whisking, until the mixture is smooth and slowly drips off a spoon.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Discard any remaining milk and fold in the melted butter.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Heat a griddle or large cast-iron pan on medium-low heat.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Once the cooking surface is preheated, drop a few heaping tablespoons of batter into the pan. The drop scones will spread as they cook, so leave 1 to 2 inches between each scone and cook in batches if need be.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: After about 2 minutes, the tops of the drop scones will begin to form bubbles. Gently lift the scones to check that the bottoms are golden brown, then flip them over to cook the other side for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Once cooked, place the drop scones onto a plate and cover them with a tea towel to keep them warm while you cook the rest.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Serve the drop scones with classic sides such as butter, jam, golden or maple syrup, and fresh berries.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/1003403/queen-elizabeth-iis-drop-scones-recipe/

docs.title: Shakshuka
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 14 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 1 medium onion
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 2 tsp paprika
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.25 tsp chili powder
  • 1 28-oz can whole peeled tomatoes
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 6 large eggs
  • 1 small bunch cilantro
  • 1 small bunch parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large sauté pan
  • 1 large spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat olive oil in a large sauté pan on medium heat. Add the chopped red bell pepper and onion and cook for 5 minutes or until the onion becomes translucent.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add garlic, paprika, cumin, chili powder and cook an additional 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour the can of whole peeled tomatoes and juice into the pan and break down the tomatoes using a large spoon. Season with salt and pepper and bring the sauce to a simmer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Use your large spoon to make small wells in the sauce and crack the eggs into each well. Cook the eggs for 5 to 8 minutes, or until the eggs are done to your liking. You can also cover the pan with a lid to expedite the eggs cooking.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Garnish with chopped cilantro and parsley before serving.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Note: If using whole tomatoes and tomato sauce, peel the tomatoes by blanching them first and dunking them in ice water. Cook the tomatoes in the sauce until tender. Reduce the sauce mixture before adding the eggs to the desired consistency.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://downshiftology.com/recipes/shakshuka/

docs.title: Slow Cooker Mexican Egg Casserole
docs.text: Total Time 4.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 dozen eggs
  • 1 cup milk
  • 1 dozen flour tortillas
  • 3 bottles salsa (2 thin, 1 chunky)
  • 1 cube butter
  • 2 pkgs blended shredded cheese
  • 1 container sour cream
  • 1 container guacamole

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 slow cooker
  • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Beat eggs in large bowl and add milk.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Tear flour tortillas into strips.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spray sides and wall of slow cooker with Pam.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Put small amounts of salsa (2 thin, 1 chunky) in bottom of slow cooker, so casserole doesn't stick.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Heat large skillet with plenty of butter.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add beaten eggs and milk mixture, only lightly scramble eggs. Turn off heat.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Simply layer tortillas, eggs, salsa, and blended shredded cheese into slow cooker.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: You can also make this the night before - However, I find casserole turns out great if left on low for 2 to 4 hours.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Stir before serving.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Side with sour cream and guacamole.

docs.title: Sourdough Pancakes
docs.text: Total Time Serves 15 minutes 10

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup coarse cornmeal
  • 3 Tbsp (42 g) unsalted butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 1.5 cups (180 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 cup whole wheat flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 1.25 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1.33 cups whole milk
  • 1 cup sourdough starter
  • 3 Tbsp granulated sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Hydrate the coarse cornmeal in some milk.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt the unsalted butter and let it come to room temperature.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Separate the eggs and let the come to room temperature.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Mix the dry ingredients in a medium bowl by whisking the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Mix the wet ingredients which includes the egg yolks, whole milk, cornmeal, melted butter, and sourdough starter in a bowl and set aside.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add a pinch of salt to the egg whites and whip until white and foamy. Slowly add the granulated sugar while whisking. Continue to beat until medium to firm peaks form.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Mix the wet ingredients into the middle of the bowl with the dry ingredients. Be sure not to overmix.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Fold the whipped egg whites into the batter in two batches.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Griddle the pancakes in a frying pan on the range.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zlOIV4Ju6FU

docs.title: Southwestern Butternut Squash and Black Bean Breakfast Bowl
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 43 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Squash
docs.text:
• 3 cups butternut squash
  • 1 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.13 tsp garlic powder

docs.title: Ingredients - Beans
docs.text:
• 1 15-oz can black beans
  • 0.25 cup enchilada sauce

docs.title: Ingredients - Veggies
docs.text:
• 0.5 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 0.25 tsp red pepper flakes (optional)
  • 5 cups baby spinach

docs.title: Ingredients - Eggs
docs.text:
• 0.5 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 4 eggs
  • 0.13 tsp salt

docs.title: Ingredients - For Serving
docs.text: • 0.25 cup enchilada sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 medium rimmed skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (218°C) and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or a non-stick sheet (use more baking sheets if making a larger batch).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the cubed butternut squash to the baking sheet. Drizzle with vegetable oil and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Use clean hands to toss and evenly coat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake for about 25 to 30 minutes or until browned and fork tender. Toss at the 15 minute mark for more even cooking.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Meanwhile, to a small saucepan, add the drained and rinsed black beans and heat over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring often, until warmed through. Add enchilada sauce, mix well to combine, and turn the heat to the lowest setting to keep warm. Alternatively, microwave beans for 1 to 2 minutes and add sauce.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a medium rimmed skillet add 1/2 Tbsp vegetable oil and the red pepper flakes (optional). Heat over medium heat until sizzling gently. Add the baby spinach and toss to evenly distribute the oil and red pepper flakes. Cook, tossing occasionally, until the spinach is wilted and reduced — about 3 minutes. Turn off the heat and add the salt and garlic powder. Set aside if making eggs, otherwise, cover to keep warm.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In the now-empty skillet, add 1/2 Tbsp vegetable oil and heat over medium heat. Once hot, add the eggs. Crack each egg into the pan, cook for 3 minutes uncovered, sprinkle with salt, then cover with a lid for another 1 to 2 minutes to help the whites cook while keeping the yolks soft. Alternatively, scramble or cook to desired doneness. Remove from heat and cover to keep warm.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Once the squash is roasted, assemble! Divide the squash, beans, spinach, and eggs (optional) between bowls and top each with remaining enchilada sauce, sliced avocado, and cilantro (optional). Enjoy!

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Leftovers (excluding eggs) keep well (without sauce) for 3 to 4 days in the refrigerator. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/southwestern-butternut-squash-black-bean-breakfast-bowl/

docs.title: Sweet Potato Pancakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup water
  • 0.5 cup sweet potato puree
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice
  • 1 cup pancake mix
  • some butter
  • some syrup

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 griddle or nonstick skillet
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the water, sweet potato puree, and cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice. Add the pancake mix and stir just to combine—the batter should be lumpy.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place a griddle or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat to let it get nice and hot. Then reduce the heat to medium. Melt a little butter in the skillet then swirl to coat the bottom of the skillet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: For each pancake, spoon in 1/4 cup of batter. Cook until bubbles form on top of the pancakes and the batter is set, 2 to 3 minutes. Then use a spatula to flip the pancakes and cook them until golden brown on the other side, 2 to 3 minutes. Serve with warm syrup.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://jessicaseinfeld.com/recipes/sweet-potato-pancakes

docs.title: The Food Lab Light & Fluffy Scrambled Eggs
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 18 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 large eggs
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp milk
  • 2 Tbsp butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 10-inch nonstick skillet
  • 1 silicone spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine the large eggs, salt, and milk in a medium bowl and whisk until homogeneous and frothy, about 1 minute. Allow to rest at room temperature for at least 15 minutes. The eggs should darken in color significantly.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt the butter in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, swirling the pan as it melts to coat evenly. Rewhisk the eggs until they are foamy, then transfer to the skillet and cook, slowly scraping the bottom and sides of the pan with a silicone spatula as the eggs solidify. Then continue to cook, scraping and folding constantly, until the eggs have formed solid, moist curds and no liquid egg remains, about 2 minutes . Immediately transfer to a plate and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Food Lab

docs.title: Toasted-Coconut Granola
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 7 cups 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cups old-fashioned rolled oats
  • 1 cup raw pumpkin seeds
  • 1 cup raw sunflower seeds
