  • 1 cup coconut flakes
  • 1.25 cup raw pecans
  • 0.75 cup maple syrup
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • 0.5 cup light brown sugar
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 300°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place old-fashioned rolled oats, raw pumpkin seeds, raw sunflower seeds, coconut flakes, raw pecans, maple syrup, olive oil, light brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon salt in a large bowl and mix until well combined.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spread granola mixture in an even layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Transfer to oven and bake, stirring every 10 minutes, until granola is toasted, about 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove granola from oven and season with salt. Let cool completely before serving or storing in an airtight container for up to 1 month.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.marthastewart.com/256537/farmhands-choice-granola

docs.title: Vegan Bacon
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4-6 27 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 oz extra-firm tofu
  • 2 tsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp low-sodium soy sauce or tamari
  • 2 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 1 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 2 tsp smoked paprika
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 6 sheets rice paper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 paper towels
  • 1 plate
  • 1 baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Pat 4 ounces extra-firm tofu (about a 2-inch-wide piece) dry with paper towels. Line a plate with more paper towels and place the tofu on top. Set a small plate on top of the tofu and weight it down with something heavy, like a 28-ounce can of tomatoes. Press for 15 minutes, changing the paper towels when they become saturated with water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, arrange 2 racks to divide the oven into thirds and heat the oven to 375°F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Drizzle each piece of parchment with 1 teaspoon of the olive oil and spread with a paper towel, your fingers, or pastry brush to evenly coat the parchment.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Crumble the tofu very finely (about 1/2 cup). Place the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce or tamari, 2 tablespoons maple syrup, 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast, 2 teaspoons smoked paprika, and 1 teaspoon garlic powder in a medium bowl and whisk until combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place 2 sheets of the rice paper side-by-side on a work surface. Brush with the marinade. Flip and brush the other side with the marinade. Sprinkle about a third of the crumbled tofu over one sheet of rice paper, making sure to spread tofu out so it’s not all in one spot. Sandwich with the other sheet of rice paper. Cut into 6 (about 1 1/4-inch wide) strips. Transfer to the baking sheets, spacing them about 1/4-inch apart.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Repeat assembling and cutting two more rice paper sandwiches. Brush any remaining marinade onto the slices.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake until the edges start to darken and crisp, 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool completely on the baking sheets, the vegan bacon will continue crisp as it cools.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/vegan-bacon-recipe-23421086

docs.title: Vegan Banana Pancakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup (1) banana
  • 1 cup (227 g) soy milk
  • 2 Tbsp canola oil
  • 2 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 cups (180 g) whole wheat flour
  • 1 Tbsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 wooden spoon
  • 1 large griddle or pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium bowl, mash the banana. Use a measuring cup to make sure you have about 1/2 cup mashed banana.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Now add the soy milk, canola oil, granulated sugar and vanilla. Whisk until well combined.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the whole wheat flour to the wet ingredients, then sprinkle the baking powder, salt, and cinnamon (optional) (if using) on top of the flour. Mix until just combined with a wooden spoon. The batter will be lumpy.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat a large griddle or pan over medium-high heat. Drop about 1/3 cup of the batter onto the griddle. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden brown on the other side, about 1 to 2 minutes. Repeat with all the remaining batter.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Serve with vegan butter, pure maple syrup and more sliced bananas. These pancakes freeze well, and the recipe can be easily double, tripled or quadrupled.

Note

May sub any non-dairy milk for the soy milk.

Note

May omit oil if needed, or sub more milk or mashed banana.

Note

For gluten free, try a gluten free mix such as Bob's Red Mill 1:1.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.noracooks.com/vegan-banana-pancakes/

docs.title: Veggie Chickpea Hash
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 can Greek Chickpeas with Parsley & Cumin
  • 1 red onion
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 1 tsp Smoked Paprika
  • some 21 Seasoning Salute
  • 4 eggs

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cast iron pan
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To a cast iron pan over medium heat, add Greek Chickpeas with Parsley & Cumin and all the oil in the can. When oil is hot, add the red onion and red bell pepper, and sauté until the onions begin to brown and the peppers soften, about 5 to 10 minutes, depending on the strength of your heat source. Season with Smoked Paprika and 21 Seasoning Salute.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Use a spatula to create four individual pockets throughout the hash. Crack the eggs into each pocket. For eggs with a runny yolk, cook until egg whites have set, about 3 to 5 minutes. For a firmer yolk, cook a few more minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Whole Wheat Pancakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
  • 2 cups skim milk
  • 0.33 cup egg substitute
  • 0.25 cup applesauce
  • 2 Tbsp sugar
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine whole wheat flour, skim milk, egg substitute, applesauce, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt and mix well.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour batter on heated skillet 1/4 cup at a time.

docs.title: Yeasted Doughnuts with Chocolate Frosting
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.75 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Doughnuts
docs.text:
• 4.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 1 tsp instant yeast
  • 0.2 cups milk
  • 1 large egg
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 8 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 qts vegetable oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 4 oz bittersweet chocolate
  • 0.5 cup water
  • 2 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 2 Tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 plastic
  • 1 3-inch round cutter
  • 1 1-inch round cutter
  • 1 sheet
  • 1 kettle or small saucepan
  • 1 large Dutch oven
  • 1 spider skimmer
  • 1 medium bowl

Note

You'll need two large baking sheets and two wire racks for this recipe. You'll also need 3-inch and 1-inch round cutters. For the best results, weigh the flour for the doughnuts and the confectioners' sugar for the frosting. Heating the oil slowly will make it easier to control the temperature when frying. Use a Dutch oven that holds 6 quarts or more. If the frosting stiffens before you use it, microwave it at 50 percent power, stirring every 30 seconds, until it is smooth and fluid. The frosting can be made up to 48 hours in advance.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Stir all-purpose flour, sugar, and instant yeast together in bowl of stand mixer. Add milk and egg and mix with rubber spatula until all ingredients are moistened. Fit stand mixer with dough hook and mix on medium-low speed until cohesive mass forms, about 2 minutes, scraping down bowl if necessary. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let stand for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add salt and mix on medium-low speed until dough is smooth and elastic and clears sides of bowl, 5 to 7 minutes. With mixer running, add unsalted butter, a few pieces at a time, and continue to mix until butter is fully incorporated and dough is smooth and elastic and clears sides of bowl, 7 to 13 minutes longer, scraping down bowl halfway through mixing. Transfer dough to lightly greased large bowl, flip dough, and form into ball. Cover bowl with plastic. Let sit at room temperature for 1 hour. Transfer to refrigerator and chill overnight (or up to 48 hours).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Adjust oven racks to lowest and middle positions. Place loaf pan on lower rack. Line rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and grease parchment. Transfer dough to lightly floured counter. Press into 8-inch square of even thickness, expelling as much air as possible. Roll dough into 10 by 13-inch rectangle, about 1/2 inch thick. Using 3-inch round cutter dipped in flour, cut 12 rounds. Using 1-inch round cutter dipped in flour, cut hole out of center of each round. Transfer doughnuts and holes to prepared sheet. (If desired, use 1-inch cutter to cut small rounds from remaining dough. Transfer to sheet with doughnuts.) Bring kettle or small saucepan of water to boil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour 1 cup boiling water into loaf pan. Place sheet on upper rack, uncovered. Close oven and allow doughnuts to rise until dough increases in height by 50 percent and springs back very slowly when pressed with your knuckle, 45 minutes to 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: About 20 minutes before end of rising time, add vegetable oil to large Dutch oven until it measures about 1.5 inches deep and heat over medium-low heat to 360°F. Set wire rack in second rimmed baking sheet and line with triple layer of paper towels. Using both your hands, gently place 4 risen doughnuts in oil. Cook until golden brown on undersides, 1 to 1.5 minutes, adjusting burner as necessary to maintain oil temperature between 350°F and 365°F. Using spider skimmer, flip doughnuts and cook until second sides are browned, 1 to 1.5 minutes. Transfer doughnuts to prepared rack. Return oil to 360°F and repeat with remaining doughnuts. For doughnut holes, transfer all to oil and stir gently and constantly until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Transfer to prepared rack to cool. Let doughnuts cool completely, about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: While doughnuts cool, microwave finely chopped bittersweet chocolate and water in medium bowl at 50 percent power until chocolate is melted, about 30 seconds. Whisk in confectioners' sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, and salt until smooth and fluid. Let cool slightly.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Set clean wire rack in now-empty sheet. Dip top half of 1 cooled doughnut into frosting until evenly coated, allowing excess to drip back into bowl. Invert doughnut and place on wire rack. Repeat with remaining doughnuts. Let doughnuts stand until frosting is dry to touch, 15 to 30 minutes, before serving.

docs.text:
• 4.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 1 tsp instant yeast
  • 1.5 cup milk
  • 1 large egg
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 8 Tbsp butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 3.25 confectioners' sugar
  • 0.5 cup hot water
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Ingredients - Frying
docs.text: • 2 qt vegetable oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Raspberry Frosting
docs.text:
• 8 oz frozen raspberries
  • 2 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • some rainbow sprinkles (optional)

docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheets
  • 1 wire racks
  • 1 3 inch round cutter
  • 1 1 inch round cutter

  • 1 stand mixer

  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 spider skimmer
  • 1 blender
  • 1 fine-mesh strainer

Note

You'll need two large baking sheets and two wire racks for this recipe. You'll also need 3 inch round cutter and 1 inch round cutter. For the best results, weigh the flour for the doughnuts and the confectioners' sugar for the glaze. Heating the oil slowly will make it easier to control the temperature when frying. Use a Dutch oven that holds 6 quarts or more.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Stir all-purpose flour, sugar, and instant yeast together in bowl of stand mixer. Add milk and egg and mix with rubber spatula until all ingredients are moistened. Fit stand mixer with dough hook and mix on medium-low speed until cohesive mass forms, about 2 minutes, scraping down bowl if necessary. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let stand for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add salt and mix on medium-low speed until dough is smooth and elastic and clears sides of bowl, 5 to 7 minutes. With mixer running, add 1/2 inch pieces of softened butter, a few pieces at a time, and continue to mix until butter is fully incorporated and dough is smooth and elastic and clears sides of bowl, 7 to 13 minutes longer, scraping down bowl halfway through mixing. Transfer dough to lightly greased large bowl, flip dough, and form into ball. Cover bowl with plastic. Let sit at room temperature for 1 hour. Transfer to refrigerator and chill overnight (or up to 48 hours).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Adjust oven racks to lowest and middle positions. Place loaf pan on lower rack. Line rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and grease parchment. Transfer dough to lightly floured counter. Press into 8-inch square of even thickness, expelling as much air as possible. Roll dough into 10 by 13-inch rectangle, about 1/2 inch thick. Using 3-inch round cutter dipped in flour, cut 12 rounds. Using 1-inch cutter dipped in flour, cut hole out of center of each round. Transfer doughnuts and holes to prepared sheet. (If desired, use 1-inch cutter to cut small rounds from remaining dough. Transfer to sheet with doughnuts.) Bring kettle or small saucepan of water to boil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour 1 cup boiling water into loaf pan. Place sheet on upper rack, uncovered. Close oven and allow doughnuts to rise until dough increases in height by 50 percent and springs back very slowly when pressed with your knuckle, 45 minutes to 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Whisk confectioners' sugar, hot water, and salt in medium bowl until smooth.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: About 20 minutes before end of rising time, add vegetable oil to large Dutch oven until it measures about 1½ inches deep and heat over medium-low heat to 360°F. Set wire rack in second rimmed baking sheet and line with triple layer of paper towels. Using both your hands, gently place 4 risen doughnuts in oil. Cook until golden brown on undersides, 1 to 1.5 minutes, adjusting burner as necessary to maintain oil temperature between 350°F and 365°F. Using spider skimmer, flip doughnuts and cook until second sides are browned, 1 to 1.5 minutes. Transfer doughnuts to prepared rack. Return oil to 360°F and repeat with remaining doughnuts. For doughnut holes, transfer all to oil and stir gently and constantly until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Transfer to prepared rack to cool. Let doughnuts sit until cool enough to handle, at least 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Set clean wire rack in now-empty sheet. Working with 1 doughnut at a time, dip both sides of doughnut in glaze, allowing excess to drip back into bowl. Place on unlined rack. Repeat with doughnut holes. Let doughnuts and holes stand until glaze has become slightly matte and dry to touch, 15 to 30 minutes, before serving.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: While doughnuts cool, process thawed frozen raspberries in blender until smooth. Strain purée through fine-mesh strainer into bowl or measuring cup. Measure out 6 tablespoons purée for frosting (reserve remaining purée for another use). In medium bowl, whisk confectioners' sugar, salt, and purée until smooth. Top with rainbow sprinkles (optional).

docs.title: Zeb's Waffles
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 orange
  • 1 cup rolled oats
  • 0.25 cup walnuts
  • 2 Tbsp flaxseed meal
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 banana
  • 0.5 cup milk
  • 2 kiwi
  • 0.5 cup raspberries
  • 4 tsp maple syrup

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 waffle iron
  • 1 grater or vegetable peeler
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 food processor or high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat a waffle iron. Using a grater or vegetable peeler, zest the orange.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a bowl, combine the rolled oats, walnuts, flaxseed meal, orange zest, and cinnamon. Place two-thirds of the mixture into a food processor or high-speed blender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Blend until the mixture has a flour-like texture. Return to the bowl with the remaining one-third of the dry ingredients; this step ensures that the waffles have a chunky texture. If you prefer a smoother, uniform texture to your waffles, blend all of the dry ingredients initially.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the smashed banana and milk to the dry ingredients in the bowl. Mix thoroughly with a fork; the batter will be fairly thick. If you prefer a thinner batter, add more milk.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Portion the batter thickly onto a preheated waffle iron and spread it out to all corners. Close the lid and cook the waffle according to the manufacturer’s directions for your waffle iron. When done, remove the waffle from the iron (some waffles require the assistance of a chopstick to encourage release from the waffle iron). Top with sliced kiwi, raspberries, and maple syrup.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://mealplanner.plantstrong.com/recipe/5a4d20cfbc1767ff4c771e83

docs.title: Almond Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 cups almonds
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 3 Tbsp orange flower water
  • 1 lemon zest

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor or high-powered blender
  • 1 sauce pot
  • 1 tissue paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a 300°F oven, toast blanched and peeled almonds for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a food processor or high-powered blender, process almonds until they reach the consistency of coarse almond flour. In a sauce pot, combine 1/2 cup sugar and orange flower water. Heat over very low heat until the syrup becomes thick. Add the almond flour into the syrup, mixing to combine over heat for a couple minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Turn off heat and add lemon zest, mixing to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When cool enough to handle, roll dough into walnut-size balls with hands.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Roll the balls in remaining sugar.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Let almond balls dry completely and wrap in tissue paper, twirling the sides like candy wrappers.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Keep in glass jars or another covered container.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Blue Zones

docs.title: Apple Cinnamon Raisin Bars
docs.text: Total Time 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 2 cups light brown sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 cup diced apples
  • 0.75 cup raisins

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 X 13 pan
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat oven to 350°F. Coat a 9 X 13 pan. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt; set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, blend light brown sugar, eggs, unsalted butter, and vanilla.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Gradually add flour mixture. Stir in diced apples and raisins, and spread into pan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake for 35 minutes.

docs.title: Black & White Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12-18 1.73 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cookies
docs.text:
• 3 cups (360 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 14 Tbsp (198 g) unsalted butter
  • 1.25 cups (248 g) granulated sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 large egg yolk
  • 0.75 cup (170 g) buttermilk
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 1 Tbsp lemon zest

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 3.5 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 5 Tbsp milk
  • 3 Tbsp heavy cream
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 10 Tbsp dark cocoa powder
  • some water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 cooling rack
  • 1 offset spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl, mix the unsalted butter and granulated sugar with an electric mixer (stand or hand held) until fluffy, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the eggs and egg yolk, one at a time, mixing between each addition. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the flour in three steps, alternating with the buttermilk, added in two steps, mixing until just blended. Scrape down the sides of the bowl. Mix in the vanilla and lemon zest.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Line baking sheets with parchment paper, and using a 1/4 cup ice cream scoop, scoop the batter onto the pans, allowing about three inches between each cookie. You should get no more than six cookies per half sheet pan.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake the cookies, one sheet at a time, for 17 minutes. The edges should be slightly golden, and the center should spring back when slightly touched.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cool the cookies on the pan on a rack for 5 minutes, and then remove from the pan and cool on a cooling rack completely.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: To make the icing, mix the confectioners' sugar, 4 to 5 Tbsp milk, heavy cream, and vanilla. The icing should be spreadable, but thin enough to not look like cake frosting.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Spread the vanilla frosting over half of the flat side of the cookie with an offset spatula. Let the frosting set for about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Add the dark cocoa powder to the rest of the icing and whisk. Add water, by the teaspoon, until you get a similar consistency to the vanilla icing. Spread the chocolate icing over the other half of the cookie. Let the icing set or at least 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: These cookies are best served within 24 hours, but will keep for up to three days if kept in an airtight container at room temperature.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.karenskitchenstories.com/2016/11/black-and-white-cookies.html
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2021/06/10/best-black-and-white-cookie-bake-off/

docs.title: Brookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 15 44 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Brownie Batter
docs.text:
• 113 g unsalted butter
  • 35 g cocoa powder
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 100 g light brown sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 65 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.75 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips

docs.title: Ingredients - Cookie Dough
docs.text:
• 113 g unsalted butter
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 50 g light brown sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 large egg
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 160 g all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9x13 baking dish
  • 1 parchment or foil
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a 9x13 baking dish with parchment or foil and heat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: For the brownies, melt unsalted butter then stir in cocoa powder. Whisk in both granulated sugar and light brown sugar and the salt then add the eggs and vanilla and beat well (secret to glossy brownies is to beat the eggs and sugar very well.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the all-purpose flour and mix until almost combined then fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips and finish the batter off by hand with a spatula scraping the bowl down and mixing in any errant flour etc.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the brownie batter to your prepared pan and spread into a thin layer then set aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cream the unsalted butter, granulated sugar, and light brown sugar on high for 3 to 4 minutes or until light and fluffy, scraping the bowl down as needed.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Mix in the vanilla and egg and scrape the bowl down once more.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add salt, baking soda, and baking powder then mix until combined.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Pour in the all-purpose flour and mix until almost combined then fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips, reserving a handful to sprinkle on top later. Finish mixing the batter with your spatula then drop spoonfuls onto the brownie batter. You don't need full coverage, it will be nice to see the brownie batter peaking through after baking.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Cover with foil and bake at 350°F for 20 minutes then bake another 20 minutes uncovered. Allow to cool before removing from pan and cutting.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://preppykitchen.com/brookies/

docs.title: Brown Butter and Maple Chewy Pumpkin Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 cookies 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cookies
docs.text:
• 220 g unsalted butter
  • 280 g all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp pumpkin pie spice
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 280 g dark brown sugar
  • 1 large egg yolk
  • 3 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 80 g pumpkin purée

docs.title: Ingredients - Coating
docs.text:
• 1.5 Tbsp light brown sugar
  • 1.5 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 0.75 tsp cinnamon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: First, brown the unsalted butter. Melt 1 cup of butter over medium heat, continuing to stir until it reaches a rich amber color.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour the butter into a measuring glass to ensure you have the right amount, making sure to scrape the bottom of the pot to get all of the brown bits as well. It should be a bit short of 1 cup. Place in the refrigerator to chill for about 20 minutes. Don’t let it solidify.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, pumpkin pie spice, and cinnamon. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the dark brown sugar and cooled brown butter. It should look like clumpy wet sand.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Whisk in the egg yolk, maple syrup, vanilla, and pumpkin purée until smooth.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add in all of the dry ingredients and use a rubber spatula to fold into the dough. If your dough feels too thin (it should hold its shape when scooped), chill the dough for about 15 to 20 minutes until thickened. This can happen sometimes if the butter is too warm at the start.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Off to the side, mix together the light brown sugar, granulated sugar, and cinnamon in a small dish to make the coating.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Scoop out the dough in 60 g portions. Drop into the cinnamon sugar mixture and toss to coat. The dough will be very soft but not sticky.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Place onto the baking sheet, spaced about 3 inches apart from each other. You should be able to bake 4 to 5 cookies at a time. Leave the rest of the dough out at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Bake for 12 to 15 minutes (13.5 minutes for me) or until the edges are darkened and the center looks puffed and slightly underdone.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Allow them to rest on the baking sheet for a couple minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack. Continue to bake the rest of the cookie dough.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Allow the cookies to cool, then dig in!

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://butternutbakeryblog.com/chewy-pumpkin-cookies/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2022/10/28/best-pumpkin-cookie-bake-off/

docs.title: Brown Butter Chocolate Chunk Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 15 47 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 225 g unsalted butter
  • 145 g all-purpose flour
  • 75 g buckwheat flour
  • 140 g granulated sugar
  • 135 g dark brown sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 100 g dark chocolates
  • 70 g semisweet chocolate
  • 1 60 g dark chocolate bar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small pot
  • 1 large ovenproof skillet
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 half-sheet pans
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the brown butter. In a small pot, bring the unsalted butter to a boil over medium-high heat. As the milk solids begin to settle to the bottom of the pot, the foam will burn off. Reduce the heat to low. Once the milk solids are a deep mahogany hue, another 4 to 5 minutes, and the air smells nutty and sweet, remove the pan from the heat. Carefully pour the liquid into a small bowl, scraping up all the browned milk solids on the bottom of the pot. Transfer to the refrigerator to resolidify, about 2 hours.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Toast the flours. Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C). Spread the all-purpose flour and buckwheat flour in a large ovenproof skillet or on a sheet pan and toast for 10 to 15 minutes. Set aside to cool completely. (This can be done up to 2 weeks in advance and stored until ready to use.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cream the butter. When the brown butter feels softened but not greasy, add 145 g of it to a stand mixer fitted with the paddle (or a large bowl for using a handheld mixer). Cream the butter on medium-high speed until it is fluffy, smooth, and white in color, about 2 minutes. Scrape the butter into a small bowl and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Dissolve the sugar in the eggs. Switch to the whisk attachment (or continue to use a handheld mixer). In the same bowl (no need to wash it), combine the granulated sugar, dark brown sugar, and eggs and whip until the mixture is lightened in color and doubled in volume, 4 to 5 minutes. Swap the whisk out for the paddle, add the brown butter and vanilla, and mix on medium-low speed to combine, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Prepare the dry ingredients. In a medium bowl, whisk together the toasted flours, baking soda, and kosher salt. Tip the dry ingredients into the mixer bowl and paddle on low speed until they are halfway combined, about 10 seconds. When the dough looks streaky, add both chopped dark chocolates and semisweet chocolate and paddle to combine.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Age the dough. Transfer the dough to an airtight container. Refrigerate for 24 hours before baking.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and prep the pans. To bake in batches, top two or three half-sheet pans with parchment paper and lightly mist the paper with cooking spray.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Shape the cookies. Scoop the chilled dough into plump tangerine-size balls (aim for 65 g to 70 g each); you should get about 15 cookies. Transfer the cookies to the pans, spacing them about 4 inches (10 cm) apart. Break the dark chocolate bar into 12 to 15 inch-long (2.5 cm) shards and press a couple of them onto the surface of each ball. Sprinkle generously with flaky sea salt.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake the cookies. Bake until the cookies are golden and puffy in the center, 17 to 19 minutes. Remove from the oven and firmly rap the sheet pans on top of the counter to force the cookies to fall. Let the cookies cool completely on the sheet pans. Store the cookies wrapped at room temperature for 1 to 2 days or in the freezer for up to 3 weeks.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cupofjo.com/2023/04/12/brown-butter-chocolate-chunk-cookies/

docs.title: Brown Butter Iced Oatmeal Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup (170 g) butter
  • 0.75 cup (160 g) light brown sugar
  • 0.25 cup (50 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup (120 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 1 cup (99 g) old fashioned oats

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 1.33 cups (227 g) confectioners' sugar
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) milk
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 1.5 ounce cookie scoop
  • 1 cooling rack
  • 1 microwave safe bowl
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Brown the butter over medium heat, stirring constantly until the butter begins to foam and turns a golden brown, emitting a nutty aroma. Make sure you only brown the butter lightly. When butter browns the liquid evaporates off which can dry out your dough. As soon as the butter starts to turn brown and smell nutty, take it off the heat to prevent any more liquid from escaping. Take butter off the heat and allow to cool for about 1 minute, or until no longer hot to the touch, before using.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl combine the butter, light brown sugar, and granulated sugar. Beat until mixed together. Add in the egg, egg yolk, and vanilla extract. Mix well.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the all-purpose flour, salt and baking soda and beat until well mixed. Add the old fashioned oats and mix until just combined and no streaks of flour remain.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Use a 1.5 ounce cookie scoop to scoop the cookie dough out into balls, placing them 2 inches apart on the prepared sheet. Bake for 11 minutes, or until the edges are just golden brown and the centers have puffed up but are still gooey.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Transfer the cookies to a cooling rack to cool. While the cookies cool, make the icing. Combine confectioners' sugar, milk, vanilla, and salt for the frosting in a microwave safe bowl. Mix until smooth. Microwave the icing for 30 seconds – this will help thin it out and help it harden once it cools!

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Frost the top of each oatmeal cookie, using an offset to spatula to scrape off any excess glaze. Allow the glaze to set before eating!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://bromabakery.com/brown-butter-iced-oatmeal-cookies/

docs.title: Brown Butter Macadamia Nut
docs.text: Total Time 52 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 Tbsp (113 g) unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp water
  • 1.25 cup (150 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp cornstarch
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 10 Tbsp (124 g) granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp (27 g) brown sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup (85 g) white chocolate chips
  • 0.5 cup (75 g) roasted, salted macadamia nuts

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 flexible spatula
  • 1 small saucepan or skillet
  • 1 heatproof spatula
  • 1 medium heatproof bowl
  • 1 baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Melt 1 stick unsalted butter in a small saucepan or skillet over medium heat until it begins to foam and bubble. Continue cooking, swirling the pan occasionally, until the cracking sounds stop, about 2 minutes. Continue to swirl the pan or stir with a heatproof spatula until brown bits start to form at the bottom and the butter starts to smell nutty. When the bits are amber in color and the butter is light brown, immediately remove from the heat. Scrape into a medium heatproof bowl, making sure to scrape all the browned solids into the bowl. Add 1 teaspoon water and set aside to cool slightly.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, place 1.25 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, and 1 teaspoon baking powder in a second medium bowl and whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons packed brown sugar, 1 large egg, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, and 1 teaspoon kosher salt to the browned butter. Whisk well to combine. Add 1/2 cup white chocolate chips and 1/2 cup roasted, salted macadamia nuts, and fold with a flexible spatula until combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add 1/2 of the flour mixture and fold until the flour is mostly incorporated. Add the remaining flour mixture and fold until just combined. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, arrange 2 racks to divide the oven into thirds and heat the oven to 350ºF. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Scoop out the cookie dough into 20 (2 rounded tablespoon) portions and place on the baking sheets, spacing them evenly apart. No need to roll into smooth balls — irregular cookie shapes make for dynamic cookies!

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake until the cookies are lightly golden and puffed, 12 to 15 minutes. Let cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack and let cool completely.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/macadamia-nut-cookies-recipe-23424474

docs.title: Butter Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 30 53 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 230 g unsalted butter
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • 1 tsp almond extract
  • 281 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1.5 Tbsp whole milk
  • 113 g semi-sweet chocolate (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper or silicone baking mats
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 handheld mixer or a stand mixer
  • 1 large piping tip
  • 1 piping bag

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line 2 to 3 large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Or leave unlined. If unlined, do not grease the pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, using a handheld mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream the unsalted butter and granulated sugar together on medium-high speed until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the egg, vanilla extract, and almond extract, and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: On low speed, beat in the all-purpose flour and salt. Turn up to high speed and beat until completely combined. On medium speed, beat in 1.5 Tablespoons of whole milk. You want a dough that’s creamy and pipe-able (but still thick), so you may need up to 2 or 2.5 Tablespoons of milk. The more milk you add, the more the cookies will spread so chilling is imperative. I recommend keeping the amount of milk small and using a large enough piping tip.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add your large piping tip to the piping bag. Spoon a little bit of dough into the piping bag and pipe a 1-2 inch swirl or line on the prepared baking sheet. The reason I suggest only a little bit of dough to start is because the dough may still be too thick to pipe. If it’s too thick, transfer that dough back to the mixing bowl and add another 1/2 Tablespoon of milk. If the dough is creamy enough to pipe, continue piping the dough in 1-2 inch swirls or lines, 3 inches apart on the baking sheet. If desired, place a maraschino cherry in the center of the swirl or sprinkle the dough with festive sprinkles and/or coarse sugar.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Chill the shaped cookies on the baking sheet for 20 to 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350°F (177°C).

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake the chilled cookies for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned on the sides. The cookies will spread like all cookies do, but not completely lose their shape especially if you chilled the shaped dough. If the cookies are smaller, they will take closer to 12 minutes. Keep your eye on them. They’re done when the edges lightly brown.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Remove from the oven and allow to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: You can melt the semi-sweet chocolate (optional) in a double boiler or the microwave. If using the microwave: place the chopped chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl. Melt in 20 second increments in the microwave, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Dip the cookies in chocolate and top with sprinkles, if desired. Allow the chocolate to set completely at room temperature for about 1 hour or in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Plain cookies stay fresh in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week. Cookies with chocolate or cherries stay fresh in an airtight container at room temperature for 3 days or in the refrigerator for 1 week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#tasty-recipes-78810

docs.title: Butter Swirl Shortbread Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 cookies 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup (226 g) unsalted butter
  • 114 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 240 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 Tbsp whole milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 pastry bag
  • 1 large star tip
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place the unsalted butter, confectioners' sugar and vanilla in a large bowl, and beat with an electric mixer until combined, light, and fluffy.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the all-purpose flour and salt and mix until it’s crumbly and looks like it can’t be mixed more.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the whole milk and keep mixing. The dough should clump together after about 15 seconds.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place the dough into a pastry bag fitted with a very large star tip, and pipe onto a silicone mat lined baking sheet, with no more than 12 cookies per sheet.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake the cookies for 15 minutes or until lightly golden.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Let them cool completely (on the tray is fine), and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.fifteenspatulas.com/butter-swirl-shortbread-cookies/

docs.title: Butterscotch Brownies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 48 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 cup unsalted butter
  • 1.75 cups brown sugar
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 cup butterscotch morsels
  • 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 x 3-inch baking pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 wooden spoon or spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C), and line a 9 x 3-inch baking pan with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sift the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl, beat the unsalted butter, brown sugar, and vanilla with an electric mixer until light and fluffy (about 5 minutes). Add the eggs, one by one, beating well after every addition.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Change to a wooden spoon or spatula, then gradually pour the flour into the butter and egg mixture. Stir until only a few streaks of flour remain.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add 1 cup of butterscotch morsels and the chopped nuts (optional), then gently mix to combine.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Spoon and spread the mixture into the lined baking pan. Sprinkle remaining butterscotch morsels on top.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the edges start to pull away from the sides. Let the brownies cool for about 15 minutes, or until cool enough to touch. Slice, serve, and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://insanelygoodrecipes.com/butterscotch-brownies/

docs.title: Buttery Pineapple Crumble Bars
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 2.73 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 240 g all-purpose flour
  • 170 g unsalted butter
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 264 g granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 638 g pineapple
  • 28 g cornstarch
  • 1.5 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 29 g slivered almonds

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch square baking pan
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Lightly coat a 9-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. Beat all-purpose flour, softened unsalted butter, vanilla, 198 g of the granulated sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt with a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment on medium-low speed until mixture resembles coarse crumbs, about 1 minute. Reserve 1 cup of the crumb mixture in a small bowl for the topping. Press remaining crumb mixture evenly into bottom of prepared pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Bake crust until golden brown, about 18 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack, and cool crust completely, about 30 minutes.

Note

Do not turn off oven.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, gently stir together chopped pineapple, cornstarch, lemon juice, and remaining 66 g sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a bowl until thoroughly combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spread pineapple mixture evenly over cooled crust.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Stir together slivered almonds and reserved crumb mixture in a small bowl until combined. Sprinkle almond mixture evenly over pineapple mixture on crust. Bake at 375°F until the filling is bubbly and the topping is lightly browned, 45 to 55 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack. Cool completely, about 1 hour. and cut into 16 squares.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Coastal Living Spring 2024

docs.title: Cherry Bars
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 bars 2.27 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust & Topping
docs.text:
• 188 g all-purpose flour
  • 85 g whole rolled oats
  • 100 g brown sugar
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 142 g melted unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 11 g cornstarch
  • 525 g sour cherries
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • 0.25 tsp almond extract
  • 2 Tbsp whole rolled oats

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp whole milk
  • 120 g confectioners' sugar
  • 0.25 tsp almond extract

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch square baking pan
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 fork
  • 1 wire rack

Tip

You can use dark sweet cherries (fresh or frozen) instead of sour cherries. Reduce the sugar in the filling to 1/3 cup (67 g) and add another 1 teaspoon of lemon juice. Still, if I had to choose, I would use sour cherries here.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C). Line a 9-inch square baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to easily lift the bars out of the pan. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk the all-purpose flour, 1 cup (85 g) whole rolled oats, brown sugar, baking powder, lemon zest, and salt together in a medium bowl. Add the melted unsalted butter and vanilla, and stir until the mixture resembles moist crumbly sand and no dry spots remain.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: You will have a little more than 3 cups of crust mixture, or about 520 g. Press 2/3 of the mixture (about 2 cups/345 g) into the prepared baking pan. Press it into the pan (with your hands, a large spoon or spatula, or the bottom of a measuring cup) to form a crust. Bake for 10 minutes, and then remove from the oven to slightly cool.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place the cornstarch in a small bowl and set aside, within reach of the stove. In a medium saucepan set over medium heat, combine the sour cherries, granulated sugar, and lemon juice.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook, stirring occasionally, until the cherries begin to release their juices, about 4 to 6 minutes. While the cherries continue to cook, carefully remove a couple of spoonfuls of the juice from the saucepan and add to the bowl of cornstarch. Using a fork, mix the cornstarch and cherry juice together until the cornstarch is dissolved. Stir this mixture into the filling, then bring to a boil and cook, stirring occasionally, until the filling has thickened, about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove from heat and stir in the almond extract.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Pour/spread the filling over the warm crust. Stir 2 Tablespoons whole rolled oats into the remaining crumble mixture, then sprinkle it all over the filling, and lightly press it down with the back of a large spoon or flat spatula.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Bake for about 40 to 50 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a toothpick comes out mostly clean (with a few jammy cherry specks!). Mine take about 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Remove from the oven and allow the bars to cool completely in the pan set on a wire rack. After about 1 hour, you can place the whole pan in the refrigerator to help speed things up.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Whisk the icing ingredients together. Add whole milk to confectioners' sugar and almond extract to thin it out, if desired. Drizzle over cooled bars.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Lift the bars out of the pan using the edges of the parchment paper lining and place the whole thing on a cutting board. Slice squares with a sharp knife and, for neat squares, wipe the knife clean between each cut.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Cover and store leftover cherry pie bars (with or without icing) at room temperature for up to 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cherry-pie-bars/#tasty-recipes-124000

docs.title: Chewy Brownies
docs.text: Total Time 3.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.33 cup Dutch-processed cocoa
  • 1.5 tsp espresso powder
  • 10 Tbsp water
  • 2 oz unsweetened chocolate
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 egg yolks
  • 4 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 2.5 cup sugar
  • 1.75 cup flour
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 6 oz bittersweet chocolate

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9x13 pan
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to lowest position. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 9x13 pan with parchment paper or greased-foil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk Dutch-processed cocoa, optional espresso powder, and boiling water. Mix until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add chopped unsweetened chocolate and whisk until it is melted.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add eggs, egg yolks, melted unsalted butter, and vanilla; continue to whisk until smooth.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Mix in sugar, flour, and salt.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Fold in bittersweet chocolate 1/2" pieces.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Pour into prepared pan and bake 30 to 35 minutes, rotating pan halfway through.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Transfer pan to wire rack and cool for 1.5 hours.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Lift parchment paper with brownies in it, and cool on rack for 1 hour.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Chocolate Chip Blondies
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 113 g unsalted butter
  • 213 g brown sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla extract
  • 0.25 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 120 g all-purpose flour
  • 170 g chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8 x 8 pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line an 8 x 8 pan with parchment paper and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the melted unsalted butter and brown sugar. Add the egg and egg yolk, and vanilla extract and mix well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl stir together the baking powder, salt, and all-purpose flour. Add the wet ingredients into the dry and fold together until just mixed and no clumps of flour remain. Fold in the chocolate chips. Do not over mix. Leave some chocolate chips for the topping.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the batter into your prepared pan, spreading into an even layer. Sprinkle the left over chocolate chips on top.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the blondies are golden brown, set on the edges and have puffed up. The middle will still be undercooked, but they will continue to cook as they cool!

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Once the blondies are cool, cut into 9 squares for big blondies, or 16 squares for smaller portions and enjoy!

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://bromabakery.com/the-best-chewy-blondies/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2023/05/28/best-blondie-bake-off/

docs.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies with Chickpeas
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 cookies 13 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup light or dark brown sugar
  • 0.75 cup margarine
  • 2 large egg whites
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 15-oz can chickpeas
  • 12 oz semisweet chocolate chips
  • 0.75 cup walnuts (optional)
  • 0.75 cup raisins (optional)
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 cup old-fashioned rolled oats
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp kosher salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 cooling rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray or line with parchment.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl or the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the light or dark brown sugar and margarine with a wooden spoon or on medium speed until smooth. Beat in the egg whites and vanilla, then the chickpeas and semisweet chocolate chips (and walnuts (optional) and raisins (optional), if using). Add the all-purpose flour, old-fashioned rolled oats, baking soda, and kosher salt, and mix on low speed until a thick dough forms.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Drop the dough by the tablespoonful onto the baking sheet, spacing the cookies about 2 inches apart. Press gently with a fork to flatten. Bake until the cookies are golden brown and just set, 11 to 13 minutes; do not overbake. Transfer to a cooling rack to cool.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://jessicaseinfeld.com/recipes/chocolate-chip-cookies-with-chickpeas

docs.title: Chocolate Chip Skillet Cookie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.25 cups (283 g) butter
  • 1.5 cup (320 g) brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup (99 g) granulated sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 3 cups (360 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 3 cups (510 g) semisweet chocolate chips
  • 0.5 cups (57 g) walnuts
  • some vanilla ice cream (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 10 inch cast iron skillet
  • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F and generously grease a 10 inch cast iron skillet with butter. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl combine the melted butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar. Beat until mixed together. Add in the eggs, egg yolk, and vanilla extract. Mix well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In separate bowl mix together the all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Mix half the dry ingredients into the wet until everything comes together. Slowly add in the remaining flour a little bit at a time, stopping if the dough starts to get too dry. Fold in the semi sweet chocolate chips and the walnuts. Do not over mix.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the cookie dough to your prepared skillet and pat into an even layer.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes or until the edges are just golden brown and the center has puffed up but is still very gooey in the middle.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Allow to cool for at least 15 minutes before serving with vanilla ice cream (optional). Best served warm!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://bromabakery.com/chocolate-chip-skillet-cookie/

docs.title: Chocolate Crinkles
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 dozen 12 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup vegetable oil
  • 4 oz melted unsweetened chocolate
  • 2 cups granulated sugar
  • 4 eggs
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 cup confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix vegetable oil, melted unsweetened chocolate, and granulated sugar.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend in one egg at a time until well blended.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add vanilla.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt into oil mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Chill for several hours or overnight.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Drop teaspoonfuls of dough into confectioners' sugar.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Roll in sugar and shape into balls.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Place about 2 inches apart on greased baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
Bake 10 to 12 minutes.

Note

Do not overbake.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Grandma Beatrice Wilde

docs.title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cheesecake Bars
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 bars 45 minutes

docs.title: Dough
docs.text:
• 2 sticks (226 g) butter
  • 1 cup (198 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 cup (213 g) brown sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 cup (42 g) cocoa powder
  • 0.75 tsp salt

docs.title: Topping
docs.text:
• 1 18-oz brick cream cheese
  • 0.5 cup (68 g) peanut butter
  • 0.5 cup (99 g) granulated sugar
  • 2 eggs

docs.title: Garnish
docs.text:
• 5 Reese's Peanut Butter Cups
  • 0.5 cup Reese's Pieces
  • 1 Tbsp peanut butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 9x13-inch pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a mixing bowl, cream the butter, 1 cup sugar, and the brown sugar until they're light and fluffy. Mix in 2 of the eggs.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, cocoa powder, and salt. Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients to form a soft dough.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Press the dough into a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 10 minutes, then remove it from the oven and set it aside as you make the topping.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a mixing bowl, add the cream cheese, 1/2 cup peanut butter, and 1/2 cup sugar. Whip the mixture to combine, then mix in the remaining 2 eggs. Mix until smooth.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour the topping over the prepared base and return the pan to the oven. Bake for another 20 minutes, until slightly jiggly.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove the bars from the oven and set aside to cool.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Top the bars with chopped Reese's Peanut Butter Cups and Reese's Pieces. Melt the remaining 1 tablespoon of peanut butter. Drizzle the top of the bars with the melted peanut butter.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Allow the bars to fully cool and set for 1 hour before cutting and serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/789612/chocolate-peanut-butter-cheesecake-bars-recipe/

docs.title: Chocolate Pizzelle
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 28 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 large eggs
  • 198 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp espresso powder
  • 0.38 tsp salt
  • 21 g Dutch-process cocoa
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 200 g all-purpose flour
  • 113 g melted unsalted butter
  • 1 plain pizzelle batter (optional)
  • 0.5 tsp hazelnut flavor (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 pizzelle iron

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Beat together the eggs, granulated sugar, vanilla, espresso powder, and salt till smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the Dutch-process cocoa and baking powder, again beating till smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the all-purpose flour, mixing till well combined. Add the melted unsalted butter, again mixing till well combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake pizzelle according to your pizzelle iron instructions. A tablespoon cookie scoop works well for scooping batter onto the iron; a level scoopful of batter is the right size for most standard pizzelle makers.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To make two-tone pizzelle: Prepare plain pizzelle batter (optional), flavoring it with 1/2 teaspoon hazelnut flavor (optional). Using a teaspoon scoop (which holds 2 level measuring teaspoons), drop a chestnut-sized ball of vanilla batter just below center in the cooking area of the pizzelle iron. Drop a slightly smaller ball of chocolate batter just above the center line, nestling it right next to the vanilla batter. Close the iron, and bake according to the manufacturer's directions.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/chocolate-pizzelle-recipe

docs.title: Chocolate Scotcheroos
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup (198 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 cup (312 g) light corn syrup
  • 1 cup (135 g) peanut butter
  • 6 cups Rice Krispies
  • 1 cup (170 g) chocolate chips
  • 1 cup butterscotch chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 3-quart saucepan
  • 1 9x13 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine sugar and light corn syrup in a 3-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until mixture begins to bubble. Remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in peanut butter; mix well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add Rice Krispies; stir until blended.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Press mixture into greased 9x13 pan.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Melt chocolate chips and butterscotch chips together, stirring until well blended.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove from heat; spread evenly over Rice Krispie mixture.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cool until firm.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Cinnamon-Spiced Shortbread
docs.text: Total Time 52 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Shortbread
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups unsalted butter
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp warm water
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 420 g all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Ingredients - Sugar Coating
docs.text:
• 100 g granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.25 tsp cloves

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 large (3 1/2") star cutter
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 baking sheets
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Shortbread: Preheat oven to 350°F. In the large bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat unsalted butter, granulated sugar, warm water, and vanilla on low speed until just combined (make sure that you don’t whip it!). In a medium bowl, sift all-purpose flour, cinnamon, and salt and whisk to combine. With mixer still on low speed, slowly add dry ingredients to butter mixture, beating just until dough comes together in large clumps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Turn out dough onto a floured surface and shape into a flat disk.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Wrap in plastic wrap and chill until cold, about 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: On a floured board, roll dough to 1/2" thick. Cut with a large (3 1/2") star cutter or any other shape you like! Arrange dough on 2 parchment-lined baking sheets, spacing 1" apart.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake shortbread until edges just begin to brown, 20 to 22 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a medium bowl, combine granulated sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: As soon as cookies come out of the oven, generously sprinkle with sugar mixture. Let cool on sheets. Shake off any excess sugar mixture and serve warm or at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a41830806/cinnamon-spiced-shortbread-recipe/

docs.title: Classic Pizzelle
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 30-50 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 large eggs
  • 149 g granulated sugar
  • 0.38 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 210 g all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 113 g melted butter
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 pizzelle iron
  • 1 cooking rack
  • 1 scissors

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Beat the eggs, granulated sugar, salt, and vanilla until well combined.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in the all-purpose flour and baking powder, mixing until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the melted butter, again mixing until smooth; the batter will be thick and soft.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat your pizzelle iron. Grease it as directed in the manufacturer's instructions. As the iron heats, the batter will stiffen.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook the pizzelle according to the instructions that came with your iron. In general, they'll take between 45 seconds and 2 1/2 minutes to brown.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove the pizzelle from the iron, and cool on a cooking rack. If desired, use a pair of scissors to trim any ragged edges.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Dust cooled pizzelle with confectioners' sugar, if desired.

Tip

Flavor to taste: classic pizzelle are often flavored with anise extract or anise seed. Butter-rum, lemon, or rum flavors are also delicious. Simply add extract to the batter to taste. Start with 1/4 teaspoon; amounts will vary a lot, depending on the strength of the extract you choose.

Tip

One reader suggests the best way to grease your pizzelle iron is to dip a towel in vegetable oil, and wipe it all over the iron's interior plates. This helps avoid the sticky residue you may get from spraying the iron with non-stick spray.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/classic-pizzelle-recipe

docs.title: Consumer Union Chocolate Chip Cookies
docs.text: Total Time 11 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 1/2 Batch
  • 0.375 cup (75 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.375 cup (80 g) light brown sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 1 stick (113 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 1.125 cups (135 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 12 oz pkg (170 g) semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • some walnuts
Serves 1 Batch
  • 0.75 cup (149 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.75 cup (160 g) light brown sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 sticks (226 g) unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2.25 cups (270 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 12 oz pkg (340 g) semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • some walnuts

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixer
  • 1 cooking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, unsalted butter, and vanilla with mixer.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend flour, baking soda, and salt with whisk. Stir into wet ingredients. Stir in semi-sweet chocolate chips and walnuts, if desired.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Portion cookies out in 3 Tbsp (60 g) measurements. Bake on lightly greased cooking sheet or parchment paper. Bake at 375°F for approximately 9 to 11 minutes.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• Consumer Union
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Cook’s Illustrated Perfect Chocolate Chip Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 23 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 cups (210 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 14 Tbsp (198 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup (99 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.75 cup (160 g) dark brown sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 egg
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1.25 cups (213 g) semi-sweet chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 18x12-in baking sheets
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 10-inch stainless steel or cast iron skillet
  • 1 large heatproof bowl
  • 1 rubber spatula or wooden spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line 2 large 18x12-in baking sheets with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour and baking soda; set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat 10 tablespoons of the unsalted butter in a 10-inch stainless steel or cast iron skillet over medium-high heat until melted, about 2 minutes. Continue cooking, swirling the pan constantly until the butter is dark golden brown and has a nutty aroma, 1 to 3 minutes. Remove skillet from heat and transfer the browned butter to a large heatproof bowl. Stir the remaining 4 tablespoons butter into the hot browned butter until completely melted. Set aside and let cool to room temperature.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add granulated sugar, dark brown sugar, salt, and vanilla to the bowl with the butter and whisk until fully incorporated. Add the egg and egg yolk and whisk until the mixture is smooth with no sugar lumps remaining, about 30 seconds. Let the mixture stand for 3 minutes, then whisk for 30 seconds. Repeat the process of resting and whisking 2 more times until the mixture is thick, smooth, and shiny. Using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, stir in the flour mixture until just combined, about 1 minute. Stir in the semi-sweet chocolate chips and give the dough a final stir to ensure there are no hidden flour pockets.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Press plastic wrap against the dough and refrigerate for at least 24 hours, up to 72 hours.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Scoop the dough into 16 even portions, each about 3 tablespoons (60 g), and arrange them 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets, 8 dough balls per sheet.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake the cookies 1 tray at a time until the cookies are golden brown but still puffy, and the edges have begun to set but centers are still soft, 10 to 14 minutes, rotating the baking sheet halfway through baking. Transfer the baking sheet to wire rack and allow cookies to cool completely before serving. Cookies can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.browneyedbaker.com/cooks-illustrated-perfect-chocolate-chip-cookies/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-brown-butter-chocolate-chip-cookie-bake-off/

docs.title: Cracked-Surface Crunchy Gingersnaps
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3.5 dozen 1.17 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 397 g granulated sugar
  • 170 g unsalted butter
  • 59 ml molasses
  • 1 egg
  • 281 g all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking soda
  • 3 g salt
  • 5 g ginger
  • 2 g cinnamon
  • 1 g cloves
  • 0.5 g nutmeg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 heavy-duty mixer
  • 1 medium mixing bowl
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 release foil
  • 1 non-stick cooking spray
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a heavy-duty mixer, beat 1.75 cups (349 g) of the granulated sugar and the unsalted butter until fluffy. Add the 1/4 cup molasses and beat to blend in well. Add the egg and beat on low just to blend in.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the all-purpose flour, baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 Tbsp ginger, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp cloves, and 1/4 tsp nutmeg. Add this dry mixture to the mixer and blend on lowest speed. Cover and chill dough for at least 1 hour or overnight.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover a baking sheet with release foil, or parchment lightly sprayed with non-stick cooking spray.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Roll the dough into 1.25 inch balls. Place the remaining 1/4 cup (51 g) granulated sugar in a small bowl and roll each ball in sugar. Place the baking sheet, 2 inches apart. Bake until edges just begin to color, about 10 minutes, but check on them at 8 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove the foil and cookies to a rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • BakeWise

docs.title: Cranberry Bars
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 18-24 squares 1.92 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust & Topping
docs.text:
• 375 g all-purpose flour
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 226 g cold cubed unsalted butter
  • 1 large egg
  • 60 g milk
  • 2 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 400 g fresh or frozen cranberries
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 2 tsp orange zest
  • 15 g fresh orange juice
  • 30 g sliced almonds (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 30 g fresh orange juice
  • 120 g confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 X 13-inch baking pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 pastry cutter
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C). Line the bottom and sides of a 9 X 13-inch baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to lift the finished bars out (makes cutting easier!). Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Make the crumble mixture for the crust and topping: Whisk the all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon together in a large bowl. Add the cold cubed unsalted butter and using a pastry cutter, two forks, or a food processor, cut in the butter until all the flour is coated and resembles pea-sized crumbles. This takes at least 5 minutes of cutting in with a pastry cutter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk the egg, milk, and vanilla together in a small bowl. Pour over the flour/butter mixture and gently mix together until the mixture resembles moist crumbly sand.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: You will have about 6 cups of the crust/crumble mixture. Set 2 cups aside. Pour the remaining into the prepared pan and flatten down with your hands or a flat spatula to form an even crust. It will be a little crumbly, which is ok. Set aside. (Almonds will be used in the topping in the next step.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cranberry Filling: Mix the fresh or frozen cranberries, granulated sugar, cornstarch, orange zest, and fresh orange juice. Spread over the crust. Sprinkle the remaining crumble mixture all over the cranberries. Sprinkle the sliced almonds (optional) all over top.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for about 40 to 50 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a toothpick comes out mostly clean (with a few jammy cranberry specks!). Mine take about 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow the bars to cool completely in the pan set on a wire rack. After about 1 hour, I stick the whole pan in the refrigerator to help speed things up.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Make the icing and cut into squares: Whisk the fresh orange juice, confectioners' sugar together. Add more orange juice to thin out, if desired. Drizzle over cooled bars, then cut into squares.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cover and store leftover cranberry bars (with or without icing) at room temperature for up to 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cranberry-crumble-pie-bars/#tasty-recipes-77854

docs.title: Custard Creams
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.87 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Biscuit
docs.text:
• 100 g unsalted butter
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 175 g all-purpose flour
  • 35 g custard powder

docs.title: Ingredients - Custard
docs.text:
• 65 g granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp water
  • 2 egg yolks
  • 20 g custard powder
  • 150 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 biscuit cutter and stamp
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 small pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the biscuits. Beat the unsalted butter and granulated sugar in a stand mixer fitted with the beater, on medium speed for 2 to 3 minutes, until light and creamy. Add the egg and vanilla and thoroughly mix.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sift in the all-purpose flour and custard powder and mix by hand to a crumbly dough. Bring the dough together with your hands and knead it gently on a lightly floured work surface until smooth. Do not overwork the biscuit dough.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Divide the dough in half and shape each half into a flat disc, then wrap and chill them for 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Roll out one of the discs of dough on a lightly floured work surface until about 3 mm thick. Lightly flour the custard cream biscuit cutter and stamp, then cut out and stamp 12 biscuits, flouring the cutter and stamp each time.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place the biscuits on one of the lined baking sheets and chill them while you roll out the remaining dough to make 12 more custard cream biscuits. Chill the biscuits for 30 minutes and heat the oven to 170°C/150°C fan/325°F/Gas 3.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake the biscuits for 12 to 14 minutes, until the edges start to turn a golden color. Leave them to cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Make the crème au beurre. Tip the granulated sugar into a small pan, add 2 tablespoons of water and bring it to the boil. Boil the mixture until the temperature on the sugar thermometer reaches 115°C/239°F.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Put the egg yolks in the bowl of stand mixer fitted with a whisk and whisk on low speed. Slowly and carefully pour the hot sugar syrup over the egg yolks, then increase the speed to high and whisk until the mixture is thick and leaves a ribbon trail when you lift the whisk. Sift the custard powder over the surface of the mixture and whisk again until the mixture is cool to the touch.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: A little at a time, gradually add the unsalted butter, whisking continuously until incorporated. Spoon the crème au beurre into the piping bag fitted with the medium plain nozzle and chill it until you're ready to assemble the biscuits.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Assemble the custard creams. Turn 12 of the biscuits design-side down and pipe equal amounts of the crème au beurre around the edges and in the middle of each one. Sandwich with the remaining 12 biscuits, design-side out, on top, then chill the biscuits until the filling is firm. They will keep for up to 3 days in an airtight box.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://thegreatbritishbakeoff.co.uk/recipes/all/prue-leiths-custard-creams/

docs.title: Diamond-Edged Melt-in-Your-Mouth Butter Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 dozen 2.27 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 227 g European style unsalted butter
  • 198 g granulated sugar
  • 3 g salt
  • 2.5 ml almond extract
  • 2 large egg yolks
  • 281 g all-purpose flour
  • 108 g coarse sugar
  • 1 egg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 heavy-duty mixer
  • 1 paddle attachment
  • 1 wax paper
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 heavy baking sheet
  • 1 release foil or parchment
