  • 1 non-stick cooking spray

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a heavy-duty mixer with the paddle attachment, cream the European style unsalted butter, granulated sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp almond extract until light and creamy. Add the egg yolks, one at a time, and beat with each addition, just to blend in thoroughly.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: On a low speed, beat in the all-purpose flour, scraping down the bowl twice. Divide the dough into 4 pieces. Roll each into a log about 1.5 inches in diameter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Sprinkle coarse sugar on wax paper, the length of the rolls and about 4 inches wide. Brush a roll lightly with beaten egg, then roll in sugar to coat well. Repeat with each roll. Wrap each roll individually in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: About 30 minutes before you are ready to bake, place a shelf in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cover a heavy baking sheet with release foil or parchment sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Slice cookies into 3/8 inch slices and arrange about 1 inch apart on the sheet.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Place the baking sheet on the arranged shelf. Bake one sheet at a time until the edges just begin to brown, about 14 minutes. Allow to cool on the sheet for 2 minutes, and then remove to a cooling rack.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • BakeWise

docs.title: Double Chocolate Mint Paleo Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 dozen 26 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup almond butter
  • 0.25 cup melted coconut oil
  • 0.25 cup coconut sugar
  • 0.25 cup maple syrup
  • 1 egg
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.75 tsp peppermint extract
  • 1 cup almond flour
  • 0.33 cup coconut flour
  • 0.33 cup cocoa powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 cup chocolate chips
  • 0.5 cup melt chocolate
  • 0.5 cup crushed candy cane

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together almond butter, melted coconut oil, coconut sugar, and maple syrup.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk in egg and then add in vanilla and peppermint extract.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large bowl, mix almond flour, coconut flour, cocoa powder, salt, and baking soda.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add wet ingredients to dry and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Once fully combined, let sit for 15 minutes for flours to absorb liquid.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Roll into balls and flatten with hand onto baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add chocolate chips to top.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until slightly firm to touch.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Let cool completely.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Once cooled, melt chocolate and dip one half of cookie into chocolate and then into crushed candy cane pieces. They will contain added sugar if you use candy cane.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Let set and store at room temperature for up to one week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.erinliveswhole.com/paleo-double-chocolate-mint-cookies/

docs.title: Edible Cookie Dough
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 89 g all-purpose flour
  • 30 g unsalted butter
  • 15 g granulated sugar
  • 30 g brown sugar
  • 0.25 tsp vanilla
  • 15 ml milk
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 59 g chocolate chips

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text:
Microwave your all-purpose flour for in 15 second intervals, (30 seconds to 1 minute total) till it reaches an internal temperature of 160°F, to eliminate any risk of e. coli or salmonella

Note

If you are also worried about the raw flour, its an easy fix. Put the flour on a pan and bake for a few minutes at 350°F until it reaches 160°F! Or microwave for about 30 seconds!

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a small bowl, cream together your unsalted butter and your granulated sugar and brown sugar until mixed.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add in your vanilla and milk and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add in your salt and flour and mix until all combined. (Add a little more flour if mixture is too wet)

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Dump in your chocolate chips and stir them into the cookie dough.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://lmld.org/eggless-cookie-dough-two/

docs.title: Florentines
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 30 42 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 145 g almonds
  • 3 Tbsp (23 g) all-purpose flour
  • 2 Tbsp orange peel (optional)
  • 140 g granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp heavy cream
  • 2 Tbsp light corn syrup
  • 71 g unsalted butter
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 567 g milk or dark chocolate

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 17 x 12 inch (43 x 30 cm) baking or cookie sheet
  • 1 parchment paper or a silicone mat
  • 1 food processor or blender
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 sharp knife
  • 1 cooling rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Position oven rack in the center of the oven. Preheat oven to 325°F/163°C. Line a large 17 x 12 inch (43 x 30 cm) baking or cookie sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To peel the almonds: Over high heat, bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Add the almonds and boil for 1 minute (no longer because they will soften). Drain and rinse with cold water to cool and stop them from cooking. Spread onto a towel and rub them until the peels come off. Dry well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the almonds to a food processor or blender and pulse until finely chopped.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a mixing bowl, stir together the almonds, all-purpose flour and orange peel.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To a small saucepan add the granulated sugar, heavy cream, light corn syrup and unsalted butter. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally until the mixture comes to a rolling boil and the sugar is completely dissolved. Continue to simmer for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove from the heat and add the mixture to the almond mix along with the vanilla. Stir until combined. Allow to cool until it is cool enough to handle, about 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Using a teaspoon measuring spoon, portion out 1 teaspoon of dough and roll into a ball using your hands. Roll the balls as round as you can, this will ensure nice round cookies. If the dough seems dry and crumbly, simply put a ball of the dough your warm hand it will soften so you can shape.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Place the dough balls 6 inches (15 cm) apart on to the prepared baking sheet. They spread to 3 inches (7.5 cm) in diameter. You'll need to work in batches to fit your baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. If they join together, use a sharp knife to separate while they are hot and soft on the baking sheet as they will harden very quickly.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Remove from the oven and allow to cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes until they are no longer soft, then transfer to a cooling rack. Repeat with the remaining dough.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: In a microwave safe bowl, add the milk or dark chocolate and microwave in 10 second increments, stirring in between until melted. Be careful not to burn.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Take a cooled cookie, spread the chocolate on one side, take another cookie and make a sandwich, press carefully as they are delicate. Repeat with all cookies.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: If you would like to drizzle chocolate on the top, put the melted chocolate into a small zip top bag. Snip of a very tiny piece of the corner and this will allow you to get the perfect drizzle.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Allow the cookies to cool and store in an air tight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://culinaryginger.com/florentine-cookies/

docs.title: French Macarons
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 36 1.37 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Macarons
docs.text:
• 205 g confectioners sugar
  • 190 g ground almonds
  • 144 g egg whites
  • some food coloring paste (optional)
  • 60 ml cold water
  • 190 g granulated sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - French Buttercream
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 3 Tbsp water
  • 5 egg yolks
  • 1 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 large heavy saucepan
  • 1 very clean bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 piping bag
  • 1 medium round piping tip (around 1 cm in diameter)
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 toothpick
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 stand-mixer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Clean all utensils with vinegar to remove all oils.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blitz the confectioners sugar and ground almonds in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pulse 16 times. Should look like bread crumbs.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Sift the confectioners' sugar and ground almonds into a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Divide the egg whites into two equal portions (72 g each). Some people use aged egg whites.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Add one half of the egg whites to the almond and sugar mixture to make a paste. Can add food coloring paste (optional) at this moment.

Note

Liquid color can change the consistency of the paste.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cover with plastic wrap.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Make an italian meringue by adding sugar syrup by adding cold water and granulated sugar to large heavy saucepan.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bring sugar syrup to 230°F (110°C) on medium heat.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Add the second half of the room temperature egg whites into a very clean bowl.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Using an electric mixer, whisk egg whites. Once the sugar syrup reaches 245°F (118°C) and the egg whites begin to foam, SLOWLY add the sugar syrup by pouring it along the wall of the bowl.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Continue to beat for 5 to 6 minutes until meringue is glossy and flops over nicely and the bowl comes to room temperature.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Begin folding a small spoonful of the Italian meringue into the almond mixture. Can be quite vigorous and don't need to be too gentle.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Be careful to add the remaining meringue and fold in gently.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: The final mixture should look like flowing lava, and be able to fall into a figure eight without breaking. Spoon into a piping bag with a medium round piping tip (around 1 cm in diameter) and you’re ready to start piping.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Pipe 1.5 inch dollops onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper (this should be glued down with dabs of batter). Tap on counter several times to release air bubbles. Use a toothpick to pop any air bubbles and fill any gaps. Allow to sit for about 40 minutes, so that a skin forms, before placing in oven. They should be dry when touched with a finger.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 12 to 15 minutes, rotate tray after 7 minutes. They are ready when you touch them and the top comes away from the bottom. Allow to cool completely before removing from baking sheet, about 10 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Combine granulated sugar and water in medium saucepan. Heat over low heat while stirring until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium- high and bring to a boil

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Put egg yolks in a stand-mixer fitted with a whisk attachment and beat until thick and foamy.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: Cook the sugar and water syrup until it reaches 240°F. Immediately remove from heat. With mixer running, SLOWLY drizzle hot syrup into bowl with yolks.

docs.title: Step 21
docs.text: Continue mixing until the bottom of the bowl is cool to the touch and the yolk mixture has cooled to room temperature.

docs.title: Step 22
docs.text: Add in unsalted butter one cube at a time allowing each piece to incorporate before adding the next. Add vanilla and salt. Continue mixing until buttercream is smooth and creamy. (About 5 to 6 minutes.) Add food coloring if desired.

docs.title: Step 23
docs.text: After assembly, refrigerate overnight or for a full 24 hours so that the filling solidifies.

docs.title: Template
docs.text: • 1.5 Inch Macaron Piping Template

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uWSOJMcvDec

docs.title: Fudge Brownies
docs.text: Total Time 33 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 2 dozen
  • 4 eggs
  • 106 g Dutch-process cocoa
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp espresso powder
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 227 g unsalted butter
  • 447 g granulated sugar
  • 180 g all-purpose flour
  • 340 g chocolate chips
Serves 1 dozen
  • 2 eggs
  • 53 g Dutch-process cocoa
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp espresso powder
  • 0.5 Tbsp vanilla
  • 114 g unsalted butter
  • 224 g granulated sugar
  • 90 g all-purpose flour
  • 170 g chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9" x 13" pan
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 9" x 13" pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a 9" x 13" pan. If you plan to turn the whole sheet of brownies out of the pan at once, grease the pan, line it with parchment, and grease the parchment.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Crack the 4 eggs into a bowl, and beat them at medium speed with the Dutch-process cocoa, salt, baking powder, espresso powder, and vanilla for about 1 minute, or until smooth. You can do this while you're melting your unsalted butter (next step).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium-sized microwave-safe bowl, or in a saucepan set over low heat, melt the butter, then add the granulated sugar and stir to combine. Or simply combine the butter and sugar, and heat, stirring, until the butter is melted. Continue to heat (or microwave) briefly, just until the mixture is hot (about 110°F to 120°F), but not bubbling; it'll become shiny looking as you stir it. Heating the mixture to this point will dissolve more of the sugar, which will help produce a shiny top crust on your brownies.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the hot butter and sugar mixture to the egg and cocoa mixture, stirring until smooth.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the all-purpose flour and chocolate chips, stirring until smooth. Again, adding the chips helps produce a shiny top crust.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Spoon the batter into a lightly greased 9" x 13" pan.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake the brownies for 28 to 32 minutes, until the edges feel set, and the center should look very moist, but not uncooked. When testing to see if brownies are done, take a toothpick or the tip of a sharp knife and carefully poke it into the center of the pan, digging around just enough to see the interior. You should see moist crumbs, but no uncooked batter. Yes, you'll be left with a small divot in the center of your brownies; just cut around it when you're cutting the brownies into squares.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Remove them from the oven and cool on a rack before cutting and serving.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text:
Store any leftovers, well-wrapped, at room temperature for 5 to 6 days. Freeze for longer storage.

Note

This recipe is written using Dutch-process cocoa. If you use natural cocoa, your results may be different; the brownies may taste slightly acidic, and might be denser.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/fudge-brownies-recipe
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2018/05/14/best-brownie-bake-off/

docs.title: Glazed Lemon Bars
docs.text: Total Time 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup Reduced Fat Bisquick
  • 2 Tbsp (14 g) confectioners' sugar
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) firm unsalted butter
  • 0.75 cup (149 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup egg substitute
  • 2 tsp grated lemon peel
  • 0.75 cup (85 g) confectioners' sugar
  • 1 Tbsp + 1.5 tsp lemon juice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 square pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat oven to 350°F. Stir together 1 cup of Reduced Fat Bisquick and powdered sugar.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut in firm butter until mixture looks like fine crumbs.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Press mixture into bottom and sides of ungreased square pan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake for 10 minutes. Stir sugar, egg substitute, and grated lemon peel and pour over crust.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: While warm, loosen edges and spread with glaze: powdered sugar, and lemon juice.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Healthy Carrot Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 19 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cookie
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup (72 g) almond flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.13 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 cup coconut oil
  • 0.5 cup (107 g) brown or coconut sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup shredded carrots
  • 1.25 (124 g) cups rolled oats
  • 0.33 cup unsweetened coconut
  • 0.25 cup pecans or walnuts
  • 0.25 cup raisins

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup (28 g) confectioners' sugar
  • 2 tsp unsweetened oat milk
  • 1 dash cinnamon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 large spoon
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, mix almond flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate large bowl, mix together the melted and cooled coconut oil, brown or coconut sugar, egg and vanilla until well combined. Then fold in the shredded carrots and add in the flour mixture. Mix with a large spoon until ingredients are combined. Fold in rolled oats, unsweetened coconut, chopped pecans or walnuts, and raisins.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Roll the mixture into small balls and place on a prepared baking sheet. Gently flatten with your hand.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Allow cookies to cool for a few minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: To make the glaze, combine the confectioners' sugar, 1 to 2 tsp unsweetened oat milk and cinnamon in a bowl. Drizzle a small amount over cookies, then let dry.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Honey Cookies (Finikia)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 48 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup orange juice
  • 0.75 cup honey
  • 0.5 lemon juice
  • 1 Tbsp lemon zest
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 oz cognac or rum
  • 0.75 cup olive oil
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 3.5 cups (420 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 pinch cloves
  • 2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp nutmeg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 fork
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 325°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, whisk together orange juice, honey, lemon juice, lemon zest, vanilla, and cognac or rum. Gradually drizzle in olive oil, whisking to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl, combine baking soda, baking powder, all-purpose flour, cloves, cinnamon, and nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Slowly add dry ingredient mixture to wet ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not over mix or knead, as the dough will become tough.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Let rest for 30 minutes at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Roll dough into walnut-size balls (30 g) and score with a fork. Place balls on a baking sheet, about an inch apart from each other.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake for 14 to 18 minutes, or until golden.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Drizzle with honey, if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: King Arthur Chocolate Chip Cookies
docs.text: Total Time 47 minutes

docs.title: Ratios
docs.text: flour  milk 1 part 5 parts

docs.title: Ingredients - Tangzhong
docs.text:
Serves 8
  • 12 g bread flour
  • 57 g whole milk
Serves 16
  • 23 g bread flour
  • 113 g whole milk

docs.title: Ingredients - Cookies
docs.text:
Serves 8
  • 213 g light brown sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 113 g unsalted butter
  • 154 g bread flour
  • 1 large eggs
  • 0.5 Tbsp vanilla
  • 0.875 tsp baking powder
  • 0.125 tsp baking soda
  • 170 g semisweet chocolate
Serves 16
  • 426 g light brown sugar
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 226 g unsalted butter
  • 307 g bread flour
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 1.75 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp baking soda
  • 340 g semisweet chocolate

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 whisk or flexible spatula
  • 1 serrated knife

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large bowl, combine the light brown sugar and salt. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2 - Brown Butter
docs.text: In a saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the unsalted butter. After several minutes, the butter will sizzle and may spatter. Continue to cook the butter, swirling the pan regularly, for about 5 to 7 minutes, until it's a dark golden brown color and brown bits start collecting at the bottom of the pan; the butter will have stopped sizzling and may also have a layer of foam on the surface.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Once the butter is browned, immediately pour it over the sugar mixture (be sure to scrape out the brown bits at the bottom) and whisk vigorously to combine; this helps dissolve the sugar slightly and creates the shiny surface of the baked cookies. (The mixture will stay lumpy and won't become smooth at this point.) Set the empty saucepan aside to cool slightly.

docs.title: Step 4 - Tangzhong
docs.text: In the same saucepan used to brown the butter, combine the whole milk with 3 tablespoons (23 g) of the bread flour and whisk until no lumps remain.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place the saucepan over low heat and cook the mixture, stirring regularly with a whisk and then a flexible spatula, until it’s thickened, paste-like, and starts to come together into one mass, about 2 to 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove from the heat and transfer directly to the bowl with the butter and sugar. Whisk until mostly smooth; some lumps of the tangzhong mixture are OK.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add the eggs and vanilla and continue whisking until smooth.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Weigh or measure the remaining 2 1/2 cups plus 1 tablespoon (307g) bread flour by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess. Add the bread flour to the bowl with the butter and sugar, then add the baking powder and baking soda. Using a whisk or flexible spatula, stir until well combined and no dry spots remain.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Place the bowl, uncovered, in the refrigerator and allow it to cool for 10 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: While the batter is cooling, use a serrated knife to roughly chop the semisweet chocolate into coarse pieces. Avoid chopping the chocolate too fine, as small pieces will melt when mixed into the dough.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Remove the dough from the refrigerator and fold in the chopped chocolate. Cover the bowl and return to the refrigerator for 24 to 72 hours to allow the flavors to intensify.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: To bake the cookies: When you’re ready to bake, remove the chilled cookie dough from the refrigerator and let it rest at room temperature for about 10 to 15 minutes to allow it to warm up slightly. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350°F with a rack in the center.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Scoop the dough into 85 g to 90 g portions; a level scone and muffin scoop works well here. If you're scooping by hand, the mounds of dough should be about 2 1/4" in diameter. To make smaller cookies (that are still generous in size), scoop the dough into 50 g portions using a jumbo cookie scoop.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Arrange the scooped cookie dough on parchment-lined baking sheets, them 3" to 4" apart. (Five dough balls fit perfectly on a half-sheet pan. The 90 g cookies can be arranged in a 2 1 2 pattern; the 50 g cookies can be arranged in a slightly staggered 4 x 2 pattern.) For consistently shaped cookies, roll each piece of dough into a smooth ball before baking.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Bake the large (90 g) chocolate chip cookies for 18 to 22 minutes or the smaller (50 g) cookies for 15 to 18 minutes, until the edges are set and the cookies are browned, rotating the pan halfway through baking to ensure even browning. (For best results, bake one pan of cookies at a time.) Remove the cookies from the oven and let them rest on the baking sheets until cool enough to handle, at least 15 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/supersized-super-soft-chocolate-chip-cookies-recipe

docs.title: Ladyfingers
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 36 4 inch ladyfingers 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 French Sponge Cake (Biscuit)
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large pastry bag
  • 1 5/8 inch plain tip

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: These light sponge fingers are a delicious nibble, but most find their way into refrigerator desserts such as Tiramisù, or Charlotte Russe.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease and flour 2 large baking sheets or line the bottoms with parchment paper. Prepare batter for French Sponge Cake (Biscuit).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Scrape the batter into a large pastry bag fitted with a 5/8 inch plain tip. Pipe 4 inch fingers at least 1 inch apart on the baking sheets. Sift lightly over the ladyfingers confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake until golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes. Transfer the ladyfingers to a rack, or slide the parchment paper onto the rack, and cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Lemon Bars
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup (57 g) confectioners' sugar
  • 1 cup (226 g) unsalted butter
  • 2 cups (240 g) all-purpose flour
  • 4 eggs
  • 2 cups (396 g) granulated sugar
  • 6 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9 x 13 inch pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cream confectioners' sugar and butter then stir in 2 cups all-purpose flour.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Press mixture into ungreased 9 x 13 inch pan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Beat eggs, granulated sugar, and lemon juice lightly.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Stir in 1/4 cup all-purpose flour and 1/2 tsp baking powder. Pour over crust.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake for 25 to 30 minutes and let cool.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Sprinkle with confectioners' sugar and cut into squares.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Lofthouse Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 285 g confectioners' sugar
  • 0.25 tsp kosher salt
  • 70 g heavy cream
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 225 g unsalted butter
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 1.25 tsp kosher salt
  • 2 egg whites
  • 30 g heavy cream
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 310 g cake flour

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 spatula
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 2 tablespoon cookie scoop

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, combine confectioners' sugar, kosher salt, heavy cream, and vanilla. Mix at low speed to moisten, then increase speed to medium and beat until creamy and soft, about 5 minutes. Using a spatula, scrape frosting into a small bowl, or as many bowls as you would like colors, and cover with plastic pressed directly against the surface. Set aside until needed, up to 24 hours at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Using the same bowl and paddle attachment used for frosting (no need to clean), combine unsalted butter, granulated sugar, baking powder, and kosher salt. Mix at low speed to moisten, then increase speed to medium and beat until fluffy, pale ivory, and soft, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk egg whites, heavy cream, and vanilla in a glass measuring cup until homogeneous. With the mixer still running, add liquid mixture in 4 or 5 additions, pausing to scrape bowl and beater about halfway through. Decrease mixer to low speed, sprinkle in cake flour, and continue mixing to form a soft dough. Fold batter once or twice with a flexible spatula to make sure it's well mixed from the bottom up.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using a 2 tablespoon cookie scoop, divide dough into 24 level portions and carefully drop onto 2 parchment-lined aluminum half sheet pans, leaving 2.5 inches between each dough ball. If needed, pause to rinse scoop in hot water to ensure a clean release (misshapen scoops will spread into an irregular form). Bake until puffed and pale overall, but just barely golden around the very edges, about 15 minutes. Cool directly on sheet pans until no trace of warmth remains, about 15 minutes longer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: If you like, tint frosting with a drop or two of gel paste. Working with one at a time, dollop a shy tablespoon of frosting (3/8 ounce; 10 g) over each cookie, spread into an even layer with a palette knife or butter knife, and top with sprinkles, if desired. Repeat with remaining cookies and enjoy immediately. Let remaining cookies stand at room temperature until frosting forms a crust, then transfer to an airtight container with a sheet of wax paper between each layer. Store up to 3 days at room temperature.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.seriouseats.com/soft-frosted-sugar-cookies-homemade-lofthouse
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2021/02/11/best-lofthouse-cookie-bake-off/

docs.title: M&M Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 cookies 7 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 14 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.75 cup dark brown sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 egg
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1 cup M&M candies
  • 0.5 cup semisweet chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula or wooden spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour and baking soda, and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut the unsalted butter into 14 even-sized pieces. In a medium skillet, melt 10 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat. Continue cooking, swirling pan constantly until golden brown and a nutty aroma forms, 1 to 3 minutes. Remove the skillet from heat. Stir the remaining 4 tablespoons of butter into warm butter until completely melted.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, add the browned butter to the mixing bowl. Add the granulated sugar, dark brown sugar, salt, and vanilla. Whisk on medium speed (setting 5) until combined, 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the whole egg and egg yolk to the mixing bowl. Whisk on medium-high speed (setting 8) until smooth with no sugar lumps remaining, about 30 seconds. Let the mixture stand for 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Repeat the whisking and resting process 3 more times: 30 seconds mixing at medium-high speed and 3 minutes of rest. After four total times, the mixture should be thick, smooth, and shiny.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Using a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, stir in the flour mixture until just combined, about 1 minute. Stir in 3/4 cup M&M candies and semisweet chocolate chips. Give the dough a final stir to ensure no flour pockets remain.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Transfer the mixing bowl to the refrigerator for 30 minutes or the freezer for 15 minutes. Chill until the dough firms up, around 65 to 70°F (18 to 21°C). The dough should not feel overly sticky.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Adjust the oven rack to the middle position. Heat to 375°F (191°C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, then set aside.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Divide the dough into 16 portions, each about 3 tablespoons (about 60 grams, 2 ounces), and roll into a ball. If the dough starts to warm and get sticky, place it on a sheet tray and refrigerate for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: For a rustic appearance, tear the dough balls in half, then press the two halves together again with the lumpy torn sides facing upward to expose the chips. Shape the sides of the dough back into a circle. If desired, use the remaining ¼ cup of M&M candies and press some on top, so they pop out of the surface.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Arrange dough balls at least 2" apart on lined baking sheets, 8 portions per tray. Smaller baking sheets can be used but will require baking in 3 batches. The dough should be room temperature or just below for even cooking, around 65 to 70°F (18 to 21°C).

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Bake one tray at a time in the center position for 5 minutes, then rotate the baking sheet. Continue to bake until the edges are golden brown and the centers look slightly underdone, about 5 to 7 minutes. The color will continue to darken during cooling.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Leave the cookies on the baking sheet to cool for 3 to 5 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack. Make sure the oven returns to 375°F (191°C) before baking the remaining tray.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.jessicagavin.com/m-and-m-cookies/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2022/06/14/best-mm-cookie-bake-off/

docs.title: Magic Cookie Bars
docs.text: Total Time 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups graham cracker crumbs
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
  • 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
  • 1.33 cups flaked coconut
  • 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9x13-inch baking dish
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). If using a glass dish, preheat the oven to 325°F (165°C). Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix graham cracker crumbs and unsalted butter in a bowl until well combined. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press onto the bottom.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour sweetened condensed milk on graham cracker crust. Sprinkle with an even layer of semisweet chocolate chips, flaked coconut, and chopped nuts (optional). Press toppings down firmly with the back of a fork.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 25 minutes. Cool completely, then cut into 36 bars or diamonds.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/63959/magic-cookie-bars-from-eagle-brand/

docs.title: Meringues
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 36 4.50 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 large egg whites
  • 0.25 tsp cream of tartar
  • 1 dash salt
  • 98 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper or aluminum foil
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 200°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil, shiny side up.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, combine the egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt. Beat until soft peaks form, then gradually add the granulated sugar, continuing to beat until the mixture is stiff and glossy. Add the vanilla at the end.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Drop the meringue by large spoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet and sprinkle each meringue with a bit of sugar. Bake for 1.5 hours. Turn off the heat and leave the meringues in the oven until they're completely cool, 3 hours or more. These are good to make in the evening; they can be left in the oven, with the heat turned off, overnight. Store them in an airtight container to keep them crisp.

Cocoa meringues

Sift together 28 g confectioners' sugar and 2 Tbsp (11 g) unsweetened cocoa. Use 50 g granulated sugar while beating the egg whites and fold in the cocoa mixture and vanilla before baking.

Chocolate chip meringues

Fold in 84 g mini chocolate chips (or any other flavored chips you like) or shaved chocolate before baking.

Vermont maple meringues

Substitute the following for the sugar: 84 g granulated maple sugar, 1/2 to 1 tsp maple flavor (to taste) and additional maple sugar, for sprinkling.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • King Arthur

docs.title: Millionaire's Shortbread
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 2.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2.5 cups shortbread cookies
  • 0.25 cup (57 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.75 cup (160 g) dark brown sugar
  • 0.67 cup (151 g) unsalted butter
  • 1 14 oz can sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup (170 g) dark chocolate
  • 0.25 cup (43 g) white chocolate

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rolling pin
  • 1 freezer bag
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 square cake pan
  • 1 non-stick pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: With a rolling pin, crush the shortbread cookies in a freezer bag. Put the crushed cookies into a bowl with the melted butter. Mix them together, then using a spoon, press the mixture into the base of a lined, square cake pan. Chill in the fridge for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Gently heat the dark brown sugar and 2/3 cup of butter in a non-stick pan, stirring until melted.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the sweetened condensed milk, cinnamon, and vanilla, and bring to a boil, stirring continuously until the mixture has thickened slightly — on a high heat for about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the caramel over the base, then allow it to cool for at least 20 minutes. Once cooled, chill in the fridge or freeze until set — around 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Melt the dark chocolate and white chocolate in separate bowls. Put them in the microwave for 30-second bursts on high and keep stirring until melted.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour the dark chocolate over the caramel, then add spoonfuls of the melted white chocolate on top.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Using a spoon, swirl them together until you get a marbled effect. Put the pan back in the fridge to set for another 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: When set, slice into squares and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/853741/millionaires-shortbread-recipe/

docs.title: Mini Madeleines
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 100 cookies 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 115 g unsalted butter
  • 15 g brown sugar
  • 15 g honey
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 1 g salt
  • 120 g all-purpose flour
  • 4 g baking powder
  • 3 large eggs
  • 0.5 lemon
  • 0.5 orange
  • some confectioners’ sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium pot
  • 1 heatproof spatula
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 whisk
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 piping bag
  • 1 nonstick mini madeleine pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium pot, melt the unsalted butter, brown sugar, and honey over low heat. Stir gently with a heatproof spatula to ensure nothing burns. Keep the mixture warm over very low heat, or reheat if necessary.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
In a large bowl, combine the granulated sugar, salt, all-purpose flour, and baking powder and mix well with a whisk. Form a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the eggs one by one, whisking to incorporate each before adding the next.

Tip

Use room temperature eggs to avoid cooling down the batter. If the batter is too cold, the butter may congeal when you add it.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
When the eggs are fully incorporated and the batter is smooth, slowly whisk in the butter mixture. Whisk in the lemon and orange zests. The batter will still be runny and similar in consistency to cake batter. Cover with plastic wrap pressed directly onto the surface of the batter, to prevent a skin from forming. Refrigerate overnight to rest.

Tip

Many recipes containing baking powder do well to rest overnight. This helps with rising, which is especially important for the madeleine - a pastry that puffs up in the center when it bakes.

docs.title: Instructions - Day 2: Pipe, Bake, and Serve
Step 4
docs.text:
Place a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) for conventional or 350°F (175°C) for convection.

Tip

In general for baking pastries, set your oven to convection if the option is available. This allows the heat to flow more evenly. It’s an ideal setting because it helps pastries bake evenly on all sides.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Using a rubber spatula, place 2 large scoops of batter in a piping bag so that it is one-third full. Push the batter down toward the tip of the bag.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cut an opening about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm) straight across the tip of the bag.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Hold the nonstick cooking spray about 4 inches (10 cm) away from a nonstick mini madeleine pan and spray evenly in all the cavities.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Holding the piping bag at a 90° angle about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm) above the pan, pipe the madeleine batter into the cavities so that it fills each about three-quarters of the way to the top.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Place a rimmed sheet pan upside down on the oven rack then place the mold on top and bake the madeleines for about 2 to 2.5 minutes on the center rack.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
When you see the batter puff up in the center, rotate the mold 180°. Bake for 2 to 2.5 minutes more, until the sides of the madeleines are golden blonde and the center has set.

Tip

Baking the madeleines on an upside down sheet pan lifts the mold off the oven rack, so that the more intense heat in the bars of the rack does not transfer to the cakes in an uneven fashion. This also allows the heat of the oven to circulate around the mold more evenly, thus baking the madeleines more efficiently.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text:
Unmold immediately. Bang the corner or sides of the madeleine pan against your work surface so that the fresh madeleines drop out.

Tip

If you find that the madeleines stick to the mold, for the next batch, try spraying a bit more cooking spray. Keeping the mold clean and washing it thoroughly with a soft sponge after use will also prevent the madeleines from sticking.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Using a small sieve, sprinkle confectioners’ sugar evenly over the fresh-baked madeleines. Eat immediately (do not wait for more than even a few minutes!).

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Madeleines are good only when freshly baked. Do not attempt to store them. However, you can keep the batter in a closed airtight container, with plastic wrap pressed onto the surface, in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Dominique Ansel

docs.title: Molasses Spice Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 11 cookies 16 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup (99 g) granulated sugar
  • 1.33 cups (160 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.75 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.75 tsp ginger
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp cloves
  • 0.13 tsp allspice
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 cup (53 g) dark brown sugar
  • 6 Tbsp (85 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.25 cup (85 g) molasses
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 wide metal spatula
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 375°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Place 1/4 cup granulated sugar for rolling in small bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk all-purpose flour, cinnamon, ginger, baking soda, cloves, allspice, salt, and pepper in medium bowl until thoroughly combined. Combine dark brown sugar and remaining 1/4 cup granulated sugar in second medium bowl. Add unsalted butter and whisk until smooth. Add molasses, egg yolk, and vanilla and whisk until smooth. Add flour mixture and stir with rubber spatula until completely incorporated.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using tablespoon measure, scoop heaping tablespoon of dough and roll between your palms into 1.5 inch ball. Roll in sugar to coat and place on prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough, spacing dough balls about 2 inches apart. Bake until cookies are browned, still puffy, and edges have begun to set but centers are still soft (cookies will look raw between cracks and seem underdone), 9 to 11 minutes, rotating baking sheet halfway through baking.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Let cookies cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes. Use wide metal spatula to transfer cookies to wire rack. Let cookies cool completely before serving. (Cookies can be stored at room temperature in airtight container or zipper-lock plastic bag for up to 5 days.)

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup (226 g) unsalted butter
  • 1.25 cup (226 g) packed brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup (99 g) granulated sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 Tbsp milk
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1.75 cups (210 g) flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 2.5 cup (249 g) rolled oats
  • 2 cups (340) chocolate chips

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 365°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine butter, packed brown sugar, granulated sugar, eggs, milk, vanilla, all-purpose flour, baking soda, rolled oats, and chocolate chips and bake for 8 to 10 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Oatmeal Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 18 cookies 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 227 g unsalted butter
  • 173 g all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 portion pecan brittle
  • 200 g old-fashioned rolled oats
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 150 g dark brown sugar
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 2 eggs

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 sheet tray
  • 1 cooling rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the pecan brittle and pulverize.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Brown half of the unsalted butter. Add the brown butter the other half of the cold butter and wait until the butter is room temperature.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour salt baking soda, half of the pecan brittle, and 100 g (half) of old-fashioned rolled oats to food processor. Process until everything is very fine and broken down and no big pieces are left.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add vanilla extract, dark brown sugar, and granulated sugar to the butter in stand mixer. Add the cold eggs one egg at a time until the batter has emulsified a bit.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add mixed dry ingredients to wet ingredients.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the remaining oats and pecan brittle to the batter and mix.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Chill the dough for 24 hours.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Make 60 g portions of the cookie dough on a parchment lined sheet tray.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Bake the cookies for 16 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Cool on the sheet for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Move to a cooling rack to let the cookies completely cool.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gGBC4-CsXOM

docs.title: Oatmeal Cream Pies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 1 hour

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup (113 g) unsalted butter
  • 1 cup (213 g) light brown sugar
  • 1 Tbsp molasses
  • 1 egg
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.25 cup (150 g) all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 cup (50 g) old fashioned oats
  • 0.75 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Ingredeitns - Vanilla Cream Filling
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup (113 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.25 cup (46 g) vegetable shortening
  • 4 cups (454 g) confectioners' sugar
  • 3 Tbsp heavy cream
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 2 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cookie sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 piping bag
  • 1 round tip

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a stand mixer fit the paddle attachment, combine the butter, light brown sugar, and molasses. Beat until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Use a rubber spatula to scrape the sides of the bowl and add the egg and the vanilla extract. Mix well.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a separate bowl stir together the all-purpose flour, old fashioned oats, baking soda, and salt.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the dry ingredients to the wet and mix until just combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Use 1 Tablespoon measure of a .5 ounce cookie scoop to scoop the dough out onto your cookie sheet 2 inches apart.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake 10 minutes or until the edges of the cookies are set and the centers have puffed up but are still underdone. Transfer the cookies to a wire rack. Allow the cookies to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: While the cookies cool, make the creme filling. Combine 1/2 cup unsalted butter, room temperature, 1/4 cup vegetable shortening, 4 cups powdered sugar, 2 – 3 Tablespoons heavy cream, pinch of salt, and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract in a stand mixer fit with the whisk attachment and beat on slow, gradually increasing to high until light and fluffy. Transfer to a piping bag fit with a round tip.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Pipe the creme filling onto the backside of one of the cookies and sandwich together with another cookie.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Store in an airtight container or Ziploc bag for up to 7 days! Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://bromabakery.com/homemade-oatmeal-creme-pies/

docs.title: Oatmeal Raisin
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 dozen 14 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3.75 cups (450 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 Tbsp baking powder
  • 1.5 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 34 Tbsp (391 g) vegetable shortening
  • 1.75 (373 g) brown sugar
  • 1.5 cups (297 g) granulated sugar
  • 3 eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 4 cups (396 g) oats
  • 2.5 cups (373 g) raisins

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Blend all-purpose flour, baking powder, ground cinnamon, salt, and baking soda in a mixing bowl. Set aside until needed.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend vegetable shortening, brown sugar, sugar, eggs, and vanilla in mixing bowl until fluffy.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix in reserved dry ingredients until well blended, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Blend in oats and raisins.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place 2.5 Tbsp dough on baking sheet and press down until about 1/4 inch thick and about 3 inches across.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 9 to 12 minutes. Cook on baking sheet.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Orange Sparkle Slice-and-Bake Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 dozen 2.55 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 75 g candied orange peel
  • some hot water
  • 132 g granulated sugar
  • 76 g confectioners' sugar
  • 0.25 tsp orange citrus oil
  • 1.75 tsp table salt
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp Fiori di Sicilia
  • 255 g unsalted butter
  • 1 large egg
  • 390 g all-purpose flour
  • 113 g sparkling sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 Slice-and-Bake Cookie Dough Keeper
  • 1 baking sheets

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place candied orange peel in a small bowl and cover with hot water. Cover and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: For the dough: Beat together the granulated sugar, confectioners' sugar, orange citrus oil, table salt, and vanilla and Fiori di Sicilia until fragrant, about 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add unsalted butter and beat on medium-low speed until smooth, 3 to 4 minutes. Scrape the bowl, add egg, and beat until combined, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Strain the orange peel and press gently to remove any excess moisture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour and orange peel, and beat on low speed until combined, about 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Transfer dough to a clean work surface and divide in half (about 500 g per piece). Shape each half into an 11" log.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: For the topping: Spread the sparkling sugar across the middle of a piece of parchment, then roll each log in the sugar to completely coat.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Transfer each log into the bottom of a Slice-and-Bake Cookie Dough Keeper. Cover with the lid and refrigerate until very firm, 1 to 2 hours.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Take one log of dough out of the refrigerator, remove from Dough Keeper, and slice into ¼"-thick rounds. Rotate the log about 90° every few slices to maintain a neat circular shape.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Transfer slices to 2 parchment-lined baking sheets, placing the cookies about 2" apart.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Bake for 14 to 18 minutes, until edges are golden brown. Let cookies cool on the pan for about 10 minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool completely before serving. Repeat with remaining dough.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • King Arthur

docs.title: Oreos
docs.text: Total Time 51 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Biscuit
docs.text:
• 225 g butter
  • 50 g muscavado sugar
  • 150 g caster sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 250 g all-purpose flour
  • 150 g cocoa powder
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 160 g butter
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 250 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1.5 Tbsp whole milk
  • 0.25 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a stand mixer, cream together butter, muscavado sugar, and caster sugar until it is light and fluffy.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Beat in 1 large egg.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour, cocoa powder, salt, and baking soda and bring together.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Roll dough with a rolling pin to 3 mm (1/8 inch) thick in two stages with an unfloured rolling pin and between two sheets of parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Refrigerate the rolled dough for at least 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Use a 4 cm (1.5 inch) cookie cutter to cut out cookies and place on baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Bake at 375°F for 14 to 16 minutes.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Cream butter and salt for 3 to 5 minutes until it is nice and pale.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Add confectioners' sugar in two stages and keep mixing until it is nice and pale.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Add whole milk and vanilla and beat until nice and pale.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Pipe buttercream in between two biscuits with the flat sides in the middle.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Refrigerate for a little bit so the buttercream firms up.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yb59UR2mUNg

docs.title: Peach Bars
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 bars 2.27 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust
docs.text:
• 163 g all-purpose flour
  • 8 g granulated sugar
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 113 g unsalted butter
  • 60 g ice water

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 680 g ripe peaches
  • 2 tsp cornstarch
  • 62.5 g demerara sugar
  • 🫚 1/2 tsp ground ginger
  • 1/4 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1/8 tsp ground nutmeg
  • 1/4 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt
  • 1 Tbsp fresh lemon juice
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract

docs.title: Ingredients - Crumble Topping
docs.text:
• 87 g all-purpose flour
  • 60 g old-fashioned rolled oats
  • 43 g demerara sugar
  • 1 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt
  • 93 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch square baking pan
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 fork
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F. Line a 9-inch square baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on the sides to easily lift the bars out of the pan. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix dough ingredients per instructions and chill. Roll out the pie dough on a baking sheet and cut off the edges using a knife. Then chill the prepared sheet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Score peaches along meridian into 4 quadrants using a knife.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Blanch peaches in boiling water for a few minutes until the skin starts to peel off and place them into a bath of ice water.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Peel the peaches and cut them into bite sized pieces.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the demerara sugar, ground ginger, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, Diamond Crystal kosher salt, fresh lemon juice and vanilla extract to the peaches in a large bowl and let it sit.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add the all-purpose flour, old-fashioned rolled oats, demerara sugar, ground cinnamon, Diamond Crystal kosher salt, and unsalted butter to a bowl and mix together with your hands until there are no discrete pieces of butter left and there aren't any flowery bits.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Place the cornstarch in a small bowl and set aside, within reach of the stove.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Strain the peach juice into a saucepan and cook, stirring occasionally, until the juice begins thicken, about 4 to 6 minutes. While the peach juice continues to cook, carefully remove a couple of spoonfuls of the juice from the saucepan and add to the bowl of cornstarch. Using a fork, mix the cornstarch and peach juice together until the cornstarch is dissolved. Stir this mixture into the juice, then bring to a boil and cook, stirring occasionally, until the filling has thickened, about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. An ice bath may be used to cool the pan.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Pour/spread the filling over the crust dough. Sprinkle it all over the filling, and lightly press it down with the back of a large spoon or flat spatula.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Bake for about 20 minutes at 425°F then turn down the oven to 350°F and bake for another 25 to 40 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a toothpick comes out mostly clean (with a few jammy peach specks!).

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Remove from the oven and allow the bars to cool completely in the pan set on a wire rack. After about 1 hour, you can place the whole pan in the refrigerator to help speed things up.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Lift the bars out of the pan using the edges of the parchment paper lining and place the whole thing on a cutting board. Slice squares with a sharp knife and, for neat squares, wipe the knife clean between each cut.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Cover and store leftover peach pie bars (with or without icing) at room temperature for up to 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T1YQBxY-bv4

docs.title: Peanut Butter Bars with Salted Chocolate Ganache
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 46 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 1.5 cups graham cracker crumbs
  • 1 cup creamy peanut butter
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 8 Tbsp melted butter
  • 8 oz semisweet baking chocolate
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 tsp flaky sea salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8 x 8-inch baking dish
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 small saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Coat the bottom and sides of an 8 x 8-inch baking dish with nonstick spray.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, stir to combine the confectioners' sugar, graham cracker crumbs, creamy peanut butter, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and melted butter. Press the mixture into the prepared baking dish and set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place the semisweet baking chocolate and 1/8 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl. Heat the heavy cream in a small saucepan until bubbles start to form around the edges. Pour the cream over the chocolate, let sit for 1 minute and then whisk until completely melted and smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the ganache over the peanut butter mixture and refrigerate until the chocolate is cooled and set, at least 45 minutes and up to overnight.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Sprinkle evenly with the flaky sea salt. Cut into squares to serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/nancy-fuller/peanut-butter-bars-with-salted-chocolate-ganache-3287824

docs.title: Peanut Butter Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 8 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 260 g bread flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp baking powder
  • 1.25 tsp salt
  • 168 g unsalted butter
  • 50 g granulated sugar
  • 250 g light brown sugar
  • 49 g vegetable oil
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 1 egg
  • 2 egg yolks
  • 202 g creamy peanut butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium-large bowl
  • 1 whisk
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 plastic wrap

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine the bread flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a medium-large bowl and whisk to fully incorporate the ingredients. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer, fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the unsalted butter, granulated sugar and light brown sugar on medium to medium high speed until fully incorporated and lightened in color, about 3 to 5 minutes, scraping the bowl, as needed.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the vegetable oil and vanilla and beat until incorporated, another 1 or 2 minutes, again, scraping as needed. On low speed, add the egg and egg yolks all at once and mix until just combined, scraping as needed. Add the creamy peanut butter and mix until just combined, again.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: With the mixer still on low, add the dry ingredients all at once, and mix until only some of the flour is incorporated into the wet batter (less than 1 minute). Turn off the machine and continue mixing by hand with a rubber spatula.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Scoop the dough into 60 g balls and place the scooped dough on a parchment lined baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 to 48 hours (or even 72).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: When you are ready to bake your cookies, preheat the oven to 375°F. Roll your scooped dough in granulated sugar, and sprinkle the tops with Maldon sea salt. Place the cookies on a parchment-lined cookie sheet and bake the cookies for exactly 12 minutes, rotating after 6.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Place the cookie sheet on a cooling rack and lightly press each cookie with a spatula to flatten. let cool and enjoy. Cookies will keep at room temp tightly covered for up to 3 days or up to a month frozen.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.jessiesheehanbakes.com/2015/02/10/salty-milk-chocolate-peanut-butter-cookies/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2020/06/30/best-peanut-butter-cookie-bake-off/

docs.title: Peanut Butter Crisscrosses
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup vegetable shortening
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup peanut butter (smooth supermarket style, not natural)
  • 3 cups flour
  • 2 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, beat together the vegetable shortening, granulated sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla, and peanut butter (smooth supermarket style, not natural). Sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt and add to the peanut butter mixture, stirring to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Drop cookies by spoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet and press down with a fork, making a crisscross design. Bake cookies for 10 minutes, or until lightly browned. Remove from the oven and cool on a rack.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The King Arthur Baking Company All-Purpose Baker's Companion

docs.title: Peanut Butter Sandwich Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 3.5 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cookies
docs.text:
• 1.25 cups (6.25 oz/177 g) raw peanuts
  • 0.75 cups (3.75 oz/106 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup creamy peanut butter
  • 0.5 cup (3.5 oz/99 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup (3.5 oz/99 g) light brown sugar
  • 3 Tbsp whole milk
  • 1 large egg

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup creamy peanut butter
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 cup (4 oz/113 g) confectioners’ sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheets
  • 1 food processor
  • 2 bowls
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 number 60 scoop or tablespoon measure
  • 1 prepared baking sheet
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Instructions - Cookies
docs.text:
Note

Do not use unsalted peanut butter for this recipe.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven racks to upper-middle and lower-middle positions and heat oven to 350°F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Pulse raw peanuts in food processor until finely chopped, about 8 pulses. Whisk all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt together in bowl. Whisk 3 Tbsp of unsalted butter, 1/2 cup of creamy peanut butter, granulated sugar, light brown sugar, whole milk, and egg together in second bowl. Stir flour mixture into peanut butter mixture with rubber spatula until combined. Stir in peanuts until evenly distributed.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Using number 60 scoop or tablespoon measure (20 g), place 12 mounds, evenly spaced, on each prepared baking sheet. Using damp hand, flatten mounds until 2 inches in diameter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake until deep golden brown and firm to touch, 13 to 18 minutes, switching and rotating sheets halfway through baking. Let cookies cool on sheets for 5 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire rack and let cool completely, about 30 minutes. Repeat portioning and baking remaining dough.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Microwave 3/4 cup creamy peanut butter and 3 Tbsp of unsalted butter until butter is melted and warm, about 40 seconds. Using rubber spatula, stir in confectioners’ sugar until combined.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place 24 cookies upside down on work surface. Place 1 level tablespoon (20 g) (or number 60 scoop) warm filling in center of each cookie. Place second cookie on top of filling, right side up, pressing gently until filling spreads to edges. Allow filling to set for 1 hour before serving. Assembled cookies can be stored in airtight container for up to 3 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.cooksillustrated.com/recipes/6908-peanut-butter-sandwich-cookies

docs.title: Peanut Butter Stuffed Brownies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 dozen 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 336 g creamy conventional peanut butter
  • 1 dozen fudge brownie

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 heat-safe bowl
  • 1 8 inch square pan
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place the creamy conventional peanut butter in a heat-safe bowl and microwave for 20 to 30 seconds, or until pourable but not super hot.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Line a metal 8 inch square pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang. Spread the peanut butter into an even layer in the pan. Freeze for 1 hour or until solidified. Use the parchment to remove from pan and return peanut butter sheet to freezer. Keep frozen while making the brownie batter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Make the fudge brownie batter.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour half of the batter into prepared pan and smooth out. Carefully place the frozen peanut butter sheet over the batter.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour remaining batter on top, covering completely.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake and cool according to instructions.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://handletheheat.com/peanut-butter-stuffed-brownies/

docs.title: Persian Chickpea Cookies with Pistachio
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 30 cookies 2.65 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup vegetable oil
  • 0.75 cup (85 g) confectioners' sugar
  • 1 tsp ground cardamom
  • 0.5 Tbsp rose water
  • 149 g chickpea flour
  • 3 Tbsp pistachios

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 hand mixer
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 baking tray
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 1 inch clover shaped cookie cutter
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine the vegetable oil, confectioners' sugar, ground cardamom and rose water in bowl. Using a hand mixer, mix on medium for 2 to 3 minutes until light and creamy.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sift chickpea flour into the bowl and beat on low for 1 minute until the dough is no longer sticky.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Dust your work surface with some chickpea flour and knead the dough for 10 minutes until it is more workable. The dough is very crumbly.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Wrap tightly in plastic wrap and set aside for 2 hours. Do not refrigerate.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Preheat oven to 300°F and line baking tray with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Roll out the dough on a dusted work surface until it is 3/4 inch thick. Cut out cookies using a 1 inch clover shaped cookie cutter and place the cookies on the baking tray, spaced 1 inch apart. Reroll and repeat until all the dough is used up.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Sprinkle chopped pistachios on top of each cookie.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Place cooking tray in middle rack and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until the cookies turn a light golden color.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Remove cookies from oven and let it cool on tray for 5 minutes. Then carefully transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Be careful when you transfer the cookies as they crumble very easily.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.aheadofthyme.com/2017/03/nan-e-nokhodchi-persian-chickpea-cookies/

docs.title: Preposterously Peanut Butter Cup Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups sugar
  • 2 cups peanut butter
  • 2 cups sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 2 tsp baking soda
  • 2 tsp bourbon vanilla
  • 16 TJ's Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 2 baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside. Pour a bit of sugar on a shallow plate for rolling cookies, set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, mix peanut butter, sugar, eggs, baking soda, and vanilla until combined. Take a large scoop of cookie dough, place peanut butter cup in the center and pat dough closed around the cup to form a dough ball. Roll dough ball in sugar and place on prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients until you have 8 dough balls per baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake sheets, one at a time, on center rack of oven for about 13 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring cookies to cooling racks. Cookies are best enjoyed warm!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/preposterously-peanut-butter-cup-cookies

docs.title: Pumpkin Cheesecake Cookies
docs.text: Total Time 26 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 oz cold cream cheese
  • 3 Tbsp sugar
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 0.25 cup sugar
  • 0.5 tsp pumpkin pie spice
  • 0.5 cup pumpkin purée
  • 1.75 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 Tbsp pumpkin pie spice
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.75 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 cup light brown sugar
  • 2 egg yolks
  • 2 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 plate
  • 1 paper towels
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a baking sheet with {}parchment paper or a nonstick baking mat{}. (This reusable silicone baking mat is our editors’ go-to.) Combine the cold cream cheese, sugar and vanilla in a bowl. Mix on medium-high speed with an electric mixer until fluffy. Scoop the filling into 16 2 teaspoon sized portions. Transfer the baking sheet to the freezer. Leave the cheesecake balls in the freezer until frozen and very firm.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk the sugar and pumpkin pie spice together in a small bowl. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spread the pumpkin purée on a plate. Place paper towels on top and lightly press down to absorb the liquid in the pumpkin. Repeat this step four times to reduce the pumpkin down from 1/2 cup to about 1/4 cup, removing the extra liquid. This will ensure the cookies bake properly without being cakey.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper. Whisk together the all-purpose flour, pumpkin pie spice, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, cream the unsalted butter and light brown sugar with an electric mixer on high speed until fluffy, about 2 minutes. Mix in the egg yolks and vanilla extract until pale and fluffy, about 1 minute. Mix in the pumpkin.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Mix in the dry ingredients mixture on low speed until combined.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Using a 2 tablespoon sized cookie scoop, portion and roll the dough into 16 balls. Slightly flatten each ball and place a frozen cheesecake ball in the center. Close the cheesecake ball within the cookie dough, making sure it’s completely covered. Roll it into a ball again. Only remove the cheesecake balls from the freezer once they’re ready to be used for each batch of cookies. Roll each filled ball of cookie dough in pumpkin spice sugar.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text:
Place each prepared cookie dough ball on the lined baking sheet. Bake 6 cookies at a time for 12 to 13 minutes. Once baked, remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool for 10 minutes on the cookie sheet before transferring them to a wire rack to finish cooling completely.

Note

Properly creaming the butter and sugar is a crucial step to making great cookies with the perfect texture. Don’t just mix until combined. Mix the butter and sugar for at least two minutes until it’s pale and fluffy for the best results.

Note

Typically, pumpkin cookies come out very fluffy and cakey due to the moisture content of the pumpkin puree. The key to making these chewy pumpkin cookies is to reduce the amount of liquid in the pumpkin by patting it with paper towels.

Note

The cheesecake balls used to fill the cookies should be made before the cookie dough. Place them on a baking sheet and leave them in the freezer until frozen and firm. This is a crucial step to make sure the cheesecake filling doesn’t leak out of the cookies while baking.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Taste of Home

docs.title: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 30 13 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 250 g all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.75 tsp baking soda
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.5 tsp ginger
  • 0.13 tsp cloves
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 110 g light brown sugar
  • 99 g vegetable oil
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 240 g pumpkin purée
  • 255 g mini semisweet chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheets
  • 1 silicone baking mats or parchment paper
  • 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 electric stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line baking sheets with silicone baking mats or parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a mixing bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves and salt for 20 seconds, set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, blend together granulated sugar, light brown sugar and vegetable oil until combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Mix in egg and vanilla then blend in pumpkin purée.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: With mixer on low speed, slowly add in flour mixture and mix just until nearly combined, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed (batter will be pretty wet).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: With a rubber spatula, fold in mini semisweet chocolate chips while folding batter to evenly combined.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Drop dough 2 Tbsp (40 g) (either using a medium cookie dough scoop or using two spoons) at a time onto baking sheets lined with silicone liners or parchment paper, spacing cookies two inches apart.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Bake in preheated oven until cookies are nearly set about 11 - 13 minutes.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Allow to cool several minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
Store in a single layer in an airtight container (these are best once they've rested in an airtight container a few hours, they soften throughout).

Note

Substitute 2 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice for the spices listed here if that's what you've got. Or feel free to increase spices listed, I usually like to add 2 tsp cinnamon now.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.cookingclassy.com/pumpkin-chocolate-chip-cookies/

docs.title: Pumpkin Cookies with Cream Cheese Frosting
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 dozen 38 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cookies
docs.text:
• 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 0.67 cup brown sugar
  • 0.33 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup pumpkin purée
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • 4 oz cream cheese, softened
  • 2 cups confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large bowl
