docs.text: Combine almost the entire can of sweetened condensed milk (leave about 2 tablespoons in the can) with sweetened coconut. Stir to combine. Add in vanilla and stir to combine. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Next, in a separate bowl combine egg whites and salt and beat until soft peaks form.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Gently fold egg whites into coconut mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Then scoop or spoon mixture, about two tablespoons, onto baking sheets that are covered with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Finally, bake for approximately 25 minutes or until starting to turn golden brown. Remove from oven, then immediately remove cookies from baking sheet and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.lovefromtheoven.com/macaroons/

docs.title: Cooks Illustrated Lemon Bars
docs.text: Total Time 2.23 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust
docs.text:
• 120 g all-purpose flour
  • 50 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 113 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 198 g granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp cream of tartar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 large eggs
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.67 cup lemon juice
  • 4 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • some confectioners' sugar (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 foil
  • 1 8 inch square baking pan
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 fine-mesh strainer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text:
Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 350°F. Make foil sling for 8 inch square baking pan by folding 2 long sheets of aluminum foil so each is 8 inches wide. Lay sheets of foil in pan perpendicular to each other, with extra foil hanging over edges of pan. Push foil into corners and up sides of pan, smoothing foil flush to pan.

Note

Do not use an aluminum pan because the acid from the lemon juice can react with the aluminum, leaving a metallic taste.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, and salt together in bowl. Add melted unsalted butter and stir until combined. Transfer mixture to prepared pan and press into even layer over entire bottom of pan (do not wash bowl). Bake crust until dark golden brown, 19 to 24 minutes, rotating pan halfway through baking.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Massage the granulated sugar with the lemon zest until fragrant.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While crust bakes, whisk granulated sugar and lemon zest mixture, all-purpose flour, cream of tartar, and salt together in now-empty bowl. Whisk in eggs and egg yolks until no streaks of egg remain. Whisk in lemon juice (4 lemons). Transfer mixture to saucepan and cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and registers 160°F, about 5 to 8 minutes. Off heat, stir in unsalted butter cut into 8 pieces. Strain filling through fine-mesh strainer set over bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour filling over hot crust and tilt pan to spread evenly. Bake until filling is set and barely jiggles when pan is shaken, 8 to 12 minutes. (Filling around perimeter of pan may be slightly raised.) Let bars cool completely, at least 1.5 hours. Using foil overhang, lift bars out of pan and transfer to cutting board. Cut into bars, wiping knife clean between cuts as necessary. Before serving, dust bars with confectioners' sugar (optional), if using.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• Cook's Illustrated
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-lemon-bar-bake-off/

docs.title: Crème Brûlée
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 3.30 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 cups heavy cream
  • 0.75 cup sugar
  • 1 vanilla bean
  • 7 large egg yolks
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 kettle or pot
  • 1 5-ounce baking dishes
  • 1 large roasting pan
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 ladle
  • 1 fine sieve
  • 1 large liquid measuring cup
  • 1 tongs
  • 1 plastic wrap

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat oven to 300°F. Bring a kettle or pot of water to a boil. Place eight 5-ounce baking dishes in a large roasting pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, combine heavy cream and half the sugar (1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons). Scrape vanilla bean seeds into pan, then add pod. Heat over medium just until mixture starts to bubble around the edge of the pan, 7 to 8 minutes (do not let boil).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, whisk egg yolks: In a large mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks with remaining sugar and the salt.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Use ladle to pour a small amount of the hot cream mixture into the egg mixture, then whisk to combine. (This is called tempering and prevents the eggs from curdling.) Add two more ladles of cream mixture, one at a time, whisking to combine after each addition. Gradually whisk in remaining cream mixture. Strain through a fine sieve into a large liquid measuring cup (to remove the vanilla pod and any cooked bits of egg).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Divide custard evenly among baking dishes. Place pan in oven. Add enough boiling water to come halfway up the sides of the dishes. Bake until custards are just set (they should tremble slightly in center when shaken), 30 to 40 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove pan from oven. Use tongs to carefully remove dishes from hot-water bath and place on a wire rack for 30 minutes. Then, cover with plastic wrap and chill for at least 2 hours (or up to 3 days) before serving. The custard will finish setting in the refrigerator. If you like, transfer the custards to the freezer 15 minutes before serving to ensure they stay cold after being brûléed (this is especially important if using the broiler).

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Sprinkle about 1.5 tablespoons granulated sugar over each custard. Working with one at a time, pass the flame of the torch in a circular motion 1 to 2 inches above the surface of each custard until the sugar bubbles, turns amber, and forms a smooth surface. Serve immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.marthastewart.com/339077/creme-brulee

docs.title: Crêpes Suzette
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Crêpes
docs.text:
• 2 large eggs
  • 0.75 cup all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 cup milk
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp sugar
  • 0.33 cup cold water
  • 1 Tbsp canola oil
  • 1 Tbsp butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Orange Butter
docs.text:
• 6 Tbsp butter
  • 6 Tbsp sugar
  • 1 Tbsp orange zest
  • 0.33 cup orange juice
  • 0.25 cup Grand Marnier
  • 2 Tbsp cognac

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 6-inch crêpe pan or nonstick skillet
  • 1 mini food processor
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 long spatula
  • 1 heatproof platter
  • 1 small saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, all-purpose flour, milk, salt and sugar until smooth; the batter will be thick. Whisk in the cold water, canola oil and melted butter.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat a 6-inch crêpe pan or nonstick skillet and rub with a little butter. Add 2 tablespoons of the batter and tilt the skillet to distribute the batter evenly, pouring any excess batter back into the bowl. Cook over moderately high heat until the edges of the crêpe curl up and start to brown, 45 seconds. Flip the crêpe and cook for 10 seconds longer, until a few brown spots appear on the bottom. Tap the crêpe out onto a baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining batter to make 12 crêpes, buttering the skillet a few times as necessary.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a mini food processor, blend the 6 tablespoons of butter with 1/4 cup of the sugar and the orange zest. With the machine on, gradually add the orange juice until incorporated.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Preheat the broiler. Butter a large rimmed baking sheet and sprinkle lightly with sugar. Place 2 rounded teaspoons of the orange butter in the center of each crêpe. Fold the crêpes in half and in half again to form triangles; arrange on the prepared baking sheet, pointing them in the same direction and overlapping slightly. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar and broil on the middle shelf of the oven until they begin to caramelize, about 2 minutes. Using a long spatula, transfer the crêpes to a heatproof platter.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat the Grand Marnier and cognac. Ignite carefully with a long-handled match and pour the flaming mixture over the crêpes. Tilt the platter and, with a spoon, carefully baste the crêpes until the flames subside. Serve right away.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.foodandwine.com/recipes/crepes-suzette

docs.title: Disney's Churros
docs.text: Total Time 7 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup water
  • 8 Tbsp butter
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon
  • 1.25 cups flour
  • 3 eggs
  • 1.5 cups vegetable oil
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • some dipping sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 1.5 quart saucepan
  • 1 medium skillet
  • 1 piping bag
  • 1 large star tip
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 knife
  • 1 slotted spoon
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 serving plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine water, butter, salt, and cinnamon in a 1.5 quart saucepan over medium heat. Bring pot to rolling boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Reduce heat to low.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add flour and stir vigorously until mix forms a ball. Remove from heat and let rest for 5 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add eggs one at a time, and stir until combined. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Heat vegetable oil in medium skillet or 1-quart saucepan over medium-high heat or until temperature reaches 350°F.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Spoon dough into piping bag fitted with large star tip. Pipe 1-inch strip of dough over saucepan, cut with knife, and drop into hot oil. Repeat until churro fills saucepan with room to fry.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Fry churro until golden brown. Remove with slotted spoon or mesh spider strainer.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Drain churros on paper towel.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Mix sugar and 1/2 tsp cinnamon in medium bowl. Toss in churros until coated. Place on serving plate and serve with favorite dipping sauce.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.disneyfoodblog.com/2020/04/05/disney-recipe-make-disneys-churros-at-home-with-this-recipe/

docs.title: Disney's Frozen Pineapple Treat
docs.text:
Total Time 0 minutes

Note

This is not the same Dole Whip served in Disney parks. See this link for the official recipe.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 scoop vanilla ice scream
  • 4 oz pineapple juice
  • 2 cups frozen pineapple

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add vanilla ice scream, pineapple juice, and frozen pineapple to a blender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Make a swirl using a piping bag or plastic sandwich bag.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.disneyfoodblog.com/2020/04/08/foodies-theres-a-brand-new-step-by-step-cooking-at-home-feature-on-the-disney-world-app/

docs.title: English Toffee
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.5 lbs 28 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 cups sugar
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 stick unsalted butter
  • 0.13 tsp cream of tartar
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 Tbsp dark rum (alternative)
  • 4 oz bittersweet, semi-sweet, or milk chocolate
  • 0.5 cup almonds

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 13 x 9 inch pan
  • 1 silicone liner or heavy-duty aluminum foil
  • 1 large heavy saucepan
  • 1 pastry brush
  • 1 wooden spoon
  • 1 offset spatula
  • 1 wax paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a 13 x 9 inch pan with a silicone liner or heavy-duty aluminum foil, leaving a 2 inch overhang of foil at the two narrow ends of the pan. Coat the foil with nonstick spray.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine in a large heavy saucepan sugar, heavy cream, unsalted butter, and cream of tartar.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir over low heat until the sugar is dissolved. Wash down the sides of the pan with a pastry brush dipped in warm water. Bring to a boil and boil for 3 minutes. Place a warmed candy thermometer in a pan and cook, stirring frequently, to about 280°F, the soft-crack stage. The syrup will be light-colored and thick.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove from the heat and stir with a wooden spoon vanilla or dark rum (alternative).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour the candy into the prepared pan and cool 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Sprinkle the hot toffee with finely chopped or grated bittersweet, semi-sweet, or milk chocolate.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Let stand for 1 to 2 minutes, then spread the chocolate evenly across the toffee with a small offset spatula.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Sprinkle on top finely chopped toasted almonds.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Refrigerate the toffee for 20 minutes to set the chocolate. Break the toffee into pieces. Store between layers of wax paper in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 month.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Fruit Galette
docs.text: Total Time 3.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 165 g all-purpose flour
  • 15 g granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 large egg
  • some heavy cream
  • 113 g unsalted butter
  • 2 tsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 tsp lemon zest (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 3 cups summer fruit
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 0.5 lemon
  • 4 Tbsp cornstarch

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 measuring cup
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a food processor fitted with a steel blade, or in a large bowl, pulse or mix together all-purpose flour, granulated sugar and salt. In a measuring cup, lightly beat the egg, then add just enough heavy cream to get to l Lightly whisk the egg and cream together.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add unsalted butter to flour mixture and pulse or use a pastry cutter or your fingers to break up the butter. If using a food processor, do not over process; you need chickpea size chunks of butter. Drizzle the egg mixture (up to 1/4 cup) over the dough and pulse or stir until it just starts to come together but is still mostly large crumbs. Mix in lemon juice and lemon zest (optional) if using.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Put dough on lightly floured counter and pat it together to make one uniform piece. Flatten into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap and chill for 2 hours, or up to 3 days.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat the oven to 400°F. Roll the dough out to a 12 inch round (it can be ragged). Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment paper and chill while preparing the filling.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Toss together summer fruit, 100 go to 150 g but a tablespoon of granulated sugar, the salt, the lemon juice and zest, and the 3 to 4 Tbsp of cornstarch. Use more cornstarch for juicy stone fruit and less for blueberries, raspberries and figs. Pile fruit on the dough circle, leaving a 12 inch border. Gently fold the pastry over the fruit, pleating to hold it in (sloppy is fine). Brush pastry generously with leftover egg and cream mixture. Sprinkle remaining sugar on the crust.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until the filling bubbles up vigorously and the crust is golden. Cool for at least 20 minutes on wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1016758-fruit-galette

docs.title: Fruit Sorbet
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 300 g confectioners' sugar
  • 300 g water
  • some mint
  • 500 g strawberries
  • 0.5 lime juice
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 egg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 sauce pan
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make a simple syrup by combining equal amounts of confectioners' sugar and water in sauce pan. Bring the mixture to a boil until the sugar is dissolved.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour mixture into a container with a few leaves of mint and let cool.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add strawberries to a blender with a lime juice of half a lime and blend.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the puree through a strainer to remove the pulp.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add vanilla to the puree.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove the mint leaves from simple syrup.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add the simple syrup to the puree a little at a time.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add a clean uncooked egg to the mixture and keep adding the simple syrup until the egg floats and the exposed part of the egg is about the size of a quarter.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Make the sorbet the same way as making ice cream using a food processor.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2rcf0MzBjy0

docs.title: Gordon Ramsay's Chocolate Soufflé
docs.text: Total Time 27 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Dishes
docs.text:
• 25 g softened butter
  • some grated chocolate

docs.title: Ingredients - Crème Pâtissière
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp sugar
  • 0.5 tsp cornflour
  • 1 medium egg yolk
  • 1 medium whole egg
  • 4 Tbsp whole milk
  • 1 Tbsp heavy cream
  • 25 g 70 percent chocolate

docs.title: Ingredients - Meringue
docs.text:
• 6 medium egg whites
  • 85 g granulated sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - Ganache
docs.text:
• 4 Tbsp heavy cream
  • 50 g 70 percent chocolate
  • 1 Tbsp cocoa powder

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 200 ml soufflé dishes
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 pan
  • 1 wire whisk
  • 1 electric whisk
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 palette knife

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Take four 200 ml soufflé dishes and brush them completely with softened butter. Chill the dishes for 5 minutes, then, as an insurance policy so the soufflé doesn’t stick to the dish, apply a second coat as before.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Tip a little grated chocolate into each dish, roll the dish around tilting it as you do so it is evenly lined all round.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: For the crème patisserie, mix the all-purpose flour, sugar and cornflour Put egg yolk and whole egg into a bowl, stir, then beat in half of the flour mixture to give a smooth paste. Tip in the rest of the flour mixture and mix well.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the whole milk and heavy cream into a pan and bring just to the boil. Remove from the heat. Add the 70 percent chocolate and beat until it is melted and smooth with no lumps.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Gradually stir hot chocolate mix into paste.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Return to pan. Cook, stirring, over a medium-low heat for 5 minutes to a smooth, thick paste. Remove from the heat. Leave until cold, beating occasionally with a wire whisk.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Slowly warm the heavy cream in a pan.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Just before it boils, take off the heat and add 70 percent chocolate.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Beat constantly to a velvety texture, gradually sprinkling in the cocoa powder as it dissolves. Allow to cool.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Heat oven to 190°C (375°F) / fan 170°C / gas 5.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Whisk the egg whites to soft peaks with an electric whisk.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Sprinkle in the sugar as you are mixing.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Keep whisking to give stiff, firm peaks to give volume to the soufflés.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Mix crème patisserie and ganache in a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Stir in 2 Tbsp of egg white. Carefully fold in a third of the rest, cutting through the mixture.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Fold in another third (take care not to lose the volume); fold in the rest.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Spoon the mixture into the dishes to fill them by three-quarters, then gently press a spoon in to make sure it fills all the gaps. Fill the dishes to the top with the mixture, then bang each dish on to the surface so the mixture fills the sides.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Take a palette knife and pull it across the top of each dish so the mixture is completely flat.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Take a little time to wipe any splashes off the outside of each dish, or they will burn on while cooking.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: So mixture won’t stick to the top of the mold, and to give a straight finish, go around the top edge of the mixture with your finger. Sprinkle a little grated chocolate in the center, then bake the soufflés for 15 to 17 minutes.

docs.title: Step 21
docs.text: The soufflés should have risen by about two thirds of their original height and jiggle when moved, but be set on top. To serve, make a small dip with a spoon in the center of each, then pour in single cream or add a spoonful of ice cream.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/hot-chocolate-souffle

docs.title: Grandma Kleins Chocolate Caramels
docs.text: Total Time 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups granulated sugar
  • 1.5 cups corn syrup
  • 1.5 cups heavy cream
  • 1 cup unsalted butter
  • 4 oz unsweetened chocolate
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 cups nuts (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9" x 13" pan
  • 1 heavy medium sauce pan
  • 1 spatula or wooden spoon
  • 1 wax paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Generously butter a 9" x 13" pan and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place granulated sugar, corn syrup, heavy cream, unsalted butter, and unsweetened chocolate in a heavy medium sauce pan. Over medium to medium-high heat, stir the mixture quite constantly with a spatula or wooden spoon until it just reaches 240°F, and then quickly pull pan from heat. This will take quite some time, be prepared to stand by the stove for awhile, stirring, stirring,

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: stirring! Do not let the caramel mixture over cook, or you will have hard caramel. Likewise, undercooking will result in softer caramels. With pan off the heat, stir in the vanilla. Stir in nuts (optional), if using. Pour into prepared pan. Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: If you prefer regular caramels, omit the chocolate.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: If you want to gift these caramels, simply cut them into your desired size and wrap in wax paper.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: This is how I achieve those super clean cuts: With refrigerated caramel, I first cut around the outer edge of the pan to loosen the caramel from the sides, and then invert caramel onto a wood cutting board that has a layer of wax paper on it, flipping the caramel slab right-side up again. Let warm a bit. Depending on the consistency of the caramel, this can take 20 to 60 minutes. If it's hard to cut, wait another 15 minutes and repeat as necessary. Then I use a long non-serrated knife (a "sandwich knife") to make the cuts. For even more precision, use a ruler to mark out exact sized cuts.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.afarmgirlsdabbles.com/grandma-kleins-chocolate-caramels/

docs.title: Gulab Jambu
docs.text: Total Time 5.37 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup Bisquick
  • 1 cup dried milk powder
  • 2 Tbsp ghee
  • 0.25 cup whole milk
  • 1.5 cup water
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 4 green cardamom pods
  • 5 strands saffron
  • 1 tsp lemon juice (optional)
  • 1 tsp rose water (optional)
  • 2 cups ghee or vegetable oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet or large plate
  • 1 kitchen towel or plastic wrap
  • 1 small pot
  • 1 large saucepan
  • 1 slotted spoon
  • 1 plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Sift 1/2 cup Bisquick into a medium bowl. Add 1 cup dried milk powder and whisk until combined. Melt 2 tablespoons ghee in the microwave or on the stovetop. Pour into the Bisquick mixture and stir until the texture is crumbly and you can visibly see no more ghee. Add 1/4 cup whole milk and stir until a sticky and wet dough forms.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Scoop out 1 to 1 1/2 teaspoons of the dough and roll in between your hands or pinch and press together until smooth and oval in shape (or round if desired). Place on a baking sheet or large plate. Cover with a damp kitchen towel or plastic wrap to keep them from drying out. Repeat until all the dough is formed, placing them in a single layer.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cover with a kitchen towel or damp cloth. Let sit for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, make the chasni.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place 1 1/2 cups water, 1 cup granulated sugar in a small pot (about 3 quarts). Add 4 green cardamom pods and crumble in 5 saffron strands. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Continue boiling for 2 to 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove the pot from the heat. Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice (optional) and 1 teaspoon rose water (optional) if using. Cover to keep warm.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Heat enough ghee or vegetable oil in a large saucepan to go about 1/3 inch up the sides over medium heat. The oil is ready when you add a small piece of the dough and the ghee starts bubbling.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Fry the jambu in batches of 6 to 8: Slowly add one at a time to the hot oil. Fry, constantly moving them with a slotted spoon so they fry evenly, until deep golden brown, about 2 minutes. Using the slotted spoon, transfer onto a plate.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Remove and discard the cardamom from the chasmi. Transfer the jambus to the chasni and let sit for 4 to 5 hours at room temperature to soak. Eat as is, warm up again, or, do what we always did, which was to refrigerate them in an airtight container for a few hours and eat chilled.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/gulab-jambu-pooja-bavishi-23436759

docs.title: Ice Cream
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.5 pints 4.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups (454 g) heavy cream
  • 1 cup (227 g) whole milk
  • 0.67 (132 g) cup granulated sugar
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 6 large egg yolks

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small pot
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 fine-mesh sieve
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 zip-top bag
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a small pot, simmer heavy cream, whole milk, granulated sugar, and salt until sugar completely dissolves, about 5 minutes. Remove pot from heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a separate bowl, whisk egg yolks. Whisking constantly, slowly whisk about a third of the hot cream into the yolks, then whisk the mixture back into the pot with the cream.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Return pot to medium-low heat and gently cook until mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon (about 170°F on an instant-read thermometer).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl. Cool mixture to room temperature by spreading into a rimmed baking sheet. Place in a zip-top bag and chill at least 4 hours or overnight.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: After freezing, you’ll have a sheet of frozen ice cream base that you can break or cut into chunks to fit inside your food processor. Then you pulse the frozen base in a food processor before freezing again overnight.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The New York Times

docs.title: Ina Garten's Apple Crisp
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Crisp
docs.text:
• 5 lbs apples
  • 1 orange zest
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 2 Tbsp orange juice
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp nutmeg

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.75 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.75 cup brown sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 cup quick-cooking oats
  • 2 sticks cold butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 14 x 9 in oval baking dish
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 sheet pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F and butter or grease a baking dish (Ina’s recipe uses a 14 x 9 in oval baking dish). Peel and core the apples and cut them into large wedges. Mix the apples with the orange zest, lemon zest, orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour the mixture into the dish.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine the all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, brown sugar, salt, quick-cooking oats and cold butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Mix on low speed until the mixture is crumbly and the butter is the size of peas.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Scatter the oat topping evenly over the apples. Place the baking dish on a sheet pan and bake the crisp for 1 hour until the top is brown and the apples are bubbly. Serve warm.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tasteofhome.com/article/ina-garten-apple-crisp/

docs.title: Lemony Blueberry Sorbet
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4-6 4.63 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cups blueberries
  • 3 Tbsp honey
  • 1 lemon juice
  • 1 lemon zest

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 parchment
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Rinse and remove the stems from the blueberries. Wipe them off as much as possible. Freeze the blueberries on a parchment-lined baking sheet for 4 hours or overnight so they are completely frozen.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Once frozen, add the blueberries, honey, lemon juice (save the zest for later) and water to the bowl of a food processor. Process the blueberries until they become crumbly, pressing down the mixture with a spatula as needed. Continue to process until the blueberries becomes very smooth. You will have to mix a few times with the spatula to ensure even processing. This process will take at least 8 minutes or so. Fold in the lemon zest.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Transfer the sorbet to an airtight container and freeze for another 30 minutes or longer. Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.farmfreshtoyou.com/recipes/601/lemony-blueberry-sorbet

docs.title: Mamie Eisenhower's Fudge
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 25 pieces 3.10 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 13 oz marshmallow creme
  • 12 oz German sweet chocolate
  • 12 oz semisweet chocolate chips
  • 2 cups walnuts
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • 12 oz evaporated milk
  • 4.5 cups sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large heat-safe bowl
  • 1 large, heavy saucepan
  • 1 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the marshmallow creme, German sweet chocolate, semisweet chocolate chips, and chopped walnuts to a large heat-safe bowl. Set it aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large, heavy saucepan, melt the butter on medium heat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour the evaporated milk and sugar into the pan and mix until combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook on medium-high. Bring to a boil and boil for 6 minutes, stirring often.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: After six minutes, pour the boiling syrup over the chocolate mixture and mix until combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour fudge into the pan and sprinkle a handful of walnuts on top.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Allow the fudge to set up for two to 3 hours at room temperature or one to two hours in the refrigerator.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Once it sets up you can lift fudge out with the parchment paper.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.backtomysouthernroots.com/the-best-million-dollar-fudge-recipe/

docs.title: Martha Stewart's New York-Style Cheesecake
docs.text: Total Time 8.05 hours  Serves 1 9 inch cake

docs.title: Ingredients - 9 Inch - Crust
docs.text:
• 9 squares (68 g) graham crackers
  • 4.5 Tbsp (64 g) unsalted butter, melted
  • 1.5 Tbsp (19 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Ingredients - 9 Inch - Cake
docs.text:
• 2.625 lbs (5.25 pkgs) cream cheese
  • 1.6875 cups (335 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.375 cup (45 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.75 cup (171 g) sour cream, room temperature
  • 4 large eggs
  • 0.75 tsp lemon zest (optional)
  • 1 sour cream topping (optional)
Serves 1 10 inch cake

docs.title: Ingredients - 10 Inch - Crust
docs.text:
• 12 squares (90 g) graham crackers
  • 6 Tbsp (85 g) unsalted butter, melted
  • 2 Tbsp (25 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Ingredients - 10 Inch - Cake
docs.text:
• 3.5 lbs (7 pkgs) cream cheese
  • 2.25 cups (446 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup (60 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup (227 g) sour cream, room temperature
  • 5 large eggs
  • 1 tsp lemon zest (optional)
  • 1 sour cream topping (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 10-inch springform pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter the sides of a 10-inch springform pan. Wrap exterior of pan (including base) in a double layer of foil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To make the crust, process graham crackers in food processor until fine. Combine graham cracker crumbs, unsalted butter, melted, granulated sugar, and salt in a medium bowl. Transfer mixture to the pan and pat into an even layer using the bottom of a measuring cup or meat pounder. Freeze the dough in the pan, about 15 minutes. Place pan on a baking sheet. Bake until the crust is firm to the touch and deeply golden brown, about 15 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the (7 pkgs) cream cheese on medium speed until fluffy, about 3 minutes, scraping down sides as needed.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large bowl, whisk together granulated sugar and all-purpose flour. With mixer on low speed, add vanilla. Gradually add a little bit of the sugar mixture to cream cheese, a little bit of sour cream, room temperature and an eggs. Repeat process until all ingredients are mixed. Beat until just combined; do not over mix.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Optionally, add a tsp of lemon zest (optional).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour cream cheese filling into the prepared pan. Set pan inside a large, shallow roasting pan. Carefully ladle boiling water into roasting pan to reach halfway up sides of springform pan.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake 45 minutes; reduce oven temperature to 325°F. Continue baking until cake is set but still slightly wobbly in the center, about 30 minutes more. Turn off oven; leave cake in oven with the door slightly ajar, about 1 hour. Transfer pan to a wire rack; let cake cool completely. Refrigerate, uncovered, at least 6 hours or overnight. Before unmolding, run a knife around the edge of the cake.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Optionally, add a sour cream topping.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.marthastewart.com/332755/new-york-style-cheesecake
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0UB2nOT6Wic

docs.title: Melomakarona
docs.text: Total Time 1.48 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 6.75 cups flour
  • 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp cloves
  • 1 stick butter
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1.5 cup olive oil
  • 1 cup orange juice
  • 2 tsp orange zest

docs.title: Ingredients - Honey Syrup
docs.text:
• 3 strips orange peel
  • 1.5 cups sugar
  • 1.5 cups honey
  • 1.5 cups water

docs.title: Ingredients - Walnut Topping
docs.text:
• 8 oz finely chopped walnuts
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.13 tsp cloves

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 tall sauté pan
  • 1 slotted spoon
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To make dough, whisk together flour, 1.5 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp baking soda, and 1/4 tsp cloves.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a stand mixer, cream butter and 1 cup sugar for 3 minutes. Reduce speed to low, then add eggs, olive oil, orange juice, and orange zest.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: To make honey syrup, stir together orange peel, 1.5 cups sugar, honey, and water in a tall sauté pan.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Heat to boiling and allow to boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let syrup cool completely.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: To make the walnut topping, stir together finely chipped walnuts, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1/8 tsp cloves.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: To bake cookies, preheat the oven to 350°F. Scoop 1.5 Tbsp of dough and roll and press into an oval shape. Prick tops of cookies with a fork 4 to 5 times so that tiny marks are visible.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Return remaining dough to refrigerator between batches.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake cookies for 20 to 25 minutes. Line a cooling rack with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: In batches, transfer hot cookies to cool honey syrup. Soak for 30 seconds, turning halfway through.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Using a slotted spoon, transfer cookies to parchment-lined wire rack. Immediately sprinkle with walnut topping.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: When completely cooled, transfer cookies to airtight containers. With parchment paper between layers. Cookies will last up to 2 weeks.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Millefeuille
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Rough Puff Pastry
docs.text:
• 140 g unsalted butter
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 225 g all-purpose flour
  • 135 ml very cold water

docs.title: Ingredients - Crème Diplomat
docs.text:
• 4 egg yolks
  • 110 g granulated sugar
  • 50 g all-purpose flour
  • 50 g cornflour
  • 580 ml whole milk

docs.title: Ingredients - Raspberry Jam
docs.text:
• 400 g raspberries
  • 400 g jam sugar
  • 1 lemon juice
  • 300 ml heavy cream

docs.title: Ingredients - Fondant
docs.text:
• 4 tsp egg white powder
  • 4 Tbsp water
  • 400 g white fondant

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 baking trays
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 large saucepan
  • 1 potato masher
  • 1 piping bag

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To make the rough puff pastry, place the unsalted butter, salt and all-purpose flour in a bowl and then gradually mix through the very cold water, you may not need all of it. You want to have a soft, not sticky dough. Knead extremely lightly to bring together and then wrap in plastic wrap and freeze for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, line two baking trays with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Once the dough has chilled, flour the surface and roll out the dough with sharp taps up and down the dough, rather than rolling, flouring the surface more if necessary. Continue to tap the dough up and down until it measures 30 cm by 10 cm.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Brush off any excess flour and fold the bottom third up and the top third down and turn so the dough looks like a closed book. Roll out again to the same size and repeat the fold before freezing again for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Meanwhile, start making the crème diplomat by making a crème patisserie. Whisk together the egg yolks, granulated sugar and all-purpose flour and cornflour until well combined and then heat the milk until just before simmering. Add 5 tbsp of whole milk to the egg mixture and whisk together to combine. Gradually add in the remaining milk and whisk until smooth. Place back in the pan and then bring the mixture to a boil, whisking constantly until thickened. Once thickened, remove from the heat and then transfer into a bowl and allow to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Continue with the pastry and do two more rolls and folds, rolling and folding once more if the butter is still a little streaked. Rewrap in the plastic wrap and allow to freeze for 10 minutes more. Preheat oven to 220°C / 200°C fan / 425°F / Gas 7.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Once the pastry has chilled, divide in half and roll each piece out carefully to 26 x 26 cm and place on the lined baking trays. Top with another piece of parchment paper and top with two other baking trays.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden and fully cooked through. Once cooked, remove the top baking tray and allow to cool on the tray.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: For the jam, add the raspberries, jam sugar and lemon juice to a large saucepan. Breakdown slightly with a potato masher, then heat over low until the sugar has melted.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Bring to the boil, then boil for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer to a bowl to set.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Meanwhile, whisk the crème pat in a stand mixer until smooth. In a separate bowl, whisk the heavy cream to soft peaks, then use a little of this whipped cream to slacken the crème pat. Fold through the remaining whipped cream. Transfer into a piping bag with a large round nozzle and then chill until required.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Once the pastry is cool, trim each square to 24 x 24 cm. Divide each square into 8 rectangles that measure 12 x 6 cm. You should have 16 rectangles.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Sieve a quarter of your jam into a bowl, removing the seeds. Transfer the sieved jam to a piping bag and leave to one side until needed.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Combine the egg white powder and water to create a smooth paste. Break the block of white fondant into small pieces and add to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Beat the fondant to break it down, then gradually add the egg white liquid. Continue to beat until you have a smooth, spreadable consistency.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Coat the top of 4 pastry rectangles with the fondant and smooth. Using the sieved jam, create a feathered pattern on each of the fondant topped rectangles.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Spread the remaining pastry rectangles with a small amount of jam, then pipe 3 long rows of crème diplomat blobs to cover.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: To build the millefeuille, stack three crème diplomat topped rectangles on top of each other, then top with a feathered fondant rectangle.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Repeat with the remaining pastry rectangles until you have 4 millefeuille.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://thegreatbritishbakeoff.co.uk/recipes/all/prue-leith-millefeuille/

docs.title: Montélimar Nougat
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 10 Tbsp honey
  • 1.33 cups granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp corn syrup
  • 3 Tbsp water
  • 1 egg white
  • 1 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 1.5 cups unblanched almonds
  • 0.25 cup pistachios

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 X 4 inch loaf pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 candy thermometer
  • 1 serrated knife
  • 1 plastic wrap

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a 9 X 4 inch loaf pan with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, warm the honey over medium-high heat until it registers 255°F on a candy thermometer.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate medium saucepan, combine the 1.33 cups granulated sugar, corn syrup, and water and cook over medium-high heat until the mixture registers 285°F, swirling occasionally.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Meanwhile, in the clean, dry bowl of a stand mixer, whip the egg white and remaining 1 Tbsp granulated sugar on low speed with the whisk attachment until foamy. With the mixer running, slowly pour in the warm honey, followed by the hot sugar syrup. Continue beating on low speed for 5 minutes more, until the mixture is lukewarm. Meanwhile, heat the unblanched almonds and pistachios in a medium frying pan over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until warm to the touch.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To check if the nougat is ready, scoop up a small amount with a spoon and dip it into cold water; it should form a firm ball. Add the warm nuts to the nougat and fold with a spatula until well combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Spoon the nougat into the prepared loaf pan, cover, and allow to cool overnight at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: The next day, remove the nougat from the pan and, with a serrated knife, cut it lengthwise into 6 slices.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Wrap each slice in plastic wrap to protect it from humidity. (Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.)

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.bakepedia.com/montelimar-nougat/

docs.title: New Orleans Pralines
docs.text: Total Time 31 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup (198 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 cup (213 g) brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup evaporated milk
  • 4 Tbsp (57 g) unsalted butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla extract
  • 1.5 (149 g) cup toasted pecans
  • 0.25 cup (57 g) boiling hot water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 aluminum foil
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 candy thermometer
  • 1 wooden spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Gather the ingredients.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with aluminum foil and spraying the foil with nonstick cooking spray. Alternatively, use a silicone mat on top of the baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the white granulated sugar, brown sugar, and evaporated milk.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir until the sugar dissolves. Once all is well mixed, insert a candy thermometer. Cook the candy, stirring occasionally, until the thermometer reads 240°F.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once the proper temperature is reached, remove the pan from the heat and drop the cubes of unsalted butter on top, without stirring. Allow the sugar mixture to sit for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the vanilla extract and toasted pecans.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Begin to stir smoothly and constantly with a wooden spoon; the candy will begin to thicken and appear lighter in color. Continue to stir until the candy starts to hold its shape. It should still be easy to stir, but don't overdo it, as pralines quickly go from fluid to rock-solid.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Once the confection has a lighter opaque-brown color and is holding its shape, work quickly and drop small spoonfuls of the candy onto the prepared baking sheet. Because the pralines will start to set in the saucepan, you need to spoon out the candy as fast as you safely can. If the candy stiffens before you’re done scooping, add a spoonful of boiling hot water and stir until it loosens, then continue scooping until you have formed all the pralines.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Allow the candy to fully set at room temperature; it should take about 30 minutes for the pralines to harden. Store the pralines in an airtight container at room temperature. Enjoy.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thespruceeats.com/new-orleans-pralines-521172

docs.title: New York-Style Cheesecake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 15-20 8.03 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 shortbread crust
  • 1 egg white
  • 2.5 lbs cream cheese
  • 1.75 cups sugar
  • 3 Tbsp all-purpose flour (optional)
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 5 large eggs
  • 2 large egg yolks
  • 0.5 cup heavy cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch spring-form pan
  • 1 fork
  • 1 rack
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 wooden spoon
  • 1 rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Do not be afraid of the extreme oven temperature - the surface of the cake will be golden, with a creamy interior. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Lightly grease a 9-inch spring-form pan. Prepare the dough for shortbread crust.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Press one-third of the dough, or slightly less, over the bottom of the pan as evenly as possible. Prick the dough all over with a fork. Bake until the crust is light golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes. Let cool completely on a rack. Press the remaining dough about 1/8 inch thick around the sides of the pan, making sure that it is attached to the bottom crust all around. Brush the bottom and sides of the crust with 1 well beaten egg white.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Refrigerate the crust if you are not filling it right away. Have all of the ingredients at room temperature, about 70°F. Preheat the oven to 500°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Beat in a large bowl until smooth and creamy, about 30 seconds cream cheese.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Scrape the sides of the bowl and the beaters well. Gradually add and beat until smooth and creamy, 1 to 2 minutes sugar and all-purpose flour (optional), if you prefer a denser texture.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Beat in lemon zest and vanilla.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Beat in one at a time just until incorporated, scraping the sides of the bowl and the beaters after each addition eggs and egg yolks.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: On low speed, beat in heavy cream.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Scrape the batter into the crust and smooth the top. Bake for 15 minutes at 500°F, then reduce the oven temperature to 200°F and bake for 1 hour more. Turn the oven off, prop the oven door ajar with the handle of a wooden spoon, and let the cake cool in the oven for 30 minutes. Remove to a rack and let completely in the pan before unmolding. Cover and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, preferably 24 hours, before serving. The cheese flavor is even more intense after 48 hours.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Old-Fashioned Rice Pudding
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 4
  • 6 cups milk
  • 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup long grain white rice
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • some cinnamon (optional)
  • 3 Tbsp cocoa powder (optional)
  • 1/4 cup raisins (optional)
Serves 2
  • 3 cups milk
  • 0.25 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 cup long grain white rice
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • some cinnamon (optional)
  • 1.5 Tbsp cocoa powder (optional)
  • 2 Tbsp raisins (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large saucepan, combine 5 1/2 cups milk, granulated sugar, and salt. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in long grain white rice and reduce heat to low. Be sure to adjust the heat so that it is at a gentle simmer.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stirring occasionally, cook for 50 to 60 minutes. Mixture should thicken up to consistency of yogurt.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once thickened, remove from heat and stir in vanilla.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Let cool and then refrigerate. The last 1/2 cup milk is stirred in just before serving. Sprinkle with cinnamon (optional) if desired.

Variation

To make Chocolate Rice Pudding, add 3 Tbsp cocoa to the milk.

Variation

Add 1/4 cup of raisins when cooking the rice.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://spicysouthernkitchen.com/old-fashioned-rice-pudding/

docs.title: Peanut Brittle
docs.text: Total Time 55 minutes

docs.title: Ratios
docs.text: sugar  corn syrup  water  peanuts  butter 4 parts 3 parts 1 part 3 parts 1/2 part  sugar  baking soda 200 g 1 tsp

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup (198 g) sugar
  • 0.5 cup (156 g) corn syrup
  • 0.25 cup (57 g) water
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 cup (142 g) peanuts
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 1 tsp baking soda

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 heavy 2-quart saucepan
  • 1 cookie sheet
  • 1 forks
  • 1 candy thermometer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Grease a large cookie sheet. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a heavy 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, bring sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt to a boil. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Stir in peanuts.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Set candy thermometer in place, and continue cooking. Stir frequently until the temperature reaches 300°F (150°C), or until a small amount of mixture dropped into very cold water separates into hard and brittle threads.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove from heat; immediately stir in softened butter and baking soda; pour at once onto the 13" x 18" rimmed baking sheet. With two forks, lift and pull peanut mixture into a rectangle, about 14x12 inches; cool.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Snap candy into pieces.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/15987/moms-best-peanut-brittle/

docs.title: Peanut Butter Cups
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 mini cups 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 12 oz milk chocolate
  • 0.5 cup creamy peanut butter
  • 3 Tbsp confectioners’ sugar
  • 1 Tbsp butter
  • 0.13 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 24‑cup mini-muffin tin
  • 1 paper liners
  • 1 large zipper-lock plastic bag
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 small microwave-safe bowl
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 quart-size zipper-lock bag
  • 1 scissors
  • 1 oven mitts

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line 24‑cup mini-muffin tin with 24 paper liners.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place milk chocolate in large zipper-lock plastic bag and seal, removing as much air as possible from bag. Use rolling pin to gently pound chocolate into small pieces.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In small microwave-safe bowl, add half of pounded chocolate. Heat in microwave at 50 percent power for 1 minute. Use rubber spatula to stir chocolate. Return to microwave and heat at 50 percent power until melted, about 1 minute longer. Use oven mitts to remove bowl from microwave. Use rubber spatula to stir chocolate until completely melted and smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour melted chocolate into one quart-size zipper-lock bag. Push chocolate to one corner of bag and twist top. Use scissors to snip 1/8 inch off corner of filled bag.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pipe chocolate in spiral in each muffin-tin cup, working from outside in, to cover bottom of liner. Transfer muffin tin to freezer and freeze for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pipe chocolate in spiral in bottom of each muffin-tin cup, working from outside in, to cover bottom of liner. Take a break every six cups and gently tap pan on counter to even out layer of chocolate. Transfer muffin tin to freezer and freeze for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Meanwhile, add creamy peanut butter to second small microwave-safe bowl and heat in microwave until warm, about 1 minute. Use oven mitts to remove bowl from microwave.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add confectioners’ sugar, butter, and salt to warmed peanut butter and use clean rubber spatula to stir until well combined. Fill second quart-size zipper-lock bag with peanut butter mixture. Use scissors to snip 1/8 inch off corner of filled bag.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Remove muffin tin from freezer. Pipe peanut butter mixture over chilled chocolate layer in each muffin-tin cup in spiral to cover chocolate layer. Take a break every six cups and gently tap pan on counter to even out layer of peanut butter.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Add remaining pounded chocolate to bowl used to melt chocolate. Heat in microwave at 50 percent power for 1 minute. Use rubber spatula to stir chocolate. Return to microwave and heat at 50 percent power until melted, about 1 minute longer. Use oven mitts to remove bowl from microwave. Use rubber spatula to stir chocolate until completely melted and smooth.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Fill third quart-size zipper-lock bag with melted chocolate. Use scissors to snip 1/8 inch off corner of filled bag.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Pipe melted chocolate on top of peanut butter layer in each muffin-tin cup in spiral to cover peanut butter layer. Take a break every six cups and gently tap pan on counter to even out layer of chocolate.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Transfer muffin tin back to freezer and chill for 30 minutes. Remove muffin tin from freezer and remove peanut butter cups from pan. Serve. (Peanut butter cups can be refrigerated in airtight storage container for up to 2 weeks).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Pear Tarte Tatin
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 pears
  • 100 g sugar
  • 100 g butter
  • 2 star anise
  • 3 pods cardamom
  • 1 large cinnamon stick
  • 2 Tbsp brandy
  • 500 g all-butter puff pastry

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 ovenproof frying pan
  • 1 plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Core the pears, then peel as neatly as possible and halve. If you like, they can be prepared up to a day ahead and kept in the fridge, uncovered, so that they dry out.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Tip the sugar, butter, star anise, cardamom and cinnamon stick into an ovenproof frying pan, about 20cm wide, and place over a high heat until bubbling. Shake the pan and stir the buttery sauce until it separates and the sugar caramelizes to a toffee color.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Lay the pears in the pan, then cook in the sauce for 10 to 12 minutes, tossing occasionally, until completely caramelized. Don’t worry about them burning – they won’t – but you want to caramelize them as much as possible. Splash in the brandy and let it flambé, then set the pears aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat oven to 200°C / fan 180°C (350°F) / gas 6. Roll the all-butter puff pastry out to the thickness of 3 mm (1/8 in). Using a plate slightly larger than the top of the pan, cut out a circle, then press the edges of the circle of pastry to thin them out.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: When the pears have cooled slightly, arrange them in the pan, cut side up, in a floral shape, with the pears around the edge pointing inwards. Rest the cinnamon stick on the top in the center, with the cardamom pods scattered around.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Drape the pastry over the pears, then tuck the edges down the pan sides and under the fruit (see Gordon’s guide). Pierce the pastry a few times, then bake for 15 minutes. If a lot of juice bubbles up the side of the pan, pour it off at this stage (see guide). Reduce oven to 180°C / fan 160°C (325°F) / gas 4 and bake for 15 minutes more until the pastry is golden. Leave the tart to stand for 10 minutes, then invert it carefully onto a serving dish.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/pear-tarte-tatin

docs.title: Pecan Brittle
docs.text: Total Time 2.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 142 g pecans
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 57 g unsalted butter
  • some water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small container
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 sheet pan
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Toast the coarsely chopped pecans.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine the baking soda and salt in a small container and mix.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add granulated sugar and unsalted butter to a saucepan. Add a little bit of water to help bind everything together.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in the beginning to encourage the sugar to dissolve into the butter until the mixture comes to a boil.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Switch to swirling to even out the heat and temperature and prevent crystallization.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cook until the mixture becomes a deep amber.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Kill the heat and add in the toasted pecans and give the mixture a stir to ensure that the pecans are well coated.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add the baking soda and salt mixture that'll cause a foaming effect and stir rapidly.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Quickly transfer the mixture to a sheet pan lined with parchment paper while the mixture is till hot and spread into a single layer.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Let cool to room temperature for about 2 hours and break up into small pieces.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gGBC4-CsXOM

docs.title: Pouding Chômeur with Pure Maple Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 to 16 52 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups maple syrup
  • 1.5 cups light brown sugar
  • 1.5 cups heavy cream
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 0.75 cup granulated sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 cup cornstarch
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.75 cup buttermilk
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 separate bowl
  • 1 9-inch square baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350 F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine maple syrup, light brown sugar, heavy cream, softened unsalted butter, vanilla, and salt in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium, stirring occasionally, until the butter is melted and sugar is dissolved. Turn the heat off and reserve.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened unsalted butter and granulated sugar with an electric mixer until light, about 5 minutes. Add the room temperature eggs and mix until fluffy, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a separate bowl, mix the all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking powder and salt until very well combined. Separately, mix the room temperature buttermilk and vanilla.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add half of the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture. Mix on low speed until barely incorporated, then pour in half the buttermilk-vanilla mixture; resume mixing on low speed until just combined. Repeat with a third of the dry ingredients, then the buttermilk-vanilla mixture, and finally add the rest of the dry ingredients.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Transfer the batter to a 9-inch square baking dish. Make sure that the dish is at least 2.5 inches high, and spread lightly to the edge.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Delicately pour the reserved maple sauce over the batter, placing a spoon under the stream of sauce to help break its fall. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the top is golden and completely set.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Remove the cake from the oven. Cool for a few hours.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Costco

docs.title: Pumpkin Cheesecake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10-12 54 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 1 Crumb Crust made with graham crackers
  • 1 Nut Crust made with pecans (alternative)
  • 0.67 cup brown sugar
  • 0.75 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp cloves
  • 0.25 tsp ginger
  • 0.13 tsp nutmeg
  • 1 lb cream cheese
  • 2 large eggs
  • 2 large egg yolks
  • 1 cup canned or cooked pumpkin

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup sour cream
  • 0.33 cup light brown sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cake pan
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prepare and bake in an 8-inch springform or cake pan Crumb Crust made with graham crackers or Nut Crust made with pecans(alternative).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Let cool. Have all ingredients at room temperature, about 70°F. Place a loaf pan or cake pan filled with hot water in the oven to moisten the air. Preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine in a small bowl: 2/3 cup packed brown sugar, 3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves, 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger, and 1/8 teaspoon grated or ground nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Beat in a large bowl just until smooth, 30 to 60 seconds cream cheese.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Scrape the sides of the bowl and the beaters well. Gradually add the sugar mixture and beat until smooth and creamy, 1 to 2 minutes. Beat in one at a time until well blended, scraping the sides of the bowl and the beaters after each addition: 2 large eggs and 2 large egg yolks Add and beat in just until mixed 1 cup canned or cooked pumpkin

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Scrape the batter into the crust and smooth the top. Set the pan on a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes at 350°F, then reduce the oven temperature to 325°F and bake until the edges of the cheesecake are puffed but the center still looks moist and jiggles when the pan is tapped, 10 to 15 minutes more. Meanwhile, to make the topping, whisk together until well blended: 1/2 cups sour cream , 1/3 cup packed light brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Scrape on top of the hot cake and smooth with a spatula. Return to the oven for 7 minutes. Remove the pan to a rack and cover the pan and rack with a large inverted bowl or pot so that the cake cools slowly. Let cool completely before unmolding. Cover and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, preferably 24 hours, before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Rice Krispies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 18 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 7 cups Rice Krispies Cereal
  • 6 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 16 oz marshmallows

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 x 13 inch pan
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 medium or large saucepan
  • 1 rubber spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan and a large mixing bowl with butter or baking spray.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour the Rice Krispies Cereal into the greased bowl and set it aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Begin to melt unsalted butter over low heat in a medium or large saucepan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the marshmallows to the saucepan and stir.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Continue to stir often, until about 75 percent of the marshmallows are melted.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Remove the pan from the heat and continue to stir, smashing the marshmallows using a rubber spatula or the back of a wooden spoon, until the marshmallows completely melt and become smooth.

Note

We recommend taking the marshmallows off the heat before they are completely melted, so you will not overheat the marshmallows. The residual heat from the melted marshmallows will heat the unmelted marshmallows slowly, allowing them to melt without getting too hot. When marshmallows are overheated, the sugar crystallizes, turning into hard candy. Overheated marshmallows will make your treats hard to bite into.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Pour the marshmallows over the cereal and toss to combine.

Note

We recommend pouring the marshmallows over the cereal instead of adding them to the pan. If the cereal is poured into the hot pan, the crisp rice may become soft if it gets too hot. Your treats may taste stale immediately after they are made because the cereal will be soft.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Once the cereal is mixed with the melted marshmallows, pour it into a well-buttered 9 x 13 pan.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: GENTLY spread it into an even layer. Do not compress the mixture or your treats will be dense and hard.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
Allow the treats to cool for at least 30 minutes before cutting into rectangles or squares.

Note

European-style salted butter contains more butterfat than American-style butter adding richness to the treats. Salted butter balances out the sweetness.

Note

We recommend using Kraft Jet-Puffed Marshmallows. They have great texture and flavor. We found store-brand marshmallows to be stickier. If you use store-brand marshmallows, we recommend adding up to one additional cup of Rice Krispies Cereal.

Note

Store your treats in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week.

Note

Do NOT refrigerate your treats. They will become stale-tasting if stored in the fridge.

Note

You can freeze the treats. Wrap them well, and freeze for up to 3 months. To thaw, bring them to room temperature and let them sit, wrapped, for a few hours. Then unwrap and enjoy.

Note

Do NOT overheat your marshmallows. This is key to making soft and chewy Rice Krispie Treats, not hard treats.

Note

Do NOT compact the cereal treat mixture into your pan or you will end up with very dense, hard treats. Gently press the mixture into the pan.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://howtomakecerealtreats.com/rice-krispie-treats-recipe/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/rice-krispies-treats-recipe-reviews-23153075

docs.title: Slow Cooker Apple Crisp
docs.text: Total Time 4.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups flour
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 1 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.25 tsp ginger
  • 0.75 cup softened butter
  • 6 medium apples

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 slow cooker

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger and softened butter.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place peeled, cored, and sliced apples in slow cooker and top with flour mixture, pressing down lightly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook on high for 3 to 4 hours.

docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Sticky Toffee Pudding
docs.text: Total Time 38 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Pudding
docs.text:
• 5 oz dates
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 cup boiling water
  • 42 g unsalted butter
  • 84 g light brown sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 78 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder

docs.title: Ingredients - Toffee Sauce
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 225 g brown sugar
  • 2 Tbsp milk
  • 2 Tbsp heavy cream
  • 2 Tbsp corn syrup
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 2 Tbsp bourbon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 heat-proof bowl or measuring cup
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 blender or immersion blender
  • 1 6 cup muffin tin
  • 1 small saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the Pudding: Place the dates and baking soda in a heat-proof bowl or measuring cup. Pour boiling water over and press the dates down with a spoon so they’re submerged. Let sit for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (alternatively, a large bowl and a hand mixer), cream butter and light brown sugar on high until light and fluffy, about 1 minute. Reduce speed to medium, add the egg and continue to mix until combined, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low, add all-purpose flour and baking powder and mix until just combined.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Puree the dates using a blender or immersion blender. Pour the mixture directly into the bowl of the stand mixer mix on low until well combined.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Grease and flour a 6 cup muffin tin. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared cavities and place in the oven. Bake for 17 to 19 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out mostly clean. Allow the cakes to cool for about 5 minutes before turning out onto a plate or tray.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
While the cakes are baking, make the Toffee Sauce: combine unsalted butter, brown sugar, milk, heavy cream, corn syrup, and salt (except bourbon) in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally to dissolve the sugar, and boil for 3 minutes until thickened. Remove from heat, stir in bourbon, and allow to cool slightly before spooning over the puddings. Serve immediately.

Note

A standard 12-cup muffin tin can of course be used, simply grease and flour only 6 of the cavities. The recipe also easily doubles to make 12 puddings.

docs.title: Source
docs.text:
• https://www.gordonramsay.com/gr/recipes/stickytoffee-pudding/
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lZpGUWygrlg

docs.title: Strawberry Mousse
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg silken tofu
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 Tbsp strawberry preserves
  • 1 cup frozen strawberries
  • 4 Medjool dates
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender
  • 1 freezer-safe dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a blender, process 12.3 oz package of organic firm silken tofu, vanilla, strawberry preserves, frozen strawberries, Medjool dates, and lemon juice until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place mixture into a freezer-safe dish and allow to set for 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Scoop and serve. Store any leftovers in the refrigerator.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/dessert/strawberry-mousse/

docs.title: Strawberry Rhubarb Crisp
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 1 cup frozen strawberries
  • 1 cup frozen rhubarb
  • 4 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp orange juice
  • 1 tsp orange zest
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 0.5 Tbsp all-purpose flour

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 2 Tbsp light brown sugar
  • 0.25 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 0.5 cup old fashioned oats
  • 3 oz cold unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 oven proof ramekins
  • 1 pastry blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, mix halved frozen strawberries, 1 inch diced frozen rhubarb, granulated sugar, orange juice, orange zest, salt and all-purpose flour. Stir until well combine and transfer mixture to oven proof ramekins.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl combine all-purpose flour, light brown sugar, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, salt and old fashioned oats. Using a pastry blender, a fork or your hands cut in cold unsalted butter. Mix until ingredients resemble a coarse meal and butter is combined (be sure to not over mix into one large ball of dough).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Sprinkle topping onto filling to cover. Bake until top is golden and fruit is bubbly, about 30 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tspoons

docs.title: Strawberry Shortcakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 51 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Shortcake
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 0.75 tsp granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 1 pinch baking soda
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 0.33 cup heavy cream
  • 0.5 tsp granulated sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - Strawberries & Cream
docs.text:
• 8 oz strawberries
  • 1 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 cup heavy cream
  • 1 Tbsp confectioners' sugar
  • 0.25 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 1/3-cup dry measuring cup
  • 1 vegetable oil spray
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 butter knife
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 potato masher
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to upper-middle position and heat oven to 450°F. Line rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. In medium bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, 3/4 teaspoon granulated sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Microwave heavy cream until just warmed to body temperature (95 to 100°F), about 15 seconds. Stir warm cream into flour mixture until soft, uniform dough forms.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Spray 1/3-cup dry measuring cup with vegetable oil spray. Using spoon, transfer half of dough to prepared measuring cup, pressing to fill bottom of cup (cup will not be completely filled). Run butter knife around edge of cup and deposit dough onto prepared sheet. Repeat with remaining dough. If portions are misshapen, use your fingers to gently reshape dough into level cylinders. Sprinkle remaining 1/2 teaspoon granulated sugar over shortcakes. Bake until tops are light golden brown, 9 to 11 minutes, rotating sheet halfway through baking. Transfer to wire rack and let cool completely, about 20 minutes. While shortcakes cool, prepare strawberries and cream.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In medium bowl, stir together 1/4" thick sliced strawberries, granulated sugar, and lemon juice. Using potato masher, mash one-third of strawberries. Let rest, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved and strawberries are juicy, about 20 minutes. Whisk chilled heavy cream in small bowl until small bubbles form, about 30 seconds. Add confectioners' sugar and vanilla. Continue to whisk until soft peaks form, about 1/2 minutes longer. Do not overwhip.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Split shortcakes crosswise and place bottoms on plates. Place half of whipped cream on bottom of each shortcake. Top each portion with half of strawberry mixture. Cap with shortcake tops and dust with extra confectioners' sugar, if desired. Serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Swiss Roll
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 27 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some vegetable oil
  • 3 large eggs
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 100 g self-rising flour
  • 1 Tbsp warm water
  • 2 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 185 g raspberry jam

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 32 x 22 cm Swiss roll tin
  • 1 baking parchment
  • 1 hand-held electric whisk or food mixer
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 damp tea towel

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat your oven to 400°F (200°C/fan 180°C/gas 6). Line a 32 x 22 cm Swiss roll tin with baking parchment and oil very lightly with vegetable oil. Using a hand-held electric whisk or food mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, whisk the eggs and granulated sugar together in a large bowl until the mixture turns pale, increases in volume and is mousse-like in texture. This takes about 8 to 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: The mixture should be thick enough to hold a trail on the surface when the whisk is lifted. Sift the self-rising flour over the surface and carefully fold in. Finally, fold in the warm water. Carefully pour the mixture into the prepared tin, tilting the tin so it spreads out evenly and gently easing it right into the corners. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, until golden and firm to the touch.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cut a sheet of baking parchment larger than the Swiss roll tin, place on a wire rack and sprinkle with the 2 Tbsp granulated sugar. Invert the sponge onto the paper, cover with a damp tea towel and leave to cool for 5 minutes. Remove the tea towel and carefully peel the paper from the sponge. Lightly score a line along the short side nearest to you, about 1 cm from the edge.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Carefully roll up the sponge, folding along the score mark to make the first roll and using the paper to help. This initial roll, while the sponge is warm (before the jam is added), helps to prevent cracking. Gently unroll the sponge, cover with the damp tea towel and leave to cool a little more, until just slightly warm. Trim the edges of the sponge to neaten.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Spread the raspberry jam on the sponge, leaving a 2 cm margin at the edges. Roll up the sponge again, starting at the short end along the score mark again. Roll up tightly, using the paper and both hands, patting gently as you go to keep the roll compact but still airy. Trim the ends off the sponge to neaten then place the Swiss roll on a serving plate or board, with the seam underneath.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/food/article-5013617/Paul-s-classic-bakes-Swiss-roll.html

docs.title: Tiramisù
docs.text: Total Time 4.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 large egg yolks
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 0.75 cup heavy cream
  • 8 oz mascarpone
  • 1.75 cups espresso or very strong coffee
  • 2 Tbsp rum or cognac
  • 2 Tbsp cocoa powder
  • 24 ladyfinger
  • 1.5 oz chocolate (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 electric mixer
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 8x8-inch dish or a 9-inch round cake pan

docs.title: Step 1
