docs.text: Using an electric mixer in a medium bowl, whip together egg yolks and 1/4 cup/50 grams sugar until very pale yellow and about tripled in volume. A slight ribbon should fall from the beaters (or whisk attachment) when lifted from the bowl. Transfer mixture to a large bowl, wiping out the medium bowl used to whip the yolks and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the medium bowl, whip heavy cream and remaining 1/4 cup/50 grams sugar until it creates soft-medium peaks. Add mascarpone and continue to whip until it creates a soft, spreadable mixture with medium peaks. Gently fold the mascarpone mixture into the sweetened egg yolks until combined.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine espresso or very strong coffee and rum or cognac in a shallow bowl and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Using a sifter, dust the bottom of a 2-quart baking dish (an 8x8-inch dish or a 9-inch round cake pan would also work here) with 1 tablespoon cocoa powder.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Working one at a time, quickly dip each ladyfinger into the espresso mixture

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Dust top layer with remaining tablespoon of cocoa powder. Top with shaved or finely grated chocolate (optional), if desired.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cover with plastic wrap and let chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours (if you can wait 24 hours, all the better) before slicing or scooping to serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1018684-classic-tiramisu

docs.title: Toffee Bits
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.5 cups 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 113 g unsalted butter
  • 200 g light brown sugar
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper or a silicone baking mat
  • 1 heavy-bottomed small saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a small rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a heavy-bottomed small saucepan, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat. Add the light brown sugar and salt and whisk vigorously for one minute until combined. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture looks like melted peanut butter and a candy thermometer reaches 295 to 305°F, about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: If the mixture separates at all, remove from heat and whisk vigorously until recombined. Return to heat and continue cooking.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Immediately and carefully pour the hot toffee onto the prepared baking pan, allowing it to spread into an even layer. Let cool and harden for about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place the sheet of toffee on a cutting board or in a zip top bag. Use a mallet, rolling pin, or heavy object to crack it into small pieces. You can also cut into bits with a sharp serrated knife. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://handletheheat.com/homemade-toffee-bits/

docs.title: Tofu Mousse
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 10-oz block silken tofu
  • 2 tsp unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 4 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 3.5 oz 70% dark chocolate
  • some coconut yogurt (optional)
  • some fresh raspberries (optional)
  • some chocolate flakes (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Before you start, take the silken tofu out of the fridge for at least 30 minutes to 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Open the silken tofu, and discard the water in the packaging, you don't need to press this tofu before using it.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In the bowl of a food processor, add the silken tofu, unsweetened cocoa powder, 3-4 Tbsp maple syrup, and melted 70% dark chocolate.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Blend until it forms a consistent mousse. You may have to stop the food processor a few times, scrape down the sides of the bowl and repeat until all the ingredients come together.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer the mousse into ramekins and top them with coconut yogurt (optional), fresh raspberries (optional), and chocolate flakes (optional), and store them in the fridge for 1 hour before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.theconsciousplantkitchen.com/tofu-mousse/

docs.title: Ultimate Brown Butter Rice Krispies Treats
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 113 g unsalted butter
  • 25 g dried whole milk powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 387 g mini marshmallows
  • 43 g mini marshmallows
  • 196 g crispy rice cereal

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8" square pan
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 large saucepan
  • 1 flexible spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line the bottom and sides of an 8" square pan with a parchment sling. Lightly grease the parchment. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the unsalted butter until it begins to brown. Look for the butter to foam and sputter then start to show some brown bits at the bottom, about 3 minutes after it has melted.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Turn the heat to low. Add the dried whole milk powder and use a flexible spatula to incorporate, stirring constantly and making sure to clean the bottom and sides of the pan so the milk powder doesn’t burn. Cook until copper in color, about 1 to 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once the butter and milk powder are browned, turn off the heat and stir in the salt, vanilla, and 9 cups (387g) of the mini marshmallows. Stir to combine. Turn the heat back on low, stirring constantly, to fully melt the marshmallows.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once the marshmallows are fully melted, turn off the heat and remove the saucepan from the burner. Fold in the remaining 1 cup (43g) mini marshmallows. Fold only a couple times — the goal is not to melt the last addition of marshmallows.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the crispy rice cereal and stir until fully combined.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Working quickly, scrape the marshmallow and cereal mixture into the prepared pan. Use the spatula to press and compact the mixture evenly into the pan.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Let the Rice Krispies treats cool in the pan until they’re room temperature, about 1 hour. Use the parchment sling to remove the Rice Krispies treats out of the pan before slicing and serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/ultimate-brown-butter-rice-krispies-treats-recipe

docs.title: Vanilla Bean Ice Cream
docs.text: Total Time 2 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 150 g granulated sugar
  • 4 large egg yolks
  • 570 g whole milk
  • 270 g heavy cream
  • 1 vanilla pod
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 zip-top bag
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make a crème anglaise custard using granulated sugar, egg yolks, whole milk, heavy cream, vanilla pod, and a pinch of salt.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour the custard into a zip-top bag and press every last bit of air out. Seal it tightly and place it flat in the freezer. Allow to freeze completely.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Crumble the frozen custard into your food processor and process until completely smooth. At this point, you can stir in any mix-ins or additional flavorings you want.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Scrape the ice cream into a storage container and place back in the freezer.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZkZAQ2QLr7Q
  • https://greatist.com/eat/make-easy-ice-cream-in-a-food-processor

docs.title: Vanilla Bean Whip
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 cups 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup cashews
  • 1 12 oz pkg silken tofu
  • 0.5 cup maple syrup
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 vanilla bean

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 plastic wrap

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak cashews overnight in water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine the silken tofu, cashews, maple syrup, lemon juice, and salt in a blender. Puree until smooth. Scrape down the sides of the blender to incorporate all the ingredients.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Slice the vanilla bean in half lengthwise with a sharp knife and scrape the seeds into the blender. Blend the mixture until very smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the mixture to a bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Chill for several hours in the refrigerator, or until firm.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Forks Over Knives

docs.title: Vanilla Pudding
docs.text: Total Time 4.17 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup sugar
  • 3 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 2.25 cup whole milk
  • 2 large egg yolks
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • some fresh berries (optional)
  • some vanilla wafers (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 heavy-bottomed medium saucepan
  • 1 heat-proof container
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 serving bowls (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix the sugar, cornstarch, and salt together in a heavy-bottomed medium saucepan. Whisk in the whole milk and egg yolks.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat over medium, whisking constantly until the mixture thickens and bubbles, which takes about 5 to 8 minutes. Once thickened, continue to cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes all while still whisking constantly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove from the heat and whisk in the butter and vanilla. Pour into a heat-proof container and press a layer of plastic wrap to the top of the pudding, making sure the plastic wrap makes contact with all of it in order to prevent a film forming as it cools.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Chill in the fridge for 4 hours, or overnight.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Before serving, stir the pudding well. Transfer to serving bowls (optional), if desired. Top with toppings of your choice. I always like serving it with fresh berries (optional) and vanilla wafers (optional)!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://therecipecritic.com/homemade-vanilla-pudding/

docs.title: Vegan Banana Ice Cream
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some bananas
  • some peanuts
  • some maple syrup (optional)
  • some pecans (optional)
  • some real whipped cream (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Slice some bananas in the morning and put them in a resealable bag in the freezer.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Come evening, put those banana slices into a food processor and whiz them up into an ice cream that has no cream.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Scoop and top with some chopped peanuts.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add a splash of maple syrup (optional) to the whizzed-up bananas, if you like. You can top with pecans (optional) instead of peanuts. Or both. Finish with a squirt of real whipped cream (optional).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The New York Times Cooking No-Recipes Recipes

docs.title: Vegan Chocolate Pudding with Cinnamon & Chile
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: 1 lb Tofu
docs.text:
Serves Serving Size 6 161 g
  • 0.75 cup sugar
  • 0.75 cup water
  • 1 lb silken tofu
  • 8 oz semi-sweet chocolate
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp chili powder
  • some chocolate shavings

docs.title: 12 oz Tofu
docs.text:
Serves Serving Size 4 182 g
  • 0.5 cup + 1 Tbsp sugar
  • 0.5 cup + 1 Tbsp water
  • 12 oz silken tofu
  • 6 oz semi-sweet chocolate
  • 0.75 tsp vanilla
  • 1-1/8 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 3/8 tsp chili powder
  • some chocolate shavings

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small pot
  • 1 blender
  • 4 ramekins

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a small pot, combine sugar with 3/4 cup water to make a simple syrup; bring to a boil and cook until sugar is dissolved, stirring occasionally. Cool slightly.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put simple syrup, silken tofu, semi-sweet chocolate, vanilla, ground cinnamon, and chili powder in a blender and purée until completely smooth, stopping machine to scrape down its sides if necessary. Divide among 4 to 6 ramekins and chill for at least 30 minutes. If you like, garnish with chocolate shavings before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1012538-vegan-chocolate-pudding-with-cinnamon-and-chile

docs.title: 1-Bowl Vegan Gluten-Free Carrot Cake
docs.text: Total Time 1.42 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.33 cup coconut oil
  • 3 Tbsp flaxseed
  • 7.5 Tbsp water
  • 0.25 cup maple syrup
  • 1 cup applesauce
  • 0.5 cup brown sugar
  • 0.25 cup sugar
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp baking soda
  • 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 cup almond milk
  • 1.5 cup grated carrot
  • 1.5 cup almond flour
  • 0.75 cup walnuts
  • 1.5 cup gluten-free flour blend

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (176°C). Butter and flour two 8-inch, 1 9x13-inch, or 3 6-inch round pans with coconut oil or vegan cooking spray and dust with gluten-free flour (adjust number/size of pans if altering batch size). Shake out excess. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Prepare flax eggs in a large mixing bowl by mixing flaxseed and water and let rest for 5 minutes. To the flax eggs, add oil and maple syrup and whisk to combine. Next, add applesauce, brown sugar, sugar, salt, baking soda, baking powder, and cinnamon and whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add lesser amount of almond milk (3/4 cup or 180 ml as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size) and stir. Add grated carrot and stir. Then add almond flour and gluten-free flour blend and stir. The batter should be thick but pourable. If too thick, add remaining almond milk 1/4 cup or 60 ml as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size). If adding chopped walnuts, add at this time and stir.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Divide evenly among cake pan(s). Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until deep golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. When you press on the top, it shouldn’t feel too spongy, so don’t be afraid of over-baking! The gluten-free flour blend just takes a little longer to bake. Also, note that the size of pan you use will vary baking time.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Remove from oven and let rest in the pans for 15 minutes. Then carefully run a knife along the edges and gently invert onto cooling racks to let cool completely.

Note

This cake needs to cool completely. It benefits from plenty of airflow, and the flavors develop as the cooling process goes on. If short on time, you can speed the cooling by placing the cakes in the refrigerator or freezer until very cool to the touch.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Once cooled, you can serve as is or frost! For frosting, you have several options! See options above.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Store leftovers at room temperature, covered, for 2-3 days, in the refrigerator for 3-4 days, or covered well in the freezer for several weeks. However, it's best when eaten fresh.

Note

Do note that, if using vegan cream cheese or yogurt in the frosting, the cake should be stored in the refrigerator. From the refrigerator, let set out for 10 to 15 minutes before serving so it warms a bit and becomes more tender. Let thaw completely from the freezer.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/1-bowl-vegan-gluten-free-carrot-cake/

docs.title: Apple Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.70 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 313 g all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.75 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.25 tsp ginger
  • 0.25 tsp allspice
  • 240 g neutral oil
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 100 g brown sugar
  • 180 g applesauce
  • 4 eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 30 g orange juice
  • 360 g apples
  • 15 g confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 56 g unsalted butter
  • 200 g brown sugar
  • 120 g heavy cream
  • some salt
  • 60 g confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 X 13 inch baking pan
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 aluminum foil
  • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (177°C) and grease a 9 X 13 inch baking pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Make the cake: Whisk the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and allspice together in a large bowl. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk the neutral oil, granulated sugar, brown sugar, applesauce, eggs, vanilla extract, and orange juice together in a medium bowl. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until combined. Fold in the peeled chopped apples until combined. It will seem like a lot of apples and that’s ok!

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour and spread batter evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes. Baking times vary, so keep an eye on it. Around the 30 minute mark, loosely tent with aluminum foil to prevent over-browning. The cake is done when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove the cake from the oven and set the pan on a wire rack. Allow to cool for at least 30 minutes before topping or serving.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Right before serving, you can top the slightly warm cake with a dusting of 2 Tablespoons (15g) confectioners' sugar or make the brown sugar glaze in the next step.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Make the glaze: As the cake cools, prepare the brown sugar glaze. Combine the unsalted butter, brown sugar, heavy cream, and pinch of salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until the butter has melted, and then stop stirring and let the mixture come to a rapid boil. Boil for 1 minute. Turn the heat down to low, give it a quick stir, and let simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat and whisk in the sifted confectioners' sugar. Allow glaze to cool and slightly thicken for at least 20 minutes. Spoon glaze over the cake right before serving. (Cake can still be warm when glazing.) If your glaze thickened up too much as it cooled, warm in the microwave for 15 seconds and stir until smooth.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: The cake (glazed, dusted, or plain) can be served warm or at room temperature. Cover leftovers and store at room temperature for 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. If you topped with a dusting of confectioners’ sugar, note that the sugar will melt and disappear into the cake after a few hours.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-cake/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2023/10/14/best-apple-cake-bake-off/

docs.title: Apple Fritter Cake
docs.text: Total Time 1.77 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling & Topping
docs.text:
• 107 g light brown sugar
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp all-purpose flour
  • 396 g diced apples

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 270 g all-purpose flour
  • 2.5 tsp baking powder
  • 149 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg or allspice
  • 170 g unsalted butter
  • 3 large eggs
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 170 g milk

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 85 g confectioners' sugar
  • 3 Tbsp milk
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 12” x 4” x 2 1/2" tea loaf pan or 8" square pan
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 whisk
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 mixer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 12” x 4” x 2 1/2" tea loaf pan or 8" square pan and line with parchment. (See "tips," below for more pan options.)

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the light brown sugar, cinnamon, and all-purpose flour. Add the diced apples and stir to coat; set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl (or the bowl of a stand mixer), combine the all-purpose flour, baking powder, granulated sugar, salt, and nutmeg or allspice. Add the unsalted butter and mix until the mixture is sandy looking.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Beat in the eggs one at a time, scraping the bowl between additions as needed.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: With the mixer running at low speed, add the vanilla and milk. Once the milk is absorbed, scrape the bowl and mix at medium-high speed for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Spread half the batter (about 465 g) in the prepared pan. Spoon half the apple mixture (about 285 g) over the batter and press in lightly. Spread the remaining batter over the apples and spoon the remaining apples on top.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake the cake for 65 to 75 minutes for a tea loaf pan, or 60 to 65 minutes for an 8" square pan. The cake is done when a paring knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove it from the oven and cool for 30 minutes before gently tipping it out of the pan onto a rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text:
To make the glaze: Combine confectioners' sugar, 1.5 to 3 Tbsp milk, and vanilla stirring until smooth. Drizzle over the cooled cake.

Note

Use more milk to create a thin, almost transparent glaze that's characteristic fritters. Use less milk if you want to drizzle the glaze.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text:
Storage information: Store cake, covered, at room temperature for several days. For longer storage, wrap airtight and freeze.

Note

There are a LOT of apples in this cake, by design. Some types of apples may not cook down as much as others, causing the batter to overflow a 9" x 5" pan. The filling has been updated to reduce the amount of apples from 4 to 3 1/2 cups, leaving the remaining ingredients the same. If you want a cake that's packed with apples, use the full 4 cups (452g) and put your pan on a parchment-lined baking sheet to catch any potential spills as the cake bakes.

Note

This cake can also be baked in a 9" x 5" loaf pan or a 9" x 4" x 4" loaf pan; bake the cake for the full 65 to 75 minutes or a paring knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Be sure to place a baking sheet below the loaf pan as it bakes in case the apples don't cook down as much as expected and some juice overflows.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/apple-fritter-cake-recipe

docs.title: Beccherie Tiramisù
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some coffee
  • 12 egg yolks
  • 0.5 kg granulated sugar
  • 1 kg mascarpone
  • 60 ladyfinger biscuits
  • some unsweetened cocoa powder

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 circular plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Brew the coffee and leave it to cool in a bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whip the 12 egg yolks with 1/2 kg of granulated sugar at top speed until the ribbon stage.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Add 1 kg of mascarpone to make a soft cream and whisk on low speed, about 3 minutes.

Warning

Be careful not the split the cream, otherwise fats and liquids with separate.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Dunk 30 of the ladyfingers in the coffee, taking care not to soak them too much, and arrange them in a row in the center of a circular plate.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Spread half of the cream on the ladyfinger biscuits and then apply another layer of 30 ladyfingers, also soaked in coffee, then spread the remaining mascarpone cream over the top.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Sift unsweetened cocoa powder onto the mascarpone layer.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Store in the fridge until ready to serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.lebeccherie.it/allegati/ricetta-storia-tiramisu-en.pdf

docs.title: Boston Cream Pie
docs.text: Total Time 5 hours 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 397 g granulated sugar
  • 4 large eggs
  • 67 g vegetable oil
  • 240 g all-purpose flour
  • 1.25 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 57 g unsalted butter
  • 227 g whole milk
  • 2 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 567 g whole milk
  • 99 g granulated sugar
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 39 g cornstarch
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 1 egg
  • 2 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 57 g semisweet chocolate
  • 57 g heavy cream
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9" round pans
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 cooling rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 325°F. Lightly grease two 9" round pans or line with parchment paper rounds.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Beat the granulated sugar and eggs together until they're light and fluffy, about 2 minutes at medium-high speed using an electric or stand mixer. Slowly beat in the vegetable oil.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Weigh your all-purpose flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the flour, salt, and baking powder to the egg mixture in the bowl, beating just enough to combine. Scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl, then beat again, to fully incorporate any sticky bits.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a saucepan set over medium heat, bring the unsalted butter and whole milk just to a boil. Add the vanilla. Remove the pan from the heat, and stir the mixture until the butter is completely melted.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Slowly add the hot milk mixture to the cake batter, mixing until everything is well combined. Scrape the bowl and mix briefly, just until smooth. The batter will be very thin.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Divide the batter evenly among the prepared pans.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Bake the cakes for 30 to 35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, and the top feels set. Remove the cakes from the oven, cool them in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn them out onto a cooling rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: In a medium-sized saucepan, stir together 2 cups (454g) of the whole milk, the granulated sugar, and the salt. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring to dissolve the sugar.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Meanwhile, whisk the cornstarch, egg yolks, and whole egg with the remaining 1/2 cup (113g) milk.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Whisk about half of the hot milk mixture into the egg yolks/cornstarch to temper the yolks. This keeps them from turning to scrambled eggs when you add them to the simmering milk.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Pour the egg/milk mixture back into the remaining simmering milk in the pan, pouring it through a strainer to capture any bits of egg.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Bring the mixture to a low boil over medium heat (this may happen very quickly), stirring constantly with a whisk, and cook for 2 minutes; the mixture will thicken significantly.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Remove the filling from the heat and stir in the vanilla.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Transfer the filling to a heatproof bowl, and top it with a piece of buttered plastic wrap (make sure it touches the top of the filling so it doesn't develop a skin). Refrigerate until cool.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: When the cakes and pastry cream are completely cool, spread the filling in an even layer over one layer then stack the second layer on top. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Melt the semisweet chocolate and heavy cream together until smooth and lump-free. Add the vanilla and stir well. Let the glaze sit for about 10 minutes to cool a bit and to thicken just a touch. Pour the glaze over the filled cake. Serve immediately, or cool to room temperature, and refrigerate until ready to serve.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Store any leftovers in the fridge, well wrapped in plastic.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/boston-cream-pie-recipe

docs.title: Breton Butter Bake
docs.text: Total Time 1.32 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup unsalted European butter
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 5 egg yolks
  • 2 Tbsp dark rum or orange flower water
  • 120 g all-purpose flour
  • 120 g cake flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 Tbsp milk
  • some crème fraiche
  • 0.75 cup jam (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8-inch springform pan or 9-inch fluted tart pan
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 handheld electric beaters
  • 1 sieve
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 pastry brush
  • 1 cake plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line an 8-inch springform pan or 9-inch fluted tart pan with a round of parchment.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, cream the unsalted European butter and granulated sugar together using handheld electric beaters for roughly 4 minutes, until pale and not fluffy. The idea isn't to incorporate large amounts of air into the cake as it is meant to be dense and decadent. One by one, beat in the five room temperature egg yolks until all are fully incorporated. Add the dark rum or orange flower water and beat to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place a sieve over the mixing bowl and sift in the all-purpose flour, cake flour, baking powder, and salt. Give the mixture a quick fold with a rubber spatula, then beat briefly on low until no streaks of flour remain.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the batter - it will be thick and tacky - to the baking pan. Cover with plastic wrap. Use the palm of your hand to lightly smooth the top. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Lightly whisk the whole egg with the milk. Remove the pan form the fridge, discard the plastic wrap and, using a pastry brush, brush the top of the cake with the egg wash. Drag the tines of a fork across the surface in a crisscrossing diamond pattern. Give the cake another light brushing of egg wash. Bake for 20 minutes, then reduce the heat to 325°F and bake for another 15 to 20 minutes, or until the cake is a rich golden brown and the edges have started to pull away from the sides of the pan.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 5 minutes before moving it to a cake plate. Your slices will be neater if you slice the cake while still warm. The cake can be eaten warm or at room temperature. Serve with a generous dollop of crème fraiche.

Jam Variation

If you'd like to try this with a layer of jam, fill the prepared tart pan with half the batter, freeze for 10 minutes, add 3/4 cup of jam (optional), freeze for another 10 minutes and add the final layer of batter. It will need 45 minutes total baking time.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Gateau: The Surprising Simplicity of French Cakes

docs.title: Bride's Cake with Raspberry Filling and White Chocolate Frosting
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 1.20 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some solid vegetable shortening
  • 18.25 oz plain white cake mix
  • 1 cup whole milk
  • 8 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 3 eggs
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 White Chocolate Frosting
  • 0.25 cup seedless raspberry jam
  • 1 cup fresh raspberries

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch round cake pans
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 dinner knife
  • 1 serving platter

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 350°F. Generously grease two 9-inch round cake pans with solid vegetable shortening, then dust with flour. Shake out the excess flour. Set the pans aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place the plain white cake mix, whole milk, melted unsalted butter, eggs, and vanilla in a large mixing bowl. Blend with an electric mixer on low speed for 1 minute. Stop the machine and scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. Increase the mixer speed to medium and beat 2 minutes more, scraping the sides down again if needed. The batter should look well blended. Divide the batter evenly into the prepared pans, smoothing it out with the rubber spatula. Place the pans in the oven side by side.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake the cakes until they are light brown and spring back when lightly pressed with your finger, 27 to 29 minutes. Remove the pans from the oven and place them on wire racks to cool for 10 minutes. Run a dinner knife around the edge of the cakes and invert each onto a rack, then invert them again onto another rack so that the cakes are right side up. Allow to cool completely. 30 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Meanwhile, prepare the White Chocolate Frosting.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place one cake layer, right side up. on a serving platter. Spread the top with a thin layer of the White Chocolate Frosting, then spread with the seedless raspberry jam, spreading the jam with a spatula up to 1 inch from the cake edge. Place the second layer, right side up, on top of the jam. Spread frosting on the top and sides of the cake with clean, smooth strokes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Garnish the cake with the fresh raspberries. Slice and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Cake Mix Doctor

docs.title: Carrot Cake
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 cups sugar
  • 2 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1.5 cups vegetable oil
  • 4 eggs
  • 3 cups grated carrots
  • 1 can crushed pineapple
  • 1 cup chopped walnuts
  • 1 cream cheese frosting

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9 x 13 inch pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix together all-purpose flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, vegetable oil, eggs, grated carrots, drained crushed pineapple, and chopped walnuts.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake at in a 9 x 13 inch pan for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Decorate with cream cheese frosting.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Cherry Almond Skyr Cake
docs.text: Total Time 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 4.4-oz pkgs Icelandic Provisions Fruit & Nut Cherry & Almonds Skyr
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 64 g grapeseed oil
  • 3 eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 250 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 20 amarena cherries or fresh pitted black cherries
  • 0.5 cup sliced almonds

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 spatula
  • 1 loaf pans
  • 1 paring knife / cake tester

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 320°F (convection) or 360°F (conventional).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a mixing bowl, combine the Icelandic Provisions Fruit & Nut Cherry & Almonds Skyr, granulated sugar, grapeseed oil, eggs, vanilla extract, and salt with a spatula. Mix until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the all-purpose flour and baking soda, stirring until just combined. Be careful not to over mix.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Butter your loaf pans. Fill both pans halfway up with batter. Divide amarena cherries or fresh pitted black cherries and scatter the cherries on top of the batter in both pans. Top off with remaining batter until each pan is 3/4 full (do not fill to the top, as the cakes will rise in the oven). Sprinkle the tops with a handful of sliced almonds.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a paring knife / cake tester comes out clean and the surface is golden. Let cool for 5 to 10 minutes before unmolding. Slice and enjoy!

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Best enjoyed fresh-baked day of. You can also store in an air-tight container and enjoy next day.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.icelandicprovisions.com/skyr-recipes/cherry-almond-skyr-cake/

docs.title: Chez Panisse Almond Torte
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.58 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.25 (248 g) cups granulated sugar
  • 200 g almond paste
  • 1 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 6 eggs
  • 130 g all-purpose flour
  • 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9 inch springform pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 325°F. Beat the granulated sugar with the almond paste until the almond paste is in fine pieces. Or, better, pulverize it in a food processor. Beat in the unsalted butter and the vanilla, then cream the mixture until it is light and fluffy. Beat in the whole eggs, one at a time - the eggs should be at room temperature - beating well after each addition so the eggs are thoroughly mixed in.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt, and beat in just until thoroughly blended.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Butter a 9 inch springform pan and turn the batter into it, smoothing the top evenly. Bake for 1 to 1.25 hours (mine baked for 1.25 hours) or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the center feels springy when you push it gently.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Let cool for about 20 minutes before releasing the sides of the springform pan. Dust with confectioners' sugar.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://alexandracooks.com/2012/12/14/chez-panisse-almond-torte/

docs.title: Cinnamon Chocolate Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 cups granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 stick margarine or butter
  • 4 tsp cocoa powder
  • 1 cup water
  • 0.5 cup vegetable shortening
  • 0.5 cup buttermilk
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 1 stick margarine
  • 2 Tbsp cocoa powder
  • 6 Tbsp milk
  • 1 lb confectioners' sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 cup chopped walnuts
  • 1 cup coconut

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 11" x 15" x 3" jellyroll pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, and cinnamon; set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In saucepan, heat margarine or butter, cocoa powder, water, and vegetable shortening to boiling: pour over dry ingredients.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add buttermilk, baking soda, eggs, and vanilla; mix well.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour into an 11" x 15" x 3" jellyroll pan and bake 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a saucepan, combine margarine, cocoa powder, and milk; heat to boiling.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove from heat; add confectioners' sugar a little at a time, stirring thoroughly. Add vanilla, cinnamon, chopped walnuts, and coconut.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Spread over cake while still warm. "Tastes wonderful!"

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Olga Sarouhan, Edison High School, Huntington Beach, CA: Sweet Surprises: Compiled By Professional Home Economics Teachers of California, Nevada, and Arizona, ©1998 California Cookbook Company

docs.title: Cinnamon-Crisp Coffee Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8" square cake 2 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 66 g granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 2 Tbsp unsweetened cocoa

docs.title: Ingredients - Crumbs
docs.text:
• 120 g all-purpose flour
  • 75 g granulated sugar
  • 14 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 85 g unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 240 g all-purpose flour
  • 149 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp baking soda
  • 113 g unsalted butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 2 large eggs
  • 227 g buttermilk
  • 227 g Greek yogurt (alternative)

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze (Optional)
docs.text:
• 85 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1 pinch cinnamon
  • 3 tsp water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8" square pan
  • 1 parchment sling or reusable silicone liner
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 small offset spatula
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Prepare an 8" square pan with a parchment sling or reusable silicone liner, then lightly grease the sides of the pan. Alternatively, line a 9" cake pan with a round piece of parchment or round reusable liner and lightly grease the sides.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a small bowl, combine the granulated sugar, cinnamon, and unsweetened cocoa. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Weigh your all-purpose flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, granulated sugar, confectioners' sugar, cinnamon, and salt. Add the cubed, room temperature unsalted butter and vanilla; toss to combine. Using a bowl scraper, fork, or your fingers, work in the butter until crumbs form and no dry spots remain. The crumbs should be irregular, ranging in size from a pea to walnut. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large bowl or bowl of a stand mixer, combine the all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, salt, and baking soda. Add the unsalted butter and mix at low speed using an electric hand mixer or the flat beater attachment of a stand mixer until the mixture looks sandy, about 1 to 2 minutes. (This mixing method is called reverse creaming and is also known as the paste method.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Beat in the vanilla and eggs, then mix until no dry spots of flour remain. Stop the mixer and scrape the bowl and beater attachment as needed; the mixture will be thick.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: If using buttermilk, slowly pour it into the mixture while the mixer is running on low speed. If using Greek yogurt (alternative), add the yogurt all at once before starting to mix. Continue to stir until the batter is smooth. Stop to scrape the bowl and then mix again at low speed for 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Transfer half the batter (about 1 1/2 cups, 420 g) into the prepared pan, spreading it all the way to the edges. (A small offset spatula is a helpful tool here.)

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Sprinkle the filling evenly across the batter.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Transfer the remaining batter atop the filling and gently spread to the edges. (The batter will be pourable if you’ve used buttermilk; otherwise, transfer the thick batter by dolloping portions over the filling then use a spatula to smooth it out into an even layer.) It’s OK if a little bit of the filling gets mixed into the top layer of batter.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Sprinkle the crumbs evenly over the batter and gently press to adhere.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Bake the cake for about 45 to 50 minutes, until it's set in the middle and light brown. When the cake is done, a toothpick or paring knife inserted into the center should come out mostly clean.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to cool in the pan for 20 minutes. Prepare the glaze while the coffee cake is cooling, if using.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: In a small bowl, stir together the confectioners' sugar, cinnamon, and 2 to 3 tsp of water until smooth, starting with smaller amount of water. Add additional water as needed until the glaze is the consistency of molasses.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Remove the cake from the pan using the overhanging edges of parchment as handles to gently lift it out. Place the cake (still on the parchment) on a wire rack to cool slightly.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Drizzle the glaze over the cake, or finish by dusting with non-melting sugar or confectioners’ sugar.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/cinnamon-crisp-coffee-cake-recipe
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RXBlS39oTTg

docs.title: Classic Birthday Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 1.65 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 240 g all-purpose flour
  • 1.25 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 4 large eggs
  • 2 cups granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 0.13 tsp almond extract (optional)
  • 1 cup whole milk
  • 57 g unsalted butter
  • 0.33 cup vegetable oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 106 g cocoa powder
  • 454 g confectioners’ sugar
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 74 g hot water
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 284 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 electric hand mixer or stand mixer
  • 1 cooling rack
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 325°F with a rack in the center. Lightly grease two 8” x 2” or 9” x 2” round cake pans; for extra protection against sticking, line the bottom of the pans with parchment rounds (you can cut these yourself or use precut 8” or 9” rounds), and grease the parchment. If your 8” pans aren’t at least 2” deep, use 9” pans.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Weigh your all-purpose flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a small bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, either using an electric hand mixer or stand mixer with whisk attachment, beat the eggs, granulated sugar, vanilla, and almond extract (optional), until thickened and light gold in color, about 2 minutes at medium-high speed. If your stand mixer doesn’t have a whisk attachment, beat for 5 minutes using the paddle attachment. The batter should fall in thick ribbons from the beaters, whisk, or paddle.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the dry ingredients to the mixture in the bowl and mix — by hand or on low speed of a mixer — just enough to combine. Scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl, then mix again briefly, to fully incorporate any residual flour or sticky bits.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a saucepan set over medium heat or in the microwave, bring the whole milk just to a simmer. Remove the pan from the heat and add the unsalted butter and vegetable oil, stirring by hand until the butter has melted.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Slowly mix the hot milk-butter-oil mixture into the batter, stirring on low speed of a mixer until everything is well combined. Scrape the bowl and mix briefly, just until smooth.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Divide the batter evenly between the two pans. You’ll use about 2 3/4 cups (about 580 g) in each.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake the cakes until the edges are pulling away from the sides of the pan, a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, and the top feels set. This should take 26 to 30 minutes for two 9” pans, or 38 to 42 minutes for two 8” pans; a digital thermometer inserted into the center of the cakes should read 205°F. Remove the cakes from the oven, carefully loosen the edges, and allow them to cool for 15 minutes in the pans. Then turn them out of the pans and transfer them to a cooling rack, right-side up, to cool to room temperature.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl or the bowl of your stand mixer, stir together — by hand or mixer — the cocoa powder, 1 cup (113g) of the confectioners’ sugar, and the salt. Stir in the hot water and vanilla, scraping the bowl if necessary.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Add the unsalted butter and remaining confectioners’ sugar, stirring to combine. Using an electric hand mixer or a stand mixer with paddle attachment, beat the frosting at medium-high speed for 1 to 2 minutes, until lightened in color and fluffy, stopping halfway through to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl. When the frosting is ready, scoop out a bit on your spatula; does it seem nicely spreadable? If it's too stiff, beat in water (1 teaspoon at a time) until it's the consistency you want.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: To assemble the cake: Place one of the cake layers on a serving plate; tuck pieces of waxed or parchment paper underneath the edge of the cake to keep the plate clean. Spread the bottom layer with about 1 cup of frosting, enough to make a 1/4” to 1/2”-thick layer. Center the second layer bottom-side up (for a flat top) over the frosted layer and press gently to set it in place.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: If your schedule permits, place the cake in the refrigerator or freezer, uncovered, for at least 30 minutes (or up to 2 hours) to firm it up. This will make the layers less likely to slide around as you work, and the cake won’t shed crumbs as you frost. If you’re pressed for time, you can skip this step.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: For the best-looking cake, do the frosting in two steps. First, spread a very thin layer of frosting around the sides and across the top; this is called a crumb coat. You should be able to see the cake through the frosting in spots, it’s that thin. Refrigerate the cake for 20 minutes to let this layer set. Again, skip this step if time is a factor.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Once the cake is chilled, use the remaining frosting to coat it thoroughly and evenly; our cake styling guide offers six pro-style options for "styling" your cake. If you have any leftover frosting, you can use it to pipe decorations on the top and/or around the base.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Store the cake, covered, at room temperature, or in the refrigerator if your kitchen is hot. Let it come to room temperature before serving. For tips on slicing, see The best way to cut cake.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/classic-birthday-cake-recipe
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/birthday-cake-recipe-reviews-23115314

docs.title: Cream Cheese Pound Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 2.65 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups unsalted butter
  • 8 oz cream cheese
  • 2.75 cups granulated sugar
  • 6 large eggs
  • 3 cups cake flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 12 cup bundt pan
  • 1 mixer bowl
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Start by preheating your oven to 325°F then liberally spray a 12 cup bundt pan with non-stick baking spray or greasing with butter or shortening and then flour.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In your mixer bowl, add unsalted butter, oil or shortening, and cream cheese and beat for 2 minutes on high speed. Slowly add in granulated sugar beat on high speed for an additional 7 minutes until very pale yellow and fluffy. There is no leavening in this cake because we add ample air to this cake by having a very long creaming period.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Next, add eggs, one at a time, combining well after each addition and scraping down the sides as needed.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Turn your mixer down to its lowest speed, and slowly add cake flour into batter in two increments then add salt. Be careful not to overbeat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Lastly, add in vanilla extract, scrape down sides and mix until just combined and turn off mixer.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour cake batter into prepared bundt pan, and bake for 1 hour and 15 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes, then invert cake on serving plate for at least 1 hour or until the cake is cool to the touch.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Dust with confectioners' sugar and serve.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://grandbaby-cakes.com/cream-cheese-pound-cake-recipe/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/pound-cake-recipe-reviews-23177769

docs.title: Dinner Party Yogurt Cake
docs.text: Total Time 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 200 g granulated sugar
  • 1 orange zest
  • 125 g whole plain yogurt
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 180 g all-purpose or cake flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup canola oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Soaking Syrup
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp Grand Marnier
  • 2 Tbsp orange juice
  • 50 g superfine sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup apricot jam or marmalade
  • 2 tsp rum or water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8.5 x 4.5-inch loaf pan
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter and flour an 8.5 x 4.5-inch loaf pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine the 2 jars of granulated sugar and orange zest in a bowl and, using your fingertips, rub them together to distribute the citrus oils.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk the 1 jar of whole plain yogurt and room temperature eggs together. Add the zesty sugar and vanilla and whisk to thoroughly combine. Add the 3 jars of all-purpose or cake flour, baking powder, and salt and whisk just to combine. Add the 1 jar of canola oil and whisk just until homogeneous.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Prepare the soaking syrup by heating the Grand Marnier and orange juice in a microwave until warm, but not hot. Stir in the superfine sugar to dissolve. Drizzle this over the cake while still warm.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
To make the glaze, warm the apricot jam or marmalade with the rum or water over low heat. Strain. Brush into the cake once it has cooled to room temperature.

Note

This recipe can be made in an 8-inch springform or a 9-inch round cake pan. A 9-inch cake will only take around 30 to 35 minutes to take, whereas and 8-inch round will take closer to 40 and medium loaf between 35 and 45 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Gâteau

docs.title: Dominique Ansel's Chocolate Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 8-inch cake 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 kg chocolate biscuit
  • 500 g rum syrup
  • 1 kg dark chocolate mousse
  • 500 g dark chocolate mirror glaze, rewarmed
  • 170 meringues

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8-inch cake ring
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 sheet pan
  • 1 acetate
  • 1 ladle
  • 1 large offset spatulas
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 rimmed sheet pan
  • 1 cardboard cake circle
  • 1 paring knife
  • 1 serving plate or cake stand

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place the 8-inch cake ring on a parchment paper-lined sheet pan and line the inside with the sheet of acetate.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place the first circle of chocolate biscuit in the bottom of the ring on the sheet pan and brush lightly with half the rum syrup. Press the cake with your fingers while you’re doing this to ensure that the cake is not soaked but damp and lightly moistened with the syrup.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using a ladle, pour half the dark chocolate mousse over the cake, pressing the top gently with the bottom of the ladle to make sure the mousse is even.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place the second cake layer gently over the mousse, then brush again with the remaining rum syrup.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour the remaining mousse over the cake and press again to make sure the top is even. Transfer the assembled mousse cake, on the sheet pan, to the freezer. Freeze until firm, at least 4 hours.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove the sheet pan from the freezer and lift off the cake ring. Peel away the acetate. Using 2 large offset spatulas, transfer the mousse cake to a wire rack set in a rimmed sheet pan.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Once the dark chocolate mirror glaze, rewarmed is ready, position it over the center of the cake and immediately pour it all on, allowing gravity and force to cover the cake fully in the glaze. Quickly, while the glaze is still liquid, use an offset spatula to smooth the top and sides of the cake, if necessary. Let the cake stand until the glaze sets completely.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Using the offset spatulas, transfer the cake to a cardboard cake circle. Holding the bottom of the cake firmly with one hand, use a paring knife to trim the glaze from the bottom so it’s even and clean. Place the cake on a serving plate or cake stand.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text:
Arrange the meringues all over the top and side of the cake so the tips are pointing outward. Eat immediately within 1 to 2 days.

Tip

The finishing touch of adding the baked meringue drops is optional. If you use the meringue drops, make sure to twist them a tiny bit when you add them to the cake to ensure they are set firmly in the glaze and won’t fall off.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: To serve, slice the cake into thin wedges. Place a slice on a serving plate and place a small, thumbnail-sized scrap piece of flourless chocolate cake next to the cake. Make a quenelle of ice cream, or use a scoop, and place the ice cream on top of the cake scrap to prevent it from melting and sliding around the plate.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Dominique Ansel

docs.title: Flourless Chocolate Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 22 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 200 g dark chocolate
  • 200 g unsalted butter
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • some raspberries (optional)
  • 1 pinch sea salt (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bain-marie
  • 1 sandwich tin or a silicone baking mold (22 cm)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat the oven to 350°F (180°C).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt the dark chocolate with the unsalted butter. It’s fine to do this in a microwave, but using a bain-marie (a bowl over a pan of simmering water) is good too. Just don’t do it on direct heat.) Let the mixture cool a little, then add the granulated sugar and stir thoroughly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition, but without beating too much air into the mix. Fold in the sieved all-purpose flour. Turn into a sandwich tin or a silicone baking mold (22 cm) and cook for around 22 minutes. It should be a little wobbly in the middle when you take it out. Don’t worry about this, the gooey center is fabulous, and it will set further as it cools.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove from the oven and leave to cool completely before turning out the cake. Let it rest in a cool place, covered with foil. Slice and serve with crème fraîche and some raspberries (optional) or for fun a few drops of good olive oil and a pinch of sea salt (optional) flakes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Try to make this cake the day before you intend to serve it to let it rest and the flavors develop. Good luck resisting.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.redonline.co.uk/food/recipes/a500295/trish-deseine-s-decadent-almost-flourless-chocolate-cake/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2023/04/04/the-flourless-chocolate-cake-bake-off/

docs.title: Funfetti Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 layer 8 inch cake 39 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 2.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 cup cornstarch
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 1 cup unsalted butter
  • 1.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 4 large egg whites
  • 0.25 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp almond extract
  • 0.75 cup whole milk
  • 0.5 cup rainbow sprinkles

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 1.75 cup unsalted butter
  • 3.5 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • 0.25 tsp almond extract
  • 2 Tbsp whole milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8 inch cake pans
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. grease and line the bottoms of three 8 inch cake pans or line 24 cups of two muffin tins.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, cornstarch, salt, and baking powder.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream together the unsalted butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy, 3 to 4 minutes. add the egg whites, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add the vegetable oil and vanilla and almond extract.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: With the mixer running on low speed, add the dry mixture and the whole milk in two or three alternating batches and mix until just barely combined, using a rubber spatula, gently fold in the rainbow sprinkles until they're evenly distributed. Distribute the batter among the cake pans or muffin cups, spreading it out evenly if using cake pans.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Begin checking for doneness at 25 minutes for cakes and 20 minutes for cupcakes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Let cool in the pans for 10 minutes and then turn onto a wire rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: To make the frosting: in a standing mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the unsalted butter until smooth and gradually beat in the confectioners' sugar. Add the salt, vanilla, almond extract, and whole milk and beat to combine.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Frost the cake or cupcakes as desired and enjoy.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://mynameisyeh.com/blog/2014/9/funfetti-cake
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/funfetti-cake-recipe-reviews-23228315

docs.title: Galette des Rois
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust
docs.text:
• 180 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 227 g unsalted butter
  • 113 g sour cream

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 170 g almond paste
  • 85 g unsalted butter
  • 99 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 large egg yolks
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 40 g all-purpose flour
  • 48 g almond flour

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 1 large egg yolk
  • 1 tsp cold water
  • some syrup (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Weigh your all-purpose flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess. Whisk together the flour, salt, and baking powder. Cut the cold unsalted butter into pats, and work it into the flour mixture until it's unevenly crumbly, with larger bits of butter remaining intact.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in the sour cream. The dough will be craggy but cohesive. Turn the dough out onto a well-floured surface and bring it together, if necessary, with a few quick kneads.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pat the dough into a rough square. Roll it into a rough 8" x 10" rectangle. Make sure the underside is sufficiently dusted with flour that you can move it around easily.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Starting with one of the shorter (8") ends, fold the dough in thirds like a business letter. Flip it over (so the open flap is on the bottom), and turn it 90°. Roll the dough into an 8" x 10" rectangle again. Fold it in thirds again.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, and place it in the refrigerator to chill for at least 30 minutes (or overnight).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: When you're ready to proceed, start preheating the oven to 400°F. Lightly grease a baking sheet, or line it with parchment.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Divide the pastry in half. Roll one half into a 10" square.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Using a 10" round template (e.g., a dinner plate), cut a 10" circle. Set the circle onto the prepared baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Beat the almond paste, unsalted butter, granulated sugar, and salt until thoroughly combined.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Add the egg yolks and vanilla, and beat until well incorporated.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Mix in the all-purpose flour and almond flour.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Roll the other piece of pastry into an 11" square. Cut an 11" circle.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: To assemble the galette: Spread the filling over the smaller circle, leaving a 1" rim around the edge of the pastry.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Mix the egg yolk and cold water together. Brush some glaze over the uncovered edge of the pastry.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Center the larger round of dough over the filled bottom crust, and smooth it over the filling. Using a fork, press and crimp the edge of the galette to seal.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Brush an even coat of the glaze over the surface of the galette. (Doing this step before decorating the top will give your design nice definition and contrast.)

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Decorate the galette by using the back of a knife to trace a pattern on the surface; you'll just barely cut into the surface without cutting all the way through to the filling. Poke a vent hole in the center, and four additional small slits at other random spots, hiding the slits in the pattern you've drawn.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until it's golden. Don't be afraid to let it become deeply browned; this slight caramelization gives the butter in the crust wonderful flavor. Remove the galette from the oven, and cool it slightly right on the baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: For a shinier galette, brush the top of the baked pastry with a teaspoon or so of syrup (optional) (maple, agave, golden syrup, or your favorite) while it's still hot from the oven.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: Serve galette warm or at room temperature. Store any leftovers at room temperature for several days; freeze for longer storage.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/king-arthurs-almond-galette-recipe

docs.title: Grammys Texas Sheet Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 260 g all-purpose flour
  • 400 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 113 g unsalted butter
  • 66 g vegetable oil
  • 21 g cocoa powder
  • 227 g water
  • 2 eggs
  • 227 g buttermilk
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Pecans
docs.text:
• 28 g unsalted butter
  • 228 g chopped pecans

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 113 g unsalted butter
  • 4 oz cream cheese
  • 454 g confectioners' sugar
  • 16 g cocoa powder
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 half sheet pan (13×18")
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease and flour a half sheet pan (13×18"). See notes for additional size options.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, sift together the 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 2 cups of granulated sugar, 1 tsp baking soda and 1 tsp salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine 8 Tbsp unsalted butter, 1/3 cup vegetable oil, 1/4 cup cocoa powder and 1 cup of water and heat until melted. Add butter mixture to the dry ingredients and mix until incorporated.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a separate bowl (or the saucepan that you just emptied), whisk together 2 eggs, 1 cup buttermilk and 1 Tbsp vanilla. Gradually add to the butter mixture and stir until fully incorporated.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the cake is fragrant and springs when you press it.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: While cake is baking, melt 2 Tbsp unsalted butter in a medium saucepan over medium low heat. Add 2 cups of chopped pecans to the butter and toast, stirring occasionally, until golden and fragrant, about 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from saucepan and let cool.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: In the same saucepan (no need to wash), combine 8 Tbsp unsalted butter, 4 oz cream cheese, 4 cups confectioners' sugar and 3 Tbsp cocoa powder and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until melted. Remove from heat, stir in 1 Tbsp vanilla, then pour over the warm (but not hot) cake. Sprinkle the toasted pecans over the top.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text:
Cake is best served the day it's made. Wrapped well or put in an airtight container, cake will last 1 to 2 days at room temperature or up to a week in the fridge.

Note

Texas sheet cake is traditionally baked in a 13×18″ half sheet pan. You may also use a jelly roll pan (typically 10.5×15.5″) but will likely need to add 5-10 additional minutes of bake time (I haven’t tried this iteration). If you’d like to use a 9×13 pan, I’d recommend baking at 350 for at least 30 minutes and adding additional time as needed.

Note

If you don’t have buttermilk on hand, you can sub an equal volume of 1 part milk to sour cream or Greek yogurt. In a pinch, you can sub 1 cup of buttermilk for 1 cup of milk (ideally whole milk, but any kind will work) with 1 tablespoon of milk replaced with vinegar.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/grammys-texas-sheet-cake/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-texas-sheet-cake-bake-off/

docs.title: Gâteau Basque
docs.text: Total Time 1.28 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Shortcrust
docs.text:
• 200 g all-purpose flour
  • 12 g baking powder
  • 130 g granulated sugar
  • 140 g diced cold butter
  • some lemon zest
  • 4 egg yolks

docs.title: Ingredients - Pastry Cream
docs.text:
• 250 ml milk
  • 0.5 vanilla bean
  • 60 g granulated sugar
  • 4 egg yolks
  • 10 g all-purpose flour
  • 15 g cornstarch
  • 20 g butter
  • 1 tsp rum (optional)
  • 1 egg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 stiff rubber spatula
  • 1 plastic film
  • 1 sieve
  • 1 tray
  • 1 piping bag
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 high profile tart ring

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Sift the all-purpose flour into a bowl and stir in the baking powder and (after sifting) the granulated sugar.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the diced cold butter and with your fingers and hands, rub it into the flour mixture until it starts to resemble sand. Rub any buttery clumps remaining between your hands to reduce them to sand-like grains.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Grate some lemon zest into the mixture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Using a stiff rubber spatula, and with a hacking slicing type motion incorporate the egg yolks into the mixture until a dough is formed. Then slightly knead the dough and form it into a ball.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: On a lightly floured bench, flatten out the pastry using the palm of your hand and then roll it into a ball again.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Divide the ball into 2 equal halves and use a scale to ensure the halves are equal. Flatten each half into a disc, wrap each in plastic film and rest in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Heat the milk and the vanilla bean (scrape the seeds out of the pod into the milk before placing the pod in) on medium heat and bring to a gentle boil.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Whilst the milk is coming to the boil, gently beat the granulated sugar into the egg yolks until the sugar dissolves, then mix in the all-purpose flour and cornstarch.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Pour the heated milk through a sieve into the mixture and gently mix together and pass it through the sieve back into the pan. On a medium heat, bring back to the boil, whisking continuously.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and keep cooking for 2 minutes. Turn off the heat and whisk in the butter. The mixture should be smooth and thick.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Scrape the cream into a tray and flatten it out to fill the tray. Cover the cream to prevent a crust from forming and place in the fridge until cold.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Remove a disc of dough from the fridge and place it onto a sheet of plastic film and then place another sheet on top.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Roll out the dough until the round disc is a diameter of 20 cm (8 inches). Place on a flat board and return to the fridge.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Repeat the process with the second disc.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Turn the pastry cream into a bowl, add the rum (optional) and mix together and place into a piping bag.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Place a sheet of parchment paper on a baking tray. Remove one pastry disc from the fridge and place it on the parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Brush the egg wash on an 18 mm (3/4 inch) wide strip on the perimeter of the dough and then pipe the pastry cream to cover the rest of the disc. Flatten it with a spatula but be careful not to spread it over the egg wash.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Remove the second pastry disc and place it on top of the first disc with the pastry cream.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Seal the pastry cream in the discs by flattening the rim of the second disc on the egg wash on the first disc.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: Place a high profile tart ring over the cake and push down to cut through the rim of the dough and remove the off cuts.

docs.title: Step 21
docs.text: Brush the top of the cake with egg wash and decorate the top with four crisscross lines gently scratched with a fork (or any design you like really.)

docs.title: Step 22
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 180°C (356°F) (fan forced) and keep the cake in the fridge while the oven is heating.

docs.title: Step 23
docs.text: Bake the cake for 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 24
docs.text: Remove the cake from the oven and allow to cool and remove the tart ring (if necessary, run a knife along the inside of the ring to help remove it).

docs.title: Step 25
docs.text: Wait until the cake is at room temperature before eating.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thefrenchcookingacademy.com/recipes/basque-cake

docs.title: Hot Milk Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 41 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 227 g whole milk
  • 113 g unsalted butter
  • 240 g all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 400 g granulated sugar
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9×13-inch baking pan
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9×13-inch baking pan with baking spray.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat the whole milk and unsalted butter in a small saucepan, stirring occasionally, just until bubbling and butter is melted, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the granulated sugar and eggs on medium-high until fluffy, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the flour mixture and beat on low until just incorporated. With the mixer running on low, gradually pour in the hot milk mixture. Stir in vanilla extract. Pour batter into the prepared baking pan.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 28 to 32 minutes or until lightly browned, and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the cake cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Dust the cake with confectioners' sugar before slicing and serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://preppykitchen.com/hot-milk-cake/

docs.title: Hummingbird Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.07 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
Layers 3 Tiers
  • 250 g pecans
  • 375 g all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp allspice
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 large bananas
  • 1 8-oz can crushed pineapple
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 3 large eggs
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 150 g light brown sugar
  • 198 g vegetable oil
Layers 2 Tiers
  • 167 g pecans
  • 250 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.75 tsp baking soda
  • 0.75 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.375 tsp allspice
  • 0.375 tsp salt
  • 2 large bananas
  • 151 g crushed pineapple
  • 1.25 tsp vanilla
  • 2 large eggs
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 100 g light brown sugar
  • 132 g vegetable oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
Layers 3 Tiers
  • 16 oz cream cheese
  • 113 g unsalted butter
  • 480 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • some salt
Layers 2 Tiers
  • 303 g cream cheese
  • 75 g unsalted butter
  • 320 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8-inch cake pans
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Toast the pecans for 8 to 10 minutes then pulverize them.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Grease three 8-inch cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Whisk the all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and 1.5 cups toasted pecans (Save the rest for garnish.) together in a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Combine the mashed ripe bananas, crushed pineapple, and vanilla in a medium bowl.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cream the eggs, granulated sugar, and light brown sugar until pale and fluffy and it creates a slowly dissolving ribbon in a stand mixer.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Combine the vegetable oil slowly to the bowl in the stand mixer so that it emulsifies into the batter.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Switch to the paddle attachment in the stand mixer.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Alternate pouring the dry then wet ingredients into the batter, starting and ending with dry. You should have about 6 to 7 cups of batter.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Spread batter evenly between the 3 prepared cake pans. Bake for 26 to 29 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Rotate pans halfway through baking.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Remove cakes from the oven and allow to cool completely in the pans set on a wire rack. Once completely cooled, remove cakes from pan and level the tops off so they are flat. I simply use a serrated knife. Discard the tops or eat.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text:
In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese and unsalted butter together on medium-high speed until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the confectioners' sugar, vanilla, and a pinch of salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to high speed and beat for 3 minutes until completely combined and creamy. Add more confectioner's sugar if frosting is too thin, a little milk if frosting is too thick, or an extra pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. Frosting should be soft, but not runny.

Note

Brown Butter Cream Cheese Frosting may be used instead of this frosting. Use a half serving for a 2 tiered cake.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: First, using a large serrated knife or cake leveler, layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. Place 1 cake layer on your cake turntable, cake stand, or serving plate. Evenly cover the top with frosting. Top with 2nd layer, more frosting, and then top with the 3rd layer. Spread remaining frosting all over the top and sides. Decorate the sides and top of the cake with the remaining toasted pecans. Refrigerate cake for at least 15 to 20 minutes before slicing. This helps the cake hold its shape when cutting.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Cover leftover frosted cake tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/hummingbird-cake/

docs.title: Ina Garten's Coconut Cake
docs.text: Total Time 2.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
