docs.text:
• 3 sticks unsalted butter
  • 2 cups sugar
  • 5 extra-large eggs
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 tsp almond extracts
  • 3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 cup milk
  • 4 oz sweetened shredded coconut

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 2 8-oz bricks softened cream cheese
  • 2 sticks unsalted butter
  • 0.75 tsp vanilla
  • 0.25 tsp almond extract
  • 1 lb confectioners’ sugar
  • 6 oz sweetened shredded coconut

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch round cake pans
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 knife or flat spatula
  • 1 baking rack
  • 1 flat serving plate or cake stand

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Prepare two 9-inch round cake pans. Grease them with butter or cooking spray, line them with parchment paper, grease them again and then dust the pans lightly with flour.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, or the bowl of a stand mixer, cream the unsalted butter and sugar until light yellow and fluffy, 3 to 5 minutes. Crack the eggs into a separate bowl. With the mixer running on medium, add in the eggs one at a time, scraping down the bowl once during mixing. Mix in the vanilla and almond extracts.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl, sift together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. With the mixer running on low, add in a third of the flour. Next add in half of the milk and another third of the flour. Add the remaining milk, and then finish with the rest of the flour. Mix until the batter is just combined. Do not overmix.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Fold in the 4 ounces of sweetened shredded coconut with a rubber spatula.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour batter evenly into the two prepared pans and smooth the top with a knife or flat spatula. Put the cakes in the center of the oven. Check the cakes after 35 minutes, and continue baking as needed. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes until the tops are browned and a cake tester comes out clean. Cool on a baking rack for 30 minutes. Turn the cakes out onto a baking rack to finish cooling.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: For the frosting, add the softened cream cheese, unsalted butter, vanilla extract and almond extract in a large mixing bowl, or the bowl of a stand mixer. Mix on low until combined. Mix in the confectioners’ sugar until just smooth.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Place one cake layer on a flat serving plate or cake stand, top side down. Use a sharp knife to cut off the top; even it off if necessary. Spread frosting over top. Place the second layer on top, top side up, and frost the top and sides. To decorate the cake, sprinkle the top with sweetened shredded coconut and lightly press more coconut onto the sides. Serve at room temperature. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tasteofhome.com/article/ina-garten-coconut-cake/

docs.title: King Arthurs Carrot Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 248 g vegetable oil
  • 397 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp ginger
  • 0.25 tsp cloves
  • 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 240 g all-purpose flour
  • 326 g carrots
  • 170 g pecans or walnuts

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 113 g unsalted butter
  • 1 8-oz pkg cream cheese
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 397 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1 tsp milk or heavy cream (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9" round layer pans
  • 1 cake tester
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease two 9" round layer pans, or one 9" x 13" pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Toast the pecans or walnuts for about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, beat together the vegetable oil, granulated sugar, salt, eggs, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves, baking powder, and baking soda.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Weigh your all-purpose flour; or measure it by gently spooning it into a cup, then sweeping off any excess.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the flour, stirring until well blended.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the finely grated carrots and pecans or walnuts, and mix until just blended. Pour into the prepared pans.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake the cakes for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean, or with a few moist crumbs clinging to it. Allow the cake(s) to cool completely before frosting. If you're using round layer pans, remove the layers from the pans after about 15 minutes, and place them on a rack to cool.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: In a large bowl working with a hand mixer or in the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the room temperature unsalted butter and cream cheese together until smooth. Add the salt and vanilla. Beat in 283 g to 397 g of confectioners' sugar. Add a teaspoon of milk or heavy cream (optional) if the frosting is too stiff to spread; add additional sugar if it's too thin.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Frost the sheet cake right in the pan. For the layers, frost the top of one layer, top with the second layer, and frost the top and sides of the cake. For helpful tips, see our blog post: How to assemble and frost a layer cake.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Refrigerate the cake. An hour or so before serving, remove it from the refrigerator and bring it to room temperature. Refrigerate any leftovers, well wrapped, for a day or so; freeze for longer storage.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/king-arthurs-carrot-cake-recipe
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-carrot-cake-bake-off/

docs.title: Lemon Bundt Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 405 g all-purpose flour
  • 2.5 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp kosher salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 240 g whole milk
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 170 g Meyer lemon juice
  • 2 Meyer lemon zest
  • 479 g granulated sugar
  • 4 large eggs
  • 267 g olive oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 132 g granulated sugar
  • 114 g Meyer lemon juice
  • 25 g olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bundt pan or 2 loaf pans
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 cake tester
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 cake tester
  • 1 skewer
  • 1 pastry brush
  • 1 cooling rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven at 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Grease and flour a bundt pan or 2 loaf pans.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk the all-purpose flour, baking powder, kosher salt, and baking soda together.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
In a separate bowl, mix the whole milk, vanilla, 1/4 cup (57 g) of Meyer lemon juice to make a home made buttermilk. Curdling is okay.

Note

If using regular lemons, use 2 Tbsp of lemon juice in place of the 1/4 cup.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a large bowl, massage the Meyer lemon zest and the 1.75 cups (347 g) granulated sugar together.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Combine the eggs with the sugar and zest mixture and mix together on low and then increase to high to incorporate air until the mixture is fluffy and pale.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Slowly incorporate the 1.33 cup (267 g) olive oil into the egg mixture.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add a third of the dry mixture to the egg mixture and then half of the wet mixture. Alternate dry and wet until you end with dry.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Combine the last bit by hand so that you don't overmix the batter and create unwanted gluten.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Pour batter into prepared pan. Don't need to level out the batter because it is pretty liquid.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Bake the cake for 45 to 55 minutes until a cake tester comes out clean when used from the top of the cake. Rotate the cake halfway through baking.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Make the glaze by combining 2/3 cup (132 g) granulated sugar, 1/2 cup (114 g) lemon juice, 2 Tbsp olive oil to a small bowl

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Whisk until there are no more lumps and set aside.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Check the cake with a cake tester at the tallest part of the cake until the cake tester is clean.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Separate the edges of the cake from the pan using a small offset spatula.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Let the cake cook in the pan for about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Poke the bottom of the cake with a skewer to add holes for the glaze to seep into.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Glaze the bottom of the cake while still warm with a pastry brush.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Let the cake cook in the pan for about 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: Turn the cake out of the pan by putting a cooling rack over the pan and then flipping the pan upside down.

docs.title: Step 21
docs.text: Poke the top and sides of the cake with a skewer to add holes for the glaze to seep into.

docs.title: Step 22
docs.text: Glaze the top and sides of the cake while still warm with a pastry brush.

docs.title: Step 23
docs.text: Wait for the cake to cool and the glaze to crystallize before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KhGI83cHJgo

docs.title: Lemon Thyme Yogurt Cake
docs.text: Total Time 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 150 g granulated sugar
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 125 g whole plain yogurt
  • 3 large eggs
  • 180 g all-purpose or cake flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp lemon thyme leaves
  • 0.5 cup olive oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 2 lemon juice
  • 1 Tbsp limoncello (alternative)
  • 60 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1.5 tsp thyme (alternative)
  • 1 tsp rosemary (alternative)
  • 1.5 tsp verbana (alternative)
  • 1.5 tsp tarragon (alternative)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8.5 x 4.5-inch loaf pan
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter and flour an 8.5 x 4.5-inch loaf pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine the 1.5 jars of granulated sugar and lemon zest in a bowl and, using your fingertips, rub them together to distribute the citrus oils.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk the 1 jar of whole plain yogurt and eggs together. Add the zesty sugar and whisk to thoroughly combine. Add the 3 jars of all-purpose or cake flour, baking powder, salt and lemon thyme leaves and whisk just to combine. Add the 1 jar of olive oil and whisk until homogeneous.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Prepare the glaze by mixing the lemon juice or juice of 1 lemon plus 1 Tbsp limoncello (alternative) and 30 to 60 g of confectioners' sugar together until smooth. Drizzle this over the cake once it has come to room temperature. Scatter the lemon thyme leaves, for decoration.

Note

Substitute thyme (alternative), rosemary (alternative), verbana (alternative), or tarragon (alternative).

Note

This recipe can be made in an 8-inch springform or a 9-inch round cake pan. A 9-inch cake will only take around 30 to 35 minutes to take, whereas and 8-inch round will take closer to 40 and medium loaf between 35 and 45 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Gateau: The Surprising Simplicity of French Cakes

docs.title: Marble Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.84 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 210 g all-purpose flour
  • 40 g cornstarch
  • 2.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 181 g sour cream
  • 0.25 cup whole milk
  • 227 g unsalted butter
  • 300 g granulated sugar
  • 2 large eggs
  • :egge: 1 large egg yolk
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Chocolate Marbling
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp whole milk
  • 15 g unsalted butter
  • 1 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 30 g cocoa powder
  • 0.13 tsp baking soda

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 77 g white chocolate
  • 40 g semisweet or bittersweet chocolate
  • 77 g hot heavy whipping cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 liquid measuring cup (or a small bowl)
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 fine-mesh strainer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust the oven rack to middle position and preheat the oven to 350°F / 180°C. Butter and flour (or generously spray with a non-stick cooking spray) a 10-cup bundt pan (*see note).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a liquid measuring cup (or a small bowl) whisk together the sour cream and whole milk. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment (or in a large bowl and an electric hand mixer), beat the unsalted butter on medium speed until creamy, ribbon-like and slightly lightened up; 2 to 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: With the mixer running on medium-low speed, gradually add in the granulated sugar. Raise the speed to medium-high and continue beating together until lightened up in both color and texture; 4 to 5 minutes. The color should turn very pale (almost white) and texture should look fluffy.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the eggs and egg yolk, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add in the vanilla and beat together for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: On lowest speed, add in one-third of the flour mixture and mix until mostly combined. Add in half of the sour cream/milk mixture and lightly stir until almost mixed in. Continue with adding another one-third of the flour mixture, followed by the remaining sour cream and ending with the last third of flour mixture. Mix until just combined and a smooth batter forms. Do not overmix. With a rubber spatula, give the batter one good, final stir to make sure that everything is well incorporated.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Remove 1.5 cups of the batter from the bowl and set aside.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: In a medium bowl, combine the whole milk, unsalted butter and granulated sugar and heat in the microwave until the butter has melted. Whisk to dissolve the sugar. Add in the cocoa powder and stir really well until there are no lumps and a very thick chocolate paste forms. Add in the baking soda and stir again.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
Take a few tablespoons from the reserved vanilla cake batter and stir really well into the chocolate paste to lighten it up. Add the remaining reserved cake batter into the chocolate mixture and fold until evenly incorporated and no light streaks remain.

Note

The following method of marbling creates a cake with subtle marbleness, meaning that the vanilla and chocolate portions are more distinct in 2 different ends like a yin yang, instead of them being thoroughly mixed in a zebra-like pattern. It's just a matter of preference. Please see note below for a more layered marbling effect.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Transfer the vanilla cake batter into the prepared pan, then using the back of a spoon, make a tunnel in the middle, around the pan. Spoon the chocolate batter into the tunnel, avoiding the sides. Using a butter knife, swirl the 2 batters together in an 'S' shape motion.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Bake in the oven for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the center springs back to the touch and a skewer inserted down the center of the cake comes out clean or with a few moist but cooked crumbs attached.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Allow to cool in the pan for 20 minutes then invert on to a wire rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Serve plain or dust with powered sugar or drizzle with the milk chocolate ganache glaze (recipe below) if you prefer.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: The cake will keep for 3 days stored in air-tight container, at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: In a small microwave-safe bowl, combine together white chocolate and semisweet or bittersweet chocolate and heat in the microwave, stirring every 15 seconds, until almost completely melted; about 1.5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Remove from the microwave and stir until completely melted.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Pour the hot heavy whipping cream on top of the chocolates and stir until completely smooth. It will look broken at the beginning but will come together just fine as you continue to stir. If you'd like, press the glaze through a fine-mesh strainer for a smoother finish.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Allow the ganache to cool a bit, until it mounds slightly before smoothly disappearing; about 0.5 hour.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: Use the glaze right away or cover until ready to use, reheating it in 3 second bursts in the microwave until desired consistency is achieved.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://cleobuttera.com/cakes/moist-and-tender-marble-cake/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-marble-cake-bake-off/

docs.title: Olive Oil Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 1.78 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 1.25 cup granulated sugar
  • 3 large egg
  • 1 lemon
  • 0.75 cup olive oil
  • 0.75 cup milk
  • 2 tsp granulated sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 inch round cake pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 handheld electric mixer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease 9 inch round cake pan. Line bottom with 6-inch parchment paper round and line sides with two 10-inch strips of parchment. Spray parchment lightly, Whisk all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt together in bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Using handheld electric mixer, mix 1.25 cup granulated sugar, egg, and lemon zest in bowl on low speed until combined. Increase speed to high and whip until mixture is fluffy and pale yellow, about 2 minutes. Reduce speed to medium and, with mixer running, slowly pour in olive oil. Mix until oil is fully incorporated, about 30 seconds. Add half of flour mixture and mix on low speed until incorporated, about 30 seconds. Add milk and mix until combined, about 30 seconds. Add remaining flour mixture and mix until just incorporated, about 30 seconds, scraping down bowl as needed.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Transfer batter to prepared pan. Sprinkle remaining 2 teaspoons granulated sugar over entire surface. Bake until cake is deep golden brown and toothpick inserted in center comes out with few crumbs attached, about 30 minutes. Transfer pan to wire rack and let cool for 15 minutes. Gently invert pan onto rack; remove all parchment and reinvert. Let cake cool completely, about 1 hour. Cut into wedges and serve. (Cake can be wrapped in plastic wrap and stored at room temperature for up to 3 days.)

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• Cook's Illustrated
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2022/03/31/best-olive-oil-cake-bake-off/
  • https://www.cleveland.com/cooking/2017/12/olive_oil_cake_from_americas_t.html

docs.title: Pineapple Upside Down Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 9 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup butter
  • 0.5 cup brown sugar
  • 5 fans pineapple
  • 1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake and Baking cake mix
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 stick butter
  • 1 cup milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8-inch square baking pan
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 heatproof serving plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Add 1/4 cup butter to an 8-inch square baking pan and place in oven to melt, 5 minutes. Remove pan from oven and sprinkle brown sugar over butter. Layer pineapple fans over butter and sugar mixture to cover base of pan; set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, add TJ's Vanilla Cake and Baking cake mix, eggs, melted butter and milk. Stir to combine. Pour cake batter evenly atop prepared pineapple fans. Place pan in oven on center rack and bake 45 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and immediately run a knife around edges to loosen cake. Carefully flip pan onto a heatproof serving plate. Leave pan over plate for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove baking pan and rearrange any pineapple slices that did not transfer to the cake. Serve warm, with TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream, if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text:
• Trader Joe's
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Poppy Seed Almond Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.60 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 390 g all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp poppy seeds
  • 465 g granulated sugar
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 tsp almond extract
  • 360 g whole milk
  • 3 eggs
  • 288 g neutral oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Glaze
docs.text:
• 90 g confectioners' sugar
  • 57 g orange juice
  • 2 tsp (10 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp almond extract

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bundt pan or 2 loaf pans
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 cake tester
  • 1 small offset spatula
  • 1 cooling rack
  • 1 skewer
  • 1 pastry brush

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Prepare a bundt pan or 2 loaf pans with a neutral oil and flour.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add baking powder, all-purpose flour, salt, poppy seeds, and granulated sugar to bowl of stand mixer and mix.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add vanilla extract and almond extract to room temperature whole milk.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add room temperature eggs, neutral oil and milk mixture to bowl and mix with dry ingredients.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Mix for about 1 minute on medium-high.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in oven for 80 to 90 minutes.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Make the glaze by adding confectioners' sugar, orange juice, melted unsalted butter, vanilla extract, and almond extract to a small bowl.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Whisk until there are no more lumps and set aside.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Check the cake with a cake tester until the cake tester is clean.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Separate the edges of the cake from the pan using a small offset spatula.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Let the cake cook in the pan for about 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Turn the cake out of the pan by putting a cooling rack over the pan and then flipping the pan upside down.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Poke the cake with a skewer to add holes for the glaze to seep into.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Glaze the cake while still warm with a pastry brush.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Wait for the cake to cool and the glaze to crystallize before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IBlRFuMjvZE

docs.title: Pound Cake
docs.text: Total Time 1.47 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 196 g unsalted butter
  • 250 g granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 large egg yolk
  • 120 g sour cream
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 187 g all-purpose flour

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 X 5 inch metal loaf pan
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 offset spatula
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Set a rack in the lower-middle position and heat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9 X 5 inch metal loaf pan with butter.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the unsalted butter, granulated sugar, baking powder, and salt on medium-high speed until pale and very fluffy, stopping once during mixing to scrape down the paddle and bowl, 6 to 8 minutes total. (You might think it’s done before that time, but keep going all the way.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Scrape down the paddle and sides of the bowl. On medium-high speed, beat in the eggs and egg yolk one at a time, scraping down the paddle and the bowl after each addition. The batter should look very fluffy, creamy, and emulsified (if not, your eggs or butter may have been not at room temperature - let the mixture come to room temperature then try mixing it again).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Scrape down the paddle and sides of the bowl. In a small bowl, stir together the sour cream and vanilla until lump-free and totally smooth.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add half of the sour cream and mix on medium-low until just incorporated, about 15 seconds. Add half of the all-purpose flour and mix until just incorporated, about 15 seconds. Repeat with the remaining sour cream and flour. Using a flexible rubber spatula, scrape down the paddle and the bowl and mix the batter a few times to make sure everything is evenly combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Scrape the batter into the prepared pan and roughly level the batter with the spatula. With a butter knife or offset spatula, swirl the knife through the batter to make sure it is evenly distributed into the pan with no big air pockets and give the pan a few swift taps against the counter. Wet a butter knife and use it to slice down the center of the loaf cake (this ensures an even crack right down the middle of the cake).

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake until the crust is deeply browned, the loaf rises and splits, and the cake feels firm and set when you gently press the top, 60 to 70 minutes. (This is a very moist cake and it is better to overbake rather than underbake. If the crust is looking very dark partway through, set a wire rack just above the loaf pan and place a rimmed baking sheet on it to provide a shield.)

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cool the cake in the pan for 10 minutes, then run an offset spatula or butter knife around the sides to loosen. Tip the cake into your hand, then place on a wire rack to fully cool before slicing.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://food52.com/recipes/84768-best-pound-cake-recipe
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/2022/02/18/best-pound-cake-bake-off/
  • https://youtu.be/ODFho7KaDbY?si=bNItHj_2-XMHBGNy

docs.title: Prinsesstårta (Swedish Princess Cake)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 to 16 4 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Vanilla Custard
docs.text:
• 600 ml whole milk
  • 1 vanilla pod
  • 6 egg yolks
  • 100 g granulated sugar
  • 50 g cornflour
  • 50 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Jam
docs.text:
• 200 g raspberries
  • 175 g jam sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - Sponge
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp water
  • 4 large eggs
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 75 g cornflour
  • 75 g all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 50 g melted unsalted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Fondant Rose
docs.text:
• 25 g pink fondant
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - Decoration
docs.text:
• 750 ml heavy cream
  • 50 g dark chocolate (36 percent solids), melted

docs.title: Ingredients - Marzipan
docs.text:
• 400 g ground almonds
  • 150 g granulated sugar
  • 250 g confectioners' sugar
  • 2 medium eggs
  • 1 tsp almond extract
  • some green food coloring paste

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 pan
  • 1 clingfilm
  • 1 deep saucepan
  • 1 sugar thermometer
  • 1 heatproof bowl
  • 1 23cm/9 inch springform tin
  • 1 baking parchment
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 large metal spoon
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 greaseproof paper
  • 1 serrated knife
  • 1 serving plate
  • 1 piping bag
  • 1 small plain nozzle
  • 1 small star nozzle

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: For the vanilla custard, pour the whole milk into a pan with the vanilla seeds and vanilla pod and place over a low heat until just simmering. Remove from the heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, whisk the egg yolks, granulated sugar and cornflour together until pale and creamy.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove the vanilla pod from the warm milk. (You can rinse this off to use in making vanilla sugar.)

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir the warm milk slowly into the egg mixture. Pour the mixture back into the pan and cook over a low heat for 4 to 5 minutes, whisking, until the mixture thickens. (It should be very thick.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove from the heat and beat in the unsalted butter until melted and incorporated. Transfer to a bowl, cover the surface with clingfilm to prevent a skin forming and leave to cool. Set aside to chill in the fridge.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: For the jam, tip the raspberries into a deep saucepan with the jam sugar and two tablespoons of water. Cook gently over a low heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is dissolved. Bring the mixture to the boil and boil vigorously for about 4 minutes, or until the temperature reaches 104°C / 219°F on a sugar thermometer. Transfer to a heatproof bowl and leave to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: For the sponge, preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) / 160°C (fan) / Gas 4. Grease and line the base of a 23cm/9 inch springform tin with baking parchment.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Put the eggs and granulated sugar into a large bowl and using an electric mixer, whisk together until the mixture is very pale and thick and the whisk leaves a trail on the surface when lifted. This will take about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Sift the cornflour, all-purpose flour and baking powder over the egg mixture and carefully fold in using a large metal spoon. Fold in the melted unsalted butter, taking care not to over mix.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Pour the mixture into the lined tin and bake for 25 30 minutes until the sponge is golden-brown and has just started to shrink away from the sides of the tin. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool. When cool enough to handle, turn out on to a wire rack to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: For the fondant rose, roll 10 little pieces of pink fondant into small balls about the size of a cherry stone.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Dust two small pieces of greaseproof paper with confectioners' sugar and one by one, place the balls of fondant between the sheets of greaseproof and flatten each ball out with your fingers, to a thin circle, approximately 2 cm / 1 inch in diameter. These form the petals. Roll the first petal up like a sausage to form a bud and wrap the remaining petals around the bud to make a rose. Bend and curl the edges of the petals, to make them look more realistic. Leave to dry for at least 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: To assemble the cake, using a serrated knife, cut the cake horizontally into three even layers. Place one of the sponges onto a serving plate. Spread a very thin layer of custard over the base of the first sponge.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Spoon a quarter of the custard into a piping bag fitted with a small plain nozzle and pipe a border around the edge of the sponge – this is to contain the jam.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Spoon the jam over the sponge, and spread evenly within the border.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: In a bowl, whip 600 ml / 20 fl-oz of the heavy cream to firm peaks. Fold half of the whipped cream into the remaining custard.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Spread one-third of the custard cream over the jam.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Place the second sponge on top and spread over the remaining custard cream.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Place the third sponge on top. Spoon over the remaining whipped cream covering the sides and smoothing into a small dome shape on the top. Set aside in the fridge for an hour.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: For the marzipan, mix the ground almonds, granulated sugar, confectioners' sugar in a mixer fitted with a dough hook, before adding the eggs and almond extract.

docs.title: Step 21
docs.text: Knead in the bowl until it forms a stiff dough. Turn out onto a surface dusted with icing sugar. Using a cocktail stick add a tiny amount of green food coloring paste and knead to an even pastel green color.

docs.title: Step 22
docs.text: Roll out the marzipan on a surface lightly dusted with icing sugar, to a 40 cm / 16 in diameter circle, large enough to cover the cake. Lift the marzipan up over the cake and using your hands, shape the marzipan around the sides of the cake to get a smooth finish. Trim any excess.

docs.title: Step 23
docs.text: Whip the remaining 150 ml / 5.5 fl-oz of cream to medium peaks and spoon into a piping bag fitted with a small star nozzle. Pipe around the base of the cake.

docs.title: Step 24
docs.text:
Spoon the melted chocolate into a small paper piping bag. Snip off the end and pipe a swirl over the top of the cake. Top with the fondant rose.

Tip

The custard, jam, fondant roses and marzipan can all be made the day before, leaving you time to rest up before the assembly. If you used store-bought jam and marzipan, we wouldn’t hold it against you.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/prinsesstrta_17336

docs.title: Reine be Saba (Queen of Sheba)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 4 oz bittersweet chocolate
  • 2 Tbsp strong, hot coffee
  • 3 egg whites
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 2 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 8 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 0.33 cup pulverized almonds
  • 2 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 0.25 tsp almond extract
  • 0.5 cup all-purpose flour

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 3 oz bittersweet chocolate, chopped fine
  • 2 Tbsp strong, hot coffee
  • 6 Tbsp unsalted butter, softened and cut into cubes
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 cup slivered almonds

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8 x 1.5 inch round cake pan
  • 1 8 inch piece of parchment paper
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 325°F. Set the rack to the lower middle level. Butter an 8 x 1.5 inch round cake pan, place an 8 inch piece of parchment paper in the bottom, brush with butter and coat the whole pan with flour.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a small bowl, combine the bittersweet chocolate and the strong, hot coffee. Set aside for a few minutes for the chocolate to melt. (If the chocolate doesn’t melt down completely, place the bowl in a few inches of hot water for a minute or two.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, beat the egg whites until foaming, add the salt, and continue beating until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in the 2 tablespoons of granulated sugar and continue beating until shiny peaks form. Don’t make the whites too stiff or they’ll be difficult to incorporate. Set aside while you go on to the next steps but don’t dawdle, as you want to use the whites as soon as possible.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In another bowl, using the same beaters, cream the unsalted butter until soft, add the 1/2 cup sugar and beat until fluffy. Then beat in the egg yolks.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Stir the warm chocolate into the yolk mixture, then add the pulverized almonds with 2 Tbsp granulated sugar and almond extract. Gently stir a dollop of the egg whites into the chocolate mixture to lighten it. Add the remaining whites and, alternating with sprinkles of the flour, gently but quickly fold in the whites.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Turn the batter into the prepared pan and spread the batter evenly over the bottom. Place in the preheated oven and bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the edges of the cake are set about 3 inches in but the center is still a little soft and shiny.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove from the oven and place on a rack and cool for 10 minutes, then carefully run a knife around the edges and unmold onto the rack, peeling off the parchment paper. The center may want to stick to the pan. If so, just use a knife to scoop it back into the center of the cake. This little blotch will be covered with the frosting. Let it cool completely.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Place the bittersweet chocolate, chopped fine and the strong, hot coffee in a bowl, stir, and set aside in a warm place for the chocolate to melt. You may have to place the bowl in a few inches hot water if the chocolate doesn’t melt completely. Stir until smooth.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Whisk the unsalted butter, softened and cut into cubes, one cube at a time, into the chocolate along with the salt, until all of the butter is incorporated. The mixture may be a bit runny. If so, set it on the counter until it thickens to spreading consistency.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Frost the top and sides of the cake and decorate the top with a swirl if you’d like. Picking the cake up in your left hand, press the slivered almonds into the side of the cake with your right hand, tilting the cake slightly so the excess almonds fall off.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Serve with pride and joy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/what-is-your-favorite-julia-ch-106817

docs.title: Rhubarb Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 loaf 2.12 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some Demerara sugar
  • 454 g rhubarb
  • 1 Tbsp water
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 228 g all-purpose flour
  • 2.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp orange zest
  • 250 g granulated sugar
  • 113 g melted unsalted butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 80 g whole-milk Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 loaf pan
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 foil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: reheat the oven to 350°F and coat the loaf pan with butter. Line with parchment paper and sprinkle Demerara sugar on the bottom and sides of the pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Choose the thinnest rhubarb stalks, or trim accordingly, making about 4 to 5 pieces that are about 8.5 inches in length. Set these pieces aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Chop up the remaining rhubarb into 1/2 inch pieces. Transfer 227 g into a small saucepan and set aside the remaining 113 g to fold into the batter later.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add 1 Tbsp water to the saucepan and cook the chopped rhubarb over medium heat, stirring often and mashing with the back of a wooden spoon, until the pieces have broken down. Claire notes the mixture should begin to resemble applesauce, which will take about 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Once the mixture is cooled, stir in the baking soda, it will bubble and turn a grayish color which is normal! Set mixture aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk the all-purpose flour, baking powder and salt, set aside.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, massage the orange zest with the granulated sugar until it looks like wet sand.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Stir in the melted unsalted butter, and room temperature eggs.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Whisk in the whole-milk Greek yogurt, vanilla, and rhubarb mush until smooth. Scrape the bowl as needed until all the dry ingredients disappear.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Switch to a flexible spatula and fold in the remaining 113 g of chopped rhubarb into the batter.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Scrape the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Place the reserved rhubarb stalks over the top of the batter in parallel lines. Sprinkle with Demerara sugar, or regular sugar, and bake for 60 minutes.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Reduce the temp to 325°F and cook for an additional 30 to 40 minutes or until the cake tester comes out clean. Tent the top with foil if it starts to get too brown.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Let cool for 20 minutes in the pan before removing it from the pan and letting it cool completely.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://youtube.com/watch?v=WsQOYaSauMk&si=hXDlk67yF1IiksUM

docs.title: Smash Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 2.25 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.75 cup unsalted butter
  • 0.75 cup maple syrup
  • 0.5 cup applesauce
  • 2 large eggs
  • 0.33 cup milk
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 16 oz cream cheese
  • 0.5 cup plain whole milk Greek yogurt
  • 0.33 cup maple syrup
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.25 cup freeze-dried strawberry

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 parchment paper
  • 1 5" round pans
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. On parchment paper, trace the bottom of a 5" round and cut out three circles. Place the parchment paper into 3 different 5" round pans and grease or spray.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, sift the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt together. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl with a hand mixer or stand mixer, add the unsalted butter. Cream (mix) for 1 minute. Add in the maple syrup and beat for 1 minute, scraping down the sides as needed. Add in the applesauce and beat for 1 minute, scraping down the sides as needed. Add in the eggs, milk, and vanilla and mix for 1 to 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add in the flour mixture, and mix until just incorporated.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Divide the batter equally between the 3 round pans. Bake for 22 to 26 minutes or until golden brown around the edges and a toothpick comes out clean when inserted in the center.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then invert layers onto a cooling rack, remove the parchment paper, and set aside to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: In a large bowl with a hand mixer or stand mixer, add in the cream cheese, plain whole milk Greek yogurt, maple syrup, and vanilla extract and beat on medium-high for 3 to 4 minutes or until soft and smooth. If too thick, you may need to add in 1-2 tablespoons of milk.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Divide the frosting into two bowls and add in the freeze-dried strawberry into one of them. Mix until incorporated.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Place one of the round cakes on a serving platter and top with 1/2 cup of strawberry frosting, spreading the frosting to the edges. Add on the second round cake, and spread 1/2 cup of frosting. Add on the third round cake.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Add on the white cream cheese frosting generously to the top and top half of the sides in the tiered cake. Take the rest of the strawberry frosting and starting on the bottom of the cake and working your way up to the top mix the two frostings together in the middle of the cake creating an ombre effect.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://babyfoode.com/blog/healthy-smash-cake-baby/

docs.title: Sour Cream Coffee Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 51 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Streusel
docs.text:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 1 cup unsalted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 2.25 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1.25 cups granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp baking powder
  • 0.75 tsp baking soda
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.75 cup unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup sour cream
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 cup milk
  • 2 cups confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 x 13 inch cake pan
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 larger bowl
  • 1 large bowl or stand mixer
  • 1 paddle attachment}
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F. Grease a 9 x 13 inch cake pan with nonstick spray or rub with butter.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, whisk together 3 cup all-purpose flour, 1 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1 teaspoon salt, and 2 tablespoons cinnamon.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Melt 1 cup unsalted butter in a small bowl in the microwave. Pour into the larger bowl and stir the butter into the flour. You should end up with a bowl of what looks like wet sand, with lots of big chunks. Don’t try to smooth it out.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large bowl or stand mixer, whisk together 2 and 1/4 cups all-purpose flour, 1 and 1/4 cups granulated sugar, 1 tablespoon baking powder, 3/4 teaspoon baking soda, and 3/4 teaspoon salt.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Chop 3/4 cup softened unsalted butter into chunks. You want the butter to sit out of the fridge for several minutes to that it’s not rock-hard, but don’t let it soften so much that it’s completely creamy.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the chopped butter and 1/2 cup sour cream to the flour mixture. Use the paddle attachment}| (or electric beaters) to blend the butter in. Eventually the butter will moisten the flour and it will all come together in a ball. Scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl as necessary. Don’t over mix, just beat until all the butter is incorporated.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: In another large bowl, whisk together 4 eggs, 1 cup sour cream, and 1 tablespoon vanilla. Beat well until the eggs are well blended.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture in 3 additions, beating for about 20 seconds after each one. Once all the egg mixture is added, beat for another 1 minute until the batter is light and fluffy.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Spread 2 cups of batter into the bottom of your prepared cake pan. Sprinkle 1 cup of streusel evenly over the top, breaking up any too-large pieces with your hands.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Spread another 2 cups batter on top and spread it around as best you can.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Add another 1 cup streusel on top.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Add the rest of the batter and spread evenly.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Evenly spread another 2 cups of streusel on top of the cake. Do NOT add all the remaining streusel! There will be some left over. Spread the remaining streusel on a baking sheet to dry out a little bit.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Bake the cake at 350 for 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Do this next part fast. Remove the cake from the oven and shut the oven door. Use your hands to sprinkle all the remaining streusel on top of the cake, focusing on any areas where the cake batter has puffed up from the center. Move quickly! Get the cake back in the oven as soon as you can, and keep the oven door shut as much as possible.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Bake for another 20 to 25 minutes. The total bake time for the cake should be about 45 to 50 minutes, depending on your oven and whether you use a glass or metal pan. Test the cake with a toothpick. It is done when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with no wet batter on it. The cake should not wobble around at all when you shake the pan.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Let the cake cool on a wire rack for at least 15 to 20 minutes for cutting into it.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: In a medium bowl, beat 1/4 cup unsalted butter until smooth. (I actually did it by hand with a whisk. You can do this if your butter is ultra soft.)

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Add 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 cup milk, and 2 cups confectioners' sugar. Beat with a mixer or by hand until very smooth.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: Drizzle the icing over the cake. You can either drizzle it over the whole cake or drizzle each individual serving. I like to drizzle about half the icing over the whole cake, and then save the rest of drizzling over each serving.

docs.title: Step 21
docs.text: The cake is best served warm! Zap individual servings in the microwave for 10 to 20 seconds if you are serving after the cake has cooled.

docs.title: Step 22
docs.text: This cake will keep well covered on the counter for 2-3 days. After that, put it in the fridge.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://thefoodcharlatan.com/sour-cream-coffee-cake/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-coffee-cake-bake-off/

docs.title: Southern Velvet Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 2 Tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 cups granulated sugar
  • 1 cup vegetable oil
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 cup buttermilk
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 2 oz red food coloring
  • 0.5 cup plain hot coffee
  • 1 tsp white vinegar
  • 1 cream cheese frosting

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 inch round cake pans
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 cooling rack
  • 1 knife or offset spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 325°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Generously grease and flour (2) 9 inch round cake pans. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, baking soda, baking powder, unsweetened cocoa powder, and salt. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large bowl, combine the granulated sugar and vegetable oil.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Mix in the eggs, buttermilk, vanilla, and 1 to 2 oz of red food coloring until combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Stir in the plain hot coffee and white vinegar.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients a little at a time, mixing after each addition, just until combined. (Batter will be thin)

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Pour the batter evenly into each pan.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake in the middle rack for 30 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with moist crumbs clinging to it. Do not overbake as the cake will continue to cook as it cools.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Let pans cool on a cooling rack until the pans are warm to the touch.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Slide a knife or offset spatula around the inside of the pans to loosen the cake from the pan.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Gently remove the cakes from the pan and let them finish cooling. (The warm cake will be very delicate)

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Frost the cake with cream cheese frosting when the cakes have cooled completely.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://divascancook.com/the-best-red-velvet-cake-recipe-easy-homemade-moist-with-southern-flair/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/red-velvet-cake-recipe-reviews-23284551

docs.title: Strawberry Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 to 12 6 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Purée
docs.text: • 454 g strawberries

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 285 g cake flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 170 g unsalted butter
  • 350 g granulated sugar
  • 5 large egg whites
  • 75 g sour cream or plain yogurt
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 120 ml whole milk
  • 2 drops food coloring

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 25 g freeze-dried strawberries
  • 1 8-oz full-fat cream cheese
  • 113 g unsalted butter
  • 360 g confectioners' sugar
  • 1 Tbsp whole milk
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch round cake pans
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 handheld or stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 blender or food processor
  • 1 large serrated knife

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the reduced strawberry puree first, and let cool: Puree 1 pound of rinsed and hulled strawberries. You should have a little over 1 cup. Stirring occasionally, simmer the puree over medium-low heat until you’re left with 1/2 cup or slightly more (you need 1/2 cup for the cake). This takes at least 25 to 35 minutes, but could take longer depending on your pan or how juicy your strawberries were. Allow to cool completely before using in cake batter. I always make the reduced puree the day before so it has plenty of time to cool down. I cover and place in the refrigerator overnight. Allow it to come back to room temperature before adding to the cake batter. (See Notes for further make-ahead instructions.)

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C). Grease two 9-inch round cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the unsalted butter and granulated sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamed, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Beat in the egg whites on high speed until combined, about 2 minutes. Then beat in the room temperature sour cream or plain yogurt and vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the whole milk, at room temperature, just until combined. Do not overmix. Whisk in 1/2 cup of room-temperature reduced strawberry puree, making sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. The batter will be slightly thick. Stir in food coloring, if desired. (I use 1 small drop of pink gel food coloring.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour batter evenly into cake pans. Bake for around 24 to 25 minutes or until the cakes are baked through. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it is done. Allow cakes to cool completely in the pans set on a wire rack. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Using a blender or food processor, process the freeze-dried strawberries into a powdery crumb. You should have around 1/2 cup crumbs. Set aside. In a large bowl using a hand-held or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the full-fat cream cheese for 1 minute on high speed until completely smooth and creamy. Beat in the unsalted butter until combined. Add the confectioners' sugar, strawberry powder, 1 Tablespoon whole milk, and vanilla and beat on medium-high speed until combined and creamy. Add 1 more Tablespoon of milk to slightly thin out, if desired. Taste, then add a pinch of salt if needed. Yields about 3 cups of frosting.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: First, using a large serrated knife, slice a thin layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. Discard (or crumble over ice cream!). Place 1 cake layer on your cake stand or serving plate. Evenly cover the top with frosting. Top with 2nd layer and spread the remaining frosting all over the top and sides. Refrigerate for at least 45 minutes before slicing. This helps the cake keep its shape when cutting. It could slightly fall apart without time in the fridge.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cover leftover cake tightly and store in the refrigerator for 5 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cake/

docs.title: The Original Boston Cream Pie
docs.text: Total Time 21 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 7 egg
  • 8 oz granulated sugar
  • 1 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 oz melted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Pastry Cream
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 cups milk
  • 2 cups light cream
  • 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 3.5 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 6 eggs
  • 1 tsp dark rum

docs.title: Ingredients - Icing
docs.text:
• 6 oz white fondant
  • 3 oz semisweet chocolate
  • 5 oz white fondant

docs.title: Ingredients - Chocolate Icing
docs.text:
• 6 oz semisweet chocolate
  • 2 oz warm water

docs.title: Ingredients - White Icing
docs.text:
• 1 cup confectioners' sugar
  • 1 tsp corn syrup
  • 1 tsp warm water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 wooden spatula
  • 1 10-inch greased cake pan
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 slicing knife
  • 1 piping bag

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Separate egg yolks and whites into two separate bowls. Add 1/2 of the granulated sugar to each bowl. Beat both until peaked. When stiff, fold the whites into the yolk mixture. Gradually add all-purpose flour, mixing with a wooden spatula. Mix in the melted butter. Pour this mixture into a 10-inch greased cake pan. Bake at 350°F for about 20 minutes, or until spongy and golden. Remove from the oven and allow to cool fully.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bring to a boil in a saucepan the unsalted butter, milk and light cream. While this mixture is cooking, combine the granulated sugar, cornstarch and eggs in a bowl and whip until ribbons form. When the cream, milk, and butter mixture reaches the boiling point, whisk in the egg mixture and cook to boiling. Boil for 1 minute. Pour into a bowl and cover the surface with plastic wrap. Chill overnight if possible. When chilled, whisk to smooth out and flavor with 1 tsp dark rum.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Level the sponge cake off at the top using a slicing knife. Cut the cake into two layers. Spread the flavored pastry cream over one layer. Top with the second cake layer. Reserve a small amount of the pastry cream to spread on the sides to adhere to the almonds.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Warm 6 oz. of white fondant over boiling water to approximately 105 degrees. Add melted semisweet chocolate. Thin to a spreading consistency with water.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Warm 5 oz. of white fondant over boiling water to approximately 105 degrees. Thin with water if necessary. Place in a piping bag with a 1/8-inch tip.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Melt the semisweet chocolate. Combine with warm water. Combine ingredients and warm to approximately 105 degrees. Adjust the consistency with water. It should flow freely from the pastry bag.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Spread a thin layer of chocolate fondant icing on the top of the cake. Follow immediately with spiral lines starting from the center of the cake, using the white fondant in the pastry bag. Score the white lines with the point of a paring knife, starting at the center and pulling outward to the edge. Spread sides of cake with a thin coating of the reserved pastry cream. Press on toasted almonds for the final step of our classic Boston Cream Pie recipe.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.omnihotels.com/blog/boston-cream-pie-recipe-original/

docs.title: The Perfect Chocolate Cake
docs.text: Total Time 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 220 g all-purpose flour
  • 300 g granulated sugar
  • 45 g unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 2 g baking powder
  • 3 g baking soda
  • 1 g salt
  • 2 large eggs
  • 115 g vegetable oil
  • 225 g whole milk
  • 1 chocolate ganache

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8 inch round cake pan
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 spatula
  • 1 serrated knife
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 cooking tray
  • 1 offset spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Butter the bottom, sides, & edges of the 8 inch round cake pan. Pour in some all-purpose flour & shake around until evenly coated. Tap out any excess. (If you don’t plan on frosting your cake, use cocoa powder instead of flour to dust the pan so you won’t see white spots on the cake when unmolded.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk together flour, granulated sugar, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, & salt in a large bowl until combined.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk together eggs, vegetable oil, & whole milk in a medium bowl until combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add wet ingredients to the dry ingredients in thirds, mixing with a spatula until combined after each addition to create a smooth chocolate batter.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Pour batter into the prepared pan until it reaches halfway up the sides. Level the surface with a spatula. Bake until cake is set in the center, 45 to 50 minutes There are 3 ways to check if it’s done:

  1. Jiggle it: The cake should wiggle a little in the middle. If it wiggles a lot, it’s not ready.
  2. Nudge it: Press the top gently; it should bounce back to your touch.
  3. Poke it: Stick a paring knife into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it’s done.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Let the cake cool in the pan for 15 minutes. While still warm, place a large plate over it, flip the plate & pan together; the cake should easily slide out. (Run a paring knife along the side of the pan if needed).

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Slice the cake into 4 1/4 in inch thick layers using a serrated knife.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add chocolate ganache, that should be the consistency of tooth paste, in between the layers of the cake and on top and the sides.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Set the cake in the refrigerator to cool.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Add plastic wrap and wire rack to cooking tray. Set cake on top of wire rack.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Microwave ganache for about 30 to 45 seconds to make it more liquid.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Pour ganache over cake and let it run off the sides and into the tray. Use offset spatula to go over the top of the cake once to remove the excess ganache.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Lift cake and scrape off excess ganache from the bottom edges to catch the drips.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=71_lLTlE8vM

docs.title: Tiramisù
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 1.22 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Ladyfingers
docs.text:
• 6 egg
  • 0.75 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - Ladyfingers - Soaking Liquid
docs.text:
• 1.75 cups coffee
  • 0.33 cup rum (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 6 egg
  • 0.5 cup whole milk
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1.5 cups heavy whipping cream
  • 0.25 cup confectioners' sugar
  • 16 oz chilled custard mascarpone
  • 2 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text: • 1 Tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 8 x 8 or 9 x 9 square pan or 9 round cake pan
  • 1 standing mixer
  • 1 spatula
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 large dish or baking pan
  • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 3 baking sheets with parchment paper. Trace the bottom of an 8 x 8 or 9 x 9 square pan or 9 round cake pan on each piece of parchment paper. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the wire whisk attachment (or in a large bowl with a hand-held mixer), whip egg yolks and 1/4 cup of granulated sugar with an electric mixer until thick and pale. Transfer mixture to a different bowl, scraping the bowl clean. Rinse off the beater.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the wire whisk attachment (or in a large bowl with a hand-held mixer), whip egg whites. Once the mixture starts to thicken, add the remaining 1/2 cup granulated sugar and continue beating. Once stiff peaks form add vanilla and beat to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Gently stir in egg yolk mixture on low speed.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour and salt and gently stir or fold in with a spatula. The batter should be thick and pale yellow.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour about 1 cup of batter into the center of each square traced on the parchment paper. Evenly spread it out to fit the square, leaving about 1/4 inch border. The batter should be about 1/2 inch thick.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Sprinkle confectioners' sugar on top of the ladyfinger batter to get a nice golden top.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes, until set and very lightly browned. Carefully transfer parchment paper to a wire rack to cool.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Once cooled, carefully remove the lady finger squares from the parchment paper, set aside to use in the recipe.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Brew coffee. Let cool. (or use instant coffee or instant espresso and brew 1 3/4 cups).

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Whisk the rum (optional) into the coffee, then pour the mixture into a large dish or baking pan that will fit the layers. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, whisk together egg yolks, whole milk and granulated sugar until combined.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text:
Cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until mixture boils. Turn heat to medium low and boil for 1 minute, remove from heat and transfer the mixture to a container with lid, but don't put the lid on yet. Leave the lid open and whisk the mixture every few minutes until it’s cooled slightly. Then put the lid on and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour.

Note

This can be done before you bake the lady fingers, if desired, so it has time to cool. It can even be done the day before and chilled overnight.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: In the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the wire whisk attachment (or in a large bowl with a hand-held mixer), Beat the heavy whipping cream and confectioners' sugar until stiff peaks form, transfer to a different bowl.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: In the same bowl used to beat whipping cream (but with the cream no longer in it), beat the chilled custard mascarpone and vanilla with the paddle attachment until combined.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Gently fold in beaten whipping cream.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Add cooled custard mixture and beat until combined. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Quickly dip one of the three lady finger layers into the soaking liquid for about 5 to 10 seconds. Do not drop it in and let it sit or it will soak up too much liquid and fall apart. Remember, homemade lady fingers are more delicate than store-bought. If using hard store-bought you will need to soak them longer.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Place it in the bottom of the baking dish you used to trace the shape.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: Spread 1/3 of the filling mixture evenly on top of the layer.

docs.title: Step 21
docs.text: Repeat with the second and third lady finger layers and remaining custard. Alternating soaked lady finger, custard, soaked lady finger, custard.

docs.title: Step 22
docs.text: Sprinkle unsweetened cocoa powder over the top custard layer.

docs.title: Step 23
docs.text: Chill for at least 8 hours, or overnight.

docs.title: Step 24
docs.text: Cut into square portions and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://joyfoodsunshine.com/tiramisu-recipe/

docs.title: Tres Leches Cake with Berries
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 7.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.75 tsp kosher salt
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 cup whole milk
  • 1.25 cups heavy cream
  • 1 12-oz can evaporated milk
  • 1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
  • 0.5 tsp almond extract
  • 1 vanilla bean
  • 5 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Ingredients - Whipped Cream
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups cold heavy cream
  • 0.25 cup confectioners' sugar
  • 2 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp creme fraîche
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 x 13 x 2 inch baking pan
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 electric mixer
  • 1 paddle attachment
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 4 cup liquid measuring cup
  • 1 bamboo skewer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter a 9 x 13 x 2 inch baking pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sift the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and kosher salt into a small bowl and set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place the eggs, 1 cup of granulated sugar, and the vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and beat on medium-high speed for 10 minutes (really!) until light yellow and fluffy.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Reduce the speed to low and slowly add half the flour mixture, then the whole milk, and finally the remaining flour mixture. Mix with a rubber spatula to be sure the batter is well mixed.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour the batter into the prepared pan, smooth the top, and bake for 25 minutes, until the cake springs back when touched lightly in the middle and a cake tester comes out clean.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Set aside to cool in the pan for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: In a 4 cup liquid measuring cup, whisk together the heavy cream, evaporated milk, sweetened condensed milk, almond extract, and vanilla bean seeds.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Using a bamboo skewer, poke holes all over the cooled cake and slowly pour the cream mixture over the cake, allowing it to be absorbed completely before continuing to pour on more of the mixture.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Cover the cake with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 6 hours.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: To serve, toss the fruit with the 5 tablespoons of granulated sugar. Dust the cake with confectioners' sugar, cut in squares, and place on dessert plates. Surround the cake with the fruit, put a dollop of whipped cream on top, and serve.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Place the cold heavy cream, confectioners' sugar, granulated sugar, creme fraîche, and vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Beat on high speed, until it forms soft peaks.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Serve cold.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/ina-garten/tres-leches-cake-with-berries-1-6565515
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-tres-leches-bake-off/

docs.title: Vanilla Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 23 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 198 g granulated sugar
  • 1 vanilla bean
  • 210 g cake flour
  • 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 57 g unsalted butter
  • 2 large eggs
  • 76 g sour cream
  • 50 g canola oil
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 151 g whole milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 medium-sized mixing bowl
  • 1 small mixing bowl
  • 1 8" round cake pans

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a small bowl, combine granulated sugar and seeds from the vanilla bean. (For those of you who are new to using vanilla beans, check out this video to learn how to get the seeds out of the bean.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using the back of a spoon, move around the bowl and apply pressure to break up any clumps of seeds and to better infuse the vanilla flavor into the sugar. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a medium-sized mixing bowl or bowl of a stand mixer, mix together cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the vanilla bean sugar and mix until well combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add room temperature unsalted butter and mix on medium-low speed for 3 minutes. Because there is so little butter, you’ll end up with a very fine crumb texture.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: In a small mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, sour cream, canola oil, and vanilla extract until smooth.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture and beat on medium speed until just combined. Be sure to scrape down the sides of the mixture as needed to make sure that everything is incorporated into the batter.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Slowly add whole milk and mix on low speed until just combined. The batter will be liquid. (Don’t worry, you didn’t do anything wrong. It’s supposed to be that way.)

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Divide the batter evenly between two 8" round cake pans.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Bake for 20 minutes (16 minutes if using a convection oven) and then test to see if they are done. They are done when a toothpick comes out without wet batter stuck to it. The cakes should appear white with specks of vanilla bean. They should not turn a golden brown. If they are not done, test again in two minutes. If they are still not done, test again in another two minutes.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: When the cakes are done, place them on a cooling rack (or just on your counter if you don’t own a cooling rack) to cool to room temperature. Then, refrigerate before frosting.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: For the true vanilla lover, frost with vanilla buttercream frosting, using vanilla bean paste instead of vanilla extract.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.cupcakeproject.com/ultimate-vanilla-cake-recipe/
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-vanilla-cake-bake-off/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/vanilla-cake-recipe-showdown-23651936

docs.title: Vegan Carrot Cake
docs.text: Total Time 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2.25 cups sugar
  • 0.75 cups shredded coconut
  • 1 Tbsp baking soda
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 18 Tbsp canola oil
  • 0.75 cup applesauce
  • 0.75 cup crushed pineapple, juice included
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 3 cups grated carrots

docs.title: Ingredients - Buttercream Frosting
docs.text:
• 1 buttercream frosting (alternate)
  • 8 oz cream cheese
  • 8 Tbsp butter
  • 4 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8-inch cake pans
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 cake pans
  • 1 butter knife
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 hand mixer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: For the cake, preheat oven to 350°F. Line 2 8-inch cake pans with parchment and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Into a large mixing bowl, add all-purpose flour, sugar, shredded coconut, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt, and combine. Add canola oil, applesauce, crushed pineapple, juice included, and vanilla and mix well until combined. Add grated carrots and mix well until incorporated.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Into prepared cake pans, evenly divide batter and bake for 45 to 50 minutes, until a butter knife inserted comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: For the buttercream frosting (alternate), into a large bowl, add cream cheese and butter and beat with a hand mixer until combined. Add confectioners' sugar one cup at a time and slowly mix until fully incorporated. Add vanilla and beat until smooth.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place one cake on a serving plate and spread 1/3 of batter over top evenly. Place second cake on top and frost top and sides with remaining frosting.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://vegnews.com/2022/10/cafe-indigo-vegan-carrot-cake-recipe

docs.title: Vegan Strawberry Cake
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup (160 g) fresh strawberries
  • 0.25 cup vegetable oil
  • 0.67 cup sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • some vegan strawberry frosting
  • some vanilla frosting
  • some chocolate ganache

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking dish
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (176°C) and line a baking dish with parchment paper. This recipe will make one 8x8-inch square, one 9-inch circle, or two 6-inch rounds (adjust if altering batch size).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Make strawberry purée by blending fresh strawberries (160 g) until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To a large mixing bowl, add strawberry purée, vegetable oil, sugar, and vanilla. Whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt to the wet ingredients and mix until fully incorporated with no lumps remaining. The texture should be thick, like cornbread batter.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour the batter into your prepared baking dish, spread into an even layer, and bake on the center rack for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. The center of the cake should be firm but springy when touched and the edges slightly golden brown.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Let your cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before carefully turning it out onto a cooling rack.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Once your cake is completely cool, you can top it with vegan strawberry frosting, vanilla frosting, or a chocolate ganache!

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Best enjoyed the first day but will last, covered, at room temperature up to 3 days. Freeze up to 1 month (then thaw at room temperature).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/vegan-strawberry-cake-gf/

docs.title: Victoria Sandwich Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 3 medium eggs
  • 175 g unsalted butter
  • 175 g granulated sugar
  • 175 g self-raising flour
  • 0.75 tsp vanilla
  • 1 Tbsp warm water

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 150 ml whipping cream (optional)
  • 6 Tbsp raspberry jam
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cake tins
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 plastic spatula
  • 1 fork
  • 1 large metal spoon or plastic spatula
  • 1 round-bladed knife
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 180°C / 160°C fan / 350°F / Gas 4. Grease and line the cake tins with butter and baking paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Weigh the eggs – 3 medium eggs in their shells weigh around 175 g – then use this same weight for the unsalted butter, granulated sugar and self-raising flour.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Put the soft (but not oily) butter into a large mixing bowl or the bowl of a food mixer and beat well with a wooden spoon or the whisk attachment until very creamy and mayonnaise-like. Scrape down any butter mixture from the sides of the bowl with a plastic spatula, then gradually beat in the sugar a couple of tablespoons at a time. Scrape the mixture off the sides of the bowl again and beat well for 1 minute or until the mixture looks very light and fluffy. Scrape down the mixture again.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Break the 3 eggs into a small jug, add the 3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract and beat with a fork just until the eggs are broken up. Gradually add to the butter mixture a tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition and scraping down the sides of the bowl from time to time. If the mixture looks like it might be 'splitting' or curdling, rather than appearing smooth and creamy, stir in a tablespoon of the flour with each of the last two additions of egg.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Sift the rest of the flour onto the mixture. Start to gently fold in the flour with a large metal spoon or plastic spatula and after two or three movements add the warm water. Keep folding in until the flour is well mixed in and there are no streaks.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Divide the mixture between the two prepared tins - if you want to be really precise, use your scales, or just do it by eye, then spread it evenly.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until the sponges are a light golden brown, and starting to shrink back from the sides of the tin. (Check the sponges after 15 minutes and if they aren't baking evenly rotate the trays.) Check that the sponge springs back when lightly pressed in the middle.

docs.title: Step 8
