docs.text: When cooked, take them out of the oven and run a round-bladed knife around the inside of each tin to loosen the sponge. Leave for 1 minute to firm up, then carefully turn out the cakes onto a wire rack. Leave until they are completely cooled.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: If you are using whipping cream (optional), put a bowl and whisk (or whisk attachment) in the fridge to chill.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: To assemble the cake, set one sponge crust-side down on a serving plate. Using the back of a tablespoon, evenly spread the sponge with the 6 tablespoons of raspberry jam.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text:
Pour the cream, if using, into the chilled bowl and whip with the chilled whisk or attachment until it thickens and soft peaks form when you lift out the whisk. Spoon the cream onto the cake and then gently smooth it evenly over the jam. Top with the second sponge, crust-side up, and dust with confectioners' sugar.

Info

A traditional Victoria Sandwich Cake only has raspberry jam in the middle and topped with granulated sugar.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://thegreatbritishbakeoff.co.uk/recipes/all/victoria-sandwich-cake/

docs.title: Yogurt Cake Version 1
docs.text: Total Time 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 125 g whole plain yogurt
  • 3 large eggs
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 180 g all-purpose or cake flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 cup canola oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8.5 x 4.5 inch loaf pan
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter and flour an 8.5 x 4.5 inch loaf pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Empty the 1 jar of whole plain yogurt from its little jar in a mixing bowl. Add the eggs and whisk to combine. Using the yogurt jar as a measuring cup, add 2 jars of granulated sugar. Whisk well. Whisk in 3 jars of all-purpose or cake flour, the baking powder, then 1 jar of canola oil. Whisk until homogeneous.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

Note

This recipe can also be made in an 8-inch springform or a 9-inch round cake pan. A 9-inch cake will only take around 30 to 35 minutes, whereas an 8-inch round will take closer to 40 and a medium loaf between 35 and 45.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Gateau: The Surprising Simplicity of French Cakes

docs.title: Yogurt Cake Version 2
docs.text: Total Time 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 125 g whole plain yogurt
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 180 g all-purpose or cake flour
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup canola oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 8.5 x 4.5 inch loaf pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter and flour an 8.5 x 4.5 inch loaf pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk the 1 jar of whole plain yogurt and eggs together. Whisk in the vanilla and lemon zest. Add the 2 jars of granulated sugar and whisk to thoroughly combine. Add the 3 jars of all-purpose or cake flour, baking powder, and salt and whisk just to combine. Add the 1 jar of canola oil and whisk until homogeneous.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

Note

This recipe can also be made in an 8-inch springform or a 9-inch round cake pan. A 9-inch cake will only take around 30 to 35 minutes, whereas an 8-inch round will take closer to 40 and a medium loaf between 35 and 45.

docs.text: • Gateau: The Surprising Simplicity of French Cakes

docs.title: Yule Log (Classic Bûche de Noël)
docs.text: Total Time 1 hour 12 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 170 g semisweet chocolate
  • 170 g heavy cream
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 85 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 5 large eggs
  • 99 g granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 60 g all-purpose flour
  • 28 g unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 3 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 1 tsp espresso powder (optional)
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 50 g vegetable oil
  • 85 g buttermilk

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 1 cup heavy cream
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 17 g granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp Instant ClearJel
  • 170 g mascarpone
  • some confectioners' sugar (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed half-sheet pan (13" x 18")
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 offset spatula
  • 1 knife
  • 1 cooling rack
  • 1 whisk

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a rimmed half-sheet pan (13" x 18") with parchment and grease the parchment and pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place the semisweet chocolate in a bowl. Heat the heavy cream in a saucepan or in the microwave until it begins to steam. Pour over the chocolate, let sit for 2 to 3 minutes, then stir until the chocolate is completely melted. Set this ganache aside to cool to room temperature while you make the cake.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To make the cake: In a large bowl beat the eggs until thick and pale, then beat in the granulated sugar, salt, and vanilla. Beat until the mixture is thick and the whisk leaves tracks in the bowl; this can take up to 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While the eggs are beating sift together the all-purpose flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, cornstarch, espresso powder (optional) (if using), and baking powder. When the egg mixture is ready, sift a third of the dry ingredients into the bowl and gently fold in; it’s OK if the batter is streaky at first. Repeat twice more until all the dry ingredients have been incorporated.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Whisk together the vegetable oil and buttermilk and fold into the batter, mixing just until combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour the batter into the pan and lightly smooth the top with an offset spatula; it will be thin and might not quite reach the corners: that’s OK. Bake the cake for 10 to 12 minutes, until the top springs back when lightly pressed.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 2 minutes. Loosen the short edges with a knife. Use the parchment under the layer to loosely roll the cake up from the long side. Place it on a cooling rack and let it cool completely, leaving it rolled as it cools.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: To make the filling: Whip the heavy cream until soft peaks form. Mix in the vanilla. Stir together 1 tablespoon of the granulated sugar and the Instant ClearJel and beat into the cream; it will become thicker right away.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Stir the remaining tablespoon of sugar into the mascarpone and mix it into the whipped cream by hand (overwhipping mascarpone can make it grainy), using a whisk to fold in 1/4 cup of the mascarpone mixture at a time.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Once the chocolate ganache has cooled to room temperature, transfer it to a mixing bowl and add the salt and vanilla. Using an electric hand mixer or a stand mixer with the whisk attachment, beat the ganache on low speed and slowly add the unsalted butter in three additions. Once all the butter has been added increase the speed and whip until fluffy, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Unroll the cooled cake and spread the filling inside, leaving 1” on a long end uncovered (as you roll the cake up the filling will get pushed to cover this part). Gently roll the cake back up and place seam-side down on a large serving platter. Cut a 4” piece of the cake at a 45° angle and place the angled edge against the larger log to simulate a branch. Square off the pointed end of the larger log and place that slice on the top of the cake to make another "branch."

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Spread or pipe the frosting all around the outside in a layer at least 1/4” thick. Score the frosting with a skewer or fork with widely spaced tines to make it look like bark. Refrigerate, lightly covered, until ready to serve.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Just before serving, dust the top with confectioners' sugar (optional) if desired. Refrigerate any leftovers, well wrapped, for several days; freeze for longer storage.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/yule-log-classic-buche-de-noel-recipe

docs.title: Chocolate Cupcakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 18 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 cup cocoa powder
  • 0.25 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 2 oz semisweet chocolate
  • 2 large eggs
  • 2 large egg yolks
  • 9 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 0.33 cup full-fat sour cream
  • 0.5 cup room temperature water
  • 1 chocolate ganache

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium-sized bowl
  • 1 fork or whisk
  • 1 medium-sized mixing bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 cupcake liners
  • 1 cupcake tin

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sift together all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, and cocoa powder into a separate medium-sized bowl. Use a fork or whisk to ensure that the ingredients are mixed well after sifting. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium-sized mixing bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, mix unsalted butter and granulated sugar until fully combined. The end result should look like wet sand.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Melt the semisweet chocolate in the microwave or in a double boiler.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once the melted chocolate is cool enough to touch, add it to the butter/sugar mixture and mix until just combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Mix in eggs and egg yolks one at a time until just combined.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Mix in vegetable oil, vanilla, and full-fat sour cream until just combined.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients in three additions, mixing until just combined after each addition.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Mix in room temperature water until just combined.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Fill cupcake liners 2/3 full and put in the oven.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Check for doneness at 18 minutes – a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake should come out clean. If they are not done, check again every three minutes until they are done.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Immediately remove cupcakes from the cupcake tin and place on a cooling rack or on the counter to cool to room temperature. Although they are really good when they are hot, be sure to wait until they are room temperature to give your evaluation.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Top with chocolate ganache frosting.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.cupcakeproject.com/chocolate-cupcake-recipe-the-ultimate-chocolate-cupcake-test-baked-by-50-bakers-and-counting/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/chocolate-cupcake-recipe-reviews-23123993

docs.title: Corn & Hatch Chile Cupcakes with Honey Buttercream
docs.text: Total Time 34 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 egg
  • 0.5 cup Canola oil
  • 4 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 Tbsp cane sugar
  • 0.75 cup whole milk
  • 0.25 cup TJ's Hatch Valley Salsa
  • 1 box TJ's Cornbread Mix
  • 1 cup unsalted butter
  • 0.13 tsp sea salt
  • 0.25 cup honey
  • 2.75 cup powdered sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 cupcake pan
  • 1 cupcake liners
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 whisk attachment

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prepare the cupcakes: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a mixing bowl, add the egg, Canola oil, melted unsalted butter, and cane sugar and whisk until smooth. Add whole milk and TJ's Hatch Valley Salsa and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the entire box of TJ's Cornbread Mix and stir until smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Line a cupcake pan with cupcake liners and fill each cup about 3/4 of the way full with batter.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 17 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean. Let cool completely before frosting.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Prepare the frosting: Using a stand mixer with a whisk attachment, combine softened unsalted butter and sea salt and beat on medium-high for 6 to 7 minutes, until light & creamy.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Reduce speed to medium-low and add honey and powdered sugar, taking care to add powdered sugar about 1/2 cup at a time and waiting until fully incorporated before adding more. Periodically stop and scrape the bowl to make sure everything is mixing evenly. Mix until frosting is smooth, creamy, and fluffy.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: If the frosting seems too soft, refrigerate about 10 minutes to firm up, then mix another minute or two.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Pipe or spread frosting onto the cooled cupcakes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: For the best eating experience, these cupcakes should be enjoyed the day they are made—and enjoy you will!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Vanilla Cupcakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 vanilla bean
  • 1.75 cups cake flour
  • 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 cup unsalted butter
  • 2 large eggs
  • 0.33 cup full-fat sour cream
  • 0.25 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla
  • 0.67 cup whole milk
  • 1 vanilla buttercream frosting

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 small mixing bowl
  • 1 cupcake liners
  • 1 cooling rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a small bowl, combine granulated sugar and seeds from the vanilla bean. (For those of you who are new to using vanilla beans, watch the video in this post to see how it’s done.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using the back of a spoon, move around the bowl and apply pressure to break up any clumps of seeds and to better infuse the vanilla flavor into the sugar. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a medium-sized mixing bowl or bowl of a stand mixer, mix together cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the vanilla bean sugar and mix until well combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add unsalted butter and mix on medium-low speed for 3 minutes. Because there is so little butter, you'll end up with a very fine crumb texture.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: In a small mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, full-fat sour cream, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract until smooth.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture and beat on medium speed until just combined.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Slowly add whole milk and mix on low speed until just combined. The batter will be liquid. (Don't worry, you didn't do anything wrong. It's supposed to be that way.)

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Fill cupcake liners just over 1/2 full.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Bake for 14 minutes and then test to see if they are done. They are done when a toothpick comes out without wet batter stuck to it. The cupcakes should appear white with specks of vanilla bean. They should not turn a golden brown. If they are not done, test again in two minutes. If they are still not done, test again in another two minutes.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: When the cupcakes are done, remove them immediately from the tins and leave them on a cooling rack (or just on your counter if you don’t own a cooling rack) to cool.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Top with vanilla buttercream frosting.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.cupcakeproject.com/best-vanilla-cupcake-recipe/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/vanilla-cupcake-recipe-reviews-23198138

docs.title: White Chocolate Strawberry Cupcakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 14-15 27 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Cake
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup strawberry purée
  • 207 g cake flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 115 g unsalted butter
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 3 egg whites
  • 60 g sour cream
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla
  • 80 ml milk

docs.title: Ingredients - Frosting
docs.text:
• 25 g freeze-dried strawberries
  • 170 g white chocolate
  • 230 g unsalted butter
  • 240 g confectioners' sugar
  • 2 Tbsp heavy cream
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • some white chocolate covered strawberry (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 12-cup muffin pan
  • 1 cupcake liners
  • 1 handheld or stand mixer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 double boiler
  • 1 blender or food processor
  • 1 Wilton 8B piping tip

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the reduced 1/2 cup of strawberry purée by simmering 1/2 lb (227 g) of strawberries on low to medium heat for 20 minutes, or until you have a half of cup. Allow it to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F (177°C). Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. Line a second pan with 2-3 liners – this recipe makes 14-15 cupcakes. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk the cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the unsalted butter and granulated sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamed, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Beat in the egg whites on high speed until combined, about 2 minutes. Beat in the sour cream and vanilla extract. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour and mix in the milk just until combined. Do not overmix. Whisk in 1/4 cup of reduced strawberry puree, making sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. Batter will be slightly thick.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour/spoon the batter into the liners. Fill only 2/3 full to avoid baking over the sides. Bake for 20 to 22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. For around 35 mini cupcakes, bake for about 11 to 13 minutes, same oven temperature.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Allow the cupcakes to cool completely before frosting. Time saving tip: When the cupcakes are almost finished cooling, melt the white chocolate used for the frosting. You can melt it in a double boiler or use the microwave. I melt it in the microwave in 20 second increments, stopping and stirring after each. Let it cool down for 15 minutes before using in the frosting in the next step.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Make the frosting: Using a blender or food processor, process the freeze-dried strawberries into a powdery crumb. You should have around 1/2 cup. Set aside. In a large bowl using a hand-held or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the unsalted butter for 1 minute on high speed until completely smooth and creamy. Add the confectioners' sugar, strawberry powder, melted and cooled white chocolate, 2 Tablespoons heavy cream, vanilla extract, and salt and beat on medium-high speed until combined and creamy. Add 2 more Tablespoons of heavy cream to slightly thin out, if desired. Taste, then add another pinch of salt if desired.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Frost cooled cupcakes and serve. I used Wilton 8B piping tip and nestled a white chocolate covered strawberry (optional) in the center.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text:
Cover and store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

Tip

If desired, add a drop or 2 of pink or red food coloring to brighten the color of the cupcakes and/or frosting. I added 1 drop of "dusty rose" gel food coloring to the cupcake batter and to the frosting.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-strawberry-cupcakes/

docs.title: Banana Cream Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 9 inch pie 8.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 cups heavy cream
  • 1.5 cups whole milk
  • 1.5 cups granulated sugar
  • 1 vanilla bean
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 2 large eggs
  • 0.5 cup cornstarch
  • 1 graham cracker crust
  • 3 lbs (6 to 7) banana
  • 2 tsp granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large heavy-bottomed saucepan
  • 1 large wooden spoon
  • 1 fine-mesh strainer
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 large spoon or rubber spatula
  • 1 pastry bag

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine 2 cups heavy cream, the whole milk, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, and vanilla bean and seeds in a large heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a gentle boil, whisking to dissolve sugar. Remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine egg yolks, eggs, cornstarch, and 1 cup sugar in a medium bowl; whisk until pale yellow in color. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk 1 cup hot cream mixture into egg yolk mixture. Gradually add egg mixture to hot cream mixture, whisking constantly. Bring to a simmer, stirring constantly with a large wooden spoon to cook out cornstarch and thicken mixture, about 5 minutes. (The mixture may separate slightly; if it does, remove from heat and beat with an electric mixer until thick and smooth.) Strain through a fine-mesh strainer into a clean bowl. Cover with plastic wrap, pressing down against surface to prevent a skin from forming. Chill in refrigerator about 4 hours.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: To assemble, spread 1/2 cup custard over bottom of prepared graham cracker crust, smoothing with the back of a large spoon or rubber spatula. Arrange enough (6 to 7) banana slices (not quite one-third of them) in a tight, tiled pattern over custard, pressing down with hands to pack them firmly. Repeat to build a second layer, using 3/4 cup custard and enough bananas to cover, smoothing down layer evenly. For third layer, spread 3/4 cup custard over bananas and top with remaining bananas, starting 1 inch from outer edge and working toward center. Spread 1 cup custard evenly over bananas to prevent discoloration. Cover with plastic wrap and chill at least 4 hours or overnight.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Whip remaining 2 cups heavy cream in a medium bowl until soft peaks form. Add remaining 2 teaspoons granulated sugar and vanilla extract and continue to whip until stiff peaks form.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove pie from refrigerator. Fill a pastry bag with whipped cream and pipe onto pie. (Alternately, spread whipped cream evenly over pie.) With a sharp knife dipped in hot water, cut pie into 10 equal slices. Transfer slices to dessert plates. Serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.marthastewart.com/1105366/marthas-banana-cream-pie

docs.title: Banoffee Pie
docs.text: Total Time 1 hour 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust
docs.text:
• 2.25 cup graham cracker
  • 2 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup melted butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup butter
  • 0.5 cup dark brown sugar
  • 1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 4 sliced bananas
  • 2 cups heavy cream
  • some chocolate shavings

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 springform pan or pie dish
  • 1 medium sized saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine graham cracker crumbs, granulated sugar, and melted butter and press in the bottom of a springform pan or pie dish and press it up along the sides. Chill the crust until firm.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To make the filling: Melt butter in a medium sized saucepan. Stir in dark brown sugar and melt over medium low heat. Add the sweetened condensed milk and bring it to a boil for a few minutes stirring continuously. The toffee should start to darken. Pour the filling over the crust. Cool and chill again for at least and hour or until firm.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Top with sliced bananas, heavy cream, and chocolate shavings.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://therecipecritic.com/banoffee-pie/

docs.title: Blueberry Pie
docs.text: Total Time 1.22 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 Tbsp vegetable shortening
  • 12 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2.5 cups flour
  • 2 Tbsp sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.25 cup vodka
  • 0.25 cup ice water
  • 3 cups berries
  • 1 granny smith apple
  • 3 cups berries
  • 2 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.75 cup sugar
  • 2 Tbsp instant tapioca
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • 2 tsp lemon juice
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9" pie plate
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 potato masher
  • 1 towel

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: For crust, chill and cut vegetable shortening into 4 pieces. Chill 12 Tbsp unsalted butter and cut into 1/4" pieces.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine flour, sugar, salt, butter, vegetable shortening, chilled vodka, and ice water.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Roll 1 disk of dough into a 12" circle on a lightly flowered counter. Roll into a 9" pie plate.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place 3 cups of berries in a medium saucepan and set over medium heat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Mash with potato masher until half of berries have broken down.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Heat for 8 minutes, until mixture is thickened and reduced to 1.5 cups.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Place shredded granny smith apple in towel and squeeze out juice.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Mix apple, cooked berries, raw berries, 2 Tbsp unsalted butter, sugar, instant tapioca, lemon zest, lemon juice, and pinch of salt.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Pour into pie plate and cover with second crust or make lattice top.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Bake on lowest rack at 400°F for 25 minutes, then reduce to 350°F and bake 30 to 40 minutes more.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Butterfinger Ice Cream Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 bars Butterfinger
  • 0.5 gal vanilla ice cream
  • 2 Oreo pie crusts
  • 1 8-oz tub Cool Whip

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 plastic bag
  • 1 rolling pin

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Allow vanilla ice cream to soften.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, place all 5 Butterfinger bars into a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix together softened ice cream and most of the Butterfinger crumble, reserving some Butterfinger to sprinkle on top.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add mixture to Oreo pie crusts and freeze.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once frozen, top with Cool Whip and remaining Butterfinger crumble and freeze again.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Grandma Beatrice Wilde

docs.title: Buttermilk Chess Pie
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• Chess Pie
  • 0.67 cup white sugar
  • 0.67 cup buttermilk
  • 0.5 cup pecans or walnuts (optional)
  • 0.5 cup raisins (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prepare Chess Pie.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add 2/3 cup additional white sugar and us 2/3 cup buttermilk instead of cream or milk.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir into the filling chopped pecans or walnuts (optional) and chopped raisins (optional).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake until the center is set when nudged, 35 to 40 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Buttermilk Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 3.45 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pie crust
  • 0.5 cup salted butter
  • 1.5 cup sugar
  • 3 large eggs
  • 3 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 0.75 cup buttermilk
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.13 tsp nutmeg (optional)
  • 1 pinch salt
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch pie plate
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 pie weights
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: On a lightly floured surface, roll the pie crust into a 12-inch circle. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate (no more than 1 1/4" deep). Tuck the edges under and crimp as desired. Freeze for 20 minutes. Prick the bottom of the crust 8-10 times, all over, with a fork.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Line the frozen pie crust with parchment paper and fill with pie weights. Place on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes just until the edges of the crust are dry. Carefully remove the paper with weights. Return to the oven for 3 to 5 minutes until the bottom of the crust is dry and the edges just start to turn light brown. Let cool slightly. Reduce the oven temperature to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place the melted salted butter and sugar in a medium bowl and whisk to combine. Whisk in the eggs, then all-purpose flour. Add the buttermilk, lemon juice, lemon zest, vanilla extract, nutmeg (optional) and pinch of salt and mix to combine.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Carefully pour the filling into the crust. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes, until the edges and center of pie are set completely. (Tent the pie with foil towards the end if either the crust or surface of the pie look darker than golden brown). Let the pie cool completely, about 2 hours. Garnish with a sprinkle of confectioners' sugar, if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thepioneerwoman.com/food-cooking/recipes/a40808207/buttermilk-pie-recipe/

docs.title: Chess Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time One 9-inch single-crust pie 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 Basic Pie or Pastry Dough
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 1 large egg
  • 4 large egg yolk
  • 0.67 cup sugar
  • 0.67 cup light brown sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.67 cup heavy cream or evaporated milk
  • 0.33 cup milk
  • 0.33 cup heavy cream
  • 6 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.75 cup toasted walnuts or pecans (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 inch pie pan
  • 1 heatproof bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a 9 inch pie pan with 1/2 recipe Basic Pie or Pastry Dough.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Glaze the crust with 1 large egg yolk.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake the crust as directed in About Baking Crusts Before Filling. Position a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 275°F. Warm the piecrust in the oven while you prepare the filling. Whisk in a heatproof bowl just until no yellow streaks remain 1 large egg, 4 large egg yolks, 2/3 cup sugar, 2/3 cup packed light brown sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Whisk in 2/3 cup heavy cream or evaporated milk or 1/3 cup milk plus 1/3 cup heavy cream.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Scatter over the top 6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter, cut into small pieces.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bring 1 inch of water to a simmer in a skillet. Set the bowl in the skillet and gently whisk the mixture until shiny and warm to the touch. Stir in 1/2 to 3/4 cup chopped toasted walnuts or pecans (optional)

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Pour the filling into the crust. Bake until firm, 50 to 65 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Fresh Cherry Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 9 1.58 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 1 deluxe butter pastry
  • 4.5 cups (1.5 lb) fresh cherries
  • 2/3 cup (135 g) granulated sugar
  • 1/4 cup (28 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) lemon juice
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • 0.25 tsp almond extract
  • 1 Tbsp (14 g) unsalted butter
  • 1 large egg
  • some demerara sugar (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 pie pan
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 fork
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the deluxe butter pastry and shape the crust in a pie pan ahead of time, then store covered in the fridge.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Make the filling: In a large bowl, stir the cherries, sugar, cornstarch, lemon juice, vanilla, and almond extract together until thoroughly combined. Cover filling and place in the refrigerator as you roll out the pie dough or for up to 24 hours.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Roll out the chilled pie dough: On a floured work surface, roll out one of the discs of chilled dough (keep the other one in the refrigerator). Turn the dough about a quarter turn after every few rolls until you have a circle 12 inches in diameter. Carefully place the dough into a 9-inch pie dish. Tuck it in with your fingers, making sure it is smooth. Use a slotted spoon to spoon and spread the cherries into the crust. Reserve the juice for the next step. Refrigerate pie, uncovered, as you reduce the juices in the next step.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the few Tablespoons of leftover juice into a small saucepan over low heat. Cook and stir for 3-4 minutes or until juice has slightly reduced and thickened. Cool for 5 minutes, then pour over cherries in filling. Do your best to gently toss together—doesn’t have to be perfect. The reduction will harden and thicken as a result of mixing with the cold cherries. This is normal and it will melt again in the oven. Dot the pieces of butter on top of the filling.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Arrange the lattice: Remove the other disc of chilled pie dough from the refrigerator. Roll the dough into a circle that is 12 inches diameter. Using a pastry wheel, sharp knife, or pizza cutter, cut strips of dough—I cut four strips 2 inches wide and two strips 1 inch wide. Carefully thread the strips over and under one another, pulling back strips as necessary to weave. Press the edges of the strips into the bottom pie crust edges to seal. Use a small paring knife to trim off excess dough. Flute or crimp the pie crust edges with a fork.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Lightly brush the top of the pie crust with the egg wash. Sprinkle the top with coarse sugar, if using.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Place the pie onto a large baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Keeping the pie in the oven, turn the temperature down to 375°F (190°C) and bake for an additional 30-40 minutes or until the top crust is golden brown and the filling juices have been bubbling up around the edges or through the lattice/vents for at least 5 minutes. After the first 20 minutes of bake time, I recommend placing a pie crust shield on the crust’s edges to prevent it from over-browning too quickly.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Remove pie from the oven, place on a cooling rack, and cool for at least 3-4 hours before slicing and serving. Filling will be too juicy if the pie is warm when you slice it.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Cover leftovers tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text: • https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cherry-pie/

docs.title: His Favorite Butterscotch Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 9.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tsp granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup salted butter
  • 3 Tbsp ice water

docs.title: Ingredients - Caramel Sauce
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup water
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 Tbsp rye whiskey
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 3 large egg yolks
  • 6 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 1.75 cups half-and-half
  • 1.5 cups light brown sugar
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.25 cup salted butter
  • 1 Tbsp rye whiskey
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 3 cups heavy cream
  • 0.25 cup confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 9-inch pie pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 pie weights or dried beans
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Pulse the all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons of the granulated sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of the salt, and 1/2 cup of the salted butter pieces in a food processor until the mixture resembles coarse sand.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While pulsing, add the ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, through the food chute, just until the mixture can be pressed together with your fingertips.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Form the dough into a disk and wrap it with plastic wrap.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Chill the dough for 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Unwrap the dough and roll it into a 12-inch circle on a lightly floured surface.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Fit the pie crust dough into a 9-inch pie pan and trim the edges so that only 1/2-inch extends over the edge.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Fold the edges under and crimp.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Freeze the pie crust for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Line the pie crust with parchment paper and fill it completely with pie weights or dried beans.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Bake the pie crust until it is set and the edge is light brown, about 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Transfer the pie crust from the oven and remove the pie weights from the crust.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Bake the pie crust again until it is golden-brown, about 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Allow the pie crust to cool completely on a wire rack, about 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Combine the remaining granulated sugar and the water in a medium saucepan, bring the mixture to a boil over high heat, and cook, without stirring, until the mixture is a deep amber color, about 9 minutes.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Transfer the mixture from the heat, protecting yourself from the steam, and gradually whisk in 1 cup of the heavy cream until it is smooth.

docs.title: Step 17
docs.text: Whisk 1 tablespoon of the rye whiskey and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt into the heavy cream mixture.

docs.title: Step 18
docs.text: Cool the mixture at room temperature for 30 minutes and then store it in the refrigerator until ready to use.

docs.title: Step 19
docs.text: Whisk the egg yolks, the cornstarch, and 1/4 cup of the half-and-half in a medium bowl.

docs.title: Step 20
docs.text: Stir the light brown sugar, the remaining salt, and the remaining half-and-half in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.

docs.title: Step 21
docs.text: Slowly whisk the hot brown sugar mixture into the egg yolk mixture and then return the mixture to the saucepan.

docs.title: Step 22
docs.text: Cook the mixture over medium-high heat, whisking constantly and ensuring the mixture at the bottom of the saucepan is whisked, until the mixture comes to a boil.

docs.title: Step 23
docs.text: Boil, whisking the mixture constantly, for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 24
docs.text: Transfer the saucepan from the heat and whisk in the remaining salted butter, the remaining rye whiskey, and the vanilla.

docs.title: Step 25
docs.text: Let the mixture cool for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 26
docs.text: Spoon the filling into the cooled pie crust.

docs.title: Step 27
docs.text: Chill the pie in the refrigerator until the filling is firm and cold, about 4 hours.

docs.title: Step 28
docs.text: About 1 hour before serving, beat the remaining heavy cream and the confectioners' sugar with an electric mixer on high speed until stiff peaks form, about 3 to 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 29
docs.text: Spread the whipped cream over the pie filling and chill for 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 30
docs.text: Drizzle the caramel sauce over the pie.

docs.title: Step 31
docs.text: Serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cookingprofessionally.com/recipe/his-favorite-butterscotch-pie

docs.title: Key Lime Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 3.48 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
  • 0.5 cup lime juice
  • 4 tsp lime zest
  • 4 large egg yolks
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1.25 cups graham crackers
  • 3 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 71 g unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 9 inch pie dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Thoroughly whisk sweetened condensed milk, lime juice, lime zest, egg yolks, and salt together, and set aside to thicken while you prepare the crust.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350ºF.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Process the graham crackers in a food processor to fine crumbs. Add the granulated sugar and salt, and pulse to combine. Last, add in the unsalted butter and pulse until the mixture resembles wet sand.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Press the mixture into a 9 inch pie dish (metal works best here) evenly on the bottom and up the sides. I like to use a dry measuring cup to help this along. Bake the crust until it is light golden brown and fragrant, 10 to 12 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cool the crust slightly, then give the prepared filling a final mix, and pour it into the pie pan. Turn the oven down to 325°F, and bake the pie until just set, but slightly wiggly in the center, 15 to 17 minutes. Cool the pie to room temperature, then set it in the fridge to chill completely, at least 3 hours or overnight.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Just before serving, whip the cream to soft peaks, and spread it on top of the pie.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://food52.com/recipes/33481-key-lime-pie
  • https://www.thepancakeprincess.com/best-key-lime-pie-bake-off/

docs.title: Lemon Pie
docs.text: Total Time 1.37 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups (149 g) crushed graham crackers
  • 0.33 (66 g) cup granulated sugar
  • 6 Tbsps (85 g) melted salted butter
  • 1/2 lemon zest (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• some vegetable oil
  • 3 cups (936 g) sweetened condensed milk
  • 3 egg yolks
  • 0.66 cup (151 g) lemon juice
  • some salt

docs.title: Ingredients - Whipped Cream Topping
docs.text:
• 1 cup (227 g) heavy cream
  • 2 Tbsp (25 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • some fresh lemon slices
  • some lemon zest
  • some mint sprigs
  • some candied lemon peel

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch pie plate
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 prepared pie plate
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 handheld electric mixer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly spray a 9-inch pie plate with vegetable oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, combine the crushed graham crackers, 1∕3 cup of the granulated sugar, and lemon zest (optional) and stir to blend. Stir in the melted salted butter until well blended. Press the cracker mixture onto the bottom and up the sides of the prepared pie plate. Bake until firm, about 8 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or in a large bowl with a handheld electric mixer), beat the condensed milk, egg yolks, lemon juice, and salt on medium speed for 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the mixture into the baked pie crust. Return to the oven and bake until the center is set when the pan is gently nudged, about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cool the pie on a rack for 30 minutes. Place in the refrigerator until set, at least 1 hour and up to 3 days.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a medium bowl, with a handheld electric mixer, beat the heavy cream, granulated sugar, and vanilla on high speed until fluffy and the cream holds a soft peak when you pull the beater out of the bowl.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Spread the cream on the cooled pie. Garnish with fresh lemon slices, a sprinkle of lemon zest, candied lemon peel, and mint sprigs.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://magnolia.com/blog/article/12252/lemon-pie-recipe/

docs.title: Libby's Famous Pumpkin Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 2.92 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp ginger
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.25 tsp pumpkin pie spice
  • 0.25 tsp cloves
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 15-oz can pumpkin
  • 1 12-oz can evaporated milk
  • 1 pie shell
  • some fresh nutmeg
  • some whipped cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix granulated sugar, cinnamon, salt, ginger, nutmeg, pumpkin pie spice, and cloves in small bowl. Beat eggs in large bowl. Stir in pumpkin and sugar-spice mixture. Gradually stir in evaporated milk.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour into pie shell.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake in preheated 425°F oven for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350°F; bake for 40 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack for 2 hours. Top with fresh nutmeg and whipped cream. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.verybestbaking.com/libbys/recipes/libby-s-famous-pumpkin-pie/

docs.title: Mini Apple Pies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 pie crusts
  • 315 g apples
  • 50 g granulated sugar
  • 15 g all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.13 tsp nutmeg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 3.5 inch cookie cutter or a cup
  • 1 standard 12 count muffin pan
  • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Roll the pie crusts out to 1/8" thickness on a lightly floured surface. Using a 3.5 inch cookie cutter or a cup cut out 12 circles from the pie crusts. Re-roll any scrap pieces of pie dough as needed to cut out the circles.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place each circle of pie crust in each cavity of a standard 12 count muffin pan. Gently press the dough down and around the sides, making sure the dough fits snuggly in each cavity of the muffin pan. Transfer the muffin pan and any leftover pie crust dough to the refrigerator while you make the filling.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, mix together the chopped apples, granulated sugar, all-purpose flour, ground cinnamon, vanilla extract, and ground nutmeg until fully combined. Remove the muffin pan from the refrigerator and evenly distribute the apple pie filling between all of the cavities in the muffin pan (about 2-3 tablespoons per mini pie).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove the extra pie dough from the refrigerator, cut out your designs for the tops of the pies, and place them on top.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake at 425°F for 20 to 25 minutes or until the pie crust is lightly golden brown and the filling is bubbly. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool for 10 to 15 minutes. Carefully remove the mini pies from the pan and transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.livewellbakeoften.com/mini-apple-pies/

docs.title: Peanut Butter Cream Pie
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup (198 g) granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup (58 g) cornstarch
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 3 cups (681 g) whole milk
  • 3 egg yolks
  • 0.5 cup (68 g) creamy peanut butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 pie crust
  • some whipped topping or homemade whipped cream (optional)
  • some peanuts (optional)
  • some hot fudge sauce or chocolate syrup (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 waxed paper or plastic film

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make a crème pâtissière. Whisk together the granulated sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a small bowl and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put the whole milk and the egg yolks in a medium saucepan, and whisk until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Turn on the heat to low.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Slowly add the sugar mixture to the milk mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Increase the heat to medium, and whisk constantly until the mixture comes to a boil and thickens to a pudding consistency.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove the pan from heat, and pour the mixture into a bowl.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Press waxed paper or plastic film onto the surface of the pudding immediately.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cover the pudding and refrigerate until the pudding is completely cool.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Use a hand mixer to whip the chilled pudding until it is creamy, then add the creamy peanut butter and the vanilla.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Continue to beat the mixture until evenly blended and creamy.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Pour the filling into a cool prebaked pie crust.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: If desired, top with whipped topping or homemade whipped cream (optional).

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Garnish with crushed peanuts (optional) if you like.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Drizzle with hot fudge sauce or chocolate syrup (optional) if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://yeyfood.com/how-to-make-a-yummy-peanut-butter-cream-pie/

docs.title: Shoofly Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 3.17 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 1 pie dough
  • 0.5 cup brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup molasses
  • 1 large egg
  • 1.5 tsp all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 1 cup boiling water
  • 1 egg yolk

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.75 cup brown sugar
  • 0.75 tsp baking soda
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch deep-dish pie plate
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 aluminum foil
  • 1 pie weights, uncooked rice, or dried beans
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 pastry cutter or fork
  • 1 aluminum foil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Sprinkle some flour onto a clean flat surface. Roll the pie dough into a flat round wide enough to fit a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate. Fit the dough into the bottom and sides of the pie plate and trim the edges. Refrigerate it for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Prepare the filling. Mix the brown sugar, molasses, egg, all-purpose flour, and baking soda in a large bowl. Gradually pour in boiling water and stir. Allow the filling to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Line the crust with aluminum foil and fill it with pie weights, uncooked rice, or dried beans. Place the crust on the lower rack of the oven and bake it for 15 minutes. Remove the weights and foil. Brush the crust with a slightly beaten egg yolk. Bake it for another 5 minutes. Allow the crust to cool completely on a wire rack.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Lower the oven heat to 350°F and make the topping. Whisk together the all-purpose flour, brown sugar, baking soda, and salt until well combined. Using a pastry cutter or fork, cut in the butter cubes until the mixture is crumbly.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour the pie filling into the crust and sprinkle with the crumble topping. Cover the pie with aluminum foil and bake it for 45 to 50 minutes, or until the filling has set and is golden brown. Cool it completely on a wire rack, for about 2 hours. Slice, serve, and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://insanelygoodrecipes.com/shoofly-pie/

docs.title: Spring Fruit Tart Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4-6 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 frozen pie crust
  • 1 egg
  • 0.25 cup brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup lemon curd
  • 0.5 cup whipped cream
  • some raspberries
  • some mangoes
  • some kiwis
  • some strawberries
  • some confectioners' sugar (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 pie pan
  • 1 fork
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place frozen pie crust that is slightly defrosted in a pie pan or directly on a baking sheet (use a baking sheet if you would like to be creative with the shape of the crust).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Brush pie crust with egg wash and sprinkle 1/4 cup of brown sugar on top. Pierce the crust a few times with a fork.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake the crust for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Then, set it aside to cool.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: While the crust is baking, begin making the lemon curd icing.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a medium bowl, mix 1/2 cup of lemon curd with 1/2 cup of whipped cream.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Once the pie crust has cooled, spread the lemon icing evenly with a spatula.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Decorate your fruit tart using your favorite fruits such as raspberries, mangoes, kiwis, strawberries.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Sprinkle confectioners' sugar (optional) for an added touch.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Tart Cherry Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 9 1.58 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 1 deluxe butter pastry
  • 24 oz frozen tart cherries
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 2 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp almond extract
  • 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 Tbsp amaretto

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 cup brown sugar
  • 0.25 cup rolled oats
  • 6 Tbsp melted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 pie pan
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 fork
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the deluxe butter pastry and shape the crust in a pie pan ahead of time, then store covered in the fridge.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To make the tart cherry pie filling: add frozen tart cherries, granulated sugar, cornstarch, all-purpose flour and almond extract to a large pot and place over medium heat. After 5 minutes or so, the cherries will thaw, begin to break down and the sugar will melt. Stir frequently during this time. Add in unsalted butter and amaretto and continue to stir. After another 5 to 10 minutes or so, the mixture will begin to thicken and start to bubble along the edges. Once the filling begins to stick slightly to the back of your spoon, remove it from the heat and set aside to cool off.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While your oven preheats, make the Dutch crumble topping: in a medium bowl, mix together the all-purpose flour, brown sugar and rolled oats. Add in the melted butter and stir together with a fork until it begins to form into crumbles and resembles clumpy wet sand. You may need to use your hands/fingers to form into nice crumbles. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 5 minutes or until ready to use.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove pie pan with pie crust from the refrigerator and place pie pan onto a large baking sheet. I do this to avoid any spillage that may happen as the pie filling bubbles and bakes. Pour cooled tart cherry pie filling into the crust, then top filling with the dutch crumble topping.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes or until the filling is very bubbly and the crumble is slightly golden brown. Check pie after 30 minutes to make sure the crust isn’t burning. If it is getting too golden brown, simply cover pie edges with foil or pie shield.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Allow pie to cool on a wire rack until completely cooled before cutting into it (this is annoying, but if you cut into it before then the pie filling won't be set). The longer the pie rests, the easier it is to serve! Can be made a few days ahead of time. Pie is best served at room temp or just slightly warm. Serves 9. Great with vanilla bean ice cream. Enjoy!

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.ambitiouskitchen.com/tart-cherry-pie/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/cherry-pie-recipe-showdown-23394698

docs.title: The Best Lemon Meringue Pie
docs.text: Total Time 2.12 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 1.25 cup all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 Tbsp vegetable shortening
  • 4 Tbsp butter
  • 4 Tbsp ice water

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 1 cup sugar
  • 0.25 cup cornstarch
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 1.5 cups cold water
  • 6 large egg yolks
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.5 cup lemon juice (2-3 lemons)
  • 2 Tbsp butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Meringue
docs.text:
• 3 egg whites
  • 0.25 tsp cream of tartar
  • 6 Tbsp superfine sugar
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 9 inch plate
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 large saucepan
  • 1 knife or spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix all-purpose flour and salt in a food processor. Add chilled vegetable shortening and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse sand. Scatter 1/4 inch butter pieces over the mixture and pulse until it becomes pale yellow and the butter pieces are no larger than small peas. Pour mixture into a medium bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sprinkle 4 Tbsp of ice water over the mixture. Using a rubber spatula, fold the mixture to combine. Press down on the dough until it sticks together, adding another tablespoon of ice water if necessary. Flatten the dough into a 4-inch disk. Wrap in plastic and place in the refrigerator for at least an hour or up to 2 days.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove dough from the refrigerator and let stand at room temperature until malleable. Roll the dough on a lightly floured surface or between two sheets of parchment paper until it becomes a 12 inch circle. Transfer to a 9 inch plate by rolling the dough around the rolling pin and unrolling it over the plate. Ease the dough into the corners of the plate by gently lifting the edge of the dough with one hand, while pressing into the bottom of the pan with the other hand. Trim the dough edges so they extend about 1/2 inch beyond the rim of the plate. Fold the overhang over onto itself and either flute the dough or press down with fork tines, to flatten the edges against the plate. Refrigerate for about 40 minutes, then place in the freezer until very cold, about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place a rack on the lower-middle position and heat to 375°F. Remove the dough from the freezer, put a double lined 12-inch piece of aluminum foil inside the pie shell and fold the foil over the fluted edges to shield from overcooking. Put 2 cups of pie weights over the foil. Bake until the dough looks dry and is light in color, approximately 25 to 30 minutes. Carefully remove the foil and pie weights by pulling at the corners and pulling up. Place back into the oven for about 12 minutes to complete the bake. When done, transfer to a wire rack.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Mix sugar, cornstarch, salt, and cold water in a large saucepan. Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat, whisking occasionally at the beginning, then more frequently as the mixture thickens. When the mixture starts to thicken, whisk in egg yolks, two at a time. Whisk lemon zest and lemon juice (2-3 lemons), ending with the butter. Whisk constantly and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the filling to prevent a skin from forming.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Spread the prepared filling in the shell and bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until the filling is just set. Remove pie and return oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: While pie is baking, make the meringue. Beat the egg whites until frothy, add the cream of tartar and continue beating until rounded peaks form. Beat in superfine sugar and vanilla.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Spread the meringue over the filling, making sure it meets the edges of the crust to make a seal. Swirl in a design with a knife or spatula and bake for about 10 minutes, or until the meringue is lightly browned.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Allow to cool completely (1-2 hours), but do not refrigerate.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cupcakesandcashmere.com/food/the-best-lemon-meringue-pie

docs.title: Tollhouse Pie
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 eggs
  • 0.5 cup flour
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 0.5 cup brown sugar
  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 6 oz pkg chocolate chips
  • 1 unbaked pie shell

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 325°F. In large bowl, beat eggs until foamy.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add flour, sugar, and brown sugar,and beat until well-blended.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix in melted butter. Stir in chocolate chips and pour into unbaked pie shell.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake for 1 hour.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Trader Joe's Key Lime Pie with Strawberry Whipped Cream
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 bag TJ's freeze dried strawberries
  • 16 oz whipping cream
  • 2 Tbsp powdered sugar
  • 1 TJ's Key Lime Pie

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 hand mixer or whisk

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the TJ's freeze dried strawberries to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse to the consistency of a fine powder, set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add whipping cream, powdered sugar, and strawberry powder to a medium bowl. Using a hand mixer or whisk, beat until peaks form. (Be careful not to overbeat—the cream will turn lumpy instead of fluffy!)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spread, dollop, or swoosh whipped cream atop the TJ's Key Lime Pie to your heart's content. Serve immediately.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Whipped cream can be prepared a few hours ahead of time and refrigerated until needed. Cover and refrigerate leftovers and use within a day.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/key-lime-pie-strawberry-whipped-cream

docs.title: Chocolate Tart
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 6 hours 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 8 oz bittersweet chocolate, chopped
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 3 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 pinch of salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 tart pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the tart shell using 1 serving of Sweet Tart pastry shell.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Set up a double boiler. You don't need an actual double boiler you can assemble your own with equipment you already have: bring an inch or two of water to a simmer, not a boil because you’re going for gentle heat, and then place a bowl with your ingredients inside over top. You want it to fit snugly without touching the water (if it dips into the water, it will get too hot). So in this case, add the chopped chocolate, heavy cream, sugar, butter, vanilla and salt to the bowl over the simmering pot of water.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir until everything is melted and smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove the bowl from the pot, set aside and allow to cool for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once cooled, pour onto the tart shell.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Refrigerate for 6 hours or ideally overnight until it is set.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Slice the chocolate tart, serve with whipped cream, fresh berries and flaky sea salt on top. Enjoy!

Tip

This tart goes really well with a mixed berry sorbet.

Variation

About 75 g of homemade praline and a splash of brandy sprinkled over the pastry case before it is filled are quite delicious. Or, try orange zest and a splash of Cointeau.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://krollskorner.com/recipes/desserts/chocolate-tart/

docs.title: Cranberry Curd Tart with Almond Crust
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 5.52 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 1 lb cranberries
  • 1.25 cups granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup water
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 2 tsp cornstarch
  • 4 Tbsp softened butter

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust
docs.text:
• 4 oz almond flour
  • 2 oz cornstarch
  • 2.33 oz granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 6 Tbsp melted butter
  • 0.75 tsp almond extract
  • 1 cup heavy cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 9 inch tart pan
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 pastry bag

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

You'll need a 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom for this recipe. We strongly recommend weighing the almond flour and cornstarch for the crust. If preferred, you can use a stand mixer or handheld mixer to whip the cream in step 4. The tart crust will be firm if you serve the tart on the day that it's made; if you prefer a more tender crust, make the tart through step 3 up to two days ahead. For tips on how to pipe the whipped cream into decorative patterns, see note.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Bring cranberries, 1.25 cups granulated sugar, water, and salt to boil in medium saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Adjust heat to maintain very gentle simmer. Cover and cook until all cranberries have burst and started to shrivel, about 10 minutes. While cranberries cook, whisk egg yolks and cornstarch in bowl until smooth. Transfer hot cranberry mixture to food processor. Immediately add yolk mixture and process until smooth (small flecks of cranberry skin will be visible), about 1 minute, scraping down sides of bowl as necessary. Let mixture cool in processor bowl until skin forms and mixture registers 120 to 125°F, 45 minutes to 1 hour. While mixture cools, make crust.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 350°F. Whisk almond flour, cornstarch, granulated sugar, and salt in bowl until well combined. Add melted butter and almond extract and stir with wooden spoon until uniform dough forms. Crumble two-thirds of mixture over bottom of 9 inch tart pan with removable bottom. Press dough to even thickness in bottom of pan. Crumble remaining dough and scatter evenly around edge of pan. Press crumbled dough into sides of pan. Press edges to even thickness. Place pan on rimmed baking sheet and bake until crust is golden brown, about 20 minutes, rotating pan halfway through baking.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add softened butter to cranberry puree and process until fully combined, about 30 seconds. Strain mixture through fine-mesh strainer set over bowl, pressing on solids with rubber spatula to extract puree. Transfer 2 tablespoons puree to medium bowl, then stir in heavy cream and remaining 1 tablespoon sugar. Cover and refrigerate. Transfer remaining puree to crust (it's OK if crust is still warm) and smooth into even layer. Let tart sit at room temperature for at least 4 hours. (Cover tart with large bowl and refrigerate after 4 hours if making ahead.)

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Whisk cream mixture until stiff peaks form, 1 to 3 minutes. Transfer to pastry bag fitted with pastry tip. Pipe decorative border around edge of tart. Transfer any remaining whipped cream to small serving bowl.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: French Fruit Tart
docs.text: Total Time 2.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cup Bisquick
  • 0.25 cup sugar
  • 0.25 cup butter
  • 8 oz cream cheese
  • 0.33 cup sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup whipping cream
  • some berries
  • 0.5 cup apple jam

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 tart pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat oven to 375°F. Mix Bisquick and 1/4 cup sugar. Cut in butter and press into tart pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bake 12 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Beat cream cheese, 1/3 cup sugar, vanilla, and whipping cream.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spread into crust and top with berries.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Heat 1/2 cup apple jam or apricot jam and brush over berries.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Refrigerate at least 2 hours.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Plum Torte
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 2 eggs
  • 5 plums
  • some lemon juice
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • some whipped cream (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 springform pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cream the granulated sugar and unsalted butter in a bowl. Add the all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, and eggs and beat well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spoon the batter into a springform pan of 8, 9, or 10 inches. Place the plum halves, skin side up, on top of the batter. Sprinkle lightly with granulated sugar and lemon juice, depending on the sweetness of the fruit. Sprinkle with about 1 tsp of cinnamon, depending on how much you like cinnamon.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Bake for 1 hour, approximately. Remove and cool; refrigerate or freeze, if desired. Or cool to lukewarm and serve plain or with whipped cream (optional).

Tip

To serve a torte that was frozen, defrost and reheat it briefly at 300°F.

Variation

Massage lemon zest into the sugar, sprinkle with Demerara or turbinado on top, and use brown butter cooled in an ice bath.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://youtu.be/W1qpZWkrQMA?si=acxgEX5gTpZ0N7s1

docs.title: S'mores Tart
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 2.40 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 71 g unsalted butter
  • 198 g graham crackers
  • 1 large egg yolk
  • 2 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 170 g semisweet chocolate (64%-70% cocoa)
  • 180 g heavy cream
  • 57 g unsalted butter
  • 120 g heavy cream
  • 1 easy marshmallows

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 resealable bag
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 fork
  • 1 9 inch removable-bottom tart pan
  • 1 straight-sided glass
  • 1 large heatproof bowl
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 hand mixer
  • 1 kitchen torch

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Arrange an oven rack in the center position and preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt 5 Tbsp of unsalted butter and set aside to cool. Place the graham crackers in a resealable bag, press out the air, and seal. Use a rolling pin or a heavy-bottomed saucepan to crush the crackers, periodically shaking the bag so the larger pieces settle to one side, and continue to crush until you have very fine, uniform crumbs (you can also pulse the graham crackers in a food processor until finely ground, but it's very doable by hand). Transfer the crumbs to a medium bowl and add the egg yolk, 2 Tbsp granulated sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and the melted butter. Toss with a fork to combine then rub the mixture between your fingers until it looks like wet sand.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Transfer just shy of half the mixture to a 9 inch removable-bottom tart pan and scatter the crumbs evenly around the perimeter. Use a straight-sided glass or 1-cup dry measure to press the mixture firmly against the fluted sides (it will form a thick layer), then scatter the remaining crumbs across the bottom of the pan and use the bottom of the glass or measuring cup to flatten the mixture into an even layer. Place the tart pan on a sheet pan and bake until the crust is fragrant, firm to the touch, and dark brown around the edges, 13 to 18 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool completely.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large heatproof bowl, combine the semisweet chocolate (64%-70% cocoa) and a generous pinch of salt and set aside. In a small saucepan, heat 3/4 cup of the heavy cream over medium heat just until you see gentle bubbling around the sides. Remove the saucepan from the heat and set it aside for 30 seconds to cool slightly, then pour it over the chocolate. Cut the remaining 4 Tbsp unsalted butter into 1/2 inch pieces and add them to the bowl. Let the chocolate mixture sit undisturbed for about 5 minutes to allow the chocolate to melt. Whisk the ganache gently, starting in the center of the bowl and working outward, until the mixture is completely smooth. Set the bowl aside while you whip the cream.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a medium bowl, with a hand mixer, whip the remaining 1/2 cup heavy cream on low speed and gradually increase the speed to medium-high as it thickens until you have medium peaks.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Beat the ganache with the hand mixer (no need to wash after whipping the cream) on low speed to start and gradually increase the speed to medium-high until the ganache thickens to the consistency of chocolate pudding and holds the marks of the whisk, about 4 minutes. Scrape in the whipped cream and fold until the mixture is streak-free. Scrape the whipped ganache into the cooled tart crust and smooth the surface, working it to the sides in an even layer. Set the tart aside, uncovered at room temperature, until the filling is set, at least 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Follow the recipe for the easy marshmallows, but rather than transferring the mixture to a pastry bag, scrape it onto the tart and swirl with the back of a spoon across the surface. Let the tart sit uncovered at cool room temperature until the marshmallow is form and set, at least 2 hours. If desired, brown the surface of the marshmallow with a kitchen torch. Press up on the bottom of the tart pan to pop the tart out of the fluted ring and place it on a serving plate.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • What's For Dessert

docs.title: Strawberry Tart
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 8-inch tart 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 8-inch vanilla sable shell
  • 150 g quick strawberry jam
  • 300 g pastry cream
  • 2 lbs fresh strawberries
  • 50 g clear glaze

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cake stand or cardboard cake circle
  • 1 plastic piping bag
  • 1 cutting board
  • 1 pastry brush

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place the 8-inch vanilla sable shell on a cake stand or cardboard cake circle.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fill 1 plastic piping bag with the quick strawberry jam, then twist the open end of the bag to close. Snip the tip of the bag off and pipe the jam in a spiral pattern evenly over the bottom of the tart shell until it’s mostly covered. Reserve about 20 percent of the jam in the bag for later use.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Fill the second plastic piping bag with the pastry cream, then twist the open end of the bag to close. Snip the tip of the bag off and pipe the pastry cream in a spiral pattern evenly over the jam.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: On a cutting board, halve the fresh strawberries lengthwise, making sure to group large halves at one end of the cutting board and group smaller halves toward the opposite end.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Starting with the larger halves, arrange them cut side up and tips pointing outward along the entire edge of the tart so their points extend about 1/4 inch beyond the edge of the shell. Continue arranging halves in this fashion until they form a ring, then continue making concentric circles with the halves, working toward the smaller pieces, until they meet in the center and completely cover the pastry cream. From the top, the tart should look like a blooming flower.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Using a pastry brush, gently brush the warmed clear glaze over the cut side of each strawberry only, working from the base toward the tip like painting a fingernail, to make a thin, delicate layer.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Dominique Ansel

docs.title: Kroket
docs.text: Total Time 1.80 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb ground beef
  • 5 cups water
  • 1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 tsp chives
  • 4 oz butter
  • 1 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup Italian seasoned breadcrumbs
  • 1 egg white
  • 2 Tbsp milk
  • some mustard or deli brown mustard (optional)
  • some pickles (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 sauce pan
  • 1 strainer
  • 1 wok or frying pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Dough: Brown ground beef.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain to ground beef, add water, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and chives and cook for about 15 minutes. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Melt butter in sauce pan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Turn off heat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour to mix to form a stiff dough.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Then pour beef and broth through a strainer.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Stir the meat into dough and about 3 cup of the broth pouring it gradually so the sauce doesn't become lumpy, cook until texture is stiff.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Let cool and refrigerate 1 hour or overnight.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Breading and frying: Roll the dough into rolls 4 inches long and 1 inch wide.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Coat with Italian seasoned breadcrumbs.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Mix egg white and milk.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Dip rolls in egg mixture and bread crumbs again.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Deep fry in a wok or frying pan 2 to 3 minutes until golden brown.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Serve with mustard or deli brown mustard (optional) and pickles (optional)

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Alton Brown's White Trash
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 25 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3.5 cups Cheerios toasted oat
  • 3 cups Rice Chex
  • 3 cups Corn Chex
  • 16 oz M&Ms plain chocolate
  • 2.5 cups salted mixed nuts
  • 2 cups small pretzels
  • 2 11-oz pkgs white chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 double boiler
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Dump the Cheerios toasted oat, Rice Chex, Corn Chex, M&Ms plain chocolate, salted mixed nuts & small pretzels in a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt the white chocolate chips in the microwave or in a double boiler. Melt very slowly, stirring occasionally, being careful not to burn the chocolate.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Dump melted chocolate over the rest of the ingredients and fold over and over until you have well-coated hunks and chunks.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spread the whole mess out on parchment paper and set in a cool place until it sets up, then break it into pieces.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Store in zip-top bags or air-tight containers.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.food.com/recipe/alton-browns-white-trash-226723

docs.title: Aunt Mary's Cherry Mashers
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 dozen 2.40 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 7.2-ounce package Betty Crocker Home Style Fluffy White Frosting Mix
  • 1 lb confectioners' sugar
  • 6 Tbsp margarine
  • 1 10-oz jar maraschino cherries
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 0.25 cup sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 20-oz pkg chocolate almond bark
  • 1 11.5-oz bag milk chocolate chips
  • 2.5 cups dry-roasted peanuts
  • 1 Tbsp vegetable oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the 7.2-ounce package Betty Crocker Home Style Fluffy White Frosting Mix, confectioners' sugar, margarine, maraschino cherries, vanilla, and sweetened condensed milk.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Starting on low speed, then gradually turning the speed to medium, beat until the mixture has a fluffy consistency, about 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
