docs.text: Form the cherry mixture into 1 inch balls using a small (.75-ounce) cookie scoop. Place on the prepared baking sheet and freeze until firm, 1 to 2 hours.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, combine the chocolate almond bark broken up into smaller pieces, milk chocolate chips, finely chopped dry-roasted peanuts, and vegetable oil and melt over medium heat, mixing to combine.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Working in batches, remove the cherry balls from the freezer and dunk them one at a time with a fork or spoon into the chocolate mixture. Allow any excess chocolate to drip off over the pan, then return the balls to the parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Refrigerate until completely hardened, about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://magnolia.com/blog/recipe/922fe751-664a-4622-aff9-4d51f4a6f97d/aunt-marys-cherry-mashers/

docs.title: Baked Ziti
docs.text: Total Time 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb penne pasta
  • 2 16-oz jars marinara sauce
  • 16 oz mozzarella
  • 1 16-oz container ricotta
  • 1 block Jack cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large saucepan
  • 1 9 x 13" casserole dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large saucepan, cook penne pasta until al dente.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: in a 9 x 13" casserole dish, pour just enough marinara sauce to coat the bottom of the dish.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When pasta has cooked, drain and then mix in 1 entire jar of marinara, and mozzarella, ricotta, and Jack cheese, reserving about 1/2-3/4 cup of mozzarella.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour pasta mixture in casserole pan and pour remaining marinara and mozzarella on top.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake covered for 10 minutes, then uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes more, or until cheese is brown and bubbly.

docs.title: Cheesy Potatoes
docs.text: Total Time 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 medium potatoes (peeled, boiled, refrigerated, shredded)
  • 2 cups shredded cheese
  • 0.25 cup butter
  • 0.33 cup chopped green onion
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 2 cups sour cream
  • 2 Tbsp butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9 x 13" pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Spray 9 x 13" pan with Pam. Lightly mix potatoes (peeled, boiled, refrigerated, shredded), shredded cheese, and 1/4 cup butter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add chopped green onion, salt, pepper, and sour cream.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Dab 2 Tbsp butter on top.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Broil the potatoes for a few minutes to brown the top.

docs.title: Chippy Chewy Bars
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 48 bars 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup butter
  • 1.5 cups graham cracker crumbs
  • 1 10-oz pkg REESE'S peanut butter chips
  • 1.5 cups MOUNDS Sweetened Coconut Flakes
  • 1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • 1.5 tsp vegetable shortening

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 13 X 9 X 2-inch baking pan
  • 1 fork
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place butter in 13 X 9 X 2-inch baking pan. Heat in oven until melted. Remove pan from oven. Sprinkle graham cracker crumbs evenly over butter; press down with fork. Layer 1 cup REESE'S peanut butter chips over crumbs; sprinkle MOUNDS Sweetened Coconut Flakes over peanut butter chips. Layer remaining 3 cup peanut butter chips over coconut; drizzle sweetened condensed milk evenly over top. Press down firmly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake 20 minutes or until lightly browned.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Place semi-sweet chocolate chips and vegetable shortening in small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave at HIGH (100%) 1 minute; stir. If necessary, microwave at HIGH an additional 15 seconds at a time, stirring after each heating, just until chips are melted when stirred. Drizzle evenly over top of baked mixture. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into bars.

Note

For lighter drizzle, use 1/2 cup chocolate chips and 3/4 teaspoon shortening. Microwave at HIGH 30 seconds to 1 minute; stir. If necessary, microwave at HIGH an additional 15 seconds at a time, stirring after each heating, just until chips are melted when stirred.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Fudge
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3-4 dozen 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.33 cup butter
  • 0.33 cup brown sugar
  • 0.75 cup all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1.33 cups mini semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • 1 lb confectioners' sugar
  • 1 8-oz pkg cream cheese
  • 1 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8 or 9-inch square pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 plastic wrap

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line 8 or 9-inch square pan with foil, leaving 1-inch overhang on sides. Lightly butter foil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine melted butter and brown sugar in small bowl. Stir in all-purpose flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir in 1/3 cup mini semi-sweet chocolate chips.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Form dough into a ball. Place on plastic wrap; flatten into a disc. Wrap disc in plastic wrap; freeze 10 minutes or until firm.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Unwrap dough and cut into 1/2-inch pieces; refrigerate.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place confectioners' sugar, softened cream cheese, vanilla, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in large bowl. Beat with electric mixer at low speed until combined. Scrape down side of bowl; beat at medium speed until smooth.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Melt remaining 1 cup chips in heavy small saucepan over very low heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat as soon as chocolate is melted.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add melted chocolate to cream cheese mixture; beat just until blended. Stir in chilled cookie dough pieces.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Spread evenly in prepared pan. Score into squares, about 14 X 1-1/4 inches, while fudge is still warm.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Refrigerate until firm. Remove from pan by lifting fudge and foil using foil handles. Place on cutting board; cut along score lines into squares. Remove foil. Store in airtight container in refrigerator.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Chocolate Mint Squares
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 dozen 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup cocoa
  • 2 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 3 Tbsp milk
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 Mint Filling
  • 1 tsp milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8 inch square pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 small saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line 8 inch square pan with foil, extending foil over edges of pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt unsalted butter in small saucepan over low heat; add cocoa.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook, stirring constantly, just until mixture is smooth. Remove from heat; add confectioners' sugar, 3 tablespoons milk and vanilla.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is glossy.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Spread half of mixture into prepared pan. Refrigerate.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Meanwhile, prepare Mint Filling; spread filling over chocolate layer. Refrigerate 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: To remaining chocolate mixture in saucepan, add remaining 1 teaspoon milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until smooth. Spread quickly over filling. Refrigerate until firm.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Use foil to lift candy out of pan; peel off foil. Cut candy into squares. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Chocolate Mousse Pie with Joe-Joe's Crust
docs.text: Total Time 4.12 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 28 cookies TJ's Joe-Joe's
  • 0.25 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 14-oz can coconut cream
  • 1 12-oz bag semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 can whipped cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food
  • 1 double boiler

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Crush TJ's Joe-Joe's in a food processor until they are fine crumbs. Blend in melted unsalted butter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake 5 to 7 minutes, the remove and cool completely.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Clean the food processor, then pour in coconut cream. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Melt semi-sweet chocolate chips in double boiler, then pour into the food processor with the coconut cream. Add salt. Blend until completely smooth, 20 to 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour filling into crust and chill for 4 hours or overnight in the fridge.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Serve with whipped cream.

docs.title: Chocolate-Peanut Clusters
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 50 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 bag semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • 1 bag peanut-butter chips
  • 1 can skinless salted peanuts

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 50 mini-cup holders

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Melt semi-sweet chocolate chips slowly in microwave of double broiler stirring often.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in peanut-butter chips and stir often.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir in skinless salted peanuts.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spoon into mini-cup holders.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Leave at room temperature until they solidify and then refrigerate.

docs.title: Chocolate Truffles
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 dozen 3.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 18 oz semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • 1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 Tbsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 heavy saucepan
  • 1 1-quart glass measure

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In heavy saucepan over low heat, melt semi-sweet chocolate chips with sweetened condensed milk. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Chill 2 hours or until firm. Shape into 1-inch balls; roll in desired coating.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Chill 1 hour or until firm. Store covered at room temperature.

docs.title: Microwave Directions
docs.text: In 1-quart glass measure, combine chips and sweetened condensed milk. Microwave at HIGH (100% power) 3 minutes, stirring after 1½ minutes. Stir until smooth. Proceed as directed above.

docs.title: Amaretto Truffles
docs.text: Substitute 3 tablespoons amaretto liqueur and 1/2 teaspoon almond extract for vanilla. Roll in finely chopped toasted almonds.

docs.title: Orange Truffles
docs.text: Substitute 3 tablespoons orange-flavored liqueur for vanilla. Roll in finely chopped toasted almonds mixed with finely grated orange peel.

docs.title: Rum Truffles
docs.text: Substitute 4 cup dark rum for vanilla. Roll in flaked coconut. Bourbon Truffles: Substitute 3 tablespoons bourbon for vanilla. Roll in finely chopped toasted nuts.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Classic Walnut Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 eggs
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 2 Tbsp flour
  • 1 cup light Karo corn syrup
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 unbaked pie shell
  • 1.5 cups walnuts

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine eggs, lightly beaten, sugar, flour, light Karo corn syrup, butter, melted, and vanilla; blend well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour into unbaked pie shell.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Arrange walnuts on top (or blend into mixture).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake in lower third of oven at 400°F for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F and bake for additional 35 to 45 minutes.

docs.title: Cookies & Cream Candy Bark
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups vanilla melts
  • 2 cups milk chocolate melts
  • 15 cookies Oreo

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 wax paper
  • 1 knife

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place vanilla melts and milk chocolate melts into separate bowls and melt in microwave.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Take 3/4 cups crushed Oreo crumbs and mix into both chocolate and vanilla and reserve 1/4 cup for topping.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Drop spoonfuls of both mixtures onto wax paper and swirl with a knife.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Sprinkle remaining Oreos on top; allow to harden in refrigerator.

docs.title: Cranberry Glazed Roasted Brussels Sprouts
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 1.33 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 lbs Brussels sprouts
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 1 small shallots
  • 0.5 cup Balsamic Vinegar
  • 0.5 cup fresh cranberries
  • 1 Tbsp honey
  • 0.5 tsp thyme
  • 0.25 cup vegetable broth
  • 1 Tbsp Dijon mustard

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 sheet pan
  • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut off the brown ends of the Brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. If the sprouts are large cut them in half. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and pepper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour them on a sheet pan and roast for 30 minutes, until crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the sprouts evenly.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While the sprouts roast make the glaze. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and sauté 6 minutes. Add Balsamic Vinegar. Increase heat to high and bring to a boil. Boil 5 to 8 minutes until balsamic vinegar is reduced to a thick syrup. Stir in fresh cranberries, honey, and thyme.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Reduce heat and cook 6 minutes, until cranberries start to break down. Add the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes, until thick. Add the mixture to a blender with the Dijon mustard and purée mixture in a blender until smooth.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour the glaze over the roasted Brussels sprouts and return to the oven for anther 10 to 15 minutes or until glaze has clung and coated the Brussels sprouts.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/cranberry-glazed-roasted-brussel-sprouts/

docs.title: Cranberry Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2.25 cups 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 198 g granulated sugar
  • 227 g water
  • 1 12-oz pkg cranberries
  • 1 orange zest

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine granulated sugar and water in a medium saucepan. Bring to boil; add cranberries, return to boil. Reduce heat and boil gently for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the orange zest near the end.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cover and cool completely at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Refrigerate until serving time.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Ocean Spray

docs.title: Creamy Double Decker Fudge
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 dozen 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup REESE'S peanut butter chips
  • 1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8-inch square pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 small microwave-safe bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line 8-inch square pan with foil. Place REESE'S peanut butter chips and 3 cup sweetened condensed milk in small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave at HIGH (100%) 1 to 1½ minutes, stirring after 1 minute, until chips are melted and mixture is smooth when stirred. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla; spread evenly into prepared pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place remaining sweetened condensed milk and semi-sweet chocolate chips in another small microwave-safe bowl; repeat above microwave procedure. Stir in remaining 1/2 teaspoon vanilla; spread evenly over peanut butter layer.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Cover; refrigerate until firm. Remove from pan; place on cutting board. Peel off foil. Cut into squares. Store tightly covered in refrigerator.

Warning

For best results, do not double this recipe.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Double Chocolate Peppermint Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 oz chocolate wafer cookies
  • 6 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.75 cup granulated sugar
  • 2 8-oz pkgs cream cheese
  • 1 Tbsp peppermint extract
  • 1.5 cups heavy cream
  • some red food coloring (optional)
  • some hot fudge sauce
  • 0.25 cup crushed peppermint candies

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 inch pie plate
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Lightly coat a 9 inch pie plate with cooking spray. In a bowl stir together crushed chocolate wafer cookies, unsalted butter, and 1/4 cup of the granulated sugar. Press into bottom and up sides of prepared pie plate. Bake 5 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Beat cream cheese and peppermint extract in a medium bowl on medium until combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Combine heavy cream, the remaining 1/2 cup sugar, and desired amount of red food coloring (optional) in a chilled bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Beat on high until stiff peaks form (tops stand straight). Add a spoonful of whipped cream to cream cheese mixture. Add cream cheese mixture to whipped cream; find to combine.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Spoon filling into pie crust. Chill pie 3 to 6 hours or until cold. Serve the same day the pie is made. Drizzle with hot fudge sauce and sprinkle with crushed peppermint candies before serving.

Tip

Gel food coloring is a much thicker product than liquid food coloring, and it provides more intense color. Use 1/8 tsp gel coloring or 15 to 18 drops liquid for a light pink filling.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Eggnog Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg yellow cake mix
  • 2 Tbsp rum
  • 1 cup eggnog
  • 0.25 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 can whipped cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 8-in square greased pans

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a stand mixer, beat yellow cake mix, rum, eggnog, and vegetable oil for 3 minutes at medium speed.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Divide mixture into three 8-in square greased pans.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Layer tiers with whipped cream.

docs.title: Five-Cup Fruit Salad
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 medium can pineapple tidbits (drained)
  • 1 small can mandarin oranges
  • 1 cup small marshmallows
  • 1 cup coconut
  • 1 cup sour cream

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix pineapple tidbits (drained), mandarin oranges, small marshmallows, coconut, and sour cream.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Chill overnight.

Note

Fruit cocktail, well drained, may also be added.

docs.title: Gingerbread Caramel Corn
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 cups 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 10 cups popcorn
  • 1 cup lightly salted roasted cashews
  • 1 cup dark brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup butter
  • 0.25 cup light corn syrup
  • 1 tsp ginger
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 17 X 11-inch shallow roasting pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 heavy
  • 1 2-quart saucepan
  • 1 pastry brush
  • 1 candy thermometer
  • 1 large baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 250°F. Line 17 X 11-inch shallow roasting pan with foil or use disposable foil roasting pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine popcorn and lightly salted roasted cashews in prepared pan; set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine dark brown sugar, butter and light corn syrup in heavy 12 or 2-quart saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Wash down sugar crystals with pastry brush, if necessary.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Attach candy thermometer to side of pan, making sure bulb is submerged in sugar mixture but not touching bottom of pan. Continue boiling, without stirring, about 5 minutes or until sugar mixture reaches soft-crack stage (290°F) on candy thermometer. Remove from heat; stir in ginger, cinnamon and baking soda.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Immediately drizzle sugar mixture slowly over popcorn mixture; stir until evenly coated.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake 1 hour, stirring quickly every 15 minutes. Transfer to large baking sheet lined with foil; spread caramel corn in single layer. Cool completely, about 10 minutes. Store in airtight container at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Gingerbread People
docs.text: Total Time 2.20 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups dark molasses
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 0.67 cup cold water
  • 0.33 cup vegetable shortening

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 cookie-cutters

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix dark molasses, brown sugar, cold water, and vegetable shortening. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Roll out dough and cut with cookie-cutters.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: While they are still warm, spread evenly with lemon glaze.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cool before frosting with Royal icing.

docs.title: Good Gravy
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2.5 cups 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 2.5 Tbsp tamari or other soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp fresh thyme
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 3 Tbsp water
  • 0.25 cup milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a small saucepan, combine the vegetable broth, tamari or other soy sauce, fresh thyme, and salt and pepper to taste and bring to a boil over high heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Reduce the heat to low, whisk in the cornstarch, dissolved in 3 Tbsp water, mixture, and boil, whisking until the sauce thickens, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Slowly whisk in the milk; do not allow to boil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Taste to adjust the seasonings. Serve hot.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Vegetarian Meat & Potatoes Cookbook

docs.title: Grandpa's Stuffing
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 loaf white bread
  • 1 stalk celery
  • 1 yellow onion
  • 1 pkg Albers yellow cornmeal (prepared)
  • some water
  • some poultry seasoning
  • 1 stick melted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender
  • 1 casserole pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend white bread, celery, and yellow onion in a blender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Crumble Albers yellow cornmeal (prepared). Add water to the desired texture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place into a casserole pan.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cover with poultry seasoning to taste.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add melted butter.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Stir, then cook for 30 to 40 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Grandpa Sims

docs.title: Green Bean Casserole
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.33 stick butter
  • 0.5 onions
  • 0.5 cup sliced mushrooms
  • 2 cups green beans
  • 3 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 can cream of mushroom soup
  • 1 8-oz can French-fried onion rings
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • some garlic powder
  • some cheddar cheese (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large skillet
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 1.5 quart baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt butter in a large skillet. Sauté onions and sliced mushrooms.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add green beans to a saucepan and boil in vegetable broth, then drain.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add green beans, cream of mushroom soup, French-fried onion rings, salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour into 1.5 quart baking dish.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 20 minutes; sprinkle with cheddar cheese (optional) if desired, and bake for 10 minutes more.

docs.title: Gumbo
docs.text: Total Time 18 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 oz unsalted butter
  • 0.25 cup diced onion
  • 0.25 cup diced celery
  • 0.5 oz flour
  • 0.5 cup okra
  • 8 cups vegetable stock
  • 0.5 Tbsp gumbo filé
  • 0.5 cup diced tomatoes
  • 0.5 Tbsp cayenne (or less)
  • 0.5 tsp white pepper
  • 1.5 cups cooked rice
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large soup pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large soup pot, melt unsalted butter.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add diced onion and diced celery; sauté until tender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add flour to make a roux. Cook for 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add okra, vegetable stock, gumbo filé, diced tomatoes, cayenne (or less), white pepper, cooked rice, and salt and pepper to taste and bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Simmer for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Hawaiian Toffee
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.25 lb toffee 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup macadamia nuts
  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 2 Tbsp water
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 4 oz milk chocolate chips
  • 1 cup toasted coconut

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch square pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 candy thermometer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line 9-inch square pan with foil, extending edges over sides of pan. Sprinkle coarsely chopped macadamia nuts evenly in single layer in prepared pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine butter, sugar, water and salt in medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring frequently. Attach candy thermometer to side of pan. Continue boiling about 20 minutes or until sugar mixture reaches hard-crack stage (305° to 310°F) on candy thermometer, stirring frequently. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla. Immediately pour over nuts in pan, spreading to edges with $spatula{}. Cool completely.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place milk chocolate chips in small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave at MEDIUM (50% power) 4 to 5 minutes until chocolate is melted, stirring every 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Lift toffee out of pan using foil; spread chocolate evenly over toffee. Sprinkle with toasted coconut. Refrigerate about 30 minutes or until chocolate is set. Bring to room temperature before breaking toffee. Break toffee into pieces. Store in airtight container at room temperature between sheets of waxed paper.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Holiday Nuts
docs.text: Total Time 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb pecans halves
  • 1 stick butter
  • 2 egg whites
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 shallow pan
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 pancake turner

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 250°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put pecans halves in shallow pan, about 10 x 15" in oven for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove pecans to bowl, put butter in pan and heat in oven to 300°F while you beat the egg whites stiff, then beat in sugar and salt gradually.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir nuts into meringue and spread into pan. Bake for 45 minutes at 300°F, gently turning over with a pancake turner every 15 minutes. Cool and store in covered pan.

docs.title: Holiday Peppermint Bark
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 lb 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 12-oz pkg white chocolate morsels
  • 24 pieces peppermint candies

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 wax paper
  • 1 medium, microwave-safe bowl
  • 1 heavy-duty resealable plastic food storage bag
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 strainer
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line baking sheet with wax paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Microwave white chocolate morsels in medium, microwave-safe bowl on MEDIUM-HIGH (70%) power for 1 minute; stir. Microwave at additional 10 to 20 second intervals, stirring until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place peppermint candies in heavy-duty resealable plastic food storage bag. Crush candies using rolling pin or other heavy object. While holding strainer over melted morsels, pour crushed candy into strainer. Shake to release all small candy pieces; reserve larger candy pieces. Stir morsel-peppermint mixture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spread mixture to desired thickness on prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with reserved candy pieces; press in lightly. Let stand for about 1 hour or until firm. Break into pieces. Store in airtight container at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Huevos in a Crockpot
docs.text: Total Time 8.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 dozen flour tortilla
  • 1 dozen eggs, cracked and lightly scrambled
  • 1 large bottle salsa
  • 1 lb shredded cheddar cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 Crockpot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Grease inside of Crockpot.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Lay one flour tortilla, add scoop of eggs, cracked and lightly scrambled, and 1/4 cup salsa, followed by a handful of shredded cheddar cheese.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Repeat until all ingredients are used.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook 8 hours on low.

docs.title: Jiffy Corn Casserole
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup butter
  • 2 cans whole kernel corn, drained
  • 2 cans cream-style corn
  • 2 cups sour cream
  • 4 eggs
  • 2 boxes Jiffy corn muffin mix

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 casserole dish
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Grease a casserole dish, and pour melted butter, whole kernel corn, drained, and cream-style corn into a mixing bowl. Mix in sour cream.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl, beat eggs and stir into corn and sour cream. Add Jiffy corn muffin mix and blend thoroughly.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake 35 to 45 minutes.

docs.title: Leftover Thanksgiving Pot Pies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 hot water crust
  • 0.5 cup good gravy
  • 1 cup mashed potatoes
  • 1 cup stuffing
  • 1 egg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 dolly
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 cooking twine
  • 1 circular cutter

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Tip the warm hot water crust pastry dough onto a lightly floured worktop and gently work until it forms a smooth ball. Divide it in half. Set aside one quarter of each portion for the lids and keep covered with plastic wrap until needed. Form the rest of one portion of dough into a ball, then flatten slightly. Set a dolly on top of the flattened disc. Using your hands, mold the still warm dough around the dolly. Try to make sure the dough is the same thickness on the sides, that the dough on the base is not too thick and that there are no holes. Repeat with the other portion of dough. Set the molded pie cases on the lined baking sheet and chill for about 20 minutes or until really firm.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Roll out the 2 saved portions of dough to make discs 13 cm across, or to fit the size of the pies you’ve molded. Make a hole in the center of each lid, then chill them for about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Wrap the outside of the pie case with a strip of parchment paper and tie cooking twine around the pie case to help keep its shape.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add a tablespoon of good gravy to the pie case.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Fill up half of the pie case with mashed potatoes. Add a teaspoon of gravy on top.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Fill up the rest of the pie case with stuffing. If stuffing is too dry, add a teaspoon of gravy on top.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Set a top on each pie and crimp the lid and the rim of the pastry case together with your thumb and forefinger to seal thoroughly.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Beat the egg with one tablespoon of water. Brush top with egg wash.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Optionally, make decorative leaves with the left over pastry dough by using a circular cutter, pinching one end of the leaves, and score down the middle and along the sides. Adhere the leaves to the top of the pies with the egg wash. Add more egg wash on top of the leaves.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Bake mini pies in a 400°F oven for 50 minutes or until the pastry has puffed up and has developed a nice golden color.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://thegreekfoodie.com/leftover-stuffing-pies

docs.title: Maple-Cinnamon Almonds
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3.5 cups 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup maple syrup
  • 3 Tbsp butter
  • 2 Tbsp sugar
  • 1.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 lb blanched whole almonds
  • 0.25 cup crystallized sugar (optional)

Note

Look for crystallized sugar where either gourmet coffees or cake decorating supplies are sold.

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 15 X 10 X 1-inch jelly-roll pans
  • 1 foil
  • 1 heavy medium saucepan
  • 1 wooden spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 325°F. Line two 15 X 10 X 1-inch jelly-roll pans with foil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine maple syrup, butter, sugar, cinnamon, and salt in heavy medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring frequently. Boil 30 seconds. Remove from heat; stir in blanched whole almonds with wooden spoon, tossing to coat evenly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spread almond mixture in single layer in one prepared pan. Bake about 40 minutes or until almonds are crisp and dry, stirring every 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Immediately transfer almonds to remaining prepared pan; sprinkle evenly with crystallized sugar (optional). Cool completely. Store in airtight container at room temperature.

Note

If almonds become tacky upon storing, place on baking sheet lined with foil. Bake at 325°F 15 to 20 minutes; cool.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Mom's Potatoes
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 lbs Russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 2 cup milk
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • 1 béchamel (alternative)
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 1 tsp garlic salt
  • 1 small Velveeta cheese, sliced
  • 1.5 cups shredded share cheddar
  • some parsley flakes

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large casserole dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Peel and slice Russet potatoes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spray Pam into large casserole dish.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Make white sauce: Stir cornstarch into 1 cup of milk. Stir well before adding to simmering butter. Alternatively, make a béchamel (alternative).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add pepper and garlic salt to mixture.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Mixture quickly thickens. Stir constantly while adding approximately 1 more cup of milk.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Simply add Velveeta cheese, sliced, and shredded share cheddar until melted.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Pour over potatoes. Top potatoes with parsley flakes and add more shredded cheddar.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake for approximately 1 hour.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Mom Farmer

docs.title: Monastery Pumpkin Bread
docs.text: Total Time 1.5 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3.5 cups flour
  • 3 cups sugar
  • 2 tsp baking soda
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp nutmeg
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 4 eggs
  • 1 cup oil
  • 0.67 cup water
  • 2 cups pumpkin
  • some walnut halves

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 loaf pans

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine eggs, oil, water, and pumpkin and mix well.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir into dry ingredients and mix in walnut halves.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour into three greased loaf pans.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 1 hour and cool before slicing.

docs.title: Old-Fashioned Peanut Butter Fudge
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 pieces 2.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 14 oz white chocolate chips
  • 2 cups creamy peanut butter
  • 1 14-oz can sweetened condensed milk
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 microwave-safe bowl
  • 1 larger mixing bowl
  • 1 10 X 10 inch pan
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Measure out all of your ingredients.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the white chocolate chips. Heat them in 15-second intervals, stirring in between each heating cycle. Repeat until the white chocolate chips are melted and smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate microwave-safe bowl, melt the creamy peanut butter so it becomes liquid. Heat it in 15 to 30 second intervals to avoid scorching.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a larger mixing bowl, combine the melted white chocolate and peanut butter, and mix until smooth.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add in the sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract, and salt, then mix until thoroughly combined.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Evenly spread the mixture into a 10 X 10 inch pan. You can use a piece of parchment paper on top to smooth it out if desired.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: At this point you can either let it set, or go on to optionally garnish the fudge with extra melted peanut butter and chopped white chocolate chips.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: The peanut butter fudge will need to set for around 2 hours at room temperature.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Once set, slice into 24 pieces and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/774933/old-fashioned-peanut-butter-fudge-recipe/

docs.title: Pampered Chef Cannoli
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 18 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 large pkg chocolate instant pudding
  • 1 8-oz pkg Cool Whip
  • 1 pkg puff pastry
  • some confectioners' sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cannoli molds
  • 1 PAM cooking spray
  • 1 piping bag

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven according to pastry directions.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To make the filling, combine chocolate instant pudding with Cool Whip.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cut puff pastry into 18 strips.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spray cannoli molds with PAM cooking spray.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Wrap the pastry strips around the molds with the strips overlapping.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake pastry according to package directions. Let pastry cool on cooling rack and then unmold pastries.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Fill the pastries with the filling using a piping bag.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Dust with confectioners' sugar.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Pampered Chef

docs.title: Peppermint Chocolate Cookies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 29 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.5 cup brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp peppermint extract
  • 0.5 tsp instant espresso coffee powder
  • 0.33 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1.66 cups all-purpose flour
  • 4 oz bittersweet chocolate
  • 1 Peppermint Buttercream
  • some peppermint candies (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 cookie sheets
  • 1 wire racks

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, beat granulated sugar, brown sugar, and unsalted butter on medium for 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Beat in eggs, vanilla, peppermint extract, and instant espresso coffee powder until combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Beat in unsweetened cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt until combined.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Beat in all-purpose flour. Stir in chopped bittersweet chocolate.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Drop dough by 1/4 cup portions 3 inches a part on parchment lined cookie sheets. Flatten mounds slightly. Bake 7 minutes. Remove cookie sheets and firmly tap three times on counter. Return to oven and bake 2 minutes more or until centers appear set. Repeat tapping. Let cool 2 minutes on cookie sheets. Remove; cool completely on wire racks.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Spread cooled cookies with Peppermint Buttercream. If you like, sprinkle with crushed peppermint candies (optional).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Peppermint Fudge
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 45 squares 4.18 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 cups granulated sugar
  • 1 12-oz can evaporated milk
  • 0.75 cup unsalted butter
  • 12 oz semisweet chocolate chips
  • 12 oz bittersweet chocolate chips
  • 1 7-oz jar marshmallow creme
  • 0.5 tsp peppermint extract
  • 1 cup crushed peppermint candies

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 13 x 9 inch pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 large heavy saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a 13 x 9 inch pan with foil, allowing foil to hang over edges of pan. Butter foil with softened butter.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine granulated sugar, evaporated milk, and the 3/4 cup unsalted butter in a large heavy saucepan.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook and stir over medium-high heat until boiling; reduce heat to medium.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Continue cooking and stirring 10 minutes. Remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add semisweet chocolate chips and bittersweet chocolate chips, marshmallow creme, and peppermint extract, stirring until melted and smooth.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Stir by hand 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Pour fudge into prepared pan. Sprinkle with crushed peppermint candies. Cover and chill at least 4 hours. Use foil to left fudge from pan; cut into squares.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 3 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Peppermint Patties
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 28-30 patties 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2.5 cups confectioners' sugar
  • 2 Tbsp vegetable shortening
  • 2 Tbsp corn syrup
  • 2 tsp peppermint extract
  • 2 tsp water
  • 12 oz bittersweet chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp vegetable shortening

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 serrated knife
  • 1 tray
  • 1 waxed paper
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine confectioners' sugar, 2 Tbsp vegetable shortening, corn syrup, peppermint extract and the water in a bowl. Beat on low until combined. (Mixture will be crumbly.) Lightly knead dough in bowl until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Shape dough into 1.5 inch diameter log that is about 7 inches long. Wrap in plastic wrap, chill 1 hour. Us a serrated knife to cut log into 1/4 inch thick slices. Arrange slices on a tray lined with waxed paper; freeze 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, combine bittersweet chocolate chips and the remaining 1 tsp vegetable shortening in a small bowl. Microwave in 30 second intervals until melted and smooth, stirring between intervals.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Us a fork to dip each slice into melted chocolate, allowing excess to drip off. Place dipped patties on the tray. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 5 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Persimmon Cookies
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 tsp baking soda
  • 1 cup persimmon pulp
  • 1.5 tsp vanilla (optional)
  • 0.5 (113 g) cup butter
  • 1 cup (198 g) granulated sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 2 cups (240 g) all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp cloves
  • 0.5 tsp nutmeg
  • 1 cup raisins and/or nuts (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 greased cookie sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Stir in baking soda with persimmon pulp that is sieved and put through blender and set aside. Add vanilla extract (optional) to the mixture, if desired.

Tip

If using Fuyu persimmons, cut equatorially and scoop out the pulp with a spoon before pureed. If using Hachiya, ensure they are fully ripe. Optionally, they can be skinned before pureeing entirely.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cream together butter and sugar. Beat in egg, then persimmon mixture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Sift all-purpose flour with baking powder, salt, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add to creamed mixture along with raisins and/or nuts (optional). Mix thoroughly.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Drop by teaspoonful onto greased cookie sheet.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake until done, about 15 minutes (set when touched in center).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Pumpkin Spiced Apple Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6-8 1.33 hours

docs.title: Filling
docs.text:
• 5 cups apples
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp pumpkin pie spice
  • 8 tsp sugar
  • 8 tsp brown sugar
  • 2 Tbsp pumpkin butter
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1.5 Tbsp flour

docs.title: Crust
docs.text:
• 2 cups flour
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pumpkin pie spice
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon
  • 38 tsp cold butter
  • 6 Tbsp ice water

docs.title: Crumb Topping
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup brown sugar
  • 0.25 cup butter
  • 0.5 cup flour
  • 0.25 cup crushed granola

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 pie pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Prepare filling by peeling and slicing apples. Toss with cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, sugar, brown sugar, pumpkin butter, salt, and flour. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Prepare crust by whisking flour, salt, pumpkin pie spice, and cinnamon in large bowl.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add cold butter and cut into flour mix until crumbly. Add 1 Tbsp of ice water at a time until loose dough forms.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer to floured surface and gently mold together with hands.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Divide in two, making one - the bottom crust - slightly larger.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Gently roll out larger crust and drape over pie pan.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add apple filling to crust, reserving mot of the excess liquid that's formed.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake 45 to 50 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Prepare the crumb topping by combining brown sugar, butter, and flour. Stir in crushed granola.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Reduce oven temperature to 350°F and bake for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Pumpkin Squares
docs.text: Total Time 25 minutes

docs.title: Cake
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup butter
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 0.5 cup brown sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 14-oz can pumpkin
  • 1 cup flour
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.25 tsp ginger
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cream Cheese Frosting
docs.text:
• 4 oz softened cream cheese
  • 0.25 cup butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2 cups sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 9 x 13" pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a stand mixer, Cream butter and sugar. Beat in brown sugar and eggs one at a time.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Slowly beat in pumpkin. Add flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, baking powder, baking soda, and salt and stir.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Scrape into 9 x 13" pan.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 25 minutes. Cool, then frost with cream cheese icing.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Beat in softened cream cheese, butter, and vanilla, then beat in sugar.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Spread then chill.

docs.title: Russian Tea Cakes
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup butter, softened
  • 0.5 cup confectioners' sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2.25 cups flour
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.75 cup finely chopped walnuts

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 ungreased cookie sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix butter, softened, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, and vanilla.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix in flour, salt, and finely chopped walnuts until dough holds together.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Place about 1-inch apart on an ungreased cookie sheet.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake until set, but not brown; about 10 to 12 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Roll in confectioners' sugar while warm, then let cool.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Roll in confectioners' sugar again.

docs.title: Ruth's Chris Sweet Potato Casserole
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Sweet Potatoes
docs.text:
• 3 cups steamed sweet potato
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 0.5 tsp vanilla
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 stick butter

docs.title: Crust
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup brown sugar
  • 0.33 cup flour
  • 0.33 cup butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 casserole pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Grease a casserole pan.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Sweet potatoes: Blend steamed sweet potato, sugar, vanilla, eggs, and 1 stick of butter. Bake for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Crust: Blend brown sugar, flour, and 1/3 cup of butter. Top potatoes with crust and bake for 10 minutes longer.

docs.title: Salted Caramel Peanut Brittle
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups granulated sugar
  • 10 Tbsp salted butter
  • 0.33 cup light corn syrup
  • 0.33 cup whole milk
  • 2 tsp vanilla bean paste
  • 1.25 tsp baking soda
  • 3 cups honey roasted peanuts
  • 0.5 tsp Maldon salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 sheet pan
  • 1 nonstick silicone mat
  • 1 large heavy-bottomed pot
  • 1 candy thermometer
  • 1 pastry brush

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 200°F. Line a sheet pan with a nonstick silicone mat and place it in the oven to warm.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large heavy-bottomed pot fitted with a candy thermometer, combine the granulated sugar, salted butter, light corn syrup, and whole milk. Heat over medium high until the mixture reaches 300°F, whisking frequently and brushing the sides of the pot with a pastry brush lightly dipped in water if you notice sugar stuck to the sides. This helps to prevent the mixture from crystallizing.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Once the mixture registers 300°F, turn off heat. Add the vanilla bean paste and baking soda, and stir vigorously, the mixture will bubble.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in the desired amount of honey roasted peanuts and mix well.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Working quickly, pour the mixture onto the silicone mat on the warmed sheet pan and gently spread with a greased rubber spatula into a thin and even layer.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Sprinkle with the Maldon salt and let it sit until completely cool, about 30 minutes. Break the brittle into pieces.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://magnolia.com/blog/recipe/72248df7-9d8e-4737-90ff-1d846692cec2/salted-caramel-peanut-brittle/

docs.title: Spinach-Artichoke Tarte Soleil
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 sheets puff pastry
  • 1 10-oz pkg spinach
  • 1 14-oz can artichokes
  • 1 10-oz pkg artichoke hearts (alternative)
  • 0.5 5.2-oz pkg Boursin garlic and fine herbs cheese
  • 0.25 cup shredded Parmesan
  • 0.25 cup dill
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 tsp water
  • 1 Tbsp sesame seeds

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 parchment paper
  • 1 12-inch pot lid
  • 1 tea towel
  • 1 spatula
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Dust a sheet of parchment paper with flour. Gently roll out one puff pastry sheet, dusting with a little more flour as needed to prevent sticking, into a very thin 13”x13” square. Slide the parchment sheet with pastry onto a baking sheet and place in the freezer while you roll out the second sheet of pastry on another sheet of parchment paper. Slide the second parchment of pastry onto the same baking sheet and return to the freezer for 5 minutes to firm up.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place one of the chilled pastry sheets, still on parchment, on a work surface. Place a 12-inch pot lid, plate, or other round object on top of pastry and use a small sharp knife to trace out a circle. Set aside the pastry scraps (you can use them to patch up any tears in the pastry). Transfer the pastry round on its parchment back to the baking sheet and return to the freezer while you repeat with the second pastry sheet. Once both rounds are cut out, return to the freezer to firm up while you make the filling.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Gather the thawed spinach and the artichokes or artichoke hearts (alternative) in a large clean tea towel or several layers of cheesecloth and squeeze, squeeze, squeeze out every last bit of liquid like your life depends on it (this will ensure the baked pastry doesn’t get soggy and stays light and crisp). Finely chop the squeezed spinach and artichokes and transfer to a mixing bowl. Add the Boursin garlic and fine herbs cheese, shredded Parmesan, dill, lemon zest, and salt and mash together with a spatula to combine. Season with pepper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Beat the egg and 1 tsp water in a small bowl until blended. Brush some egg wash all around the edges of one of the pastry rounds, still on parchment. Evenly spread the spinach-artichoke mixture over, leaving a ½” border. Place the second pastry round on top and gently press to seal. Use a small glass (a shot glass or cocktail jigger works perfectly) to make an indent in the center of the pastry. Taking care not to cut through the indent, cut the pastry into four quarters, then cut each quarter into four thin wedges (you should have 16 "rays" of pastry emanating out from the center circle). Slide the entire parchment sheet onto the baking sheet and refrigerate tarte for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Working with one wedge at a time, gently pull away from the center and twist three or four times. Brush all over with egg wash, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and bake until puffed and deep golden brown all over, 30 to 35 minutes. Serve warm.

Do Ahead

You can assemble the tart the night before through the stage where you cut out all 16 wedges, but before you twirl them into twists. Cover the tart with plastic wrap, refrigerate overnight. The next day, twist the wedges, brush with egg wash, and bake.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cupofjo.com/2024/11/13/tarte-soleil-easy-holiday-appetizer/

docs.title: Tiny Mini Kisses Peanut Blossoms
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 14 dozen cookies 16 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup REESE's Creamy Peanut Butter
  • 0.5 cup vegetable shortening
  • 0.33 cup granulated sugar
  • 0.33 cup brown sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 3 Tbsp milk
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 pkg HERSHEY's Mini Kisses

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 ungreased cookie sheet
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Beat REESE's Creamy Peanut Butter and vegetable shortening in large bowl with mixer until well mixed. Add cup granulated sugar and brown sugar; beat well. Add egg, milk and vanilla; beat until fluffy. Stir together all-purpose flour, baking soda and salt; gradually add to peanut butter mixture, beating until blended. Shape into 1/2-inch balls. Roll in granulated sugar; place on ungreased cookie sheet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake 5 to 6 minutes or until set. Immediately press HERSHEY's Mini Kisses into center of each cookie. Transfer cookies to wire rack.

docs.title: Variation
docs.text: For larger cookies, shape dough into 1-inch balls. Roll in granulated sugar. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10 minutes or until set. Immediately place 3 Mini Kisses in center of each cookie, pressing down slightly. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rack. Cool completely.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Toffee Crackers
docs.text: Total Time 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 can sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 0.25 cup milk
  • 1 box (90 crackers) Club crackers
  • 1 bag semi-sweet chocolate chips

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 x 13" pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 cooking spray
  • 1 2 quart saucepan
  • 1 casserole pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line a 9 x 13" pan with foil and spray with cooking spray.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a 2 quart saucepan, mix sweetened condensed milk, brown sugar, unsalted butter, and milk. Cook until butter is melted, stirring frequently.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Increase heat to medium-high; heat to boiling and continue to boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Line a layer of Club crackers in casserole pan then arrange a layer of caramel mix over crackers.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Repeat layers until crackers / caramel are gone.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Melt semi-sweet chocolate chips in microwave, then pour over crackers / caramel and spread evenly.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cut into desired sizes.

docs.title: Triple Layer Chocolate Mints
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 64 mints 2.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 oz semisweet chocolate
  • 6 oz white chocolate
  • 1 tsp peppermint extract
  • 6 oz milk chocolate

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8 inch square pan
  • 1 foil
  • 1 double boiler

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Line 8 inch square pan with foil, leaving 1-inch overhang on sides. Place semisweet chocolate in top of double boiler over simmering water. Stir until melted. Remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Spread melted chocolate onto bottom of prepared pan. Let stand until firm. (If not firm after 45 minutes, refrigerate 10 minutes.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Melt white chocolate in clean double boiler; stir in peppermint extract. Spread over semisweet chocolate layer. Shake pan to spread evenly. Let stand 45 minutes or until set.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Melt milk chocolate in same double boiler. Spread over white chocolate layer. Shake pan to spread evenly. Let stand 45 minutes or until set.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cut mints into 16 (2-inch) squares. Remove from pan by lifting mints and foil with foil handles. Place squares on cutting board.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cut each square diagonally into 2 triangles. Cut in half again to make 64 small triangles. Store in airtight container in refrigerator.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Favorite Brand Name: Gifts From the Christmas Kitchen

docs.title: Unexpected Cheddar Cheese Ball
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 2.03 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg Unexpected Cheddar
  • 1 pkg cream cheese
  • 1 tsp chili pepper sauce
  • 1 tsp 21 Seasoning Salute
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 pkg chopped Sweet & Spicy pecans
  • 1 pkg TJ's Golden Rounds Crackers

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 cling wrap

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add Unexpected Cheddar cheese broken up into chunks, cream cheese chili pepper sauce, 21 Seasoning Salute and lemon juice to food processor bowl. Pulse to bring mixture together, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. Continue to process until mixture is smooth, 1 to 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Lay a square of cling wrap large enough to cover cheese ball on work surface. Scoop cheese mixture into center of wrap, then gather wrap up on all sides, gently shaping the mixture into a ball. Twist the ends of the cling wrap tightly, and refrigerate cheese ball (2 hours minimum, but overnight really lets the flavors meld together!).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Before serving, remove cheese ball from fridge. Spread chopped Sweet & Spicy pecans on work surface. Unwrap cheese ball and press into chopped pecans, gently reshaping as needed. Serve with a cheese spreader, surrounded by TJ's Golden Rounds Crackers.

docs.title: Vegetarian Stuffing
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Mrs. Cubbison's stuffing
  • some celery
  • some water chestnut
  • some vegetable broth
  • some onion
  • some butter
  • some poultry seasoning

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prepare Mrs. Cubbison's stuffing as directed.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add celery, water chestnut, vegetable broth, onion, butter, and poultry seasoning to taste before baking.

docs.title: Indonesian Satay
docs.text: Total Time 1 day

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lemon
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp coriander
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 6 Tbsp brown sugar
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 cups Indonesian sweet soy sauce (sweet medium ketchup)
  • 2 lbs top sirloin

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 skewer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the marinade by adding the juice of 1 lemon, pepper, salt, coriander, cumin, 3 to 6 Tbsp of brown sugar, garlic, and Indonesian sweet soy sauce (sweet medium ketchup).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Marinate cubed and cut top sirloin with the fat cut off, pieces at least a day in sauce and place on a skewer to barbecue.

docs.title: Source

docs.title: Lemper
docs.text: Total Time 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 cups sweet rice
  • 1 can coconut milk
  • 1 can water
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 2 lbs ground beef
  • 1 medium onion
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 tsp sambal oelek
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp sugar
  • 1 pkg soto ayam spice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rice steamer
  • 1 large pan
  • 1 foil

docs.title: Step 1 - Sticky Rice
docs.text: Fill rice steamer 3/4 full with sweet rice. Wash and rinse rice for a couple of minutes until water is clean.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Steam rice for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place rice in a large pan with 1 can coconut milk and 1 can water.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add 1 tsp salt and bay leaves to rice and milk mixture. Cook on medium heat until all liquid is gone. Return rice mixture back to steamer and cool for another 30 to 45 minutes until done.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Meat filling: Cook ground beef with finely chopped onion and garlic until brown. Add 1/2 tsp sambal oelek, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 tsp sugar, 1 package of soto ayam spice (you can purchase it at any Asian market) add more salt and sugar to taste.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Assembly: Take 1/4 cup of rice and place on a 4" X 4" piece of foil. Flatten with hands dipped in water. Place 1 heaping tablespoon of meat mixture lengthwise in middle of rice and roll it up.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Lumpia
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 medium onion
  • 1 tsp vegetable oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 lb ground pork or chicken
  • 0.5 lb shrimp (optional)
  • 0.75 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp ginger powder
  • 0.5 head green cabbage
  • 2 carrots
  • 2 cups bean sprouts (optional)
  • some egg roll wrappers
  • some flour
  • some water
  • some vegetable oil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Saute onion in 1 tsp vegetable oil until soft. Add minced garlic and ground pork or chicken until done.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add shrimp (optional), and garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and ginger powder, simmer 5 minutes and then add green cabbage and shredded carrots. Cook for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Turn off fire and while mixture is still hot, stir in rinsed bean sprouts (optional).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Let mixture cook completely and drain off excess liquid.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place mixture inside of egg roll wrappers and glue with flour and water and deep fry in vegetable oil until golden brown.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Nasi Goreng
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 cups white steamed rice
  • 2 scramble eggs
  • 2 slices bacon
  • 1 medium onion
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 cup pork tenderloin
  • 0.5 cup medium shrimp
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 3 Tbsp medium sweet Indonesian soy sauce
  • 3 stalks green onion

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make white steamed rice and scramble eggs. Set Aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut bacon into piece and fry until crisp. Take bacon out and drain. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In the bacon drippings, add chopped onion and cook until onion is soft and clear.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add garlic and pork tenderloin. Sauté until brown and fully cooked.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add medium shrimp and cook for 2 to 3 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Then add salt, 1 Tsp. garlic powder and onion powder and 1/2 Tsp. pepper to meat mixture.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Then add rice, medium sweet Indonesian soy sauce and green onion until brown.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Mix in eggs and bacon.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Eat with Chinese chili sauce and sweet bread and butter pickles. Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Wontons
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 lb lean ground beef
  • 0.25 tsp garlic salt
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp onion powder
  • 2 splashes soy sauce
  • some wonton skins
  • 0.5 tsp Chinese hot sauce
  • 0.5 tsp peanut butter
  • 0.5 cup catsup
  • 1 Tbsp sugar

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix lean ground beef, garlic salt, salt, onion powder, and soy sauce together and roll into 1/2 tsp balls.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Form them in wonton skins and fry.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Make dipping sauce by mixing Chinese hot sauce, peanut butter, catsup, and sugar.
