docs.text: Color, if desired, with liquid, powdered, or paste food coloring, the color will intensify as the icing stands. The icing can be stored in a covered container for up to 3 days; press a piece of wax or parchment paper directly against the surface to prevent drying. The icing can be rebeaten if necessary. To pipe, use a small pastry bag fitted with a fine tip, or cut off the corner of a sealable plastic bag or the tip of a parchment paper cone.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Powdered egg whites: Beat together in a medium bowl until stiff peaks form confectioners' sugar, powdered egg whites, and water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Color if desired with liquid, paste powdered food coloring.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Celery Salt
docs.text: Total Time 7 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 bunch leaves from each celery stalk
  • some flaky sea salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 strainer
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 large skillet
  • 1 jar

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Pick the leaves from each celery stalk, leaving the stems behind. The outer leaves tend to be dark green and hearty, the inner leaves pale green and tender. I use them all.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Rinse the leaves with cold water in a strainer, then shake off as much of the water as you can. At this point you want to dry the leaves as much as possible, so they toast (not steam) when you cook them. Gently pat them dry in a clean dish towel, or paper towels. Once dry you have two options for toasting the leaves.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: If I have a lot of leaves, I arrange them in a single layer on a baking sheet, then bake in a 350°F / 180°C oven for about 5 to 7 minutes. Bake until dehydrated and crispy, but not browned.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: If I have fewer leaves, or just don't feel like heating the oven, I'll throw them in a large skillet. Single layer if possible, over medium-low heat. Again, you want to barely toast them, not brown the leaves much.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In either case, when you're done cooking. Remove from heat and let the leaves cool completely. They'll crisp up even more at this point. When cool, use your fingers to crumble the leaves completely, discarding any leaves that aren't crispy.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Combine equal parts celery leaves and flaky sea salt in a jar, and either stir or shake to distribute the celery leaves evenly throughout.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.101cookbooks.com/celery-salt/

docs.title: Cinnamon Sugar
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp cinnamon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 fork
  • 1 glass jar

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add granulated sugar and cinnamon to a bowl. Use a fork or small whisk to combine, breaking up any clumps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Store in a glass jar or any container with a tight-fitting lid for a few months.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.simplyscratch.com/cinnamon-sugar/

docs.title: Doritos Popcorn
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup nutritional yeast
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • 0.25 tsp chili powder
  • 0.25 tsp cayenne pepper (optional)
  • 2 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 spice or coffee grinder

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine nutritional yeast, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, paprika, chili powder, 1/8 – 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper (optional), and salt (or to taste) in a small bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend seasonings in a spice or coffee grinder, or blend in blender to make a fine powder.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://wholenewmom.com/dorito-flavored-popcorn-dairy-free/#recipe

docs.title: Everything Bagel
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 tsp white sesame seeds
  • 1.5 tsp dried minced onion
  • 1.5 tsp dried minced garlic
  • 1.5 tsp black sesame seeds
  • 1 tsp sea salt
  • 0.5 tsp poppy seeds

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 air-tight container

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text:
Combine white sesame seeds, dried minced onion, dried minced garlic, black sesame seeds, sea salt, and poppy seeds thoroughly and store in an air-tight container at room temperature. Sprinkle on hard-boiled eggs, avocados, over salads, or anything else you wish!

Note

Don't make any ingredient substitutions that will change the texture of the ingredient

Note

I used toasted sesame seeds which gave the blend a slightly more pronounced sesame flavor. You can use either toasted or untoasted.

Note

If you don't want to buy black sesame seeds, you can substitute white sesame seeds and the flavor will be about the same.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.perrysplate.com/2017/06/diy-everything-bagel-seasoning.html

docs.title: Herbes de Provence
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 cup 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp fennel seeds
  • 2 Tbsp rosemary
  • 3 Tbsp marjoram
  • 1 Tbsp tarragon
  • 1 Tbsp basil
  • 1 tsp mint
  • 1 tsp chervil (optional)
  • 1 tsp lavender (optional)
  • 3 Tbsp summer savory (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 spice grinder
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Grind the fennel seeds and rosemary in a spice grinder. Pour into a mixing bowl. Stir in marjoram, summer savory (optional), tarragon, basil, chervil (optional), mint, lavender (optional).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Store in an airtight container. Use to season meats, chicken, fish, salads, vegetables, soups, and stews.

Note

Certain herbs are known to pair well with particular foods: rosemary with lamb, tarragon with chicken, basil with tomatoes, and fennel with fish so it is best to keep these combinations in mind when mixing your herbs. You might want to try making separate batches, each with different ratios of herbs for use in various recipes. Just be sure to label your containers.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thespruceeats.com/make-your-own-herbes-de-provence-995824

docs.title: Italian Seasoning
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 tsp 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 tsp dried oregano
  • 1 tsp dried marjoram
  • 1 tsp dried thyme
  • 0.5 tsp dried basil
  • 0.5 tsp dried rosemary
  • 0.5 tsp dried sage

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Whisk dried oregano, dried marjoram, dried thyme, dried basil, dried rosemary, and dried sage together in a bowl until combined. Use immediately or store in a sealed container.

docs.title: Source

docs.title: Pizza Dough Seasoning

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 Tbsp white or yellow cheddar cheese powder
  • 1 Tbsp garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp onion powder
  • 1 Tbsp Italian seasoning

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix white or yellow cheddar cheese powder, garlic powder, onion powder, and Italian seasoning together in a bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Just add a tablespoon or so to your pizza dough recipe when you are mixing and you will have one extra tasty crust.

docs.title: Pumpkin Pie Spice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 5 Tbsp 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp cinnamon
  • 2 tsp ginger
  • 1.5 tsp nutmeg (optional)
  • 1 tsp cloves
  • 1 tsp allspice
  • 1 pinch black pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 Whisk
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Whisk the cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg (optional), cloves, allspice, and black pepper together in a small bowl. The ground ginger can clump, so whisk it very well to rid any clumps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour spice mixture into your desired jar that seals well. A small funnel makes this step a little easier.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: This homemade pumpkin pie spice mixture will last in a tightly sealed container until the individual spices’ expiration dates, which is typically 1–2 years. Buy them all at once to ensure equal freshness and store at room temperature in a dry place, like a cupboard, drawer, or pantry.

  • 1.5 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 tsp paprika
  • 0.25 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.25 tsp onion powder
  • 0.25 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 0.25 tsp oregano

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix together chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, red pepper flakes, and oregano in a small bowl.

docs.title: Umami Seasoning
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 Tbsp 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 oz dried mushrooms
  • 0.25 cup granulated onion
  • 2 Tbsp mustard powder
  • 1 Tbsp salt
  • 1 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 1 tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp thyme

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 high-powered blender, spice grinder or food processor
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the dried mushrooms to a high-powered blender, spice grinder or food processor and blend for 5 to 10 seconds, or until it turns into a fine powder.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the granulated onion, mustard powder, salt, red pepper flakes, black pepper and thyme to a bowl with the mushroom powder.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir to combine all of the ingredients.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover and store in an airtight container in the pantry for up to 6 months.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine onion powder, garlic powder, turmeric powder, salt in a mixing bowl.

docs.title: Step 2

docs.title: Angel Food Cake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 2.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 120 g cake flour
  • 298 g granulated sugar
  • 12 large egg whites
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1.5 tsp cream of tartar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 knife

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 325°F. Don't grease or flour your angel food cake pan. A 10" round pan or an angel food loaf pan will fit this recipe well.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the cake flour and 3/4 cup of the granulated sugar. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, combine the egg whites, salt, and vanilla. Beat until the mixture is just frothy, then sprinkle the cream of tartar on top and continue beating until the mixture forms stiff, glossy peaks.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the remaining sugar, 1/4 cup at a time, then gradually fold in the dry ingredients.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Spoon the batter into the pan, and bake the cake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until it's golden brown and the top springs back when lightly touched.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove the cake from the oven, and set it upside down with a bottle through its center cone to keep its top from flattening on the counter. Let the cake cool for 1.5 hours. This cooling period sets the structure, and keeps the cake from collapsing.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Loosen the edges of the cake with a knife, and remove it from the pan.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Store the cake, covered, on the counter for up to a week. Freeze, well wrapped, for up to 3 months.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/traditional-angel-food-cake-recipe

docs.title: Chiffon Sponge
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 9" cakes 1.57 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 7 large egg
  • 0.5 tsp cream of tartar
  • 298 g granulated sugar
  • 240 g all-purpose flour
  • 2.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 99 g vegetable oil
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp almond extract
  • 170 g whole milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 10" tube or angel food cake pan
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 stand mixer
  • 1 thin-bladed flexible spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 325°F with a rack in the bottom third. Have on hand an ungreased 10" tube or angel food cake pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, beat the egg whites with the cream of tartar until foamy. Gradually add 1/2 cup (99g) of the granulated sugar and continue beating until stiff and glossy. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the remaining 1 cup (198g) sugar with the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl or bowl of your stand mixer, use the whisk attachment to beat the vegetable oil, reserved egg yolks, and vanilla and almond extract until pale yellow. Add the dry ingredients in thirds, alternating with the whole milk, beating at medium speed for 2 to 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Gently fold in the whipped egg whites with a whisk or spatula just until the batter is uniform. Scrape the bottom of the bowl to ensure the batter is evenly mixed.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 50 minutes without opening the oven; the cake will rise high above the pan then settle back almost even as it continues to bake.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Increase the oven temperature to 350°F and bake for 10 minutes more, until a gentle touch on the center of the cake leaves no indent; if you listen carefully, the cake should make a crackling sound.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text:
Remove from the oven and invert the tube pan over the neck of a wine bottle for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, use a thin-bladed flexible spatula to free the cake from the sides and tube of the pan. Turn the cake out onto a serving plate to finish cooling completely.

Note

If using a 12 x 8.5 sheet pan, bake for 20 to 30 minutes at 360°F.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/chiffon-cake-recipe

docs.title: French Sponge Cake (Biscuit)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time Two 9-inch round layers or one 10-inch round cake 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 18 Tbsp cake flour
  • 6 large egg yolks
  • 0.25 cup sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 6 large egg whites
  • 0.25 tsp cream of tartar
  • 0.33 cup sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 rubber or silicone spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Biscuit (bis-KWEE) is a classic air-leavened sponge cake used to make fancy layered cakes. This light, dry-textured cake is meant to be soaked with syrups before being filled with buttercream, mousse, or other filling. This recipe yields two 1-inch layers or one 2-inch layer that can be sliced into 2 or 3 thin layers.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Have all ingredients at room temperature, about 70°F. Preheat the oven to 325°F. Grease and flour the bottom(s) of two 9 x 2-inch round cake pans or one 10-inch springform pan or line the bottom(s) with wax or parchment paper. Measure and return to the sifter sifted cake flour

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Beat in a large bowl on high speed until thick and pale yellow, 2 to 3 minutes 6 large egg yolks, 1/4 cup sugar, and 1 teaspoon vanilla

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Sift the flour evenly over the top but do not mix it in. Using clean beaters, beat in another large bowl on medium speed until soft peaks form 6 large egg whites and 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Gradually add, beating on high speed 1/3 cup sugar.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Beat until the peaks are stiff but not dry. Use a rubber or silicone spatula to fold one-third of the egg whites not quite thoroughly into the egg yolk mixture. Fold in the remaining whites in 2 additions. Scrape the batter into the pan(s) and spread evenly.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake until the top springs back when lightly pressed and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes in cake pans, 35 to 40 minutes in a springform pan. To cool and remove from the pan.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Genoise Sponge
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 9-inch cake 38 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 eggs
  • 132 g granulated sugar
  • 0.33 tsp vanilla
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 120 g cake flour
  • 25 g butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cake pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large heat-proof bowl
  • 1 hand mixer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line the bottom and sides of the cake pan with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large heat-proof bowl, add the eggs, granulated sugar, vanilla, and salt. Place the bowl inside a larger bowl filled with hot water (bain-marie). Using a hand mixer, beat the eggs on high speed until soft, fluffy, and pale yellow ribbons form, about 8 to 10 minutes. Replace the hot water halfway through as it cools down.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Reduce to the lowest speed and mix for 3 minutes to pop large air bubbles.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Sift in the cake flour in three parts, gently folding after each time.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To help incorporate the butter, mix 3 heaping spoonfuls of the batter into the warmed, melted butter. Next, gently fold the butter mixture into the batter.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour the batter into your cake pan and bake at 350°F until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. For one 9-inch round pan, about 25 minutes. For two 6-inch round pans, about 18 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove all parchment paper and allow it to cool completely on a cooling rack. Slice into even layers using a leveler and top with fresh fruit and fill with cream. Enjoy! See Note 3 for the sugar syrup option.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://drivemehungry.com/genoise-sponge/

docs.title: Air Fryer Tofu
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 33 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 16 oz tofu
  • 2 Tbsp tamari or soy sauce
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 air fryer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat your air fryer to 400ºF (200ºC) (I preheat mine according to manufacturer’s recommendations, for about 3 minutes).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut the tofu into cubes. I don’t press the tofu because I prefer to save some time and also think it’s not necessary, but it’s up to you. I just drain the tofu and discard the liquid.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place the tofu cubes into a mixing bowl and add tamari or soy sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, and olive oil. Stir until well combined and let the tofu marinate for at least 15 minutes, preferably overnight.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the tofu cubes to the air fryer basket in a single layer and cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown, shaking the pan a couple of times to promote even cooking. Depending on the size of your air fryer, you may need to cook half the tofu at a time.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve immediately with dishes like veggie stir fry, cabbage soup, or vegetable soup.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Keep the leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://simpleveganblog.com/air-fryer-tofu/

docs.title: Baked Sriracha Tofu
docs.text: Total Time 22 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 block tofu
  • 1 tsp olive oil
  • 1.5 Tbsp sriracha
  • 2 Tbsp soy sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 cookie sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Slice your tofu into your desired shape. I usually go with quarter-sized squares - I'd recommend sticking close to that size and ensure that you slice it no thicker than ½ inch.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the tofu to your mixing bowl and add the olive oil, sriracha, and soy sauce. Gently mix to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spread evenly on a cookie sheet and bake for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: After 10 minutes, remove your baking sheet from the oven and flip each piece of tofu. Drizzle the remaining marinade over the tofu and bake for another 10 to 12 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: One the tofu is crispy on the outside, remove from the oven.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://ilovevegan.com/baked-sriracha-soy-sauce-tofu-2-quick-easy-recipes/

docs.title: Crispy Baked Peanut Tofu
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 1.18 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Tofu
docs.text: • 340 g extra-firm tofu

docs.title: Ingredients - Sauce
docs.text:
• :peantus: 38 g peanut butter
  • 15 ml sesame oil
  • 30 ml tamari or soy sauce or coconut aminos
  • 30 ml maple syrup
  • 2 tsp chili garlic sauce

docs.title: Ingredients - Cauliflower Rice
docs.text:
• 1 small head cauliflower
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 15 ml sesame oil
  • 2 tsp tamari

docs.title: Ingredients - Veggies (optional)
docs.text:
• 75 g veggies (optional)
  • 1 dash sesame oil
  • 1 dash tamari

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 tofu press
  • 1 medium mixing bowl
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 serving platter

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: If your block of extra-firm tofu is larger than 12 ounces, trim it down. Then drain your tofu and use a tofu press or wrap in an absorbent towel several times and place something heavy on top to press for 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Once pressed, slice tofu into roughly 1/2-inch cubes and arrange on the parchment-lined baking sheet in a single layer. Ensure they aren't touching so they will crisp up. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes to dry/firm the tofu.

Note

At 20 minutes, the tofu should be chewy, and at 25 minutes, the tofu should be more crispy. Bake according to preference.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In the meantime, prepare sauce by adding peanut butter, sesame oil, tamari or soy sauce or coconut aminos, maple syrup, and chili garlic sauce to a medium mixing bowl and whisking until combined. Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more chili garlic sauce for heat, maple syrup for sweetness, or tamari for saltiness.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add baked tofu to the peanut sauce and toss to coat. Let marinate for 10 to 15 minutes to saturate the tofu and infuse the flavor.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In the meantime, prepare cauliflower rice by using a large grater or the grater attachment on a food processor. Set aside. Mince garlic if you haven’t already done so, and wash and slice any veggies (optional) you want to add to the dish (optional).

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Heat a large rimmed skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add sesame oil (1 Tbsp as original recipe is written // adjust if altering serving size), cauliflower rice, garlic, and tamari. Stir and sauté, stirring occasionally, for about 5 to 8 minutes until slightly browned and tender. Transfer to a serving platter.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: If adding any veggies to your dish (optional), cook them now in a bit of sesame oil and a dash of tamari until just tender. Add to the cauliflower rice.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: To the preheated pan, add the marinated tofu with most of the sauce (reserving a few spoonfuls for serving). Cook, stirring frequently for about 3 minutes until browned. The sauce will caramelize and may stick to the pan a bit – this is normal and adds more flavor to the dish. Stir with spatula, scraping up any caramelized bits. Then transfer tofu to the cauliflower rice platter.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Serve with any leftover sauce. Leftovers reheat well and will keep covered in the refrigerator up to 2-3 days. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/crispy-peanut-tofu-cauliflower-rice-stir-fry/#wprm-recipe-container-35907

docs.title: Crispy Baked Tofu Nuggets
docs.text: Total Time 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some avocado oil
  • 1 14-oz pkg extra-firm tofu
  • 0.75 cup cashews
  • 1.5 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 2 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.75 tsp pepper
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 cup unsweetened dairy-free milk
  • 2 tsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 cup cornstarch

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 tofu press
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 shallow bowl or dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C) and prepare a baking sheet by spraying it with avocado oil (for the crispiest nuggets) or lining with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: If you haven’t already pressed your extra-firm tofu, do so at this time by using a tofu press, or wrap in a clean, absorbent towel and set something heavy — like a cast iron skillet or books — on top to press out the moisture. Press for about 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: While your tofu drains, prepare the cashew coating. In the bowl of a food processor, combine the cashews, cornstarch, nutritional yeast, salt and pepper, smoked paprika, and garlic powder. Pulse a few times to break down the cashews slightly, then turn the processor on until you achieve a fine meal (see photo), about 30 to 45 seconds. Transfer the cashew coating to a shallow bowl or dish.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Next, make the vegan buttermilk in a separate shallow bowl or dish by combining the unsweetened dairy-free milk and lemon juice. Mix and set aside to curdle. Then add 1/2 cup cornstarch (56 g) to another shallow bowl and set aside (adjust the amount of cornstarch if altering the default number of servings).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cut your pressed tofu into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes, and start the assembly line! Using clean hands, start by coating your tofu in cornstarch and gently tapping on the side of the bowl to shake off any excess. Next, dip in the vegan buttermilk and evenly coat, then place in the cashew coating and turn the tofu a few times to evenly coat all sides. Place your breaded nugget on the prepared baking sheet and repeat with the remaining tofu.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 30 minutes, flipping halfway through, until the tofu nuggets are slightly golden, dry, and bouncy to the touch. Let cool slightly before serving with your favorite sauce — we love them with tartar sauce, ketchup, "honey" mustard, ranch, or BBQ sauce. If serving to kids, it’s best to slice the nuggets in half to help the insides cool off.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Leftovers keep in the refrigerator for 2-3 days or in the freezer for up to 1 month. For best texture, reheat in a 400°F (204°C) oven for 5-10 minutes or until warmed through.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/crispy-baked-tofu-nuggets/

docs.title: Crispy Baked Tofu with Italian Herbs
docs.text: Total Time 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 extra-firm tofu
  • 1.5 Tbsp tamari
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 3 Tbsp balsamic vinegar
  • 1.5 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 4.5 cloves garlic
  • 2 tsp basil
  • 1.5 tsp oregano
  • 0.75 tsp thyme
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 absorbent towel
  • 1 tofu press
  • 1 parchment-lined baking sheet
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F (218°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Wrap your extra-firm tofu in an absorbent towel. Set something heavy on top - like a cast iron skillet - to press out extra moisture for 15 minutes. Alternatively, use a tofu press.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Crumble the tofu into pieces less than 1/2-inch in size and arrange them on the parchment-lined baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a small bowl, whisk the remaining ingredients (tamari, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, tomato paste, garlic, basil, oregano, thyme, and salt). Pour over the tofu and toss to coat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 20 minutes, flip with a spatula, and bake for another 10 to 15 minutes or until the tofu is a little firm and golden with crispy edges.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Enjoy warm or at room temperature. This tofu is the perfect protein boost for wraps, risotto, polenta, creamy pink pasta, pasta arrabiata, or on pizza or paired with roasted vegetables.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Leftovers keep in a sealed container in the refrigerator for 3-4 days or in the freezer for up to 1 month. Reheat in a skillet or in the oven at 350°F (176°C) for 5-10 minutes until warm and crispy.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/italian-herb-crispy-baked-tofu/

docs.title: Orange Honey Tofu
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 5 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 pan-fried or air fryer tofu
  • 1 cup vegetable broth
  • 0.5 cup orange juice
  • 0.25 cup sugar (coconut sugar, brown sugar, or pure maple syrup)
  • 8 tsp honey
  • 0.33 cup rice vinegar
  • 0.25 cup tahini or soy sauce
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 tsp ginger
  • 1 tsp Sriracha hot sauce
  • 0.125 tsp red pepper flakes (alternative)
  • 2 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 5 cups brown or white rice with chives
  • 3 Tbsp green onions (optional)
  • some sesame seeds (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pan
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make either pan-fried or air fryer tofu.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large pan (large enough to fit the tofu and sauce), add vegetable broth, orange juice, sugar (coconut sugar, brown sugar, or pure maple syrup), honey, rice vinegar, tamari or soy sauce, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes (alternative) or Sriracha hot sauce. Bring to a boil, and cook for 1 minute or two.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix the cornstarch and water in a small bowl to combine, and then add to the pot.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir over medium-high heat constantly for a couple of minutes, until the sauce thickens.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Now add the tofu to the pan and stir to coat the tofu in the sauce. Remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve over brown or white rice with chives. Sprinkle with green onions (optional) and/or sesame seeds (optional). Add a side of steamed broccoli or cauliflower if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.noracooks.com/crispy-baked-orange-tofu/

docs.title: Pan-Fried Tofu
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2-4 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 12 oz tofu cubes
  • 1 Tbsp tamari or soy sauce
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 tsp onion powder
  • 0.5 tsp black pepper
  • 6 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 2 Tbsp oil of choice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 freezer bag

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the tofu cubes, tamari or soy sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, and black pepper to a large bowl, mix until well combined, and let it rest for at least 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain the tofu and transfer 1/3 of the tofu cubes into a freezer bag with 1 or 2 Tbsp of cornstarch and toss to coat. Repeat this step with the remaining tofu and cornstarch. Add more cornstarch if needed.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: If you don’t want to use a freezer or plastic bag, just add the cornstarch to a shallow dish, then the tofu cubes and toss to coat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once the tofu cubes are coated with the cornstarch, heat the 1 to 2 Tbsp of oil of choice in a skillet or a pan and add the tofu cubes. I used extra virgin olive oil, but any oil will do.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook the tofu cubes over medium-high heat until all sides are golden brown. Remove the tofu from the skillet and place it onto a plate or a wire rack.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve immediately with dishes like vegetable tempura, sauteed kale, vegan stuffed peppers, or even roasted red peppers.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Keep the leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://simpleveganblog.com/fried-tofu/

docs.title: Terri's Quick and Easy Way
docs.text: After purchasing tofu in plastic container from the produce section of the grocery store, bring it home and place directly in the freezer. This greatly lengthens the time allowed for using it, since it won't be spoiling within a couple of weeks. When ready to use in a stir fry or other dish, defrost completely by either placing in the refrigerator for 24+ hours, or submerging in a large bowl of very warm water. If submerging, it will take an hour or so and will require changing the water a couple of times to make sure it stays very warm. Once defrosted, open the container and drain out excess water. You will notice that the molecular structure of the tofu has actually changed. It is much firmer and more sponge-like. It can now be handled with ease and the water can be squeezed out of it using your hands, just like wringing out a sponge.

docs.title: Baked Cream Cheese Spaghetti Casserole
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb ground soy meat
  • 1 28-oz jar marinara
  • 1 12-oz pkg spaghetti
  • 8 oz cream cheese
  • 1 tsp Italian seasoning
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.5 cup grated Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 9x13 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. In a saucepan, mix ground soy meat and marinara.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Separately, cook spaghetti, then drain.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add cream cheese, Italian seasoning, and garlic to spaghetti.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Lightly grease 9x13 pan. Spread a small amount of sauce in bottom of pan. Put spaghetti on top, and pour remaining sauce over pasta.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Top with grated Parmesan and bake for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Butternut Squash and Sage Spaghetti
docs.text: Total Time 1.03 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 butternut squash
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 24 sage leaves
  • 320 g pasta
  • 0.5 lemon juice
  • 3 Tbsp Mascarpone cheese
  • some nutmeg
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 3 cups pasta cooking water
  • some olive oil
  • 0.5 tsp chili flakes
  • 1 cup pecorino cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 kitchen towel or paper
  • 1 blender
  • 1 large frying pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut the butternut squash (pumpkin) in half, remove seeds and drizzle with olive oil. Place in oven skin side up along with garlic cloves. Bake at 350°F for 50 to 60 minutes or until soft.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a frying pan on high heat, add enough olive oil to cover the bottom and once hot, fry your sage leaves on each side until crispy. Set aside on kitchen towel or paper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Meanwhile get your pasta water ready. Bring to the boil with enough salt. Try and time your pasta cooking time so it’s ready at the same time the pumpkins are soft. Cook your pasta 2 minutes less than al dente.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once pumpkins are cooked, remove skins and place the flesh in blender, add the garlic clove flesh, simply by squeezing the skins, add half a lemon juice, the Mascarpone cheese, some grated nutmeg, salt & pepper, and two to three cups of the pasta cooking water, blitz all ingredients until smooth.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a large frying pan on high heat, add a little olive oil, chili flakes and shredded sage leaves. Fry for 30 seconds to release the aromas. Pour the blended butternut content into the pan. Drain and transfer pasta directly to sauce. Mix well, you may need to add a little more of the pasta cooking water for a saucy consistency. Cook 2 minutes until al dente.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Turn heat off, add three quarter cup of grated pecorino cheese, mix again taste for seasoning, adjust if required, mix and serve immediately.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Garnish with grated pecorino cheese and crispy fried sage leaves.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://recipe30.com/squash-and-sage-spaghetti.html/

docs.title: Butternut Squash Pasta with Walnuts & Sage
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups butternut squash
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 6 oz spaghetti or linguine pasta
  • 1 Tbsp butter
  • 1 small shallot
  • 0.25 cup sage
  • 0.25 cup walnuts
  • 0.5 cup chickpeas
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 lemon
  • 1 splash balsamic vinegar
  • some spinach
  • some pecorino (optional)
  • 0.5 cup parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Roast the butternut squash cubes with a little olive oil, salt, and pepper for about 20 minutes, or until they're soft and mostly cooked through. Remove from the oven and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook spaghetti or linguine pasta in salty water until al dente and reserve at least 1 cup of the starchy pasta water.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil and butter, then add the shallot and cook until translucent. Add the chopped sage and cook for another 30 seconds, then add the walnuts, chickpeas, butternut squash cubes, garlic, salt, and pepper. Cook until the chickpeas and squash brown a bit (but before the garlic burns).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add a big squeeze of lemon and a good splash of balsamic vinegar and stir.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the cooked pasta and spinach. Use tongs to gently toss the pasta with everything in the pan, allowing the greens to wilt. Add pasta water to help loosen it (I used about 1/4 cup).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add some grated pecorino (optional) at this step if you wish.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove from heat, then stir in the chopped parsley.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Taste and adjust seasonings and serve with extra grated cheese.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.loveandlemons.com/butternut-pasta-walnuts-sage/

docs.title: Caprese Risoni
docs.text: Total Time 14 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg Risoni
  • 6 organic tomatoes on a vine
  • 1 can cannellini beans
  • 0.25 cup pesto
  • 1 container optional Ciliegine fresh mozzarella
  • 3 Tbsp balsamic glaze

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, bring 1.5 cups of water to a boil. Stir in Risoni and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 9 minutes, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Chop organic tomatoes on a vine and mix cannellini beans, pesto, and optional Ciliegine fresh mozzarella.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve and drizzle with balsamic glaze.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Classic Margherita Pizza
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4-6 13 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 14.5-oz can tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp sugar
  • 1 tsp balsamic vinegar
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp pepper
  • New York-style pizza sauce (alternative)
  • 1 lb pizza dough
  • some all-purpose flour
  • some cornmeal
  • 8 oz mozzarella
  • 0.25 cup basil
  • 0.25 cup Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Arrange a rack in the bottom third of the oven. Place a heavy rimmed baking sheet upside-down on the rack, and heat the oven to 450°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Make the sauce: Place the garlic in a food processor fitted with the blade attachment and pulse until coarsely chopped, 2 to 3 pulses. Add the tomatoes and their juices, olive oil, sugar, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper and process until puréed or to desired consistency, 20 to 30 seconds; set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Divide the pizza dough into two pieces. If the dough is sticky, dust with a little bit of all-purpose flour. Dust a 12-inch piece of parchment paper with cornmeal and place the dough on it. Use the heel of your hand to press the dough flat. Work from the middle out to shape it into a 10-inch round with your hands or a rolling pin. The dough will stick to the parchment; if it starts to shrink back, wait a few minutes to let it relax and continue shaping.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Brush the dough with 1 teaspoon of the olive oil, then spread 1/4 cup of the pizza sauce into a thin layer onto dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Carefully remove the preheated baking sheet from the oven and use the parchment paper to slide the pizza onto the back of the baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 4 minutes. Top the pizza with half of the mozzarella, leaving some space between the slices. Bake until the crust is golden brown and crisp and the cheese melts, 6 to 7 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove the pizza from the oven. Immediately drizzle with 2 teaspoons of the olive oil. Scatter half of the basil on the pizza and sprinkle with half of the Parmesan. Cool for 2 minutes before slicing and serving. Repeat with the remaining dough and toppings.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/easy-recipe-classic-margherita-pizza-recipes-from-the-kitchn-174103

docs.title: Creamy Italian White Bean
docs.text: Total Time 33 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup cashews
  • 1.25 cup water
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 medium shallot
  • 4 cups cherry tomatoes
  • 4.5 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 tsp red pepper flakes (optional)
  • 0.75 tsp sea salt
  • 0.5 cup white wine
  • 2 15-oz cans white beans
  • 4 cups baby spinach
  • 2 Tbsp basil
  • 1 crispy baked tofu with Italian herbs (optional)
  • some vegan Parmesan (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 heatproof bowl
  • 1 large rimmed skillet
  • 1 high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the cashews to a heatproof bowl and cover with hot water by at least 1-2 inches. Let them soak for 15 minutes while you get started on the rest of your ingredients.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat a large rimmed skillet over medium heat. Once warmed, add the olive oil and minced shallot. Sauté for 2 to 3 minutes until the shallot is translucent.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the whole cherry tomatoes, sliced garlic, red pepper flakes (optional), and sea salt. Cook for 2 minutes, then add the white wine (or water) and increase to medium-high heat. Cover the pan and let the tomatoes cook for 5 to 8 minutes. At this point, the skins on the tomatoes should have blistered. Remove the lid and turn the heat back down to medium. Use the back of your spoon or spatula to smash the tomatoes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the drained and rinsed white beans and stir, letting them sauté (uncovered) with the tomatoes until most of the liquid has evaporated - about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Meanwhile, drain the cashews and add them to a high-speed blender with the water. Blend on high until smooth and creamy.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Once the liquid has reduced from your tomatoes and beans, add the cashew cream and cook, stirring occasionally, until it’s a thick, saucy consistency.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Turn off the heat and stir in the baby spinach and basil. Optionally, add crispy baked tofu with Italian herbs (optional). Let it wilt before serving over pasta or with a side of crusty bread (both optional)! Garnish with an optional sprinkling of vegan Parmesan (optional) and black pepper! Enjoy hot.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days or in the freezer for up to 1 month.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/creamy-italian-white-bean-skillet-meal/

docs.title: Creamy Mushroom Pasta
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 oz unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup red onion
  • 6 oz mushrooms
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 Tbsp garlic
  • 1 Tbsp fresh tarragon or sage or thyme or rosemary
  • 2 cups spinach
  • 3 oz vegetable stock
  • 8 oz heavy cream
  • 1 cup Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 sauté pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a sauté pan, heat the unsalted butter, and when melted, add the finely diced red onion and cook for about 5 minutes at medium heat. Add the mushrooms, salt, and pepper and sauté until they have released ALL their water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the garlic and the fresh tarragon or sage or thyme or rosemary incorporate and add the spinach and cook until it is wilted.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the vegetable stock and let it reduce for a minute. Add the heavy cream and let it reduce to the right thickness. Make sure to cook until you have the perfect texture, which is to coat the pasta.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the grated Parmesan and adjust the seasoning with freshly ground black pepper.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/pasta/creamy-mushroom-pasta/

docs.title: Easiest Ever Macaroni & Cheese
docs.text: Total Time 17 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups water
  • 1 cup milk
  • 8 oz elbow macaroni
  • 4 oz American cheese (shredded, from deli)
  • 4 oz extra-sharp cheddar
  • 0.5 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 1 pinch cayenne
  • 0.33 cup panko breadcrumbs
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp pepper
  • 2 Tbsp Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Boil water and milk and stir in elbow macaroni. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook 6 to 8 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add in American cheese (shredded, from deli), extra-sharp cheddar, Dijon mustard, and cayenne.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook, stirring constantly, until cheese has completely melted. Cover saucepan and let stand for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Meanwhile, combine panko breadcrumbs, olive oil, and 1/8 tsp salt and 1/8 tsp pepper in a skillet.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until evenly browned, 3 to 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Off heat, sprinkle Parmesan over panko and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Transfer macaroni to serving dish and sprinkle panko mixture over top.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp basil
  • 0.25 tsp black pepper
  • 1 cup bread crumbs
  • 12 oz eggplant
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 24 oz marinara sauce
  • 2 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 medium onion
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 0.25 cup parsley
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 16 oz spaghetti
  • 0.5 tsp thyme

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• baking sheet
  • parchment paper
  • large skillet
  • spatula
  • large bowl
  • medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the eggplant and cook, occasionally mashing it with the side of a spatula or wooden spoon, for about 5 minutes, or until the eggplant starts to become tender. Add the onion and cook for 4 to 5 minutes more, until the eggplant is cooked through and tender but still holds its shape.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the garlic, basil, oregano, thyme and black pepper and cook for 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the eggplant mixture to a large bowl. Mix in the nutritional yeast and bread crumbs. (Bread crumbs contain different amounts of sodium, so it is important to taste the eggplant mixture before adding the salt.) Taste the mixture and season with the salt. Allow the mixture to sit at room temperature until cool enough to handle before forming the meatballs.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Using your hands and about 1½ tablespoons of the eggplant mixture for each, form 15 meatballs. Place the meatballs on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. Flip them over and cook for about 10 minutes more, or until golden brown on both sides.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Meanwhile, cook the spaghetti according to the package directions until it is al dente and heat the marinara sauce in a medium saucepan over medium heat.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Allow the meatballs to cool for about 10 minutes. Transfer them to the saucepan with the marinara sauce. Heat gently until warmed through before serving on top of the pasta and garnishing with parsley.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cupofjo.com/2022/4/eggplant-parm-meatballs/

docs.title: Eggplant Parmesan Pasta
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsps Parmigiano-Reggiano
  • 1 sprig basil sprig
  • 0.25 cups chopped basil
  • 1 can crushed tomatoes
  • 8 cups cubed eggplant
  • 0.25 tsp dried oregano
  • 0.5 cups finely chopped onion
  • 3 cloves minced garlic
  • 8 ozs mozzarella
  • 8 Tbsps olive oil
  • 0.75 cups panko bread crumbs
  • 0.5 cups pasta water
  • 1 lb short pasta
  • 2 Tbsps tomato paste
  • 1.5 cups water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• high-sided large (12-inch) skillet with a lid
  • plate
  • large pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a high-sided large (12-inch) skillet with a lid, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium. Add panko, season with salt and pepper, and cook, stirring constantly, until golden and crispy, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Set a large pot of salted water to boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Wipe out the skillet and heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium. Add finely chopped onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in minced garlic until fragrant, 30 seconds. Add eggplant and drizzle over the remaining 4 tablespoons olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, and cook, stirring occasionally, until eggplant is softened, about 8 minutes. Add in tomato paste and stir constantly until lightly caramelized on the bottom of the skillet, about 2 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, basil sprig, dried oregano and 1½ cups of water, and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cover the skillet and reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring occasionally and smashing some of the cubed eggplant, until the eggplant is very tender and the sauce is thickened, about 15 minutes. Discard the basil sprig.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Meanwhile, in the large pot of water, cook short pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve ½ cup of pasta water and drain.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add cooked pasta, reserved pasta water and the eggplant sauce to the large pasta cooking pot, and cook over medium heat, stirring, until sauce thickens and coats the pasta, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in ¼ cup of the chopped basil.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add Parmigiano-Reggiano to the panko bread crumbs and mix well. Divide the pasta in bowls and top each with some of the mozzarella. Sprinkle over cheesy bread crumbs, and garnish with the remaining basil.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1023096-eggplant-parmesan-pasta

docs.title: Eggplant Parmigiana
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8-12 2.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Sauce
docs.text:
• 1 28-oz can plum tomatoes and their juices
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Ingredients - Eggplant
docs.text:
• 3 large eggs
  • 1 Tbsp water
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1.25 cups dried plain fine bread crumbs
  • 1 Tbsp Italian seasoning
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup vegetable oil
  • 3 medium eggplant
  • 10.5 oz mozzarella
  • 3 Tbsp Pecorino

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender
  • 1 medium–large (4-quart or so) heavy-bottomed pot
  • 1 medium baking dish or wide shallow bowl
  • 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 paper towels
  • 1 large high-sided skillet
  • 1 9 X 13 inch baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a blender, pulse the plum tomatoes and their juices until just slightly chunky. In a medium–large (4-quart or so) heavy-bottomed pot over medium-low heat, add the olive oil and garlic, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is softened slightly and fragrant but not yet browned, about 4 minutes. Pour in the puréed tomato mixture and season with a generous pinch each of salt and pepper. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook, stirring frequently, until thickened slightly, at least 1 to 1.5 hours. The sauce can be cooled and refrigerated for up to 2 days.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: If you’re baking and serving right away, set a rack in the top third of the oven and preheat to 400°F. If not, skip the preheat for now.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium baking dish or wide shallow bowl, beat the eggs with 1 tablespoon water. Season with a generous pinch of salt. In a second baking dish or bowl, stir together the dried plain fine bread crumbs, Italian seasoning, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Working with one or two at a time, dredge the eggplant slices in the egg wash and let the excess drip back into the bowl. Transfer to the bread crumbs and coat very lightly on each side.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Line a large baking sheet with a few layers of paper towels and set by the stove. In a large high-sided skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1/2 cup vegetable oil until shimmering. Turn the heat down to medium and add some eggplant slices in a single layer until the skillet is full. Cook, turning once, until well browned on each side, about 6 minutes total. Transfer to the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining eggplant, working in batches as needed and adding a little more oil every other batch, or as needed. As you work, continue to add layers of paper towels between the eggplant slices so they remain separate. The fried eggplant can be refrigerated in airtight container for up to 1 day.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a 9 X 13 inch baking dish, ladle 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons sauce into the bottom. Cover the sauce with a single layer of eggplant (start with the thickest ones on the bottom and save the prettiest slices for the top). Ladle another 1/2 cup sauce on top, spreading it evenly. Sprinkle with about 1/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons mozzarella and 1 tablespoon Pecorino. Add another layer of eggplant and repeat this process until you’ve reached the final layer of eggplant. Top this layer only with 1/2 cup sauce, a final thin layer of mozzarella, and some Pecorino. (Reserve any remaining sauce for another use.) At this point, the eggplant parmigiana can be refrigerated, covered, for up to 1 day.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake, uncovered, until the cheese is melted and bronzed in places and the sauce is bubbling around the edges, about 20 minutes (add about 10 minutes if your dish was previously assembled and chilled). Remove and let cool slightly. Slice into squares and serve warm.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.saveur.com/best-ever-eggplant-parmigiana/
  • https://www.thekitchn.com/eggplant-parmesan-recipe-reviews-23048190

docs.title: Firecracker Chickpea Meatballs
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 400 g chickpeas
  • 1 cup breadcrumbs
  • 0.5 cup red onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp black pepper
  • some water
  • 1 Tbsp high-heat oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place drained chickpeas, breadcrumbs, chopped red onion, garlic, soy sauce, paprika, cumin, and black pepper in food processor. Pulse until well mixed. Add water if needed to allow ingredients to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Roll mixture into 1.5" balls.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place on baking sheet and spray/drizzle with high-heat oil.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 15 minutes, then flip; bake 10 to 15 minutes more.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Ginger Sesame Vegan Meatballs
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 70 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 can black beans
  • 8 ozs cremini mushrooms
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 2.5 Tbsp ginger
  • 3 stalks green onion
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 1 cup quinoa
  • 1 tbsp sesame oil
  • 2 tbsp tamari

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• small saucepan
  • fork
  • large skillet
  • kitchen towel
  • baking sheet
  • food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: If you haven’t done so, cook quinoa and set aside to cool. To prepare 1 cup cooked quinoa: Add 1/3 heaping cup (65 g) dry quinoa to a small saucepan and toast for 2-3 minutes over medium heat. Then add 2/3 cup (160 ml) water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 10-15 minutes or until water is absorbed. Then fluff with a fork, remove from the heat, and crack the lid so the quinoa can cool.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat a large skillet over medium heat with the sesame oil. Once hot, add the cremini mushrooms and sauté for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are lightly browned and have released most of their moisture.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Drain and rinse the black beans, then dry in a clean kitchen towel.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: To the sautéed mushrooms, add the black beans, garlic, green onion, ginger, and tamari (or soy sauce or coconut aminos). Sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until slightly softened, stirring frequently. Set aside to cool slightly.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400 F (200 C) and set out a baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Transfer the mixture to a food processor and pulse until no large pieces of beans or mushrooms remain, being careful not to overmix into a paste.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add 1 cup (185 g) cooked and cooled quinoa (adjust amount if altering batch size) and the maple syrup (or agave or honey). Pulse to combine until a textured dough forms, again being careful not to overmix.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more tamari for saltiness/depth of flavor, sesame oil for nuttiness, or maple syrup for balance. If it’s too wet, add more quinoa and pulse to combine.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Scoop out 1 ½-Tbsp portions of dough and gently shape into round balls using wet hands. Recipe as written makes ~15 meatballs. Add formed meatballs to a bare or parchment-lined baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Bake for 15 minutes. Then flip to ensure even baking and bake for another 10-15 minutes, or until golden brown and slightly dry to the touch.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: These "meatballs" are delicious served with steamed or roasted broccoli, sesame seeds, teriyaki sauce, and your grain of choice (brown rice, white rice, quinoa, coconut rice, millet // or cauliflower rice for grain-free).

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Leftovers will keep up to 3-4 days in the refrigerator or 1 month in the freezer. To reheat cooked meatballs from frozen, place on a baking sheet and bake at 400 F (200 C) for 10-12 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/ginger-sesame-vegan-meatballs/#wprm-recipe-container-89162

docs.title: Healthy Pasta with Pesto & Broccoli
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 8 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg fusilli pasta
  • 4 cups broccoli florets
  • 2 cups grape tomatoes
  • 0.5 cup Parmesan cheese
  • 1 cup pasta water
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp pesto
  • 1 Tbsp pesto
  • 0.25 cup pesto
  • 0.33 cup sun-dried tomatoes
  • 1 salt
  • some black pepper
  • 0.13 tsp red pepper flakes

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 dutch oven

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook fusilli pasta as per package instructions.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While pasta is cooking, get all ingredients ready – chop broccoli florets, half grape tomatoes, and grate Parmesan cheese.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Reserve 1 cup of pasta water, draining the rest. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Preheat large deep skillet or a dutch oven on medium heat, add olive oil and garlic. Sauté for 30 seconds, stirring frequently.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add 1 tbsp pesto, tomatoes and stir. Cook for 1 – 2 minutes, stir and cook another 1 – 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Move to one side of the skillet and make sure the empty side of is positioned directly over heat. Add 1 tbsp pesto and broccoli, stir and cook for 4 minutes, stirring once.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove skillet from heat and add remaining 1/4 cup pesto, sun-dried tomatoes, half Parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper, red pepper flakes, pasta and pasta water. Stir gently and let flavors marinate for a few minutes. Do not cover because broccoli will become a mushy mess.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Sprinkle with remaining half Parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://ifoodreal.com/healthy-pasta/
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Jamie Oliver Ricotta Fritters
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 egg
  • 14 oz ricotta
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 1.5 oz Parmesan
  • 1 heaped Tbsp flour
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • some marinara

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 frying pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix egg, ricotta, nutmeg, lemon zest, Parmesan, and flour.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put 1 Tbsp olive oil into frying pan. Scrape 8 dollops of mixture into pan and turn when golden.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Serve with favorite marinara.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.jamieoliver.com/recipes/cheese-recipes/ricotta-fritters-with-tomato-sauce-courgette-salad/
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Lemon & Pea Alfredo
docs.text: Total Time 11 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb fusilli con buco pasta
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 2.5 cup Parmesan
  • 1 cup mascarpone
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 1.5 cup peas
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 tsp pink pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 large straight-sided skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the fusilli con buco pasta and cook until just short of al dente, 10 or 11 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, heat a large straight-sided skillet over medium heat. Add the unsalted butter and olive oil to the hot skillet. When the butter is melted, add the garlic; cook, stirring often, until soft and fragrant. Add 1/2 cup of the pasta water, then reduce the heat to low.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: When the pasta is ready, lift it out of the water and add it directly to the sauce; reserve the pasta water. Sprinkle the Parmesan over the pasta and stir to combine. Return the heat to medium, add the mascarpone, lemon zest and 3/4 teaspoon salt and toss well. Continue cooking until the pasta is al dente, another minute or two, adding pasta water as needed to thin the sauce.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the peas and lemon juice; toss well to combine. Add more pasta water as needed to reach the desired sauce consistency (you will most likely use about 1.5 cups pasta water in all).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Sprinkle with the pink pepper and additional Parmesan, if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/giada-de-laurentiis/lemon-and-pea-alfredo-4488393

docs.title: Light & Tender Potato Gnocchi With Sage-Butter Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 lb russet potatoes
  • some kosher salt
  • 3 egg yolks
  • 0.75 cup flour
  • 1 stick butter
  • 1 sprig sage
  • some Parmesan cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 wire rack
  • 1 tongs
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 ricer or food mill
  • 1 pastry blender or bench scraper
  • 1 large pot
  • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 450°F (232°C). Set russet potatoes either on a wire rack set over a baking sheet, on a baking sheet lined with a layer of kosher salt, or directly on the oven's racks. Bake until completely tender throughout when pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer potatoes to a work surface. Using tongs to hold hot potatoes, slice each in half lengthwise.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using a spoon, scoop potato flesh into a ricer or food mill fitted with the finest disk. Press potato flesh onto a clean work surface, spreading it into an even layer, and allow steam to escape for a few minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Drizzle egg yolks all over, if using.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Scoop 1/2 cup flour into a fine-mesh sieve and tap to dust flour all over potatoes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Using a pastry blender or bench scraper, chop down repeatedly all over to cut flour and egg into potato.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Using a bench scraper, gather up shaggy potato mass and pat into a loose ball. Press ball flat with hands, then fold in half using bench scraper and press down again.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Scoop remaining 1/4 cup flour into sieve and dust all over potato dough. Continue to gently fold and press, just until a uniform dough comes together. (Make sure to simply fold and press down; avoid the smearing motion more commonly used when kneading bread.)

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Dust potato dough all over with flour and gently form into a log.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Clean work area well and dust with fresh flour. Using bench scraper, slice off a roughly 1-inch-thick portion of dough and roll into a snake about 1/2 inch thick; use a light touch as you roll, trying to use your palms more than your fingers, and dusting as necessary with flour to prevent sticking.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Using bench scraper, cut snake into 1-inch portions, trimming off uneven ends as necessary. Transfer gnocchi to a well-floured area or baking sheet and repeat with remaining dough.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Bring a large pot of very well-salted water to a boil. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it foams. Add sage and fry until very aromatic and butter begins to lightly brown; remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Using a bench scraper or slotted spatula to scoop them up, transfer gnocchi to boiling water. Stir once very gently with a spider or slotted spoon to prevent sticking. When gnocchi begin to float to the surface, wait about 20 seconds, then taste one; it should be soft yet cooked through, without any raw-flour flavor.

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Using spider or slotted spoon, scoop gnocchi directly into skillet with sage butter, allowing some of the water clinging to them to come along. Cook gnocchi in sage butter over medium-high heat, tossing very gently and adding a splash of cooking water as needed if sauce becomes greasy or breaks, until gnocchi are coated in a rich, creamy sauce, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Carefully spoon gnocchi into serving dishes and top with grated Parmesan cheese. Serve right away.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.seriouseats.com/light-tender-potato-gnocchi-recipe

docs.title: Macaroni & Cheese
docs.text: Total Time 43 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 cups whole milk
  • 1 onion pique
  • 1 stick unsalted butter
  • 113 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 113 g Parmigiano-Reggiano
  • 113 g extra-sharp cheddar
  • 113 g Gruyere
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 2 oz truffle oil (optional)
  • 1.5 lb elbow macaroni
  • 0.5 cup breadcrumbs

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 casserole dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Flavor the whole milk using an onion pique.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Prepare béchamel sauce: melt 1 stick unsalted butter in saucepan and stir in all-purpose flour. Cook roux, stirring for 3 minutes, then whisk in whole milk and nutmeg. Bring to a boil, whisking constantly, then simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in Parmigiano-Reggiano, grated extra-sharp cheddar, Gruyere, 2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp pepper until smooth. Make sure the cheese is melted and add the truffle oil (optional). Blend with an immersion blender, if desired. Remove from heat and keep covered.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook elbow macaroni until al dente. Reserve 1 cup pasta water.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Mix together cooked pasta, sauce, and water. Transfer to a casserole dish and sprinkle breadcrumbs and Parmigiano-Reggiano over the top. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/ultimate-mac-and-cheese-recipe/

docs.title: Maria Agresta’s Gnocchi alla Cilentana
docs.text: Total Time 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Pasta
docs.text:
• 2 eggs
  • 4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 3.5 oz water
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Ingredients - Sauce
docs.text:
• 2.2 lbs tomatoes
  • 0.25 red onion
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 20 leaves basil
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 10.6 oz smoked mozzarella
  • some black pepper
  • some pecorino cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: The first thing to do is to make the dough. You should add two whole eggs to the 17.7 oz of all-purpose flour, 2.5 oz of water and start to work/mix the dough. If the dough is too dry, slowly and carefully start adding the rest of the water. The dough must be soft, not sticky. Make the substance into a ball, cover with a plastic wrap and let it rest for 30 minutes. While the dough is resting, start preparing the sauce.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a pot, boil an amount of water that is enough to cover all of the tomatoes. Then wash the tomatoes and make careful slight cuts on the skin of each tomato. For no more than 20 seconds put the tomatoes into the boiling water, then take them out and carefully peel off the skin. Right after, cut the tomatoes into little cubes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cut the red onion and place it in a different pot, along with the olive oil, one clove of garlic, one leaf of basil and let it warm up. When the oil is turning hot and the garlic starts to golden, take out the garlic and put all of the tomato cubes inside the pot. Add one teaspoon of salt and let it cook for 20 minutes. At the end, add the rest of the fresh basil leaves and cover with the pot cover.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: The next step is to transform everything into pasta. Take the dough and divide it into 5 to 6 parts. Be careful, because while you are using the one part, all the others should be covered like before, so the humidity can be preserved.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: With this little part of the dough, we need to make it in a shape of a long and thin snake-shaped log. After, use a knife to cut pieces every 3/4 inch. With two fingers, push each piece as if you are trying to push out a hole inside. Spread some flour on the table or on a big flat dish, and put the already shaped gnocchi on top, to preserve them from sticking to the surface. Follow the same procedure with the remaining pieces of the dough.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Take another pot with two liters of water and let it boil. When the water covers with bubbles, add one tablespoon of salt and add the gnocchi. They will be ready when they start to rise to the water surface.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Drain the gnocchi very well and put them in the pot with tomato sauce. At the same moment add smoked mozzarella and mix everything fast.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Take one-portion deep plate and put one sixth of the gnocchi inside, or if you are hungry—a little more) After, add a little bit of black pepper if you like, shaved pecorino cheese, a couple of basil leaves and put everything into the oven for 5 minutes at 392°F. Follow the same process with the rest of the portions. Take the dish out of the oven, serve on the table and Buon Appetito.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://parade.com/545773/nancyberk/opera-star-maria-agrestas-gnocchi-alla-cilentana/

docs.title: Mezza Luna Lasagna
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 1.67 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 large squash
  • some oil
  • some sea salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 jars Alfredo sauce
  • 15 oz ricotta cheese
  • 2 cups chopped spinach
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 12 sheets no boil lasagna noodles
  • 1 cup Mozzarella cheese
  • 0.5 cup Parmesan cheeses

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 9"x 13" baking dish
  • 1 foil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Slice squash halves into 1/2" half-moon-shaped pieces. Spray a large baking sheet with a light dusting of oil and sprinkle with a little sea salt and pepper. Place the slices on the sheet in a single layer. Lightly spray the tops and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until the slices are tender, about 35 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to cool; lower oven temperature to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Empty Alfredo sauce into a sauce pan; warm over very low heat, just enough to liquefy, and remove from heat. Place ricotta cheese, chopped spinach, nutmeg and a pinch of salt into a bowl and combine. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Assemble lasagna: Coat the bottom of a 9"x 13" baking dish with a light layer of Alfredo sauce. Place four sheets of no boil lasagna noodles side by side and top them with more Alfredo sauce. Next, add squash in a single layer. Top squash with more Alfredo sauce and another layer of noodles. Top noodles with all of the ricotta-spinach mixture and smooth out. Top with another layer of noodles, then Alfredo sauce and the last of the squash. Pour over the remainder of Alfredo sauce and top with Mozzarella cheese & Parmesan cheeses.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover lasagna with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Remove foil and bake another 5 to 10 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly. Remove from oven and rest 15 minutes before slicing.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/mezza-luna-lasagna

docs.title: Mushroom Risotto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup dried porcini mushrooms
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 lb sautéed any kind of fresh mushrooms
  • 2 shallots
  • 2 clove
  • 2 sprig thyme
  • 0.25 cup dry white wine
  • 1 Risotto Milanese omitting the saffron
  • 1 Tbsp butter
  • some chives

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mesh sieve
  • 1 paper towel
  • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak in hot water and cover for 20 minutes dried porcini mushrooms.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain the soaking liquid through a mesh sieve lined with a paper towel, reserving the liquid, and chop coarsely. Heat in a large skillet over medium-high heat 2 Tbsp olive oil.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the porcini and sauté 1 pound of any kind of fresh mushrooms with sliced and minced shallots, garlic, and thyme.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook until lightly browned. Add the mushroom soaking liquid and boil until it has evaporated. Add dry white wine.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Boil until it has evaporated. Prepare Risotto Milanese omitting the saffron.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Fold the mushrooms into a risotto for the last 10 minutes of cooking. Fold in with the cheese 1 Tbsp butter.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Top with a sprinkling of chives.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Olive Garden Fettuccine Alfredo
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 oz fettuccine
  • 3 Tbsp butter
  • 1 cup heavy whipping cream
  • 0.25 cup Parmesan
  • 0.25 cup Romano cheese
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 1 dash pepper
  • 1 dash nutmeg
  • some parsley (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To start, cook the fettuccine according to the package instructions. While the pasta is cooking, you can prepare the Alfredo sauce.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat. Be sure to choose a saucepan that will fit all of your Alfredo sauce with the cooked fettuccine—everything will be combined in it.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour the cup of heavy whipping cream into the pot, stirring to combine. While heavy whipping cream and heavy cream are typically used interchangeably for some cooks, they do contain a slight difference in milk fat content, so the consistency might be a bit different if you decide to substitute.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once combined, sprinkle in 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, all the Romano cheese, the lightly beaten egg yolk, salt, pepper and nutmeg. The extra dash of ground nutmeg elevates the flavor along with the usual salt and pepper combo, making the Olive Garden Alfredo sauce stand out among the rest.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook and stir the sauce over medium-low heat until a thermometer reads 160°F; do not bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Drain the cooked fettuccine pasta, then add it to the saucepan with the Olive Garden Alfredo sauce and the remaining Parmesan cheese. Stir together the pasta, sauce and cheese until fully combined. The thick sauce and extra cheese should cling to the pasta nicely. If the Olive Garden Alfredo sauce still feels slightly thin, you can let the pasta simmer for a few minutes to thicken it up before serving.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: If desired, sprinkle with parsley (optional). Serve with a slice of garlic bread or, even better, a batch of Copycat Olive Garden Breadsticks.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tasteofhome.com/recipes/homemade-fettuccine-alfredo/

docs.title: Pasta e Ceci (Pasta with Chickpeas)
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 200 g dried chickpeas
  • 1 bay leaf
  • some salt
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 sprig rosemary
  • 1 chili (optional)
  • some olive oil
  • 0.5 14-oz can chopped tomatoes
  • 200 g short pasta (ditalini, mista, or rombi)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: If you’re using dried chickpeas, put them in a bowl covered with plenty of fresh cold water the night before and leave them to soak in the fridge. The next day, drain the soaked chickpeas and place them in a saucepan, cover with fresh water, add a bay leaf and simmer for a couple of hours or until the chickpeas are soft. Add salt to taste at the end. Don’t throw away the cooking liquid – this is gold and you’ll need it for the sauce. If using canned chickpeas, skip to next step.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In another saucepan, gently heat a smashed garlic, a sprig of rosemary (minus the twigs, or remove them before adding the chickpeas) and the chili (optional) in a few tablespoons of olive oil. When the garlic begins to get fragrant and soften, perhaps even slightly color, add the chopped tomatoes and let sizzle for a few minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add a ladle-full of the chickpea liquid (if you’ve used canned, use the liquid in the can) and about two-thirds of the chickpeas. Puree the remaining chickpeas before adding to the saucepan to create a creamy, thick sauce. There are some who remove the lump of smashed garlic before adding the chickpea puree – but I leave it in.

docs.title: Step 4
