docs.text: Add more of the chickpea liquid (or water or stock) to the sauce until it is quite watery, then add the short pasta (ditalini, mista, or rombi) and cook until the al dente and the sauce has reduced. If you choose to use a long pasta, you may want to cook it separately in a pot of water then simply add it to the ready sauce.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: By the time the pasta has cooked, the sauce should be creamy, not watery, but not too thick either. Like a creamy soup. Season with salt and plenty of freshly ground pepper. Ladle into shallow bowls, pour over your very best extra virgin olive oil, more freshly ground pepper and then let it sit for a moment or two before serving as it will be piping hot and it needs to cool a little to be best enjoyed. Grated Parmesan or Pecorino cheese is entirely optional. Serve this pasta dish with a spoon.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://food52.com/recipes/25865-pasta-e-ceci-pasta-with-chickpeas

docs.title: Pasta Pomodoro
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some pasta
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.33 cup onion, finely diced
  • 1 tsp garlic, finely diced
  • 1 lb cherry or Campari tomatoes, cut in half
  • some basil leaves
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • some Parmigiano-Reggiano

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 potato masher

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook the pasta according to the manufacturer instructions.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a saucepan, heat the olive oil, when hot add the onion, finely diced, and cook for a few minutes at medium heat until light golden brown. Add the garlic, finely diced, and when fragrant add the cherry or Campari tomatoes, cut in half, and add some basil leaves including the stems and cook at medium to low heat for 10 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using a potato masher, mash the tomatoes and remove the stems of the basil. Add a few more basil leaves and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Grated some Parmigiano-Reggiano on top of each plate.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/pasta-pomodoro-recipe/

docs.title: Pasta with Burst Cherry Tomato Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Topping
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 cup capers
  • 1 fillet anchovy
  • 0.5 cup panko
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 cup parsley
  • 1 tsp lemon zest

docs.title: Ingredients - Pasta
docs.text:
• 4 qt water
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 fillets anchovy
  • 2 lbs cherry tomatoes
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp sugar
  • 0.13 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 12 oz penne rigate, orecchiette, campanelle, or other short pasta
  • 1 Tbsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • 1 cup basil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 10-inch skillet
  • 1 slotted spoon
  • 1 paper towel
  • 1 plate
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 large pot
  • 1 large saucepan

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Be sure to use cherry tomatoes; grape tomatoes won't break down as much and will produce a drier sauce. Our topping contributes crunch and depth, but you can substitute 1 cup (2 ounces) of grated Parmesan cheese, if desired. For a spicier dish, use the larger amount of red pepper flakes.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: FOR THE TOPPING: Heat olive oil in 10-inch skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add capers and rinsed, patted dry, and minced anchovy and cook, stirring frequently, until capers have darkened and shrunk, 3 to 4 minutes. Using slotted spoon, transfer caper mixture to paper towel–lined plate; set aside. Leave oil in skillet and return skillet to medium heat. Add panko, salt, and pepper to skillet and cook, stirring constantly, until panko is golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer panko to medium bowl. Stir in parsley, lemon zest, and reserved caper mixture.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: FOR THE PASTA: Bring 4 quarts water to boil in large pot. While water is coming to boil, heat olive oil, thinly sliced garlic, and anchovy in large saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until anchovies break down and garlic is lightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Add cherry tomatoes, salt, sugar, and red pepper flakes to saucepan and stir to combine. Cover and increase heat to medium-high. Cook, without stirring, for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, add penne rigate, orecchiette, campanelle, or other short pasta and 1 tablespoon salt to boiling water. Cook, stirring often, until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain pasta and return it to pot. Off heat, add butter and tomato mixture to pasta and stir gently until oil, butter, and tomato juices combine to form light sauce, about 15 seconds. Adjust consistency with reserved cooking water as needed, adding 2 tablespoons at a time. Stir in basil and season with salt to taste. Serve, passing topping separately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.americastestkitchen.com/recipes/12833-pasta-with-burst-cherry-tomato-sauce-and-fried-caper-crumbs

docs.title: Pea Pesto Pasta with Sun-Dried Tomatoes & Arugula
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups basil
  • 0.5 cup parsley
  • 1 cup peas
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 0.25 cup toasted pine nuts
  • 1 medium lemon juice
  • 0.25 cup vegan Parmesan cheese
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 10 oz pasta
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.25 cup sun-dried tomatoes
  • 1 cup arugula

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Fill a large saucepan 3/4 full with water, salt generously, and bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the meantime, prepare pesto. To a food processor, add basil, parsley, peas, garlic, toasted pine nuts, lemon juice, vegan Parmesan cheese, and sea salt. Mix to combine. While the machine is running, stream in olive oil through the spout.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Continue blending, scraping down sides as needed, until creamy and fully combined. If it has trouble blending, add a bit more olive oil or water.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Taste and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more lemon juice for acidity/brightness, vegan Parmesan for cheesy flavor, salt for saltiness, or peas for sweetness.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Next add pasta to boiling water and cook according to package instructions. Be sure not to overcook, and drain when noodles are al dente and still have a slight bite to them. Return to pan off heat and set aside.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Once your pasta is drained, heat a large saucepan or cast iron skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add olive oil, garlic, and sun-dried tomatoes. Sauté for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the garlic is fragrant but not yet browned.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Turn off heat and remove skillet from burner, then add cooked pasta and toss to coat.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Transfer to a serving platter or mixing bowl and add 3/4 of pea pesto and the arugula. Toss to combine.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Serve warm with additional pesto on the side, and garnish generously with additional parsley, pine nuts, and vegan Parmesan cheese.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Best when fresh, though leftovers will keep in the refrigerator up to 2-3 days. Enjoy chilled or at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/pea-pesto-pasta-with-sun-dried-tomatoes-arugula-vegan-gf

docs.title: Penne Alla Vodka
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.92 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 2 onions
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 tsp oregano
  • 0.5 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 1 cup vodka
  • 2 28-oz cans whole tomato
  • 2 tsp salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp salt
  • 0.75 lb penne pasta
  • 2 Tbsp fresh oregano
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 cup Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium (11-inch) Dutch oven
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat the olive oil in a medium (11-inch) Dutch oven, such as Le Creuset, over medium-low heat. Add the onions and cook for about 5 minutes, until the onions are translucent. Add the garlic, oregano, and red pepper flakes and cook for just 1 minute. Add the vodka and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes, until the mixture is reduced by half. With clean hands, crush each whole tomato into the pot. Add 2 teaspoons of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and bake for 1.5 hours.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add 2 tablespoons of salt and the penne pasta and cook according the directions on the package. Drain and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the tomato mixture into a food processor fitted with the steel blade and puree until smooth. (You can also use a blender.) Return the tomato mixture to the pot. Add the fresh oregano, heavy cream, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and simmer partially covered for 10 minutes. Add the pasta to the sauce and cook for 2 minutes. Off the heat, stir in 1/2 cup of the Parmesan cheese and serve hot sprinkled with extra Parmesan and fresh oregano.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://barefootcontessa.com/recipes/penne-alla-vodka

docs.title: Potato Gnocchi
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 1.03 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs all-purpose or boiling potatoes
  • 1.33 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted butter, melted

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 fork
  • 1 potato ricer or sieve
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 large pot
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 slotted spoon or skimmer
  • 1 wide bowl

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Here is ingenuity at its best-light but substantial and delicious, amiably matched with other flavors, well worth the effort. It is traditional to cook and sauce potato gnocchi like pasta and eat them as a first course or one-dish meal.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Scrub well: 2 pounds all-purpose or boiling potatoes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Prick each potato in a dozen places with a fork. Bake directly on an oven rack until easily pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. While the potatoes are still hot, split therm lengthwise and scoop out the pulp. Push it through a potato ricer or sieve with the back of a spoon. There should be about 2.66 packed cups. Combine the potatoes in a bowl with 1.33 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir vigorously, then turn out onto a work surface knead until smooth and blended. Bring 3 to 4 inches of well-salted water to a simmer in a large pot. Have ready. 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, or olive oil. Roll about 2 tablespoons of the dough into a 3/4 inch thick cylinder. Cut into 3/4 inch pieces. Roll each piece against the tines of a fork while pressing a small dent on the opposite side with your finger. Test the gnocchi by dropping a few into the simmering water and cooking until they float, about 2 minutes. They should hold a firm shape and be chewy to the bite. If they are too soft or dissolve in simmering water, knead into the dough: (Up to 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour and Some beaten egg.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Both of these have binding properties. Test again. When the dough is right (keep the water hot), roll it into three or four 3/4 inch thick ropes. Cut the ropes into 3/4 inch pieces, shape the dough on the fork as below, letting them drop onto a lightly floured baking sheet. Bring the water back to a simmer. Drop one-third to half of the gnocchi into the pot and simmer, uncovered, until they float, then remove with a slotted spoon or skimmer to a wide bowl. Drizzle some of the melted butter over the gnocchi. Toss to coat. Repeat until all the gnocchi are done. Serve hot with: Additional melted butter and grated Parmesan, a tomato sauce or ragù or Pesto Sauce.

Info

To make gnocchi ahead, spread the uncooked gnocchi on a lightly floured baking sheet and refrigerate, covered with plastic wrap, for up to 12 hours. To keep them longer, freeze the gnocchi on the baking sheet until hard, then remove to a freezer bag or container; they will keep frozen for up to 1 month. Cook directly from the freezer, adding about 1 minute to the cooking time.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Risotto Milanese
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 generous pinches saffron threads
  • 1 cup vegetable broth
  • 9 cups vegetable broth
  • 3 Tbsp butter
  • 1 cup onion
  • 2 cups Arborio rice
  • 0.5 cup dry white wine
  • 1.5 cups Parmesan
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 large heavy saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine and let stand for 10 minutes saffron threads and hot vegetable broth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour into a saucepan, heat, and maintain at a simmer vegetable broth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Melt in a large heavy saucepan over medium-low heat 3 Tbsp butter.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add and cook, stirring, until soft and translucent but not browned minced onion.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Stir in Arborio rice.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Continue to stir the rice until it is thoroughly coated and almost entirely opaque, 3 to 5 minutes. Add dry white wine.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Stir until absorbed. Add the saffron mixture and simmer, stirring often, until absorbed. Add the vegetable stock 1 cup at a time, waiting for each cup to be absorbed before adding the next. Stir continuously and maintain a simmer. The risotto is done when the rice is tender but firm; it should be creamy, not stiff. Fold in 1 to 1.5 cups grated Parmesan.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Season to taste with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: If desired, serve with grated Parmesan.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Spaghetti Aglio E Olio
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 lb spaghettoni
  • 5 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 1 small chili pepper
  • 2 Tbsp garlic

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 shallow dish
  • 1 saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a shallow dish (like a frying pan) add the spaghettoni and barely cover the pasta. You want the pasta water to have as much starch as possible.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a saucepan, heat the olive oil and the parsley stem and add some pasta water. Add the chili pepper, garlic, and maybe a little more pasta water. The perfect formula is about 1 part olive oil for two part pasta water. Cook and mix well to create an emulsion.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the cooked pasta and mix vigorously to keep that emulsion with the pasta. You can always add a little more olive oil if you wish. Add the chopped parsley at the last minute.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Traditionally this dish is NOT served with cheese but as long as you do not have Italian at the dinner table, Bon Appetito 😊!!!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/pasta/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio-recipe/

docs.title: Spaghetti All'Assassina
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 cups water
  • 0.25 cup tomato paste
  • 1 tsp sugar
  • 0.33 cup olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 1 cup tomato passata
  • 1.75 tsp salt
  • 12 oz spaghetti
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 12-inch nonstick skillet
  • 1 long-handled rubber spatula
  • 1 thin spatulas

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Whisk water, tomato paste, and sugar together in medium saucepan. Bring to simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to low to keep tomato broth warm.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat 1/3 cup olive oil, garlic, and red pepper flakes in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook, stirring frequently with long-handled rubber spatula, until garlic is golden brown, about 2 minutes. Stir in tomato passata and salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until sauce thickens and oil around edges of skillet begins to sizzle, about 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add spaghetti in even layer and increase heat to medium-high. Add 1 cup tomato broth (A) and cook, pushing between pasta strands frequently with edge of spatula to prevent clumping, until broth has been mostly absorbed by pasta and sauce around edges of skillet begins to sizzle, 4 to 5 minutes. Add 1 cup broth (B) and cook, shaking skillet occasionally and continuing to prod pasta strands with spatula, until broth has been mostly absorbed and sauce begins to sizzle, 5 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Using 2 thin spatulas, gently flip half of pasta so bottom is on top and spread into even layer. Repeat with remaining half of pasta (C). Add 1 cup broth and cook, continuing to shake skillet and prod pasta, until broth has been mostly absorbed and sauce begins to sizzle, 5 to 7 minutes. Add 1 cup broth (D) and repeat cooking until sauce begins to sizzle, 5 to 7 minutes. Repeat dividing and flipping pasta (E).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add 1 cup broth and repeat cooking until sauce begins to sizzle, 5 to 7 minutes. Pasta should be firm but cooked through. If not, add remaining 1 cup broth, 1/2 cup at a time, and continue to cook, checking frequently, until pasta is cooked through.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Increase heat to high and cook pasta, without moving it, until under side is deeply browned and crisp and some strands are beginning to char, 3 to 5 minutes (F). Remove skillet from heat, drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, and serve immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Spaghetti Alla Puttanesca
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 16-oz pkg whole wheat spaghetti
  • 2 oz sliced black olives
  • 1 14-oz can artichoke hearts
  • 0.75 cup cooked chickpeas

  • 1 14-oz can diced tomatoes
  • 1 Tbsp dried oregano
  • 1 tsp dried basil
  • 1 tsp dried thyme
  • 0.5 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 0.5 tsp ground black pepper
  • 3 cups vegetable broth

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large, deep skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the whole wheat spaghetti to a large, deep skillet, breaking in half if needed.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the sliced black olives, artichoke hearts, cooked chickpeas, capers, minced onion, diced tomatoes, dried oregano, dried basil, dried thyme, red pepper flakes, and ground black pepper, to the pan on top of the pasta.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour the vegetable broth over everything.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover the pan and bring to a boil. Reduce to a steady simmer, and, keeping covered and stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 5

docs.title: Spinach & Ricotta Gnudi with Tomato-Butter Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.25 hours

docs.title: Gnudi
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups whole-milk ricotta
  • 0.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 oz Parmesan
  • 1 Tbsp panko
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 tsp lemon zest
  • 10 oz frozen whole-leaf spinach
  • 2 large egg whites

docs.title: Sauce
docs.text:
• 4 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 12 oz cherry or grape tomatoes
  • 2 tsp cider vinegar
  • 1 qt water
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 2 Tbsp basil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 paper towels
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 Dutch oven
  • 1 spider skimmer or slotted spoon
  • 1 bowls

docs.title: Instructions - Gnudi
docs.text:
Note

Ricotta without stabilizers such as locust bean, guar, and xanthan gums drains more readily. You can substitute part-skim ricotta for the whole-milk ricotta. Frozen whole-leaf spinach is easiest to squeeze dry, but frozen chopped spinach will work. Squeezing the spinach should remove 1/2 to 2/3 cup of liquid; you should have 2/3 cup of finely chopped spinach. Our tomato-butter sauce isn't strictly canonical; if you'd prefer a more traditional accompaniment, substitute our Simple Tomato Sauce or browned butter and fresh sage. Serve with a simple salad.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: FOR THE GNUDI: Line rimmed baking sheet with double layer of paper towels. Spread whole-milk ricotta in even layer over towels; set aside and let sit for 10 minutes. Place all-purpose flour, Parmesan, panko, salt, pepper, and lemon zest in large bowl and stir to combine. Process frozen whole-leaf spinach in food processor until finely chopped, about 30 seconds, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. Transfer spinach to bowl with flour mixture. Grasp paper towels and fold ricotta in half; peel back towels. Rotate sheet 90 degrees and repeat folding and peeling 2 more times to consolidate ricotta into smaller mass. Using paper towels as sling, transfer ricotta to bowl with spinach mixture. Discard paper towels but do not wash sheet. Add egg whites to bowl and mix gently until well combined.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer heaping teaspoons of dough to now-empty sheet (you should have 45 to 50 portions). Using your dry hands, gently roll each portion into 1-inch ball.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Melt unsalted butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Add thinly sliced garlic and cook, swirling saucepan occasionally, until butter is very foamy and garlic is pale golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Off heat, add cherry or grape tomatoes and cider vinegar; cover and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bring 1 quart water to boil in Dutch oven. Add 1.5 teaspoons salt. Using spider skimmer or slotted spoon, transfer all gnudi to water. Return water to gentle simmer. Cook, adjusting heat to maintain gentle simmer, for 5 minutes, starting timer once water has returned to simmer (to confirm doneness, cut 1 dumpling in half; center should be firm).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: While gnudi simmer, add salt and pepper to sauce and cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes are warmed through and slightly softened, about 2 minutes. Divide sauce evenly among 4 bowls. Using spider skimmer or slotted spoon, remove gnudi from pot, drain well, and transfer to bowls with sauce. Garnish with basil and extra Parmesan. Serve immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.americastestkitchen.com/recipes/13539-spinach-and-ricotta-gnudi-with-tomato-butter-sauce

docs.title: Spinach Lasagna
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 10-oz pkgs frozen spinach
  • 32 oz cottage cheese
  • 3 eggs
  • 20 oz mozzarella
  • 32 oz spaghetti sauce
  • 3 8-oz cans tomato sauce
  • 1 1-lb box lasagna noodles
  • 20 oz mozzarella
  • 10 oz cheddar cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Thoroughly drain frozen spinach. Mix together spinach, cottage cheese, and eggs. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Set aside 8oz of mozzarella. In a large pan, layer ingredients (3-4 layers) in the following order: spaghetti sauce and tomato sauce, lasagna noodles, spinach mixture{}, and mozzarella and cheddar cheese.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Finish off top with reserved tomato sauce and mozzarella.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake for 45 minutes; let stand for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Summer Pesto Pasta
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 ears shucked corn
  • 1 medium yellow squash

  • 1 bell pepper
  • 4 green onions
  • 1 pint grape tomatoes
  • 0.5 cup store-bought pesto
  • 1 lemon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 grill pan
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook pasta according to directions, then drain.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat a grill pan and grill shucked corn, yellow squash cut into 1/2-inch thick cubes, zucchini cut into 1/2-inch thick cubes, and bell pepper cut into sixths. Add green onions and grape tomatoes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl combine store-bought pesto, zest and juice from 1 lemon.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Mix well, then pour in pasta. Combine veggies into pasta and serve.

docs.title: Trapani-Style Pasta
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb pasta
  • 2 oz Parmesan
  • 0.75 cup almonds
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 chilies
  • 3 cups cherry tomatoes
  • some olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 large handfuls basil leaves

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook pasta as desired.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place the Parmesan, almonds, garlic and chilies into a food processor. Process to combine the ingredients.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add around two thirds of the cherry tomatoes to the food processor, one and a half handfuls of basil and a little olive oil. Process until the ingredients turn into a sauce. Taste and season with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once the pasta is ready, reserve some of the cooking water then drain and return it to the saucepan. Stir in the sauce until the pasta is thoroughly coated. Add a little of the reserved water to loosen the pasta if necessary.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer to warm bowls and top with the remaining cherry tomatoes (halved or quartered) and sprinkle over basil leaves then take to the table.

docs.title: White Pizza
docs.text: Total Time 2.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pizza dough
  • 8 oz mozzarella cheese
  • 1 cup whole-milk ricotta cheese
  • 1 oz Pecorino Romano cheese
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 tsp kosher salt
  • 0.25 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 3 sprigs fresh oregano

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: If using store-bought pizza dough, divide into 2 pieces. If the dough is cold, let sit at room temperature at least 2 hours before proceeding. The dough is ready when it does not bounce back when stretched.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pat and gently squeeze 8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese dry with paper towels if water packed. Thinly slice. Place 1 cup whole-milk ricotta cheese in a small bowl. Finely grate 1 ounce Pecorino Romano cheese (about 1/2 packed cup) or measure out 1/3 cup store-bought grated, add it to the bowl of ricotta, and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Finely chop 1 large garlic clove and place in a small bowl. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, and 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes if desired. Stir to combine. Pick the leaves from 3 small fresh oregano sprigs and set aside for garnish.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat a pizza oven to 800ºF. Stretch or roll out one portion of dough on a lightly floured pizza peel into a rough 11 to 12 inch round. Brush the dough round with 1 tablespoon of the garlic oil. Top evenly with half of the mozzarella and dollop all over with half of the ricotta mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Use the peel to slide the pizza into the pizza oven. Bake until the bottom is charred in a few spots and the cheese on top is melted (you may have to turn the heat down if the crust is charring too quickly), rotating a few times for even cooking, 2.5 to 3 minutes total. Transfer to a cutting board and repeat with the remaining dough round. Scatter the oregano leaves over the top. Garnish with more red pepper flakes if desired.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Place an upside-down baking sheet or pizza stone on the middle rack and heat the oven to 450ºF. Stretch or roll out one portion of dough on a sheet of parchment paper into a rough 11 to 12-inch round. Brush the dough round with 1 tablespoon of the garlic oil. Top evenly with half of the mozzarella and dollop all over with half of the ricotta mixture.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Slide, still on the parchment, onto the hot baking sheet or stone. Bake until the edges are golden-brown and the cheese on top is melted, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and repeat with the remaining dough round. Scatter the oregano leaves over the top. Garnish with more red pepper flakes if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/white-pizza-23411738

docs.title: Applied Grilled Cheese

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some Butter
  • 6 Texas toast

  • 6 pieces Swiss cheese

docs.text: Butter one side of each piece of the Texas toast.

docs.title: Bourbon Grilled Cheese

docs.text: Stir in brown sugar, salt and pepper. Add Bourbon, scraping up brown bits in bottom of skillet. Stir 1.5 tsp butter into mix.

docs.title: Step 4

docs.title: Brussels Sprout Melts
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 47 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 large yellow onions
  • 8 oz Brussels sprouts
  • 8 oz Swiss cheese
  • 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce or balsamic vinegar
  • 0.5 tsp kosher salt
  • 0.5 tsp black pepper
  • 8 slices rye bread
  • 4 Tbsp Dijon mustard

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place 4 tablespoons of the unsalted butter on the counter and let sit at room temperature to soften. Meanwhile, make the filling.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Halve and thinly slice 2 large yellow onions until you have about 5 cups. Melt the remaining 4 tablespoons unsalted butter in a large nonstick or cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until jammy and dark brown (similar in color to mahogany), 20 to 25 minutes. This process will take time; don’t rush it. If the bottom of the pan starts to burn before the onions caramelize, add 1 tablespoon of water to the pan and scrape the bottom. Repeat this as many times as necessary to prevent burning. Meanwhile, prepare the Brussels sprouts and Swiss cheese.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Trim the root end from 8 ounces Brussels sprouts and thinly slice into ribbony rounds (about 2 1/2 cups). If needed, grate 8 ounces Swiss cheese on the large holes of a box grater (about 2 cups).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When the onions are ready, add the Brussels sprouts, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce or balsamic vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper to the pan. Cook, stirring often, until the Brussels sprouts are tender, lightly browned in spots, and wilt, 5 to 7 minutes. (If the bottom of the pan starts to burn, continue adding water 1 tablespoon at a time as needed.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and let cool until warm but no longer hot, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, wash and dry the pan used to cook the onions.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the cheese to the onion mixture and toss to combine. Taste and season with more kosher salt as needed.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Heat the same pan over medium-low heat. Meanwhile, assemble the sandwiches: Spread one side of 8 slices of rye bread with the softened butter (about 1/2 tablespoon per slice). Flip 4 of the slices over; spread 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard on each of these slices. Divide the Brussels sprouts mixture onto the mustard slices and arrange into an even layer all the way to the edge. Close the sandwiches with the remaining bread slices buttered-side up.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add 2 of the sandwiches to the pan and cook until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is completely melted, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a clean cutting board and repeat cooking the remaining 2 sandwiches. Cut each sandwich in half.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/brussel-sprouts-melts-recipe-23432384

docs.title: Carrot Dogs
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 28 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 large carrots
  • 4 whole-grain hot dog buns
  • 0.25 cup apple cider vinegar
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 2 Tbsp tamari
  • 1 tsp molasses
  • 0.25 tsp liquid smoke
  • 0.25 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.25 tsp onion powder
  • 0.25 tsp pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 colander
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Peel the carrots, trim the ends, and cut them to the length of your whole-grain hot dog buns.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the carrots and cook for 5 to 8 minutes, until tender but not mushy. Drain the carrots in a colander and put them under cold running water. This shocks them and prevents them from getting any softer.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a small bowl, whisk together the apple cider vinegar, water, tamari, molasses, liquid smoke, garlic powder, onion powder, and pepper. Transfer the marinade to a large zip top bag and add the cooled carrots. Toss gently to coat. Refrigerate overnight.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove the carrots from the marinade and place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until heated through and slightly browned.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve the carrots in the hot dog buns with your choice of toppings.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/main-dish/carrot-dogs/

docs.title: Chickpea Sunflower Sandwich

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add chickpeas to a mixing bowl and lightly mash with a fork for texture. Then add roasted unsalted sunflower seeds, vegan mayo, mustard, maple syrup, red onion, dill, salt, and pepper and mix with a spoon. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Toast rustic bread (if desired) and prepare any other sandwich toppings you desire, tomato, onion, and lettuce.

docs.title: Step 4

docs.text: Add Green Goddess dressing to the baguette.

docs.title: Grilled Tomato Sandwich
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.75 tsp cream of tartar
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp granulated sugar
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 2 4-inch field or heirloom tomato
  • 8 tsp mayonnaise
  • 4 slices hearty white sandwich bread

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Stir cream of tartar, salt, granulated sugar, and pepper together in small bowl. Sprinkle mixture on both sides of field or heirloom tomato slices that are 3/4 inch thick. Spread 1 teaspoon mayonnaise on 1 side of each slice of bread.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Place 2 slices of hearty white sandwich bread, mayonnaise side down, in 12-inch skillet. Cook over medium heat, moving bread if necessary for even browning, until underside is golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to cutting board griddled side up. Cook remaining 2 bread slices until underside is golden brown, about 30 seconds. Let cool until griddled side is crisp, about 2 minutes.

Note

Choose ripe tomatoes that are heavy for their size. Larger tomato slices that cover the entire slice of bread are ideal. We developed this recipe with 3/2 by 5-inch slices of Arnold sandwich bread, and the amount of mayonnaise used in step 1 is just enough to thinly cover each slice. Adjust this amount as necessary if your bread has different dimensions.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Open-Faced Cherry Tomato Ricotta Sandwich
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 tsp whole-grain mustard
  • 2 tsp honey
  • 2 tsp marjoram
  • 1 tsp white or red miso
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 10 oz cherry tomatoes
  • 8 oz whole-milk ricotta
  • 4 slices rustic 1/2-inch-thick bread

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 10-inch broiler-safe skillet
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In bowl, whisk together whole-grain mustard, honey, marjoram, white or red miso, and pepper. Adjust oven rack 5 inches from broiler element and heat broiler. Place cherry tomatoes in 10-inch broiler-safe skillet and broil until most tomatoes have burst and a few are lightly charred, 8 to 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer tomatoes to mustard mixture and toss until tomatoes are well coated. Arrange bread on rimmed baking sheet and broil until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Let bread cool until warm to touch, about 3 minutes. Spread 1/4 cup whole-milk ricotta on each slice of rustic 1/2-inch-thick bread. Top with tomato mixture. Serve.

docs.title: Potato Meets Egg Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2-3 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp tahini
  • 1 Tbsp apple cider or coconut vinegar
  • 3 Tbsp plain nondairy milk
  • 0.5 tsp Dijon or prepared mustard
  • 0.5 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 0.25 tsp black salt
  • 0.25 tsp turmeric
  • 0.13 tsp plain or smoked paprika
  • 1 pinch sea salt
  • some black pepper (optional)
  • 0.5 tsp pure maple syrup
  • 1 cup cooked and cooled red or yellow potatoes
  • 0.25 cup diced bell pepper
  • 2 Tbsp celery
  • 1 Tbsp parsley or chives
  • 0.5 tsp dry dill (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a bowl, whisk together the tahini, apple cider or coconut vinegar, plain nondairy milk, and Dijon or prepared mustard.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the nutritional yeast, black salt, turmeric, plain or smoked paprika, sea salt, black pepper (optional), and pure maple syrup, and whisk through again.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the cooked and cooled red or yellow potatoes, diced bell pepper, celery, and parsley or chives or dry dill (optional), and stir through.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Taste, and season with extra salt if needed (depending on whether you are subbing tofu for potatoes, and also whether you use black salt).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve, or refrigerate for 2–3 days.

docs.title: Sonoran Salad

docs.text: Cook dry quinoa in vegetable broth for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove from heat and cover and let cooked quinoa sit for 10 minutes. Season to taste.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Combine Brussels sprouts, cooked quinoa, black beans, cilantro, corn, Pico de Gallo, and pickled jalapeño in a large bowl.

docs.text: Serve with roasted red pepper dressing.

docs.title: Sweet Potato Chickpea Buddha Bowl
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Vegetables
docs.text:
• 5.33 small sweet potatoes
  • 1.33 medium red onions
  • 5.33 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2.67 bundles broccolini
  • 0.67 tsp salt
  • 0.67 tsp pepper
  • 5.33 handfuls kale

docs.title: Ingredients - Chickpeas
docs.text:
• 2.67 15-oz cans chickpeas
  • 1.67 tsp cumin
  • 2 tsp chili powder
  • 2 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.67 tsp salt
  • 0.67 tsp pepper
  • some oregano (optional)
  • 0.67 tsp turmeric (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Tahini Sauce
docs.text:
• 0.67 cup tahini
  • 2.67 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 1.33 medium lemon juice
  • 5 Tbsp hot water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 large skillet
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C) and arrange quartered sweet potatoes and wedged red onions on a bare baking sheet. Drizzle both with a bit of olive oil, making sure the flesh of the sweet potatoes are well coated and placed skin side down on the sheet.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bake for 10 minutes, then remove from oven flip sweet potatoes and add broccolini. Drizzle broccolini with a bit of oil and season with a pinch each salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake for another 8 to 10 minutes, then remove from oven and add kale. Drizzle kale with a touch more oil and season with a pinch each salt and pepper. Bake for another 4 to 5 minutes then set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While vegetables are roasting, heat a large skillet over medium heat and add chickpeas to a mixing bowl and toss with cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, oregano (optional), and turmeric (optional).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once hot, add 1 Tbsp oil (amount as original recipe is written // use half of total amount if altering batch size) and chickpeas and sauté, stirring frequently. If they’re browning too quickly, turn down heat. If there isn’t much browning going on, increase heat. I found 10 minutes total at slightly over medium heat was perfect.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Once the chickpeas are browned and fragrant, remove from heat and set aside.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Prepare sauce by adding tahini, maple syrup, and lemon juice to a mixing bowl and whisking to combine. Add 5 to 10 Tbsp of hot water until a pourable sauce is formed. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: To serve: slice sweet potatoes into bite size pieces. Divide vegetables between 8 serving bowls and top with chickpeas + tahini sauce.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Best when fresh, though leftovers will keep for a few days in the fridge.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/sweet-potato-chickpea-buddha-bowl/

docs.title: Vegetarian Corn Dogs
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some vegetable oil
  • 12 vegetarian hot dogs
  • 1.5 cups corn meal
  • 1.25 cups all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 Tbsp baking powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1.75 cups buttermilk
  • 1 egg
  • 1 Tbsp vegetable or olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp honey

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot or dutch oven
  • 1 drinking glass
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Pour 2 to 3 inches of vegetable oil in a large pot or dutch oven and heat to 350˚F over medium heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pat dry with paper towels. Insert sticks into vegetarian hot dogs.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk together corn meal, all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, baking powder and salt. Whisk together buttermilk, egg, 1 Tbsp vegetable or olive oil and honey. Combine wet and dry ingredients and whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour batter into a drinking glass almost to the top and dip hot dogs. Put corndog straight down into batter and give it a little twirl to fully coat the hot dogs then swirl as you lift up. Let excess drip off.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Hold corn dog at an angle in the hot oil for 5 to 7 seconds to let it seal then drop into oil (this keeps them from sticking to the bottom of the pot).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Fry 3 minutes or until golden brown. Fry up to 2 to 3 at a time (so you don’t drop the temperature), turning them as needed to brown evenly. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://natashaskitchen.com/corn-dogs-recipe/

docs.title: Veggie Rainbow Wrap
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 TJ's egg wraps
  • 2 Tbsp TJ's red pepper spread
  • 0.25 bell peppers sliced into matchsticks
  • 1 Persian cucumber sliced into matchsticks
  • 0.25 cup shredded carrots
  • 1 block Sriracha flavored baked tofu
  • 1 tsp lime juice

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Lay both TJ's egg wraps on top of one another on your work surface.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: About an inch above the bottom edge of the wrap, add TJ's red pepper spread in a horizontal line, an inch thick, leaving about a half-inch gap on the left and right side of the wrap.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Arrange bell peppers sliced into matchsticks, lengthwise in an inch-thick row just above the spread, leaving the same half-inch gap on the left and right side.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Repeat with Persian cucumber sliced into matchsticks and shredded carrots, laying each row just above the previous veggie.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place Sriracha flavored baked tofu above veggies.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Drizzle lime juice over the veggies.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Roll tightly and cut into 6 pieces.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/veggie-rainbow-wrap

docs.title: Watercress Egg Salad Tea Sandwich
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8-16 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 large eggs
  • 4 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 4 Tbsp mayonnaise
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • some paprika
  • 8 slices white bread
  • 0.5 cup watercress
  • some parsley (optional)
  • 0.5 cup baby arugula (alternative)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 potato masher or fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Hard-boil the eggs, rinsing them in cold water when they are done.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While still warm, peel and mash eggs with unsalted butter, using a potato masher or fork.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir mayonnaise, salt, pepper, and paprika into egg mixture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spread egg salad onto 4 slices of the white bread.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add watercress and parsley (optional), if using.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Top watercress with remaining 4 slices of bread.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text:
Remove crusts and slice sandwiches twice, diagonally, to make 4 tea sandwiches from each large sandwich.

Note

If you don't like or can't find watercress, baby arugula (alternative) would work well in this recipe, too, or even baby spinach if you'd like something with a little less of a peppery bite.

Note

White bread is classic for tea sandwiches and especially for this watercress egg salad sandwich, but a soft, sweet wheat bread would work, too.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thespruceeats.com/watercress-egg-salad-tea-sandwiches-recipe-765632

docs.title: Baked Sweet Potatoes With Chili Beans
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 2.42 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 small sweet potatoes
  • 0.5 lb pinto beans
  • 1 yellow onion
  • 2 tsp olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp chili powder
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp paprika
  • 1 tsp smoked salt
  • 1 jar San Marzano tomatoes
  • 1 avocado
  • some sour cream
  • some cilantro
  • some shredded cheese
  • 1 red onion

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 foil
  • 1 pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400. Pierce holes in the sweet potatoes/yams, lightly wrap them in foil, and bake on the middle rack for about 45 to 55 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put the pinto beans in a pot and completely cover with water, plus 2 extra inches. Bring to a gentle boil and cook for 45 to 60 minutes until the beans are cooked through.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: While the beans cook, thinly slice the yellow onion. Over medium heat, warm the olive oil in a heavy bottomed pot and cook the onions and garlic until softened. Add chili powder, cumin, paprika, smoked salt, and the jar of San Marzano tomatoes. If the tomatoes are crushed, great, if they are whole, just smush them to a puree. Bring to a simmer and reduce for about 20 minutes while the beans finish cooking.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When the beans are cooked, drain and add them to the tomato mix, cook another 10 minutes for all the flavors to marry. Taste for salt and spices, add more if desired.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Split open the baked sweet potato/yams and create a little cavern down the middle. Fill the cavern with the chili beans and add toppings as desired. I like a bit of avocado, sour cream and cilantro. You could go with a bit of shredded cheese and minced red onion... something tells me you've had chili before and know the drill.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.sproutedkitchen.com/home/2011/9/23/baked-sweet-potatoes-with-chili-beans.html

docs.title: Cabbage & Sun-dried Tomato Sauté
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 12 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 sun-dried tomatoes
  • 2 small heads cabbage
  • 1 cup green onions
  • 1 sweet onion (Vidalia)
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • some fava beans
  • some mint
  • some scallions
  • some fennel

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large sauté pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Set a large sauté pan over medium-high heat. Cook rinsed and chopped sun-dried tomatoes, thinly sliced cabbage, sliced green onions, thinly sliced sweet onion (Vidalia) in olive oil for 10 to 12 minutes or until cooked through but not too brown.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir and toss frequently; turn down heat to medium (if needed) to avoid burning.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add salt and pepper to taste before serving.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve with fresh fava beans with mint and scallions and fennel and potato cassola.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: Cowboy Quinoa Bake
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 47 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup dry quinoa
  • 2 cups water
  • 1 jar Cowboy Caviar Salsa
  • 1 can Diced Tomatoes
  • 1 cup Mexican Blend Shredded Cheese
  • some Organic Olive Oil Spray
  • some Sour Cream
  • 1 Cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 fork.
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 8-inch square baking pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°. Add dry quinoa and 2 cups water to a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10 to 12 minutes, until water is completely absorbed. Turn off heat and fluff quinoa with a fork.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, fold together cooked Quinoa, Cowboy Caviar Salsa, Diced Tomatoes and Mexican Blend Shredded Cheese, just until mixed. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with Organic Olive Oil Spray and spread mixture into pan. Cook for 25 minutes, then turn broiler on high and cook 5 minutes more. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes. Top with Sour Cream and Cilantro, if desired and serve.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• Trader Joe's
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Crispy Chicken-less Sliders
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp Incredisauce
  • 1 avocado
  • 2 pkgs chicken-less tenders
  • 16 sprigs cilantro
  • 1 red onion
  • 8 rolls
  • 1 head shredded iceberg lettuce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• sheet pan
  • 8 skewers

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place the chicken-less tenders on a lined sheet pan in the oven for 10 minutes. Flip and cook an additional 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove the chicken-less tenders from the oven. Lower temperature to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place the rolls on a sheet pan in the hot oven for 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove the rolls from the oven. Split the buns in half, pressing down lightly.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Toss together the shredded iceberg lettuce, red onion and cilantro sprigs.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: On the bottom half of each roll, place a tablespoon of Incredisauce. Top each with the chicken-less tenders, iceberg/onion mixture and sliced avocado. Skewer to secure.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Serve Immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Curry Chicken Pot Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 5 51 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg pie crusts
  • 1 hot water crust pastry (alternative)
  • 1 cup TJ's organic foursome vegetables
  • 0.5 cup yellow onions
  • 1.5 cups chicken
  • 1 bottle TJ's Thai Yellow curry sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small cereal bowl
  • 1 juice glass
  • 1 ramekin
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 sharp knife
  • 1 microwave-safe bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400ºF. Unroll pie crusts, leaving plastic sleeves in place, and smooth together any cracks in the dough. Use hot water crust pastry (alternative) as an alternative. Using a small cereal bowl and juice glass as your guides, cut out 5 small circles and 5 medium circles from the dough. Cut a small vent hole in each of the small circles and place them in refrigerator.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Line each ramekin with a medium-sized dough circle and place on rimmed baking sheet. Poke holes in the crusts with a sharp knife. Place sheet on center rack of oven and par-bake crusts 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove small pie crust circles from refrigerator. Add TJ's organic foursome vegetables and yellow onions to a microwave-safe bowl and microwave 1 minute on high. Add chicken and TJ's Thai Yellow curry sauce to bowl and gently stir to combine. Divide mixture among ramekins and top each with a small pie crust circle.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Return baking sheet to oven and bake 20 to 30 minutes, or until crusts are golden and filling is bubbling. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes prior to serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Fall Turkey Chili With Pumpkin
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 34 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 bell pepper
  • 0.5 medium onions
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 pkg soy crumbles
  • 1 can diced tomatoes
  • 2 cans pumpkin
  • 1 can kidney beans
  • 0.5 can corn
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 0.5 cup cheese
  • 1 avocado
  • 1 pkg cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large saucepan
  • 1 spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large saucepan or stockpot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and bell peppers and sauté until onions are translucent and fragrant, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add garlic and stir for 30 seconds. Add soy crumbles and break up in pan with spoon, sautéing until soy crumbles is browned and cooked through. Stir in diced tomatoes, pumpkin, kidney beans, corn and spices. Bring to a boil, and then reduce heat and simmer 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Garnish with sour cream, cheese, avocado and cilantro, and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/fall-turkey-chili-with-pumpkin

docs.title: Fish-ish Tacos with Spicy Dill Slaw
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 boxes TJ's Battered Plant-Based Fish Fillets
  • 0.5 cup TJ's Vegan Creamy Dill Dressing
  • 0.33 cup TJ's Hot & Sweet Jalapeño brine
  • 0.33 cup jalapeños
  • 1 bag TJ's Ready Veggies OR Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots
  • 1 pkg corn tortillas
  • 1 cup feta cheese
  • 1 bunch cilantro
  • 2 lime

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 tongs

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Air-fry or bake TJ's Battered Plant-Based Fish Fillets according to package directions.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While fillets are baking, in a small bowl, whisk TJ's Vegan Creamy Dill Dressing and TJ's Hot & Sweet Jalapeño brine to emulsify. Add chopped jalapeños. Add ¼ cup of prepared dressing to a large bowl with ready TJ's Ready Veggies OR Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots and toss to combine (reserve remaining dressing for taco assembly). Refrigerate until ready to serve.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Turn a burner on medium heat. Using tongs, warm corn tortillas directly over flame for a couple of minutes, turning over every 30 seconds or so, until warmed through and just barely charred on the edges.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Slice cooked fillets in half lengthwise. To assemble tacos, place one fillet half on a warm tortilla, top with slaw, feta cheese, cilantro, and more dressing if desired. Serve with lime wedges on the side.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Fresh Fava Beans with Mint & Scallions
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 11 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 small bunch scallions
  • 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cups cooked fava beans
  • 1 cup water
  • 0.5 cup chopped mint
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • some fennel

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large pot, sauté scallions in 2 Tbsp of olive oil for 1 minute, until wilted.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add fava beans and water. Stir to combine. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until the fava beans are soft. Drain the fava beans and scallions and return to pot.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Immediately add chopped mint and remaining olive oil to the warm beans and toss. Add salt and pepper to taste before serving.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve with fennel and sun-dried tomato sauté.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: Peruvian Burrito Bowl
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 53 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 medium sweet potatoes
  • some olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.75 cup dry quinoa
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 diced onions
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 cup corn
  • 1 poblano chili
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp coriander
  • 0.5 tsp oregano
  • 1 can refried black beans
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp chili powder
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • some grated melty cheese (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 parchment
  • 1 sheet pan
  • 1 medium pot
  • 1 large skillet
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F and gather ingredients & cut veggies.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: BAKE SWEET POTATOES: Dice the sweet potatoes into 1/2 inch cubes and place on a parchment-lined sheet pan. Toss with a little olive oil, and a generous five-finger pinch of salt and pepper. Spread out and bake in the middle of the oven until crispy and tender, 20 to 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: COOK QUINOA: At the same time, bring dry quinoa, water, and pinch of salt to boil in a medium pot. Once boiling, cover, turn heat to low and cook until all the water is gone about 15 minutes. Turn heat off and leave covered. Fluff before serving.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: SAUTÉ FILLING: Also at the same time, in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Sauté diced onions 2 to 3 minutes until they just begin to soften. Add garlic, corn, poblano chili, and red bell pepper and lower heat to med, sautéing until tender, about 10 minutes. Season with the salt, cumin, coriander, and oregano. Set aside. When the sweet potatoes are tender, add them to these veggies.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: WHIP THE BLACK BEANS: Place 1 can refried black beans into a medium pot, breaking them up with a fork. Add 1/4 cup water (or more) to loosen. Gently warm over medium-low heat, whipping with a fork until they are smooth and creamy. Add a drizzle of olive oil, 1/4 tsp salt, chili powder, and cumin. If you don’t care about it being vegan, stir in grated melty cheese (optional) or a dollop of sour cream for extra richness. Whip with fork until creamy and flavorful. You want these to be slightly salty. Cover and turn heat off.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Peruvian BURRITO BOWLS: Spoon some warm whipped black beans into the bottom of a bowl. Top with some quinoa, veggies and AJI VERDE Sauce. Garnish with avocado slices, diced tomatoes, cilantro, pumpkin seeds, sunflower sprouts. If making bowls instead of burritos, I would double the beans for 4-6 people.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.feastingathome.com/peruvian-burritos/#tasty-recipes-37539-jump-target

docs.title: Potato Broccoli Casserole
docs.text: Total Time 17 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 lbs potatoes
  • 0.25 cup unsalted butter
  • 3 Tbsp flour
  • 2.5 cups milk
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 3 cups broccoli

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 casserole dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut potatoes into thin slices.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat unsalted butter in saucepan; sprinkle with flour, and cook for 2 minutes. Add milk, salt, and pepper. Simmer until boiling. Remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a casserole dish, layer potatoes and broccoli. Top with white sauce.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cover and bake for 15 minutes, then an additional 5 uncovered.

docs.title: Rice with Corned Beef
docs.text: Total Time 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some white rice
  • 1 can corned beef
  • some fried egg (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rice cooker
  • 1 can opener
  • 1 soup bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make white rice in a rice cooker until done.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place can of corned beef in a pan of boiling water enough to cover the can.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Boil for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Open can with a can opener.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Get a soup bowl, place 1 cup rice in bowl and top with corned beef.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: You can add a fried egg (optional) to your meal if you wish.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Spicy Pumpkin Curry Pot Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 1.17 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup onion
  • 2 parsnips
  • 1 cup squash
  • 3 handfuls kale
  • some salt
  • 1 can garbanzo beans
  • 1 jar spicy pumpkin curry simmer sauce
  • 0.33 cup raisins
  • 1 pie crust
  • some canola oil spray
  • 1 egg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch pie plate
  • 1 fork
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 pastry brush

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Sauté onion & parsnips in oil for 5 minutes. Stir in squash. Cover and cook 5 minutes. Add kale and salt, stir, cover and cook another 5 minutes or so until vegetables are tender. Add garbanzo beans, spicy pumpkin curry simmer sauce and raisins, stir to combine. Cover and reduce heat to simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove pie crust from refrigerator. Lay crust on a clean work surface, smoothing any cracks with your hands. Grease a 9-inch pie plate with canola oil spray. Transfer simmered vegetables to pie plate. Top with pie crust, cutting three oblong vents in center of crust.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Trim and seal crust edges (use a fork to crimp edges or use your hands for a more rustic look). In a small bowl, whisk egg and 1 tablespoon water. Use a pastry brush to cover crust with egg wash.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake pie on center rack of oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until crust is a deep golden brown. Remove from heat and let sit 15 minutes before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Vegan Salisbury Steak
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 5 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 vegan egg replacer
  • 1 lb vegan ground beef
  • 0.5 cup seasoned breadcrumbs
  • 2 Tbsp oat or unsweetened almond milk
  • 1 pkg onion soup mix
  • 2 tsp vegan Worcestershire sauce
  • 0.25 tsp black pepper
  • 1 mashed potatoes
  • 1 mushroom gravy

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prepare the vegan egg replacer according to package directions. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Into a large mixing bowl, add vegan ground beef, seasoned breadcrumbs, egg replacer mixture, oat or unsweetened almond milk, and 1/2 package onion soup mix, vegan Worcestershire sauce, and black pepper. Use your hands to mix well, until all ingredients are fully incorporated, then form into 5 patties.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add patties and cook until browned, 3 to 5 minutes on each side. Remove patties from skillet and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place on a bed of mashed potatoes and top with mushroom gravy.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://thiswifecooks.com/vegan-salisbury-steak-with-mushroom-gravy/

docs.title: Baked Feta with Chickpeas & Kale
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 17 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 bunch kale
  • 2 cups marinara
  • 1.5 cups cooked chickpeas
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 cup water
  • 1 12-oz block feta
  • some pepper
  • 1 pinch red pepper flakes
  • some pita or baguette
  • some lemon wedges

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 10-inch skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Heat 10-inch skillet and add olive oil. Add cumin and sizzle for 1 to 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add kale, with stems removed and torn into pieces, in batches; letting each handful shrink and wilt before adding the next.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: When the last of the kale has wilted, add marinara, cooked chickpeas, lemon juice, and 1/2 cup water. Stir to let come to a simmer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Nestle the feta slices into the sauce and sprinkle with pepper. Bake until feta has softened, about 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Drizzle with olive oil and a pinch of red pepper flakes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve warm with pita or baguette and lemon wedges.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Balsamic Lentil Sauté
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 medium red onion
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 handfuls spinach
  • 1 medium bell pepper
  • 0.5 package lentils
  • 2 Tbsp sun-dried tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 2 Tbsp balsamic glaze
  • 1 pouch brown rice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large skillet
  • 1 plates
  • 1 ladle

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add red onion to a large skillet on medium heat then stir in olive oil and garlic. Add spinach and bell pepper and cook until spinach begins to wilt.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Empty half the package of lentils into the mix and then add sun-dried tomatoes. Heat and stir another 2 minutes and then mix in the parsley and balsamic glaze.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Divide brown rice onto individual plates and ladle sauté over each serving. 28 minutes

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/balsamic-lentil-saute
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Cook's Illustrated Horiatiki Salata (Greek Salad)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 lbs tomatoes
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 red onion
  • some ice water
  • 2 Tbsp red wine vinegar
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 1 cucumber
  • 1 green bell pepper
  • 1 cup Kalamata olives
  • 2 Tbsp capers
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 8 oz feta
  • some oregano
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 colander
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 serving platter

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cut tomatoes into 1/2" thick wedges. Cut wedges in half crosswise. Toss tomatoes and 1/2 teaspoon salt together in a colander set in large bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain for 30 minutes. Place sliced thin red onion in small bowl, cover with ice water, and let sit for 15 minutes. Whisk red wine vinegar, oregano, pepper, and remaining 3/4 tsp salt together in second small bowl.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Discard tomato juice and transfer tomatoes to now-empty bowl. Drain onion and add to bowl with tomatoes. Add vinegar mixture, cucumber, green bell pepper, Kalamata olives, and capers and toss to gently coat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to serving platter and top with feta. Season each slice of feta with extra oregano to taste. Drizzle feta with remaining 1 Tbsp olive oil.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.cooksillustrated.com/recipes/13159-horiatiki-salata-hearty-greek-salad-for-two
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Gordon Ramsay's Spicy Sausage Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 32 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 glug olive oil
  • 1 red onion
  • 1 red pepper
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 5 veggie Italian sausage
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika
  • 200 g uncooked rice
  • 3 oz white wine
  • 2 cups vegetable stock
  • 4 scallions
  • 1 tomato
  • 1 small bunch parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 Dutch oven

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add glug of olive oil to a heated Dutch oven. Fry sliced red onion for 5 minutes until soft.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the red pepper and garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Crumble in veggie Italian sausage and cook for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add smoked paprika and season. Add uncooked rice and mix well.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Deglaze by pouring the white wine and scraping bits off the bottom of the pan.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add vegetable stock and bring to a simmer.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Cook gently for 15 to 20 minutes until the rice is tender and the liquid is almost entirely absorbed.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove from heat and gently fold in the chopped scallions, tomato, and parsley.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Greek Orzo Stuffed Red Peppers
docs.text: Total Time 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 red bell peppers
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 5 Tbsp olive oil
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 3 sprigs oregano
  • 1 cup dry orzo
  • 2 Tbsp balsamic vinegar
  • 0.5 cup Kalamata olives
  • 2 pepperoncini
  • 2 Tbsp pine nuts
  • 0.5 cup feta
  • 1 cup basil
  • 1 cup cherry tomatoes
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 1 pinch crushed red pepper flakes
  • 1 lemon zest
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9x13 dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. In a 9x13 dish, toss halved red bell peppers with salt, pepper, olive oil, and garlic. Add oregano. Roast 20 to 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, cook dry orzo according to package directions. Drain and toss with balsamic vinegar, Kalamata olives, pepperoncini, pine nuts, and feta.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Prepare lemon basil tomatoes by combining all ingredients: basil, halved cherry tomatoes, 1/4 cup olive oil, crushed red pepper flakes, lemon zest, and salt.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stuff inside peppers and drizzle with lemon basil tomato sauce.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Harissa Olive Oil-Braised Chickpeas & Fennel
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 to 6 65 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cans chickpeas
  • some cooked couscous
  • some crusty bread
  • 1 medium fennel bulb
  • 2 Tbsps fennel fronds
  • 4 ozs feta cheese
  • 3 sprigs fresh rosemary
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 Tbsps harissa paste
  • 0.5 tsp kosher salt
  • 1 medium lemon
  • 1 cup olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 3-quart baking dish
  • aluminum foil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 325°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Coarsely chop 2 tablespoons fennel fronds and reserve. Trim the top and bottom of 1 medium fennel bulb. Quarter, core, and thinly slice. Smash 4 garlic cloves. Halve 1 medium lemon. Thinly slice half the lemon and remove the seeds from the slices; reserve the remaining half. Drain and rinse 2 cans chickpeas.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour 1 cup olive oil into a 9x13-inch or other 3-quart baking dish. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons harissa paste and 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt; stir to combine. Add the chickpeas, fennel, garlic, lemon slices, and 3 fresh rosemary sprigs. Toss gently to coat everything in the harissa olive oil and arrange into an even layer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake, stirring halfway through, until the chickpeas are soft but not falling apart, and the mixture is bubbling, about 1 hour total.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Uncover and squeeze the juice from the reserved lemon half over the chickpeas and stir to combine. Let cool for 5 minutes. Taste and if you like things spicier, stir in a bit more harissa as desired. Crumble 4 ounces feta cheese over the top, sprinkle with reserved fennel fronds, and serve with crusty bread over cooked couscous, if desired.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.thekitchn.com/harissa-olive-oil-braised-chickpeas-fennel-recipe-23105455
