docs.title: Jeanie's Falafel
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 32 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 can garbanzo beans
  • 1 small onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 Tbsps cilantro
  • 1 tsp parsley
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • 0.13 tsp turmeric
  • 0.5 tsp baking powder
  • 1 cup bread crumbs
  • 1 salt
  • 1 pepper
  • 1 oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 deep fryer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mash the garbanzo beans in a large bowl. Stir in the onion, garlic, cilantro, parsley, cumin, turmeric, baking powder, bread crumbs, salt and pepper. Do not be afraid to use your hands. Shape the mixture into 1-1/2 inch balls; you should get 18 to 24. If the mixture does not hold together, add a little water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat the oil in a deep fryer to 375°F (190°C). Carefully drop the balls into the hot oil, and fry until brown. If you do not have a deep fryer, heat the oil in a heavy deep skillet over medium-high heat. You may need to adjust the heat slightly after the first couple of falafels, and be sure to turn frequently so they brown evenly.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/83307/jeanies-falafel/
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Lemon Garlic Orzo with Roasted Veggies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups cremini mushrooms
  • 1 cup bell peppers
  • 1 lb asparagus
  • 12 oz cherry tomatoes
  • 2 tsp garlic
  • 0.5 cup shallot
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 cup orzo
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1.5 cups vegetable broth
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 cup crumbled feta
  • 0.33 cup pine nuts
  • some basil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 roasting pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F, and toast pine nuts for 6 to 7 minutes. Set aside to cool.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Turn up oven to 425°F. Place sliced cremini mushrooms, bell peppers, asparagus, cherry tomatoes, garlic, and shallot on a roasting pan.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Sprinkle with 2 Tbsp olive oil, and salt, and pepper. Roast at 425°F for 35 to 40 minutes, rotating pan halfway through.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: To cook orzo, sauté 1 Tbsp olive oil until shimmering. Add orzo and stir, coating thoroughly. Stir occasionally for about 3 minutes or until golden.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer, turn down heat to low, cover and cook for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and set aside.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: To make dressing, add olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper and mix until emulsified.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Mix together vegetables, orzo, dressing, crumbled feta, and pine nuts. Garnish with basil or parsley, if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Mediterranean Coleslaw
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1.5 tsp maple syrup
  • 0.25 tsp celery seed
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 small carrot
  • 2 cups red cabbage
  • 0.25 cup red onion
  • 0.25 cup chickpeas
  • 1 Tbsp parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium bowl, stir together the apple cider vinegar, maple syrup, celery seed, salt, and pepper. Add the thinly shaved carrot, thinly shaved red cabbage, thinly shaved red onion, chickpeas, and parsley and toss until evenly mixed. Serve immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/sides/mediterranean-coleslaw/

docs.title: Mediterranean-Inspired Orzo Pasta Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 oz orzo
  • 0.25 cup pasta water
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 1 tsp Italian herbs
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 1 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 0.5 cup red onion
  • 1 cup cherry tomatoes
  • 0.75 cup bell pepper
  • 0.75 cup Kalamata olives
  • 0.5 cup artichoke hearts
  • 0.25 cup parsley
  • 0.25 cup basil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the orzo and cook according to the package instructions. Reserve 1/4 cup (60 ml) of pasta water, drain the pasta, rinse with cold water, and toss with a little olive oil. Set aside to cool.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While the water boils/pasta cooks, prep the pasta salad ingredients and make the dressing.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the 2 Tbsp of olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, garlic powder, maple syrup, Italian herbs, salt, pepper, nutritional yeast, and pasta water (once it’s ready) to a large mixing bowl and whisk to combine. Add the finely chopped red onion and mix again.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the cherry tomatoes, finely chopped bell pepper, Kalamata olives, artichoke hearts, parsley, and cooked orzo to the mixing bowl. Toss well to combine.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Mix in the chopped basil just before serving. Taste and adjust as needed, adding more salt for overall flavor, lemon juice for brightness, or herbs for freshness. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 3-4 days. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/mediterranean-orzo-pasta-salad/#wprm-recipe-container-94099

docs.title: Mediterranean Pasta Salad
docs.text: Total Time 3 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 lb red lentil pasta
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 red onion
  • 2 Tbsp pine nuts
  • 2 tomatoes
  • 1 jar roasted red peppers
  • 1 cucumber
  • 1 cup pitted olives
  • 1 Tbsp capers
  • 1 can kidney beans
  • 1 handful basil
  • 1 handful parsley
  • 2 Tbsp red wine vinegar
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 3 cloves garlic

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 sauté pan
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook red lentil pasta according to directions. Drain and rinse with cold water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat sauté pan on medium-high heat. Add olive oil, diced red onion, and pine nuts; sauté for 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Chop tomatoes into medium-large pieces, then add to sauté pan and cook for 1 minute, or until onions are translucent and pine nuts begin to brown.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Remove from heat. In a large mixing bowl, add cooked pasta, sautéed mixture, roasted red peppers, diced cucumber, pitted olives, capers, kidney beans, basil, parsley, red wine vinegar, pepper, and garlic; gently toss to mix well.

Options

Can add pesto, tempeh, tofu, spinach, green onion, or any other vegetable that can be eaten raw.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Saucy Moroccan-Spiced Lentils
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup lentils
  • 2 cup water
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 medium onion
  • 1 large bell pepper
  • 2 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 2 Tbsp coconut sugar
  • 0.5 tsp sea salt
  • 1 Tbsp paprika
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp coriander
  • 1 tsp ginger
  • 0.5 tsp turmeric
  • 0.5 tsp cayenne pepper
  • 2 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 0.75 cup parsley or cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook lentils first by bringing water to a boil and adding lentils. Bring back to a boil. Then reduce heat to low and simmer (uncovered) for about 20 minutes or until lentils are tender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In the meantime, to a food processor or small blender, add garlic, onion or shallot, bell pepper, tomato paste, coconut sugar, sea salt, paprika, cumin, coriander, ginger, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and apple cider vinegar. Mix to thoroughly combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more tomato paste for depth of flavor, spices for more overall flavor (especially coriander and paprika), cayenne for heat, coconut sugar for sweetness, apple cider vinegar for acidity, or salt for saltiness. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once the lentils have cooked, drain off any excess liquid and then add spice mixture and parsley or cilantro and mix well to combine.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Enjoy immediately with salads, rice (or cauliflower rice), bowls, and more. Store leftovers in the refrigerator up to 4-5 days or in the freezer up to 1 month.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://minimalistbaker.com/saucy-moroccan-spiced-lentils/
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Scrambled Chickpea & Spinach Pitas
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 medium bell peppers
  • 0.25 cups coconut oil
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 6 pita
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 6 cups spinach
  • 2 tsp turmeric

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• food processor
  • bowl
  • fork
  • 12-inch (or larger), high-sided skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add half of the chickpeas to a food processor fitted with the blade attachment and pulse until broken down but not puréed. (Alternatively, place in a large bowl and mash with a fork.) Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat the coconut oil in a 12-inch (or larger), high-sided skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add the onions, stir to coat with the oil, and cook until soft, 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in the bell peppers, cumin, turmeric, garlic powder, and salt, and cook until the peppers are tender, about 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the mashed and whole chickpeas, stir to combine, and cook until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes. Stir in the spinach, cooking just until wilted, about 3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: To serve immediately, divide the chickpea mixture between the pitas, filling each half with 3/4 to 1 cup of the mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: If not serving immediately, let the chickpea mixture cool completely before filling, then wrap each pita half tightly in aluminum foil. Refrigerate or freeze in resealable plastic bags. Reheat uncovered in a 325°F regular or toaster oven until warmed through, about 20 minutes if refrigerated or about 30 minutes if frozen.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/recipe-scrambled-chickpea-and-spinach-pitas-234095

docs.title: Spicy Red Lentil Curry
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 24 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.67 cup dry red lentils
  • some brown rice (optional)
  • 2 Tbsp coconut oil
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp ginger
  • 0.5 cup carrots
  • 0.5 tsp red curry paste
  • 1 6-oz can tomato paste
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 cup water
  • 2 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 0.5 tsp turmeric
  • 0.33 cup coconut milk (optional)
  • some cilantro (optional)
  • some pickled red onions (optional)
  • some pita or naan (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 fine mesh strainer
  • 1 large rimmed skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Thoroughly rinse dry red lentils in a fine mesh strainer and set aside. If serving with brown rice (optional), cook at this time.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat a large rimmed skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add coconut oil, garlic, ginger, and carrots. Sauté for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add red curry paste and sauté for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add tomato paste, vegetable broth, water and stir to combine. Then add lentils, maple syrup, turmeric, and stir.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce heat slightly to low (or medium-low), and gently simmer for 20 minutes, or until lentils are tender. Stir frequently to incorporate flavors, and add more vegetable broth as needed if the mixture becomes too thick.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: An optional (but recommended) step: stir in coconut milk (optional) for additional creaminess, and to balance the heat of the curry paste.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Taste and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more turmeric for depth of flavor, coconut sugar for sweetness/flavor balance, or a pinch of salt for saltiness.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: To serve, divide brown rice (optional) and lentils between 2-3 (amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size) serving bowls and garnish with cilantro (optional), pickled red onions (optional), and pita or naan (optional) for dipping.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Store leftovers separately in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. Reheat on the stovetop, adding water as needed for moisture, or in the microwave.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/spicy-red-lentil-curry/

docs.title: Sprouted Kitchen Spring Noodles Artichokes & Lemons
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 1 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Meyer lemons
  • 2 tsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp sugar
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • 2 trimmed endives
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 jar marinated artichokes
  • 3 Tbsp balsamic vinegar
  • 10 Tbsp crème fraîche
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.5 tsp cayenne
  • 1 tsp Italian herbs
  • 12 oz orecchiette
  • 1.25 cups grated pecorino
  • 3 cups arugula
  • some dill

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 knife
  • 1 large sauté pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Slice Meyer lemons into 1/4" rings. Remove seeds with knife. Toss slices with olive oil and sugar. Grill over medium heat, the set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large sauté pan, add 2 Tbsp butter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Slice trimmed endives lengthwise, discarding the core, then slice in 1/4" half moons.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add garlic and endives to warm butter and sauté for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add marinated artichokes, remaining butter, balsamic vinegar, crème fraîche, nutmeg, cayenne, and Italian herbs.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Chop the lemons into small pieces and add to pan. Keep heat low and cover.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cook orecchiette according to package instructions. Drain and reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Mix cooked pasta, artichoke sauce, and grated pecorino. Add arugula and dill.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Tomato Baked White Beans with Lemon Parsley Oil
docs.text: Total Time 1.92 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup white beans
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 yellow onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 3 cups diced tomatoes
  • 1 Tbsp chopped oregano
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 6 oz feta
  • 0.5 bunch parsley
  • 0.5 lemon zest
  • 0.5 lemon juice
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large saucepan
  • 1 glass baking vessel
  • 1 skillet
  • 1 small food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Beans: Soak white beans overnight. Place the soaked, drained beans in a large saucepan and cover with 4 inches of water. Add the bay leaf and 2 cloves of garlic, and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium to maintain a simmer, cover the pot partially, and simmer the beans until nearly tender; this can take anywhere from 30 to 60 minutes depending on the size and dryness of the beans. Add the salt and continue cooking until the beans are very tender but still holding a shape. Let cool in their liquid until needed. The beans can be stored, refrigerated airtight, for up to 1 week. When ready to use, drain well and remove the bay leaf.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Tomato sauce: Position a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat to 400ºF. Have a ceramic or glass baking vessel at the ready; I use an oval gratin dish measuring 9x13 inches; a 10-inch round pan or 9-inch square would work, or anything equivalent.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a wide, non-reactive skillet (steel or enamel so as not to affect the flavor of the tomatoes), heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the yellow onion and 2 cloves of garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until tender, 10 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and their juices, chopped oregano, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer, then lower the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until thick and saucy, 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Scrape the sauce into the pan and add the drained beans, tossing them to coat. Dot with the feta, pressing it into the sauce, and drizzle with a bit of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake the beans until bubbling and beginning to brown on top, 25 to 35 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Parsley oil: While the beans bake, place the parsley, lemon zest and lemon juice, olive oil, and salt in a blender or small food processor. Puree smooth. The parsley oil can be kept refrigerated airtight for up to several days.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: When the beans are baked, drizzle with some of the parsley oil and serve. Leftovers reheat well in a 350ºF oven for 10 or so minutes.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://bojongourmet.com/tomato-baked-white-beans-with-feta-and-lemon-parsley-oil/
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Vegetarian Paella
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 36 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some olive oil
  • 1 small yellow onion
  • 1 medium bell pepper
  • 0.5 tsp paprika
  • 1 pound soy chorizo
  • 6 oz crushed tomatoes
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 cup Arborio rice
  • 0.13 tsp saffron
  • 1 small zucchini
  • 4 wedges lime

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and coat with olive oil. Sauté yellow onion and bell pepper until softened, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in paprika and cook for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add soy chorizo and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring liquid to a boil and stir in Arborio rice and saffron. Rice should be completely covered with liquid.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook rice without stirring for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: When liquid has all been absorbed, add zucchini, and cook for another 10 minutes, then serve with lime wedges.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • TSpoons Cooking School

docs.title: Baked Black Bean Taquitos
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 46 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 medium onion
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 14-oz cans black beans
  • 1 cup vegetable stock
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1.5 Tbsp lime juice
  • 0.25 cup cilantro
  • 12 6-in flour tortillas
  • 2 Tbsp vegetable oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 potato masher
  • 1 large baking tray
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 pastry brush

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven at 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, sweat the onion, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic until they are aromatic, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Simmer the black beans, vegetable stock, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper for 15 minutes, until the liquid has almost evaporated.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the unsalted butter, lime juice, and cilantro, and mash everything together with a potato masher.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Lay out the flour tortillas on a flat surface and divide the bean mixture among the 12 tortillas (about 3 tablespoons for each). Roll up each tortilla tightly and place it seam side down.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Line a large baking tray with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Spread about 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil evenly across it.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Place the taquitos seam side down on the baking tray, making sure that you are leaving at least 1/2 inch of space between each one.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Using a pastry brush, brush a thin layer of oil on each taquito.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake at 400°F for 20 to 25 minutes, until the tortillas start to brown.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cooktoria.com/baked-black-bean-taquitos/

docs.title: Black Bean Burrito Bake
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 can chipotle chiles in adobo sauce
  • 0.5 cup sour cream
  • 1 can black beans
  • 1 cup corn
  • 4 flour tortillas
  • 1 cup TJ's Spicy Smoked Peach Salsa
  • 0.5 cup Monterey Jack cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 11 x 7-inch baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove one chile from chipotle chiles in adobo sauce can. Chop chile. Reserve remaining adobo sauce and chiles for another use. Combine sour cream and chile in a medium bowl; let stand 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place half of black beans in a food processor; process until finely chopped. Add chopped beans, remaining beans, and corn to sour cream mixture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spoon 1/2 cup bean mixture down the center of each tortilla. Roll up flour tortillas; place, seam side down, in an 11 x 7-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Spread TJ's Spicy Smoked Peach Salsa over tortillas; sprinkle with Monterey Jack cheese. Cover and bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

docs.title: Source

docs.title: Black Bean Burritos

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 chipotle chile in adobo sauce
  • 0.5 cup reduced fat sour cream
  • 1 15-oz can black beans

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:

docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Chop chipotle chile in adobo sauce and combine with reduced fat sour cream.

docs.title: Black Bean, Corn, & Zucchini Enchiladas
docs.text: Total Time 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Enchilada Sauce
docs.text:
• 1 tsp canola oil
  • 0.5 cup diced red onion
  • 1 tsp minced garlic
  • 0.5 cup vegetable broth
  • 1 Tbsp chili powder
  • 1 Tbsp honey
  • 1 tsp ground cumin
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • :tomoato: 1 28-oz can crushed tomatoes

docs.title: Ingredients - Enchiladas
docs.text:
• 1 tsp canola oil
  • 2 cups diced zucchini
  • 1 10-oz pkg frozen corn
  • 1 15-oz can black beans
  • 3 cups enchilada sauce
  • 8 whole wheat tortilla
  • 2 cups shredded cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Prepare enchilada sauce by sautéing canola oil, diced red onion, minced garlic, vegetable broth, chili powder, honey, ground cumin, salt, and drained crushed tomatoes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat canola oil in skillet.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add 2 cups diced zucchini and frozen corn. Sauté for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5

docs.title: Black Bean Mole
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 cups 1.12 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some canola oil
  • 1 very ripe plantain
  • 5 tomatillos
  • 1 onion
  • 1 Roma or plum tomato
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 2 tsp sesame seeds
  • 1 small cinnamon stick
  • 1 clove
  • 0.25 tsp cumin seeds
  • 2 dried pasilla chiles
  • 1 dried New Mexico chiles
  • 1 dried ancho chiles
  • 1 tsp fresh oregano leaves
  • 0.25 oz disk stone-ground Mexican dark chocolate
  • 2 cups black beans
  • some salt
  • some water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 Dutch oven
  • 1 plate
  • 1 paper towels
  • 1 large cast-iron pan
  • 1 high-speed blender
  • 1 fine-mesh strainer
  • 1 large pot
  • 1 sealed container

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a Dutch oven, heavy-bottomed pot, or high-sided frying pan over medium-high heat, heat about 3 inches of canola oil to 350°F. Line a plate with a few layers of paper towels and place nearby for draining.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fry the very ripe plantain, turning occasionally, until deep golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to the plate to drain.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a dry large cast-iron pan over medium-high heat, add the dehusked tomatillos, onion, Roma or plum tomato, and garlic. Toast them in the pan, turning occasionally, until mostly blacked on all sides, about 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer to a high-speed blender and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Wipe out any debris from the pan. Add the sesame seeds, cinnamon stick, clove, and cumin seeds and arrange in a single layer. PLace over very low heat and toast gently, shaking the pan occasionally, until the mixture becomes fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat, transfer to the blender, and set aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Wipe out any debris from the pan. Add the cleaned, deseeded, and deveined dried pasilla chiles, dried New Mexico chiles, and dried ancho chiles to the pan. Place the pan over low heat and toast the chiles for about 30 seconds per side. Remove from the heat and transfer the chiles to the blender.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Wipe out any debris from the pan. Add the reserved veins and seeds from the dried chiles. Place the pan over medium-high heat and toast until blackened and beginning to smoke, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer to the blender.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add the fresh oregano leaves, preferably Mexican oregano, and fried plantain to the blender and blend until very smooth.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Pass the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into a large pot. Place the pot over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a strong simmer, about medium heat, and cook for 15 minutes. Break up the disk stone-ground Mexican dark chocolate into a few pieces, add it to the pot, and continue simmering for 10 minutes. Add the black beans and simmer for another 10 minutes. Season with salt to taste and add a little water if needed to thin out the mole. Store in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week, or in the freezer for up to 6 months.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Butternut Squash Tostadas
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 42 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 cups butternut squash
  • 0.25 cup orange juice
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 cup onions
  • 0.5 cup bell pepper
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 cups black beans
  • 6 corn tortillas
  • 0.25 cup salsa
  • 0.5 cup red cabbage
  • 0.25 cup cilantro
  • 0.25 cup Mexicrema dressing or guacamole

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place the cubed butternut squash in a bowl and add the orange juice, garlic powder, and salt & pepper to taste. Mix well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place the squash mixture in a pan lined with parchment paper and roast for 25 minutes or until squash is tender and slightly brown.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While the squash is in the oven, sauté the diced onions and bell pepper in a skillet for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the garlic and black beans to the sautéed onions and peppers, stir and cook for 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake the corn tortillas in the oven for 10 minutes or until crisp but not burned.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Arrange the tortillas on a plate. Add salsa, the sautéed vegetable bean mixture and the roasted butternut squash. Top with red cabbage, cilantro, and Mexicrema dressing or guacamole.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/main-dish/butternut-squash-tostadas/

docs.title: Calabaza & Onion Quesadillas
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 2 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 corn tortilla
  • 2 cups pumpkin filling
  • 0.75 cup cashew nacho cheese

  • 1 cup cashew crema
  • 0.25 cup toasted pumpkin seeds
  • 0.25 cup fresh cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium saute pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat a medium saute pan over medium-high heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fill each corn tortilla with about 1/4 cup of the pumpkin filling and a few Tbsp of the cashew nacho cheese. Folder the tortilla over and crisp the quesadilla in a pan for 1 to 2 minutes per side.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Serve the quesadillas with the pumpkin seed salsa and cashew crema. Garnish with the toasted pumpkin seeds and chopped fresh cilantro.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Cheesy Black Bean Quesadilla Triangles
docs.text: Total Time 12 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 MorningStar Farms chipotle black bean burgers
  • 0.5 cup salsa
  • 0.5 cup shredded cheddar or jack cheese
  • 0.25 cup shredded pepper jack cheese
  • 2 tsp Southwest or Mexican seasoning
  • 10 flour tortillas
  • 1 Tbsp melted butter
  • 2.5 cups shredded lettuce
  • 2 Tbsp red or green bell pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 pizza cutter
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: shredded cheddar or jack cheese, shredded pepper jack cheese, and Southwest or Mexican seasoning. In a medium bowl, toss together MorningStar Farms chipotle black bean burgers thawed and cut into 1/4" pieces, salsa,

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Use a pizza cutter to cut flour tortillas into 7" triangles.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place about 2 Tbsp of burger mixture into center of each triangle. Fold corners of large triangles over filling, completely enclosing filling and making small triangles. Secure with toothpicks.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place on baking sheet. Brush with melted butter and bake at 375°F for 9 to 12 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Arrange on top of shredded lettuce. Spring with finely chopped red or green bell pepper.

docs.title: Chile Relleno Casserole
docs.text: comments: true tags: - mexican -recipe-box

docs.title: Chile Relleno Casserole
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups half and half
  • 4 eggs
  • 0.67 cups all-purpose flour
  • 6 whole green chiles
  • 6 4-oz cans diced green chiles (alternative)
  • 1 lb grated cheddar or jack cheese
  • 1 8-oz can tomato sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9 x 13 casserole dish
  • 1 foil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Beat half and half with eggs and all-purpose flour until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: If using whole green chiles, split open and rinse seeds; drain on paper towel. Use diced green chiles (alternative) as an alternative.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Make alternate layers of egg mixture, chiles, and grated cheddar or jack cheese in a 9 x 13 casserole dish.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour tomato sauce over top and sprinkle with 1/2 cup of cheese.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake uncovered 1.25 hours. Cover with foil if cheese begins to burn.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Chipotle Breakfast Tacos
docs.text: Total Time 33 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 bag TJ's roasted potatoes with peppers and onions
  • 1 pkg soy chorizo
  • some olive oil
  • 10 eggs
  • 2 pkgs corn tortillas
  • some cheese
  • 1 pkg pico de gallo
  • 1 avocado (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 skillet
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Spread TJ's roasted potatoes with peppers and onions on a rimmed baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake 20 to 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While potatoes roast, prepare soy chorizo: heat 1 Tbsp olive oil in a skillet. Add chorizo and sauté 5 to 8 minutes, until slightly brown.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer to bowl; cover and keep warm.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Prepare eggs scrambled, to taste.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Heat corn tortillas to taste.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Fill tortillas with chorizo, roasted potatoes, and eggs.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Garnish with shredded cheese, pico de gallo, and avocado (optional).

docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Chipotle-Inspired Vegan Burrito Bowls
docs.text: Serves 4

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:

  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • some salt
  • 1 lime zest
  • 1 lime juice
  • 1 bunch cilantro
  • 0.5 tsp chili powder
  • 0.5 tsp chipotle powder
  • 1 14-oz block extra-firm tofu
  • 1 15-oz can corn
  • 1 15-oz black beans
  • 0.5 tsp chipotle powder
  • 0.5 tsp chili powder
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 bunch cilantro
  • some pico de gallo
  • some guacamole

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat frozen brown rice according to package instructions, then sauté in olive oil and salt to taste.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add zest and juice of 1 lime and bunch of cilantro. Mix 1/2 tsp chili powder and 1/2 tsp chipotle powder to extra-firm tofu.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add corn, black beans, 1/2 tsp chipotle powder, and 1/2 tsp of chili powder. Sauté with olive oil over medium heat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Build bowls starting with rice, then corn and beans, then tofu. Top with cilantro, pico de gallo, and guacamole.

docs.title: Source

docs.title: Empanadas
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs lean ground beef
  • 1 onion
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp coriander
  • 3 Tbsp sugar
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 tsp accent
  • 0.5 cup Dutch soy sauce
  • some empanada pastry

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Brown the lean ground beef with chopped onion, drain and add garlic, cumin, coriander, sugar, salt, pepper, and accent. Then add Dutch soy sauce.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Make sure meat mixture is cool before you put them in the empanada pastry to fry until golden brown.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Enchiladas Verdes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 42 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb Russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • some salt
  • 0.5 cup peas
  • 0.25 jalapeño
  • 0.125 tsp chili powder
  • 2 cups salsa verde
  • 8 corn tortilla
  • 0.5 cup pumpkin seeds
  • 0.25 cup cilantro
  • 1 avocado
  • 2 cups black beans

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 large nonstick or cast-iron pan
  • 1 small baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Peel and quarter the potatoes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large pot over medium-high heat, add the Russet potatoes, enough water to cover, and a generous pinch of salt. Bring to a boil and cook until the potatoes are cooked through, about 10 minutes. Drain and let cool slightly. Dice the cooked potatoes into 1/2 inch pieces.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large nonstick or cast-iron pan over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil. Add the diced onion, garlic, and a pinch of salt and cook until the onion is translucent, about 7 minutes. Add the potatoes, peas, jalapeño, chili powder, and salt to taste and cook until the jalapeño has softened and the potatoes start to coat the mixture, 5 minutes more. Taste and adjust salt if needed.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a small baking dish, pour about 1/2 cup of the salsa verde and spread it around to coat the bottom. Fill each corn tortilla with about 1/4 cup of the potato mixture, roll it up, and place it seam side down in the dish. Repeat with the remaining tortillas, lining them up snugly in the dish. Spread the remaining salsa verde on top of the enchiladas. Bake until the salsa bubbles and the edges of the tortillas begin to crisp slightly, about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Garnish with the toasted pumpkin seeds, a little more salsa verde, and cilantro and serve with the avocado and black beans.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Escabeche
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 cups 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 tsp olive oil
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1 small cinnamon stick
  • 1 star anise
  • 0.5 tsp cumin seeds
  • 0.5 tsp whole black peppercorns
  • 0.5 tsp thyme
  • 0.5 tsp oregano
  • 0.5 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 0.5 yellow onion
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 2 cups apple cider vinegar
  • 2 cups water
  • 1.5 tsp kosher salt
  • 1.5 tsp coconut sugar
  • 4 cups mixed vegetables
  • 0.5 jalapeño

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 large jar

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the bay leaf, cinnamon stick, star anise, cumin seeds, whole black peppercorns, thyme, oregano, and red pepper flakes and toast in the oil until the spices are warm and fragrant, 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the yellow onion and garlic and cook until the onions are slightly softened, about 3 minutes. Add the apple cider vinegar and 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Add the kosher salt and coconut sugar and stir to dissolve. Remove the pan from the heat and allow the mixture to cool for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large jar or covered container, add the mixed vegetables and the 1/4 to 1/2 jalapeño. Pour the vinegar mixture over the vegetables, adding a little more water if necessary to top off the jar and keep the vegetables submerged. Cover tightly and store in the refrigerator. The vegetables will need to pickle overnight before serving and will keep in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Note: The mixed vegetables can contain zucchini, baby carrots, bell peppers, celery, broccoli, or cauliflower.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: :avodado: Guacamole
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 avocado
  • 0.5 small white onion
  • 2 Roma tomatoes
  • 3 Tbsp cilantro
  • 1 jalapeno
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 lime juice
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Slice the ripe avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop into a mixing bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mash the avocado with a fork and make it as chunky or smooth as you’d like.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the diced white onion, diced Roma tomatoes, cilantro, deseeded jalapeno, garlic, lime juice, and salt and stir together. Give it a taste test and add a pinch more salt or lime juice if needed.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve the guacamole with tortilla chips.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://downshiftology.com/recipes/best-ever-guacamole/

docs.title: Lentil Fajita Tacos with Zhoug Crema
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 7 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup Greek yogurt
  • 2 Tbsp Zhoug sauce
  • 0.5 lime juice
  • some sea salt
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 pkg TJ's fire roasted peppers and onions
  • 1 Tbsp Zhoug sauce
  • 1 pkg TJ's steamed lentils
  • some pepper
  • 0.5 lime juice
  • 1 pkg taco shells

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine 1/2 cup Greek yogurt with one to two tablespoons of Zhoug sauce, depending on how spicy you’d like it, and juice from half of lime. Stir, season with sea salt, then refrigerate until ready to use.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large skillet, over high heat, add olive oil. Add TJ's fire roasted peppers and onions to the pan, and cook until heated through and sizzling, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add one tablespoon of Zhoug sauce and stir to combine. Add TJ's steamed lentils, season with salt and pepper, and add the juice from the remaining half of lime. Continue to cook until lentils are heated through, about 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Fill the taco shells with the lentil/pepper mixture and top with zhoug crema to serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Mexican Garbanzo Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cups diced tomatoes or 1 container TJ's pico de gallo
  • 0.5 cup white onion
  • 2 Tbsp jalapeño
  • 1 can chickpeas
  • 0.25 cup cilantro
  • some lime juice
  • 1 can black beans (optional)
  • 1 cup avocado (optional)
  • 1 cucumber (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine diced tomatoes or 1 container TJ's pico de gallo, white onion, minced jalapeño, chickpeas, cilantro, lime juice to taste, black beans (optional), avocado (optional), and diced cucumber (optional) in a large bowl.

docs.title: Potato Tacos
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 27 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 bell pepper
  • 2 Tbsp taco seasoning
  • 1 15-oz can black beans
  • 1 15-oz can refried beans
  • 8 tortillas

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cast iron skillet
  • 1 pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Chop the potatoes and boil until tender, about 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: After potatoes cook, heat olive oil in a cast iron skillet. Add chopped bell pepper, potatoes, and taco seasoning. Cook 5 to 7 minutes, then flip and cook 5 minutes more or until golden/crispy.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: While potatoes cook, add black beans and refried beans in a pot. Mix together and heat through.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat tortillas according to preference.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To assemble tacos, layer beans and potato/pepper mix, then add toppings as desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Roasted Cauliflower Tacos with Chipotle Romesco
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 45 minutes

docs.title: Cauliflower
docs.text:
• 2 small cauliflower
  • 3 Tbsp avocado or coconut oil
  • 3 tsp cumin
  • 2 tsp chili powder
  • 2 tsp paprika
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Sauce
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup raw almonds
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 15-oz can fire-roasted tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 medium lime
  • 0.25 tsp paprika
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 1.5 whole chipotle peppers in adobo sauce

docs.title: For Serving
docs.text:
• 12 tortillas
  • 2 Tbsp romesco sauce
  • some cilantro (optional)
  • some red cabbage (optional)
  • some pepitas (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 2 large baking sheets
  • 1 high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C) and add bite-sized pieces of cauliflower to 2 large baking sheets (use more baking sheets if increasing batch size). Add avocado or coconut oil (or omit or sub with water), cumin, chili powder, paprika, and salt. Toss to combine and roast on the bottom rack for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and tender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To a separate baking sheet, add raw almonds and the 4 unpeeled garlic (amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size). Roast on the center rack for 10 to 12 minutes, checking at the 8 minute mark. If the almonds are dark brown and cracking, remove from the oven to avoid burning, but continue cooking garlic until light golden brown and slightly softened. Remove from oven and set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: While cauliflower finishes roasting, add drained, fire-roasted tomatoes to a high-speed blender along with almonds, roasted garlic (peeled), raw garlic (peeled), olive oil (or water), lime juice, paprika, cumin, salt, maple syrup, and chipotle peppers in adobo sauce.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Blend on high until creamy and smooth, scraping down sides as needed. Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more lime for acidity, garlic for kick/zing, salt for saltiness, paprika or cumin for smokiness, maple syrup to offset heat/add sweetness, or chipotle peppers for more heat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To serve, warm tortillas in the microwave or in the oven directly on the still-warm oven racks until pliable. Then add 1-2 Tbsp of the romesco sauce and a generous portion of cauliflower. Serve as is or garnish with lime juice/wedges, cilantro, thinly sliced red cabbage, and/or pepitas (optional).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Best when fresh. Store leftover sauce in the refrigerator up to 1 week (or 1 month in the freezer), and the cauliflower in the refrigerator up to 3 days. Reheat cauliflower in a 350°F (176°C) oven until warm (best when fresh).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/roasted-cauliflower-tacos-with-chipotle-romesco/

docs.title: Slow Cooker Black Bean Chili
docs.text: Total Time 8.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb dried black beans
  • 2 tsp chili powder
  • 1 chipotle chili in adobo sauce
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 1 can fire roasted tomatoes
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 onion
  • 1 12-oz jar salsa verde
  • 1 jar roasted red peppers
  • 1 Tbsp ground cumin
  • 4 cups vegetable broth

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 slow cooker

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add dried black beans, chili powder, chipotle chili in adobo sauce, garlic, fire roasted tomatoes, salt, pepper, chopped onion, salsa verde, roasted red peppers, ground cumin, and vegetable broth to a slow cooker.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook on high for 6 to 8 hours.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Soyrizo & Potato Empanadas
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 medium potatoes
  • 2 tsp olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 cup soyrizo
  • 0.25 cup poblano pepper
  • some salt
  • 1 vegan empanada pastry
  • 1 avocado salsa

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium pot
  • 1 large nonstick pan
  • 1 Dutch oven, heavy-bottomed pot or high-sided frying pan
  • 1 plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium pot, add the peeled and diced potatoes and enough water to cover. Set over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and boil the potatoes until fully cooked, about 8 minutes. Drain the potatoes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, until very fragrant. Add the soyrizo and minced stemmed and seeded poblano pepper and cook until the poblanos soften slightly, about 3 minutes. Add the potatoes and cook for another 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and add salt to taste.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place a few tablespoons of the soyrizo filling on one side of each vegan empanada pastry. Use your finger or a pastry brush to moisten the edges of the pastry with water. Fold the pastry snugly over the filling, easing out any excess air and press the pastry edges together. Seal the edges with the tines of a fork or pinch together with your fingers. Transfer the assembled empanadas to a baking sheet or plate and cover with a kitchen towel to keep them from drying out.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a Dutch oven, heavy-bottomed pot or high-sided frying pan over medium-high heat, heat about 3 inches of oil to 350°F. Line a plate or baking sheet with a few layers of paper towels and place nearby for draining.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Working in batches, fry the empanadas until deep golden brown, 2 or 3 minutes per side. Transfer to the plate to drain and cool.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve with the avocado salsa verde for dipping.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Sweet & Spicy Corncakes
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 box TJ's cornbread mix
  • 1 cup milk
  • 1 egg
  • some cayenne pepper
  • some grape seed oil
  • 1 cup TJ's corn and chile tomato-less salsa
  • some cabbage slaw
  • 1 pkg TJ's chicken-less chicken fingers
  • 1 bottle TJ's cilantro dressing
  • 1 lime

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 griddle

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix together TJ's cornbread mix, milk, egg, cayenne pepper to taste, and 1/2 cup grape seed oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add TJ's corn and chile tomato-less salsa and allow batter to rest for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat griddle with grape seed oil and scoop 1/4 cup batter onto grill at a time.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve with cabbage slaw, TJ's chicken-less chicken fingers and TJ's cilantro dressing with a test of lime.

docs.title: Sweet Potato Black Bean Enchiladas
docs.text: Total Time 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cup sweet or Yukon gold potato
  • 1 Tbsp oil
  • 2 Tbsp water
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp paprika
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 2 cup kale
  • 0.5 onion (optional)
  • 4 cloves garlic (optional)
  • 8 oz can black beans
  • 0.25 cup enchilada sauce
  • 10 small corn tortillas
  • some jalapeño (optional)
  • some cilantro (optional)
  • some green onion (optional)
  • some cheese (optional)
  • some avocado crema (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 large cast-iron or metal skillet
  • 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 9x13-inch (3 quart | or similar shaped) baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C) and position a rack in the middle of the oven.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add cubed sweet or Yukon gold potato to one large baking sheet (or more as needed) and drizzle with oil (or water), cumin, paprika, and salt. Toss to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until sweet potatoes are fork tender and slightly caramelized. Set aside to cool. Also reduce oven heat to 350°F (176°C).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In the meantime, add your kale to a large cast-iron or metal skillet over medium heat with 2 Tbsp (30 ml) water. Cover and steam for about 4 to 5 minutes or until kale is slightly softened but still vibrant green. Uncover and set aside. (You could also sauté the kale in a bit of oil if you prefer.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Alternatively, sweet onion (optional), about 5 minutes. Also, add black beans to the pot and garlic (optional) right before the kale.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add drained black beans to a mixing bowl with steamed kale and roasted sweet potatoes. Add the smaller measurement of enchilada sauce to the kale and sweet potatoes and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Wrap corn tortillas in damp cloth towel and microwave to warm for 30 seconds to make more pliable. (Alternatively, place wrapped tortillas directly on oven rack for a few minutes to heat through.) This will help them become more pliable and easy to roll.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Pour about one third of the enchilada sauce into the bottom of a 9x13-inch (3 quart | or similar shaped) baking dish. Spread to coat.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Lay one corn tortilla down in the saucy dish to coat. Then flip it over to coat the other side. Fill with about 1/3 cup of the filling. Then roll up and lay seam-side down at the edge of the dish. Continue until all tortillas are filled and rolled, adding more sauce as needed to moisten tortillas. Add any remaining filling to the edges of the dish. If you run out of space to roll the tortillas in the baking dish, continue saucing, filling, and rolling them on a small serving plate.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
Pour remaining enchilada sauce over the top of the enchiladas in a stripe down the middle.

Tip

Use less sauce for slightly drier enchiladas. The more sauce you use, the more tender the tortillas will become.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Bake at 350°F (176C) for 15 to 20 minutes or until warmed through. Top with desired toppings and serve. We went with fresh jalapeño (optional), cilantro (optional), green onion (optional), cheese (optional), and avocado crema (optional).

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Leftovers will keep covered in the refrigerator up to 3 days or in the freezer up to 1 month, though best when fresh. Reheat in a 350°F (176°C) oven for 15-20 minutes or until warmed through.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/sweet-potato-black-bean-enchiladas/#wprm-recipe-container-34134

docs.title: Taco Bake
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 tsp taco seasoning
  • 0.5 tsp oregano
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 small onion
  • 2 cloves minced garlic
  • some olive oil
  • 2.5 cups cooked lentils
  • 3 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 2 Tbsp hot sauce
  • 12 hard taco shells
  • some pepper jack cheese
  • some shredded lettuce
  • some cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 skillet
  • 1 potato masher

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine taco seasoning, oregano, cumin. In skillet, sauté onion and minced garlic with olive oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add spice blend and set aside. Lower heat to medium, add cooked lentils and a splash of water, tomato paste, and hot sauce.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Use potato masher to mash mixture. Continue cooking for 5 minutes, adding water as needed.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Fill hard taco shells with lentil mixture and top with shredded pepper jack cheese.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake 10 to 15 minutes at 400°F. Top with shredded lettuce, cilantro, and favorite topping.

docs.title: Taquito-lada Casserole
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg taquitos
  • 1 jar enchilada sauce
  • 1.5 cups cheese
  • 0.5 can sliced black olives
  • 0.5 can fire roasted green chiles
  • 0.5 cup cheese
  • 3 green onions

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 7-inch by 10-inch baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F. Arrange taquitos in a single layer in a 7-inch by 10-inch baking dish and cover evenly with enchilada sauce. Top with 1-1/2 cups cheese, followed by sliced black olives and fire roasted green chiles.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bake casserole on center rack of oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F. Remove pan from oven and garnish with remaining cheese and green onions. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/taquito-lada-casserole

docs.title: Tijuana Torte
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg meatless ground beef
  • 1 medium onion
  • 1 1-lb can tomatoes
  • 1 can tomato sauce
  • 1 can chopped green chili peppers
  • 1 pkg taco seasoning
  • 1 small can sliced black olives
  • 1 pkg corn tortillas
  • 1 lb Cheddar cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9 x 13 baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Brown meatless ground beef and onion, add stewed tomatoes, tomato sauce, chopped green chili peppers, taco seasoning and sliced black olives.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place 1/4 cup of meat mixture in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Place the corn tortillas side by side on the meat mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Top with more meat mixture and then grated Cheddar cheese.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Repeat layers until all is used.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• Proctor Junior Troop - Toni Wilkerson
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Tofu Tacos
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 16 oz extra firm tofu
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika
  • 2 tsp chili powder
  • 1 tsp cumin

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 silicon mat
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 fork
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Line a baking sheet with a silicon mat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl, mash patted dry extra firm tofu with a fork.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Mix olive oil, soy sauce, tomato paste, maple syrup, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, chili powder, and cumin.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Spread tofu mixture on silicon mat.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 20 minutes, then stir/flip with a spatula. Bake for 20 minutes more.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Tostadas with Refried Black Beans & Pickled Cabbage & Onion
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2-4 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Tortillas
docs.text:
• 4 corn tortillas
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Pickled Cabbage
docs.text:
• 0.25 head green cabbage
  • 1 small red onion
  • 1 jalapeño
  • 2 cups white wine vinegar
  • 0.5 cup water
  • 3 Tbsp sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Ingredients - Beans
docs.text:
• 0.5 medium yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 15.5-oz can black beans
  • 1 cup water
  • 0.25 tsp chipotle powder

docs.title: Ingredients - Garnish
docs.text:
• 1 avocado (optional)
  • some cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 sheet pan
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 potato masher or the back of a fork
  • 1 tongs

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat the oven (with the oven rack in the middle) to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put the corn tortillas on a sheet pan and brush both sides with the olive oil. Bake 12 to 15 minutes, until crisp.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: For the pickled cabbage and onion, as thinly as you can, slice the green cabbage, red onion, and jalapeño and put into a medium bowl.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a small saucepan, combine the white wine vinegar, water, sugar, and salt over medium-high heat. Let it come to a boil. Once the sugar is dissolved, pour over the cabbage mixture and toss. Let cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally, until wilted but still crisp (the cabbage mixture will slowly become submerged in the vinegar mixture as it wilts).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: For the beans, finely chop the yellow onion. In a medium saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and salt and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 to 6 minutes, until softened. Add the cumin and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Add the black beans, 1 cup water, and the chipotle powder. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 10 minutes. Use a potato masher or the back of a fork to mash the beans. Continue to simmer, stirring often, for 3 to 4 minutes, until the beans are thick.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Build your tostadas: Dividing evenly spread the beans over the tortillas. Add some slices of avocado (optional). Use tongs to lift out some of the pickled cabbage mixture, shaking of excess vinegar mixture, and top the tostadas. Top with cilantro as well.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://jessicaseinfeld.com/recipes/tostadas-with-refried-black-beans-and-pickled-cabbage

docs.title: Vegetarian Tacos
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Taco
docs.text:
• some olive oil
  • 2 chopped sweet potatoes, 1 inch diced
  • 1 Tbsp chili powder
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 8 oz mushrooms, thinly sliced
  • 0.5 red onions, sliced
  • 2 ears sweet corn
  • 1 Tbsp garlic
  • 1 can black beans, drained
  • 8 corn or TJ's Jicama tortillas
  • some feta cheese (optional)
  • some cilantro (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - Avocado Crema
docs.text:
• 1 ripe avocado
  • 0.33 cup full fat, plain Greek yogurt
  • 0.25 cup cilantro
  • 1 Tbsp lime juice
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 sauté pan
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: On a large baking sheet, drizzle 1/2 teaspoon olive oil on chopped sweet potatoes, 1 inch diced. Add chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, and evenly distribute the seasonings over the sweet potatoes. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until the sweet potatoes are roasted and slightly browned.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, drizzle 1 to 2 Tbsp of olive oil to coat the bottom of a sauté pan and bring to a medium heat. Add mushrooms, thinly sliced, red onions, sliced, sweet corn and minced garlic. Once vegetables are slightly browned, add the drained black beans, drained, and turn heat to low. Simmer until the sweet potatoes are done cooking in the oven.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Make the avocado crema by whipping ripe avocado, full fat, plain Greek yogurt, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Warm up corn or TJ's Jicama tortillas on stovetop. Assemble tacos by layering sweet potatoes, then sauteed vegetables, avocado crema and a sprinkle of feta cheese (optional) and cilantro (optional) on a warm tortilla.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Black Beans
docs.text: Total Time 1.17 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 227 g dried black beans
  • 3 cups cold water
  • 1.5 tsp kosher salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 pressure cooker

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add dried black beans to cold water and kosher salt in a pressure cooker.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pressure cook on high for 50 minutes. Allow pressure to release naturally for 20 minutes. Makes 545g total.q

docs.title: Brown Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup brown rice (200g)
  • 1 cup cold water or vegetable broth (250mL)
  • 2 star anise (optional)
  • 3 cardamom pods (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 Instant Pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place 1 cup brown rice (200g) and 1 cup cold water or vegetable broth (250mL) in Instant Pot. Optionally, add star anise (optional) and cardamom pods (optional).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: With Venting Knob in Venting Position, close the lid, then turn Venting Knob to Sealing Position.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pressure cook at High Pressure for 15 minutes (See experiment for your own preference), and Natural Release for 5 minutes, then Quick Release (turn Venting Knob to Venting position). Open the lid carefully.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Serve: Fluff brown rice with a rice paddle or fork.

Tip

If the rice is a bit wet, let it rest a bit for the moisture to escape before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.pressurecookrecipes.com/instant-pot-brown-rice/

docs.title: Chickpeas
docs.text: Total Time 1.33 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 225 g dried chickpeas
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 4 cups water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 pressure cooker

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Rinse dried chickpeas, then drain. Place in pressure cooker. Add salt and water. Close vent and set pressure to high and cook for 42 minutes (tender with a bit of chew) or 60 minutes (tender and soft).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Allow pressure to release naturally for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Drain, then serve/prepare as desired. Makes roughly 450g (1 can) cooked.

docs.title: Refried Black Beans
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 400 g dried black beans
  • 1 medium onion
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp chili powder
  • 0.5 tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • 5 cups vegetable broth
  • some salt
  • some lime juice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add dried black beans, coarsely chopped onion, garlic, cumin, chili powder, black pepper, dried oregano, and vegetable broth to an Instant Pot.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Seal the lid and pressure cook for 40 minutes, then let pressure release naturally for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Use a ladle to scoop out most of the liquid and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Use an immersion blender to blend, adding in liquid to desired consistency.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Stir in salt and lime juice to taste.

docs.title: Workflow
docs.text:
Below is my current workflow for documenting recipes.

graph TD
  S[Change to or create ./cook/catetory dir];
  A{Does the source<br/>website exist?};
  B[Import recipe using cook-import];
  C[Manually write cook<br/>file using micro editor];
  D{Is the domain<br />supported by<br/>cook-import?};
  E[Visually check cook file];
  F[Test output using cook recipe read command];
  G[Download image file and rename<br/>to same base name as cook file];
  H[Run cook-docs in ./cook/category<br/>to generate markdown file];
  I[Manually check markdown file];
  J[Move markdown file to ./docs/category];
  K[Copy image to ./docs/assets/images<br/>with same base file name as markdown file];
  L[Add markdown file to mkdocs.yaml];
  M[Locally run mkdocs to test mkdocs-material];
  N[Commit and push to repo];
  O{Is the file<br />correct?};
  P[Edit cook file];
  Q{Is the<br/>output correct?};
  R[Edit cook file];
  T{Does the page<br/>render correctly?};
  U[CI GitHub Action workflow<br/>deploys recipe site];
  V{Is the image<br/>format webp?};
  W[Convert the image<br/>to png using dwebp];
  X[Check spelling using<br/>spellchecker-cli];
  Y[Check markdown links<br/>using markdown-link-check];
  Z{What is the<br/>origin of the recipe?};
  AB{What type of device<br/>is being used?}
  AC[Use the GitHub mobile app<br/>to create an issue]
  AD[Use the GitHub website<br/>to create an issue]
  AE[Use GitHub Issues to<br/>determine which recipe to document]
  AF[Close GitHub issue, if applicable.]
  AG[Identify a recipe<br/>to be documented]
  AH[Document link in issue]
  AI[Take image of cookbook/index<br/>card and add it to issue]
  AG --> AB;
  AB --> |Mobile|AC;
  AB --> |Desktop|AD;
  AC --> Z;
  AD --> Z;
  Z --> |Website|AH;
  Z --> |Cookbook/<br/>Index Card|AI;
  AH --> AE;
  AI --> AE;
  AE --> S;
  A --> |Yes|B;
  A --> |No|C;
  B --> D;
  C --> F;
  D --> |Yes|E;
  D --> |No|C;
  E --> F;
  F --> Q;
  Q --> |Yes|G;
  H --> I;
  J --> K;
  K --> L;
  L --> M;
  I --> O;
  O --> |Yes|J;
  O --> |No|P;
  P --> H;
  Q --> |No|R;
  R --> F;
  S --> A;
  M --> T;
  T --> |Yes|X;
  X --> Y;
  Y --> N;
  T --> |No|P;
  N --> U;
  G --> V;
  V --> |Yes|W;
  V --> |No|H;
  W --> H;
  U --> AF;

  click B "#cook-import"
  click C "#cooklang-micro"
  click D "#cook-import"
  click F "#cooklang"
  click H "#cook-docs"
  click U "https://github.com/nicholaswilde/recipes/blob/main/.github/workflows/ci.yaml"
  click X "#spellchecker-cli"
  click Y "#markdown-link-check"

docs.title: Tools
docs.text:
Tools used to develop this repository.

Note

All commands are run from the root of the repo unless otherwise specified.

docs.title: cooklang
docs.text:
Used to generate shopping lists and manage recipes.

Installation
brew tap cooklang/tap
brew install cooklang/tap/cook
Usage
cook recipe read file.cook

docs.title: cook-import
docs.text:
Used to download recipe from website as a cooklang file, if possible.

Usage
cook-import -l <url> -f

docs.title: cooklang-micro
docs.text: Used as a cooklang syntax highlighter for the micro editor

docs.title: webp
docs.text:
Used to convert images from webp to png.

Installation
sudo apt install webp
Usage
dwebp file.webp -o file.png

docs.title: avif
docs.text:
Used to convert images from avif to jpg.

Installation
brew install imagemagick
Usage
magick -quality 75 input.avif output.jpg

docs.title: Task
docs.text:
Used to automate tasks.

Installation
brew install go-task/tap/go-task
Usage
# List tasks
task

docs.title: cook-docs
docs.text:
Used to generate markdown files from cooklang files.

Installation
brew install nicholaswilde/tap/cook-docs
Usage
/recipes/cook/category$ cook-docs

docs.title: Material for MkDocs
docs.text:
Used as theme for static site.

Installation
pip install mkdocs-material mkdocs-minify-plugin

docs.title: MkDocs
docs.text:
Used to generate static site.

Installation
(
  wget https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py
  python get-pip.py
  pip install mkdocs
)
TaskManual Usage
task serve
Usage
mkdocs serve

docs.title: Spellchecker CLI
docs.text:
Used to check documentation spelling.

Installation
npm install --global spellchecker-cli
TaskScriptManual Usage
task spellcheck
Usage
chmod +x ./scripts/spellcheck.sh
./scripts/spellcheck.sh
Usage
npx spellchecker -d dictionary.txt -f {"./cook/**/*.cook","./docs/**/*.md"}
Add to dictionary
echo "word to add" >> dictionary.txt
TaskManual Sort dictionary
task sort
Sort dictionary
sort dictionary.txt -u -o dictionary.txt

docs.title: markdown-link-check
docs.text:
Used to check documentation links.

Installation
npm install -g markdown-link-check
TaskScriptDocker Usage
task linkcheck
Usage
chmod +x ./scripts/linkcheck.sh
./scripts/linkcheck.sh
Usage
docker run --rm -v /:/tmp:ro -i -w /tmp ghcr.io/tcort/markdown-link-check:stable "/tmp/path/to/file" -c "/tmp{{ .ROOT_DIR }}/mlc_config.json"

docs.title: Vegetable Shortening
docs.text:
Note

No matter what you’re using, use the same amount of vegetable shortening or butter called for in your recipe. In other words, it should be a one-to-one swap. If your recipe calls for one cup of butter, you can use one cup of shortening and vice versa. Does your recipe call for salted butter? Add a pinch of salt to the shortening for a closer match.

Vegetable Shortening Equivalency to: Butter 1 Tbsp 1 Tbsp 2 Tbsp 2 Tbsp 3 Tbsp 3 Tbsp

If your recipe calls for both baking soda and cream of tartar—usually for leavening purposes—just replace both with baking powder. ↩

docs.title: A Translation of Old-Fashioned American Measurements
docs.text:
We shouldn’t give up our old measurements entirely. There’s too much history and sentiment tied up in them. “Butter the size of a walnut” stirs a chord that “28.35g butter” just can’t. But where there are no walnuts, we need the other measurement as well.

Old-Fashioned Equivalent Current Butter the size of a walnut (or a “lump”) 2 Tbsp Butter the size of an egg 1/4 cup Coffee cup 1 cup Dash 1/8 tsp Dessert spoon 1-1/2 tsp 60 drops 1 tsp Gill 1/2 cup Pinch 1/16 or 1/8 tsp Salt spoon 1/4 tsp Teacup 3/4 cup Tin cup 1 cup Tumblerful 2 cups Wineglass 1/2 gill or 1/4 cup

docs.title: Using Cookbooks From Outside The United States<sup>2</sup>
docs.text:
With the exception of the other English-speaking nations, cookbooks are written with metric measurements. Should you run into a metric cookbook, here are some conversions of our basic measurements, which are difficult to translate exactly. Small amounts will not make much difference, so metric amounts are usually rounded. (You use milliliters [ml] when speaking of liquids, and grams [g] when speaking of solids.) For baking purposes, a gram is the same as a milliliter.

Imperial Metric 1 tsp 5 ml/g 1 Tbsp 15 ml/g 1 ounce 28.35 (or 30) ml/g 1 cup 227 (or 230) ml/g 1 lb 450 ml/g 2.2 lbs 1 kilogram

And should you be faced with an overseas oven, here are some temperature conversions from Fahrenheit to centigrade, with the gas marks, used in some countries, as well.

Fahrenheit Celsius or Gas Mark 225°F 100°C or Gas Mark 1/4 250°F 130°C or Gas Mark 1/2 275°F 140°C or Gas Mark 1 300°F 150°C or Gas Mark 2 325°F 170°C or Gas Mark 3 350°F 180°C or Gas Mark 4 375°F 190°C or Gas Mark 5 400°F 200°C or Gas Mark 6 425°F 220°C or Gas Mark 7 450°F 230°C or Gas Mark 8 475°F 240°C or Gas Mark 9

  1. The scoop# may be found by measuring the scoop bowl diameter if the scoop# is not printed on the scoop. ↩

  2. The King Arthur Baking Company All-Purpose Baker's Companion ↩↩

docs.title: Spirits
docs.text: Spirit Description Abricot du Roussillon Add some to Champagne, Chantilly and, of course, apricots. Amaretto This will augment the flavor of almonds in a cake and is delicious in ganache and Chantilly. Armagnac A classic with prunes and chestnuts, Armagnac is found in many a winter cake. Calvados An essential in apple cakes. Clear Creek Distillery makes an apple brandy that has been aged eight years and is the closest American option. Chambord The black raspberry liqueur. It is delicious in a soaking syrup for a genoise topped with fresh berries and Chantilly. Added to buttercream, it complements a lemon cake beautifully. Cognac Offers a rounded, enveloping elegance that gives a complex dimension to even a simple Chantilly cream. Cointreau & Grand Marnier Both are made with oranges, but Grand Marnier, made with bitter oranges, has a brandy base and is aged in oak. Cointreau is sweeter, transparent and livelier, but less complex. If I want the citrusy brightness, I turn to Cointreau. If I want a sophisticated undercurrent of orange, I reach for Grand Marnier. Creme de Casis The ruby of Kir, it is what elevates a simple coulis of raspberries as easily as it turns a genoise syrup or buttercream into something French. Creme de Framboise Use this as you would creme de cassis whenever the taste of raspberries is desired. Clearly a great match for a bowl of summer berries, in a coulis or added to a chocolate ganache. A tablespoon will lightly scent a batch of madeleines or financiers. Creme de Peche Add to a glass of Champagne or anything with peaches. Frangelico A wonderful alternative to hazelnut extract, Frangelico has notes of vanilla in it as well as a touch of coffee. Limoncello Use on a bowl of berries, in Chantilly, as a soaking syrup, in a glaze, brushed on a genoise or brightening up a buttercream. Limonsardo is a Sardinian version that is a little less sweet. Poire Williams This pear liqueur amplifies the pear notes in a pear cake, but it is also lovely in chocolate mousse. Pear and almond are the closest of friends and show up together in everything from simple yogurt pear cakes to frangipane pear tarts. Rum Substitute with vanilla extract. Add three to four times the amount of rum as you would vanilla, if substituting. Or add both, as familiar vanilla dances with the more spirited rum. St. Germain or Fleur de Sureau Sauvage Elderflower likes lemons, limes, and roses.
