docs.title: Tips
docs.text: Tips acquired throughout my cooking journey. These tips are used in recipes that don't necessarily call for it. For instance, chilling or aging cookie dough overnight to hydrate the dry ingredients.

docs.title: Onions
docs.text: Onions should be sautéed first to caramelize them and bring out the sweetness, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Garlic
docs.text: Garlic should not be burned and added right before liquid is added, right when the garlic aroma is perceived.

docs.title: Cornstarch
docs.text:
When using cornstarch as a thickener, always mix the cornstarch in a small amount of liquid in a container before adding to the dish to avoid lumps.

Bring the dish back up to a boil for about 10 seconds to activate the cornstarch. The dish will thicken as it cools down to room temperature.

docs.title: Baking
docs.text: All ingredients should be at the same temperature, usually room temperature. An exception is when you want the ingredient to bring down the temperature of the mixture, such as adding cold eggs to warm brown butter.

docs.title: Cookie Dough
docs.text:
Aging cookie dough that uses egg as the main source of liquid in the refrigerator overnight.

Bake cookie dough while still cold to prevent spread and don't let the later baked cookie dough to come to room temperature while waiting to go into the oven.

docs.title: Eggs
docs.text:
Eggs should be separated when cold.

Eggs should be added to batter at room temperature.

docs.title: Butter
docs.text:
Butter should be a room temperature when creamed with sugar.

Creaming of butter and sugar should happen for an amount of time to make the butter pale, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Cake
docs.text:
When mixing the batter for cake, cream the sugar and butter first, add the egg and butter, combine wet together, combine dry together, then add a third of the dry ingredients, then half the wet, alternating until you end with dry.

For an oil based cake, whisk the egg and sugar together.

When using zest, massage the zest into the granulated sugar to release the oils.

docs.title: A Very Popular BBQ Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cup brown sugar
  • 1.5 cup ketchup
  • 0.5 cup red wine vinegar
  • 0.5 cup water
  • 1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 2.5 Tbsp mustard
  • 2 tsp paprika
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp black pepper
  • 2 dashes hot pepper sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine brown sugar, ketchup, red wine vinegar, water, and Worcestershire sauce in a blender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Season with mustard, paprika, salt, black pepper, and hot pepper sauce. Blend until smooth. 10 minutes

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/51226/a-very-popular-bbq-sauce/

docs.title: Aaron Combs' Salsa
docs.text: Total Time 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 tomato
  • 1 sweet white onion
  • some cilantro
  • 1 jalapeño
  • some salt
  • some lemon juice
  • some granulated garlic

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Add ingredients in order given.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add tomato and then sweet white onion to taste.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add cilantro for color.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add jalapeño to taste for heat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add salt and then lemon juice to taste. If too salty, add lemon juice. If too acidic, add salt.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Add granulated garlic to taste.

Note

Best if left overnight.

Note

Make smallest pieces as possible.

Note

Garlic granules instead of fresh garlic because the taste can be evaluated immediately.

Note

Lemon juice is used rather than lime juice because lime juice tends to make the salsa more bitter.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Aaron Combs

docs.title: Adobo Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup chile powder
  • 1.5 cups boiling water
  • 0.25 cup cider vinegar
  • 2 Roma tomatoes
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 Tbsp brown sugar
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 tsp allspice
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor or blender
  • 1 skillet or Dutch

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a food processor or blender add the chile powder and carefully pour in 1.5 cups boiling water. Cover with lid to steep while you get the other ingredients together.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the cider vinegar, chopped Roma tomatoes, garlic, brown sugar, oregano, salt, cumin, cinnamon, pepper and allspice to the food processor or blender and process to a smooth purée, about the consistency of BBQ sauce or ketchup. If needed, thin with water.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat olive oil in a skillet or Dutch oven over medium high heat. Carefully pour in the chili vegetable purée and bring to a boil, reduce to simmer and cook for 20 minutes uncovered.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Makes about 2 1/2 to 3 cups adobo sauce. Use in any Mexican dish you prefer or add chipotle chiles (See below) and keep in an airtight container and refrigerate.

docs.title: If Adding Chipotle Peppers in Adobo Sauce
If Using Dried Chipotle Peppers
docs.text:
Pre-soak: Bend and slightly crack the dried chipotle peppers (or make punctures all over with a knife). Add to a saucepan and just cover with water. Bring to a boil, reduce to simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Be sure to add more water if needed so they don't dry and burn.

Set aside to cool, then add to Adobo Sauce AFTER Step 3. Simmer in Adobo Sauce for another 10 minutes. Let cool completely and store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

docs.title: If Using Freshly Smoked Chipotle Peppers (not dried yet)
docs.text: Add freshly smoked peppers directly to the Adobo Sauce AFTER Step 3. Simmer in Adobo Sauce for another 10 minutes. Let cool completely and store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

docs.title: For Canning
docs.text:
Carefully spoon adobo sauce or adobo sauce with chipotles into clean, sterilized 4 ounce canning jars. Apply lid per packaged instructions and submerge in boiling water for 30 minutes. Remove jars from water bath and allow to cool.

Note

You can substitute ancho chile powder for regular chile powder.

Note

If available use Mexican piloncillo. The sugar is found at most Mexican markets or in the Mexican aside of most markets and is formed into a cone shape. Break off and use 2 tablespoons.

Note

I prefer Mexican oregano and it definitely adds so much authenticity to the recipe. Mexican oregano is a relative of Lemon Verbena and is native to Mexico. Similar in that it’s pungent like Mediterranean oregano, Mexican oregano has notes of mild licorice and citrus. Mediterranean oregano is a member of the mint family and most often is used in Greek and Italian recipes. Mediterranean oregano is the one most found in spice racks and supermarkets.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://keviniscooking.com/how-to-make-adobo-sauce/

docs.title: Aji Verde
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 1 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup mayonnaise
  • 1 jalapeño chile
  • 3 Tbsp cilantro
  • 2 Tbsp cotija cheese
  • 2 Tbsp lime juice
  • 1 Tbsp huacatay paste

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine mayonnaise, stemmed, seeded, and chopped jalapeño chile, minced cilantro, grated cotija cheese, lime juice, huacatay paste, and minced garlic in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend for 1 minute.

docs.title: Alfredo Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 cups 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup butter
  • 1.5 cups heavy whipping cream
  • 2 tsp garlic
  • 0.5 tsp Italian seasoning
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 2 cups Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the butter and heavy whipping cream to a large skillet.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Simmer over low heat for 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk in the garlic, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Whisk in the Parmesan cheese until melted.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve immediately.

docs.title: All-Purpose Vinaigrette
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3/4 cup 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup balsamic vinegar
  • 0.5 cup Dijon mustard
  • 0.25 cup shallot
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine balsamic vinegar, Dijon mustard, shallot, pepper in a small bowl and mix well. Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to a week.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/salad-dressing/all-purpose-vinaigrette/

docs.title: Asian Sweet-&-Sour Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 cups 45 minutes

docs.title: Sauce
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp butter
  • 1 cup vegetable stock or broth
  • 1 cup green bell peppers
  • 6 slices canned pineapple
  • 0.75 cup pineapple juice
  • 0.5 cup rice vinegar
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp ginger

docs.title: Thickener
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp cornstarch
  • 0.5 cup vegetable stock or broth
  • 2 Tbsp soy sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium heavy saucepan
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Serve over a dish of chicken, vegetables, and rice. Melt in a medium heavy saucepan 2 Tbsp butter.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add vegetable stock or broth, diced green bell peppers, and diced canned pineapple.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes. Add pineapple juice, rice vinegar, sugar, salt, and ginger.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Simmer stirring constantly, until reduced to about 3 cups, about 35 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Meanwhile, stir together in a small bowl cornstarch, vegetable stock or broth, and soy sauce.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Stir into the sauce and simmer 5 minutes to thicken.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Balsamic Onion Jam
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2.5 pints 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs sweet onions
  • 0.5 cup balsamic vinegar
  • 0.5 cup maple syrup
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp pepper
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 2 cups apple juice
  • 3 Tbsp pectin
  • 0.5 cup granulated sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 jars

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large pot combine sweet onions, balsamic vinegar, maple syrup, salt, pepper and 1 bay leaf.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook over medium heat for about 10 to 15 minutes until the onions are translucent, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add in apple juice and pectin and stir to combine. Turn heat to high and bring to a rolling boil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Then add granulated sugar all at once and bring the mixture back to a full rolling boil that cannot be stirred down. Boil at this level for 1 minute then remove the pot from the heat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: At this point you can either spoon the jam into jars and place them in the fridge or can them.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://jamjarkitchen.com/2022/07/05/balsamic-onion-jam-for-canning/

docs.title: Beet Hummus
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 beet
  • 0.33 cup olive oil
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 can, drained chickpeas
  • 0.67 cup tahini
  • 0.33 cup lemon juice
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • some radishes (optional)
  • some pine nuts (optional)
  • some parsley (optional)
  • some lemon zest (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 tin foil
  • 1 food processor or blender
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Wash the beet and drizzle it with olive oil and salt. Wrap it in tin foil and place it in the oven for about 1 hour. Allow the beet to cool, then peel and chop.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine the beet, chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and cumin in a food processor or blender.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Slowly drizzle in the olive oil and blend until smooth.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Taste and adjust the seasonings and olive oil as needed. Blend until smooth.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Serve in a bowl.

Optional toppings

Thinly sliced radishes (optional), pine nuts (optional), chopped parsley (optional), lemon zest (optional) or other ingredients you have that might compliment this dish. Sprinkle these ingredients on top and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Benedictine Sandwich Spread
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cucumbers
  • 0.5 small white onion
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • :pepper: 0.5 tsp white pepper
  • 24 oz cream cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 spoon
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Peel and slice cucumbers lengthwise.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Using a spoon, scoop out the seeds and discard.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cut into large pieces.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a food processor, puree cucumber and white onion.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Squeeze out excess liquid.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Combine with salt, white pepper, and cream cheese and refrigerate up to three days.

docs.title: Berry Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.75 cups 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 100 g granulated sugar
  • 57 g water
  • 170 g frozen raspberries
  • 170 g frozen blackberries
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 heatproof flexible spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, combine the granulated sugar and 1/4 cup water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring with a heatproof flexible spatula until the sugar dissolves to form a clear syrup, about 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: When it comes to a boil, stop stirring and cook the mixture, swirling the saucepan occasionally, until large, glassy, slow-moving bubbles form across the entire surface, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove the saucepan from the heat and carefully add the frozen raspberries and frozen blackberries (plus any juices). Stir the mixture to combine, which will cause the sugar to harden in some places.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Return the saucepan to medium-high heat and stir, mashing the berries against the saucepan and scraping the bottom and sides with the spatula, until any hardened bits of sugar dissolve and you have a smoothish sauce with some pieces of berries floating around, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the vanilla and salt.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Transfer the berry sauce to a lidded container and refrigerate until cold.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • What's For Dessert

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp walnuts
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 2 Tbsp chives
  • 0.5 cup blue cheese crumble
  • 8 oz cream cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place walnuts, chopped parsley, and chopped chives in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer to a small bowl and stir in blue cheese crumble. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place cream cheese in a food processor until smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Add herb mixture to cream cheese and process until thoroughly blended.

Note

Spread can be made 3 days ahead and chilled, covered tightly.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve at room temperature.

docs.title: Broccoli Salad Dressing

• 1 cup mayonnaise
  • 2 Tbsp red or white wine vinegar
  • 0.5 cup sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix mayonnaise, red or white wine vinegar, sugar, and salt.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Chill at least 1 hour before tossing with salad.

docs.title: Buffalo Sauce

docs.text:
• 0.67 cup hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot)
  • 0.5 cup butter
  • 1.5 Tbsp white vinegar
  • 0.25 tsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 0.25 tsp cayenne pepper
  • 0.13 tsp garlic powder
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine hot pepper sauce (such as Frank's RedHot), butter, white vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, and salt in a pot over medium heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bring to a simmer while stirring with a whisk. As soon as the liquid begins to bubble on the sides of the pot, remove from heat, stir with the whisk, and set aside for use.

docs.title: Butternut Squash Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 2 small shallots
  • 2 lbs butternut squash
  • 0.13 tsp red pepper flakes
  • some ginger
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • some nutmeg
  • 2 cloves garlic

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small pot
  • 1 skillet
  • 1 frying pan
  • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the vegetable broth to a small pot and bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the shallots and salt to the skillet and cook until translucent.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the butternut squash to a frying pan and saute.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the squash to the shallots and then add red pepper flakes and ginger and season with salt and pepper and nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook, stirring occasionally, about 8 to 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the garlic until fragrant.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add the vegetable broth. Reduce the heat and simmer until the squash is soft and the liquid is reduced by half, about 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Once the squash mixture is done cooking, blend using an immersion blender.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Season to taste.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cookieandkate.com/creamy-vegan-butternut-squash-linguine-with-fried-sage/

docs.title: Carrot-Tamarind Chutney
docs.text: Total Time 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup carrot
  • 0.25 cup onion
  • 3 Tbsp tamarind juice concentrate
  • 2 Tbsp water
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 tsp sugar
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp coriander
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Process carrot and onion in food processor until finely chopped, about 20 seconds, scraping down sides of bowl halfway through processing. Add tamarind juice concentrate, water, lemon juice, sugar, cumin, coriander, and salt and process until combined, about 20 seconds, scraping down sides of bowl halfway through processing (mixture will not be completely smooth). Transfer to bowl and serve. (Chutney can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.)

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Cashew Chipotle Ranch Dressing
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup raw cashews
  • 0.67 cup almond milk
  • 2 tsp lemon or lime juice
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tsp maple syrup
  • 0.25 tsp chipotle chili powder or sub chili powder
  • 1 Tbsp dried dill

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak raw cashews in hot water for 30 minutes. Mix almond mil and lemon juice. Set aside for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Using immersion blender, mix drained cashews and almond milk, lemon or lime juice, garlic, salt, onion powder, apple cider vinegar, maple syrup, chipotle chili powder or sub chili powder, and dried dill.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/vegan-chipotle-ranch-dressing/#wprm-recipe-container-45694

docs.title: Cashew Crema
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 cup 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Tip

Use the lesser amount for the texture of light coconut milk and the greater amount to resemble full-fat coconut milk

  • 0.25 to 0.5 cup (57 g) raw cashews
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup (113 g) water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak raw cashews for 2 hours or up to 12 hours.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain and rinse the cashews under cold water until the water runs clear.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Transfer the cashews to a high-speed blender and add the lemon juice, salt, and 1/2 cup water.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Blend until smooth and creamy.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

Tip

If the cream is grainy, try straining it through a fine mesh sieve.

Tip

Use in place of coconut milk or dairy cream in pasta, soup, overnight oats, beverages (only if using the lesser amount of cashews - and strain for best texture), desserts, and anything else that would benefit from a creamy boost! Sadly, it doesn’t work for making whipped cream.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Cashew Nacho Cheese
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 cups 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup raw cashews
  • 2 Tbsp pumpkin seeds
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 jalapeño
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp chipotle powder
  • 0.25 cup water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak the raw cashews in water for 4 hours or up to overnight.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain and rinse the raw cashews under cold water until the water runs clear.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Transfer the cashews to a high-speed blender and add the pumpkin seeds, lemon juice, garlic, 1/2 to 1 whole seeded jalapeño, salt, chipotle powder, and 1/4 cups of water.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Blend until smooth and creamy.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: The mixture will keep in the fridge, covered, for 3 to 4 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Cashew Queso Blanco
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 cups 0 minutes

  • 3 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a high-speed blender, add the raw cashews, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, salt, and 1/2 cup of water.

docs.title: Step 2

docs.title: Step 3

docs.title: Chilero Hot Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 3
  • 0.25 carrots
  • 0.5 small sweet onions
  • 0.25 cucumbers
  • 0.125 head cauliflower
  • 0.5 read or green bell peppers
  • 0.75 jalapeno peppers
  • 0.5 spicy chili peppers (like habanero)
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 oz white vinegar
Serves 24
  • 2 carrots
  • 4 small sweet onions
  • 2 cucumbers
  • 1 head cauliflower
  • 4 read or green bell peppers
  • 6 jalapeno peppers
  • 4 spicy chili peppers (like habanero)
  • 1 Tbsp salt
  • 24 oz white vinegar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 wide-mouth glass pickling bottles(s) or jar(s)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Quickly parboil carrots and sweet onions by boiling water and dropping them in for 1 to 2 minutes, until their color turns bright. Drain and pat dry.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sprinkle cucumbers, cauliflower, read or green bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, and spicy chili peppers (like habanero) with salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Fill clean wide-mouth glass pickling bottles(s) or jar(s) with vegetables, then pour white vinegar into bottles, pushing down vegetables until vinegar covers them entirely.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Allow the chilero to sit at room temperature (not in the sun) for at least a day before using. Two or three days is better.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Store for 2 to 3 months in the refrigerator.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: Chimichurri

docs.text: Whisk the olive oil into the other ingredients.

docs.title: Chipotle Mayonnaise

  • 2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce

docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine ranch dressing and 1 to 2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend on high until the mixture is smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Serve on your choice of salads, chicken, chips, vegetables, etc.

docs.title: Cilantro Dressing
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.33 cup rice vinegar
  • 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 cup mayonnaise
  • 3 oz cotija cheese or queso fresco
  • 1 lime juice
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 jalapeño
  • 0.5 cup cilantro
  • 0.5 Tbsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

This is copycat of TJ's Cilantro Dressing

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add rice vinegar, olive oil, mayonnaise, cotija cheese or queso fresco, lime juice, garlic, jalapeño, cilantro, and salt to a blender in the order given.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Process until smooth.

docs.title: Citrus Honey Dressing

• 1 lemon
  • 1 orange
  • 4 Tbsp honey
  • 3 mint leaves (optional)

docs.title: Cookware

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Zest and juice the lemon and orange.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a small bowl, whisk together the honey, lemon juice, orange juice, lemon and orange zest.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add mint leaves (optional) for extra flavor.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the dressing over the fruit and toss evenly before serving.

docs.title: Claire's Five-Onion Dip
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 white onion
  • 1 red onion
  • 1 sweet onion
  • 2 shallot
  • 0.5 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 Tbsp salt
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 2 Tbsp mayonnaise
  • 0.5 tsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 0.25 tsp white pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pan
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Chop white onion, red onion, and sweet onion into 1/4 inch pieces, and slice the shallot into thin rings. Separate the dark green part from the rest of the scallions and set aside, then thinly slice the white and light green portion. Add all onions except the dark green scallions to a large pan with the vegetable oil, and season with the salt. Stir, then set over medium-low heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Once the onions begin to sweat and soften, lower the heat as low as it will go and cook until they caramelize and reduce into a jammy, dark brown mass, at least 1 hour. Scrape into a bowl and let cool completely. (I usually cook the onions the night before I want dip so they can cool completely in the fridge.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix the onions with sour cream, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, and white pepper, taste (with a chip), and adjust salt and pepper if needed. You can even add a pinch of MSG if you like, but this is one dip that frankly does not need it, as the mixture of onions is packed with tons of deep umami. Garnish with the thinly sliced portion of the green onion (or crunchy fried onions, or fried garlic) and consume with your favorite potato chip.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://lifehacker.com/your-onion-dip-needs-at-least-five-onions-1849586590

docs.title: Classic Mustard
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp water
  • 5 Tbsp vinegar
  • 0.5 cup mustard powder
  • 1 Tbsp sugar
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp turmeric (optional)
  • 0.5 tsp sweet paprika (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: For mild mustard, combine the water and vinegar and bring to a boil, then mix in mustard powder, sugar, and salt.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Using boiling hot vinegar and water will significantly reduce the nose hit from the mustard powder.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Use cold liquids for hotter mustard. For variations, try substituting a dry white wine or lemon juice in place of the water.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Mustard seeds/powder can be any type: mild, hot, yellow, or brown. Add whole or crushed mustard seeds after completing the basic recipe. They adsorb a lot of liquid. If extra liquid is needed, consider using vinegar first.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: You can experiment with numerous other spices and flavors. The most popular additions are turmeric (optional) and sweet paprika (optional).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thespicehouse.com/blogs/recipes/classic-mustard-recipe

docs.title: Classic Tartar Sauce

  • 2 Tbsp caper berries
  • 2 Tbsp pickles
  • 1 Tbsp chives

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Do Ahead: Tartar sauce can be made 1 week ahead. Cover and chill.

docs.title: Creamy Vegan Cheese Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup potatoes
  • 0.25 cup carrots
  • 0.25 cup onion
  • 0.5 cup raw cashews or white beans
  • 4 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 pinch smoked paprika
  • 1 pinch cayenne pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In medium pot, bring about 3 cups of water to a boil. Place peeled and diced potatoes, diced carrots, and diced onion in pot and allow to cook until veggies are tender, approximately 15 minutes. Cooking time will vary based on how small the veggies are diced.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: When veggies are tender, drain and place them in blender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Reserve 1 cup of the broth from the veggies, and add to blender. Add the raw cashews or white beans, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, salt, garlic powder, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, and blend until smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Now, it’s ready to use as a Loaded Potato Skins topping, nacho cheese dip, mac-n-cheese, topping for steamed broccoli, or anything else you need a creamy, cheesy sauce in. It makes approximately 1 quart and can be stored in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/appetizer/loaded-vegan-potato-skins/

docs.title: Crème Anglaise
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 4 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 200 ml whole milk
  • 100 ml heavy cream
  • 0.25 tsp vanilla paste
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 40 g granulated sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small pan
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 heavy-based pan
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 clingfilm
  • 1 sieve

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Pour the whole milk and heavy cream into a small pan over a low heat. Add the vanilla paste and bring slowly to a simmer.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, whisk the egg yolks and granulated sugar together until pale to blanch it and get some type of a paste. Pour some the warm milk through a sieve into the mixture, whisking gently and continuously. Pour the rest of the milk into the mixture and whisk. Sieve into a clean, heavy-based pan and cook over a very low heat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Simmer the mixture gently for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring continuously, until smooth and thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. When cooked, the temperature should get to 80°C (176°F). Or once the foam starts to disappear from the top of the mixture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove from the heat, put through a sieve and then into a clean bowl and cover the surface with clingfilm to prevent a skin forming, then leave to cool.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://thegreatbritishbakeoff.co.uk/recipes/all/prue-leith-snow-eggs/
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q8uS3VI86-w

docs.title: Dijon Mustard
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp brown mustard seeds
  • 4 Tbsp yellow mustard seeds
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp white pepper
  • 1 pinch all spice
  • 1 Tbsp shallot or white or yellow onion
  • 0.33 cup white wine vinegar
  • 0.25 cup dry white wine

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 blender or food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add all dry ingredients together and mix: brown mustard seeds, yellow mustard seeds, salt, white pepper, all spice. Add shallot or white or yellow onion and mix. Add white wine vinegar and mix. Add dry white wine and mix. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 8 hours.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add mix to blender or food processor. Blend until thickness and chunkiness desired.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Store in a small mason jar in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks to 2 months. See notes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: You can omit the wine for water to remove any alcohol content for children or pregnancy.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: This recipe makes spicy Dijon mustard. To adjust the heat, reduce the amount of brown mustard seeds.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a blender or food processor, process steamed or boiled shelled edamame, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic cloves, cumin, water, finely chopped fresh cilantro, salt, and pepper to taste until smooth. Add additional water if needed for a smooth consistency.

docs.title: Enchilada Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 tsp chili powder
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.25 tsp oregano
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 pinch cinnamon (optional)
  • 2 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 2 cup vegetable broth
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp apple cider or distilled white vinegar
  • some black pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 medium-sized pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: This sauce comes together quickly once you get started, so measure the dry ingredients (the all-purpose flour, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, salt and cinnamon (optional)) into a small bowl and place it near the stove. Place the tomato paste and vegetable broth near the stove as well.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium-sized pot over medium heat, warm the olive oil until it’s hot enough that a light sprinkle of the flour/spice mixture sizzles on contact. This might take a couple of minutes, so be patient and don’t step away from the stove!

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Once it’s ready, pour in the flour and spice mixture. While whisking constantly, cook until fragrant and slightly deepened in color, about 1 minute. Whisk the tomato paste into the mixture, then slowly pour in the broth while whisking constantly to remove any lumps.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Raise heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook, whisking often, for about 5 to 7 minutes, until the sauce has thickened a bit and a spoon encounters some resistance as you stir it. (The sauce will thicken some more as it cools.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove from heat, then whisk in the apple cider or distilled white vinegar and season to taste with a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper. Add more salt, if necessary (I usually add another pinch or two).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cookieandkate.com/enchilada-sauce-recipe/

docs.title: French Dressing
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 16 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup sugar
  • 0.67 cup ketchup
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • 0.5 cup white vinegar
  • 0.5 tsp celery seed
  • 0.5 tsp chili powder
  • 0.5 tsp dried mustard
  • 0.5 tsp onion powder
  • 0.13 tsp paprika
  • 2 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor or blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a food processor or blender, add sugar, ketchup, olive oil, white vinegar, celery seed, chili powder, dried mustard, onion powder, paprika, and salt to taste (I like 2 teaspoons). Process until smooth and store covered in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.

docs.title: Source

docs.title: Garlic Aioli
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 large eggs
  • 1 large clove garlic
  • 1 lemon
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup grapeseed oil
  • 0.25 cup olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 microplane or very fine grater
  • 1 food processor or blender
  • 1 measuring cup

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place the eggs in a bowl and cover with warm water to bring to room temperature.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Paste the garlic using a microplane or very fine grater. You can also use a garlic press, or finely mince the garlic then smash it with the side of your knife until it turns to a paste.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Juice 1/2 of the lemon. Measure 1 teaspoon of fresh juice and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Separate the yolk from one egg and discard the white.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the egg yolk, the white and yolk of another egg, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, the garlic paste, and salt to a food processor or blender.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pulse the food processor until the ingredients are evenly blended and frothy.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add the grapeseed oil and olive oil to a measuring cup. Turn the food processor on and add the oil very slowly (drop by drop, not a stream).

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Once the mixture starts to thicken and you can see it emulsifying (it's a consistent mixture and you can't see the oil), then start pouring faster, in a thin stream.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Once all the oil is added, stop the food processor. Check the mixture — the consistency should be similar to mayonnaise. Taste and add more salt or lemon juice, if desired.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Let the aioli sit for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Transfer the aioli to a serving dish and top with fresh cracked black pepper.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/860102/homemade-garlic-aioli-recipe/

docs.title: Green Goddess Dressing

docs.title: Step 1

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine the mayonnaise, Greek yogurt, fresh basil, basil pesto, white wine vinegar, agave syrup, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl and mix with a wire whisk until thoroughly combined.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Transfer to a dressing container, cover, and refrigerate.

docs.title: Homemade Ranch Dip

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine 3/4 cup mayonnaise, 3/4 cup sour cream, 1/4 – 3/4 tsp dried dill weed, 1/2 tsp dried parsley, 1/2 tsp dried chives, 1/2 tsp garlic powder, 1/4 tsp onion powder, 1/8 tsp salt, 1/8 tsp ground black pepper, 1-3 tsps lemon juice or white vinegar in a small bowl. Whisk to combine. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

docs.text: This dip will keep nicely in the refrigerator for up to a week. Enjoy!

docs.title: Hot Fudge Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 100 g granulated sugar
  • 21 g cocoa powder
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 240 g heavy cream
  • 2 Tbsp light corn syrup
  • 85 g bittersweet chocolate
  • 2 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 2 Tbsp water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small, heavy-bottomed saucepan
  • 1 heatproof flexible spatula
  • 1 heatproof medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a small, heavy-bottomed saucepan, whisk together the granulated sugar, cocoa powder, and salt to break up any lumps.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the room temperature heavy cream and light corn syrup and whisk until the mixture is smooth and well combine, making sure no unincorporated sugar is trapped around the sides.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the chopped bittersweet chocolate and bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high, stirring with a heatproof flexible spatula to dissolve the sugar and melt the chocolate.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When the mixture comes to a boil, reduce the heat to maintain a brisk simmer and continue to cook, stirring often and making sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the saucepan to prevent scorching, until the mixture is very thick and you see a layer of yellow fat pooling around the sides of the saucepan, 40 to 50 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove the saucepan from the heat and poor the mixtures into a heatproof medium bowl (scrape down the sides of the saucepan, but not the bottom where some of the mixture may have scorched).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the unsalted butter, vanilla, and 2 Tbsp water and let sit for 5 minutes, then whisk the mixture, outward, until it comes back together and forms a smooth and glossy sauce.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: If serving immediately, let the sauce sit at room temperature, whisking occasionally, until it's warm and the consistency is thick bu still pourable, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: If preparing ahead of time, pour the sauce into a 1 pint jar, cover, and chill.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=epGtaTsYxYY

docs.title: Hummus-Orange Juice Dressing

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix hummus, orange juice, mustard of choice, balsamic vinegar, and pealed and chopped fresh ginger in a small bowl and whisk until smooth.

docs.title: Hummus
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 6 Tbsp tahini
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 14-oz can chickpeas
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp cumin
  • 1 pinch cayenne
  • 1 Tbsp cilantro
  • 1 Tbsp parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 2 small bowl or measuring cup
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 plastic wrap

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine lemon juice and water in a small bowl or measuring cup.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk together tahini and 2 tablespoons olive oil in second small bowl or measuring cup.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Set aside 2 tablespoons chickpeas for garnish.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Process remaining chickpeas, garlic, salt, cumin, and cayenne in food processor until almost fully ground, about 15 seconds.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: With machine running, add lemon juice-water mixture in steady stream through feed tube.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Scrape down bowl and continue to process for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: With machine running, add oil-tahini mixture in steady stream through feed tube and continue to process until hummus is smooth and creamy (about 15 seconds, scraping down bowl as needed).

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Transfer hummus to serving bowl and sprinkle with reserved chickpeas and cilantro or parsley leaves over surface.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Cover with plastic wrap and let stand until flavors meld, at least 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Drizzle with olive oil and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.food.com/amp/recipe/cooks-illustrated-restaurant-style-hummus-380146

docs.title: Ina Garten's Perfect Vinaigrette

docs.title: Step 1

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While whisking, slowly add the olive oil until the vinaigrette is emulsified. Toss the greens with enough dressing to moisten and serve immediately.

docs.title: Italian Vinaigrette
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2/3 cup 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 tsp nutritional yeast
  • 1.5 tsp dried basil
  • 0.5 tsp dried oregano
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.25 tsp celery seed
  • 1 pinch crushed red pepper (optional)
  • 0.125 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 cup red wine vinegar
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 2 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1.5 tsp tahini
  • 1 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine nutritional yeast, dried basil, dried oregano, garlic powder, celery seed, crushed red pepper (optional), pepper, red wine vinegar, water, maple syrup, lemon juice, tahini, Dijon mustard, and salt in a blender and purée until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Taste and add extra pepper if desired.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Serve immediately or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

docs.title: Source

docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp balsamic vinegar
  • 2 Tbsp mustard of choice
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 whisk

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix balsamic vinegar, mustard of choice, and maple syrup in a small bowl and whisk until smooth.

docs.title: Lebanese Garlic Sauce (Toum)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 32 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup garlic
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 3 cups neutral oil
  • 0.5 lemon juice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Slice the garlic cloves in half lengthwise and remove any green sprouts.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer the sliced garlic cloves into a food processor and add the kosher salt to the garlic cloves. Process for 1 minute until the garlic becomes finely minced. Make sure to scrape down the sides of the food processor afterwards.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: While the food processor is running, slowly pour one to two tablespoons of neutral oil, then stop and scrape down the bowl. Continue adding another tablespoon or two until the garlic starts looking creamy.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once the garlic looks emulsified by the few tablespoons of oil, increase the speed of pouring the oil and alternate with the 1/2 cup of lemon juice until all the oil and lemon juice is incorporated. This will take about 15 minutes to complete.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer the sauce into a glass container and cover with a paper towel in the fridge overnight. Makes about 4 cups.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: The next day, replace the paper towel with an airtight lid and keep in the fridge for up to 3 months.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://feelgoodfoodie.net/recipe/lebanese-garlic-sauce/

docs.title: Magnolia Ranchero Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2.5 cups tomatoes
  • 1 small onion
  • 0.5 jalapeño
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 0.5 tsp cumin

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large saucepan
  • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon of the unsalted butter over medium heat until sizzling. Add the tomatoes, onion, jalapeño, garlic, and 1 teaspoon of the salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are very tender, 20 to 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add 1/4 cup to 1 cup water, depending on the type of consistency, and the cumin. Using an immersion blender, process until the sauce has a consistency of a chunky tomato sauce, 20 to 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Set the ranchero sauce aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: If making ahead, the ranchero sauce will keep for 3 to 5 days in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://magnolia.com/blog/article/428153/huevos-rancheros-recipe/

docs.title: Marinara Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2.25 cups 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 28-oz can whole tomatoes with their juice
  • 0.33 cup olive oil
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 6 sprigs basil
  • 6 sprigs parsley
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large saucepan
  • 1 food mill

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine in a large saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat whole tomatoes with their juice olive oil, garlic, basil, and parsley.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Simmer, uncovered, crushing the tomatoes with the side of a spoon to break them up, until the sauce is thickened, about 10 minutes. Pass through a food mill, and season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Mayonnaise
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 24 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 large egg
  • 4 tsp white wine vinegar
  • 0.5 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp sugar
  • 1.5 cups vegetable oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 airtight container

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

See Tofu Mayonnaise for a vegan alternative

Note

Do not substitute olive oil for the vegetable oil; the mayonnaise will turn out bitter.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Process egg, white wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt, and sugar in food processor until combined, about 5 seconds. With processor running, slowly drizzle in vegetable oil until emulsified and mixture is thick, about 2 minutes. Scrape down sides of bowl with rubber spatula and continue to process 5 seconds longer. Transfer to airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use. (Mayonnaise can be refrigerated for up to 1 week.)

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.cookscountry.com/recipes/11467-easy-homemade-mayonnaise

docs.title: Mixed Berry Coulis
docs.text: Total Time 24.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups frozen mixed berries
  • 0.25 cups granulated sugar (optional)
  • 0.25 cup lemon juice (optional)
  • 2 Tbsp Chambord Liqueur or Grand Marnier (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender
  • 1 fine sieve or chinois
  • 1 glass bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Defrost frozen mixed berries in a strainer for 24 hours so that the excess water drains into a bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place berries, granulated sugar (optional) and lemon juice (optional) in a blender and purée until very smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix in Chambord Liqueur or Grand Marnier (optional), taste and adjust the sugar to your liking.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Strain through a fine sieve or chinois into a glass bowl, pressing on solids to extract all the juice.

Note

If it is too sour, add sugar. If it is too sweet add lemon juice. It all depends on the fruits you are using!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/mixed-berry-coulis/

docs.title: Mushroom Gravy
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 cups 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 large shallots
  • 1 lb cremini mushroom
  • some water
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp thyme
  • 1 tsp sage
  • 1 tsp rosemary
  • 0.5 cup dry white wine
  • 3 cups cauliflower florets
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp nutritional yeast

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Sauté the shallots and cremini mushroom over medium heat for 5 to 6 minutes. Add water 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time, as needed, to keep them from sticking to the pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the garlic, thyme, sage, and rosemary, and cook for 1 minute more.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Add the dry white wine and cook until the wine is reduced by half, about 3 minutes.

Tip

If using lemon juice instead of white wine, you do not need to reduce the sauce.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Make a purée from steamed cauliflower florets.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the cauliflower purée, vegetable broth, sea salt, black pepper, and nutritional yeast.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Whisk well and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes until the gravy thickens some.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/sauce/best-ever-mushroom-gravy/

docs.title: Mushroom Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 Tbsp shallots
  • 2 cups mushrooms
  • 2 Tbsp tarragon
  • 2 Tbsp garlic
  • 2 Tbsp Balsamic vinegar
  • 1 cup red wine
  • 1.5 cups vegetable stock
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 3 Tbsp heavy cream
  • 1 Tbsp parsley
  • 2 Tbsp cornstarch (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 sauce pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a sauce pan, heat 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, when hot, add shallots and cook until light golden brown and add the mushrooms and the salt and cook until they have released most of their water (this could take 7 to 10 minutes).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the tarragon, garlic and when fragrant (about 15 to 20 seconds) add the Balsamic vinegar and red wine and let it reduce until about half of it remain. Add vegetable stock, add salt and pepper to taste and cook for 15 to 20 minutes. Add heavy cream and parsley if you like.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Adjust the thickness of the sauce with unsalted butter or cornstarch (optional) when boiling a little bit at a time and at the last minutes add as much butter as you like. Chef adds at least 2 large tablespoons!!!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/sauces/mushroom-sauce/

docs.title: New York-Style Pizza Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 1.05 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 28-oz can tomatoes
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp butter
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 1 pinch pepper flakes
  • 1 large pinch salt
  • 1 medium yellow onion
  • 2 sprigs basil
  • 1 tsp sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food mill
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Process tomatoes and their juice through food mill, pulse in food processor until puréed, or purée with immersion blender. Purée should not be completely smooth, but should have no chunks larger than 1/16th of an inch. Set tomatoes aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine olive oil and butter in medium saucepan and heat over medium-low heat until butter is melted. Add garlic, oregano, pepper flakes, and large pinch salt and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant but not browned, about 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add tomatoes, yellow onion halves, basil sprigs, and sugar.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bring to a simmer, reduce heat to lowest setting (bubbles should barely be breaking the surface), and cook, stirring occasionally, until reduced by half, about 1 hour. Discard onions and basil stems. Season to taste with salt. Allow to cool and store in covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.seriouseats.com/new-york-style-pizza-sauce

docs.title: New York Times' Classic Marinara Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 28-oz can tomatoes
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 7 cloves garlic
  • 1 pinch whole chili or red pepper flakes (optional)
  • 0.25 tsp oregano
  • 1 tsp kosher salt
  • 1 large basil sprig

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 fork
  • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Pour tomatoes into a large bowl and crush with a fork. Pour 1 cup water into can and slosh it around to get tomato juice. Reserve.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large skillet (do not use a deep pot) over medium heat, heat the olive oil. When it is hot, add the peeled and slivered garlic. As soon as the garlic is sizzling (do not let it burn) add the tomatoes, reserved tomato water, whole chili or red pepper flakes (optional) or TJ's Bamba Hot Pepper Sauce, oregano, and kosher salt. Stir.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place the basil sprig (including stem) on the surface like a flower. Let it wilt, then submerge in sauce.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Simmer until sauce has thickened and oil on surface is a deep orange, about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Taste and season as needed. Discard basil and chile, if using.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• The New York Times
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Peanut Dipping Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.75 cups 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 tsp vegetable oil
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp ginger
  • 0.5 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 1 cup water
  • 2 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp lime juice
  • 0.67 cup chunky peanut butter
  • 1 Tbsp light brown sugar
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted roasted peanuts
  • 1 Tbsp mint

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat in a small saucepan over medium heat 2 tsps of vegetable oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add and cook, stirring, until golden brown, about 1 minute garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add and cook, stirring, until thickened, about 4 minutes water, soy sauce, lime juice, chunky peanut butter, light brown sugar, and chopped unsalted roasted peanuts.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove from the heat and stir in finely chopped mint.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve warm or at room temperature. The sauce will keep, covered and refrigerated, for up to 1 week.

docs.title: Persian Yogurt Dip with Shallots (Mast-O Musir)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup dried Persian shallots
  • some cold water
  • 2 cups Greek yogurt
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 2 Tbsp mint (optional)
  • 2 tsp rose petals (optional)
  • some olive oil (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak the dried Persian shallots in cold water for 4 hours to overnight, until soft. Drain, rinse couple times and drain well or pat dry.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut out the stem ends and any other hard parts of the soaked musir. Then finely chop the shallot slices.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine chopped shallots, Greek yogurt, salt, pepper and mix well. Add mint (optional) if desired.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover and let it chill until served. The flavors blend well when it is left to chill for some hours.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Garnish with rose petals (optional), fresh mint leaves and a drizzle of olive oil (optional).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thedeliciouscrescent.com/persian-yogurt-dip-with-shallots/

docs.title: Pumpkin Curry Sauce

  • 1 tsp ginger
  • 2 Tbsp red curry paste

  • 0.5 tsp pepper

docs.title: Step 2

docs.title: Step 3

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the red curry paste, pumpkin puree, coconut milk, pepper, and salt to the pan and stir well. Bring the curry sauce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve and enjoy.

docs.title: Rip's Salad Dressing

  • 1 tsp tamari or soy sauce (optional)
  • 1 tsp nutritional yeast
  • 1 tsp mustard of choice
  • 2 Tbsp balsamic vinegar or any vinegar of choice
  • 1 tsp molasses or honey (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 whisk

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix lemon, lime, or orange juice, tamari or soy sauce (optional), nutritional yeast, mustard of choice, balsamic vinegar or any vinegar of choice, and molasses or honey (optional) in a small bowl and whisk until smooth.

docs.title: Roasted Garlic Hummus
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 14 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 head garlic
  • 2 cups chickpeas
  • 2 Tbsp tahini
  • 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 cup warm water
  • 1 lemon juice
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 tin foil
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Cut off the top of the head of garlic (about 1/4") so that the tops of most of the cloves are exposed slightly. Coat with a little olive oil and wrap securely in tin foil. Roast the garlic in the preheated oven for 1 hours until golden brown and soft. The cloves should pop out of the head when squeezed when cooked. Remove from the oven and allow to cool.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Using your fingers, squeeze the soft, roasted garlic out of each clove into a food processor. Rinse and drain the cooked or canned chickpeas. Add them, tahini, olive oil, warm water, lemon juice, and salt to the food processor and blend until completely smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Scrape the sides of the food processor to make sure it blends evenly. If you find that the hummus is too thick, you can add additional olive oil at this time. Add in very slowly, allowing the mixture to combine fully before adding more liquid.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve at room temperature with pita bread.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • HEAT Culinary

docs.title: Roasted Red Pepper Coulis

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a saucepan, heat the olive oil, when hot add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the garlic, and when fragrant add the roasted red peppers and their juice and cook for 10 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: With an immersion blender, process until very smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Strain through a fine sieve or a chinois and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Roasted Red Pepper Dressing
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 5 minutes

docs.text:
• 2 large roasted red bell peppers
  • 3 Tbsp apple cider vinegar (or red wine vinegar or balsamic)

  • 2 tsp white miso
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 tsp Italian seasoning
  • 1 small shallot (optional)
  • 1 Tbsp tahini (optional)
  • 1 tsp Dijon mustard (optional)
  • some lemon juice (optional)
  • some black pepper (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small blender or food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place roasted red bell peppers, apple cider vinegar (or red wine vinegar or balsamic), water, maple syrup, white miso, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, shallot (optional), tahini (optional), Dijon mustard (optional), lemon juice (optional), black pepper (optional) in a small blender or food processor. (Scrape out any seeds and extra liquid in the bell peppers before adding.)

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Blend for 20 to 30 seconds or until smooth. (I use a NutriBullet.) Taste and adjust flavors if desired.

docs.title: Roasted Red Pepper Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups extra firm silken tofu
  • 1 roasted red bell pepper
  • 2 chipotle peppers
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • 1 lime

docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine extra firm silken tofu, roasted red bell pepper, chipotle peppers, garlic, cumin, and the juice and zest of 1 lime in the bowl of a food processor and puree until smooth and creamy.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Store refrigerated for up to 7 days.

Note

To roast red bell peppers, hold them over an open flame and roast them until black, turning as needed to roast all sides. Place them in a plastic bag and let them cool. When they are cool, peel the skin off. Do not rinse them, or you will lose all of the roasted flavor.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Note: You can use jarred fire-roasted red peppers instead.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Note: For a milder version of this recipe omit or cut in half the chipotle peppers in adobo sauce. You may add a teaspoon of smoked paprika in its place.

docs.title: Salted Caramel Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 cups 7 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 57 g water
  • 200 g granulated sugar
  • 240 g heavy cream
  • 85 g unsalted butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 pastry brush
  • 1 heavy-bottomed medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Fill a glass with water, place a pastry brush inside, and set it next to the stove. You will use this brush to wash down the sides of the saucepan, dissolving any sugar crystals that form during cooking, since any undissolved crystals could cause the entire sugar mixture to crystallize and turn grainy.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pour 1/4 cup water into a heavy-bottomed medium saucepan, then add the granulated sugar (adding the water first encourages the sugar to dissolve). Avoid using a flimsy saucepan, as the caramel will more readily burn around the sides. Stir the mixture gently with a heatproof flexible spatula over medium-high heat just until the sugar dissolves to form a clear syrup and the mixture comes to a boil, about 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: When the syrup boils, stop stirring and instead swirl the saucepan to equalize the temperature and promote even cooking (stirring at this phase encourages crystallization, which you want to avoid). Using the wet pastry brush, occasionally wash down the sides of the saucepan where you see stuck-on sugar crystals.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: As the water boils off and the syrup becomes more viscous, the bubbles will become larger and slower to pop, a sign that caramelization is near. Continue to cook, swirling the saucepan and brushing down the sides as needed, until the syrup has taken on a faint golden color, about 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Turn the heat down to medium and continue to cook, keeping a close watch and swirling the saucepan frequently, until the mixture turns medium golden, then amber (it will also become progressively more fluid and less bubbly). When the mixture reaches a deep amber, is very fluid, and just starting to release wisps of smoke, remove the saucepan from the heat and proceed immediately to the next step, which will halt the cooking (otherwise the hot caramel will continue to cook and quickly burn).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the 1 cup of heavy cream in a slow, steady stream and stir until the sauce is completely smooth (it will sputter, so watch out - because this is a liquid caramel, we're not worried about crystallization at this point, so stirring is okay). Add the chilled and cubed unsalted butter a piece or two at a time, stirring until the pieces are melted and incorporated before adding more. Stir in the vanilla and salt. Let the sauce cook at room temperature, stirring occasionally, until it's warm but not hot. It will thicken as it cools.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • What's For Dessert

docs.title: Simple Berry Compote
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 5 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cups fruit
  • 3 Tbsp orange juice

  • 1 tsp chia seeds (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small saucepan
  • 1 wooden spoon
  • 1 jar or container

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place fruit and orange juice in a small saucepan and bring to medium heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Once bubbling, reduce heat slightly and use a wooden spoon to muddle and mash the fruit.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Continue cooking over medium-low heat for 10 to 12 minutes, occasionally mashing fruit to combine. Turn off heat and add optional add-ins at this point (cinnamon (optional), ginger (optional), granulated sugar (optional), chia seeds (optional)).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove from heat and transfer to a clean jar or container to cool thoroughly. Store in the fridge up to 1 week or freeze in ice cube molds up to 1 month. Reheat to serve with oats, pancakes, waffles, french toast, and more!

docs.text: Combine all mayonnaise, diced dill pickles, lemon juice, dried dill, and salt in a small bowl.

docs.title: Single Jar of Fruit Jam
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 8-oz jar 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cup fruit
  • 0.75 cup sugar
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan
  • 1 wooden spoon
  • 1 8-oz jar

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

This jam calls for just two cups of chopped fruit. This is about one pint of berries, four to six peaches or plums, or eight small apricots.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Wash and cut the fruit. Wash and hull the fruit as needed. Cut large strawberries into quarters and peaches into bite-sized pieces.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine the fruit with sugar and mash. Combine the fruit with the sugar and lemon juice in a medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan. Gently mash with a wooden spoon until the fruit is juicy and most of the sugar is dissolved.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook until jammy. Cook over a medium heat, continuing to mashing down on the fruit with a wooden spoon. Bring to a rolling boil and continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the jam is thick and darkened in color, about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the jam to an 8-oz jar and refrigerate. Carefully spoon into a very clean (8-ounce) jar and let cool to room temperature. Seal the jar and refrigerate.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/how-to-make-a-single-jar-of-fruit-jam-247431

docs.title: Sweet-&-Spicy Corn Salsa
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 cups 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 ears sweet corn kernels
  • 1 red pepper
  • 1 cup vinegar
  • 0.75 cup sugar
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 1.5 tsp mustard seeds
  • 0.25 tsp cumin seeds
  • 1 red onion
  • 1.5 tsp ground red pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 large saucepan

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

This is a copycat of TJ's Corn and Chile Tomato-less Salsa

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Toss the sweet corn kernels and finely chopped red pepper together in a mixing bowl. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large saucepan, combine the vinegar, sugar, water, mustard seeds, and cumin seeds. Pace the pan over medium-high heat until it begins to boil. Reduce the liquid to a simmer. Add the chopped red onion and ground red pepper. Simmer until the onion becomes translucent, about 10 minutes. To the simmering liquid, add the sweet corn and chopped red pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using a slotted spoon, transfer the corn salsa to a non-reactive container, pressing down lightly to pack the corn. Gently pour the remaining cooking liquid from the saucepan over the packed salsa just until it is covered. Refrigerate for a day before serving (to allow the flavors to develop).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve with chips for dipping.

docs.title: Sweet-and-Spicy Ketchup
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 small onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.25 cup brown sugar
  • 0.5 tsp smoked paprika
  • 0.25 tsp allspice
  • 0.25 tsp ground cloves
  • 0.33 cup distilled white vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 2 8-oz cans tomato sauce
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a saucepan, heat the olive oil. Add the onion and garlic and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 7 minutes. Add the brown sugar, smoked paprika, allspice and ground cloves and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sugar melts. Add the distilled white vinegar and tomato paste and cook over moderate heat until thick, about 3 minutes. Stir in the tomato sauce and simmer over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until very thick, 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer the ketchup to a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Source

docs.title: Tahini
docs.text: Total Time 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup sesame seeds
  • 3 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 baking sheet or large plate
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add sesame seeds to a wide, dry saucepan over medium-low heat and toast, stirring constantly until the seeds become fragrant and very lightly colored (not brown), 3 to 5 minutes. Careful here, sesame seeds can burn quickly.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer toasted seeds to a baking sheet or large plate and cool completely.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add sesame seeds to the bowl of a food processor then process until a crumbly paste, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add 3 tablespoons of the vegetable oil then process for 2 to 3 minutes more, stopping to scrape the bottom and sides of the food processor a couple of times. Check the tahini’s consistency. It should be smooth, not gritty, and should be pourable. You may need to process for another minute or add the additional tablespoon of oil.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Taste the tahini for seasoning then add salt to taste. Process 5 to 10 seconds to mix it in.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Store tahini covered in the refrigerator for one month. You may notice it separates over time, like a natural peanut butter would. If this happens, give the tahini a good stir before using.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.inspiredtaste.net/26901/easy-tahini-recipe/

docs.title: Tofu Mayonnaise
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 cup 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 12.3-oz pkg firm silken tofu
  • 1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 2 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 0.75 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.75 tsp onion powder
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp coconut or date sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine firm silken tofu, apple cider vinegar, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and coconut or date sugar in a blender and process until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
For best results, chill for at least an hour before using.

Tip

After 24 hours, the flavors have time to set in and this mayo tastes just like traditional mayo.

Tip

If available, use a high-speed blender.

Tip

I recommend the Mori-Nu brand of tofu vs refrigerated silken tofu varieties for a smoother and thicker consistency. Choose the organic variety that contains soybeans instead of the isolated soy protein.

Tip

You may use rice or white balsamic vinegar in place of the apple cider vinegar.

docs.title: Source
