docs.title: Tomato Bruschetta
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 2.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb plum tomatoes
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 5 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 8 large basil leaves
  • some pepper
  • 4 slices toasted bread

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 colander
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 small saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Core and chop the plum tomatoes, then transfer colander over a bowl or in the sink. Add the salt and gently stir. Let drain for up to 2 hours.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, make the garlic oil: In a small saucepan, warm the olive oil and garlic, minced over low heat until the garlic is softened and fragrant, about 5 minutes, making sure the garlic doesn't brown. Set aside to cool.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Roll the basil leaves up and thinly slice crosswise.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When the oil is cool and the tomatoes are well drained, combine the tomatoes, garlic oil and basil in a medium bowl. Season with additional salt and pepper, to taste. Spoon over toasted bread.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The New York Times

docs.title: Tomato Ragu
docs.text: Total Time 56 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1.5 cup (213 g) onion
  • 0.5 cup (71 g) celery
  • 0.5 cup (71 g) carrots
  • 1.5 lbs (680 g) vegetarian sausage
  • 0.5 lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 Tbsp fresh thyme
  • 2 Tbsp garlic
  • 2 28-oz cans tomatoes
  • 1.5 cups (348 g) tomato puree
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.25 cup parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 Dutch oven
  • 1 frying pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a Dutch oven, heat a little extra virgin olive oil and sauté the onion until lightly caramelized, about 4 minutes. Add the celery and carrots and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a frying pan, add a couple spoons of olive oil and when hot add the vegetarian sausage and brown until caramelized. Constantly breaking the sausage up while it cooks so you have small uniform crumbles. When deep golden brown, remove the meat from the pan and drain any extra fat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Back in the Dutch oven, add the mushrooms and sweat them for 5 minutes or however long it takes to eliminate the water. Add the fresh thyme and garlic when fragrant, chopped tomatoes and tomato puree. Add the cooked vegetarian meat, adjust with salt and pepper and let simmer slowly for 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the parsley at the end.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/tomato-meat-sauce/

docs.title: Tomato Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 quart 2.53 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 lbs plum tomato
  • 2 28-oz cans whole peeled plum tomatoes (alternative)
  • 6 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 medium yellow onions
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1.25 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp granulated sugar
  • 2 Tbsp fresh basil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 pot
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 sharp knife
  • 1 Dutch oven or saucepan
  • 1 wooden spoon or potato masher

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: If using fresh tomatoes: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil. Fill a large bowl halfway-full with ice cubes and cold water. Using a sharp knife, cut a 1/4 inch deep X on one end of each plum tomato. Place the scored tomatoes into the boiling water and cook until you see the skin starting to wrinkle and split, 1 to 2 minutes (be careful not to cook too long, or the tomatoes will become soft and difficult to handle). Using a slotted spoon, lift the tomatoes out of the pot and plunge them into the ice cold water bath. Let sit for a few minutes to cool, then transfer the tomatoes to a cutting board and, using your hands, peel off their skins.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut the tomatoes into 1/2 inch chunks (discard the cores at this point) and transfer them, along with all of their juices, into a Dutch oven or saucepan. Alternatively, you may use canned whole peeled plum tomatoes (alternative).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To the chopped tomatoes, add the unsalted butter, olive oil, yellow onions, garlic, salt, and granulated sugar. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for 1.5 to 2.5 hours, stirring occasionally and mashing the tomatoes, until the sauce is no longer watery.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove and discard the onions.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Using a wooden spoon or potato masher, mash any large chunks of tomatoes and garlic to make a slightly chunky and thick sauce.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Before serving, stir in the chopped fresh basil.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tomato-sauce-basil.html

docs.title: Tzatziki Dip
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cucumbers
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.5 tsp fresh dill
  • 0.5 tsp mint
  • 1 lemon
  • 1 tsp olive oil
  • 8 oz Greek yogurt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 paper towel
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Shred the cucumbers and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain and squeeze the shredded cucumbers with a paper towel to remove any additional moisture.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mince the garlic clove, chop the fresh dill and mint, and zest and juice the lemon.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Combine the cucumbers, olive oil, and Greek yogurt in a bowl, and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Tzatziki Sauce
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 English cucumber
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 cups full fat Greek yogurt
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 0.5 tsp Aleppo chiles
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 2 Tbsps dill
  • 0.5 lemon juiced
  • some white vinegar (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cheese grater
  • 1 wire sieve
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Use the coarse side of a cheese grater to shred the peeled English cucumber. Place grated cucumber in a bowl and season with 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Let it sit for 20 to 30 minutes. (This draws out the excess moisture.) Strain cucumber through a wire sieve, cheese cloth, or paper towel and place in a mixing bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add garlic, full fat Greek yogurt, olive oil, Aleppo chiles, pepper, dill, lemon juiced and salt to taste and white vinegar (optional) to taste and mix well.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Taste and adjust any extra salt, vinegar, or lemon juice to your liking.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thespicehouse.com/blogs/recipes/tzatziki-sauce

docs.title: Vegan Caesar Dressing
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup plain hummus
  • 1 tsp spicy mustard
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 1 lemon juice
  • 2 tsp minced capers + brining juice
  • 5 cloves minced garlic
  • 2 Tbsp Olive oil (optional)
  • some hot water
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 tsp Maple syrup (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To a small mixing bowl, add plain hummus, spicy mustard, lemon zest, lemon juice, minced capers + brining juice, and minced garlic, and whisk thoroughly to combine. Olive oil (optional) is optional, but will add a bit more creaminess.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add a little hot water to thin until pourable and whisk until creamy and smooth. Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more salt and pepper, lemon juice, or minced garlic if desired! Maple syrup (optional) will help offset how salty and briney this dressing is, if you find you need it.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Use immediately, or store in the refrigerator up to 5-7 days.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: This dressing is delicious on kale, romaine, and arugula. It would also be great on roasted vegetables, especially Brussels sprouts and potatoes. Top with a little vegan Parmesan cheese for the ultimate Caesar salad experience.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/5-minute-vegan-caesar-dressing/

docs.title: Vegan Chipotle Ranch Dressing
docs.text: Total Time 4.53 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup cashews
  • 0.67 cup unsweetened almond milk
  • 2 tsp lemon juice
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 chipotle pepper in adobo sauce
  • 0.25 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tsp maple syrup (optional)
  • 0.25 tsp ground chipotle chile
  • 2 Tbsp dill

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak cashews in very hot water for 30 minutes. While cashews are soaking, measure out unsweetened almond milk and add lemon juice and set aside to curdle (this makes your vegan “buttermilk”).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain and rinse cashews, then transfer to a small blender (a blender is preferred over a food processor for achieving a smooth texture) and add almond "buttermilk", garlic, salt, chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, onion powder, apple cider vinegar, maple syrup (optional), ground chipotle chile, and dill. Blend on high for 1 to 2 minutes or until very creamy and smooth, stopping to scrape down sides as needed.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more salt to taste, ground chipotle or adobo sauce for heat, maple syrup for sweetness, lemon juice or vinegar for acidity, garlic for garlic flavor, or herbs for a more herbal flavor.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Use immediately at room temperature or refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours to chill. It will thicken in the refrigerator, so you can add more almond milk or water later on to thin if needed.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/vegan-chipotle-ranch-dressing/

docs.title: Vegan Ranch Dressing
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lb tofu
  • 1.5 Tbsp parsley
  • 0.75 onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 3 Tbsp white vinegar
  • 2 Tbsp agave syrup
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 tsp nutritional yeast
  • 1 tsp dry mustard
  • 0.25 tsp paprika
  • 0.5 tsp celery seeds
  • 1 tsp dill
  • 1 Tbsp chives
  • 0.75 cup water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Blend tofu, parsley, chopped, onion, finely chopped, garlic, white vinegar, agave syrup, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, dry mustard, paprika, celery seeds, dill, chives, and water in a food processor until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Serve over your favorite salad, or use as a dip for vegetables.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/salad-dressing/ranch-dressing/

docs.title: Vegan Sour Cream
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 4.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup raw cashews
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 1 cup silken tofu
  • 3 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 tsp agave nectar
  • 1 tsp white miso paste
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor or blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak the raw cashews in water for a 2 to 3 hours to reduce blending time and to allow the cashews to blend into a smooth and creamy texture.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine cashews, water, silken tofu, lemon juice, agave nectar, white miso paste, and salt in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth and creamy.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Allow the mixture to chill for 1 hour to become thick.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/sauce/vegan-sour-cream/

docs.title: Vegetarian Sausage Gravy
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 5 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb vegetarian sausage
  • 1 lb soy chorizo (alternative)
  • 1 heavy blond roux
  • 1 cup whole milk
  • 1 pinch nutmeg
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large skillet
  • 1 platter

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large skillet, cook the vegetarian sausage or soy chorizo (alternative) over medium heat until cooked through and nicely browned, about 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer the sausage to a platter and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Make a heavy blond roux in the same pan as the sausage to incorporate the grease and browned bits.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk in the whole milk, making sure to get any lumps out until the mixture is smooth. Add two pinches of nutmeg. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir the sausage into the gravy. Season generously with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Store leftovers in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. Reheat gently over low heat.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Can be served with buttermilk biscuits.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://magnolia.com/blog/recipe/f65330af-c67f-436d-b96c-7db357d56c4b/classic-sausage-gravy/

docs.title: Vinaigrette
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 cup 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 clove garlic
  • 3 pinches salt
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 cup red wine vinegar or fresh lemon juice
  • 1 tsp shallot
  • 0.5 tsp prepared mustard
  • 0.75 cup olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: If garlic flavor is desired, mash to a paste garlic and 2 to 3 pinches of salt.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove to a small bowl. Add salt, pepper, red wine vinegar or fresh lemon juice, minced shallot, and 1/4 to 1/2 tsp prepared mustard.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk until blended. Add gradually, whisking constantly after each addition olive oil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: If made in advance, cover and refrigerate. Shake well before using.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Whipped Almond Ricotta
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups slivered blanched almonds
  • 3 tsp nutritional yeast
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 dash garlic powder
  • 3 Tbsp basil, oregano, or parsley (optional)
  • 1 cup water
  • 0.75 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add slivered blanched almonds, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, garlic powder, and basil, oregano, or parsley (optional) (starting with the lesser amount of water (3/4 cup/180 ml and salt (1/2 tsp) as original recipe is written) to a high-speed blender and blend until smooth and creamy, scraping down sides as needed, about 2 minutes. You are looking for a well-puréed mixture with only very small bits of almonds intact. Add a bit more water a little at a time if the mixture is having a hard time blending until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Taste and adjust flavor as needed, adding more salt for overall flavor, nutritional yeast for cheesiness, and lemon juice for acidity. For even more flavor, you can add in some fresh basil, oregano, or parsley (optional).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: At this point, the “cheese” is ready to enjoy, especially in dishes like Lasagna, Pizza, or Stuffed Shells. However, it can also be wrapped in cheesecloth, formed into a ball, and placed into a fine mesh strainer set over a mixing bowl up to 3 days. This will allow the “cheese” to firm up a bit. However, this is optional. You can also transfer straight from blender to a storage container and refrigerate.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Store leftovers covered in the refrigerator up to 5-7 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/whipped-almond-ricotta-5-ingredients/

docs.title: White Mac & Cheese Sauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb Yukon gold potatoes
  • 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
  • 6 Tbsps nutritional yeast
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 pinch cayenne

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 steamer basket
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Boil Yukon gold potatoes in a steamer basket until tender, 10 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer to a food processor with unsweetened almond milk, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, garlic, cayenne.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Puree until smooth.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Forks Over Knives

docs.title: Béchamel
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 cup 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 medium blond roux
  • 1 cup milk
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 pinch nutmeg
  • 1 thick onion slice (optional)
  • 2 whole cloves (optional)
  • 1 bay leaf (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make a blond roux.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove the medium saucepan from the heat and slowly whisk in 1 cup of cold milk 1/3 at a time.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Return the pan to heat and bring to a simmer, whisking constantly to prevent clumps. Continue to cook, whisking until sauce is smooth and hot and has thickened, 1 to 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Season to taste with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: For better consistency, scald the milk before adding it to the roux. For improved flavor, add to the milk before scalding thick onion slice (optional), 2 whole cloves (optional), and 1 bay leaf (optional) to make an onion pique then cover and let stand for 15 minutes; remove the cloves and bay leaf, if used, and whisk into the roux.

docs.title: Recipe Variations
docs.text: Sauce Modification Mornay Add 1/2 cup grated cheese to 1 cup of hot sauce; stir over low heat until cheese is melted. Season with a little mustard or Worcestershire sauce to taste. Velouté Substitute chicken, beef, fish, or vegetable broth for the milk. Herb Add 1 teaspoon of freshly chopped herbs or 1/2 teaspoon dried herbs to 1 cup of hot sauce. Cook for a minute or two longer to get more flavor from the herbs. Cream Add 2 or 3 tablespoons of heavy cream to the finished sauce. For an onion flavor, add an onion slice to the milk when heating; remove onion slice before adding milk to flour and butter mixture. Mustard Combine 1 teaspoon dry mustard to flour used in sauce. This sauce is especially good with fish and chicken.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Espagnole
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 5 cups 3 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 stick (1/2 cup) butter
  • 1 cup Mirepoix
  • 0.5 cup onions (alternative)
  • 0.25 cup carrots (alternative)
  • 0.25 cup celery (alternative)
  • 0.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 10 whole black peppercorns
  • 2 cups tomatoes
  • 0.5 cup parsley
  • 8 cups Brown Beef Stock
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large heavy saucepan or Dutch oven
  • 1 fine-mesh sieve
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Melt in a large heavy saucepan or Dutch oven butter.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add Mirepoix or finely chopped onions, carrots, and celery. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables begin to color.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add 1/2 cup all-purpose flour. Cook, stirring until the flour is thoroughly browned.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in whole black peppercorns, drained, peeled and finely chopped canned tomatoes or 2 cups tomato purée and coarsely chopped parsley.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add Brown Beef Stock.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until reduced by half, 2 to 2.5 hours. Stir occasionally and skim off the fat as it rises to the top. The sauce should be the consistency of heavy cream, no thicker.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl. Stir occasionally as the sauce cools to prevent the formation of a skin. If necessary, then the additional stock or water. If using this sauce as is, season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Hollandaise
docs.text: Total Time 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup butter
  • 3 large egg yolks
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 1 dash cayenne pepper
  • some parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Gather the ingredients.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt the butter in a saucepan until it is hot and foaming, but do not let it brown. Keep it warm.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place a medium saucepan or bottom of a double boiler pan with about an inch of hot water over low heat and bring it to a simmer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a stainless steel bowl or top pan of a double boiler, vigorously whisk the egg yolks with the lemon juice until the mixture is thickened.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place the bowl or pan over the simmering water and continue whisking.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Drizzle the melted butter into the egg yolk mixture in a slow, steady stream while whisking. Continue whisking until the sauce has thickened. Take care not to let the bowl or top pan sit in the simmering water or you'll end up with scrambled eggs. And don't let the sauce get too hot or it could break. If it does start to look curdled, try whisking in a small amount of boiling water a half-teaspoon at a time.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove the sauce from the heat and whisk in the salt and cayenne pepper or hot pepper sauce.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: The sauce is best served immediately, but if it must be held, place the bowl in a pan with hot water or put it in the top of a double boiler over hot water. Keep it on very low heat. Too long or too hot and the sauce will break.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: If the sauce becomes too thick on standing, whisk in a small amount of hot water to thin it.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Top with finely chopped parsley and enjoy.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thespruceeats.com/classic-hollandaise-sauce-4122491

docs.title: Tomate
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 2.25 hours minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 small onion
  • 1 small carrot
  • 1 celery rib with leaves
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp basil
  • 1 Tbsp rosemary
  • 1 Tbsp sage
  • 1 Tbsp thyme
  • 1 28-oz can whole tomatoes with juice
  • 2 tsp tomato paste
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large skillet
  • 1 spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat in a large skillet over medium heat olive oil and add finely chopped onion, carrot, celery rib with leaves, and finely chopped parsley.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cover, reduce the heat to low, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are very soft, 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add and cook, stirring, for about 30 seconds minced garlic, chopped basil, rosemary, sage, or thyme.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in whole tomatoes with juice, tomato paste, salt, and pepper.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Simmer, uncovered, crushing the canned tomatoes with the side of a spoon to break them up, until the sauce is thickened, 15 to 20 minutes. Pass through a food mill if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Velouté
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.75 cup 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 heavy blond roux
  • 2.5 cup vegetable broth
  • 0.25 cup mushrooms
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp unsalted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 spoon
  • 1 fine-mesh sieve

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make a heavy blond roux.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove the medium saucepan from the heat and slowly whisk in 2.5 cup of vegetable broth along with minced mushrooms.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Return the saucepan to the heat and bring the sauce slowly to a simmer, whisking to prevent lumps. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring often and skimming any skin that forms on the surface, until thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 20 minutes. Do not boil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Strain through a fine-mesh sieve, if desired.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Season to taste with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Just before serving, whisk in softened unsalted butter or any flavored butter.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Balsamic Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 cups 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup leeks
  • 1 cup chives
  • 0.75 cup Manchego cheese
  • 0.67 cup toasted pine nuts
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp white balsamic vinegar
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine 1 cup sliced leeks; 1 cup packed fresh chives; 3/4 cup shredded Manchego cheese; 2/3 cup toasted pine nuts; 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil; 2 Tbsp white balsamic vinegar; 1 tsp lemon zest; and 1/2 tsp kosher salt in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Process until nearly smooth. Add up to 2 Tbsp additional olive oil to reach desired consistency.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Basic Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.5 cups 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups basil
  • 0.75 cups Parmesan
  • 0.5 cups toasted pine nuts
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp crushed red pepper (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine packed fresh basil, shredded Parmesan, toasted pine nuts, olive oil, 2 to 3 cloves garlic, halved, kosher salt, and crushed red pepper (optional) in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Process until nearly smooth, stopping to scrape down sides of bowl. Add up to 2 Tbsp additional olive oil to reach desired consistency.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Transfer to airtight container. Refrigerate up to 3 days. Or place 1/4 cup portions in resealable plastic bags or in ice cube trays and freeze up to 3 months.

Tip

To keep your pesto bright and green in the refrigerator, add a thin layer of olive oil to the top.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Broccoli Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 cups 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups small broccoli florets
  • 1 cup basil
  • 1 cup Parmesan
  • 0.67 cup toasted pine nuts
  • 0.67 cup olive oil
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine 2 cups small broccoli florets; 1 cup packed fresh basil; 1 cup shredded Parmesan cheese; 2/3 cup toasted pine nuts; 2/3 cup extra virgin olive oil; 3 cloves garlic, halved; 1 tsp kosher salt in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Process until nearly smooth. Add up to 2 Tbsp additional olive oil to reach desired consistency.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Cilantro Almond Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup almonds
  • 1 cup cilantro
  • 3 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 Tbsp garlic
  • 0.5 small jalapeño
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.33 cup olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large jar or covered bowl
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large jar or covered bowl, add the almonds and enough water to cover. Soak overnight, drain, and rinse.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a food processor, add the almonds, cilantro, lemon juice, garlic, jalapeño, and salt. Pulse until well blended but not quite pureed. With the processor running, add the olive oil and process until combined.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Cook's Country Perfect Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup pine nuts
  • 0.75 cup olive oil, divided
  • 4 oz basil stems
  • 2.25 tsp salt, divided
  • 1.25 oz Parmesan
  • 2 cloves garlic

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 8-inch skillet
  • 1 dish towel
  • 1 salad spinner
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine pine nuts and 1 tablespoon olive oil in 8-inch skillet. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, until pine nuts are light golden, 3 to 6 minutes. Spread pine nuts out on plate and let cool for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, bring 2 quarts water to boil in medium saucepan. Remove and discard basil stems from leaves (you should have 4 cups leaves [3 ounces by weight]). Add basil leaves and 1.5 teaspoons salt to boiling water and cook until basil is wilted and bright green, 5 to 10 seconds. Using spider skimmer or slotted spoon, transfer basil directly to salad spinner and spin to remove excess water. Spread basil on clean dish towel to dry. (If you don't have a salad spinner, drain basil on clean dish towel and thoroughly pat dry with paper towels.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Process Parmesan in food processor until finely ground, about 30 seconds; transfer to medium bowl. Process garlic, pine nuts, basil, 3/4 tsp salt, and remaining oil (11 Tbsp) in now-empty processor until smooth, about 1 minute, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. Transfer pesto to bowl with Parmesan and stir to combine. Serve.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: TO MAKE AHEAD: Place pesto in sealable 1-pint container and cover with additional 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil. Refrigerate for up to 2 days or freeze for up to 1 month.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Jalapeño Lime Pesto
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 3.33 cups
  • 4 cups cilantro
  • 1.33 cup toasted pepitas
  • 1 cup Cotija or feta cheese
  • 1 cup canola oil
  • 2 small jalapeño chiles
  • 4 Tbsp lime juice
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
Serves 1.67 cups
  • 2 cups cilantro
  • 0.67 cup toasted pepitas
  • 0.5 cup Cotija or feta cheese
  • 0.5 cup canola oil
  • 1 small jalapeño chile
  • 2 Tbsp lime juice
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine 2 cups packed fresh cilantro; 2/3 cup toasted pepitas; 1/2 cup crumbled Cotija cheese; 1/2 cup canola oil; 1 small jalapeño chile, seeded if desired; 2 Tbsp lime juice; 1 clove garlic, halved; and 1/4 tsp kosher salt and 1/4 tsp pepper in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Process until nearly smooth. Add up to 2 Tbsp additional canola oil to reach desired consistency.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Joy of Cooking Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 cup 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups basil leaves
  • 0.5 cup Parmesan
  • 0.33 cup pine nuts
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 skillet
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Toast pine nuts in a skillet.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine in a food processor and process to a rough paste basil leaves, grated Parmesan, pine nuts, and garlic.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: With the machine running, slowly add olive oil, or as needed.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: If the pesto seems try (it should be a thick paste), add a little more olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Use immediately, or pour a very thin film of olive oil over the top, cover, and refrigerate for up to 1 week.

docs.title: Source

docs.title: Lemon Arugula Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.5 cups 5 minutes

docs.text:
• 2 cups arugula
  • 0.75 cup Parmesan
  • 0.67 cup hopped toasted walnuts
  • 0.5 cup basil
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine 2 cups packed fresh arugula; 3/4 cup shredded Parmesan cheese; 2/3 cup hopped toasted walnuts; 1/2 cup packed fresh basil; 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil; 3 cloves garlic, halved; 1 tsp lemon zest; 2 Tbsp lemon juice; and 1/4 tsp kosher salt in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Process until nearly smooth. Add up to 2 Tbsp additional olive oil to reach desired consistency.

docs.title: Lemon-Pepper Parsley Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 2.00 days

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup parsley
  • 2 Tbsp walnuts
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 tsp lemon peel
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.125 tsp black pepper
  • 0.125 tsp cayenne pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• food processor
  • bowl
  • plastic wrap

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a small food processor combine parsley and walnuts. Cover and process until finely chopped. Add garlic, lemon peel, lemon juice, salt, black pepper, and, if desired, cayenne pepper. Process until combined. Add oil; cover and process until well combined and nearly smooth, scraping sides of bowl as needed.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Use immediately or transfer pesto to a bowl and cover the surface of the pesto with plastic wrap. Chill up to 2 days.

docs.title: Mascarpone Pesto

docs.text:

  • 1 8-oz container mascarpone cheese
  • 0.67 cup toasted slivered almonds
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • 0.25 cup dill
  • 1 Tbsp white wine vinegar
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine 2 cups packed fresh parsley; one 8-oz container mascarpone cheese; 2/3 cup toasted slivered almonds; 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil; 1/4 cup packed fresh dill; 1 Tbsp white wine vinegar; 2 to 3 cloves garlic, halved; and 1/4 tsp kosher salt in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Process until nearly smooth. Add up to 2 Tbsp additional olive oil to reach desired consistency.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Serve immediately as a dip.

docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.33 cups 20 minutes

docs.title: Tomato Mixture
docs.text:
• 0.33 cup sun-dried tomatoes
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 6 leaves basil

docs.title: Pesto
docs.text:
• 1 clove garlic
  • 1 cup packed basil leaves
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 0.33 cup Parmesan
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small saucepan
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Spread this on bruschetta or pizza; toss it with pasta; or serve it with grilled poultry, seafood, or pasta.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine in a small saucepan with water to cover chopped oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, and basil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bring to a boil, then remove from the heat and let stand for 20 minutes. With the machine running, drop through the feed tube of a food processor garlic, packed basil leaves, olive oil, and grated Parmesan.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Drain the tomato mixture, reserving the liquid. Add the tomato mixture to the processor and finely chop. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Blend in 1/3 cup of the reserved soaking liquid.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: America's Test Kitchen Best Baked Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.17 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsps salt
  • 0.5 cup water
  • 1 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 4 oz goat cheese
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 1 Tbsp shallots
  • 0.5 tsp lemon zest

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 wire rack
  • 1 jelly roll pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 450°F. Poke 6 holes in russet potatoes with fork, two holes on each side. Create a brine bath with salt and water. Coat the potatoes in the brine bath and place on a wire rack and jelly roll pan and cook for 45 to 60 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook the potatoes until the inside temperature reaches 205°F.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Coat the potatoes with vegetable oil and bake for an additional 10 minutes at 450°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove the potatoes from the oven an immediately cut an X in them to release the steam.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: For the topping, combine goat cheese, olive oil, parsley, shallots, and lemon zest. Season to taste.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vr-o01qiRYI

docs.title: America's Test Kitchen Best Baked Sweet Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.20 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text: • 4 sweet potatoes

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large plate
  • 1 microwave

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prick your sweet potatoes a few times with a fork, place them on a large plate, and then microwave them until they reach an internal temperature of 200°F. That should take between 6 and 9 minutes, but remember temperature is more important than time! Flip the spuds every 3 minutes, and start checking them for doneness around the 6-minute mark.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Once nuked, transfer the sweet potato to a 425°F oven for 1 hour.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.americastestkitchen.com/articles/4039-for-better-baked-sweet-potatoes-first-use-your-microwave

docs.title: Amish Potato Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 1.50 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 medium white potatoes
  • 2 eggs
  • 0.75 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 tsp cornstarch
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.33 cup apple cider vinegar
  • 0.5 cup milk
  • 1 tsp yellow mustard
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 cup mayonnaise
  • 1 small onion, finely chopped
  • 1 cup chopped celery
  • 1 cup carrots
  • 1 tsp celery seed
  • 4 hard-boiled eggs

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place the white potatoes in a large pot and fill it with enough salted water to cover them. Bring the water to a boil and continue to cook for 20 minutes, or until the potatoes are fork-tender. Drain and set aside to cool.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, make the dressing. Whisk together the 2 eggs, granulated sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Mix in the apple cider vinegar, milk, and yellow mustard. Continue to cook, stirring continuously for about 10 minutes, or until thick.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove from heat and mix in the unsalted butter. Allow the dressing to cool in the fridge. Mix in the mayonnaise.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Peel the potatoes, if desired. Slice them into bite-sized cubes and place them in a large bowl. Mix in the onion, finely chopped, chopped celery, carrots, celery seed, and 4 hard-boiled eggs. Gently toss in the dressing. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, better if overnight. Serve chilled and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://insanelygoodrecipes.com/amish-potato-salad/

docs.title: Asparagus Purée
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp butter
  • 2 Tbsp shallots
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • some asparagus slices
  • 2 pinches salt
  • 1 dash pepper
  • 4 sprigs lemon thyme
  • 1 cup vegetable stock
  • 4 Tbsp heavy cream

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large, shallow saucepan
  • 1 wooden spoon
  • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Melt the butter in a large, shallow saucepan over medium-low heat. Add shallots and garlic with a tablespoon of olive oil and sauté for 3 minutes or until translucent and slightly tender. Do not get any color on the shallots and garlic. Add asparagus slices, season with two pinches of salt, a dash of pepper, and lemon thyme. Stir together with a wooden spoon and sauté for another 3 to 5 minutes or until the asparagus is softened. Be sure not to get any color on the asparagus. The green asparagus should have a vibrant green color—if it starts to gray it is overcooked.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Deglaze the pan with enough vegetable stock to submerge the cooked vegetables and let the liquid come to a simmer. Turn the heat off, cover with a lid, and let rest for 2.5 minutes. The asparagus should be soft when pinched between your thumb and finger and tender to the bite.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove the lid and bring the heat back to medium. Add the heavy cream and bring to a boil for 1 to 2 minutes. The purée will separate if the cream is cold when blending. Taste and season with more salt as needed.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer asparagus mixture to blender. If you still have a decent amount of cooking liquid in the pan, do not pour all of it in to the blender. Reserve to begin and add as needed or you may end up with soup instead. Start blending on low speed, then gradually increase to medium and blend for 1 minute to emulsify all of the ingredients. The purée should be silky smooth and hold to the spoon when scooped. Taste and season with more salt as needed.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: If your purée is not coming together, add a few tablespoons of the reserved cooking liquid to the blender to thin it out. If you don’t have extra cooking liquid, use vegetable stock instead. Cool down slightly and pour into an 8-ounce squeeze bottle.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.masterclass.com/articles/learn-to-puree-with-chef-grodon-ramsays-puree-asparagus-recipe

docs.title: Balsamic-Dressed Cucumber with Olives
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cucumber
  • 10 black olives
  • 3 spring onions
  • 0.5 red chili (optional)
  • 2 Tbsp balsamic vinegar
  • 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 lemon
  • some black pepper
  • 6 sprigs mint

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 chopping board
  • 1 knife
  • 1 mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Run a fork down the length of the cucumber until it’s stripy all over.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: On a chopping board, use a knife to chop off the ends.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Carefully cut them in half across the middle, then in half lengthways.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Use a teaspoon to gently scoop out and discard the seeds.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Chop the cucumber up into 1 cm chunks and place in a mixing bowl.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Place the black olives on a chopping board, squash them with the heel of your hand, pull out and discard the stones, then roughly chop them and add them to the bowl.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Trim and finely slice the spring onions and add them to the bowl.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Chop and add a red chili (optional) to the bowl.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Add the balsamic vinegar and 4 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Squeeze in the juice of 1/2 a lemon, using your fingers to catch any pips.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Sprinkle over a pinch of black pepper.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Pick and tear over the mint leaves, toss everything together, then serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.jamieoliver.com/recipes/vegetables-recipes/balsamic-dressed-cucumber-with-olives/

docs.title: Banana Chips
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 16 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 medium banana
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • 0.13 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 fryer tray

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cut the banana into 1/8 - 1/4 inch thick slices. Try to make them uniformly thick.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Juice a lemon to get a teaspoon of lemon juice, if you haven't. Put the banana slices in a single layer on a plate. Sprinkle them with half the lemon juice, then flip them over and sprinkle with the rest.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mist an air fryer tray with cooking spray. Place the banana slices in a single layer on the tray.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Spray the banana slices with cooking spray. Sprinkle them with cinnamon and salt. I like to use a dusting wand for the cinnamon, but using your fingers works too.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Air fry bananas for 10 to 12 minutes at 350°F (177°C). (Use the top rack position for air fryer ovens.) The chips on the edges of the tray tend to brown faster than the ones in the middle, so take them out early if needed.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: After they’ve cooked, let cool completely before eating. They will continue to firm up more as they cool. Flip them over and air fry for 2 to 4 minutes at 350°F (177°C) if they aren't crispy enough for you. Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://summeryule.com/air-fryer-banana-chips/

docs.title: Basmati Pilaf
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 36 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 100 g unsalted butter
  • 1 large onion
  • 500 g basmati rice
  • 1 sprig thyme
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 2 cinnamon sticks
  • 8 cardamom pods
  • 3 cloves
  • 6 strips lemon zest
  • 1 qt vegetable stock or water
  • 1.5 tsp sea salt
  • some ground black pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium casserole
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to fan 160°C / conventional 180°C (350°F) / gas 4. You will need a medium casserole with a lid. Rinse the rice well in a large bowl of water, then drain.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt two-thirds of the unsalted butter in the casserole and sauté the onion for about 5 minutes. Add the basmati rice, stir well, then add the thyme, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, cloves, and lemon zest and cook for 1 minute. Now pour in the boiling vegetable stock or water and mix into the rice, along with sea salt and ground black pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cover and bake for 25 minutes. Leave to stand for 5 minutes, then remove the lid and fork through the remaining butter until the rice is fluffy and separated.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/basmati-pilaff

docs.title: Beach Day Chickpea Salad
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup raisins
  • 1 can chickpeas, drained
  • 2 celery stalks, diced
  • 2 Tbsp chopped parsley
  • 2 Tbsp whole grain mustard
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak the raisins in warm water for 5 minutes to soften, then drain.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Coarsely chop the raisins and add them to the chickpeas, drained.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add celery stalks, diced, chopped parsley, whole grain mustard, lemon juice, olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste, and stir well to combine.

docs.title: Blueberry Chickpea Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Dressing
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 2 lemon juice
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 3 Tbsp tahini
  • 0.25 cup water
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Ingredients - Salad
docs.text:
• 2 cups fresh blueberries
  • 1 can cooked chickpeas
  • 1 cup cucumber
  • 4 cups red cabbage
  • 1 handful mixed salad greens
  • 0.25 cup walnuts

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To make the tahini dressing, whisk nutritional yeast, garlic powder, lemon juice, maple syrup, tahini, water, and salt and pepper to taste together until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix the fresh blueberries, cooked chickpeas, diced cucumber, finely sliced red cabbage, mixed salad greens, and chopped walnuts in a bowl. Top the salad with the tahini dressing.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Serve and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/salad/blueberry-chickpea-salad/

docs.title: Bow Tie Pasta Chips
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups whole-grain bow tie pasta
  • 1 Tbsp aquafaba
  • 1 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 1.5 tsp Italian seasoning
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook the whole-grain bow tie pasta for half the time called for on the package.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain the pasta then toss with the aquafaba, nutritional yeast, Italian seasoning, and salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: If your air fryer basket is small, you will have to cook the chips in two batches (larger baskets may be able to do one batch). Cook at 390°F for 5 minutes, then shake the basket and cook for 3 to 5 minutes more or until crunchy.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/appetizer/air-fryer-bow-tie-pasta-chips/

docs.title: Braised Asparagus with Lemon & Chives
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb thick asparagus
  • 1 cup water
  • 0.25 cup vegetable broth
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp lemon zest
  • 2 tsp chives

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 12-inch skillet
  • 1 paring knife
  • 1 platter

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Trim bottom inch of thick asparagus spears; discard trimmings. Peel bottom two-thirds of spears until white flesh is exposed. Bring water, vegetable broth, olive oil, and salt to simmer in 12-inch skillet over high heat. Add asparagus in even layer. Reduce heat to maintain vigorous simmer and cover. Cook, gently shaking skillet occasionally, until asparagus is tender and can be easily pierced with tip of paring knife, 8 to 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
Remove lid and continue to cook, shaking and swirling skillet, until skillet is almost dry and asparagus is glazed, 1 to 3 minutes. longer. Off heat, add lemon zest and juice and half of chives and toss to coat. Transfer asparagus to platter, sprinkle with remaining chives, season with salt to taste, and serve.

Braised Asparagus with Orange and Tarragon

Substitute orange zest and juice for lemon, increasing amount of orange juice to 1 tablespoon. Substitute minced fresh tarragon for chives.

Braised Asparagus with Sherry Vinegar and Marjoram

Substitute 1 teaspoon sherry vinegar for lemon zest and juice and 1 teaspoon minced fresh marjoram for chives.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Brazilian Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 31 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup long-grain rice
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 1 onion
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 cups water
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • some cilantro (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 colander
  • 1 medium-sized pot
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Rinse the long-grain rice in a colander under cold water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the olive oil to a medium-sized pot on medium high heat. When the oil is hot, add the finely diced onion and minced garlic. Sauté for 4 minutes, stirring constantly.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: While that is cooking, boil 2 cups of water (or heat up a tea kettle).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the rinsed rice to the pot and stir for 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Now add the boiling water and salt. Reduce heat to simmer and cook the rice, covered, for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Turn off the heat and remove the pot's lid. Let the rice sit for 5 minutes then fluff with a fork.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Optionally top the rice with fresh chopped cilantro (optional) and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/784579/easy-brazilian-rice-recipe/

docs.title: Brown Sugar & Spice Roasted Carrots
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4-6 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 lbs thin carrots
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp dark brown sugar
  • 0.5 tsp paprika
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp black pepper
  • 0.13 tsp cayenne
  • 1 Tbsp dill

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed sheet pan
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat the oven (with the oven rack in the middle) to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Peel the thin carrots. If they are longer than 7 inches, cut them in half crosswise. If they are thicker than 3/4 inch, cut them in half lengthwise. Otherwise, leave them whole.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Put the carrots on a rimmed sheet pan. Drizzle with the olive oil and, using your hands, toss them together to coat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a small bowl, stir together the dark brown sugar, paprika, cumin, salt, black pepper, and cayenne. Sprinkle over the carrots and toss again. Spread in a single layer and roast for 25 to 30 minutes, shaking the pan half-way through, until the carrots are tender. They will be candied and a little burnt in spots.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Sprinkle with dill and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://jessicaseinfeld.com/recipes/brown-sugar-and-spice-roasted-carrots

docs.title: Brussels Sprouts With Warm Honey Glaze
docs.text: Total Time 33 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 lb Brussels sprouts
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.25 cup honey
  • 0.33 cup red wine or sherry vinegar
  • 0.75 tsp red pepper flakes (optional)
  • 3 Tbsp butter
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 scallions
  • 1 tsp lemon zest

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 tongs
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 platter

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place a rimmed baking sheet on bottom rack of oven; preheat to 450°F. Toss Brussels sprouts and olive oil in a large bowl; season with salt and black pepper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Carefully remove baking sheet from oven. Using tongs, arrange Brussels cut side down on baking sheet. Roast Brussels on bottom rack until softened and deeply browned, 20 to 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, bring honey to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring often, until honey is a deep amber color but not burnt (it will be foamy, that’s okay), 3 to 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove from heat and add red wine or sherry vinegar and red pepper flakes (optional), if using, and whisk until sauce is smooth (it will bubble up quite aggressively when you add the vinegar before settling). Return saucepan to medium heat, add butter and 1/2 tsp salt, and cook, whisking constantly, until glaze is glossy, bubbling, and slightly thickened, 3 to 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer Brussels sprouts to a large bowl. Add glaze and scallions and toss to combine. Transfer to a platter and top with lemon zest.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.bonappetit.com/recipe/roasted-brussels-sprouts-with-warm-honey-glaze

docs.title: Buffalo-Baked Baby Carrots
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb baby carrots
  • 0.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp paprika
  • 0.25 tsp cayenne pepper
  • 0.5 cup milk
  • 1 cup breadcrumbs
  • 1 Tbsp nutritional yeast
  • 1 cup buffalo sauce
  • 0.25 cup parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 paper towel
  • 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove the baby carrots from the bag; dry off excess water with a paper towel.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, garlic powder, salt, paprika, and cayenne pepper. Add the milk and stir to form a thick batter.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a separate bowl, place the breadcrumbs and nutritional yeast. Dip each carrot into the batter and then into the breadcrumbs. Place each coated carrot on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While the carrots are still warm, toss gently with the buffalo sauce. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with your dip of choice.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cal-Organic Farms

docs.title: Buffalo Cauliflower Wings
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 head cauliflower
  • 1 cup water
  • 0.75 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1 Tbsp garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp onion powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 cup Frank's Hot Sauce
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup or agave
  • 1 cup ranch dressing

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Spray generously with oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Wash and cut cauliflower into bite sized pieces.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl, add water, all-purpose flour, garlic powder and onion powder, and salt. Whisk until well combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the cauliflower to the batter in the bowl, and toss to combine and really coat the cauliflower. Remove the pieces of cauliflower, one by one, and tap off the excess batter a few times on the side of the bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place on the prepared baking sheet and make sure they are not touching each other, or they will all get stuck together as they bake. Spray the tops with oil, this will help them get super crispy.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 20 minutes. Flip them over and bake for 15 minutes more, until golden and crispy.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: While the cauliflower are baking, prepare the hot sauce mixture. Melt the unsalted butter in a saucepan on the stove over medium heat. Once melted, add the Frank's Hot Sauce, maple syrup or agave and stir. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Once the cauliflower have cooked and are crispy, toss the florets with the sauce in a large bowl, then return to the pan. You can serve them immediately, or to make them crispier, put them back in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes. If you want them super crispy, leave the buffalo sauce on the side for dipping as you go.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text:
Serve with ranch dressing.

Note

To make them extra-crispy, roll the cauliflower in panko breadcrumbs (you will need about 1.5 cups) once they are coated in the flour/milk mixture. Then bake per the instructions.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.noracooks.com/vegan-cauliflower-buffalo-wings/

docs.title: Butter-Basted Grilled Mushrooms
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb mushrooms (at least 2 inch wide)
  • 0.5 tsp vegetable oil
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 recipe garlic-parsley or ginger-miso basting butter
Variety How to prep White and Cremini (Baby Bella) Trim tough ends; halve Portobello Stem; halve of smaller than 4 inches across, quarter if larger Shiitake Stem; leave caps whole Oyster and Maitake (hen of the Woods) Trim; tear into 2 to 2.5 inch pieces King Oyster (King Trumpet) Trim stem, slice lengthwise 3/4 inch thick

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 bowl

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

These mushrooms make a great accompaniment to other grilled foods. Use any mix of mushrooms you like, as long as the caps measure at least 2 inches in diameter. See "Get Mushrooms Grill Ready" for mushroom prep instructions. A grill basket is helpful here but not essential. The parcooked mushrooms can be refrigerated for up to 24 hours.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine mushrooms (at least 2 inch wide) and 1/2 cup water in bowl. Cover and microwave for 1 minute. Stir well; re-cover; and microwave until mushrooms have reduced in size by about one-third and liquid has increased to almost 1 cup, about 2 minutes. Remove from microwave and let rest, covered, for 5 minutes to finish cooking. Drain well. Dry bowl and return mushrooms to bowl. Let stand at room temperature while preparing grill.

docs.title: Step 2A
docs.text: FOR A CHARCOAL GRILL: Open bottom vent completely. Light large chimney starter three-quarters filled with charcoal briquettes (about 42 quarts). When top coals are partially covered with ash, pour evenly over half of grill. Set cooking grate in place, cover, and open lid vent completely. Heat grill until hot, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2B
docs.text: FOR A GAS GRILL: Turn all burners to high; cover; and heat grill until hot, about 15 minutes. Leave primary burner on high and turn off other burner(s).

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Clean and oil cooking grate. Toss mushrooms with vegetable oil, pepper, and salt. Arrange mushrooms on hotter side of grill. Cook (covered if using gas), flipping mushrooms every 2 minutes, until well browned on all sides, 4 to 6 minutes. Carefully brush mushrooms with half of garlic-parsley or ginger-miso basting butter and continue to cook until butter is sizzling and fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Transfer to bowl with remaining basting butter and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Caprese Flatbread
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 8 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 large flatbread or naan
  • 0.5 cup Balsamic Pesto
  • 8 oz mozzarella
  • 1 cup red and/or yellow cherry or grape tomatoes
  • some basil
  • some balsamic glaze (optional)
  • some flaky sea salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place flatbread or naan on a large baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spread each with 1/4 cup Balsamic Pesto.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Top with mozzarella and red and/or yellow cherry or grape tomatoes, halved.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Use the baking sheet to transfer flatbread directly to the oven rack. Bake 6 to 8 minutes or until crust is golden and cheese is melted.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove from oven. Top with basil and, if you like, drizzle with balsamic glaze (optional). Sprinkle with flaky sea salt.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Carrot Cake Protein Bites
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 20 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup rolled oats
  • 2 cups soft pitted dates
  • 0.75 cup finely grated carrot
  • 1 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor or high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Pulse the rolled oats in a food processor or high-speed blender to create a coarse, grainy flour.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add soft pitted dates, finely grated carrot, unsweetened shredded coconut, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt to the processor and mix to form a thick, sticky dough. If the mixture does not stick together, add 1 Tbsp of warm water and process until desired consistency is reached.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Scoop out a portion of dough and roll between your palms to form a bit-size ball. Repeat with the remaining dough to create approximately 20 bites.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Store in an airtight container and refrigerate.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Carrot Slaw
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb carrot
  • 7 oz green cabbage
  • 0.5 red onion
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 2 Tbsp mayonnaise
  • 2 tsp honey
  • 1 lemon juice
  • 1 tsp Dijon mustard
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Grate the carrot along the long edge to create long, thin strands.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Grate or slice the green cabbage and red onion into thin strips.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the olive oil, apple cider vinegar, mayonnaise, honey, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, and salt and pepper to a bowl. Mix well to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the vegetables to a large mixing bowl and pour the dressing over the top.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Toss to combine.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve with chopped spring onion on top (optional).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/783475/carrot-slaw-recipe/

docs.title: Cauliflower Purée with Thyme
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup vegetable broth
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 lbs cauliflower
  • 1.5 Tbsp butter1
  • some pepper
  • 1 tsp thyme

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 slotted spoon
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 strainer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large pot, bring the vegetable broth and salt to a boil. Add the cauliflower; bring back to a boil. Cover, reduce the heat to low and steam for 15 to 20 minutes, or until cauliflower is very tender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Strain the cauliflower using a strainer then use a slotted spoon to transfer the cauliflower to a food processor. Add 3 tablespoons of vegetable broth from the pot, along with the butter. Process until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and freshly ground pepper. Add thyme and process until just combined.

docs.title: Source
docs.text:
• https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/cauliflower-puree.html

  1. Original recipe calls for 3 Tbsp of butter. ↩

docs.title: Charred Brussels Sprouts with Walnuts & Gorgonzola
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 lbs Brussels sprouts
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 6 Tbsp olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 cups walnuts
  • 8 oz crumbled Gorgonzola
  • 0.25 cup balsamic vinegar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a food processor, pulse Brussels sprouts, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place on a rimmed baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes, turning with a spatula halfway through.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Meanwhile, toast walnuts in a heated for 8 to 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer to a large bowl. Add Brussels sprouts, walnuts, crumbled Gorgonzola, and balsamic vinegar.

docs.title: Cheese Soufflé
docs.text: Total Time 1.15 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5.5 Tbsp (78 g) unsalted butter
  • 0.25 cup (30 g) all-purpose flour
  • 2.25 cup (511 g) milk
  • 1 small onion
  • 1 star anise
  • 3 cloves
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 6 egg
  • 1 cup (113 g) Gruyère
  • 1 cup (113 g) mature cheddar
  • 0.75 cup (75 g) Parmesan
  • 1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 tsp mustard powder
  • some pepper
  • 1 squeeze lemon juice
  • 1 cup (113 g) ripe Brie

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 soufflé dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix 3.5 tablespoons (49 g) of unsalted butter and all-purpose flour to make a paste called beurre manie. Chill to firm for 30 minutes. Heat milk to boil add the onion, star anise, cloves and bay leaf to make an onion pique, reduce to simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, let cool. Taste test for flavor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Strain the milk into a pan then press down on the onion to extract the maximum flavor. Place pan back on heat and gradually whisk in the butter paste, adding in small pieces until it thickens. Season then let cool 3 to 4 minutes. Whisk egg yolks with grated Gruyère and mature cheddar plus two thirds of the Parmesan. Add in the Worcestershire sauce and mustard powder. Bring to room temperature before continuing.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Brush a soufflé dish (7" x 3") with remaining 2 tablespoons of butter using upward strokes. Coat base and sides with remaining Parmesan cheese and freshly ground black pepper. Chill to set. Cut Gruyère into diamond shapes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F / 200°C. Coat a large grease-free bowl with the lemon juice. Whisk your egg whites in the bowl, then whisk one third of them into the cheese mixture, to loosen. Carefully, fold the remaining egg whites into the cheese mixture until well blended, but still light.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Spoon half of the mixture into the prepared soufflé dish and dot with the ripe Brie pieces then top with the remaining mixture. Gently level off the top. Arrange Gruyère on top, scatter with remaining Parmesan. Bake 10 minutes then reduce oven temperature to 365°F / 185°C and bake another 15 to 20 minutes. Soufflé should evenly rise and be slightly wobbly. Serve immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/classic-cheese-souffle

docs.title: Cheesy Popcorn
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.33 (24 g) cup nutritional yeast
  • 2 Tbsp sesame seeds
  • 1 Tbsp curry powder
  • 1 Tbsp salt
  • some corn kernels
  • some oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 spice grinder

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Toast the sesame seeds until fragrant.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To a spice grinder, add in the nutritional yeast, sesame seeds, curry powder, and salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Next, to a pot add in the corn kernels and oil. Add just enough that both leave a single layer at the bottom of the pan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Turn the heat to medium and once you start to hear it pop give it a shake every 15 to 30 seconds just so that nothing burns.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour the popcorn into a bowl, and toss in the seasoning mix.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://youtube.com/watch?v=G5NEwx6KqPM

docs.title: Cheesy Potatoes
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 onions
  • 1 can cream of chicken or potato soup
  • 8 oz sour cream
  • 1 stick butter
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 8 oz mild cheddar cheese
  • 16 oz hash brown potatoes
  • some corn flakes

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 casserole or foil pan
  • 1 Pam
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bake only in casserole or foil pan coated with Pam.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a bowl mix chopped onions, cream of chicken or potato soup, sour cream, melted butter, salt, pepper, 1/2 of the grated mild cheddar cheese, and hash brown potatoes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place in pan.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place 1/2 cheese on top (cover).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake 45 minutes covered, 15 minutes uncovered with corn flakes on top.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Cilantro Almond Pesto Brussels Sprouts
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 9 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 cups Brussels sprouts
  • some canola oil
  • some salt
  • 1 cilantro almond pesto
  • 1 lemon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 skimmer or slotted spoon
  • 1 kitchen towel or a few layers of paper towels
  • 1 Dutch oven
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 skimmer or slotted spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Fill a large pot with salted water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. While the water heats, prepare an ice bath in a large bowl nearby. Add the trimmed and halved Brussels sprouts to the water and blanch until just tender, about 3 minutes. Using a skimmer or slotted spoon, remove the Brussels sprouts and place immediately in the ice bath Let sit for 3 minutes and drain.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Spread a clean kitchen towel or a few layers of paper towels across a board or counter. Spread out the blanched Brussels sprouts on the towel and pat to dry as much as possible. (Removing most of the water now means less oil will sputter up while frying.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a Dutch oven, heavy-bottomed pot, or high-sided frying pan over high heat, heat about 3 inches of canola oil to 350°F. While the oil heats, line a baking sheet with paper towels for draining and place it nearby. Working in batches so as not to crowd the pot, fry the Brussels sprouts until lightly crispy, for about 3 minutes, flipping occasionally to fry evenly Using a skimmer or slotted spoon, remove the fried Brussels sprouts and place on the baking sheet. Season immediately with salt. Repeat to fry the remaining Brussels sprouts.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large bowl, toss the Brussels sprouts with the cilantro almond pesto. Transfer to a plate and serve with the lemon wedges.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Club Crackers
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 cups 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups einkorn flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 stick cold butter
  • 1 Tbsp honey
  • 0.67 cups milk
  • 2 Tbsp melted butter
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 pizza cutter
  • 1 fork
  • 1 baking tray

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat over to 400° F

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add einkorn flour, baking powder, and salt to food processor and pulse until well combined.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add cold butter in small cubes, pulse until crumbly.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add honey and milk, pulse until ball forms.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: If dough is still very sticky, add a bit more flour and pulse again.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove dough from food processor and divide into two balls to roll out separately.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Using a rolling pin, roll dough to about 1/8" thick. Using a pizza cutter, cut the dough into whatever size crackers you'd like.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Poke holes into each cracker with a fork. I like to do 3 to 4 rows of holes to make them look like the store-bought version.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Transfer crackers to baking tray and bake at 400° for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Remove from oven and immediately brush crackers with melted butter. Sprinkle with salt to taste.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Allow to cool completely before storing in an air tight container.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.amodernhomestead.com/homemade-crackers/

docs.title: Corn Tortillas
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8-12 24 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups (186 g) masa harina
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp vegetable oil
  • 1.25 cups warm water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 tortilla press
  • 1 large plastic bag
  • 1 rolling pin (alternative)
  • 1 cast iron pan or griddle
  • 1 damp dishtowel

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large bowl mix the masa harina with the salt and 1 tsp of vegetable oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the warm water and stir with a wooden spoon to combine. Then knead the dough with your hands for about a minute, until it feels like play-doh.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add 1 Tbsp of water at a time until the dough is soft and tacky but not sticky.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover bowl with a damp dishtowel and let rest for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Now make 8 to 12 dough balls shaping them into the size of a golf ball. (You can use a 2-tablespoon cookie scoop if you have one.) If the dough feels dry, wet your hands and it will help soften the dough as you roll.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: A tortilla press works best for pressing the tortillas into a 5-inch circle. To use one, cut a large plastic bag into 2 full-size, single pieces. Place one on the bottom plate, place one dough ball on top, then place another plastic piece on top. Now press down the tortilla press and when you pull up, you will have a perfect tortilla. If you don't have a tortilla press, place each dough ball in between 2 pieces of parchment paper and roll out to a 4- to 5-inch circle with a rolling pin (alternative).

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Heat up a cast iron pan or griddle with 1 tsp of vegetable oil to medium-high until shimmering. Use a paper towel to wipe out the oil until there is a thin film on the bottom.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Put one tortilla in at a time. Cook on the first side for 45 seconds until the sides of the tortilla start to release. Do not touch to tortilla to prevent ripping. Flip and cook for another 1 minute until edges begins to curl. Flip again until puffy, about 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Wrap cooked tortillas in a damp dishtowel to keep them soft until you serve them.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.tastingtable.com/842862/classic-corn-tortillas-recipe/
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eyhsvenqo7M

docs.title: Couscous
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup vegetable broth or water
  • 1 pinch kosher salt
  • 1 cup couscous
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 pinch cumin (optional)
  • 2 cloves sautéed garlic(optional)
  • 2 green onions (optional)
  • some fresh herbs (optional)
Uncooked Cooked Liquid Serves 180 g 540 g 227 g 4 270 g 810 g 340 g 6 360 g 1080 g 454 g 8

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 extra virgin olive oil
  • 1 non-stick skillet or pan
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a saucepan, add vegetable broth or water. Add a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil and a pinch of kosher salt. Bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Now, toast the couscous. In a non-stick skillet or pan, heat about 1 to 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil. Add the couscous and toss around with a wooden spoon until golden brown. This is an optional step but can really adds a great nutty flavor.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir couscous in the boiled liquid quickly and immediately turn the heat off. Cover and let sit for 10 minutes or until couscous has completely absorbed the broth or water.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Uncover and fluff with a fork.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: You can serve couscous plain, or mix in spices and herbs to give it more flavor. If you like, add in a pinch of cumin (optional), sautéed garlic(optional), chopped green onions (optional), and fresh herbs (optional) or your choice. Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.themediterraneandish.com/how-to-cook-couscous/

docs.title: Creamed Spinach
docs.text: Total Time 14 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb spinach
  • 4 oz unsalted butter
  • 1 cup red onion, diced
  • 2 oz all-purpose flour
  • 4 cups milk
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp garlic
  • 1 dash hot sauce
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 4 oz English cheddar
  • 4 oz Gruyere
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 2 Tbsp Parmesan cheese
  • 2 Tbsp parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 potato ricer
  • 1 kitchen towel
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 buttered lasagna pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 275°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove the stems of the spinach leaves and steam in salty boiling water for about 1.5 minutes. Plunge them in ice water to stop the cooking process, and squeeze as much water as possible using a potato ricer or your hands, or a kitchen towel.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a saucepan, heat the unsalted butter, add the red onion, diced and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the all-purpose flour and cook for a couple more minutes. Add the milk and cook for 5 to 7 minutes at low heat and season to taste with salt and pepper. Add the spinach and mix very well. Add garlic, hot sauce and lemon juice. Cook for a few more minutes again and add the English cheddar, Gruyere (save a little to top the dish) and cook for another 5 minutes at low heat. Add chopped parsley and lemon zest.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour the cooked mixture into a buttered lasagna pan and top the spinach with Parmesan cheese and parsley.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/side-dishes/creamed-spinach/

docs.title: Crispy Herbes de Provence Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 1.17 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp butter
