  • 2.5 lbs gold potatoes
  • 6 Tbsp butter
  • 1 cups Parmesan
  • 0.25 cup panko breadcrumbs
  • 1.5 Tbsp TJ's Herbes de Provence
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 1 Tbsp rosemary

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9-inch cast iron pan
  • 1 mandoline or knife
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Grease a 9-inch cast iron pan with two tablespoons melted butter. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using a mandoline or knife, thinly slice the gold potatoes and place in a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Combine remaining butter, grated Parmesan cheese, panko breadcrumbs, TJ's Herbes de Provence, salt, and pepper with potatoes. Toss to coat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To arrange the potatoes, lay a single layer of potatoes against the side of the pan, until a ring of potatoes is formed. Continue to make rings of potatoes, until the entire pan is filled.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake for 1 hour, or until the edges and tops become golden brown, crispy, and the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Let cool 10 minutes before sprinkling with fresh rosemary to serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/crispy-herbes-de-provence-potatoes

docs.title: Deviled Eggs
docs.text: Total Time 3.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 eggs
  • 3 Tbsp mayonnaise
  • 0.5 tsp mustard
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp garlic salt
  • 0.13 tsp onion powder
  • 2 Tbsp bacon bits
  • some Lawry's Seasoned Salt

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Hard boil eggs.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Shell and split the eggs in half lengthwise and remove, but don't discard, the yolks.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: For filling, take yolks, mash them and mix mayonnaise, mustard, salt, garlic salt, onion powder, finely chopped bacon bits. all ingredients together until creamy. Add mayonnaise if not creamy enough.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Scoop filling into egg white and sprinkle with Lawry's Seasoned Salt.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Chill for 3 hours and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Dried Fruit & Nut Mix
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 cups 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.33 cup walnuts
  • 0.33 cup almonds
  • 0.25 cup sunflower seeds
  • 0.33 cup unsweetened cranberries
  • 0.33 cup unsweetened raisins
  • 1 pinch cinnamon (optional)
  • 1 pinch nutmeg (optional)
  • 1 pinch salt (optional)
  • some dark chocolate (optional)
  • some chocolate candy (optional)
  • some pretzels (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine walnuts, almonds, sunflower seeds, unsweetened cranberries, unsweetened raisins, cinnamon (optional), nutmeg (optional), and salt (optional) in a large bowl, mix well and enjoy.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Store in Ziploc bag or mason jar.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Tip: For some extra sweetness and fun, add chopped dark chocolate (optional), chocolate candy (optional), or pretzels (optional).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Eggless Egg Salad
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg firm tofu
  • 0.5 stalk celery plug leaves
  • 1 clove shallot
  • 0.25 tsp dry dill
  • 0.5 tsp fresh dill
  • 0.5 tsp turmeric
  • 1 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 2 tsp dill pickle relish
  • 0.25 tsp onion powder
  • 0.25 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.25 cup mayonnaise
  • some sea salt
  • some turmeric

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Put one-quarter of the block of firm tofu in a food processor with celery plug leaves, shallot, dry dill, fresh dill, turmeric, Dijon mustard, dill pickle relish, onion powder, garlic powder, and mayonnaise. Blend until combined.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the remaining three-quarter block of tofu and pulse until mixed but not smooth, keeping a course texture. Taste. Adjust ingredients and sea salt to your liking. Add more turmeric if it needs more authentic egg salad color.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastewiththeeyes.com/2010/01/eggless-egg-salad/

docs.title: Falafel Scones with Harissa Yogurt
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 22 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup Greek yogurt
  • 2 tsp harissa
  • 1 cup TJ's falafel mix
  • 1 cup flour
  • 3 Tbsp sugar
  • 4 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 2 large eggs
  • 0.5 cup heavy cream
  • 0.5 cup sun-dried tomatoes
  • 0.5 red bell pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or spray with cooking spray; set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Harissa Yogurt: Combine Greek yogurt and harissa in a small bowl, cover and refrigerate.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Falafel Scones: In a large bowl, combine TJ's falafel mix, flour, sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl. Cut the unsalted butter into the dry ingredients until crumbly, leaving pea sized chunks of butter. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a medium bowl, lightly beat the large eggs and heavy cream. Make a well in the center of dry mixture and add egg mixture. Fold gently with a spatula, until just combined. Gently stir in sun-dried tomatoes, if using.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Divide dough in half. Stretch dough into a circle, about 6 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick, and place it on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough. Cut each circle into six triangles, and top with sliced red bell pepper, if using.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15 to 17 minutes until golden. Remove from oven and transfer scones to a wire rack to cool. Wait 5 minutes, then serve with harissa yogurt for drizzling.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Fennel & Potato Cassola
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 24 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 baby bulbs fennel
  • 1 sweet onion
  • 2.5 potatoes
  • some olive oil
  • 2 cup vegetable stock
  • 3 bay leaves
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large sauté pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cut potatoes into 1 inch cubes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large sauté pan, sauté fennel, sweet onion, and potatoes in olive oil over medium-high heat until they are mostly cooked through, about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add 1 cup of vegetable stock and bay leaves.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook over medium heat until water boils off, about 6 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add another cup of vegetable stock and continue to cook until vegetables are cooked through, about 6 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove from heat, discard bay leaves, and add salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: French Potato Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 12 Yukon gold or red potatoes
  • 0.5 cup parsley
  • 0.25 cup dill
  • 3 scallions
  • 0.33 cup olive oil
  • 3 Tbsp champagne vinegar
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 Tbsp Dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium-sized pot
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Wash the Yukon gold or red potatoes and put them in a medium-sized pot. Cover the potatoes with water and boil them for 20 to 30 minutes, or until they're fork-tender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While the potatoes are cooking, chop the parsley, dill, and scallions.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, champagne vinegar, crushed garlic, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Let the potatoes cool for about 10 minutes then chop them up. Add them to a large bowl along with the parsley, dill, and scallions, and toss with the dressing. Chill the potato salad in the fridge or serve at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tastingtable.com/821288/french-potato-salad-recipe/

docs.title: Fried Green Plantains
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 6 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some vegetable oil
  • 4 green plantain
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 deep fry pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a deep fry pan, heat about 1 inch of vegetable oil on medium-high heat until it's hot. (To test oil temp, dip the handle of a wooden spoon into the oil. When the oil bubbles around the stick, it's ready for frying.)

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In batches, fry green plantain pieces about 2 to 3 minutes on both sides, until lightly golden. Remove plantains from pan and drain on a plate covered with 2 or 3 paper towels.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: While still warm, use the bottom of a glass to flatten the fried plantain pieces until they are about 1/4-inch thick.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat oil again and return flattened plantain rounds into the oil. Fry until both sides are golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Drain on a paper towel- lined plate.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Season with salt to taste and serve with refried beans, cashew cream, or chilero hot sauce for dipping.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: Fried Green Tomatoes
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 large tomatoes
  • 2 eggs
  • 0.5 cup milk
  • 1 cup flour
  • 0.5 cup cornmeal
  • 5 cup bread crumbs
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 1 qt vegetable oil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Slice tomatoes 1/2 inch thick. Discard the ends.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk eggs and milk together in a medium-size bowl. Scoop flour onto a plate. Mix cornmeal, bread crumbs and salt and pepper on another plate. Dip tomatoes into flour to coat. Then dip the tomatoes into milk and egg mixture. Dredge in breadcrumbs to completely coat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large skillet, pour vegetable oil (enough so that there is 1/2 inch of oil in the pan) and heat over a medium heat. Place tomatoes into the frying pan in batches of 4 or 5, depending on the size of your skillet. Do not crowd the tomatoes, they should not touch each other. When the tomatoes are browned, flip and fry them on the other side. Drain them on paper towels.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/16760/best-fried-green-tomatoes/

docs.title: Funeral Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 12 Russet potatoes
  • 2 10-oz cans cream of chicken soup
  • 2 cups sour cream
  • 1 cup cheddar cheese
  • 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 0.5 cup onions
  • 2 cups corn flakes or Ritz crackers
  • 2 Tbsp butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9x13-inch baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Peel Russet potatoes and boil for 30 minutes, until just tender. Cool and grate into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish (or put hash browns into the baking dish).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine cream of chicken soup, sour cream. cheddar cheese, the 1/2 cup melted unsalted butter, and onions. Gently blend into potatoes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine crushed corn flakes or Ritz crackers and the 2 tablespoons melted butter. Sprinkle on top.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Essential Mormon Cookbook

docs.title: Garlic & Lemon Roasted Romanesco Cauliflower
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups romanesco cauliflower
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 6 cloves crushed garlic
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • some sea salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 425°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place romanesco cauliflower florets on the parchment paper and drizzle with olive oil and crushed garlic. Mix everything around with a spatula.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Grate the lemon zest over these cruciferous beauties and sprinkle with sea salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake for 20 minutes, or until tender and browned.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve warm, topped with more lemon zest to taste.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://itsavegworldafterall.com/garlic-and-lemon-roasted-romanesco-cauliflower/#recipe

docs.title: Garlic Mushrooms
docs.text: Total Time 6 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some olive oil
  • 1 lb mushrooms
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 cup red onion
  • 1 Tbsp thyme
  • 1 Tbsp rosemary
  • 1 Tbsp garlic
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 oz white wine or white vermouth or vegetable stock
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 2 Tbsp butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 sauté pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a sauté pan, heat a couple tablespoons olive oil. When hot add the mushrooms, salt and pepper to taste. Cook until golden brown.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the red onion and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the thyme, rosemary and garlic.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When the garlic is fragrant, add the lemon juice and the white wine or white vermouth or vegetable stock and let it reduce for a 2 to 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the parsley and the lemon zest.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Finish with the butter and enjoy it!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/side-dishes/sauteed-mushrooms/

docs.title: Garlic Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp butter
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 1 cup jasmine rice
  • 1.5 cups water
  • some salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the garlic and cook, stirring frequently, for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the jasmine rice and stir to coat in the garlic butter.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour in the water and season with salt. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low and simmer until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes)

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://deliciouslittlebites.com/garlic-rice/

docs.title: Golden French Mashed Potatoes
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs Yukon Gold potatoes
  • 2.5 sticks unsalted butter
  • 1.33 cups whole milk
  • 1 tsp salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large saucepan
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Scrub Yukon Gold potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat unsalted butter, whole milk, and 1 tsp salt in a large saucepan until butter is melted.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add potatoes, increase heat to medium-low and cook until liquid just starts to boil. Reduce heat to low, partially cover and gently simmer until potatoes are tender (30 to 40 minutes).

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir every 10 minutes. Once cooked, blend potatoes and milk and butter mixture all together in a bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Gracias Madre Black Beans
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 cups 1.67 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup dried black beans
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 0.5 tsp oregano
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 cup onion
  • 1 jalapeño
  • 2 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium pot
  • 1 medium nonstick pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak the dried black beans overnight.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium pot over medium-high heat, add the dried black beans, bay leaf, oregano, and just enough water to cover (about 2 cups). Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce the heat to low. Stirring occasionally, simmer until the beans are very tender, about 90 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a medium nonstick pan over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onion and chopped and seeded jalapeño and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are soft and translucent, about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the onion mixture to the pot of beans. Using an immersion blender, puree the beans until nearly smooth, keeping a little bit of texture. (Alternatively, you can carefully ladle the beans into a blender, puree them, then return them to the pot.) Add the salt and taste to adjust the seasoning.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Granola Bars
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 180 g soft dates
  • 360 ml honey
  • 60 g pecans
  • 60 g dried apricots
  • 250 g rolled oats
  • 30 g sunflower seeds
  • 120 g unsweetened desiccated coconut
  • 2 Tbsp chia seeds
  • some vegetable oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small saucepan
  • 1 blender
  • 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 brownie tin
  • 1 baking paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat your oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove and throw away the stones from the soft dates, then put the dates in a small saucepan with the honey. Bring to the boil then blitz in your blender until you have a smooth paste. Leave to cool a little while you get the rest of your ingredients ready.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Roughly chop the pecans with a large knife, then chop the dried apricots.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Put the rolled oats, pecans, apricots, sunflower seeds, unsweetened desiccated coconut and chia seeds into a mixing bowl and add the date paste. Mix everything together really well.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Line a brownie tin (approximately 23cm square) with baking paper and brush it with a little tasteless oil like vegetable oil. Pour the granola mixture on top, pressing it into the corners and making sure it is roughly flat on top.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Put the tray into the oven for 40 minutes until lightly brown on top, then remove the tray from the oven and leave to cool completely.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cut into bars and try not to eat them all or you won’t have any left for your breakfast!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.gordonramsayrestaurants.com/recipes/granola-bars/

docs.title: Greek Style Lemon Roasted Potatoes
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 lbs yellow potatoes
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • 1 cup chicken broth
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp oregano
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 1 lemon juice
  • 1 sprig rosemary
  • some parsley (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9x13" casserole or baking dish

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400° F or 375°F if using convection.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Mix yellow potatoes, olive oil, chicken broth, salt, oregano, paprika, pepper, lemon juice, and rosemary in a 9x13" casserole or baking dish. Roast for 1 hour, gently stirring 2 to 3 times toward the end. After 1 hour, (or when they look 95% golden, turn off the oven and let them sit in the oven, turned off for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Garnish with parsley (optional) if desired

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://scheckeats.com/greek-style-lemon-roasted-potatoes/

docs.title: Green Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 cups 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup packed spinach
  • 0.25 cup packed cilantro
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1.75 cup water
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 cup yellow onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 cup basmati rice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 high-speed blender
  • 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a high-speed blender, add the spinach, cilantro, salt, and 1.75 cups of water and blend until smooth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the yellow onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions start to look translucent, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the basmati rice and the blended spinach mixture and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Increase the heat to high and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until the water has been absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove from the heat, leaving the lid on the steam for an additional 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Fluff with a fork and keep covered until serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Grilled Mushrooms with Rosemary-Lemon Basting Butter
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb white, cremini, shiitake, portobello, oyster, maitake, and/or king oyster mushrooms
  • 4 Tbsp butter
  • 1 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 2 tsp rosemary
  • 1 tsp garlic
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 tsp vegetable oil
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 small saucepan

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Use any mix of white, cremini, shiitake, portobello, oyster, maitake, and/or king oyster mushrooms you like, as long as the caps measure at least 2 inches in diameter. A grill basket is helpful here but not essential. These mushrooms make a great accompaniment to other grilled foods. The parcooked mushrooms can be refrigerated for up to 24 hours.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Add soy sauce, rosemary, minced garlic, lemon zest, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and cook, stirring frequently, until mixture is simmering and fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover to keep warm until ready to use.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Trim tough ends of stems on white and cremini mushrooms and cut in half. Remove stems from shiitake mushrooms. Remove stems from portobello mushrooms and halve caps if smaller than 4 inches; quarter if larger. Trim oyster and maitake mushrooms and tear into 2 to 2.5 inch pieces. Trim stems on king oyster mushrooms and slice crosswise 3/4 inch thick.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Combine mushrooms and 1/2 cup water in bowl. Cover and microwave for 1 minute. Stir well; re-cover; and microwave until mushrooms have reduced in size by about one-third and liquid has increased to almost 1 cup, about 2 minutes. Remove from microwave and let rest, covered, for 5 minutes to finish cooking. Drain well. Dry bowl and return mushrooms to bowl. Let stand at room temperature while preparing grill.

docs.title: Step 4A
docs.text: FOR A CHARCOAL GRILL: Open bottom vent completely. Light large chimney starter three-quarters filled with charcoal briquettes (about 4.5 quarts). When top coals are partially covered with ash, pour evenly over half of grill. Set cooking grate in place, cover, and open lid vent completely. Heat grill until hot, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4B
docs.text: FOR A GAS GRILL: Turn all burners to high; cover; and heat grill until hot, about 15 minutes. Leave primary burner on high and turn off other burner(s).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Clean and oil cooking grate. Toss mushrooms with vegetable oil, salt, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Arrange mushrooms on hotter side of grill. Cook (covered if using gas), flipping mushrooms every 2 minutes, until well browned on all sides, 4 to 6 minutes. Carefully brush mushrooms with half of basting butter and continue to cook until butter is sizzling and fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Transfer to bowl with remaining basting butter and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.cooksillustrated.com/recipes/15040-grilled-mushrooms-with-rosemary-lemon-basting-butter

docs.title: Grilled Sweet Potatoes with Chimichurri
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1 hour

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 medium sweet potatoes
  • 0.5 shallot
  • 3 Tbsp parsley
  • 3 Tbsp cilantro
  • 2 Tbsp sherry or red wine vinegar
  • 5 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp black pepper
  • 0.25 tsp red pepper flakes

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 serving plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Put the sweet potatoes in a steamer basket over 1 inch of simmering water and cover tightly. Steam for about 30 minutes, or until they can be easily pierced with a paring knife. Remove from the basket. When cool enough to handle, slice them in half lengthwise.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: For the chimichurri, in a small bowl, combine the finely chopped shallot, parsley, cilantro, sherry or red wine vinegar, 4 tablespoons of the olive oil, the salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat the grill to medium-high.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Drizzle the sweet potatoes with the remaining 1 tablespoon oil and rub to coat. Sprinkle with a little salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Place the sweet potatoes cut side down on the grill. Grill for 5 to 10 minutes, until grill marks form. Flip over and grill 2 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Transfer the sweet potatoes to a serving plate and drizzle with the chimichurri.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://jessicaseinfeld.com/recipes/grilled-sweet-potatoes-with-chimichurri

docs.title: Hasselback Roasted Zucchini
docs.text: Total Time 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 medium zucchini
  • 2 cup basil
  • 2 tsp capers
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 3 clove garlic
  • some sea salt
  • 0.25 tsp black pepper
  • 1.5 cup whole wheat couscous
  • 0.25 cup nutritional yeast
  • 2 Tbsp Tahini
  • 3 Tbsp lemon juice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 15×10-inch baking pan
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a 15×10-inch baking pan with parchment paper. If necessary, remove a thin slice from one side of each zucchini so it sits flat. Cut each in half crosswise. On a cutting board arrange two chopsticks or wooden spoons lengthwise on either side of zucchini. Cut zucchini crosswise into 1/4-inch slices, stopping when knife reaches chopsticks (to prevent slicing all the way through). Arrange zucchini in prepared pan.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a food processor combine basil and/or parsley; capers; lemon zest; 2 cloves of the garlic, minced; the sea salt; and black pepper. Pulse until chopped and well combined. Transfer to a medium bowl. Stir in whole wheat couscous and nutritional yeast. Spoon mixture between slices of zucchini. Spoon any remaining filling over or around zucchini. Roast, uncovered, 25 minutes or until lightly browned and tender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: For Tahini Sauce, in a small food processor combine tahini, lemon juice, and remaining garlic. Process until smooth, gradually adding 2 to 4 tablespoons of water until drizzling consistency.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve zucchini drizzled with Tahini Sauce.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.forksoverknives.com/recipes/vegan-salads-sides/hasselback-roasted-zucchini/

docs.title: Honey and Walnut Baked Brie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 wedge or wheel Brie
  • 57 g walnuts
  • 84 g honey
  • 0.5 tsp rosemary
  • 21 g dried cherries or cranberries (optional)
  • some salt
  • some toasted bread (alternative)
  • some crackers
  • some fruit (alternative)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 cast iron skillet, casserole dish, or pie plate
  • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Place the Brie into a cast iron skillet, casserole dish, or pie plate. Place into the oven and bake for 5 to 15 minutes, until softened but not completely melted.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Toast the walnuts on the range in a skillet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, combine honey, toasted walnuts, rosemary, and dried cherries or cranberries (optional). Stir until completely combined. If your honey is really thick you can place it in the microwave for a few seconds to thin it out a bit. Don't microwave it too long or it will become really thin.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once the Brie is done, sprinkle it with a little salt, then spoon over the honey mixture and sprinkle with a little more sea salt. Serve immediately with toasted bread (alternative), crackers and fruit (alternative).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://celebratingsweets.com/honey-rosemary-walnut-baked-brie/

docs.title: Honey Glazed Carrots & Parsnips
docs.text: Total Time 23 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 500 g parsnips
  • 500 g carrots
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 sprigs thyme
  • 1 stick cinnamon
  • 3 star anise
  • 2 Tbsp clear honey
  • 1 splash water
  • some butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large sauté pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Peel and halve or quarter the parsnips and carrots so that the pieces are of a similar size.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat the olive oil in a large sauté pan, then add the carrots and parsnips and toss to coat in the oil.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the thyme, cinnamon broken in two, star anise and some seasoning.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook over a medium heat for 15 to 20 minutes, turning the vegetables frequently, until golden brown and almost cooked through.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Drizzle over the clear honey and cook until the vegetables start to caramelize.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Deglaze the pan with the water and increase the heat.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until the liquid has evaporated, and the carrots and parsnips are cooked through.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Stir through a few knobs of butter to glaze.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Serve and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.gordonramsayrestaurants.com/recipes/honey-glazed-carrots-and-parsnips/

docs.title: Hummus with Pesto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1.5 cups 8 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 15-oz can chickpeas
  • 1.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 cup cold water
  • 1 ice cube
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.25 cup lemon juice
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp paprika
  • 0.33 cup tahini
  • some pesto

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large skillet
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Toss chickpeas with baking soda in a large skillet. Heat over medium 2 to 3 minutes or until chickpeas are hot. Transfer to a large bowl and wash with three or four changes of cold water while rubbing the chickpeas between your hands to release the skins. Discard skins and drain chickpeas.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine chickpeas, the cold water, 1 ice cube, and the garlic in a food processor; process 2 minutes. Add lemon juice, salt, and paprika; process 2 minutes more. With the food processor running, slowly pour in the tahini; process 1 minute more.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Transfer hummus to a small bowl. Swirl in pesto. Drizzle with a little olive oil (if using).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Ina Garten's Parmesan Roasted Broccoli
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 lb broccoli
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 6.5 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 3 Tbsp toasted pine nuts
  • 0.33 cups Parmesan
  • 12 leaves julienned fresh basil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 sheet pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat the oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cut the broccoli florets from the thick stalks, leaving an inch or two of stalk attached to the florets discarding the rest of the stalks. Cut the larger pieces through the base of the head with a small knife, pulling the florets apart. You should have about 8 cups of florets. Place the broccoli florets on a sheet pan large enough to hold them in a single layer. Toss the garlic on the broccoli and drizzle with 5 tablespoons olive oil. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Roast for 20 to 25 minutes, until crisp-tender and the tips of some of the florets are browned.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove the broccoli from the oven and immediately toss with 1.5 tablespoons olive oil, the lemon zest, lemon juice, toasted pine nuts, Parmesan, and julienned fresh basil. Serve hot.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://food52.com/recipes/67239-ina-garten-s-parmesan-roasted-broccoli

docs.title: Ina Garten's Potato Salad
docs.text: Total Time 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 lbs small white potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp salt
  • 1 cup mayonnaise
  • 0.25 cup buttermilk
  • 2 Tbsp Dijon mustard
  • 2 Tbsp whole-grain mustard
  • 0.5 cup dill
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 cup celery
  • 0.5 cup red onion
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 colander
  • 1 clean kitchen towel
  • 1 small bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place the small white potatoes and 2 tablespoons of salt in a large pot of water. Bring the water to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes, until the potatoes are just slightly tender when pierced with a knife.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain the potatoes into a colander. Set the colander over the empty pot and cover it with a clean kitchen towel. Allow the potatoes to steam for another 15 to 20 minutes, until they’re tender but not mushy.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, buttermilk, Dijon mustard, whole-grain mustard, dill, 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of pepper. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When the potatoes are cool enough to handle but still warm, cut them into bite-size chunks. Place the cut-up potatoes in a large bowl and immediately pour the dressing over them. Add the celery and red onion, 2 teaspoons of salt and 1 teaspoon of pepper. Toss until the dressing coats every bite. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for a few hours to allow the flavors to blend. Serve cold or at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.tasteofhome.com/article/ina-garten-potato-salad/

docs.title: Internet-Famous Crispy Potatoes
docs.text: Total Time 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 lbs Yukon gold potatoes
  • some olive oil
  • some dill or parsley (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 half-sheet pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat your oven to 450°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Clean and cut the Yukon gold potatoes into your desired size and place them in a pot of cold water. Add a handful of salt and bring to a boil. Cook 10 to 15 minutes, until they are almost fork-tender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Drain the potatoes and use a spoon to rough-up the edges of them. This increases the surface area, which will give them more places to get crispy.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the potatoes onto a half-sheet pan. Drizzle with the olive oil and seasonings. Make sure everything is lightly but evenly coated in the oil and seasonings.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Roast at 450°F 15 to 25 minutes (every oven is different so go by appearance not by a timer) and toss the potatoes around a couple times while they roast.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: When the potatoes look near perfectly crispy, turn off the oven and let them sit in the oven with it off for 10 to 15 minutes. My mom inadvertently found out that this gets them extra crispy when she originally just started doing it so she could prepare the potatoes in advance!

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Finish with fresh, tender herbs such as dill or parsley (optional).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://scheckeats.com/internet-famous-crispy-potatoes/

docs.title: Jalapeño Corn Pudding
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 5.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp butter
  • 1 cup milk
  • 2 eggs
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp sugar
  • 2 Tbsp flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 2 cups corn
  • 0.5 cup cheese
  • 2 Tbsp jalapeños

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix melted butter, milk, eggs, salt, sugar, flour, and baking powder.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in corn, shredded cheese, and sliced jalapeños.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Slow cook on high, 3 to 5 hours, take off lid for last 20 to 30 minutes and continue to cook on low.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: To bake in oven, preheat to 350°F and bake for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Joel Robuchon's Mashed Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 kg rattes or BF 15 potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp coarse salt
  • 250 g well-chilled unsalted butter
  • 250 g very hot whole milk
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 potato ricer
  • 1 large saucepan
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 very fine sieve

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Put the rattes or BF 15 potatoes in a saucepan with 2 liters of cold water and 1 tablespoon of coarse salt. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook until a knife slips in the potatoes easily and cleanly, about 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain the potatoes and peel them. Put them through a potato ricer (or a food mill fitted with its finest disk) into a large saucepan. Turn the heat to medium and dry the potato flesh out a bit by turning it vigorously with a spatula for about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, rinse a small saucepan and pour out the excess water but do not wipe it dry. Add the milk and bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Turn the heat under the potatoes to low and incorporate the well-chilled unsalted butter bit by bit, stirring it in energetically for a smooth, creamy finish. Pour in the very hot whole milk in a thin stream, still over a low heat, still stirring briskly. Keep stirring until all the milk is absorbed. Turn off the heat and taste for salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: For an even lighter, finer purée, put it through a very fine sieve before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2018/aug/06/joel-robuchons-best-mashed-potatoes-in-the-world-recipe

docs.title: Josh Elkin's Mushroom Toast
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup Butter
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 cup sliced shallots
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 cups porcini mushrooms
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp thyme
  • 4 thick slices crusty bread
  • 1 cup mascarpone cheese
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp thyme
  • some flaky salt
  • 2 Tbsp Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Butter and olive oil are melted in a pan, then sliced shallots and garlic get sautéed until they start to get a little soft. Next, you add your thinly sliced porcini mushrooms and season them with a little salt, pepper, and thyme. I couldn’t get my hands on fresh porcini mushrooms so I used baby bella mushrooms instead.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While all of this is cooking on the stove, toast up two thick slices of crusty bread. My preference is a yummy sourdough boule, but feel free to go with what you’d like! You’ll also need to whisk up some softened mascarpone cheese with a bit of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Once your bread is crunchy, your mushrooms are flavorful, and your mascarpone is seasoned, spread the cheese onto the bread, top with the sautéed mushrooms, and sprinkle with some thyme, flaky salt, and grated Parmesan.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thekitchn.com/mushroom-toast-recipe-review-23389923

docs.title: Julia Child's Garlic Mashed Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 43 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 30 cloves garlic
  • 2 Tbsp flour
  • 1 cup whole milk
  • 2.5 lbs russet potatoes
  • 0.25 cup heavy cream
  • 0.25 cup parsley
  • some salt
  • some white pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium pot
  • 1 immersion or regular blender
  • 1 large pot
  • 1 potato ricer

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Bring a small pot of water to a boil, then add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes; drain and peel.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium pot set over medium heat, melt 4 tablespoons of the unsalted butter, then add the garlic and cook until soft, 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes, then add the whole milk and cook until thick and bubbling, 3 to 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Using an immersion or regular blender, purée.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To a large pot, add the russet potatoes, cut into 1 inch pieces, and enough generously salted water to cover by 1 inch. Boil until tender, about 15 minutes, then drain and pass through a potato ricer back into the pan (alternatively, use a potato masher to finely mash).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Turn the heat to medium-low and stir in the remaining butter, reserved sauce, the heavy cream, parsley, salt, and white pepper and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes more.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.saveur.com/article/recipes/julia-childs-garlic-mashed-potatoes/

docs.title: Kale Chips
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 bunch kale
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 knife or kitchen shears
  • 1 salad spinner

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Gather all ingredients.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat an oven to 300°F (150°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: With a knife or kitchen shears carefully remove kale leaves from the thick stems and tear into bite size pieces.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Wash and thoroughly dry kale with a salad spinner.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Drizzle kale leaves with olive oil and toss to combine. Spread out in an even layer on the baking sheet without overlapping and sprinkle with salt.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake until the edges start to brown but are not burnt, 20 to 30 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/176957/baked-kale-chips/

docs.title: Kettle Corn
docs.text: Total Time 4 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup vegetable oil
  • 0.25 cup kernels
  • 2 Tbsp sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt

Note

To double the recipe for 12 to 14 cups of popcorn, use the same amount of oil, 1/2 cup of corn kernels, 1/4 cup of granulated sugar, and 3/4 to 1 teaspoon of salt.

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large (6-quart) soup pot
  • 1 wooden spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Gather the ingredients.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put the vegetable oil and 3 kernels of popcorn in a large (6-quart) soup pot, cover, and set over medium heat until you hear the kernels pop, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: As soon as you hear the kernels pop, add the remaining popcorn kernels and sugar. Stir once or twice with a wooden spoon.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover the pot. Slip on oven mitts and cook, swirling the pan constantly, until the popping slows to about 2 seconds apart, about 1.5 minutes. Slide the pot off of the heat and let it stand, covered, until the popping stops, about 5 seconds.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Sprinkle the popcorn with salt, cover, and shake the pot to combine everything evenly. Pour the kettle corn out into a large, wide bowl immediately. Let the popcorn cool for 2 minutes so it crisps up before serving.

docs.title: Variations
docs.text:
• Substitute light brown sugar for white sugar for a more caramelized flavor.
  • Substitute truffle salt, smoked salt, Old Bay seasoning, or garlic salt for the regular salt for a sweet and savory flavor.
  • Add a dash of chili powder to the kettle corn along with the salt.
  • For a warm spice flavor, add 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice to the kettle corn along with the salt.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thespruceeats.com/kettle-corn-recipe-6833421

docs.title: Kickstarter Garlic Mushrooms
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 12 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup vegetable broth
  • 2 bags TJ's sliced mushrooms
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 1.25 tsp paprika
  • 0.25 tsp crushed red pepper
  • 2.5 Tbsp dry marsala wine
  • 1 cup vegetable broth
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.5 cup parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large skillet
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat 1/4 cup of vegetable broth in a large skillet. Add TJ's sliced mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes without stirring, then stir and cook 5 minutes more until mushrooms brown.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add garlic, paprika, and crushed red pepper. Cook for 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add dry marsala wine and cook until it evaporates.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add remaining vegetable broth and season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Bring to a boil then lower heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Pour mixture into a bowl and mix in chopped fresh parsley.

docs.title: Kickstarter Lemony Roasted Cauliflower
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 Tbsp tahini
  • 0.25 tsp paprika
  • 5 cups cauliflower
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 450°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a large bowl, whisk lemon juice, tahini, and paprika.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add cauliflower and toss to coat.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer to baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt. Bake 25 to 30 minutes, stirring halfway through.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Remove and season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Laugenbrezeln (German Lye Pretzels)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 27 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2.33 cups bread flour
  • 1 tsp table salt
  • 1 tsp instant yeast
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • 40 g lye
  • 0.5 cup baking soda
  • some pretzel salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 stand mixer
  • 1 lightly greased bowl

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Warning

Dipping pretzels in a lye solution before baking gives them their characteristic flavor and texture, but lye is caustic and can be dangerous if used incorrectly. (Lye dipped pretzels are perfectly safe to eat after baking; the heat of the oven neutralizes the alkali.) If dipping in lye, you must read "How to Work with Lye Safely" before proceeding. Alternatively, use the baking soda dip. Food-safe lye and pretzel salt are available at specialty baking shops and online. Kosher salt can be substituted for the pretzel salt, but it will melt more easily. We strongly recommend measuring the flour by weight. This is a great place to use a silicone baking mat, or you can line your baking sheet with parchment paper and coat it very generously with vegetable oil spray. Eat the pretzels plain or like the Germans do: sliced horizontally and spread with butter.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine bread flour, table salt, and instant yeast in bowl of stand mixer and stir to combine. Add 1 cup room-temperature water and butter. Fit mixer with dough hook and mix on low speed until all flour is moistened, about 1 minute. Increase speed to medium-low and continue to mix until dough is smooth and elastic, about 6 minutes longer, scraping down bowl and dough hook halfway through mixing. Shape dough into ball and transfer to lightly greased bowl. Cover and let rise until almost doubled in size, about 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Divide dough into 6 equal portions. Working with 1 piece of dough at a time, form into smooth balls. Cover with damp dish towel and let rest for 10 minutes. While dough rests, line rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place 1 dough ball seam side up on unfloured counter and flatten with your hand, pressing out as much air as possible. Using rolling pin, roll out dough to expel remaining air. Stretch and pat dough into roughly 4 by 8-inch rectangle with short side parallel to edge of counter. Starting at short side farthest away from you, roll dough into tight cylinder. Pinch seam to seal. Roll cylinder into 9-inch rope and place under damp dish towel. Repeat with remaining dough balls.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Working from center outward, roll first 9-inch rope into 28-inch rope, expelling any lingering air pockets as you go. Shape rope into inverted U with ends facing toward you. Cross rope ends once, and then again. Lift ends and attach them to other side of inverted U at about 10 o'clock and 2 o'clock. Press ends firmly into body of pretzel. Transfer to prepared sheet. Repeat with remaining 9-inch ropes. If pretzels have contracted, stretch each gently and return to sheet. Let sit for 10 minutes, uncovered. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 475°F. Line second rimmed baking sheet with silicone baking mat or parchment. If using parchment, spray very generously with vegetable oil spray.

docs.title: Step 6A
docs.text: FOR THE LYE DIP: Set up station as directed in "How to Work with Lye Safely." Grasp 1 pretzel with your gloved hands, pinching where ends meet body of pretzel, and transfer gently, presentation side down, to prepared lye bath. Let pretzel soak for 15 seconds, pressing occasionally to submerge. Using your gloved hands, grasp pretzel gently where ends meet body of pretzel and transfer, presentation side up, to prepared wire rack. Repeat with remaining pretzels. With your gloved hands, transfer pretzels to silicone-lined sheet.

docs.title: Step 6B
docs.text: FOR THE BAKING SODA DIP: Set wire rack in third rimmed baking sheet. Dissolve baking soda in 8 cups water in Dutch oven and bring to boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to simmer. Grasp 1 pretzel with your hands, pinching where ends meet body of pretzel, and transfer gently, presentation side down, to simmering water. Cook for 30 seconds, pressing occasionally with slotted spatula to submerge. Carefully flip pretzel with spatula, then lift with spatula and transfer to prepared wire rack. Repeat with remaining pretzels. Transfer pretzels to silicone-lined sheet.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Sprinkle pretzels evenly with pretzel salt. Bake until deeply browned, about 12 minutes. Transfer to second wire rack and let cool for at least 5 minutes before serving.

docs.title: Technique Do The Twist
docs.text:
After making an inverted U with the dough rope, forming the twist is simple.

  1. Cross rope ends once, and then again.
  2. Lift ends and attach them to curve of inverted U at about 10 o'clock and 2 o'clock. Press ends firmly into body of pretzel.

docs.title: The Truth About Lye
docs.text:
Dunking dough into a strong alkali such as lye is an admittedly curious thing to do, and there are theories as to how this process came about including one of a baker who mistakenly brushed his pretzel with cleaning fluid and decided to just go with it. But the base agent's impact on the dough is actually terrific: It boosts flavorful browning by accelerating Maillardization and caramelizing sugars in the dough. It imparts that unique pretzel smell and taste by inhibiting the creation of typical baked-good aroma compounds while spurring the formation of others and also adds unmistakable mineral flavor. And it gels surface starch, so the pretzels bake up smooth and shiny.

The stronger the alkali, the more intense and impressive the results, which is why German bakers use lye; it features a chart-topping pH of 14 and produces the ultimate pretzel experience. (Rest assured, you're not ingesting a dangerous chemical: The oven's heat completely neutralizes lye and makes it safe to consume.) That said, if sourcing and handling lye isn't for you, you can use a simmering baking soda solution instead. With a pH of roughly 8.3, it reacts less than lye and yields pretzels that are lighter in color and flavor, but the results are still impressive.

docs.title: How to Work with Lye Safely
docs.text: Dipping the dough in a lye solution gives traditional German pretzels their characteristic salinity; chew; and smooth mahogany exterior, but the strong alkali (sodium hydroxide) is corrosive and can burn your skin, so it must be handled with caution. (Don't worry about eating it: Baking neutralizes lye and makes it perfectly safe to consume.) Follow this guide to make your experience safe and comfortable.

docs.title: Lye-Dipping Station Setup
docs.text: Work in a well-ventilated room, on a stable and roomy counter near an empty sink, if possible. Do not use lye around small children or pets.

docs.title: Key Supplies
docs.text:
• Food-grade lye (also known as sodium hydroxide), available at baking shops or online
  • Long sleeves with long rubber gloves (such as for dishwashing: before wearing, blow up each glove like a balloon to ensure that there are no holes)
  • Eyeglasses or safety goggles
  • Digital scale that measures in grams
  • Rags in case of spills or drips
  • Counter protection (plastic wrap or large plastic bag)

docs.title: Method
docs.text:
1. Cover counter with plastic wrap or large plastic bag. Put on rubber gloves, making sure no skin on your arms is showing. Put on eyeglasses or safety goggles.
  2. Measure out exactly 40 grams of lye crystals into small bowl on scale. Set aside small bowl with lye crystals. Cover container of lye crystals and store in safe location per package instructions.
  3. Place large bowl on scale. Add 1,000 grams cold water to large bowl. Add reserved 40 grams lye crystals to water and whisk gently to dissolve. Order of operations is important: Always add lye to water instead of adding water to lye. (Lye solution in bowl will heat up slightly and will give off some vapors, which are barely. noticeable, but it's not advisable. to put your face directly over solution.) Rinse whisk well with cool water. Remove scale.
  4. Set wire rack in rimmed baking sheet and place to right of lye solution. Unwrap sheet of chilled pretzels, place to left of lye solution, and proceed with recipe. (Clear counter while pretzels bake; see below.)

docs.title: Cleanup
docs.text:
1. Still wearing gloves and eyewear, transfer bowl of lye solution to sink.
  2. Run cold water into bowl in gentle stream to dilute solution. Pour solution down drain. Flush drain and rinse bowl and sink thoroughly with plenty of cold water.
  3. Rinse rimmed baking sheets and wire rack with plenty of cold water. Dispose of plastic wrap or plastic bag on counter. Rinse gloves before removing. Once gloves are off, remove eyewear.

docs.title: If Your Skin Touches Lye
docs.text:
Avoid touching anything but the pretzels while working with the lye solution. Before touching something else, rinse your gloved hands with cool water and dry them with rags.

  • If you get lye solution on your skin: Rinse your skin immediately with cool running water for 15 minutes.
  • If you touch lye crystals: Brush them off with a dry cloth, and then rinse your skin with cool running water for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Loaded Vegan Potato Skins
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb potatoes
  • 0.5 cup dairy-free milk
  • 2 Tbsp tofu mayonnaise
  • 1 tsp salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika
  • some Creamy Vegan Cheese Sauce
  • some chives
  • some cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 potato masher or fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F and bake whole small potatoes until tender, approximately 30 minutes, depending on size of little potatoes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove potatoes from oven and allow to cool. Slice potatoes in half, scoop out pulp leaving 1/4 inch in shell. Place pulp in a medium bowl.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add 1/4 to 1/2 cup dairy-free milk, tofu mayonnaise, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and smoked paprika to potato in bowl and mash together using a potato masher or fork.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Fill potato skins with mashed potato mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Drizzle with Creamy Vegan Cheese Sauce, then top with more smoked paprika, chives, and cilantro.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/appetizer/loaded-vegan-potato-skins/

docs.title: Macaroni Salad
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 eggs
  • 1 chicken breast
  • 1 bag macaroni noodles
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.75 tsp onion powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 onion
  • 2 stalks celery
  • 0.25 cup pickle relish
  • 1 cup mayonnaise
  • 0.5 tsp mustard
  • some Lawry's seasoned salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large soup stock pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Boil eggs until done.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Boil chicken breast in a large soup stock pan until soft and tender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Take chicken breast out and pour macaroni noodles into the chicken stock with 1 tsp salt until done.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Shred chicken breast.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: While noodles are warm, pour garlic powder, onion powder, 1/2 tsp salt, and pepper over noodles, mix and stir.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Then add chopped onion, chopped celery, pickle relish, mayonnaise, and mustard in order given.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Chill overnight add more mayo if noodles are too dry. Salad needs to be creamy. Top with Lawry's seasoned salt.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Madre Crab Cakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 7 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 cup corn
  • 2 tsp onion
  • 2 tsp red bell pepper
  • 1 cup shredded hearts of palm
  • 3 Tbsp panko breadcrumbs
  • 1.5 Tbsp vegan mayonnaise
  • 1 Tbsp crushed nori
  • 1 tsp parsley
  • 0.5 tsp Old Bay seasoning
  • 0.25 tsp mustard powder
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 pinch pepper
  • 0.5 cup Spicy Vegan Mayo
  • 0.25 cup cilantro
  • some lemon wedges

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large nonstick pan
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 large, deep nonstick or cast-iron pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Make the crab cakes: In a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil. Add the corn, minced onion, and red bell pepper and cook until just tender, 5 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a food processor and pulse to form a coarse puree.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, add the corn mixture, shredded hearts of palm, panko breadcrumbs, vegan mayonnaise, crushed nori, parsley, Old Bay seasoning, mustard powder, salt, and pepper. Stir gently to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: On a large plate, place a generous layer of breadcrumbs. Line another plate or baking sheet with parchment. Using a 4-cup measure, scoop out portions of the crab cake mixture, flatten slightly with your hands, and dredge in the breadcrumbs. Place on the parchment-lined plate and repeat with the remaining mixture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a large, deep nonstick or cast-iron pan over medium-high heat, add a thin layer of oil. When the oil is shimmering, working in batches if needed, fry the crab cakes until golden, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate and repeat with the remaining crab cakes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve: Top each crab cake with a tablespoon or two of the Spicy Vegan Mayo and sprinkle the cilantro on top. Serve with the lemon wedges.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Gracias Madre Cookbook

docs.title: Maple Harissa Glazed Sweet Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 large sweet potatoes
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 3 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 2 Tbsp Traditional Tunisian Harissa
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 cup TJ's sweet & spicy pecans

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mandoline or sharp knife
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 10-inch pan
  • 1 foil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Wash sweet potatoes. Do not peel; leave skins on.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Using a mandoline or sharp knife, thinly slice the potatoes and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add olive oil, maple syrup, Traditional Tunisian Harissa, and salt to a large bowl and mix until combined.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add potatoes to the bowl and toss until evenly coated in the mixture.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a 10-inch pan arrange potato slices upright and in a row. Repeat with the remaining empty space in the middle of the pan.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Peel and slice the garlic and nestle between potato slices, evenly distributed throughout.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: While baking, chop the TJ's sweet & spicy pecans. At the 30 minute mark, remove foil and sprinkle pecans over potatoes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Bake an additional 20 minutes, uncovered.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Serve warm and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Maple Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Pumpkin Seeds
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs Brussels sprouts
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 2 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 0.25 cup pumpkin seeds

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Peel off any yellowed or wilted leaves from the outside of Brussels sprouts and trim bottoms.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Halve any that are the size of walnuts or larger.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place on a rimmed baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss until coated.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Roast, stirring once or twice, until sprouts are browned and just tender when pierced at the base with a paring knife, about 25 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Drizzle with maple syrup and toss with pumpkin seeds. Roast 5 minutes more until pumpkin seeds are just toasted.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/recipes/maple-roasted-brussels-sprouts-pumpkin-seeds

docs.title: Maple Roasted Carrots with Tahini & Pomegranate
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs carrots
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 2 Tbsp tahini
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 1 tsp soy sauce
  • 1 tsp maple syrup
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 2 Tbsp water
  • 2 Tbsp pomegranate arils
  • 2 Tbsp pistachios
  • 1 Tbsp parsley or cilantro

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Peel the carrots and trim the tips.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix together the olive oil and maple syrup. Toss the carrots in the mixture. Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast in preheated oven until tender, about 20 to 30 minutes, turning once in the middle.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Mix the tahini, lemon juice, soy sauce, maple syrup, grated garlic, and enough water to get the sauce to the desired consistency.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Drizzle the roasted carrots with the tahini sauce. Top with pomegranate arils, chopped pistachios, and parsley or cilantro. Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • HEAT Culinary

docs.title: Mashed Sweet Potatoes with Caramelized Shallots
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2.5 lbs sweet potatoes
  • 4 shallots
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 8 sprigs thyme
  • 3 Tbsp butter
  • 0.25 tsp black pepper
  • 0.25 cup whole milk

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 fork
  • 1 sheet pan
  • 1 medium skillet
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat the oven (with the oven rack in the middle) to 400°F. Pierce the sweet potatoes several times with the tines of a fork. Place them on a sheet pan and bake for about 45 minutes, or until very tender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While the potatoes bake, caramelize the shallots: thinly slice the shallots into rings. In a medium skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Cook, stirring often, for 8 to 10 minutes, until tender and caramelized. Pull the thyme leaves from their sprigs and stir into the shallots. Remove from the heat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cut open the potatoes and scoop the flesh into a bowl. Add the butter, black pepper, and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Mash. Add the whole milk and mash until creamy. If you want them a little creamier, add a little more milk.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve the sweet potatoes topped with the caramelized shallots.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://jessicaseinfeld.com/recipes/mashed-sweet-potatoes-with-caramelized-shallots

docs.title: Mexican Coleslaw
docs.text: Total Time 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 head cabbage
  • 1 red onion
  • 1 bunch cilantro
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • 0.17 cup white vinegar
  • 0.17 cup apple cider vinegar
  • 0.75 cup sugar
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 2 tsp salt

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: For the slaw, combine cabbage, red onion, and cilantro.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: For the dressing, combine olive oil, white vinegar, apple cider vinegar, sugar, pepper, and salt.

docs.title: Miso-Glazed Bok Choy
docs.text: Total Time 2 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 small head bok choy
  • 1 miso glaze

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 metal or cast iron skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Slice bok choy in half lengthwise and heat a metal or cast iron skillet over medium heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Brush miso glaze over bok choy. Once pan is hot, lay down bok choy cut-side down and sear for 1 to 2 minutes. Flip and sear on other side.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/easy-vegan-ramen/#wprm-recipe-container-35499

docs.title: Miso-Glazed Carrots
docs.text: Total Time 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup carrots
  • 1 miso glaze

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 foil
  • 1 small mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F and line a baking sheet with foil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Chop 1 cup carrots into 1/4-inch thick pieces on an angle. To a small mixing bowl, add miso glaze and toss carrots.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Arrange on a foil-lined baking sheet in an even layer and roast for 20 to 25 minutes, stirring once at the halfway point, or until tender when pierced and deep golden brown.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/easy-vegan-ramen/#wprm-recipe-container-35499

docs.title: Mushroom Medley
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some champignons
  • some oyster mushrooms
  • some boletus
  • some slippery jack mushrooms
  • some olive oil
  • some parsley
  • some salt
  • some garlic

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Saute champignons, oyster mushrooms, boletus, slippery jack mushrooms in olive oil along with parsley, salt, and garlic.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: No Bake Sunshine Energy Bites
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 25 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 medjool dates
  • 1 cup raw pistachios
  • 1 cup raw walnuts
  • 1 Tbsp turmeric powder1
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 cup white chocolate chips
  • 1.25 cup shredded coconut

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor or blender
  • 1 spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak the medjool dates in hot water for 2 to 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place raw pistachios and raw walnuts into a food processor or blender. Blend until tiny pieces are formed.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add turmeric powder1, salt, black pepper, vanilla extract and dates. Blend again until the dates are fully incorporated into the mixture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add white chocolate chips and 1 cup of shredded coconut to the mixture. Blend quickly until incorporated (approximately 5 seconds).

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
With a spoon, scoop out a bit of the mixture, roll it into a small, 1 inch ball and then top with remaining shredded coconut. Repeat this process until all of the mixture has been used.

Note

If the ball falls apart easily add more medjool dates and blend again.

docs.title: Source
docs.text:
• Applied Kitchen

  1. Turmeric is known to stain so wearing gloves is recommended. ↩↩

docs.title: Parsnip Purée
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb parsnips
  • 2 cups heavy cream
  • 2 sprigs thyme
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 4 oz butter
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • some parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 pot
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To a pot containing slightly salted water, add peeled and sliced parsnips and bring to boil. Simmer on low heat for about 15 minutes until the parsnips are tender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To a saucepan, add heavy cream, thyme, and blanched garlic cloves. Cook it over low heat and bring it to a simmer. Transfer the parsnips into the food processor and reserve some of the cooking liquid.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add butter and 2-3 tablespoons of cooking liquid and blend the mixture. Add strained heavy cream mixture, a pinch of salt and pepper, and blend until smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Garnish the puree with a teaspoon of melted butter and freshly chopped parsley.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://thefoodxp.com/gordon-ramsay-parsnip-puree-recipe/

docs.title: Pasta Salad
docs.text: Total Time 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb pasta salad pasta
  • some garlic salt
  • some onion powder
  • some salt
  • some Italian seasoning
  • 0.5 cup broccoli
  • 2 Tbsp olives
  • 1 roasted tomato
  • 0.5 red onion
  • 1 tsp garlic
  • some slices of salami or ham
  • some slices of provolone cheese
  • 1 cruet Good Seasons Italian dressing

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Boil pasta salad pasta.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Sprinkle garlic salt, onion powder, salt, and Italian seasoning on noodles while hot so that the flavor absorbs into the noodles.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the broccoli, finely chopped olives, roasted tomato, red onion, crushed garlic, slices of salami or ham, slices of provolone cheese mixing in the Good Seasons Italian dressing last. Then mix, toss and stir.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Leave in the refrigerator at least one hour before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Pea Purée
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 16 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 Tbsp butter
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 medium shallots
  • 2 lb frozen peas
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp white pepper
  • 1 handful mint (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 mesh colander (optional)
  • 1 rubber spatula (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Aromatics: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and shallots, sauté 3 minutes until soft, but don't let them go golden.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook peas: Add frozen peas and vegetable broth, increase heat to bring to simmer then cover and reduce heat to medium. Simmer 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Reserve Liquid: Remove 1/3 cup liquid from the saucepan, reserve.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Blitz: Transfer all peas and remaining liquid into a food processor. Add salt and white pepper, and mint (optional) if using. Blitz on high for 1 minute until smooth.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Optional straining: For extra smooth, press through a mesh colander (optional) with a rubber spatula (optional) (it's easy).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Adjust consistency: Use Reserved Liquid as needed to achieve the desired consistency – I like a soft, dolloping consistency. Sometimes people want it looser. Add more salt and pepper if desired – remember, this is not supposed to be strongly flavored or seasoned!

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Serve warm. Either dollop/smear onto plates, or serve in bowls for people to help themselves.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.recipetineats.com/pea-puree-side-sauce/

docs.title: Peanut Butter Bites
docs.text: Total Time 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup almonds
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 cup pitted dates
  • 0.5 cup peanut butter
  • 1 pinch salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a food processor, pulse the almonds until a coarse meal forms. Add vanilla, cinnamon, pitted dates, peanut butter, and salt.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Pulse everything together until mixture begins to stick. Roll dough into scant tablespoon-size balls. Press down with a fork to make a cross hatch.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Keep covered and chilled in the fridge.

docs.title: Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Protein Bites
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 10-12 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp honey or maple syrup
  • 0.5 cup creamy peanut butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 0.5 cup rolled oats
  • 0.5 cup mini chocolate chips
  • 0.25 cup hemp seeds

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large mixing bowl, add honey or maple syrup, creamy peanut butter and vanilla extract. Stir with a spatula until mixture is thick and sticky.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Fold in rolled oats, mini chocolate chips and hemp seeds. Combine all ingredients using a spatula.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Scoop out a portion of dough and roll between your palms to form a bite-size ball. Repeat with the remaining dough to create approximately 10 to 12 bites.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Store in an airtight container and refrigerate.

Tip

If the mixture is too dry or crumbly, add a teaspoon of warm water.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Pearl Couscous
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 14 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 cup pearl couscous
  • 1.5 cups water or vegetable broth
  • some kosher salt
  • 0.25 cup parsley (optional)
  • 1 lemon zest (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a medium saucepan, heat about 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil over medium-high until just shimmering. Add the pearl couscous and toss around to toast (the couscous pearls should turn a nice golden brown).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Boil 1.5 cups of water or vegetable broth and add it to the toasted pearl couscous. Season with kosher salt.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bring to a boil, then turn the heat to low.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover and cook for about 14 minutes or until the pearl couscous is tender.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove from the heat.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Season and enjoy! Taste and adjust salt to your liking. To finish, add the parsley (optional) and lemon zest (optional), toss and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.themediterraneandish.com/pearl-couscous-recipe/

docs.title: Pickled Red Onions
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.02 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 small red onions
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp mixed peppercorns
  • 2 cups white vinegar
  • 2 cups water
  • 0.33 cup cane sugar
  • 2 Tbsp sea salt

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 mandoline
  • 2 16-ounce jars
  • 1 medium saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Thinly slice the red onions (it's helpful to use a mandoline), and divide the onions between 2 16-ounce jars or 3 (10-ounce) jars. Place the garlic and mixed peppercorns in each jar, if using.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat the white vinegar, water, cane sugar, and sea salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar and salt dissolve, about 1 minute. Let cool and pour over the onions. Set aside to cool to room temperature, then store the onions in the fridge.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Your pickled onions will be ready to eat once they're bright pink and tender - about 1 hour for very thinly sliced onions, or overnight for thicker sliced onions. They will keep in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.loveandlemons.com/pickled-red-onions/

docs.title: Pommes Dauphine
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb russet potatoes
  • 2 qt cold water
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • some pepper
  • 0.5 recipe choux pastry (made with equal parts milk and water)
  • 2 qt vegetable oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium bowl
  • 1 colander
  • 1 3-quart saucepan
  • 1 ricer
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 flexible spatula
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 wire rack
  • 1 Dutch oven

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place peeled and cut into 3/4-inch cubes russet potatoes in a medium bowl and cover with cool water. Using your hands, swish potatoes until water turns cloudy, about 30 seconds. Using a colander, drain potatoes, discarding the cloudy soaking water. Return potatoes to bowl, refill with cool water, and repeat process until water runs clear.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Transfer drained potatoes to a 3-quart saucepan and add 2 quarts (1.9L) cold water and salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to maintain a simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender and offer little resistance when pierced with a paring knife, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes in colander, then rinse with hot running water for 30 seconds to wash away excess starch.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Return drained potatoes to now-empty saucepan. Heat on low heat, shaking saucepan constantly to evaporate moisture from potatoes, about 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pass potatoes through a ricer onto a rimmed baking sheet, spreading them into an even layer, and allow them to cool slightly, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer riced potatoes to a medium bowl. Using a flexible spatula, stir in melted butter and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add choux pastry, and stir until thoroughly combined, about 1 minute. Cover with plastic wrap, pressing plastic against surface of the potato-choux mixture to prevent a skin from forming. Set aside (mixture can be held at room temperature for up to 2 hours, or refrigerated for up to 8 hours and brought to room temperature before frying).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 200°F (95°C). Set a wire rack inside a rimmed baking sheet and line rack with paper towels. In a large Dutch oven, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat to 340°F (171°C).
