Using a 1-tablespoon cookie scoop, scoop dough and carefully add to hot oil, dropping portion from as close to the oil’s surface as possible to minimize splashing. (Alternatively, using a spoon, scoop roughly 1-tablespoon of dough, and using a second spoon, gently form into a rough, oblong shape, then carefully add to hot oil). Working quickly, repeat process with 9 more portions of dough (for a batch of 10). Fry, using a spider or slotted spoon to turn pieces as they cook, until puffed and golden brown on all sides, about 3 1/2 minutes. Transfer pommes dauphine to prepared wire rack, season with salt, and transfer to oven to keep warm.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Return oil to 340°F (171°C) and repeat frying with remaining dough, continuing to work in batches of 10. Transfer pommes dauphine to a serving bowl and serve immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.seriouseats.com/pommes-dauphine-recipe-5217321

docs.title: Pommes Mont D'or
docs.text: Total Time 27 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 kg Yukon gold potatoes
  • 4 egg yolks
  • 2 Tbsp salt
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 pinches nutmeg
  • 100 g butter
  • 100 g grates Gruyere or Comte cheese
  • some all-purpose flour
  • 2 egg
  • some breadcrumbs

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small bowl
  • 1 saucepan
  • 1 colander
  • 1 baking tray
  • 1 fork
  • 1 vegetable mill
  • 1 shallow tray
  • 1 piping bag

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Wash, peel, and cut the Yukon gold potatoes in half. Separate the egg yolks into a small bowl and beat into an omelet.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat the oven at 200°C (400°F)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place the potatoes in a saucepan filled with cold water and 2 tablespoons of salt and bring the water to the boil. When the water boils, cook the potatoes for around 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender but still firm. When done, which is when the potatoes fall off of a knife when poked, transfer the potatoes to a colander and leave to drain for 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer the potatoes to a baking tray and break them apart with a fork, then leave to dry in the oven for 3 minutes,

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Use the vegetable mill to purée the potatoes into a saucepan. Place the saucepan over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes to remove any moisture, then season with salt and pepper along with the nutmeg.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Next, add half the 50 to 100 g of butter and mix until it is melted into the potatoes before adding the grates Gruyere or Comte cheese. When the cheese has melted into the potatoes, add the rest of the butter.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Now turn the heat off and mix in the egg 1 tablespoon at a time to avoid the mixture becoming too runny.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: When all the eggs are added, turn the heat back on to low and cook stirring constantly for a 2 minutes until the consistency of the potato mixture resembles a dough and stops sticking to the pan.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Now scrape the potato mixture into a shallow tray and let sit until lukewarm before packing the potato mixture into a piping bag.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: To make classic swirls, pipe walnut size rosettes on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper. Spoon a tablespoon of melted butter over each and a sprinkle of cheese (optional). Bake at 180 - 200°C for 15 minutes until golden.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: To make the potato nests, pipe 2 circles of around 8 cm in diameter, one on top of the other. Spoon a tablespoon of melted butter over each and a sprinkle of cheese (optional). Bake for 15 minutes until golden.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: To make the croquettes, place the potato mixture in the freezer until completely cold but not frozen. Roll the mixture into medium size balls, then coat in the all-purpose flour followed by the egg and finally the breadcrumbs. Deep fry at 180 degrees Celsius for 3-4 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thefrenchcookingacademy.com/recipes/pommes-mont-dor

docs.title: Potato Au Gratin
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 1.50 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 lbs Yukon gold potatoes
  • 4 cups heavy cream
  • 1 tsp nutmeg
  • 8 cloves garlic
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 4 oz cheddar
  • 4 oz Gruyere
  • 2 oz Mozzarella
  • some butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large plate
  • 1 8 x 11 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 275°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Slice the Yukon gold potatoes into 1/4 inch slices and immediately put them in a pot with 4 cups of heavy cream with the nutmeg, garlic and salt and pepper. Cook the potatoes until 90% cooked. Be sure they do not break up too much.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Removed the partly cooked potatoes into a large plate or another lasagna pan to stop the cooking process.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the cheddar, Gruyere, and Mozzarella to the cream mixture, reserving 1/2 of the mozzarella for the top. Mix well until all the cheese has melted. Add salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Rub the 8 x 11 pan's bottom with butter and arrange your first layer of the potatoes, top with some cream mixture, top with more potatoes and continue until you have used all your potatoes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Top the dish with the remaining mozzarella. Place the lasagna pan into a cookie sheet (in case your dish overflow) and place in a preheated oven until golden brown, about 1.5 hours.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/side-dishes/potato-au-gratin-steakhouse-style/

docs.title: Potato Salad
docs.text: Total Time 1.40 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 large eggs
  • 8 medium Russet potatoes
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 4 tsp white pepper
  • 0.5 tsp garlic salt
  • 0.5 tsp onion powder
  • 0.5 onions
  • 4 stalks celery
  • 0.5 cup sweet pickle relish
  • 1 tsp yellow mustard
  • 1 cup mayonnaise
  • 0.5 small can olives
  • some paprika

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Boil eggs for 7 to 9 minutes in salted water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Boil Russet potatoes approximately 45 minutes in salted water until soft and you can easily put a knife through it.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: As soon as your potatoes are done, peel them and cut them in cubes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While potatoes are still warm, sprinkle salt, white pepper, garlic salt, and onion powder on top of them and carefully stir.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Then add the 5 chopped eggs, chopped onions, celery and sweet pickle relish and stir carefully.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Mix in yellow mustard, mayonnaise, and olives 30 minutes later.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Top with sliced egg and paprika, refrigerate 3-6 hours or overnight.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Quinoa
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 25 minutes  Uncooked  Cooked  Liquid  Serves 133 g 400 g 300 g 4 200 g 600 g 450 g 6 267 g 800 g 600 g 8

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup quinoa
  • 1.75 cups vegetable broth

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium pot
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Rinse the quinoa.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine the quinoa and vegetable broth in a medium pot. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat, and simmer for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove from the heat and let it sit, covered for 10 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Fluff with a fork.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.loveandlemons.com/quinoa/

docs.title: Red Cabbage Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6-8 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 head red cabbage
  • 2 tsp garlic puree
  • 0.25 cup grated sweet red pepper
  • 1 small red onion
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 3 Tbsp sugar
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • some salt
  • 1 Tbsp beef bouillon powder
  • 0.5 cup red wine vinegar
  • 0.5 cup apple cider vinegar
  • 1 cup oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Shred red cabbage into bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Combine garlic puree, grated sweet red pepper and red onion.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Blend together lemon juice, sugar, pepper, salt to taste, beef bouillon powder, red wine vinegar, and apple cider vinegar and oil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour over cabbage and mix well.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Let stand overnight to mellow flavors.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Makes 6-8 servings.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Ritz Crackers
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 36 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 3 tsp baking powder
  • 1 Tbsp sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 8 Tbsp cold butter
  • 2 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 0.67 cup water
  • 1 egg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheets
  • 1 parchment paper
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 2 inch ravioli stamp
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400 F and line baking sheets with parchment paper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour, baking powder, sugar, and 1/2 tsp of salt to the food processor and give a quick pulse to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add 6 tablespoons of cold butter a few small pats at a time, and pulse to combine then. Then slowly add vegetable oil slowly with the food processor running.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While the food processor is pulsing, add water a little bit at a time until a dough starts to form into a ball.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: On a floured surface, roll dough out as thin as you can with a rolling pin. Add more flour if needed when it sticks.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Use 2 inch ravioli stamp to cut the dough out and add cut outs to baking sheets. Continue to roll out dough and cut out crackers until all the dough is used up and place them on parchment lined baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Poke holes in each of the crackers: 2, 3, and 2.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Brush the cracker cut outs with the egg wash and sprinkle with a kosher salt

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bake in oven for 10 minutes in the center rack.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Melt remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and then brush with melted butter while still hot.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Cool and enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.servedfromscratch.com/ritz-crackers-from-scratch/

docs.title: Roasted Chickpea Snack
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 15-oz can chickpeas
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 2 Tbsp cornstarch
  • some olive oil
  • 0.13 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp chili powder
  • 0.25 tsp cumin
  • 0.25 tsp paprika
  • 0.25 tsp coriander
  • 0.25 tsp curry powder
  • 0.25 tsp garlic powder

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 colander
  • 1 paper towel
  • 1 medium bowl
  • 1 fork
  • 1 medium bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Drain chickpeas in a colander and let them dry almost completely. Pat dry with a paper towel if needed.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a medium bowl, toss the chickpeas, quarter teaspoon of salt, and cornstarch together lightly with a fork. The chickpeas should all be coated with some cornstarch. Let it sit for 5 minutes while you preheat the air fryer to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spray the olive oil onto the chickpeas. Toss them around and spray them again. Try to get a light but complete coating of oil on them. Spread the chickpeas out into the air fryer and cook them for 15 to 20 minutes, shaking them every five minutes or so to ensure even cooking.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a medium bowl, combine salt, chili powder, cumin, paprika, coriander, curry powder, and garlic powder. Immediately toss with spices while hot. Eat at room temperature.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.skinnytaste.com/roasted-chickpea-snack-2-pts/
  • https://lifehacker.com/food-drink/best-air-fried-chickpeas-recipe

docs.title: Roasted Delicata Squash
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 large delicata squash
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp cayenne pepper

docs.title: Sweet Variation
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1/2 tsp cinnamon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 spoon
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper or a silicone mat
  • 1 cutting board
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cut the ends off of the delicata squash and cut in half lengthwise. Using a spoon, scrape out the seeds and filling.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 450°F (232°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Place squash halves cut-side down on a cutting board. Cut into 3/8-inch slices; transfer slices to a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil; add salt and cayenne pepper. Toss until squash is well coated. Arrange squash in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.

Sweet Variation

A sweet variable can be made by using maple syrup, olive oil, and cinnamon.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake in the preheated oven until the bottoms are browned and squash is tender, 12 to 18 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/260734/roasted-delicata-squash/

docs.title: Roasted Fennel with Garlic and Thyme
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 large bulb fennel
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 tsp thyme
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp black pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F (204°C) and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. If making a larger batch, use more baking sheets.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Chop off and discard the fennel stalks and fronds (or save for making vegetable broth). Then slice the fennel bulb in half through the core and cut out and discard the triangular core from each half. Thinly slice both halves of the fennel bulb — 1 large bulb should yield about 2.5 cups or 200 g sliced.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the sliced fennel to the parchment-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with the remaining ingredients (garlic powder, thyme, salt, and black pepper). Toss to evenly coat and arrange in a single layer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake for 15 minutes, then toss, arrange back in a single layer, and bake for another 5 to 10 minutes until golden brown on the edges and tender when pierced with a fork. Watch closely near the end to avoid burning.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Best served warm with other Italian-inspired recipes or on pasta, salads, or pizza. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/perfect-roasted-fennel-with-garlic-thyme/#wprm-recipe-container-104127

docs.title: Rosemary Roasted Cashews
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 cups 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.25 lbs cashew nuts
  • 2 Tbsp rosemary
  • 0.5 tsp cayenne
  • 2 Tbsp dark brown sugar
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 1 Tbsp melted butter

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 ungreased baking sheet
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place the cashew nuts on an ungreased baking sheet and bake for about 10 minutes until they are warmed through.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, combine the rosemary, cayenne, dark brown sugar, salt and melted butter in a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Toss the warm nuts with the rosemary mixture until the nuts are completely coated. Serve warm.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/ina-garten/rosemary-roasted-cashews-recipe-1941586

docs.title: Sautéed Mushrooms
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 lb 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.25 lbs mushrooms
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 0.5 tsp vegetable oil
  • 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • some vegetable broth (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a cold skillet, add any variety of mushrooms and a 1/4 cup of water. Cook on high until the pan is dry and the mushrooms have collapsed, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add a half teaspoon of vegetable oil to brown the mushrooms.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add a little bit of unsalted butter for gloss and richness and season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Season with vegetable broth (optional) if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XLPLCmwBLBY

docs.title: Scottish Oatcakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 20 47 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 oz Scottish oatmeal
  • 2.5 oz all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp granulated sugar
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp baking powder
  • 4 Tbsp melted unsalted butter
  • 3 Tbsp water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 parchment
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 rolling pin
  • 1 2.5-inch biscuit cutter
  • 1 thin metal spatula
  • 1 wire rack

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 325°F. Line rimmed baking sheet with parchment.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Whisk together Scottish oatmeal, all-purpose flour, granulated sugar, salt, and baking powder in bowl. Stir in melted unsalted butter and water until all ingredients are moistened. Transfer mixture to lightly floured work surface and press and knead until mixture comes together into dough. Press to 1/2-inch thickness. Using rolling pin, roll dough to 12-inch round of about 1/8-inch thickness. Using 2.5-inch biscuit cutter, cut out rounds. Using thin metal spatula, transfer to prepared baking sheet. Scraps may be rerolled and cut until all dough is used.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text:
Bake until oatcakes are firm to touch, 24 to 27 minutes, rotating sheet halfway through baking. Transfer oatcakes to wire rack to cool completely, about 20 minutes. Serve. (Oatcakes may be stored for up to 3 weeks; if they soften, recrisp in 325°F oven for 5 to 7 minutes.)

Tip

Serve with cheese and honey or salted butter and jam or marmalade.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Skillet-Steamed Haricots Verts
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 12 oz haricots verts
  • 0.25 cup water
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 Tbsp shallot

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 12-inch skillet

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

We developed this recipe with beans that were about 1/4 inch wide. If your haricots verts are skinnier, decrease the water to 3 tablespoons and decrease the covered cooking time to 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Arrange haricots verts in even layer in 12-inch skillet. Add water and sprinkle evenly with salt. Cook over medium-high heat until water is sizzling. Cover and continue to cook until beans are bright green and crisp tender, about 3 minutes longer, tossing beans twice during cooking. Reduce heat to medium. Add unsalted butter and minced shallot and continue to cook, uncovered, tossing beans frequently, until water has evaporated, about 1 minute longer. Season with salt to taste, and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Spicy Garlic Edamame
docs.text: Total Time 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 16 oz edamame
  • 3 quarts salted water
  • 0.5 tsp arrowroot starch
  • 1 Tbsp coconut oil
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp ginger
  • 0.5 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 1.5 Tbsp tamari
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 0.5 tsp toasted sesame oil (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small mixing bowl
  • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook the edamame according to package instructions — microwaving (covered), steaming, or boiling all work equally well. We boiled our edamame in 3 quarts of salted water for 8 minutes} drained, and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: While the edamame cooks, combine the water and arrowroot starch in a small mixing bowl or measuring cup. Whisk until the starch is dissolved. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Next, melt the coconut oil in a large rimmed stainless steel or non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Once melted, add the garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes. Sauté for 1 to 2 minutes until fragrant and lightly sizzling, but be careful not to let the garlic burn or it can become bitter.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the tamari and maple syrup and stir to evenly combine, then add the arrowroot/water slurry. Bring this mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes until sauce is thick and sticky.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove from heat, add the edamame, and stir to combine with sauce. Finish with the toasted sesame oil (optional), toss, and enjoy! Delicious alongside stir-fries, fried rice, or noodles!

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Best when fresh, but it will keep for 2-3 days in the refrigerator. Reheat in a microwave or covered and steamed in a skillet. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/spicy-garlic-edamame-the-ultimate-appetizer/

docs.title: Steamed Broccoli with Vinaigrette
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 to 6 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs broccoli
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • some vinaigrette

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Steam broccoli until barely tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Season with salt.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Serve with vinaigrette.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Strawberry Protein Bites
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 15 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Dough
docs.text:
• 6 pitted medjool dates
  • 0.25 cup hazelnuts
  • 0.75 cup cashews
  • 1 cup freeze-dried strawberries
  • 2 Tbsp maple syrup or honey
  • 3 Tbsp strawberry protein powder

docs.title: Ingredients - Coating
docs.text: • 1.5 cups freeze-dried strawberries

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 food processor or high-speed blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak pitted medjool dates in hot water for 10 minutes then drain any excess liquid.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add hazelnuts and cashews to a food processor. Grind to create a fine flour.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Mix in dates, freeze-dried strawberries, maple syrup or honey, and strawberry protein powder and process to form into a sticky dough.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Scoop out a portion of dough and roll between your palms to form a bite-size hall Repeat with the remaining dough to create approximately 15 bites.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pulse the freeze-dried strawberries in a food processor or high-speed blender to create a powder. Roll the bites in the powder to coat them.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Store in an airtight container and refrigerate.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Applied Kitchen

docs.title: Tater Tots
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 tsp onion powder
  • 0.25 tsp oregano
  • 0.25 tsp dill
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 3 cups vegetable oil
  • 2 Tbsp parsley (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 Dutch oven
  • 1 box grater
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 large stockpot or Dutch oven

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place russet potatoes in a Dutch oven and cover with cold salted water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, covered, until parboiled, about 6 to 7 minutes; drain well and let cool.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Using a box grater, finely shred potatoes. Using a clean dish towel or cheese cloth, drain potatoes completely, removing as much water as possible.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Transfer potatoes to a large bowl. Stir in all-purpose flour, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano and dill; season with salt and pepper, to taste. The mixture should be workable but dry. Form potatoes into tots.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat vegetable oil in a large stockpot or Dutch oven over medium high heat until it registers 360°F on a deep-fry thermometer.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Working in batches, add tots to the Dutch oven and cook until evenly golden and crispy, about 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Alternatively, spritz the air fryer basket with cooking oil spray. Arrange about half of the tater tots in the basket and spritz them lightly with cooking oil spray. Set the air fryer temperature at 375°F and set the timer for 15 minutes. Shake the basket every 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Serve immediately, garnished with parsley (optional), if desired.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://damndelicious.net/2015/04/10/homemade-tater-tots/
  • https://www.thespruceeats.com/air-fryer-tater-tots-4798915

docs.title: The Best Crispy Roast Potatoes Ever Recipe
docs.text: Total Time 1.22 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp kosher salt
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 4 lbs Yukon gold potatoes
  • 5 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 small handful rosemary
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • some black pepper
  • 1 small handful parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat oven to 450°F (230°C) (or 400°F (200°C) if using convection). Heat 2 quarts (2L) water in a large pot over high heat until boiling. Add 2 tablespoons kosher salt (about 1 ounce; 25g), baking soda, and Yukon gold potatoes and stir. Return to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook until a knife meets little resistance when inserted into a potato chunk, about 10 minutes after returning to a boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, combine olive oil, duck fat, or beef fat with finely chopped rosemary, garlic, and a few grinds of black pepper in a small saucepan and heat over medium heat. Cook, stirring and shaking pan constantly, until garlic just begins to turn golden, about 3 minutes. Immediately strain oil through a fine-mesh strainer set in a large bowl. Set garlic/rosemary mixture aside and reserve separately.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: When potatoes are cooked, drain carefully and let them rest in the pot for about 30 seconds to allow excess moisture to evaporate. Transfer to bowl with infused oil, season to taste with a little more salt and pepper, and toss to coat, shaking bowl roughly, until a thick layer of mashed potato–like paste has built up on the potato chunks.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Transfer potatoes to a large rimmed baking sheet and separate them, spreading them out evenly. Transfer to oven and roast, without moving, for 20 minutes. Using a thin, flexible metal spatula to release any stuck potatoes, shake pan and turn potatoes. Continue roasting until potatoes are deep brown and crisp all over, turning and shaking them a few times during cooking, 30 to 40 minutes longer.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Transfer potatoes to a large bowl and add garlic/rosemary mixture and minced parsley. Toss to coat and season with more salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.seriouseats.com/the-best-roast-potatoes-ever-recipe

docs.title: Three-Bean Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup cider vinegar
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp honey
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 small red onion
  • 8 oz yellow wax beans
  • 8 oz Romano beans
  • 1 15-oz can kidney beans
  • 0.25 cup parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 large pot

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Be sure to set up the ice bath before cooking the wax and Romano beans, as plunging them in the cold water immediately after blanching them retains their bright colors and ensures that they don't overcook.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Whisk cider vinegar, olive oil, honey, minced garlic, salt, and pepper together in large bowl. Stir in thinly sliced red onion and set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bring 4 quarts water to boil in large pot over high heat. Fill large bowl halfway with ice and water. Add trimmed and halved on bias yellow wax beans, trimmed and halved on bias Romano beans, and 1 tablespoon salt to boiling water and cook until crisp-tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Drain beans, then transfer immediately to ice bath. Let beans cool completely, about 5 minutes, then drain again and pat dry with paper towels.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add wax and Romano beans, kidney beans, and minced fresh parsley to vinaigrette and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Tomato Feta Pasta Salad
docs.text: Total Time 12 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Salad
docs.text:
• 0.5 lb fusilli pasta
  • 1 lb tomatoes
  • 0.75 cup Kalamata olives
  • 1 lb feta
  • 6 sun-dried tomatoes

docs.title: Ingredients - Dressing
docs.text:
• 5 sun-dried tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp red wine vinegar
  • 6 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 tsp capers
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.75 tsp pepper

docs.title: Ingredients - Garnish
docs.text:
• 1 cup Parmesan
  • 1 cup parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cook the fusilli pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water with a splash of oil to keep it from sticking together. Boil for 12 minutes, or according to the directions on the package. Drain well and allow to cool. Place the pasta in a bowl and add the tomatoes, Kalamata olives, feta and chopped sun-dried tomatoes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: For the dressing, combine the sun-dried tomatoes, red wine vinegar, olive oil, garlic, capers, salt and pepper in a food processor until almost smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour the dressing over the pasta, sprinkle with the Parmesan and parsley, and toss well.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/ina-garten/tomato-feta-pasta-salad-recipe-1948516

docs.title: Tomato Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 1 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 small bunch basil
  • some salt
  • some paper
  • 1 clove garlic
  • some olive oil
  • 1 splash white wine vinegar
  • 300 g mixed cherry tomatoes

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add basil leaves to blender with pinch of salt and paper, a peeled clove of garlic, two logs of extra virgin olive oil, and a splash of white wine vinegar. Whiz until dark green oil. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Halve or quarter mixed cherry tomatoes and poor dressing over them. Scatter with basil leaves and a pinch of salt or two.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.bigoven.com/recipe/jamie-oliver-tomato-salad/2172710

docs.title: Unsweetened Applesauce
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 625 g 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 medium apples
  • 0.67 cup water
  • some granulated sugar (optional)
  • 1 tsp lemon juice
  • 0.25 tsp cinnamon (optional)
  • 0.25 tsp nutmeg (optional)
  • 0.25 tsp vanilla

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 sauce pan or pan
  • 1 blender or immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Rinse, peel and chop the apples. While chopping, make sure to remove the seeds and pith from the center of the apples.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Place them in a sauce pan or pan.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add 1/2 to 2/3 cups of water. The water should just about cover the apples.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bring this mixture to a simmer on a low to medium heat. You can add granulated sugar (optional) if you prefer.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: If the apples are very sweet, then you don't need to add sugar. If they are less sweet or not sweet, then add sugar as needed.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add lemon juice.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: You can also add spices like cinnamon (optional) or nutmeg (optional) or vanilla extract at this step.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Simmer till the apples are softened. Keep stirring occasionally when the apples are getting cooked.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: If the water dries out and the apples start sticking to the pan, then add more water.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Once the mixture becomes warm, you can either mash the apples or puree them in a blender or immersion blender.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Mashing gives a slight chunky texture. Blending them will give a smooth texture.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: The final color of the applesauce depends on the variety of apples used.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Pour applesauce in bottles or bowls. Once cooled refrigerate them for about a week or freeze for 1 to 2 months.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.vegrecipesofindia.com/applesauce-recipe-no-sugar/

docs.title: Vegan Mashed Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 8 Yukon gold potatoes
  • 0.25 cup chives (optional)
  • 4 Tbsp vegan butter
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 potato masher

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: For creamier mashed potatoes, peel your Yukon gold potatoes at this time. Otherwise, just halve your potatoes and place in a large saucepan or pot and cover with water by 1 inch.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bring to a light boil over high heat and add 1 tsp of sea salt (as original recipe is written, adjust if altering batch size), and cook for 25 to 30 minutes or until very tender. They should effortlessly slide off a knife when pierced with a knife.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: While the potatoes are cooking, chop up your chives (optional) and measure your vegan butter.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once tender, drain your potatoes and place them back in the hot pot off the heat for 1 minute to evaporate any additional water.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Mash your potatoes using a potato masher until fluffy.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add in vegan butter, garlic, salt, and black pepper and stir to combine. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Lastly top with chives (optional, stir and serve as is or with your favorite gravy (or mushroom gravy). Leftovers will keep in the fridge covered for up to a few days. Not freezer friendly.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/the-best-damn-vegan-mashed-potatoes/

docs.title: Baked Potato Soup
docs.text: Total Time 6.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 5 lbs Russet potatoes
  • 1 large yellow onion
  • 10 cloves garlic (whole, crushed, or minced)
  • 1 Tbsp seasoned salt or all-purpose seasoning
  • 8 cups vegetable stock
  • 16 oz cream cheese
  • some shredded cheese (optional)
  • some green onions (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 slow cooker
  • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add Russet potatoes, yellow onion, garlic (whole, crushed, or minced), seasoned salt or all-purpose seasoning, and vegetable stock to slow cooker.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook on high for 6 hours or low for 10 hours.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove 1/3 of soup and using immersion blender, blend in cream cheese.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Top with shredded cheese (optional) and green onions (optional) if desired.

docs.title: Black Bean & Butternut Soup
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 yellow onion
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 head cabbage
  • 3 cups butternut squash
  • 3 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp cocoa powder
  • 1 pinch cayenne
  • 2 cups black beans
  • 4 corn tortillas
  • some salt
  • some cilantro
  • 1 avocado

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 immersion blender
  • 1 baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat olive oil in large pot and sauté yellow onion and garlic. Add cabbage, cubed butternut squash, and vegetable broth. Cover pot and cook over gentle simmer, 15 to 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add cumin, cocoa powder, and cayenne and black beans and cook for 10 minutes. Pulse soup with immersion blender.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: For tortilla crisps, preheat oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cut 4 corn tortillas into matchstick strips. Spread on baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil and salt. Bake 10 to 15 minutes, giving the pan a gentle shake halfway through.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Garnish soup with tortilla strips, chopped cilantro, and avocado.

docs.title: Chickenless Sausage and Lentil Soup
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 yellow onion
  • 2 zucchini
  • some salt
  • 1 pkg TJ's Italian sausage-less sausage
  • 1 14-oz can tomatoes
  • 1 cup red lentils
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • some lemon wedges
  • some fresh herbs

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large pot, sauté diced yellow onion and chopped zucchini. Season with salt and sauté until onion is translucent.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add diced TJ's Italian sausage-less sausage and sauté until lightly browned. Add diced tomatoes, red lentils, and vegetable broth. Season and bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until lentils are cooked through. Taste and adjust seasoning, if needed.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve with lemon wedges and fresh herbs, if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Chili Colorado
docs.text: Total Time 2.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 medium brown onions
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 2 lbs top sirloin cubes
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 1 tsp garlic salt
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 can red chili sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 crock pot (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Sauté brown onions for 3 minutes until soft and clear, add garlic and sauté for 1 minute then add top sirloin cubes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: After meat is browned, add your seasoning, salt, pepper, garlic salt, and garlic powder.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Sauté for 1 minute, add 1 large can of red chili sauce, and simmer on low for 2 hours or put in crock pot (optional) to simmer all day.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Chili Verde
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 medium brown onions
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 4 green chilis
  • 2 small cans canned green chilis (alternative)
  • 2 lbs pork tenderloin cubes
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 1 tsp garlic salt
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 can green chili sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 crock pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Sauté chopped brown onions for 3 minutes until soft and clear, add garlic and green chilis or canned green chilis (alternative) and saute for 1 minute more then add the pork tenderloin cubes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: After meat is browned add your seasoning, salt, pepper, garlic salt, and onion powder, and sauté for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add a can of green chili sauce and simmer on low until meat is tender or put in crock pot to simmer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Water may be added to thin out the chili if needed.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Chipotle Corn Chowder
docs.text: Total Time 5 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 cups [vegetable broth][1]
  • 1.5 cups frozen corn
  • 1 cup green bell pepper
  • 1 cup red bell pepper
  • 1 cup carrots
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 0.13 tsp cayenne pepper
  • 0.67 cup evaporated fat-free milk
  • 3 Tbsp flour
  • 0.5 pkg Morning Star black bean crumbles
  • 0.25 cup cheese

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large saucepan
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 whisk

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large saucepan, combine vegetable broth, frozen corn, chopped green bell pepper, chopped red bell pepper, sliced carrots, cumin, and cayenne pepper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In a small bowl, whisk together evaporated fat-free milk and flour. Stir into soup mixture and bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Mix in Morning Star black bean crumbles and heat through. Mix in cheese and stir until melted through.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Cream of Mushroom
docs.text: Total Time 23 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 50 g butter
  • 3 medium shallots
  • 500 g button mushrooms
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 40 g unsalted butter
  • 40 g all-purpose flour
  • 800 ml whole milk
  • 2 small bay leaves
  • 0.5 onion
  • 2 cloves
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp black pepper
  • 1 pinch nutmeg
  • 3 oz milk
  • 200 ml whipping cream
  • 6 croutons
  • 1 small nub butter
  • 1 tsp parsley
  • 1 dash dry sherry or port wine (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 small saucepan
  • 1 fine-mesh strainer
  • 1 rubber spatula
  • 1 stick blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Add the butter to a saucepan over medium-low heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: When butter melts, add the shallots and cook (sweat) the shallots for 2 to 3 minutes while stirring. Avoid browning the shallots.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Then add the button mushrooms and stir to combine with the shallots. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: When moisture starts to release from the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper. Continue cooking over medium-low heat and keep stirring the mushrooms so they release most of their moisture (about 10 minutes). Turn the heat off when the mushrooms just begin to dry and set them aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To make the béchamel sauce, start by preparing a roux. Add some unsalted butter to a small saucepan over medium-low heat. When the butter melts, add the all-purpose flour and mix to combine. Cook for 2 minutes while stirring occasionally and then turn the heat off and set the saucepan aside to allow the roux to cool.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Now you need to make a flavored milk for the béchamel. In another saucepan, add the whole milk, 2 small bay leaves, 1/2 onion with cloves, sea salt, black pepper and a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg. Place the saucepan over medium-high heat and bring to a gentle boil while stirring. The flavored milk is ready when the onion starts "dancing" or bobbing around.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Remove the milk from heat and let it rest/infuse for 5 minutes. Remove the onion, cloves and bay leaves after infusing.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add the roux to the flavored milk and whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Place the saucepan over medium heat and, while whisking constantly, bring the béchamel to a simmer. The sauce should start to thicken slightly when ready.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Place a fine-mesh strainer over a pot of cooked mushrooms and slowly pour in the béchamel. Use a rubber spatula to help scrape off any sauce stuck to the saucepan.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Mix to combine. Use a stick blender to further break down the mushrooms and help extract more flavor. Another round of straining and pressing the mushrooms through the wire mesh sieve adds more flavor and smoothness to the soup.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: To finish the soup, add 3 ounces of milk and some whipping cream and mix well to combine. Gently heat to a simmer over medium heat. Adjust the seasoning to your taste.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: This creamy mushroom soup can be served in a bowl with croutons, a small nub of butter and chopped parsley. A drizzle of dry sherry or port wine (optional) further enhances the flavor.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.thefrenchcookingacademy.com/recipes/cream-of-mushroom-soup

docs.title: Creamy Broccoli Bisque
docs.text: Total Time 1.50 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 4
  • 1 head broccoli
  • some milk
  • 1 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 cup onion
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp thyme
  • 1 cup (100 g) celery
  • 1 cup (145 g) carrot
  • 1 cup (225 g) potato
  • 4 cups vegetable stock
  • 0.66 cups heavy cream
  • 2.66 oz English cheddar cheese
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.33 carrot
  • 4 tsp parsley
Serves 12
  • 3 heads broccoli
  • some milk
  • 3 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 3 cups onion
  • 10 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp thyme
  • 3 cups (300 g) celery
  • 3 cups (435 g) carrots
  • 3 cups (675 g) potatoes
  • 10 cups vegetable stock
  • 2 cups heavy cream
  • 8 oz English cheddar cheese
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 carrot
  • 0.25 cup parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 immersion blender
  • 1 large soup kettle

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Take some of the broccoli into florets and poach them separately from the soup in vegetable stock or milk. You will add those at the end when the soup has been pulverized with the immersion blender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large soup kettle, heat the unsalted butter and when hot add the onion and cook until translucent. (This could take a few minutes). Add the garlic and when fragrant add thyme, celery, carrots and potatoes and broccoli.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the vegetable stock enough to barely cover all your vegetables.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook for about 90 minutes or until all vegetables are soft and cooked.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text:
Using your immersion blender, process the soup until all the ingredients are nice and smooth. Add the heavy cream and the English cheddar cheese; adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper. Add the shredded carrots, parsley and the reserved florets.

Info

The broccoli can be substituted for cauliflower

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/soups/creamy-cauliflower-bisque/

docs.title: Creamy Roasted Carrot Soup
docs.text: Total Time 1.05 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lb carrots
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 1 medium yellow onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 tsp coriander
  • 0.25 tsp cumin
  • 4 cup vegetable broth
  • 2 cup water
  • 1.5 Tbsp butter
  • 1.5 tsp lemon juice
  • some black pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 baking sheet
  • 1 Dutch oven or soup pot
  • 1 wooden spoon or sturdy silicone spatula
  • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup, if desired.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To prepare your carrots, peel them and then cut them on the diagonal so each piece is about ½″ thick at the widest part.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place the carrots on the baking sheet. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil and ½ teaspoon of the salt. Toss until the carrots are lightly coated in oil and seasonings. Arrange them in a single layer.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Roast the carrots until they’re caramelized on the edges and easily pierced through by a fork, 25 to 40 minutes, tossing halfway. (Heirloom carrot varieties will roast in as little as 25 minutes, but regular carrots are more dense and typically require 35 to 40 minutes.)

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once the carrots are almost done roasting, in a Dutch oven or soup pot, warm the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add the yellow onion and ¼ teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is softened and turning translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the garlic, coriander and cumin (if following a variation, see recipe notes for additions). Cook until fragrant while stirring constantly, about 30 seconds to 1 minute. Pour in the vegetable broth and water, while scraping up any browned bits on the bottom with a wooden spoon or sturdy silicone spatula.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add the roasted carrots to the pot when they are out of the oven. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook for 15 minutes, to give the flavors time to meld.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Once the soup is done cooking, remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes. Then, carefully transfer the hot soup to a blender, working in batches if necessary. (Do not fill past the maximum fill line or the soup could overflow!)

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Add the butter, lemon juice (or lime, if following the Thai variation), and several twists of black pepper. Blend until completely smooth. Add additional salt and pepper if necessary, to taste. Add another tablespoon of butter if you’d like more richness, or a little more lemon juice if it needs more zing. Blend again, and serve.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text:
This soup keeps well in the refrigerator, covered, for about four days, or for several months in the freezer.

Carrot Ginger Soup Variation

Add freshly grated ginger with the garlic and ground spices. Use 1 teaspoon for subtle ginger flavor, 2 teaspoons for more prominent flavor, or 1 tablespoon for relatively spicy carrot-ginger flavor.

Curried Carrot Soup Variation

Add some curry powder with the garlic and ground spices. Use 1 teaspoon (mild) or up to 2 teaspoons (somewhat spicy), depending on your preferences. For curried ginger soup, also add 2 teaspoons finely grated fresh ginger at this time.

Thai Curried Carrot Soup Variation

Add Thai red curry paste with the garlic and ground spices (be sure to choose a vegan/vegetarian option if you’re avoiding fish produces, such as Thai Kitchen). Use 1 ½ teaspoons (mild) or up to 1 tablespoon (relatively spicy), depending on your preferences. Substitute lime juice for the lemon. You might like to garnish your bowls of soup with some chopped roasted peanuts and fresh cilantro leaves.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-carrot-soup-recipe/#tasty-recipes-35404-jump-target

docs.title: Eggplant Stew
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 eggplant
  • 6 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 red onion
  • 1 red or yellow bell pepper
  • 2 tsp paprika
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 5 plum tomatoes
  • 1 15-oz can chickpeas
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 cup chopped parsley
  • some quinoa

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 skillet
  • 1 Dutch oven

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Chop eggplant into cubes. Heat olive oil in skillet and sauté for 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a heated Dutch oven, add diced red onion, chopped red or yellow bell pepper, and paprika. Sauté 8 to 10 minutes; add garlic during last few minutes

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir in tomato paste, and moisten with a few tablespoons of water.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add quartered plum tomatoes, eggplant, drained chickpeas, 1 cup water, 1 tsp salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Simmer, covered, about 20 minutes, stirring once or twice. Stir in chopped parsley and serve over quinoa or other favorite grain.

docs.title: French Onion Soup
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 0 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 4 lbs onions
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp sugar
  • 1 cup dry red wine
  • 8 cups vegetable broth
  • 4 sprigs thyme
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 6 oz baguette
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 1 cup Gruyère
  • 0.5 cup Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 Dutch oven
  • 1 wooden spoon
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 12-ounce ovensafe crocks
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Be patient when caramelizing the onions; the entire process takes 55 to 70 minutes. If you don't have ovensafe soup crocks, form six individual piles of croutons on a baking sheet, cover them with the cheese, and broil them on the middle oven rack until the cheese is melted, 1 to 3 minutes. Then use a spatula to transfer the crouton portions to the individual filled soup bowls.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Melt unsalted butter in Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Stir in halved and sliced thin onions, 1 teaspoon salt, and sugar. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions release their liquid and are uniformly translucent, about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Uncover and cook until liquid has evaporated and browned bits start to form on bottom of pot, 5 to 10 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and continue to cook, uncovered, until onions are caramel colored, 30 to 40 minutes longer, stirring and scraping with wooden spoon as browned bits form on bottom of pot and spreading onions into even layer after stirring. (If onions or browned bits begin to scorch, reduce heat to medium-low.)

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in dry red wine, scraping up any browned bits, and cook until nearly evaporated, about 1 minute. Stir in vegetable broth, thyme sprigs, bay leaves, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Increase heat to high and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: While onions simmer, adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 350°F. Toss baguette, olive oil, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper together in bowl. Transfer to rimmed baking sheet and bake until golden and crisp, 15 to 18 minutes. Remove sheet from oven and set aside. Increase oven temperature to 500°F.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Set six 12-ounce ovensafe crocks on second rimmed baking sheet. Discard thyme sprigs and bay leaves and season soup with salt and pepper to taste. Divide soup evenly among crocks (about 1-1/2 cups each). Divide 1 cup Gruyère evenly among crocks, top with croutons, and sprinkle with remaining Gruyère, then Parmesan. Bake until cheeses are melted and soup is bubbly around edges, 5 to 7 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 4
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 8 oz black-eyed peas
  • 1 bunch chopped dill
  • 1 fennel bulb
  • 4 garlic
  • 0.5 cups olive oil
  • 1 large red onion
  • salt
  • 1 large tomato
  • 2 tsp tomato paste
  • some water or vegetable broth

docs.title: Slow Cooker
docs.text:
Serves 8
  • 4 bay leaves
  • 16 oz black-eyed peas
  • 2 bunches chopped dill
  • 2 fennel bulbs
  • 8 garlic cloves
  • 1 cup olive oil
  • 2 large red onions
  • salt
  • 2 large tomatoes
  • 4 tsp tomato paste
  • 6 cups water or vegetable broth

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat half the olive oil over medium heat and cook the red onion, garlic, and fennel bulb stirring occasionally, until soft (about 12 minutes). Add the black-eyed peas and toss to coat in the oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the tomato, tomato paste and enough water or vegetable broth to cover the beans by about an inch. Add the bay leaves. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until the black-eyed peas are about half way cooked. (Check after 40 minutes, but it may take over an hour.)

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the chopped dill and season with salt.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
Continue cooking until the black-eyed peas are tender. Remove, pour in remaining raw olive oil and serve.

Slow Cooker

If cooking in a slow cooker, double the recipe except for vegetable broth, use 6 cups. Cook on high for 9 hours.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• Blue Zones
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Lemony Lentil Soup
docs.text: Total Time 21 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 medium onion
  • 2 medium carrots
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 6 cups vegetable stock
  • 1.5 cups red lentils
  • 0.67 cup corn
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp curry
  • 1 pinch saffron
  • 1 pinch cayenne
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 lemon zest and juice

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté chopped onion and diced carrots for 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute more.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir in vegetable stock, dried red lentils, corn, cumin, curry, saffron, cayenne, salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bring to a boil then simmer for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Blend with immersion blender and add zest and juice of 1 lemon.

docs.title: Mexican Lentil Soup
docs.text: Total Time 54 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 large carrot
  • 1 medium onion
  • 3 stalks celery
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp cumin
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 2 chipotle chiles in adobo
  • 3 cups lentils
  • 1 large Russet potato
  • 1 15-oz can diced tomatoes
  • 10 cups vegetable broth
  • some cilantro
  • some lime wedges

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large saucepan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and sauté carrot, onion, and celery, and garlic for 5 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir, then add chipotle chiles in adobo and sauté for 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add lentils, Russet potato, and diced tomatoes in their juice.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook, covered, for 30 to 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve with cilantro and lime wedges.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Can serve over rice, if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Minestrone Soup
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Serves 6
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 cup onion
  • 1 Tbsp garlic
  • 1 cup carrots
  • 1 cups celery
  • 1 Tbsp thyme
  • 1 cup tomatoes
  • 1.5 cups potatoes
  • 5 cups vegetable stock
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.5 lb green beans
  • 2 Tbsp cup parsley
  • 0.25 lb cavatelli pasta, or any small pasta
  • 2 Tbsp basil
  • 0.5 28-oz can cannellini beans
  • 0.5 head escarole lettuce or green leaves
  • 2 Tbsp pesto
  • 0.5 cup Parmesan
Serves 12
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cups onion
  • 2 Tbsp garlic
  • 2 cups carrots
  • 2 cups celery
  • 2 Tbsp thyme
  • 2 cups tomatoes
  • 3 cups potatoes
  • 10 cups vegetable stock
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 lb green beans
  • 0.25 cup parsley
  • 0.5 lb cavatelli pasta, or any small pasta
  • 0.25 cup basil
  • 1 28-oz can cannellini beans
  • 1 head escarole lettuce or green leaves
  • 0.25 cup pesto
  • 1 cup Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large soup kettle

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large soup kettle, heat the olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the onion and cook until translucent.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the garlic and when fragrant, add the carrots, celery, thyme, tomatoes if stock doesn't contain tomatoes, and potatoes. Add the vegetable stock until it just covers the top of the vegetables and salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook for about 30 minutes at medium heat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add green beans and chopped parsley cook for 15 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the cavatelli pasta, or any small pasta, basil and cook for another 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add the cannellini beans and the chiffonade escarole lettuce or spinach.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Thin the pesto with a little bit of olive oil so the pesto is liquid.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add the pesto and Parmesan as a decoration just before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://chefjeanpierre.com/recipes/appetizers/minestrone-soup-recipe/

docs.title: Plant-Based Chili
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 23 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 2 onions
  • 2 red bell peppers
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 Tbsp chili powder
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp chipotle in adobe sauce
  • 0.5 tsp oregano
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 12 oz plant-based ground meat
  • 1 15-oz can kidney beans
  • 1 28-oz can tomatoes
  • 1 15-oz can tomato sauce
  • 1 cup water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 Dutch oven
  • 1 wooden spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat vegetable oil in Dutch oven over medium heat until shimmering. Add finely chopped onions, red bell peppers, garlic, chili powder, cumin, chipotle in adobe sauce, oregano, salt, and pepper and cook, stirring frequently, until vegetables are softened, 8 to 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in plant-based ground meat and cook, breaking up meat with wooden spoon, until firm crumbles form, about 3 minutes. Stir in kidney beans, tomatoes and reserved juice, tomato sauce, and water. Scrape up browned bits on bottom of pot using metal spatula or wooden spoon.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Bring to simmer, then reduce heat to low and simmer until chili is slightly thickened, 15 to 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve.

docs.title: Add Extra Liquid
docs.text:
Note

Although you may see a little moisture or fat left in the pan when you're cooking plant-based ground meat, it tends to release a smaller amount of liquid than animal meat does when cooked. In our chili recipe, we compensate for this by adding a cup of water to achieve the ideal consistency.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Potato Soup
docs.text: Total Time 13 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 large Russet potatoes
  • 0.5 lb sliced bacon
  • 1 large brown onion
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2 cups half-and-half
  • 0.5 tsp white pepper
  • 0.5 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 tsp onion powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 cup Parmesan cheese
  • 1 cup extra sharp cheddar cheese
  • some bacon chives

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Bake the Russet potatoes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Peel the potatoes and cut and cube them. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cut the sliced bacon into small pieces and place in soup pan and fry until brown and crisp. Place bacon on paper towel to drain and set aside for garnish.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Place the sliced brown onion in the bacon grease and sauté until onions are soft and clear, add garlic and potatoes and sauté for 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add very hot water just enough to cover the potatoes and bring to a boil, simmer for 10 minutes, add 2 cups of half-and-half or mild along with white pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: When mixture comes to a boil, bring fire to low and add Parmesan cheese and extra sharp cheddar cheese little by little until it all melts.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Place mixture into a blender, or you can blend it in the soup pan with a BRAUN blender until smooth.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: You can serve it with sharp cheddar cheese and bacon chives on the top, whatever you prefer. Serve with warm bread and salad.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Roasted Sweet Garlic & Almond Soup
docs.text: Total Time 1.17 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 bulbs garlic
  • 1 white onion
  • some olive oil
  • 9 oz half-and-half
  • 1 qt vegetable broth
  • 1 loaf ciabatta
  • 2 Tbsp white wine vinegar
  • 150 g almonds
  • some cilantro
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Roast garlic bulbs in oven at 350°F for 30 to 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Meanwhile, in a large pot, sauté chopped white onion in olive oil for 10 minutes. Add half-and-half and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil and simmer 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove garlic from oven. Allow to cool slightly then squeeze out cloves. Whisk into soup.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove crust from ciabatta, rip bread into small pieces and add to soup. Add white wine vinegar and simmer for 5 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Toast almonds, then add to soup and mix with immersion blender. Top with cilantro, if desired. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Roasted Tomato Soup
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 1 hour 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Soup
docs.text:
• 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 medium red onions
  • 1 tsp cayenne pepper
  • some olive oil
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 pinch pepper
  • 1 tsp brown sugar
  • 1 tsp balsamic vinegar
  • 3.5 lbs tomatoes
  • 1 qt vegetable stock
  • 4 oz heavy cream

docs.title: Ingredients - Pesto
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp pine nuts
  • 3 oz sun-dried tomatoes
  • 1 pinch pepper
  • 2 oz Parmesan
  • 1 dash olive oil
  • 1 dash tomato oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 roasting tray
  • 1 potato masher
  • 1 stick blender
  • 1 mortar and pestle

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: On medium heat, place a roasting tray on the hob. Add the garlic, red onions, and cayenne pepper first. Make sure your onions are well coated with olive oil, and cook for 5 minutes. A pinch of salt and pepper, brown sugar, and balsamic vinegar should be added to the tomatoes that have been cored and halved. Stir it well and bake for 25 minutes. Continue cooking the tomatoes for another 5 minutes or until they begin caramelizing.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove the roasting tin from the oven after 25 minutes and place it back on the back burner at medium heat. Add the vegetable stock and heat until boiling, then simmer for a few minutes. Stir in the heavy cream and simmer for 2 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: If you prefer a chunky rustic soup, you can use a potato masher to ‘blend’ your soup to a thick consistency. The flavors will all mix in your soup rather than if you blend it. Using a stick blender straight in the pan can achieve a traditional cream blend.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: In a pan, toast the pine nuts until golden brown and crispy.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Grind the sun-dried tomatoes in a mortar and pestle until you have an oily paste.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add a pinch of pepper and the pine nuts, and continue grinding until you obtain the desired consistency for your pesto.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Grate the Parmesan cheese and add a dash of olive oil (add some tomato oil to give it a little extra flavor.) You should have four heaping teaspoons to add to your tomato soup!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://hellskitchenrecipes.com/gordon-ramsay-tomato-soup/

docs.title: Sam's Sweet Potato Soup
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp avocado oil
  • 0.5 jumbo yellow onion
  • 2 medium sweet potato
  • 0.5 cup Israeli couscous
  • 6 cups vegetable broth
  • 3 Tbsp taco seasoning
  • 0.5 bag TJ's Tuscan kale
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 large bowls

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large pot, heat avocado oil over medium heat. Add yellow onion and sweet potato and sauté 5 minutes. Add Israeli couscous and sauté 5 minutes to toast. Add 2 tablespoons water to pot, cover and cook 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Remove lid and add vegetable broth and 2 to 3 Tbsps of taco seasoning. Reduce heat and simmer until sweet potatoes are fork-tender, 25 to 30 minutes. Add TJ's Tuscan kale and simmer 5 minutes more until wilted. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Ladle soup into large bowls and serve with crusty bread for dipping.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: :peanut: Slow Cooker Vegan African Peanut Stew
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 8.25 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 15-oz can chickpeas (drained)
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp coriander
  • 0.25 tsp cayenne
  • 1 15-oz can diced tomatoes
  • 0.5 cup peanut butter
  • 5 cups sweet potatoes, cut into 2" cubes
  • 1 onion, diced
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 inch ginger, grated
  • 4 handfuls spinach

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 slow cooker
  • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Put chickpeas (drained), vegetable broth, salt, cumin, coriander, cayenne, diced tomatoes, peanut butter, sweet potatoes, cut into 2" cubes, onion, diced, garlic, minced, and ginger, grated in slow cooker.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir in spinach just before serving and cook 15 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Use immersion blender to thicken to taste. Serves 6.

docs.title: Spinach Tortellini Soup by Joanna Gaines
docs.text: Total Time 8 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp butter
  • 0.5 medium onion
  • 1 Tbsp garlic
  • 6 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 can fire-roasted tomatoes
  • 0.5 tsp Italian seasoning
  • 1 9-oz pkg tortellini
  • 1 can cannellini beans
  • 6 cups spinach
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 2 Tbsp basil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.5 lemon juice
  • 1 cup Parmesan
  • 1 loaf French bread

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large soup pot
  • 1 bowls

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large soup pot, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté, stirring constantly, until the onion is soft and tender, 3 to 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the vegetable broth, fire-roasted tomatoes, and Italian seasoning and bring to a rolling boil. Add the tortellini and cannellini beans and cook until the tortellini are cooked through, about 2 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Reduce the heat to medium and add the spinach, parsley, basil, and salt and pepper to taste and stir until the spinach is just wilted, 1 to 2 minutes. Squeeze the lemon juice over the soup.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Ladle into bowls, sprinkle with the Parmesan, and serve immediately with torn French bread for dipping.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 2 months. Let the soup thaw before reheating.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://food52.com/recipes/82976-spinach-tortellini-soup-recipe-joanna-gaines
  • Recipe Box

docs.title: Split Pea Soup
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 6 cups vegetable broth
  • 2 cup dried green split peas
  • 1 medium onion
  • 2 stalks celery
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 tsp marjoram
  • 0.5 tsp basil
  • 0.25 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 1 cup chopped carrots
  • 5 Tbsp shredded carrots
  • 2 green onions

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large saucepan
  • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large saucepan, combine vegetable broth, dried green split peas, onion, celery, garlic, marjoram, basil, cumin, salt, pepper, and chopped carrots.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour or until peas are tender, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: When peas have fully cooked, puree with an immersion blender.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Garnish with shredded carrots and sliced green onions.

docs.title: Tante Myrn's Split Pea Soup
docs.text: Total Time 2.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg green peas
  • 3 carrots
  • 3 stalks celery
  • 1 onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 potatoes
  • 1 ham bone or ham hock
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp marjoram
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 tsp celery salt
  • 1 cup ham pieces

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 hand blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: 1 Package dried green peas

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: 3 carrots chopped

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: 3 stalk celery chopped

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: 1 onion chopped

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: 2 cloves garlic

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: 2 potatoes cut in cubes

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Boil green peas, carrots, celery, onion, garlic, and cubed potatoes in 6 cups of water until tender with a ham bone or ham hock, about 1.5 to 2 hours.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Then blend all together with a hand blender until soup is smooth.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Then add 1 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp marjoram, 1/2 tsp pepper, 1/2 tsp celery salt and 1 cup cubed or diced ham pieces.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Simmer for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Enjoy!

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Tante Myrna Seccia

docs.title: Vegan Mushroom Stew
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 28 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 yellow onion
  • 1 cup carrot
  • 1 cup celery
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 lb mushrooms
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 2 tsp thyme
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 0.5 tsp sage
  • 2 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 cup balsamic vinegar
  • 2 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 lb yellow potatoes
  • 1 cup split red lentils
  • 1 15-oz can tomato sauce
  • 3 cups vegetable broth
  • 2 bay leaves
  • some parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add yellow onion, carrot, celery, and a couple of pinches of salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add mushrooms, garlic, thyme, oregano, and sage.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add all-purpose flour; cook and stir for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Deglaze with balsamic vinegar and soy sauce.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add yellow potatoes, split red lentils, tomato sauce, vegetable broth, and bay leaves.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cook to just below boiling over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Reduce heat; simmer 10 to 15 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender. Season with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Remove bay leaves and garnish with parsley.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Tip: Serve with mashed potatoes and bread.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Costco Connection

docs.title: Vichyssoise (Leek & Potato Soup)
docs.text: Total Time 50 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and sliced
  • 3 cups sliced white leek
  • 1.5 qts vegetable stock1
  • 1 pinch salt
  • some white pepper
  • 1 cup whipping cream
  • 3 Tbsp minced chives

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 pot
  • 1 immersion blender

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Simmer the Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and sliced, and sliced white leek in them in vegetable stock (along with a pinch of salt) until tender. Julia Child recommends simmering in a partially covered pot for about 40 to 50 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Once the vegetables are tender, you can purée the soup using an immersion blender, or carefully transfer the soup to a high-powered pitcher blender and purée until smooth.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Season with salt and white pepper to taste and stir in 1/2 to 1 cup of whipping cream.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text:
I served the soup with a garnish of minced chives as Julia suggests.

Note

White pepper is recommended in this recipe because it blends in with the color of the soup. If all you have is black pepper, that’s perfectly fine to use.

docs.title: Source
docs.text:
• https://www.tasteofhome.com/article/vichyssoise-recipe-julia-childs-favorite-soup/

  1. The original recipe calls for chicken stock or broth. ↩

docs.title: Shallot, Onion, & Chive Tart
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 to 6 1.88 hours

docs.title: Ingredients - Shortcrust Pastry
docs.text:
• 225 g all-purpose flour
  • some salt
  • 60 g cold unsalted butter
  • 60 g cold vegetable shortening
  • 5 Tbsp cold water

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 8 shallots
  • 3 large onions
  • 25 g unsalted butter
  • 1 Tbsp sunflower oil
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 4 medium eggs
  • 2 medium egg yolks
  • 200 ml heavy cream
  • 1.5 Tbsp wholegrain mustard
  • 1 Tbsp chives
  • some salt
  • some white pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 bowl
  • 1 plastic wrap
  • 1 large frying pan
  • 1 23 cm loose-based fluted tart tin
  • 1 fork
  • 1 baking parchment or foil
  • 1 baking beans, or uncooked rice or lentils

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To make the pastry, put the all-purpose flour into a bowl and mix in the salt. Add the cold unsalted butter and cold vegetable shortening and rub into the flour with your fingertips until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Alternatively, do this in a food processor or mixer and then transfer to a bowl.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Now work in just enough (3 to 5 Tbsp) cold water to bring the dough together. When it begins to stick together, gently knead it into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for around 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, for the filling, thinly slice the shallots and onions. Heat the unsalted butter and sunflower oil in a large frying pan over a medium-low heat. Add the shallots and onions with a pinch of salt and cook slowly for at least 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are very soft and golden. Season with pepper and more salt if needed. Leave to cool.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat your oven to 200°C / gas 6 / 400°F and have ready a 23 cm loose-based fluted tart tin, 3.5 cm deep.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured surface to a 3 mm thickness and use it to line the tart tin, leaving the excess hanging over the edge. Keep a little uncooked pastry back in case you need to patch any cracks later. Prick the pastry base with a fork. Line the pastry with baking parchment or foil and then fill with baking beans, or uncooked rice or lentils.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Bake blind for 15 minutes, then remove the parchment and baking beans and return the pastry to the oven for about 8 minutes or until it looks dry and faintly colored. Trim away the excess pastry from the edge. Use a tiny bit of the reserved raw pastry to patch cracks or holes if necessary. Turn the oven down to 180°C / gas 4 / 350°F.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: For the filing, whisk the eggs, egg yolks and heavy cream together, then whisk in the wholegrain mustard and chives. Season with salt and white pepper.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Spoon the cooled onion mixture into the pastry case and spread it evenly, then carefully pour on the egg mixture. Bake in the oven for 30 to 35 minutes, until the filling is just set and golden. Leave in the tin for 5 minutes, then unmold. Serve warm or cold..

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.paulhollywood.com/post/shallot-onion-chive-tart

docs.title: Adas Polo (Persian Lentil Rice)
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 48 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup lentils
  • 1 cup raisins
  • 1 cup barberries
  • 3 cups water
  • 2 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 onion
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • 2 pinches saffron
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 2 cups Basmati rice
  • 3 Tbsp saffron

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 large pan
  • 1 large nonstick pot
  • 1 pan
  • 1 colander
  • 1 serving dish

docs.title: Step 1
