docs.title: Indian Spiced Lentil Burgers
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 46 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup brown or green lentils
  • 1 15-oz can chickpeas
  • 2 scallions
  • 0.33 cup cilantro or flat-leaf parsley
  • 1 lemon
  • 2 tsp garam masala
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp black pepper
  • 1 pinch cayenne pepper
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • some shredded romaine and carrots
  • 1 cucumber
  • some hot sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 strainer
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 large

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Fill a medium saucepan with water 2 inches from the top. Place over medium-high heat and let come to a boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put the brown or green lentils in a strainer and rinse under cold running water. Add the lentils to the boiling water. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 25 to 35 minutes, until tender (or according to package directions). Drain into the strainer and pass under cold running water to cool. Squeeze out excess water.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Put the lentils in a food processor and pulse until just about smooth.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Drain the chickpeas in a strainer and rinse. Add them to the lentils. Pulse a few times until the chickpeas are roughly chopped, not smooth. Transfer the mixture to a medium bowl.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Thinly slice the white and light green parts of scallions and chop the cilantro or flat-leaf parsley; add to the lentil mixture. Grate in 1/2 teaspoon of lemon zest. Add the garam masala, cumin, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Stir well to combine.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Shape the mixture into four large or eight small 1/4 inch thick patties.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: In a large nonstick skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the patties and cook for 4 to 6 minutes, until a nice brown crust forms on the undersides. Carefully flip and cook 4 to 5 minutes more, adding the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Serve the burgers over shredded romaine and carrots. Top the burger with cucumber slices, hot sauce, and extra cilantro. Cut the lemon into wedges and serve with the burgers.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://jessicaseinfeld.com/recipes/indian-spiced-lentil-burgers

docs.title: Italian Sausage with Grits & Tomatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups vegetable broth
  • 1.5 cups milk
  • 0.75 cup white stone ground grits (not instant)
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 cup cheddar
  • 6 links soy Italian sausages
  • 2 cups cherry tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp parsley

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 saucepan
  • 1 skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a saucepan, bring vegetable broth and milk to a boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Stir in white stone ground grits (not instant) and salt and return to a boil.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook 20 to 25 minutes, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Remove from heat and stir in shredded cheddar cheese. Lightly brown soy Italian sausages in skillet.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Serve over grits with chopped halved cherry tomatoes and parsley.

docs.title: Jackfruit Curry
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 36 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Spice Paste
docs.text:
• 1 14-oz can jackfruit
  • 1 Tbsp coriander seeds
  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 0.75 inch fresh ginger
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 small green chili
  • 0.25 tsp black peppercorns

docs.title: Ingredients - Curry
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 2 dried red chillies
  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 2 medium onions
  • 2 tomatoes
  • some fingerling potatoes
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp turmeric
  • 1 tsp garam masala
  • 0.5 tsp granulated sugar

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 small blender
  • 1 pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Rinse and drain the jackfruit and cut into smaller pieces, if desired.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Make the spice paste by combining coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fresh ginger, garlic, green chili, and black peppercorns in a small blender and blitz until smooth. You could also use a pestle and mortar. Set the paste aside while you start the curry.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat the vegetable oil in a pan and add the bay leaf, dried red chillies, and cumin seeds. When they start to sizzle, add the finely chopped onions and cook on a low-to-medium heat for 12 to 15 minutes, until deep golden brown.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add your spice paste, cook for 1 minute, then add the finely chopped tomatoes. Cover and cook for 10 minutes, until the tomatoes are nice and soft.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add the salt, turmeric and jackfruit, mixing well. Cover and cook for 10 minutes, until the jackfruit has taken on all the flavors of the sauce. Stir in the garam masala and granulated sugar and it's ready to serve.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text:
Keep in an airtight container in the fridge for 4 to 5 days and reheat before serving.

Tip

Fingerling pototoes would also go well with this dish.

Tip

Frozen grated ginger would also work rather than fresh ginger or grated fresh ginger so that big chunks of ginger are not present.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• Healthy Indian Vegetarian
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3oF9tgRtajA

docs.title: Jeweled Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 48 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Carrot Mixture
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 cup water
  • 1 orange zest
  • 2 medium carrot
  • 0.25 cup dates
  • 0.25 cup raisins
  • 0.25 cup dried cranberries

docs.title: Ingredients - Onion Mixture
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 0.25 tsp saffron
  • 1 medium onion
  • 0.25 tsp cardamom
  • 0.25 tsp turmeric

docs.title: Ingredients - Rice
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cups basmati rice
  • 1/4 cup unsalted, shelled, and natural pistachios
  • 1 cup water
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 medium saucepan
  • 1 wooden spoon

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Bring the granulated sugar and water to a boil in a medium saucepan, stirring the until the sugar dissolves. Add the orange zest and match stick sized pieces of carrot. Reduce the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the carrots are tender.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add the diced dates, raisins, and dried cranberries to the carrots and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In another saucepan, add 1 Tbsp olive oil and unsalted butter. Fry the saffron until fragrant. Add the diced onion, cardamom and turmeric. Stir often until the onion softens and begins to brown. Remove from the heat and set to the side.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In another pot, heat olive oil. Add the basmati rice and toast, stirring occasionally. At the last moment of toasting, add the unsalted, shelled, and natural pistachios and then 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer. Cook the rice to "al-dente" and set to the side.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Dump the rice into a bowl.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In the same pot that the rice was in, heat the remaining 3 Tbsp olive oil. Add half of the cooked rice, spreading evenly; top with 3/4 of the carrot mixture and 1/4 of the onion mixture. Add another layer of rice and then the remaining carrot mixture and onion mixture. Using the end of a wooden spoon, poke 5 to 6 holes in the rice all the way through to bottom of pot (to help release steam and help the rice cook evenly). Drizzle the remaining saffron mixture over the rice. Place a clean kitchen towel over the pot, cover with a tight fitting lid, and secure loose edges of the towel on top of the lid using a rubber band or masking tape.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Cook until the pot begins to steam, 5 to 8 minutes. Reduce the heat to very low and cook, without stirring, until the rice is tender and the bottom layer of rice is brown and crisp, 30 to 40 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • HEAT Culinary

docs.title: Jose Guevara's Gallo Pinto
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 3 14 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 onion
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 2 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 🫘 1 8-oz can cooked black beans
  • 2 cups cooked long-grain white rice
  • some salt (optional)
  • some pepper (optional)
  • 0.5 sliced avocado
  • some Chilero hot sauce (optional)
  • some cilantro (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until starts to soften, about 4 minutes.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add garlic and cook for another 5 to 7 minutes, or until vegetables are browned.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add Worcestershire sauce and cooked black beans; turn heat to low and stir. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add cooked long-grain white rice and stir to combine. Cook and stir until rice and beans are evenly distributed and are heated through. Season with salt (optional) and pepper (optional) to taste.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Top with sliced avocado, Chilero hot sauce (optional), and chopped cilantro (optional), if desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: Lemon Garlic Cauliflower Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 15 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp garlic
  • 1 bag TJ's Riced Cauliflower
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 0.33 cup Chiave d’Oro Cheese
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large, nonstick skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat olive oil in a large, nonstick skillet over medium heat.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add garlic and sauté, until softened and aromatic, less than a minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add TJ's Riced Cauliflower to skillet and toss to combine with garlic.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cover and cook, stirring occasionally until the cauliflower is tender, about 5 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Remove from heat, add lemon juice, finely chopped parsley, and grated Chiave d’Oro Cheese, and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve warm or at room temperature.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/lemon-garlic-cauliflower-rice

docs.title: Lemony Broccoli Salad with Chickpeas & Feta
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 18 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 6 cups broccoli florets
  • 3 cups peas
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 15-oz can chickpeas
  • 0.75 cup crumbled feta
  • 1 tsp lemon zest
  • 0.5 lemon juice
  • 1 tsp olive oil

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large skillet
  • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 3 Tbsp olive oil and the broccoli florets.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook for 5 minutes, then add the peas. Season with salt and pepper and cook for 2 to 3 minutes more.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Pour veggies into a bowl and cool for 10 minutes. Add chickpeas, crumbled feta, lemon zest, lemon juice, and olive oil.

docs.title: Lentil and Mushroom Stuffed Peppers and Butternut Squash
docs.text: Total Time 38 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Squash
docs.text:
• 1 large butternut squash
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 0.5 tsp cayenne
  • 5 oz goat cheese
  • 0.5 cup whole milk or vegetable broth

docs.title: Ingredients - Slaw
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp sour cream
  • 1 Tbsp grapeseed oil
  • 2 lime juice and zest
  • 2 Tbsp granulated sugar
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 6 cups shredded cabbage
  • 2 green onions
  • 0.5 cup cilantro

docs.title: Ingredients - Peppers & Filling
docs.text:
• 4 poblano peppers
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 yellow onion
  • 1 lb cremini mushrooms
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 cups cooked lentils
  • 0.5 cup vegetable broth
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • some vinegar
  • 0.33 cup cilantro
  • 0.5 cup toasted pepitas
  • 5 oz goat cheese

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Bake butternut squash at 425°F for 20 minutes, then puree with olive oil, salt, pepper, maple syrup, cayenne, goat cheese, and whole milk or vegetable broth.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To make the slaw, mix together the sour cream, grapeseed oil, lime juice and zest, granulated sugar, salt, pepper, shredded cabbage, chopped green onions, and cilantro and let set for at least 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Slit poblano peppers lengthwise and remove ribs and seeds. Rub with olive oil and salt. Grill or bake at 425°F for 12 to 15 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: For the filling, heat 1 Tbsp olive oil and saute yellow onion. Add chopped cremini mushrooms and continue cooking until mushrooms release their liquid, 6 to 8 minutes. Drain if necessary. Add garlic, cooked lentils, and vegetable broth and heat through. Stir in cumin and vinegar.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Fill peppers with lentil mixture. To plate, portion butternut squash mash on plate, top with stuffed pepper, then add a side of slaw. Garnish with cilantro and toasted pepitas and crumbled goat cheese.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Recipe Box

docs.title: Lentil Meatballs with Lemon Pesto
docs.text: Total Time 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups lentils
  • 2 eggs
  • 0.75 cup Ricotta
  • 0.25 cup Parmesan
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.5 tsp fennel seed
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 1 pinch thyme
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 0.67 cup panko breadcrumbs
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 0.25 cup pine nuts
  • 1 lemon zest
  • 1 lemon juice
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 cup basil
  • 0.33 cup olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp water
  • 2 Tbsp Parmesan

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 parchment paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a food processor, pulverize the cooked lentils into mush.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Put them in a mixing bowl, and add the lightly beaten eggs, Ricotta, grated Parmesan, minced 1 clove of garlic, minced fennel seed, chopped parsley, thyme, salt, and pepper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir in panko breadcrumbs and let sit for 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: For the pesto sauce, put 1 clove of garlic, pine nuts, lemon zest and lemon juice and 1/2 tsp of salt in a food processor. Add packed basil leaves and olive oil until you get a smooth, sauce-like consistency.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add water, oil, or lemon juice to thin as desired.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Stir in 2 Tbsp of grated Parmesan and set aside.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F and form lentil mixture into 1-inch balls.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with olive oil. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes on the middle rack, turning halfway through.

docs.title: Lentil Mushroom Stew over Mashed Potatoes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 42 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Mushroom Lentil Gravy
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.5 cup shallot
  • 2 cups cremini mushrooms
  • 2 Tbsp coconut aminos
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 pinch pepper
  • 2 Tbsp thyme
  • 0.67 cup green lentils
  • 2 cups vegetable broth

docs.title: Ingredients - Potatoes
docs.text:
• 1 lb yellow potatoes
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 4 Tbsp unsweetened plain almond milk or vegetable broth (for moisture)

docs.title: Ingredients - Garnish
docs.text:
• some parsley (optional)
  • some vegan Parmesan cheese (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large rimmed pan
  • 1 large pot

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat a large rimmed pan over medium heat. Once hot, add olive oil or water and chopped shallot and sauté for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add cremini mushrooms and 1 to 2 Tbsp coconut aminos and increase heat to medium-high. Sauté for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add a pinch of salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add thyme, dry green lentils, and 2 cups vegetable broth (480 ml // or the smaller end of the range if adjusting recipe size). Bring to a low boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, reduce heat to a simmer and cook on low for about 20 minutes, adding more broth as needed if the mixture looks dry.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In the meantime, add yellow potatoes to a large pot and cover with water so they are just submerged. Bring to a boil on high heat and cook for 12 to 15 minutes or until they slide off easily when pierced with a knife.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Once tender, drain potatoes and add back to pot or a mixing bowl. Season with salt, pepper, and a bit of olive oil and mash until tender and fluffy. For added moisture in place of oil, add 2 to 4 Tbsp unsweetened plain almond milk or vegetable broth (for moisture).

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Once lentils are tender, taste sauce and adjust flavor as needed, adding more salt or coconut aminos for saltiness, pepper for spice, or tomato paste for more depth of flavor (optional – we didn’t find it necessary). Turn off heat and let the mixture rest so flavors can deepen. Add the 2 Tbsp (30 g // or more as needed) mashed potatoes to the lentil mushroom stew and stir in to thicken.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: To serve, divide mashed potatoes between serving plates or bowls and top with desired amount of lentil and mushroom gravy. Garnish with fresh parsley (optional), vegan Parmesan cheese (optional), or more thyme, if desired.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Store leftovers separately, covered, up to 4 days in the refrigerator or in the freezer up to 1 month. Reheat on the stovetop or in a 350°F (176°C) oven until hot.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/lentil-mushroom-stew-over-mashed-potatoes/

docs.title: Lentil Patties
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 1.08 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup dry lentils
  • 2.5 cups water
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 medium onion
  • 1 carrot
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • some salt
  • 1 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 0.75 cup rolled oats
  • 0.75 cup bread crumbs
  • 2 eggs (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Boil the dry lentils in the water with the salt for about 45 minutes. The lentils will be soft and most of the water will be gone.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Fry the diced onion and diced carrot in the olive oil until soft, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a bowl, combine the pepper, salt, soy sauce, rolled oats, and bread crumbs. Add the cooked ingredients to the bowl and toss combine.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: While still warm, form the mixture into patties. Add eggs (optional) if the mixtures is not sticking together.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Burgers can be then shallow fried for 1 to 2 minutes on each side or baked at 400°F for 15 minutes.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • HEAT Culinary

docs.title: Meat-Free Meat Loaf
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 52 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 small onion
  • 1 small carrot
  • 0.5 cup ground walnuts
  • 1 cup bread crumbs
  • 1 cup brown lentils
  • 0.25 cup soft tofu
  • 2 Tbsp tahini
  • 1 Tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp parsley
  • 1 pkg TJ's soy meat
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 9x5" loaf pan
  • 1 skillet
  • 1 bowl
  • 1 food processor
  • 1 pan
  • 1 foil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Lightly oil a 9x5" loaf pan.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Heat oil in a skillet and sauté minced onion and grated carrot for 5 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: In a bowl, mix soy meat, ground walnuts, bread crumbs, and the onion mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Pulse cooked brown lentils in a food processor then add to soy meat mixture.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: In a food processor, mix soft tofu, tahini, soy sauce, and minced parsley. Stir into the TJ's soy meat and season with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Mix in extra soy sauce and water as needed until desired texture is reached (add roughly 1/4 cup extra liquid at a time).

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Transfer to the prepared pan. Smooth the top of the loaf.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Remove foil and bake for 7 to 10 minutes more.

docs.title: Meatless Umami Shepherd's Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 1.03 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 1 container TJ's mirepoix
  • 1 pkg TJ's beefless beef
  • 1 bag mushroom medley
  • 2 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 2 Tbsp all-purpose flour
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 3 Tbsp TJ's Mushroom and Company Multipurpose umami seasoning
  • 1 cup peas
  • 1 pkg TJ's prepared mashed potatoes

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 12-inch cast iron pan or oven-safe pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To a 12-inch cast iron pan or oven-safe pan, heat over medium high and add unsalted butter. When butter has melted, add TJ's mirepoix and cook until softened, 5 to 7 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add TJ's beefless beef and mushroom medley until cooked through, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add tomato paste and mix to combine. Then add all-purpose flour and mix to combine.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add vegetable broth and TJ's Mushroom and Company Multipurpose umami seasoning and cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add peas and mix to combine. Then top with TJ's prepared mashed potatoes.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Bake for 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Cool for 15 minutes, before serving.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/meatless-umami-shepherds-pie

docs.title: Mushroom Barbacoa Bowl
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Marinade
docs.text:
• 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 medium yellow onion
  • 3 Tbsp lime juice
  • 3 chipotle peppers (optional)
  • 1 Tbsp cumin
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 1 pinch cloves
  • 2 lbs portobello mushrooms
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Ingredients - Bowl
docs.text:
• 2 cups brown rice
  • 2 cups steamed vegetables
  • 1 Roasted Red Pepper Sauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large skillet

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine the garlic, half of the yellow onion, the lime juice, chipotle peppers (optional), cumin, oregano, and cloves in a blender and process until smooth. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the remaining onion and the portobello mushrooms, and cook, stirring frequently, until the mushrooms have released their juices and cooked down, about 10 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Season with sea salt and black pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add the marinade to the skillet with the mushrooms, and reduce the heat to medium. Cook for 10 minutes, until the sauce has thickened.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To serve, spoon half a cup of brown rice into four bowls.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Top with the Barbacoa Mushrooms, steamed vegetables, and the Roasted Red Pepper Sauce.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://nutritionstudies.org/recipes/main-dish/mushroom-barbacoa-bowl/

docs.title: Mushroom Rice Burgers
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 5.18 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 medium onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 8 oz white mushrooms
  • 1 cup brown rice
  • 0.5 cup quick oats
  • 0.75 cup cheddar cheese
  • 1 egg
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 3 Tbsp bread crumbs

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 skillet
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat skillet. Sauté chopped onion and minced garlic until brown, about 4 minutes. Add chopped white mushrooms, cook until liquid has evaporated. Stir in cooked brown rice and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and transfer mixture to large bowl. Stir in quick oats, grated cheddar cheese, and egg. Add salt and pepper. If mixture seems wet, add bread crumbs.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cover mixture and refrigerate 3 to 4 hours. Make 4 patties and refrigerate for 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: On grill, cook 4 to 6 minutes per side.

docs.title: Quinoa & Veggie Power Bowls
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 45 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 cups cooked quinoa
  • 16 oz Brussels sprouts
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp adobo sauce
  • 1 Tbsp maple syrup
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 cups sweet potato
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 3 handfuls spinach or kale
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp Dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp honey
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • some pine nuts (optional)
  • some avocado (optional)
  • some hummus (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 2 baking sheets
  • 1 large saucepan
  • 1 whisk
  • 1 sauce pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prepare cooked quinoa ahead of time. Preheat oven to 425°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Toss trimmed and halved Brussels sprouts with 1 Tbsp olive oil, adobo sauce, maple syrup, and 1/2 tsp salt. Arrange on baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Toss peeled and cubed sweet potato with 1 Tbsp olive oil, smoked paprika, garlic powder, and 1/2 tsp salt. Arrange on separate baking sheet.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake Brussels sprouts and sweet potatoes for 25 minutes, stirring once halfway through.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Meanwhile, wilt spinach or kale in a large saucepan. Add cooked quinoa until warmed through.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Prepare dressing by combining 1/4 cup olive oil, apple cider vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, and salt.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Whisk until emulsified. Once baked, add Brussels sprouts and sweet potatoes to sauce pan. Missing in dressing.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Serve with desired toppings (e.g. pine nuts (optional), avocado (optional), hummus (optional)).

docs.title: Ratatouille Provençale
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 8 49 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup olive oil
  • 1 medium eggplant
  • 1 lb zucchini
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1.5 cups sliced onions
  • 2 large red bell peppers
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 14-oz can diced tomatoes
  • 3 sprigs fresh thyme
  • 0.5 tsp dried thyme (alternative)
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 0.25 cup chopped basil
  • some pitted black olives (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large skillet or Dutch oven

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

Served on a platter that shows off its contrasting colors, this dish look like a colorful Cubist style life.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat in a large skillet or Dutch oven over high heat 1/4 cup olive oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add and cook, stirring, until golden and just tender, 10 to 12 minutes eggplant, peeled and cut into 1-inch chunks and zucchini, cut into 1-inch chunks.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Remove the vegetables to a plate and reduce the heat to medium-high. Add and cook, stirring, until the onions are slightly softened 2 Tbsp olive oil and sliced onions.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Add and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are just tender but now browned, 8 to 12 minutes red bell peppers, cut into 1-inch squares and garlic, finely chopped.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Season with salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add diced tomatoes, drained, fresh thyme or dried thyme (alternative) and 1 bay leaf.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 5 minutes. Add the eggplant and zucchini and cook until everything is tender, about 20 minutes more. Taste and adjust the seasonings. Stir in chopped basil and pitted black olives (optional), chopped.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Joy of Cooking

docs.title: Slow Cooker Indian-Spiced Chickpeas & Red Potatoes
docs.text: Total Time 5.02 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 tsp olive oil
  • 2 tsp coriander
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • 0.5 tsp garam masala
  • 0.5 tsp ginger
  • 0.25 tsp turmeric
  • 0.25 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 15-oz can diced tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp tomato paste
  • 1 cup vegetable broth
  • 2 15-oz cans chickpeas
  • 1 lb red potatoes, cut into 1/2" pieces
  • 1 small bunch cilantro
  • 1 lime

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 slow cooker

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add coriander, cumin, garam masala, ginger, turmeric, red pepper flakes, and salt and cook for 1 minute.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and vegetable broth. Stir until combined.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Pour into slow cooker, then stir in chickpeas and red potatoes, cut into 1/2" pieces.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook on high for 4 to 5 hours or low for 8 to 10 hours.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Ladle into a serve and serve with fresh cilantro and lime wedges for squeezing over the top.

docs.title: Slow Cooker Red Beans and Rice
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 7.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 15-oz cans red beans
  • 1 cup onion, finely chopped
  • 1 cup chopped green pepper
  • 1 cup chopped celery
  • 2 tsp thyme
  • 3 cloves garlic
  • 2.33 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 1 tsp smoke paprika
  • 0.25 tsp cayenne
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 slow cooker

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Place red beans, onion, finely chopped, chopped green pepper, chopped celery, thyme, garlic, vegetable broth, bay leaf, smoke paprika, and cayenne in a slow cooker.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Cook on low for 4 to 5 hours.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Stir in rice. Add salt and pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Increase heat to high and cook 1 to 2 hours more.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Note: For brown rice, cook 2 more hours beyond the initial 4 to 5 hours.

docs.title: Slow Cooker Vegetarian Black-Eyed Peas
docs.text: Total Time 5.00 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cups (270 g) dried black-eyed peas
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 cup (140 g) red onion, diced
  • 0.5 cup (70 g) red bell pepper (diced)
  • 0.5 cup (70 g) green bell pepper (diced)
  • 2 tsp Tabasco
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp liquid smoke
  • 1 tsp yellow mustard
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 5 cups vegetable broth

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 slow cooker

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Rinse and sort (270 g) dried black-eyed peas.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add garlic, minced, (140 g) red onion, diced, (70 g) red bell pepper (diced), (70 g) green bell pepper (diced) Tabasco, salt, liquid smoke, yellow mustard, bay leaf, and vegetable broth to slow cooker.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Cook on high for 4 to 5 hours or low 6 to 7 hours.

docs.title: Spicy Cashew Quinoa Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups quinoa
  • 1 bag TJ's Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots
  • 1 pkg TJ's Shelled Edamame with Sea Salt
  • 1 red bell pepper
  • 0.5 bunch cilantro
  • 1 pkg sriracha tofu
  • 3 green onions
  • 0.5 cup TJ's Spicy Cashew Butter Dressing
  • 0.5 cup TJ's Chile & Garlic Cashews
  • 1 lime

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine cooked quinoa, TJ's Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots, TJ's Shelled Edamame with Sea Salt, cored and diced red bell pepper, cilantro with stems removed, sriracha tofu, and thinly sliced green onions in a large bowl. Add 1/2 cup TJ's Spicy Cashew Butter Dressing and gently stir to coat. Taste and adjust dressing as desired. Stir in crushed TJ's Chile & Garlic Cashews.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: To serve, spoon salad into shallow bowls and top with a squeeze of fresh lime juice.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Trader Joe's

docs.title: Spinach and Feta Filo Pie
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 24 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 100 g pine nuts
  • 5 large eggs
  • 300 g feta cheese
  • 50 g Cheddar
  • 1 pinch black pepper
  • 2 pinches dried oregano
  • 1 lemon zest
  • some olive oil
  • 1 knob unsalted butter
  • 400 g spinach
  • 1 270 g filo
  • some sea salt
  • 1 pinch cayenne pepper
  • 1 whole nutmeg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large ovenproof frying pan
  • 1 large mixing bowl
  • 1 frying pan
  • 1 50 cm strip of greaseproof paper

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 200°C / 400°F / gas 6.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Toast the pine nuts in a large ovenproof frying pan over a medium heat for 1 to 2 minutes, or until golden and smelling fantastic, tossing occasionally.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Crack the eggs into a large mixing bowl, crumble in the feta cheese, then grate in the Cheddar. Season with a pinch of black pepper and a couple of pinches of dried oregano.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Finely grate in the lemon zest, drizzle in a little olive oil, then toss in the toasted pine nuts. Mix well.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Melt the unsalted butter in the frying pan over a medium heat with a drizzle of oil, add half the spinach, stirring until wilted, then when there’s space, add the remaining spinach, stirring regularly until wilted.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Lay a 50 cm strip of greaseproof paper out on a clean work surface, rub lightly with oil and scrunch up, then flatten out again.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Arrange 4 sheets of filo in a large rectangle on the greaseproof paper, overlapping at the edges, so that it’s almost covering the greaseproof.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Rub the filo with a little oil, sprinkle with sea salt, pepper and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Repeat until you have 3 layers.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Stir the wilted spinach into the egg mixture, then grate in half the nutmeg and mix well.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Slide the greaseproof and filo into the empty frying pan, so that the edges spill over, then push down into the sides of the pan.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Pour in the spinach mixture and spread out evenly, spread extra Cheddar on top of the mixture, then fold the filo up over the filling to cover.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Sprinkle fresh rosemary over the top of the pie.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Place the pan over a medium heat for 2 minutes, just to get the bottom cooking, then transfer to the top shelf of the oven for 18 to 20 minutes, or until golden and crisp. Delicious served with a fresh seasonal salad.

docs.title: Sources
docs.text:
• https://www.jamieoliver.com/recipes/cheese-recipes/spinach-feta-filo-pie/
  • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hrM8vzeGJb4

docs.title: Spinach Salad with Gorgonzola and Pear
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 25 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 ripe Anjou pear
  • 3 Tbsp red wine vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp shallot
  • 1 tbsp Dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp brown sugar
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 0.25 cup canola oil
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice
  • 8 oz spinach
  • 3 oz Gorgonzola
  • 0.5 cup walnuts
  • 0.25 cup pomegranate seeds

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 large bowl

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
Note

To make a smooth dressing, be sure the pear is completely ripe. Make sure to use baby, not curly, spinach here.

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Cut 1 ripe Anjou pear half into large chunks and place in food processor. Add red wine vinegar, shallot, Dijon mustard, brown sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and process until smooth, about 15 seconds. With processor running, slowly pour in canola oil and process until emulsified, about 30 seconds.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Thinly slice remaining pear half crosswise, toss with lemon juice, and set aside. Toss spinach and 1/2 cup dressing together in large bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide salad among individual plates and top each with Gorgonzola, walnuts, pomegranate seeds, and sliced pear. Drizzle remaining 1/4 cup dressing over top. Serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Cook's Illustrated

docs.title: Sprouted Kitchen Lentil & Rice Bowls with Vegetable Kebabs
docs.text: Total Time 29 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cloves garlic
  • 2 roasted red bell peppers
  • 0.75 cup walnuts
  • 1 Tbsp honey
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp pepper
  • 1.5 tsp paprika
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.75 cup lentils
  • 1 pkg TJ's frozen brown rice
  • 3 cups spinach
  • 0.5 lb potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp butter
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 yellow onions
  • some olive oil
  • 2 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 pinch cayenne
  • 0.5 lb potatoes
  • 1 small eggplant
  • 0.5 red onion
  • 2 bell peppers
  • 0.5 cup feta

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 skewers

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Mix garlic, roasted red bell peppers, toasted walnuts, honey, salt, pepper, paprika, cumin, 3 Tbsp olive oil for sauce and blend in a food processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat cooked lentils and TJ's frozen brown rice, then mix in coarsely chopped spinach and set aside.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Boil potatoes until fork tender.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: While potatoes cook, heat butter and olive oil. Add yellow onions and cook 15 minutes until soft and brown. Raise heat to high and cook 3 to 4 minutes longer, until the bottom layer of onions has charred. Mix into lentil and rice mixture.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Chop veggies into large chunks. Mix olive oil, garlic powder cayenne, salt, and pepper.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Add in potatoes, eggplant, red onion, and bell peppers and toss to coat. Thread veggies onto 6 skewers. Grill or broil until tender, 8 to 10 minutes, rotating occasionally.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Serve with a scoop of lentil and rice mix, kebabs, sauce, and sprinkle of feta.

docs.title: Super Nourishing Beans & Greens
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 28 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • 2 large shallot
  • 8 cloves garlic
  • 1 tsp red pepper flakes
  • 2 bunches Swiss chard
  • 2 15-oz cans white beans
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 2 cups water or vegetable stock
  • 2 Tbsp lemon juice
  • some sriracha tofu (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 Dutch oven or a large rimmed skillet with a lid

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: In a Dutch oven or a large rimmed skillet with a lid, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Once hot, add the shallot and sauté for 1 to 2 minutes, until fragrant and translucent. Turn the heat down to medium low and add the garlic and red pepper flakes. Sauté for 1 minute more.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Return the heat to medium and add the chopped Swiss chard (or greens of choice). Toss to coat the greens in the oil and distribute the shallot and garlic. Once the greens are just beginning to wilt, add the white beans and salt and stir to combine.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add the 1.5-2 cups water or vegetable stock and lemon juice then cover and simmer for 15 to 25 minutes, until the greens are tender, the beans have softened, and the mixture is a bit saucy but most of the water has evaporated. Add more water or vegetable stock and cover as needed to achieve the desired consistency of your greens and beans.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Serve immediately! Delicious on its own as a quick meal, or served with toast, grains, sriracha tofu (optional), salmon, or eggs. Keeps for 3-4 days in the refrigerator or up to 1 month in the freezer.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/super-nourishing-beans-greens/#wprm-recipe-container-102870

docs.title: Texas Potato Pancakes
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 4 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 lbs russet potatoes
  • 0.5 cup all-purpose flour
  • 2 large eggs
  • 0.33 cup onion
  • some salt
  • 1.25 cups vegetable oil
  • some sour cream
  • some applesauce

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 large plate
  • 1 paper towels
  • 1 clean dish towel
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 12-inch skillet
  • 1 spatulas

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Shred the potatoes and onion on the large holes of a box grater or with the shredding disk of a food processor. The potato shreds may take on a red hue if left to sit out for a few minutes before cooking. This does not affect their flavor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 200°F. Set wire rack in rimmed baking sheet and place in oven. Line large plate with triple layer of paper towels.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place half of russet potatoes in center of clean dish towel. Gather ends together and twist tightly to squeeze out as much liquid as possible. Transfer to large bowl and repeat with remaining potatoes.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir all-purpose flour, eggs, shredded onion, and 1-1/4 teaspoons salt into potatoes until combined. Heat vegetable oil in 12-inch skillet over medium heat to 325 degrees. Using 1/3-cup dry measuring cup, place 3 portions of potato mixture in skillet and press into 4-inch disks with back of spoon.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Cook until deep golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side, carefully flipping pancakes with 2 spatulas. Transfer pancakes to paper towel–lined plate to drain, about 15 seconds per side, then transfer to prepared wire rack in oven.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Repeat with remaining potato mixture in 3 batches, stirring mixture, if necessary, to recombine and adding extra oil to skillet as needed to maintain 1/4-inch depth. Season pancakes with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately, passing sour cream and applesauce separately.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.cookscountry.com/recipes/10040-texas-potato-pancakes

docs.title: The Best Vegan Burger
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 40 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 400 g chickpeas
  • 340 g sweetcorn
  • 0.5 tsp coriander
  • 0.5 tsp paprika
  • 0.5 tsp cumin
  • 3 Tbsp flour
  • 1 pinch sea salt
  • 1 lemon zest
  • some rapeseed oil
  • 1 small lettuce
  • 2 large tomatoes
  • some ketchup
  • 4 burger buns

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor
  • 1 large frying pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Drain the chickpeas and sweetcorn, then tip into a food processor. Pick the coriander leaves, adding half the leaves and all the stalks to the processor.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add paprika, cumin, flour and a pinch of sea salt, finely grate in the lemon zest, then pulse until combined, but not smooth – you want to retain a bit of texture.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: On a flour-dusted surface, divide and shape the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties, roughly 2cm thick. Place in the fridge for 30 minutes to firm up.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat a splash of rapeseed oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat, add the patties and cook for 10 minutes, or until golden and cooked through, turning halfway.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Meanwhile, click off, wash and spin-dry four nice lettuce leaves, then finely slice the tomatoes horizontally.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Squeeze a large dollop of ketchup onto the base of each bun (toast them if you like), then top with the burgers. Layer over a couple of slices of tomato, a lettuce leaf, a few coriander leaves and finally the burger buns. Delicious served with a fresh green salad.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.jamieoliver.com/recipes/vegetables-recipes/the-best-vegan-burger/

docs.title: The Casado Plate
docs.text: Total Time 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• some Jose Guevara's gallo pinto
  • some hearts of palm ceviche
  • some fried green plantains
  • some chilero hot sauce
  • some nixtamal tortillas
  • some corn (optional)
  • some sliced avocado (optional)
  • some chopped cilantro (optional)
  • some lettuce (optional)
  • some tomatoes (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Combine Jose Guevara's gallo pinto, hearts of palm ceviche, fried green plantains, chilero hot sauce, and nixtamal tortillas.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Top with corn (optional), sliced avocado (optional), chopped cilantro (optional), lettuce (optional), or tomatoes (optional).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: Thyme & White Bean Pot Pies
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 59 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Filling
docs.text:
• 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 large white or yellow onion
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 lb carrots
  • 30 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.5 cup dry white wine (optional)
  • 3 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 tsp dry thyme
  • 1 15-oz can white beans

docs.title: Ingredients - Crust
docs.text:
• 180 g all-purpose flour
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 10 Tbsp vegan butter or coconut oil
  • 7 Tbsp ice cold water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 ramekins
  • 1 baking sheet
  • 1 large pot
  • 1 mixing bowl
  • 1 pastry cutter or fork
  • 1 wooden spoon
  • 1 pizza cutter or knife
  • 1 spatula

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C) and arrange 6 ramekins on a baking sheet. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Heat a large pot over medium heat. Once hot, add olive oil and white or yellow onion. Season with a pinch each salt and pepper and stir. Sauté until soft and translucent, about 4 to 5 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add carrots and season with a pinch more salt and pepper. Cook 2 to 3 minutes, then add all-purpose flour and stir well to thoroughly coat.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Cook for 1 minute, then slowly add dry white wine (optional) followed by vegetable broth, whisking to prevent clumps.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add dry thyme and white beans and bring the mixture to a simmer. Then lower heat to low and simmer for a few minutes. Cover and remove from heat while preparing crust.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: To prepare pie crust, add all-purpose flour and salt to a mixing bowl and whisk to combine.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Next add vegan butter or coconut oil and use a pastry cutter or fork to cut the two together, until it resembles wet sand – about 30 to 45 seconds.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add 4 to 7 Tbsp of ice cold water 1 Tbsp at a time and use a wooden spoon to gently mix. Add only as much water as needed to help it come together and form a dough – about 4 to 6 Tbsp.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Use your hands to gently knead/form the dough in the bowl and gather any loose scraps. Then wrap in plastic wrap and chill for 1/2 an hour.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Transfer directly to a well-floured surface and form into a disc with your hands.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Lightly flour the top of the dough, as well as a rolling pin, and gently roll out until about 1/8 inch thick. Add more flour as needed to prevent sticking.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Use a pizza cutter or knife to cut into 6 large squares slightly larger than the size of your ramekins.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: At this time, scoop the white bean filling into the ramekins until almost entirely full (reserve any leftovers to enjoy as soup or future pot pies).

docs.title: Step 14
docs.text: Use a lightly floured spatula to scoop each pie crust square onto a ramekin. Repeat until all ramekins are covered. Use a knife or toothpick to create small holes in the top of the pie crust to allow steam to escape.

docs.title: Step 15
docs.text: Bake pot pies for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the filling is bubbly and the pie crust is golden brown. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.

docs.title: Step 16
docs.text: Store leftovers covered in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 days, or in the freezer up to 1 month. Reheat in a 350°F (176°C) oven until completely warmed through.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/thyme-white-bean-pot-pies/#wprm-recipe-container-35425

docs.title: Tortilla de Patatas
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 to 6 55 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Tortilla
docs.text:
• 1 medium onion
  • 3 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 5 medium russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 0.13 tsp white pepper
  • 5 large eggs
  • 1 tsp olive oil

docs.title: Ingredients - Dressing
docs.text:
• 2 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 cup lemon juice
  • 2 tsp honey or sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • some oven-dried tomatoes (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 non-stick fry pan
  • 1 small paring knife
  • 1 large bowl
  • 1 9 inch, non-stick fry pan
  • 1 large plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: To start the tortilla, peel and dice the onion. Heat a non-stick fry pan to medium-low and add the olive oil, followed by the onions and salt. Stir and sweat until translucent. While the onions sweat, peel the russet potatoes. Once the onions are ready, cut the potatoes into quarters lengthwise. Using a small paring knife, cut the potato into little pyramid-shaped pieces, placing them into the pan as you cut them. Once you have finished cutting all of the potatoes, add the remaining olive oil, salt and white pepper.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Turn the heat up to medium and fold everything together. Then turn the heat down to medium-low, cover and let cook. Check the potatoes occasionally to make sure they are not taking on any color. If so, turn the heat down a bit. When the potatoes are almost done, check for seasoning. The potatoes will take anywhere from 25 to 35 minutes to cook. Once the potatoes are cooked, measure out approximately 4 to 4 1/2 cups into a large bowl.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Whisk the eggs and pour over the potatoes, fold together.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Heat a 9 inch, non-stick fry pan over medium heat and add the olive oil. Once the pan is hot, add the potato and eggs.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: As soon as the sides of the tortilla start to cook, give the pan a bit of a shake to make sure the bottom is not sticking. Once the egg starts to set, fold the sides slightly inwards. As soon as the edges of the tortilla start to brown, flip the tortilla over using a large, flat plate.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Place the frying pan back onto the stove and drizzle with a bit more oil. Slide the tortilla, uncooked side down, back into the pan and tuck the sides underneath. Cook on medium heat for another 3 to 5 minutes. Use a large plate to flip the tortilla out of the pan. Allow the tortilla to sit for at least 15 minutes before serving.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: To make the dressing, first crush the garlic and place into a bowl. Add the lemon juice, honey or sugar, salt and pepper. Slowly whisk in the olive oil.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: When you are ready to serve, spoon a few tablespoons of the dressing over the salad and mix.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Once the tortilla has cooled, cut into wedges and serve with a bit of the salad and a few oven-dried tomatoes (optional) for garnish.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://rouxbe.com/recipes/77-tortilla-de-patatas

docs.title: Vegan Baked Beans
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 12 5.50 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 16 oz dried great northern beans
  • 2 cups bean juice
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 onion
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 0.5 jalapeno pepper
  • 1 green bell pepper
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 6 oz tomato paste
  • 0.25 cup molasses
  • 0.25 cup brown sugar
  • 1 Tbsp yellow mustard
  • 1 tsp apple cider vinegar
  • 0.25 tsp ground pepper
  • 0.25 tsp chipotle chili powder
  • 1 tsp chipotle in adobo (alternative)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 crock pot (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Soak dried great northern beans overnight in several inches water.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Drain and rinse beans next morning.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add enough water to cover and bring to a boil.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: As soon as the beans begin to boil, remove from heat and cover.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Let rest 30 minutes.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Drain and rinse beans, reserving 2 cups bean juice.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Add beans back into pot, with 2 cups bean juice.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Add vegetable broth, diced onion, garlic, jalapeno pepper, finely diced green bell pepper and salt.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Bring to a boil again and simmer on low for 1 hour.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Add mixture to crock pot (optional).

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Add tomato paste, molasses, brown sugar, yellow mustard, apple cider vinegar, ground pepper, and chipotle chili powder or chipotle in adobo (alternative) and slow cook on low 2 to 4 hours.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.brandnewvegan.com/recipes/beans-legumes/vegan-baked-beans

docs.title: Vegan Caesar Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 can garbanzo beans
  • 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp TJ's vegan chicken-less seasoning salt
  • 1 vegan Parmesan cheese
  • 3 Tbsp TJ's Vegan Caesar Dressing
  • some black pepper
  • 1 lemon

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 lint-free towel or paper towels
  • 1 small bowl
  • 1 rimmed baking sheet
  • 1 food processor

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Prepare garbanzo beans: Preheat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Spread drained garbanzo beans on a clean, lint-free towel or paper towels and pat dry. Transfer beans to a small bowl, add olive oil and stir to coat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Spread beans on a rimmed baking sheet and roast on center rack of oven for 20 to 30 minutes. Remove from oven and toss beans with TJ's vegan chicken-less seasoning salt, set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Prepare vegan Parmesan cheese.

docs.title: Step 5 - Assembly
docs.text: Arrange romaine salad on a serving platter or large shallow bowl. Drizzle with 3 tablespoons TJ's Vegan Caesar Dressing and 1 tablespoon vegan Parmesan and toss to coat. Add more dressing if desired.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Top with roasted garbanzo beans, sprinkle with vegan Parmesan, and finish with a few grinds of black pepper. Serve with lemon wedges and more dressing on the side.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/vegan-caesar-salad

docs.title: Vegan Giant Bean & Kale Penne
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 28 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pkg TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes
  • 4 Tbsp olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 1 bag TJ's kale
  • 1 pkg TJ's Penne Rigate
  • 1 can TJ's Giant Baked Beans in Tomato Sauce
  • some Parmesan (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large pot
  • 1 medium-sized bowl
  • 1 baking tray
  • 1 large Dutch oven

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Fill a large pot with water, salt it, and bring it to a boil.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Rinse TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes, then dump in a medium-sized bowl. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons or more of olive oil and toss to coat. Add salt & pepper, then spread out on a baking tray, and roast in the oven at 400°F for about 20 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Meanwhile, peel and mince 4-5 large garlic cloves. Remove larger stems from TJ's kale leaves. In a large Dutch oven, sauté garlic and kale over medium heat, until kale starts to wilt. Cover pan and turn heat to low.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once the water boils, add your TJ's Penne Rigate pasta and give it a stir. Cook 6 to 8 minutes or until al dente.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Add roasted tomatoes (and any juices) to the garlic and kale. Then add one can of TJ's Giant Baked Beans in Tomato Sauce. Gently stir to incorporate. Add salt & pepper to taste.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: When the pasta is done, drain it, and add one-half to three-quarters of the penne to the garlic, kale, and tomatoes, then mix and serve topped with grated Parmesan (optional) cheese.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.traderjoes.com/home/recipes/vegan-giant-bean-kale-penne

docs.title: Vegan Ricotta & Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto Salad
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 2 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.75 cup Whipped Almond Ricotta
  • 0.5 cup pesto
  • 6 cups mixed greens or spinach
  • 0.5 cup sun-dried tomatoes
  • 0.5 cup pine nuts
  • 0.5 cup cooked chickpeas
  • 3 Tbsp lemon juice (optional)

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Start by preparing Whipped Almond Ricotta (follow link for instructions). Then set in refrigerator until serving.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Next prepare pesto dressing (follow link for instructions). Then cover and set in refrigerator until serving.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: To plate, arrange mixed greens or spinach on a serving platter (or bowl) and top with sun-dried tomatoes, pine nuts, and cooked chickpeas. Dollop on spoonfuls of almond ricotta and drizzle with vegan pesto. You can also squeeze with fresh lemon juice (optional) for extra flavor and moisture.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Best when fresh. Store leftovers separately (undressed) up to 3 days in the refrigerator.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/vegan-ricotta-sun-dried-tomato-pesto-salad/

docs.title: Vegan Zucchini Lasagna
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 9 1 hour 20 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients - Vegan Ricotta
docs.text:
• 3 cups raw macadamia nuts or soaked blanched almonds
  • 2 Tbsp Nutritional yeast
  • 0.5 cup basil
  • 2 tsp oregano
  • 1 lemon
  • 1 olive oil (optional)
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 pinch pepper
  • 0.5 cup vegetable stock
  • 0.25 cup vegan Parmesan cheese (optional)

docs.title: Ingredients - The Rest
docs.text:
• 1 28-oz jar marinara sauce
  • 3 medium zucchini

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 food processor or blender
  • 1 mandolin

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (176°C).

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text:
In two separate batches, add raw macadamia nuts or soaked blanched almonds to a food processor or blender and mix to combine, scraping down sides as needed. You’re looking for a fine meal.

Note

If subbing blanched almonds, soak in cold water overnight (or 6 hours), or in very hot water 1 hour. Then drain thoroughly and proceed with recipe as written.

Note

If subbing tofu, make sure it’s firm (not silken). Adjust seasonings as needed as the tofu requires a little bit more nutritional yeast, salt and basil.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add remaining ingredients: Nutritional yeast, fresh basil, oregano, lemon juice, olive oil (optional), salt, pepper, vegetable stock, and vegan Parmesan cheese (optional). You are looking for a well-puréed mixture/paste.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Taste and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more salt and pepper for flavor, nutritional yeast for cheesiness, and lemon juice for brightness.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Thinly slice the zucchini using a mandolin.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Pour about 1 cup (amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size) marinara sauce into a 9×13-inch (or similar size) baking dish and line with thinly sliced zucchini.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Scoop small spoonfuls amounts of ricotta mixture over the zucchini and gently spread into a thin layer. Spread on a layer of marinara sauce and then top with more zucchini slices. Continue until all filling and zucchini are used up. The top two layers should be zucchini and then sauce. Sprinkle on vegan Parmesan cheese (optional), and then cover with foil.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Bake covered for 45 minutes, then remove foil and bake for 15 minutes more. The zucchini should be very easily pierced when cut with a knife. Let cool for 10-15 minutes before serving.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Serve immediately with additional vegan Parmesan cheese and fresh basil. Leftovers keep for 2 to 3 days in the refrigerator, or in the freezer up to 1 month.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/8-ingredient-zucchini-lasagna-gf/

docs.title: Vegetable Casserole
docs.text: Total Time 35 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup zucchini
  • 1 large tomato
  • 1 medium onion
  • 0.33 cup Parmesan cheese
  • 0.5 cup reduced-fat Bisquick
  • 1 cup fat-free milk
  • 0.5 cup egg substitute
  • some salt
  • some pepper

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text: • 1 9-inch pie plate

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat oven to 400°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Grease a 9-inch pie plate.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Layer chopped zucchini, chopped tomato, onion, and Parmesan cheese. Stir reduced-fat Bisquick, fat-free milk, egg substitute, salt and pepper to taste until blended, then pour into pie plate.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Bake for 35 minutes.

docs.title: Vegetarian Pot Pie
docs.text: Total Time 1.05 hours

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 medium onion
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 cups carrots
  • 1.5 cups potatoes
  • 1 cup celery
  • 0.25 cup all-purpose flour
  • 1.5 tsp fresh thyme
  • 1.5 tsp fresh rosemary
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 2 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 cup frozen peas
  • 2 Tbsp parsley
  • 0.25 cup heavy cream
  • 1 pie crust
  • 1 medium egg
  • 1 Tbsp water

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large sauté pan
  • 1 pie pan
  • 1 fork

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Set out a 9 inch deep-dish pie pan. Chop all the fresh produce.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Set a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add the unsalted butter. Once melted, add the onion and garlic. Sauté for 2 to 3 minutes.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Then add in the carrots, potatoes, and celery. Sauté another 5 minutes to soften and vegetables.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Stir in the all-purpose flour, fresh thyme, fresh rosemary, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon cracked black pepper. Make sure the flour is evenly coating all the vegetables. Then stir in the vegetable broth.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Let the filling simmer for 3 to 5 minutes to thicken. Then turn off the heat and stir in the frozen peas, parsley, and heavy cream. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Meanwhile, roll out one round pie crust to 11 to 12 inches, or wide enough to fit down into the pie pan, while still coming up the sides and over the edge.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Gently move the crust into the pie pan and crimp the edges firmly against the rim, so the crust doesn’t slump down in the oven.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: Prick the bottom of the crust with a fork multiple times, so that the crust doesn’t bubble. Then bake for 5 minutes on the bottom rack.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Mix the eggwash using an egg and water. Once out of the oven, roll out the top crust, just wide enough to cover the top of the pan, approximately 9 inches.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Scoop the vegetable filling into the pie pan. Brush the edges of the bottom crust with eggwash. Then gently move the top crust over the filling. Use a fork to crimp the edges of the top crust to the bottom crust to seal.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Brush the top crust with eggwash. Then use a small knife to cut 3-4 vent holes in the top crust.

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Bake on the bottom rack for 25 to 30 minutes. Check the pot pie after 15 minutes. If the crust starts looking dark, place a piece of foil loosely over the top, then continue baking.

docs.title: Step 13
docs.text: Once fully cooked and golden brown, remove the pie from the oven. Cool for 15 minutes before cutting to serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://www.aspicyperspective.com/best-vegetarian-pot-pie/

docs.title: Veggie Burgers
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 6 13 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup cooked brown rice
  • 1 cup raw walnuts
  • 0.5 Tbsp oil
  • 0.5 medium white onion
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 0.5 tsp chili powder
  • 1 Tbsp cumin
  • 1 Tbsp smoked paprika
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp pepper
  • 1 Tbsp brown sugar
  • 1.5 cups cooked dried black beans
  • 0.33 cup panko bread crumbs
  • 4 Tbsp BBQ sauce
  • 1 flax egg

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 blender or food processor
  • 1 large mixing bowl

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: If your brown rice isn’t cooked yet, start there by following this method for the best results. Otherwise, move onto the next step.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Toast the raw walnuts until fragrant and golden brown. Let cool and move onto the next step.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: In the meantime, heat the same skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add oil and white onion. Season with a bit of salt and pepper and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until onion is fragrant, soft, and translucent. Remove from heat and set aside.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once walnuts are cooled, add to blender or food processor with chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, pepper and brown sugar and blend until a fine meal is achieved. Set aside.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: To a large mixing bowl, add drained, cooked dried black beans and mash well with a fork, leaving only a few whole beans.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Next add cooked rice, spice-walnut mixture, sautéed onion, panko bread crumbs, 3 to 4 Tbsp of BBQ sauce, and flax egg and mix thoroughly with a wooden spoon for 1 to 2 minutes, or until a moldable dough forms. If dry, add an extra 1 to 2 Tbsp BBQ sauce (amount as original recipe is written // adjust if altering batch size). If too wet, add more panko bread crumbs. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: For larger burgers, divide into 5 patties (1/2 cup in size // amount as original recipe is written), or form 10 smaller burgers (1/4 cup in size // amount as original recipe is written). To help form the patties, line your 1/2 or 1/4 measuring cup with plastic wrap and pack with burger mixture. Press down to pack firmly, then lift out by the plastic wrap’s edge, and slightly flatten with hands to form a 3/4-inch thick patty. Set on a baking sheet or plate for grilling.

docs.title: Step 8
docs.text: If grilling, heat the grill at this time and brush the grill surface with oil to ease cooking. Otherwise, heat the same skillet you used earlier to medium heat.

docs.title: Step 9
docs.text: Once skillet is hot, add just enough oil to lightly coat the bottom of your skillet, then add your burgers – only as many as will comfortably fit in the pan. Otherwise, add burgers to the grill and close lid.

docs.title: Step 10
docs.text: Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until well browned on the underside, then flip gently. They aren’t as firm as meat burgers, but will definitely hold their shape. Reduce heat if cooking/browning too quickly. Cook for 3-4 minutes on other side.

docs.title: Step 11
docs.text: Remove burgers from heat to let cool slightly, and prepare any other toppings/sides at this time (such as grilling/toasting your buns).

docs.title: Step 12
docs.text: Serve burgers as is, or on toasted buns with desired toppings. Leftovers keep in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 days.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/easy-grillable-veggie-burgers/

docs.title: Veggie Cassola
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 60 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 zucchini
  • 1 large onion
  • 2 large bell pepper
  • 2 carrots
  • 1 Italian eggplant
  • 0.5 cup olive oil
  • some salt
  • some pepper
  • 1 bunch parsley
  • 1 sprig thyme
  • 5 basil leaves
  • 3 bay leaves

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large bowl
  • 1 large roasting pan

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 300°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: In a large bowl, toss 1/2" diced zucchini, chopped onion, bell pepper, coarsely chopped carrots, 1/2" diced Italian eggplant with olive oil.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Salt and pepper to taste. Toss with chopped parsley, stemmed and minced thyme, basil leaves, and bay leaves, then spread out evenly on a large roasting pan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Roast for 1 hour. Remove bay leaves, then serve with crusty bread.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • The Blue Zones Kitchen

docs.title: Zesty Roasted Vegetables
docs.text: Serves  Total Time 4 30 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cups cubed carrots, sweet potatoes, and/or butternut squash
  • 3 cups cauliflower florets, halved Brussels sprouts, or halved tiny new potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp olive oil
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 0.25 tsp pepper
  • 1 Jalapeño Lime Pesto

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 15 x 10 inch baking pan
  • 1 foil

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Preheat oven to 450°F.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Line a 15 x 10 inch baking pan with foil.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Place cubed carrots, sweet potatoes, and/or butternut squash, cauliflower florets, halved Brussels sprouts, or halved tiny new potatoes in pan.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Drizzle with olive oil; toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: Roast 25 to 30 minutes or until tender and lightly browned, stirring once.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Toss or tip with Jalapeño Lime Pesto.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • Magnolia

docs.title: Zucchini Pasta with Lentil Bolognese
docs.text: Total Time 27 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 Tbsp olive oil
  • 1 medium shallot
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 3 medium carrots
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 26 oz marinara sauce
  • 1 pinch red pepper flake
  • 1 tsp basil
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 1 Tbsp coconut sugar
  • 0.5 cup water
  • 0.75 cup red lentils
  • 2 medium zucchini
  • some Vegan Parmesan Cheese (optional)

docs.title: Cookware
docs.text:
• 1 large rimmed skillet
  • 1 mandolin or vegetable

docs.title: Step 1
docs.text: Heat a large rimmed skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add olive oil, shallot, and garlic. Sauté for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until slightly softened and fragrant. Turn down heat if browning.

docs.title: Step 2
docs.text: Add carrots and a pinch of salt and stir. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes more, then add marinara sauce and stir to coat.

docs.title: Step 3
docs.text: Add red pepper flake, basil, oregano, coconut sugar, water, and red lentils. Increase heat slightly and bring mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat to low/medium-low, cover, and continue cooking until lentils are tender - stirring occasionally - about 17 to 20 minutes. Add a bit more water if mixture gets too thick.

docs.title: Step 4
docs.text: Once lentils are cooked, taste and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more salt to taste, coconut sugar for sweetness, red pepper flake for heat, or herbs for flavor balance.

docs.title: Step 5
docs.text: While the sauce is cooking, spiralize your zucchini into noodles using a tool such as this or this. Alternatively, you can use a mandolin or vegetable peeler, or simply cook up your favorite pasta.

docs.title: Step 6
docs.text: Serve the pasta over noodles of choice (I opted for raw zucchini noodles - so good!) and garnish with desired toppings - I prefer Vegan Parmesan Cheese (optional) and red pepper flake.

docs.title: Step 7
docs.text: Sauce will keep in the refrigerator up to 3 days or in the freezer 1 month.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: • https://minimalistbaker.com/zucchini-pasta-with-lentil-bolognese/#wprm-recipe-container-35207
